name: Easiest-ever fried rice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(200g) brown rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(200g) white rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles RSPCA Approved Australian Chicken Breast Fillet, cut into 3cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(120g) frozen baby peas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, seeded, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}]
steps: Boil brown and white rice separately following packet directions. Drain well., Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the chicken and stir-fry for 3-4 mins or until chicken is browned and cooked through., Add the carrot, peas and capsicum to the pan. Stir-fry for 3 mins or until vegetables are tender. Add combined rice to the pan. Stir-fry for 2 mins or until well combined. Remove from heat. Stir in the soy sauce and spring onion.

name: Cheesy French onion meatballs and mushrooms
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Beef 3 Star Regular Mince'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) panko breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet French onion soup mix'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Colby cheese, cut into 20 small pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'portobello mushrooms, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 ⁄2 cup) thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'crusty', 'name': 'bread slices'}]
steps: Combine the egg, beef, breadcrumbs and 1&1/2 tbsp soup mix in a large bowl. Use your hands to mix evenly. Roll a slightly heaped tablespoonful of mixture into a ball then flatten slightly. Place a piece of cheese in the centre then enclose and reshape mixture firmly into a ball. Repeat with the remaining mixture and cheese. Place on a tray and transfer to the fridge for 30 minutes to chill., Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add half the meatballs. Cook, turning occasionally, for 5 minutes or until browned evenly. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining meatballs., Add mushroom to pan. Spread out to a single layer and cook, without turning, for 3 minutes or until golden brown underneath. Turn and cook on other side for 2 minutes. Transfer to the plate with meatballs., Reduce heat to medium. Add the tomato paste to pan and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Place the cream and 125ml (1 ⁄2 cup) water in a jug. Stir through the remaining soup mix until combined. Gradually pour the cream mixture into the pan, stirring, until combined., Return the meatballs and mushrooms to pan. Cover with a lid and reduce heat to low. Simmer for 3 minutes then add the spinach. Cover and simmer for 2 minutes or until wilted. Season and serve with crusty bread.

name: Thai chicken lettuce cups with avocado and lime
ingredient: [{'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': "Chang's rice vermicelli noodles"}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Coles brand cornflour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': '(75g) carrot, peeled, cut into matchstick-size strips'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': '-piece (20g) fresh ginger, peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(', 'name': '14g) fresh loose long red chilli, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles chicken mince'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles brand oyster sauce'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Maggi fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh bean sprouts'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'cos', 'name': 'lettuce leaves (about 1/2 lettuce)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'firm', 'name': 'but ripe avocado, peeled, pitted, and cut into cubes'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': ', cut into 4 thin wedges'}]
steps: Bring a large saucepan of salted water to a boil over high heat. Stir in the vermicelli and cook, stirring often, for about 1-2 mins or until barely tender. Drain in a sieve and rinse under cold water until cooled. Drain well and transfer to a bowl. Stir the cornflour and 2 tablespoons water in a small bowl to blend., Heat a wok or large heavy-based non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the oil, then add the carrot, ginger, garlic, and chilli and cook for about 1 min, or until fragrant. Add the mince and cook, breaking it up with a spoon or spatula, for 2 mins or until almost cooked. Stir in the oyster sauce, fish sauce, and cornflour mixture. Cook for about 1-2 mins to allow the flavours to blend and the sauce to simmer and thicken slightly. Fold in the bean sprouts., Divide the vermicelli among the lettuce cups. Top with the mince mixture. Garnish with the avocado and coriander, and serve with the lime wedges.

name: Oven-baked mushroom risotto with pesto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'leek', 'name': ', pale section only, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'fennel, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'brown mushrooms, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried porcini mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(400g) arborio rice'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(1L) vegetable or chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(40g) finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125g) mascarpone'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 150°C. Heat half the oil in a flameproof casserole pan over medium heat. Add leek, fennel, onion and garlic and cook, stirring, for 5 mins or until onion softens. Transfer to a bowl., Heat remaining oil in the pan. Add brown mushroom and cook, stirring, for 2-3 mins or until light golden. Remove from heat. Stir in the onion mixture, porcini mushrooms, wine, rice and stock., Cover and bake for 1 hour or until rice is tender and liquid is almost absorbed. Set aside, covered, for 5 mins., Meanwhile, to make the chive pesto, process the rocket, chive, garlic, parmesan and almond in a food processor until finely chopped. With the motor running, add the oil in a thin, steady stream until combined. Season., Stir the parmesan and half the mascarpone into the risotto. Divide the risotto among serving bowls. Top with remaining mascarpone and chive pesto.

name: Tomato-tofu salad with creamy ginger dressing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'sheet', 'name': 'nori (3g)'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'toasted sesame seeds, divided'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped, peeled fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tamari or soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'mirin'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'silken firm tofu'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumbers (200g total), thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'truss', 'name': 'tomatoes (200g), thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'avocado, quartered, pitted, peeled, and sliced'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow pea sprouts, bottoms trimmed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced diagonally'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 220°C (200°C fan-forced). Place the nori on a baking tray and bake for about 5 minutes, or until toasted. Transfer the nori to a clean coffee grinder or mortar & pestle and grind to a powder. In a small bowl, combine 1 tablespoon of the sesame seeds and ground nori. Set aside., In a blender, blend the mayonnaise, vinegar, ginger, tamari, mirin, sugar and remaining 2 tablespoons sesame seeds for 1 minute., Drain the tofu and pat dry with paper towels. Cut the tofu in half lengthways, then crossways into 8 slices, to give 16 squares. Divide the cucumber slices among 4 plates. Place 4 slices of the tofu and 3 slices of tomato over the cucumber on each plate. Divide the avocado, sprouts and spring onions among the plates. Drizzle the dressing over and sprinkle generously with the nori-sesame mixture, and serve. Reserve any remaining nori-sesame mixture for another use.

name: Porcupine meatballs with cheesy toasts
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'lean beef mince'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) Basmati rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'zucchini, coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried Italian herbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '800g can diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'Turkish', 'name': 'bread loaf, split'}, {'quantity': '130', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Jarlsberg cheese, thinly sliced'}]
steps: Combine the mince, rice, carrot, zucchini and herbs in a large bowl. Roll heaped tablespoonfuls of the mince mixture into balls. Place on a plate., Place the tomato, water and tomato paste in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Bring to the boil. Add meatballs. Reduce heat to medium., Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Uncover and cook for a further 10 minutes or until the rice is tender and sticking out of the meatballs., Meanwhile, preheat grill on high. Place bread on a baking tray. Cook under grill for 2-3 minutes or until toasted. Turn the bread over and top with cheese. Cook under grill for 2-3 minutes or until the cheese melts., Use a serrated knife to cut the toast into fingers. Serve with the meatballs.

name: Corned beef with horseradish bearnaise
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'piece corned silverside (uncooked) (see note), rinsed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bay', 'name': 'leaves'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'thyme', 'name': 'sprigs'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'dried', 'name': 'juniper berries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'peppercorns'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'malt vinegar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chopped', 'name': 'mustard fruits, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'vegetables, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chopped', 'name': 'parsley, to serve'}]
steps: Place beef in a large saucepan with herbs, spices and vegetables. Cover with cold water, add vinegar and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low, then cover and simmer for 3 hours, skimming surface occasionally, until meat is very tender., About 30 minutes before beef is done, make the bearnaise. Place vinegar, wine and eschalot in a pan over medium heat. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until reduced to 1 tablespoon. Strain into a heatproof bowl, then cool slightly. Add egg yolks, then set bowl over a pan of simmering water (don't let bowl touch water). Whisk until pale, then slowly whisk in butter, 1 tablespoon at a time, until mixture thickens. Remove bowl from heat, then stir in horseradish and tarragon. Season, then keep in a warm place until ready to serve., Drain beef, discarding liquid and vegetables. Thinly slice meat, then serve with baby vegetables (see related recipe) and sauce, scattered with mustard fruits and parsley.

name: Fish tacos
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'cabbage, finely shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice or lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cobs', 'name': 'corn, husks and silks removed'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) olive oil or rice bran oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocado', 'name': ', mashed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'French', 'name': 'shallot, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'White Plain Flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'white fish fillets, cut into strips'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'flour', 'name': 'tortillas, warmed through'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles Sour Cream'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thinly', 'name': 'sliced fresh jalapeno chilli, to serve (optional)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'cheeks, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Hot', 'name': 'chilli sauce, to serve'}]
steps: Mix the cabbage1/4 red cabbage, finely shredded, extra virgin olive oil1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil and 1 tbs of the lemon or lime juice in a bowl until well combined., Cook the corn2 cobs corn, husks and silks removed in a steamer set over a saucepan of simmering water for 10 minutes or until just tender., Preheat a barbecue plate or large frying pan over medium-high heat. Brush the corn with 1 tsp of the olive oil. Add the corn and cook, turning occasionally, for 10 minutes or until charred. Remove the kernels from the cob., Combine the avocado1 avocado, mashed, shallot1 French shallot, finely chopped, coriander1 tbsp fresh coriander leaves, chopped and remaining lemon or lime juice1 1/2 tbsp lemon juice or lime juice in a bowl., Combine the flour3 tbsp White Plain Flour, ground coriander1 tsp ground coriander and cayenne pepper1/2 tsp cayenne pepper in a large shallow bowl. Turn the fish400g white fish fillets, cut into strips in the flour mixture to coat. Heat the remaining olive oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the fish and cook for 2 minutes each side or until golden and cooked through. Drain on paper towel., Divide the tortillas4 flour tortillas, warmed through among plates. Top with the cabbage mixture, corn, fish, avocado, sour cream1 tbsp Sour Cream, corianderFresh coriander leaves, to serve and chilliThinly sliced fresh jalapeno chilli, to serve (optional), if desired. Serve with the lime cheeks and chilli sauceHot chilli sauce, to serve.

name: Pork tostadas with avocado salsa
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Canola', 'name': 'oil, to shallow-fry'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'corn', 'name': 'tortillas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Mexican chilli powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pork medallions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '425', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can Old El Paso Mexe-Beans, drained'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocado', 'name': ', peeled, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'punnet grape tomatoes, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh coriander'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) coarsely grated cheddar'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 120°C. Add canola oil to a frying pan to come 1cm up side of pan. Heat over medium-high heat. Add 1 tortilla. Cook for 30 seconds each side or until crisp and golden. Transfer to a baking tray lined with paper towel. Repeat with remaining tortillas, reheating oil between batches. Place in oven to keep warm., Combine chilli powder, cumin, garlic and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a bowl. Add pork. Toss to coat. Heat half the remaining olive oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook one-third of pork for 2 minutes or until golden and cooked through. Transfer to a bowl. Cover with foil to keep warm. Repeat, in 2 more batches, with the remaining pork., Add beans to pan. Cook, mashing slightly, for 1-2 minutes or until heated through. Place in a bowl and cover with foil to keep warm., Combine lime juice, sugar and remaining olive oil in a large bowl. Add the avocado, tomato, cucumber and coriander. Toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper., Divide tortillas among serving plates. Top with pork, beans, avocado salsa and cheese.

name: Vanilla bean panna cotta recipe
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(375ml) pouring cream'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(375ml) milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'vanilla', 'name': 'bean'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(115g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'gelatine powder'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sliced', 'name': 'strawberries, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Blueberries', 'name': ', to serve'}]
steps: Place the cream1 1/2 cups (375ml) pouring cream and milk1 1/2 cups (375ml) milk in a saucepan. Use a small sharp knife to split the vanilla bean1 vanilla bean lengthways, then scrape the seeds from inside the bean. Add the seeds and bean to the saucepan. Slowly bring to the boil over a medium heat. Remove from the heat and set aside for 10 minutes., Discard bean from cream mixture. Add sugar1/2 cup (115g) caster sugar and return to a low heat. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes, or until sugar dissolves., Place 2 tablespoons of boiling water in a small heatproof bowl. Sprinkle over gelatine2 1/2 tsp gelatine powder. Bring a small saucepan of water to boil. Remove from heat. Sit the bowl of gelatine in the water and stir until dissolved. Cool slightly, then stir into the cream mixture., Lightly oil 6 x 1/2 cup (125ml) dariole moulds or ramekins. Place on a tray and pour in cream mixture. Refrigerate for 4 hours., To serve, break the seal by inserting a small knife between the panna cotta and the mould. Turn onto a serving plate and shake to release. Serve dish with fresh berriesSliced strawberries, to serve|Blueberries, to serve.

name: Thai grilled beef and eggplant salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) lime juice'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'fresh red chilli, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '300g) long slender eggplant, cut into 1cm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red onion, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef porterhouse steak'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'vermicelli bean thread noodles'}, {'quantity': '85', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) trimmed bean sprouts'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves'}]
steps: Combine the lime juice, fish sauce, brown sugar and chilli in a small bowl. Set aside., Heat a chargrill over medium-high heat. Brush both sides of eggplant with 1 1/2 tbs of the oil. Season. Cook, in batches, turning, for 4 minutes or until charred and tender. Transfer to a large bowl. Drizzle onion with remaining oil, then season. Cook, turning, for 4 minutes or until charred and tender. Transfer to bowl., Drizzle steak with 2 tsp of the lime dressing. Spray with oil. Cook on chargrill, turning, for 4 minutes for medium or until cooked to your liking. Rest for 4 minutes. Remove fat and discard. Thinly slice., Meanwhile, place the noodles in a heatproof bowl. Cover with boiling water. Stand for 3-4 minutes until noodles are tender. Separate with a fork. Refresh under cold running water and drain well., Add noodles, bean sprouts, mint, coriander, steak and half the remaining dressing to the grilled vegetables. Gently toss to combine. Divide among serving plates and drizzle with remaining dressing.

name: Pork tray bake with mustard nut butter
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt microwave white mini potatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Pink', 'name': 'Lady apples, cored, cut into 12 thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, peeled, cut into 12 thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh sage, leaves picked'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'pork', 'name': 'mid-loin chops'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'garlic butter, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '65', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) walnut halves, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard or horseradish mustard'}]
steps: Preheat an oven to 220C/200C fan forced. Microwave the potatoes following packet directions for 5 minutes or until just tender. Set aside to cool slightly and cut each in half. Place in a large bowl. Add the apple, onion, half the sage leaves and 2 tbs oil. Toss until well combined., Heat the remaining 1 tbs oil in a flameproof roasting pan over a medium-high heat. Cook the pork for 3 minutes each side or until golden brown. Transfer to a plate., Transfer the potato mixture to the roasting pan and roast on the top shelf in the oven for 25 minutes or until golden. Place the pork on top of vegetables and roast for a further 10 minutes or until the pork is cooked through., Meanwhile, finely chop half the remaining sage leaves and place into a bowl. Add butter, walnut and mustard. Stir until well combined., Spoon the butter mixture onto the pork and sprinkle with the remaining sage leaves.

name: Quail egg and pancetta pies
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pancetta', 'name': 'slice, very finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onion, trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '24', 'unit': 'cocktail', 'name': 'pastry cases'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '24', 'unit': 'quail', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped chervil'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 160°C. Place a small frying pan over medium heat. Add the pancetta and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until crisp. Add the green onion and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds or until green onion softens. Remove from heat., Place the pastry cases on an oven tray. Spoon the pancetta mixture evenly among the pastry cases. Drizzle the cream evenly among the pastry cases. Carefully crack an egg into each case. Season with salt and pepper. Bake in preheated oven for 4-5 minutes or until egg is just cooked (or cooked as desired). Remove pies from oven, place on a serving plate and sprinkle with chervil. Serve immediately or at room temperature.

name: South Indian pumpkin & coconut soup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '170g pkt Continental South Indian Curry with Roasted Spices Flavour Base'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, peeled, deseeded, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3 cups) water'}, {'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3/4 cup) coconut cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'coconut cream, extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh chives'}]
steps: Combine the flavour base, pumpkin and water in a large saucepan over high heat. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, for 15-20 minutes or until the pumpkin is tender. Remove from heat and set aside for 5 minutes to cool slightly., Place the pumpkin mixture in the jug of a blender and blend until smooth. Transfer to a saucepan and add the coconut cream. Place over medium heat and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until heated through., Ladle the soup among serving bowls. Drizzle with a little extra coconut cream and sprinkle with chives. Serve immediately.

name: Rigatoni Bolognaise
ingredient: [{'quantity': '330', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'thin Italian pork sausages (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'veal mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'brown onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans crushed tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried rigatoni pasta'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'shaved', 'name': 'parmesan cheese, to serve'}]
steps: Squeeze sausage meat from casings. Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add sausage meat and mince. Cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up mince, for 10 minutes or until browned. Transfer to a bowl., Add onion to pan. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add garlic. Cook, stirring for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add tomato. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 5 minutes. Return mince to pan. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until mixture has thickened., Meanwhile, cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling, salted water, following packet directions, until tender. Drain. Return to pan. Add mince mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat. Serve with parmesan.

name: Red wine-poached quince cobbler with honey ice-cream
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'litre', 'name': 'vanilla ice-cream'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry red wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '8cm strips lemon zest'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'vanilla', 'name': 'bean, split lengthways'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'small', 'name': '(1.8kg) quinces, peeled, cored, quartered'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'flaked almonds'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Flaked', 'name': 'almonds, to serve'}]
steps: Place ice-cream in a bowl, reserving container. Set aside for 10 minutes to soften (ice-cream should not be melted). Fold in 2 tablespoons honey to create a marbled effect. Return ice-cream to container. Cover surface with plastic wrap, then lid. Freeze for 3 hours or until firm., Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Combine wine, zest, juice, sugar, vanilla bean and remaining honey in a bowl. Add quince. Toss to coat. Transfer to a 10-cup-capacity baking dish. Cover with baking paper then foil. Bake, stirring halfway during cooking, for 1 hour 15 minutes to 1 hour 30 minutes or until quince is soft. Discard vanilla bean., Make Topping. Sift flour into a large bowl. Use your fingertips, rub butter into flour until mixture resembles coarse breadcrumbs. Stir in sugar. Make a well in the centre. Add buttermilk. Stir to form a soft, sticky dough., Drop large spoonfuls of topping over quince mixture. Sprinkle with aked almonds. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes, or until topping has risen and is golden. Stand 10 minutes. Serve with ice-cream and extra almonds.

name: Samurai chicken stir-fry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'capsicum, deseeded, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'carrot, peeled, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely chopped ginger'}, {'quantity': '650', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken thigh fillets, excess fat trimmed, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) light soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'mirin'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'dried red chillis'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'shallots, trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'rice, to serve'}]
steps: Heat the oil in a wok over high heat. Add the capsicum and carrot and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until softened. Use a slotted spoon to transfer to a plate., Add the garlic and ginger to the work and stir-fry for 1 minute or until aromatic. Add the chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until starting to brown. Add the soy sauce, sugar, mirin and chillies. Reduce heat to medium and simmer, stirring occasionally for 15-20 minutes or until liquid has reduced., Return the capsicum mixture to the wok. Cook, tossing, for 1 minute or until heated through. Drizzle with sesame oil and sprinkle with shallots. Serve with steamed rice.

name: Baby beet, lamb and spinach salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lamb backstraps'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach leaves'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'feta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '425', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can baby beets, drained, halved'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'walnuts, toasted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}]
steps: Preheat a barbecue plate or chargrill over medium-high heat. Brush lamb with 1 tablespoon of oil. Season with salt and pepper. Cook lamb for 5 minutes each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Remove to a plate. Cover with foil. Set aside for 5 minutes to rest., Combine spinach, feta, beets and walnuts in a large bowl. Thinly slice lamb. Add to salad. Toss to combine., Combine vinegar and remaining oil in a jug. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle over salad. Serve.

name: Steak with polenta and black peppercorn sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'beef', 'name': 'fillet steaks (about 180g each)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eschalots', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'sprig', 'name': 'fresh thyme, leaves picked'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) marsala wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'black peppercorns, lightly crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(110g) instant polenta*'}]
steps: Heat the olive oil1 tbsp olive oil and half the butter30g unsalted butter in a large frypan over medium-high heat., Season the steaks4 beef fillet steaks (about 180g each) with salt, then cook in batches for 3-4 minutes on each side, turning once (for medium rare). Cover and set aside to rest for 5 minutes., Add the remaining butter to the frypan and reduce the heat to low. Add the eschalots2 eschalots, thinly sliced and cook for about 1 minute until softened. Add the thyme1 sprig fresh thyme, leaves picked, marsala1/2 cup (125ml) marsala wine and peppercorns2 tsp black peppercorns, lightly crushed. Simmer for about 2 minutes until slightly thickened., Meanwhile, place the chicken stock1 cup (250ml) chicken stock in a saucepan with 1 cup (250ml) of water and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to low, then slowly add the polenta2/3 cup (110g) instant polenta* and cook, stirring constantly, for about 5 minutes or until thick and creamy., Remove from the heat and season with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper. To serve, place polenta and steak on plates and pour over sauce.

name: Chicken baked in limoncello with zucchini 'spaghetti'
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '180g corn-fed chicken breasts with skin, wing bone attached'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'lemons, grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'lemon thyme'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) limoncello*'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}]
steps: Place chicken in a non-metallic dish with garlic, rind and juice, and thyme. Add limoncello, cover and chill for 1 hour., To make zucchini, heat butter and oil in a frypan over medium heat, add garlic and zucchini and stir for 6-8 minutes until just cooked through. Add parsley and lemon juice and season. Serve hot or at room temperature., Preheat oven to 180°C. Heat butter and oil in a large heavy-based frypan over high heat. Remove chicken from marinade (reserving marinade) and brown for 2-3 minutes each side. Place skin-side up on a baking tray and roast for 10 minutes or until cooked through., Return frypan to medium heat, add reserved marinade (including garlic and herbs) and stir for 5 minutes to reduce. Remove chicken from oven and rest for 5 minutes. Place on a serving plate, pour over sauce and serve with zucchini.

name: Tiramisu
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) strong espresso coffee'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) Tia Maria liqueur'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': 'savoiardi', 'name': '(sponge finger biscuits)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', separated'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g tub mascarpone'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Shaved', 'name': 'dark chocolate, to serve'}]
steps: Combine coffee and Tia Maria in a bowl. Dip biscuits, 1 at a time, into the coffee mixture and use to line the sides of four 375ml (1 1/2-cup) capacity serving glasses. Drizzle with remaining coffee mixture., Use an electric beater to beat together the egg yolks and sugar in a medium bowl until thick and creamy. Add the mascarpone and beat until combined., Use a clean electric beater to whisk the egg whites in a bowl until soft peaks form. Use a metal spoon to fold half the egg white into the mascarpone mixture. Fold in the remaining egg white until combined. Spoon mascarpone mixture among glasses. Cover with plastic wrap. Place in the fridge for 6 hours to chill., Sprinkle with chocolate to serve.

name: Our favourite caesar salad recipe
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'bacon', 'name': 'rashers, rind and excess fat trimmed, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'white crusty bread, crusts removed, cut into 1cm cubes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cos', 'name': 'lettuce, washed, dried, torn'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'shaved parmesan'}]
steps: Heat olive oil1 tbsp olive oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the bacon3 bacon rashers, rind and excess fat trimmed, coarsely chopped and cook, stirring, for 2-3 minutes or until golden. Use a slotted spoon to transfer to a plate lined with paper towel., Reduce the heat to medium. Heat the butter20g butter and remainder of the olive oil1 tbsp olive oil in the pan. Add the garlic1 garlic clove, crushed and bread3 slices white crusty bread, crusts removed, cut into 1cm cubes and cook, stirring occasionally, for 4 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel., To make the dressing, place the egg1 egg in a small saucepan of cold water. Bring to the boil over high heat. Cook for 1 minute. Drain. Cool under cold running water. Crack the egg into a bowl. Use a teaspoon to scoop any remaining egg from the shell into the bowl. Place the egg, oil80ml (1/3 cup) extra virgin olive oil, vinegar2 tbsp Italian Red Wine Vinegar, mustard1 tsp Dijon mustard and anchovy fillets2 drained anchovy fillets in the bowl of a food processor and process until combined. Season with salt and pepper., Combine the bacon, bread mixture, lettuce1 cos lettuce, washed, dried, torn and parmesan40g shaved parmesan in a large serving bowl. Drizzle over the dressing to serve.

name: Moroccan sweet potato bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Moroccan seasoning'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'mild paprika'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roughly chopped fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'small orange sweet potatoes, cut into thick wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'Dutch (baby) carrots, trimmed, scrubbed'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, halved, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, slickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'wholemeal couscous'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain Greek-style yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander sprigs, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Line 2 large baking trays with baking paper., Combine seasoning1 tbsp Moroccan seasoning, paprika2 tsp mild paprika, chilli1/4 tsp dried chilli flakes and coriander1/4 cup roughly chopped fresh coriander leaves in a small bowl. Place sweet potato1kg small orange sweet potatoes, cut into thick wedges and carrots1 bunch Dutch (baby) carrots, trimmed, scrubbed in a large bowl. Drizzle vegetables with 2 1/2 tablespoons oil and sprinkle with 3/4 of the spice mix. Rub to coat. Place, in a single layer, on prepared trays. Bake for 20 minutes., Place onion1 red onion, halved, cut into wedges and capsicum1 red capsicum, slickly sliced in bowl. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon oil. Sprinkle with remaining spice mix. Rub to coat. Add to potato and carrot in oven. Bake for a further 25 minutes or until vegetables are golden and tender., Meanwhile, place couscous1 cup wholemeal couscous in a 4.5cm deep, 26cm round (4-cup-capacity) baking dish. Pour over 1 cup cold water and drizzle with remaining oil. Season with salt and pepper. Cover with foil. Bake for 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove and discard foil. Fluff with a fork to separate grains., Combine yoghurt3/4 cup plain Greek-style yoghurt, lemon rind2 tsp finely grated lemon rind and lemon juice1 tbsp lemon juice in a small bowl. Spoon vegetables on top of couscous. Drizzle with yoghurt mixture. Top with coriander sprigsFresh coriander sprigs, to serve and serve with lemon wedgesLemon wedges, to serve.

name: Tex Mex pasta salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '320', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'carton cherry tomato medley mix'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocad', 'name': 'o'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'mini', 'name': 'flour tortillas'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'shallots'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried elbow pasta'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Canola', 'name': 'oil, to shallow-fry'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can corn kernels, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can black beans, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '310', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'jar roasted pepper strips, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh coriander'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Light', 'name': 'sour cream, to serve'}]
steps: Put the kettle on. Fill one-third of a large saucepan with water and place over high heat. Cover and bring to the boil., While the water heats up, cut tomatoes in half, slice the avocado and cut the tortillas into thin strips. Thinly slice the shallots., Pour the boiling water from the kettle into the pan of hot water. Cover and return to the boil. Add the pasta and cook following packet directions for 2 minutes less than stated on the packet. Drain., While the pasta cooks, add oil to a frying pan to come 1cm up the side of the pan. Heat over medium heat. Add the tortilla strips and cook for 1-2 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel to drain., Place the pasta, tomato, corn, beans and peppers in a large serving bowl and toss to combine. Coarsely chop coriander leaves. Add to bowl. Toss until well combined. Top with avocado, tortilla strips and a dollop of sour cream. Season and serve.

name: Mixed bean and peas tomato casserole
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'brown onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '700', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'btl Mutti Tomato Passata'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'frozen baby green beans'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'frozen broad beans, thawed, peeled'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil leaves, plus extra leaves to serve'}]
steps: Heat oil in a small flameproof casserole dish over medium heat. Add onion. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until tender. Add garlic. Cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add vinegar. Cook for 1 minute. Add passata, green beans and sugar. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 6 to 8 minutes., Stir in broad beans, peas and chopped basil. Cook for 2 minutes or until sauce is slightly thickened and peas are warmed through. Sprinkle with extra basil. Serve.

name: Honey ricotta crepes with orange sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '115', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eg', 'name': 'g'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'whites'}, {'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3/4 cup) reduced-fat milk'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'reduced-fat ricotta'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'orange', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'vanilla', 'name': 'bean, split'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'reduced-fat dairy spread (Devondale brand), melted'}]
steps: Sift flour into a bowl. Make a well in the centre. Whisk egg, egg whites and milk in a jug. Pour 2-3 tablespoons of the milk mixture into flour and use a wooden spoon to gradually mix. Gradually add remaining milk and whisk until smooth. Cover batter with plastic wrap and set aside for 20 minutes to rest., Combine ricotta and honey in a bowl. Cover and place in the fridge., Use a zester to remove rind from 1 orange. Place in a saucepan. Peel 1 of the remaining oranges (remove pith). Use a sharp knife to segment orange and place in a bowl. Juice remaining oranges and add to saucepan. Add vanilla bean and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and cook, uncovered, for 5 minutes. Add orange segments and set aside., Brush a little spread over the base of a small (14cm diameter) non-stick frying pan and heat over medium-high heat. Pour 2 tablespoons of batter into the pan and tilt to cover the base. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 1 minute or until golden. Turn and cook for 30 seconds or until just cooked. Transfer to a plate and cover with a tea towel to keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter, greasing pan with dairy spread if crepes stick, to make 11 more crepes., Place crepes browned-side down, spread with ricotta and roll to enclose. Place 3 crepes in each dish. Top with orange sauce and serve immediately.

name: Pappardelle with hazelnut and parsley pesto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'kent pumpkin, peeled, seeded, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'rashers', 'name': 'middle bacon, trimmed, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh breadcrumbs (see note p24)'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet dried pappardelle pasta'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'loosely packed fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '35', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dry-roasted hazelnuts'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'garlic clove, quartered'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced. Line a large baking tray with baking paper. Place pumpkin on prepared tray. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon oil. Season with salt and pepper. Roast for 20 minutes or until golden and tender., Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add bacon. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until crisp. Add breadcrumbs. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until golden. Remove from heat., Cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling, salted water, following packet directions, until tender. Drain, reserving 1/3 cup cooking liquid. Return to pan., Meanwhile, place parsley, rocket, hazelnuts, lemon rind, lemon juice, garlic and 2 tablespoons cold water in a food processor. Process, scraping down sides occasionally, until almost smooth. With motor running, add remaining oil in a slow, steady stream. Process until combined., Add hazelnut and parsley pesto, pumpkin and reserved cooking liquid to pasta. Toss to combine. Serve pasta sprinkled with breadcrumb mixture.

name: Peach splash cocktail
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'peaches', 'name': ', peeled, halved, pitted, finely sliced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': None, 'name': '-4 fresh lime leaves or 1/2 lime, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) light rum'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) cranberry juice'}]
steps: These drinks are prepared in two stages: first you make the alcoholic marinade, which also doubles as a fruit garnish, and then you add soda water., Pour all the ingredients for the marinade into a portable flask, bottle or jar (preferably the night before the picnic). Secure the lid, give it a quick shake and refrigerate. To serve, fill a tall glass with ice, half fill with the marinade, then top up with soda.

name: Honeycomb semifreddo with strawberries
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '600ml ctn thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', separated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '50g bars honeycomb chocolate, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g punnet strawberries, washed, hulled, cut into 1cm pieces'}]
steps: Line the base and 2 long sides of an 11 x 21cm (base measurement) loaf pan with plastic wrap, allowing the sides to overhang., Use an electric beater to beat the cream and sugar in a bowl until soft peaks form. Add the egg yolks and beat to combine., Use a clean, dry electric beater to beat the egg whites in a clean, dry bowl until firm peaks form. Use a large metal spoon to gently fold the egg whites into the cream mixture., Add half the Violet Crumble to the cream mixture and gently fold until just combined. Pour into the lined pan. Fold over the plastic wrap to cover. Place in the freezer overnight or until firm., Remove the semifreddo from the freezer and set aside for 10 minutes to soften slightly. Turn onto a chopping board. Remove the plastic wrap. Cut into slices. Divide among serving plates. Top with the strawberries and the remaining Violet Crumble. Serve immediately.

name: Choc mousse tart with berries and port glaze
ingredient: [{'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'filo pastry'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'ripe bananas, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'ripe', 'name': 'avocado, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'raw cacao powder, sifted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'coconut oil'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) dark agave nectar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'port'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh raspberries'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C fan forced. Spray a 2cm-deep, 21cm (base measurement) fluted tart tin with olive oil. Place filo on a clean surface. Cover with a damp tea towel to prevent drying out. Spray 1 filo sheet with olive oil. Place in prepared pan. Repeat with remaining filo, alternately placing sheets horizontally and vertically, to line the tin. Spray with oil. Use scissors to trim pastry 1cm above side of pan. Bake for 6-8 minutes or until golden and crisp. Cool completely., Meanwhile, process the banana, avocado, cacao powder, coconut oil and 2 tbs of agave nectar in a food processor until smooth and combined., Place the port and the remaining agave nectar in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 3-4 minutes or until syrupy. Transfer to a bowl. Cool completely., Transfer the filo case to a platter. Gently press the back of a spoon over the base to lightly crush and flatten the filo. Fill with chocolate mousse mixture and smooth the surface. Top with the raspberries and drizzle with port glaze.

name: The ultimate breakfast toastie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'thick', 'name': 'slices white country loaf or ‘toast’ bread'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Obela Classic Hommus Spread 375g'}, {'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'thinly sliced leg ham'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'roma', 'name': 'tomatoes, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'cheddar'}]
steps: Place the eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to the boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 5-7 minutes for hard-boiled or until cooked to your liking. Drain and cool under cold running water. Peel. Thickly slice., Preheat a sandwich press. Spread 4 slices of bread with 1 tablespoon Obela Smooth Classic Hommus each. Divide the spinach, egg, ham, tomato and cheese between 2 slices. Season well. Cover with remaining slices, hommus side down., Place in the sandwich press. Close lid and cook for 1-2 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Cut in half to serve.

name: Frozen almond creams with peaches and cherries in dessert wine
ingredient: [{'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'whole blanched almonds, toasted, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '275', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/4 cups) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '7', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'whites, plus 1 extra'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream, whipped to soft peaks'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) flaked almonds'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'peaches', 'name': ', peeled, halved, stoned, each cut into 8 wedges'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '18', 'unit': 'cherrie', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) dessert wine'}]
steps: Process almonds and 55g (1/4 cup) sugar in a food processor until finely ground. Using an electric mixer, whisk 7 egg whites to soft peaks, gradually add 55g (1/4 cup) sugar and vanilla, and whisk to firm peaks. Gently fold in almond mixture and whipped cream., Place six 5cm-deep x 6cm diameter ring moulds on a baking paper-lined oven tray and fill with mixture, or use six 180ml (3/4-cup) capacity moulds. Freeze for at least 4 hours or overnight., Preheat oven to 180C. Combine flaked almonds, 55g (1/4 cup) sugar and extra egg white in a bowl and spread onto a baking paper-lined oven tray. Bake for 20 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes, or until golden. Cool on tray, then break into small, irregular pieces., Toss peaches with remaining 110g (1/2 cup) sugar in a bowl. Heat butter in a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add peaches and cook for 1 minute each side or until caramelised. Add cherries and wine, and simmer until sauce thickens. Transfer to a bowl to cool slightly., To serve, rub a hot cloth around ring moulds to loosen filling, then place on plates and lift rings away. Top each almond cream with some of the fruit mixture and place a little more to the side, then scatter with almond clusters.

name: Chorizo and borlotti bean soup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) dried borlotti beans'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'chorizo', 'name': 'sausages, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'sticks, ends trimmed, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': '(about 200g) fennel bulb, ends trimmed, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) dry sherry'}, {'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'L', 'name': '(6 cups) Massel chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'zucchini, ends trimmed, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'English spinach, stems trimmed, finely shredded'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Grated', 'name': 'parmesan, to serve'}]
steps: Place beans in a glass bowl and cover with cold water. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside overnight to soak. Drain., Place beans and water in a saucepan and bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 45 minutes or until tender. Drain well., Meanwhile, heat a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add chorizo and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a bowl. Add celery, fennel, carrot and garlic and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until tender. Add sherry and bring to the boil. Add chorizo, stock, tomato and zucchini and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes or until mixture thickens. Add beans and cook for a further 1 minute or until heated through. Remove from heat., Taste and season with salt and pepper. Add spinach and basil and stir until spinach wilts. Ladle soup among bowls and sprinkle with parmesan to serve.

name: Spring chicken with flageolet beans and pancetta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'shallots', 'name': '(spring onions), chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'chilli, seeded, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'fennel bulb, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '425g cans flageolet beans, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', zested, juiced'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped mixed herbs'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '500g each) spatchcock or baby chickens'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'mild pancetta'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) Chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) vincotto (see Notes)'}]
steps: Heat half the oil60ml (1/4 cup) olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat, add the garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed, shallots2 shallots (spring onions), chopped, chilli1 red chilli, seeded, finely chopped and fennel1 small fennel bulb, chopped and saute for 5 minutes, stirring to prevent it from catching. Add the beans2 x 425g cans flageolet beans, drained, lemon1 lemon, zested, juiced zest and juice and season with salt and pepper. Stir in half the herbs6 tbsp chopped mixed herbs. Remove from heat, cover and set aside to cool., Combine the remaining herbs and olive oil together, then use to rub all over the spatchcock4 (about 500g each) spatchcock or baby chickens. Use kitchen string to tie the legs together., Preheat oven to 200°C. Place the spatchcocks in a roasting dish and roast in the oven for 25-30 minutes, adding pancetta for the last 6-8 minutes of cooking, until spatchcocks are cooked through and the pancetta8 slices mild pancetta is crisp. Remove pancetta and break into shards. Set aside spatchcocks to rest while you make the sauce., Drain the excess fat from the roasting pan, then add the stock250ml (1 cup) Chicken stock and vincotto250ml (1 cup) vincotto (see Notes) to the pan and cook over high heat, scraping the base of the pan, until reduced by half., Cut each spatchcock into four pieces. Place some bean mixture on each serving plate, then top with the spatchcock pieces and some of the pancetta shards. Finish with a drizzle of the sauce.

name: Summer berry cheesecake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'plain sweet biscuits, coarsely broken'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'buttersnap biscuits, coarsely broken'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'melted butter'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen raspberries, defrosted'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'white cooking chocolate, chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cream cheese, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(215g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'ctn mascarpone'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'ctn sour cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': '-3 drops pink liquid food colouring'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'fruit (strawberries, raspberries, blueberries and cherries), to decorate'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Icing', 'name': 'sugar mixture, to dust'}]
steps: Line the base and side of a round 20cm (base measurement) springform pan with baking paper., Process the combined biscuit in a food processor until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add butter and process until well combined. Place in the prepared pan and use a straight-sided glass to spread and press the biscuit mixture over the base and side. Place in the fridge for 30 minutes to chill., Meanwhile, process the frozen raspberries in a food processor until smooth. Strain through a fine sieve into a jug, using the back of a spoon to press as much pulp through as possible., Place the chocolate in a heatproof bowl over a saucepan half-filled with simmering water. Stir with a metal spoon until melted and smooth., Preheat oven to 160°C. Process the cream cheese and sugar in a food processor until smooth. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, processing well between each addition. Add the mascarpone and sour cream and process until combined. Add the melted chocolate and process until just combined., Pour evenly among two medium bowls. Add the raspberry pulp to 1 portion and stir to combine. Add the pink food colouring and stir to combine., Pour half the cream cheese mixture into the prepared base. Pour half the raspberry mixture over the top. Continue layering with the remaining cream cheese mixture and raspberry mixture. Use a skewer to gently swirl to create a marbled pattern., Place on an oven tray. Bake for 1 hour or until just set. Turn off oven and leave, with door ajar, for 2 hours to cool. Transfer to fridge to cool., Transfer the cheesecake to a serving plate. Top with mixed berries and dust with icing sugar.

name: Spanish potato, chorizo & herb tortilla
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, quartered, seeded'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'red delight potatoes, peeled, cut into4cmpieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'chorizo', 'name': ', coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'feta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh continental parsley, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'rocket leaves or basil leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat grill on high. Cook capsicum, skin-side up, under grill for 8-10 minutes or until charred and blistered. Transfer to a sealable plastic bag. Seal and set aside for 10 minutes. Peel and cut into 2cm pieces., Meanwhile, cook the potato in a large saucepan of salted boiling water for 7-8 minutes or until just tender. Drain., Heat the oil in a 22cm (base measurement) non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook chorizo, turning occasionally, for 3-4 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a plate. Add potato to pan and cook, turning occasionally, until golden brown. Add chorizo and capsicum and spread evenly. Top with the feta., Whisk eggs, parsley and chives in a jug. Season. Pour into pan. Reduce heat to low and shake pan slightly to evenly distribute the egg., Cook until set around the edge but still runny in the centre. Cook under grill for 3-4 minutes or until golden and just set. Serve with rocket or basil.

name: Hot spiced apple cider
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.25', 'unit': 'L', 'name': 'non-alcoholic apple cider'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'sticks'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'crushed', 'name': 'cardamom pods'}]
steps: Heat apple cider, cinnamon and cardamom in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes to allow the spices to infuse their flavour., Strain and divide among serving glasses. Serve immediately.

name: French toast with tomatoes, mushrooms and pesto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'flat', 'name': 'mushrooms, stems trimmed'}, {'quantity': '240', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt cherry truss tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '45', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'crusty', 'name': 'sourdough bread rolls'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) milk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'basil pesto'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C. Place the mushrooms, stem-side up, and tomatoes in a baking dish. Divide one-third of the butter among the mushrooms. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until tender., Meanwhile, combine the parmesan and parsley on a large plate. Trim the ends from the bread rolls and cut each roll diagonally into 4 slices. Combine the egg and milk in a large, shallow dish. Soak the bread in the egg mixture, turning, until all the liquid is absorbed., Melt half the remaining butter in a large frying pan over medium heat. Cook half the bread for 2-3 minutes each side or until golden. Add to the parmesan mixture. Toss to lightly coat. Transfer to a plate. Cover with foil to keep warm. Repeat with remaining butter, bread and parmesan mixture. Divide the toast, mushrooms and tomatoes among serving plates. Top with the pesto.

name: Apple and prosciutto chicken
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '220g each) single chicken supremes'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'thin', 'name': 'slices prosciutto, cut in half crossways'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'golden', 'name': 'delicious apple, peeled, cored, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'calvados liqueur'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) creme fraiche'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'thin cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'wholegrain mustard'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'watercress, leaves picked, washed, dried'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'radicchio', 'name': ', leaves separated, washed, dried'}]
steps: Use a small sharp knife to cut into the side of each chicken breast to create a pocket (don't cut all the way through). Season with salt and pepper., Place 2 pieces of prosciutto in each chicken pocket. Then place one quarter of the apple slices in each pocket and secure each with a toothpick to enclose the filling., Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the chicken, skin-side down, and cook, uncovered, for 8 minutes or until skin is golden brown and crisp. Turn and cook for a further 8 minutes or until cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Cover loosely with foil and set aside for 5 minutes to rest., Increase heat to high. Add the calvados to frying pan and cook, shaking the pan, for 1 minute or until calvados reduces slightly. Add the creme fraiche, cream and mustard, and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until the sauce thickens slightly., Combine watercress and radicchio in a bowl. Remove toothpicks from chicken. To serve, arrange chicken, watercress and radicchio on serving plates and drizzle with sauce.

name: Roasted pastrami rubbed beef with fennel and leeks
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'fennel', 'name': ', cut into wedges, fronds reserved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'leeks', 'name': ', halved lengthways, cut into 5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Kent pumpkin, peeled, seeded, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'bulb, halved crossways'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Coles Beef Blade Roast with Pastrami Rub'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'portobello', 'name': 'mushrooms'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Flat', 'name': '-leaf parsley leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180˚C. Line a roasting pan with baking paper. Place the fennel wedges, leek, pumpkin and garlic in the lined pan. Season. Top with the beef and drizzle with oil. Roast for 40 mins. Add the mushrooms to the pan and roast for a further 20 mins for medium or until the beef is cooked to your liking. Loosely cover with foil and set aside for 10 mins to rest., Slice the beef. Sprinkle with the parsley and reserved fennel fronds. Serve with the vegetables.

name: Fennel and udon noodle salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried udon noodles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'fennel bulb, trimmed, fronds reserved'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow peas, trimmed, thinly sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'yellow capsicum, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'grape tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, halved, thinly sliced'}]
steps: Cook noodles in a large saucepan of boiling, salted water for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain. Refresh under cold water. Drain., Thinly slice fennel bulb. Place fennel, snow peas, capsicum, tomato, onion and noodles in a large bowl., Make Red wine dressing: Place vinegar, oil, garlic and 1 tablespoon finely chopped reserved fennel fronds in a screw-top jar. Season with salt and pepper. Secure lid. Shake to combine. Pour over fennel mixture. Toss to combine. Serve.

name: Fruit tea cream
ingredient: [{'quantity': '15', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fruit tea leaves (we used Bolero tea by Mariage Freres*)'}, {'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thick cream'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': '(15g) leaf gelatine*, soaked in cold water (or 1 1/2 tsp powdered gelatine)'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fruit tea leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(220g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) white vinegar'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sesame seeds, lightly toasted'}]
steps: Place tea, cream and sugar in a pan over low heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring to just below boiling point, then strain into a bowl. If using gelatine sheets, squeeze out excess water and add to cream. If using powdered gelatine, sprinkle onto cream, wait 1 minute, then stir until dissolved., Pour into four 125ml dariole moulds. Refrigerate overnight until set., To make syrup, bring 1 cup of water to boil in pan, then add tea. Remove from heat and infuse for 5 minutes, then strain. Return liquid to pan, add sugar and stir until dissolved. Increase heat to medium, simmer until reduced by half, then cool completely., To make wafers, place sugar, vinegar and 2 tablespoons water in a pan over medium heat. Stir to dissolve sugar. Bring to the boil and simmer for 8-10 minutes, without stirring, until golden Add seeds and cook for 1 minute - don't allow to go too brown. Line a tray with lightly oiled foil. Pour mixture over tray, rolling tray to spread. Cool, then break into shards. Turn out creams, pour syrup over top and serve with wafers. Garnish with petals from tea.

name: Fish parcels with shallots
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'shallots', 'name': ', trimmed, pale section thinly sliced diagonally, green section cut into thin strips'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'white', 'name': 'fish fillets'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': '-piece fresh ginger, cut into thin strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Place shallot strips in a bowl of iced water in the fridge for 15 minutes. Drain., Meanwhile, cut four 40cm squares of baking paper and four 40cm squares of foil. Place 1 paper square on top of 1 foil square. Top with 1 fish fillet. Repeat with remaining paper, foil and fish. Divide the sliced shallot, ginger, soy sauce and oil among fish. Fold up to enclose filling. Bake on 2 baking trays for 15 minutes or until just cooked through., Open the parcels. Top with shallot curls.

name: Pork and strawberry salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pork fillet'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cracked black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'strawberries, hulled, halved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'salad leaves'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'goats cheese, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sunflower seeds'}]
steps: Heat a frying pan over medium-high heat. Drizzle pork with half the oil. Sprinkle with pepper and rub to coat. Cook pork, turning, for 12 to 15 minutes or until cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Stand covered for 5 minutes to rest. Reduce heat to low. Add balsamic vinegar to pan. Bring to a simmer. Simmer for 5 minutes or until reduced by half., Place strawberries, balsamic vinegar and lemon juice in a bowl. Toss to combine., Slice pork. Place salad leaves on a platter. Top with pork, strawberry mixture, cheese and seeds. Serve.

name: Rosemary chicken skewers with lemon salt
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'fresh rosemary'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'chicken', 'name': 'thigh fillets, excess fat trimmed, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', rind finely grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': '-2 tsp sea salt flakes'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}]
steps: Run your fingers down 1 rosemary stalk to remove two-thirds of the leaves from the rosemary lower part of the stalk. Reserve leaves. Repeat with the remaining stalks., Finely chop the reserved rosemary leaves to make 2 tablespoonfuls., Combine the chopped rosemary, chicken, garlic, lemon juice and oil in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 3 hours to marinate., Meanwhile, combine the lemon rind and sea salt in a small bowl. Season with pepper., Use a metal skewer to pierce the chicken. Thread chicken onto the rosemary skewers. Preheat a chargrill on medium-high. Spray with oil. Cook half the chicken skewers for 3-4 minutes each side or until cooked through. Transfer to a serving platter and cover with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining chicken skewers. Sprinkle with the lemon salt.

name: Satay chicken burgers
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander leaves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Fountain Satay Sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'hamburger', 'name': 'buns, split'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'oak', 'name': 'leaf lettuce leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber, cut into long, thin ribbons'}]
steps: Combine mince, onions, coriander and 1/4 cup satay sauce in a bowl. Mix until well combined. Using hands, shape mixture into 4 patties. Place on a lined tray. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes, if time permits., Heat oil in a large, non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add patties. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes each side or until golden and cooked through. Drain on paper towel., Meanwhile, heat remaining 1/4 cup satay sauce in a small saucepan over low heat. Toast bread buns., Place bun bases on a board. Top each with lettuce, cucumber and 1 pattie. Spoon over warm satay sauce and cover with bun tops. Serve.

name: Roasted cauliflower salad with poblano chillies and chickpeas
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'poblano', 'name': 'chillies'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, unpeeled'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(160ml) olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(120g) sour cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'cauliflower (about 900g), cut into large florets'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chickpeas, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(160g) shredded green cabbage'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, very thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Danish-style fetta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'radishes', 'name': ', finely shaved'}]
steps: Preheat grill on high. Line a large heavy-rimmed baking tray with foil and toss the chillies and garlic with 1 tbs oil. Cook under the grill, turning the chillies and garlic halfway through cooking, for 15 mins or until the chillies are charred all over and garlic skins are blackened. Transfer to a bowl. Cover and set aside for 10 mins to cool., Peel the garlic, discarding the skins. Peel and seed the chillies. Tear 2 chillies into strips and reserve. Finely chop the garlic and remaining chilli until a paste forms. Place the sour cream in a bowl. Add the chilli mixture, coriander and 2 tbs water. Stir to combine. Season with salt. Cover and place in the fridge to chill until ready to serve., Preheat oven to 230°C (210°C fan-forced). Remove and discard foil from the baking tray. Place baking tray in the oven for 5 mins to preheat., In a large bowl, combine the cumin, paprika, 1/4 cup (60ml) oil, 1 1/2 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp pepper. Add cauliflower and chickpeas and toss to coat. Arrange the cauliflower mixture in a single layer on the hot baking tray. Roast for 15 mins. Toss and roast for a further 10-15 mins or until the cauliflower is crisp-tender and the chickpeas are crisp., In a small bowl, whisk the lime juice, mustard, honey and remaining oil. Season with salt and pepper., Spread sour cream mixture over a serving platter. Sprinkle with cabbage and onion. Top with the cauliflower, chickpeas and reserved chilli strips. Drizzle with the lime juice mixture. Sprinkle with fetta and radish to serve.

name: Carrot and sunflower seed muffins with lemon icing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '140g container apple fruit puree'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) reduced-fat milk or light soy milk'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'light olive oil'}, {'quantity': '155', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/4 cups, firmly packed) finely shredded carrot'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sunflower seed kernels'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '265', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 3/4 cups) gluten-free all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '3 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'gluten-free baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'mixed spice'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sunflower seed kernels, extra'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line twelve 80ml (1/3 cup) capacity muffin pans with paper cases. Whisk together the eggs, apple puree, milk, sugar and oil in a large bowl until well combined. Stir in the carrot, sunflower seeds and lemon rind., Sift the flour mix, baking powder and mixed spice into the carrot mixture. Use a large metal spoon to fold until well combined. Spoon batter evenly among prepared pans., Bake in preheated oven for 18-20 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centres comes out clean. Remove from oven. Turn muffins onto a wire rack and set aside to cool completely., Meanwhile, to make the lemon icing, sift icing sugar into a bowl. Add the lemon rind and melted butter. Stir in the lemon juice until a smooth paste forms. Drizzle the muffins with icing and sprinkle with the extra sunflower seeds. Set aside for 15 minutes to set.

name: Spanish pear tarts with pedro ximenez syrup
