ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(200g) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chilled unsalted butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(30g) almond meal'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground aniseed (see note) (optional)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(75g) icing sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eg', 'name': 'g'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250g) mascarpone cheese'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(70g) thick Greek-style yoghurt'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Melted', 'name': 'chocolate, to drizzle (optional)'}]
steps: For pears, peel, halve and core fruit, leaving stems intact. Pare 2 strips of rind from lemon and set aside, then halve lemon and rub over the pears to keep them from browning. Place sugar, rind, cinnamon, vanilla pod and seeds in a pan with 1 1/4 cups (310ml) water. Stir over low heat until sugar dissolves. Add sherry and pears, then cover surface closely with baking paper cut to fit. Increase heat to medium-low. Simmer for 15-20 minutes (depending on ripeness) until pears are tender. Chill pears in the liquid overnight., The next day, place flour, butter, almond meal, aniseed and 2 tablespoons icing sugar in a food processor with 1/2 teaspoon salt. Process until mixture resembles breadcrumbs. Add egg and vanilla and process until it comes together in a smooth ball. Enclose pastry in plastic wrap. Chill for 30 minutes., Grease six 10cm loose-bottomed tart pans. Divide dough into 6 pieces, roll out to 3mm thick, then use to line the pans. Chill for a further 15 minutes., Preheat oven to 180°C. Line pastry with baking paper and fill with pastry weights or uncooked rice, then blind-bake for 10 minutes. Remove paper and weights and cook for a further 3-5 minutes until pastry is crisp and golden. Allow to cool., Meanwhile, remove pears from syrup and transfer syrup to a saucepan. Bring to the boil, then simmer over medium-low heat for 15-20 minutes until thick and syrupy. Cool. Slice each pear lengthways almost to the top, leaving stem-end intact., Combine mascarpone, yoghurt and remaining 1/3 cup (50g) icing sugar, then spread into tart cases. Place 2 pear halves on top, fanning out slices, then brush with the reduced syrup just before serving. If desired, drizzle plates with chocolate.

name: Surf and turf rissole traybake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef mince'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) panko breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen potato wedges'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green prawns, peeled and deveined'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'pouring cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Massel Chicken Stock Powder'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, steamed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan forced. Heat 2 tsp oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the onion1 small brown onion, finely chopped and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until soft. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside to cool., Add beef750g beef mince, breadcrumbs25g (1/2 cup) panko breadcrumbs, egg1 egg, lightly whisked and sauce to the bowl. Season. Use dampened hands to mix until well combined. Divide into 4 equal portions. Shape into patties about 9cm in diameter., Arrange potato wedges400g frozen potato wedges on a large baking tray. Place in the oven., Meanwhile, heat 2 tsp oil in pan over medium heat. Cook rissoles for 3 minutes each side or until browned. Add to tray with wedgesLemon wedges, to serve. Bake for 25 minutes., While the rissoles bake, heat remaining 2 tsp of oil in the pan over medium-high heat. Add prawns300g green prawns, peeled and deveined. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until lightly golden. Transfer to a plate. Set aside. Reduce heat to low. Add garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed to pan. Cook, stirring, for 30 seconds or until aromatic. Add cream150ml pouring cream and stock powder1 tsp Chicken Stock Powder. Bring to a simmer, stirring and scraping base of pan with a wooden spoon. Return prawns to pan. Increase heat to medium. Cook for 2 minutes or until prawns are cooked through., Add steamed beans200g green beans, steamed to the tray. Top the rissole with prawns and drizzle over the creamy sauce. Sprinkle with chives1 tbsp chopped fresh chives and serve with steamed beans and lemon wedges.

name: Swordfish with capsicum & macadamia pesto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) white wine (preferably sweet)'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'light soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '180-200g swordfish steaks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(400g) jasmine rice'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pandanus', 'name': 'leaf, tied in a knot (optional) (see Notes)'}]
steps: Combine wine, coriander, garlic and soy in a bowl. Add fish and coat well. Leave to marinate for 30 minutes., For pesto, process all ingredients except oil and lemon juice in a food processor. With motor running, slowly add oil, then add juice., Rinse rice in cold water several times. Place in a saucepan with coconut milk, pandanus leaf, 400ml water and 1 teaspoon salt. Bring to boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 15 minutes until cooked. Drain and discard leaf., Cook fish on a chargrill or barbecue over medium-high heat for 3-4 minutes each side. Serve with pesto and rice.

name: Sticky Hawaiian chicken
ingredient: [{'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) fresh pineapple juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh ginger, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': ', rind finely grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '1.2kg) chicken marylands, excess fat trimmed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'small', 'name': '(about 530g) sweet potatoes, scrubbed, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red onion, cut into wedges'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 200C/180C fan forced. Combine pineapple juice, tomato sauce, soy sauce, honey, ginger, garlic, cumin, chilli, 1⁄2 tsp lime rind and 1 tbs lime juice in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 6-7 minutes or until thickened slightly., Meanwhile, heat a large flameproof roasting pan over medium-high heat. Spray the chicken with olive oil. Season. Cook the chicken, turning, for 5 minutes or until browned., Add sweet potato and onion to pan. Pour over the pineapple mixture and roast, basting twice with pan juices, for 35 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and caramelised. Serve sprinkled with the remaining lime rind.

name: Warm sausage salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'thick', 'name': 'lean lamb sausages'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'oranges', 'name': ', juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'couscous'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'mint leaves, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'basil leaves, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chilli, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, deseeded, roughly chopped'}]
steps: Place pumpkin, in a single layer, on a microwave-safe plate. Cover and microwave on HIGH (100%) for 4 to 5 minutes or until just tender. Drain., Spray a large, non-stick frying pan with oil and heat over medium-high heat. Add sausages and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until cooked through. Remove from pan. Cover to keep warm., Spray pumpkin with oil. Add to pan and cook for 5 minutes or until light golden., Meanwhile, bring 1/2 cup orange juice and 1/2 cup cold water to the boil in a saucepan over high heat. Place couscous in a large, heatproof bowl. Pour over boiling liquid. Stir with a fork to combine. Cover and stand for 5 minutes or until couscous has absorbed all liquid. Drizzle with oil. Stir., Slice sausages. Combine sausages, pumpkin, spinach, mint, basil, chilli and couscous. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

name: Prawn fried rice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(200g) jasmine rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Australian Free Range Eggs, lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'raw prawns, peeled leaving tails intact, deveined'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'streaky', 'name': 'bacon rashers, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(120g) frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'salt-reduced soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}]
steps: Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil over medium-high heat. Add rice. Cook for 12 mins or until tender. Drain well. Spread the rice evenly over a baking tray. Place in the fridge for 2 hours or until rice is dry to the touch., Heat a wok over high heat. Add 1 teaspoon of the oil and swirl to coat the base of the wok. Add half the egg and swirl to coat the base. Cook for 30 secs or until egg is lightly golden underneath and just set. Turn onto a clean work surface. Roll the egg into a log and thinly slice crossways. Repeat with remaining egg., Heat half the remaining oil in the wok over high heat. Stir-fry the prawns for 2 mins or until prawns curl and change colour. Transfer to a bowl., Add remaining oil to the wok. Stir-fry the bacon for 2-3 mins or until golden brown. Add garlic and ginger. Stir-fry for 30 secs. Return prawns to the wok with rice and peas. Stir-fry for 3-5 mins or until rice is heated through. Add soy sauce, egg and half the spring onion. Stir-fry for 1 min or until well combined and heated through. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with remaining spring onion.

name: Japanese sticky salmon
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Massel chicken style stock powder'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) brown rice and quinoa'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'L', 'name': '(4 cups) Massel chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece fresh ginger, peeled, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '120g salmon fillets'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'mirin, plus 1 tbsp extra'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'salt-reduced soy sauce, plus 2 tsp extra'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocado', 'name': ', sliced'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) dried cranberries'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) tamari almonds, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'picked watercress sprigs'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}]
steps: Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil. Add stock powder and rice and cook for 25 minutes or until just tender. Drain. Set aside to cool., Meanwhile place liquid stock and ginger in a deep frying pan and bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Add salmon. Simmer gently for 5 minutes or until fish is almost cooked through. Transfer to a baking tray., Combine mirin, soy and honey in a small saucepan and heat over medium heat. Simmer for 3 minutes or until reduced by half., Combine cooled rice, cranberries, almonds, watercress and avocado in a large bowl. Combine lemon juice, sesame oil and extra mirin and soy sauce in a small bowl. Add to salad and gently toss to combine., Preheat grill on high heat. Brush salmon fillets with the mirin glaze. Grill salmon for 1-2 minutes or until bubbling and caramelised. Serve salmon with the rice salad.

name: Curried beef and pappadam nachos
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'ghee'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'korma curry paste'}, {'quantity': '175', 'unit': 'g', 'name': "(3/4 cup) Maharajah's Choice Red Split Lentils, rinsed"}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) Mutti Tomato Passata'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) beef stock'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'Pappadam', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1 1/3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'baby spinach leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Greek', 'name': 'yoghurt, to serve'}]
steps: Melt ghee1 tbsp ghee in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion1 brown onion, finely chopped and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until golden. Increase heat to high. Add mince500g beef mince and cook for 5 minutes or until browned. Add curry paste2 tbsp korma curry paste and stir to coat. Add lentils175g (3/4 cup) Maharajah's Choice Red Split Lentils, rinsed, passata250ml (1 cup) Mutti Tomato Passata and stock500ml (2 cups) beef stock. Reduce heat to medium and cook, stirring often, for 15 minutes or until lentils are soft and liquid has reduced., Meanwhile, cook pappadams20 Pappadams in the microwave following packet directions., Divide the pappadams among bowls. Top with beef mixture and spinach1 1/3 cups baby spinach leaves. Serve with the yoghurtGreek yoghurt, to serve.

name: Quick-cook puds orange & raisin puddings
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Melted', 'name': 'butter, to grease'}, {'quantity': '90', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup, firmly packed) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated orange rind'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) wholemeal breadcrumbs (made from day-old bread)'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) chopped raisins'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) self-raising flour, sifted'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) fresh orange juice'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, extra'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) pouring cream'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'custard powder'}]
steps: Brush four 250ml (1-cup) capacity microwave-safe ramekins with melted butter. Use an electric beater to beat the butter, brown sugar and 1 tablespoon of orange rind in a bowl until pale and creamy. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition., Stir in breadcrumbs and raisins. Stir in flour and half the orange juice, in alternating batches, until combined., Divide among prepared ramekins. Cook on Medium/500watts/50% for 5-7 minutes or until a skewer inserted into centres comes out clean. Set aside for 2 minutes to cool slightly., Meanwhile, melt the extra butter in a microwave-safe bowl on High/ 800watts/100% for 30 seconds. Stir in cream, caster sugar, custard powder and remaining orange rind and orange juice. Cook on High/800watts/100%, stirring once, for 3 minutes or until thick., Turn the puddings onto serving plates and drizzle over the custard.

name: Satay beef steak with cucumber salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'satay sauce'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef rump steak'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumbers'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chilli, halved, deseeded, thinly sliced'}]
steps: Combine satay sauce, 1 tablespoon lime juice and 1 tablespoon cold water in a glass or ceramic dish. Add beef. Turn to coat. Cover. Refrigerate for 30 minutes, if time permits., Using a vegetable peeler, cut cucumbers into ribbons. Place cucumber, coriander, chilli and remaining lime juice in a bowl. Toss to combine., Heat a greased barbecue plate or chargrill over medium-high heat. Cook beef for 3 to 4 minutes each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate. Cover. Set aside for 5 minutes to rest. Thinly slice., Serve beef with cucumber mixture.

name: Portuguese chicken
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chilli, seeded, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'ground paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'oregano, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt flakes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Coles Australian RSPCA Approved Extra Large Whole Chicken, cut into portions'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'baby Red Royale potatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onions, cut into wedges'}]
steps: Combine the garlic, chilli, vinegar, oil, sugar, paprika, oregano and salt in a bowl. Add the chicken and toss to combine. Cover with plastic wrap. Place in the fridge for 2 hours to marinate., Preheat oven to 200C. Place chicken in a roasting pan. Arrange potato and onion around chicken. Cook, turning occasionally, for 1 hour or until cooked through.

name: Chocolate peanut butter crunch cookies
ingredient: [{'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Flora Buttery'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'light brown soft sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'golden syrup'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '220', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'good-quality cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'salted peanuts , roughly chopped'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced (350°F/gas Mark 4)., In a bowl, beat the Flora Buttery and sugar together. Add golden syrup, peanut butter and vanilla extract to the same bowl and mix in well. Add in flour, cocoa and peanuts and mix well, forming a soft sticky cookie dough., Take a spoonful of the mixture, shape into a ball about the size of a walnut and place on a baking sheet lined with baking parchment. Repeat the process until all the mixture has been used, making sure to space them well apart and using more than one baking sheet if necessary., Use the back of a fork to press down and flatten each cookie dough ball., Bake for 12–15 minutes in the oven. Remove and cool on the baking sheet.

name: Cranberry and pecan stuffed turkey
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'stick, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(140g) finely chopped day-old Coles Finest by Laurent White Sourdough Vienna*'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(45g) dried cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(40g) pecans, toasted, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped sage'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Australian Free Range Egg, lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'RSPCA Approved Small Turkey Buffet (about 2.8kg)'}, {'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Kent pumpkin, seeded, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onions, cut into wedges'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add brown onion, celery and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 5 mins or until onion softens. Transfer to a bowl. Set aside to cool completely., Add the bread, cranberries, pecans, sage, egg and lemon rind to the onion mixture. Stir to combine., Rinse turkey under cold water and pat dry with paper towel. Spoon stuffing into the neck cavity and pull down excess skin to enclose, securing with a skewer. Place the turkey in a large heavy-based roasting pan. Spoon the remaining stuffing into the body cavity. Spray turkey with olive oil spray. Season. Cover the pan tightly with greased foil., Roast the turkey for 1 1/2 hours. Remove foil. Add pumpkin and red onion to the pan. Roast, uncovered, for 1 hour or until turkey is golden brown and juices run clear when breast is pierced with a skewer. Loosely cover with foil. Set aside for 20 mins to rest., Cut the turkey into slices and serve with the roasted vegetables.

name: Mandarin jellies with cardamom cream
ingredient: [{'quantity': '14', 'unit': 'mandarin', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'gelatine', 'name': 'leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(215g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'yolks'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'cardamom', 'name': 'pods, bruised'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(500ml) milk'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(55g) light muscovado sugar (see note)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'hot water'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(40g) chopped pistachios'}]
steps: Peel and segment 3 of the mandarins and set aside. Use a grater to finely zest the rind of 1 mandarin. Juice remaining mandarins [you will need 2 cups (500ml) mandarin juice]., Soak 2 gelatine leaves in cold water for 2 minutes or until soft. Combine 1 cup (250ml) of mandarin juice, the mandarin zest and 1/2 cup (100g) of caster sugar in a small saucepan over high heat. Bring to the boil. Squeeze excess liquid from the gelatine leaves. Add to mandarin syrup, remove from heat and stir to dissolve. Strain through a fine sieve into a medium bowl. Add remaining mandarin juice and stir to combine. Pour evenly among six 1-cup (250ml) capacity ramekins. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until set., Use an electric mixer to beat egg yolks and remaining caster sugar until pale and fluffy. Combine the cardamom and milk in a medium saucepan over medium heat and bring to the boil. Pour over egg mixture and whisk to combine. Set aside for 10 minutes to cool slightly. Return to low heat and cook, stirring continuously, for 5 minutes or until mixture thickens slightly. Remove from heat., Meanwhile, soak remaining gelatine leaves in cold water for 2 minutes or until soft. Squeeze excess liquid from the gelatine and add to cardamom mixture. Stir to dissolve. Strain through a fine sieve into a medium bowl. Place the bowl over a separate bowl filled with ice. Stir occasionally for 10 minutes or until mixture is almost set. Remove from ice., Use an electric mixer to whisk the cream in a medium bowl until soft peaks form. Carefully fold whipped cream through cardamom mixture. Spoon on top of mandarin jellies. Return to fridge for 2 hours or until completely set., Meanwhile, combine muscovado sugar and hot water in a small bowl. Add reserved mandarin segments and set aside for 20 minutes or until sugar dissolves. Spoon mandarin segments and syrup evenly among jellies. Sprinkle with pistachios to serve.

name: Chicken katsu curry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'SunRice Sushi Rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'nori', 'name': 'sheet'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds, toasted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'chicken', 'name': 'breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Japanese breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'head', 'name': 'broccoli, broken into florets'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Japanese curry sauce mix'}]
steps: Cook SunRice Sushi Rice following packet directions. Meanwhile, finely chop nori sheet. Combine with sesame seeds in a small bowl., Meanwhile, split each chicken breast. Place each piece between 2 sheets of baking paper and flatten with a rolling pin. Place flour, egg and breadcrumbs in 3 shallow dishes. Season flour. Add 2 teaspoons of water to egg. Coat each piece of chicken in flour, then egg and breadcrumbs. Set aside., Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook onion and carrot, stirring, for 5 minutes or until onion is tender. Add 2 cups water (500ml) and bring to the boil. Add broccoli and simmer, covered, for 3 minutes. Add curry sauce mix and stir until dissolved. Simmer, covered, for 3 minutes to thicken slightly., Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a large frying pan over medium high heat. Cook chicken for 2-3 minutes each side or until golden and cooked through. Drain on paper towel. Thickly slice chicken. Sprinkle nori mixture over rice and serve with chicken and curry sauce.

name: Chicken chow mein tray bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) Massel salt reduced chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) light soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) Chinese rice wine'}, {'quantity': '45', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup, lightly packed) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt fresh chow mein noodles'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken thigh fillets, fat trimmed, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely shredded fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'or red capsicum, deseeded, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'sticks, trimmed, sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', peeled, sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'wombok', 'name': '(Chinese cabbage), finely shredded'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sesame', 'name': 'oil, to drizzle'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sliced', 'name': 'green shallot, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sliced', 'name': 'long fresh red chilli, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander sprigs, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan forced. Pour the olive oil into a large baking dish and place in the oven for 5 minutes to heat., Meanwhile, combine the stock, soy sauce, rice wine and sugar in a jug. Place the noodles in a large heatproof bowl. Pour over enough boiling water to cover. Set aside to soak until required., Add the chicken, onion, ginger and garlic to the preheated dish. Toss to coat. Add the capsicum, celery and carrot. Pour in one-third of the soy sauce mixture. Toss to combine. Bake for 30 minutes or until the chicken is golden., Drain the noodles and add to the dish with the cabbage and remaining soy sauce mixture. Toss to combine. Bake for a further 10 minutes or until the noodles on top are crispy., Drizzle with sesame oil and serve topped with shallot, chilli and coriander.

name: Chargrilled vegetable pizza
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggplant, sliced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'zucchini, sliced'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'button', 'name': 'mushrooms, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, quartered'}, {'quantity': '4 80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'wholemeal pita breads'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato pizza sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Bulla Cottage Cheese'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Basil', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Char-grill eggplant, zucchini, mushroom and capsicum on a non-stick grill or BBQ until tender. Remove skin from blackened red capsicum and cut into strips., Spread the pita breads with tomato sauce and top with vegetables. Dollop evenly with cottage cheese., Bake at 200°C for 10-15 minutes or until base is crisp and the cheese has browned. Serve topped with basil leaves.

name: Baked coconut and coriander fish
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '270ml can light coconut cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'broccolini, cut into 3cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g pkt Sun Rice Long Grain'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'White', 'name': 'Rice in 90 Seconds'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'shallots', 'name': ', trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh coriander'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'basa fillets, cut into 4cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) dried multigrain breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mixed', 'name': 'salad leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Place the coconut cream in a large frying pan over medium-low heat. Add broccolini, rice, shallot, coriander and fish sauce., Stir to combine. Cook, stirring often, for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. 2 Stir in the fish. Transfer to a 2L (8-cup) capacity ovenproof dish., Combine breadcrumbs and lemon rind in a small bowl. Sprinkle over the fish mixture. Bake, covering with foil if necessary to prevent overbrowning, for 20-25 minutes or until breadcrumbs are golden. Serve with mixed salad leaves.

name: Beef and hokkien noodle stir-fry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef rump steak, trimmed, cut into 1cm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shao hsing Chinese cooking wine (see note) or sweet sherry'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh hokkien noodles'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '230', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can water chestnuts, drained, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, cut into 6cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'oyster sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken stock'}]
steps: Combine beef750g beef rump steak, trimmed, cut into 1cm-thick slices and wine or sherry1/3 cup shao hsing Chinese cooking wine (see note) or sweet sherry in a large glass or ceramic dish. Stand for 10 minutes., Meanwhile, place noodles600g fresh hokkien noodles in a large heatproof bowl. Cover with boiling water. Stand for 2 to 3 minutes or until noodles soften. Drain. Separate noodles with a fork. Set aside., Heat 1 tablespoon of peanut oil1/4 cup peanut oil in a wok over high heat. Add half the beef. Stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes or until browned. Remove to a plate. Repeat with oil1 tsp sesame oil and remaining beef., Heat remaining peanut oil in wok. Add chestnuts230g can water chestnuts, drained, thickly sliced, sesame oil, green onions6 green onions, cut into 6cm lengths and garlic2 garlic cloves, finely chopped. Stir-fry for 1 minute. Return beef to wok. Add oyster sauce1/2 cup oyster sauce, stock1/4 cup chicken stock and noodles. Stir-fry for 1 to 2 minutes or until warmed through. Divide between bowls and serve.

name: Egg and leek breakfast tarts
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'Coles frozen shortcrust pastry, thawed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles pure olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'leeks, white part only, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Coles shredded parmesan cheese'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'free range eggs'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Coles cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g packets cherry truss tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'butcher thin beef sausages'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'rocket, washed and trimmed'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C or 160C fan-forced. Lightly grease 6 x 10cm (base measurement) pie dishes or loose-bottom flan tins. Use a saucer as a guide to cut 6 x 15cm rounds from the pastry, and ease them into the tins. Line each with a piece of crumpled non-stick baking paper, and fill with dried rice or beans. Bake for 10 mins, remove paper and rice and bake a further 5 mins, or until cooked and lightly golden. Cool completely., Heat oil in a small frying pan. Cook leeks over medium-low heat for 7 mins, or until soft. Cool, then divide between pastry cases. Sprinkle with parmesan., Lightly beat eggs and cream together, and pour into pastry cases. Bake for 25-30 mins, or until set and golden. Place tomatoes on a baking tray and add to the oven with the tarts. Bake for about 20 mins, or until softened., Meanwhile, cook sausages in a lightly oiled frying pan over medium-low heat for 10 mins, or until well-browned and cooked through. Serve tarts with tomatoes, sausages and rocket.

name: Lemon & ginger cake with honey icing
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Melted', 'name': 'butter, to grease'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) pistachio kernels'}, {'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '220', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) buttermilk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground ginger'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Brush an 11 x 21cm (base measurement) loaf pan with melted butter to lightly grease. Line base with non-stick baking paper. Place pistachio kernels in a small non-stick frying pan over medium heat and cook for 3 minutes or until toasted (see microwave tip). Remove from heat. Set aside for 5 minutes to cool slightly. Coarsely chop pistachios. Set aside., Meanwhile, use an electric beater to beat the butter in a large bowl until smooth. Add the sugar and beat until pale and creamy. Scrape down the side of the bowl when necessary. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well between each addition, until combined. Using a wooden spoon, stir in half the flour, then half the buttermilk, until combined. Stir in remaining flour and buttermilk, lemon rind, juice and ginger until combined., Spoon the cake batter into the prepared pan and smooth the surface. Bake in preheated oven for 55 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean. Remove from the oven and stand for 5 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely., To make the honey icing, use an electric beater to beat the cream cheese, icing sugar mixture and honey together in a medium bowl until well combined and fluffy. Spread the honey icing evenly over the top of the cooled cake. Sprinkle with chopped pistachio kernels.

name: Asparagus with poached egg
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'asparagus, woody ends trimmed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vinegar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) finely grated parmesan'}]
steps: Bring a large frying pan of salted water to the boil over medium-high heat. Add the asparagus and cook for 2-3 minutes or until bright green and tender crisp. Use tongs to transfer the asparagus to a plate. Cover to keep warm., Add the vinegar to the water in pan. Reduce heat to medium-low. Crack 1 egg into a small bowl. Use a spoon to stir the water to make a whirlpool. Carefully pour the egg into the centre of the whirlpool. Cook for 4 minutes for a soft yolk or until cooked to your liking. Use a slotted spoon to transfer to a plate. Cover with foil to keep warm. Repeat with remaining eggs., Divide the asparagus among serving plates. Top with an egg. Season with salt and pepper. Top with parmesan to serve.

name: Lavender-scented caramel poached pears
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(750ml) water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) sweet dessert wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(200g) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'vanilla', 'name': 'bean, split'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'stick'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'whole', 'name': 'star anise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dried lavender flowers (see note), plus extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'packham', 'name': 'pears, peeled'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vanilla', 'name': 'ice-cream or lavender ice-cream, to serve'}]
steps: Combine the water, wine, sugar, vanilla bean, cinnamon, star-anise and lavender in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Add the pears and bring to a very gentle simmer. Cover with a sheet of baking paper. Cook, turning occasionally, for 1 hour or until pears are tender. Remove pears from syrup and place in a heatproof bowl., Increase heat to high and bring syrup to the boil. Cook, uncovered, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until syrup thickens. Strain through a fine sieve over the pears. Set aside for 30 minutes to cool. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 2-3 hours to chill, turning pears occasionally., Place the pears on serving dishes. Drizzle with syrup and serve with ice-cream, if desired.

name: Asian-style salmon patties with crunchy slaw
ingredient: [{'quantity': '460', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'skinless salmon fillets, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) chilli garlic sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sunflower oil'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': ', juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'iceberg', 'name': 'lettuce, shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, cut into long matchsticks'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'unsalted peanuts, toasted, coarsely chopped'}]
steps: Place half the salmon and 2 tsp of the chilli garlic sauce in a food processor and process until salmon is finely chopped. Cut remaining salmon into 1cm pieces. Add to food processor and pulse until just combined. Divide into 4 equal portions and shape each portion into a patty., Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the patties and cook for 5 mins each side or until just cooked through. Transfer to a plate., Add the fish sauce and remaining chilli garlic sauce to the pan and bring to the boil. Return fish cakes to the pan and spoon over the sauce to coat. Remove from heat. Stir lime juice into the sauce mixture in the pan., Arrange lettuce and carrot on a large serving plate. Top with the patties and spoon over the sauce from the pan. Sprinkle with the green bean and peanut to serve.

name: Sticky fig tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'frozen ready-rolled shortcrust pastry, partially thawed'}, {'quantity': '215', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet dessert figs, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry port wine'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'firmly-packed brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pouring cream'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'pure', 'name': 'icing sugar, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a 3cm-deep, 23cm (base) fluted loose-based flan pan. Roll out pastry between 2 sheets of baking paper until 3mm thick. Line pan with pastry. Trim excess pastry and reserve for lattice. Refrigerate for 10 minutes. Place pan on a baking tray., Combine figs, port and 1/2 cup cold water in a saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook for 5 minutes. Add half the butter, half the brown sugar and all the vanilla. Cook, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until butter melts. Remove from heat. Cool slightly. Add eggs and flour. Stir to combine. Pour fig mixture into pastry case., Press reserved pastry together. Roll out between 2 sheets of baking paper until 3mm thick. Cut into 1cm-thick strips. Place in a lattice pattern across pie top. Press edges to seal. Trim excess pastry. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until golden. Remove from oven. Dust with icing sugar., Combine cream, remaining butter and brown sugar in a saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until sugar dissolves. Simmer for 1 to 2 minutes or until slightly thick. Serve tart with sauce.

name: Sour cream coffee cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, at room temperature, chopped'}, {'quantity': '155', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '170', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2/3 cup) sour cream'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) milk'}, {'quantity': '225', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) self-raising flour'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 170C/150C fan forced. Grease a 20cm square cake pan and line the base with baking paper, extending over 2 sides., To make the streusel, combine the ingredients in a medium bowl. Use your fingertips to rub the butter into the dry ingredients until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Set aside., Use electric beaters to beat the butter, caster sugar and vanilla until pale and creamy. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the sour cream and milk. Fold in the flour until just combined., Transfer half the batter to the prepared pan. Sprinkle over half the streusel mixture in an even layer. Dollop the remaining batter on top and spread out with the back of a spoon. Sprinkle with remaining streusel., Bake for 40 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre of cake comes out clean. Set aside in the pan for 20 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely., For the drizzle icing, stir the ingredients together until smooth. Transfer to a small snaplock bag and snip off one corner. Drizzle over the cake. Leave for about 30 minutes to set. Cut into squares to serve.

name: Sausage pasty
ingredient: [{'quantity': '700', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef sausages'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(260g) Mutti Tomato Passata'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped flat-leaf parsley'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'block frozen puff pastry, thawed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Plain', 'name': 'flour, to dust'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', beaten'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chilli', 'name': 'sauce, to serve'}]
steps: Remove sausage meat from casings and discard casings. Heat oil1 tbsp olive oil in a saucepan over medium-low heat, add onion1 large onion, chopped and garlic2 garlic cloves, chopped, and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until onion has softened. Increase heat to high and add sausage700g beef sausages meat, then cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up. When meat is starting to brown, stir in tomato paste1 tbsp tomato paste, passata1 cup (260g) Mutti Tomato Passata and 1/3 cup (80ml) water, then cook for a further 5 minutes. Set aside to cool., Place mixture in a food processor with parsley1 tbsp chopped flat-leaf parsley and pulse until just combined. Season to taste. Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Cut pastry375g block frozen puff pastry, thawed in half lengthways. Roll out one piece on a lightly floured board to a 18cm x 35cm rectangle. Place on the tray and top with sausage mixture, leaving a 2cm border. Brush the border with water. Roll out remaining pastry on a lightly floured board so that it is slightly larger than the first rectangle., Make several small slashes across middle of the pastry. Place over the sausage meat and seal edges. Brush the pastry with beaten egg1 egg, beaten and bake for 25 minutes until puffed and golden. Serve with the quick chilli sauceChilli sauce, to serve.

name: DIY steak sandwiches with aioli
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'loaf', 'name': 'white bread'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': None, 'name': '-8 beef minute steaks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'onions', 'name': ', slice into rings'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tomatoes', 'name': ', sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'mixed', 'name': 'salad leaves to serve'}]
steps: To make aioli, place the mayonnaise in a bowl with garlic and 1 tablespoon water. Stir until combined and set aside., Heat a barbecue hot plate or grill to hot. Oil the surface well and add the onions. Cook for 4-5 minutes until soft and browned. Remove, cover and keep warm., Add the minute steaks to the barbecue, cook for 1-2 minutes on each side. Remove., To serve, place steak and onions on the table, along with thick slices of toasted bread, tomato, salad leaves and garlic aioli. Allow everyone to help themselves and assemble their own steak sandwich.

name: Five-bean salad with egg
ingredient: [{'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen broad beans'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Juice', 'name': 'of 1/2 lemon'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'green chilli, seeds removed, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'punnet', 'name': 'mung bean sprouts'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed green and Italian flat beans, sliced on the diagonal, blanched'}, {'quantity': '410', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'canned red kidney beans, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'quail', 'name': 'eggs*, hard-boiled, halved (or 4 eggs, hard-boiled, quartered)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eschalots', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Grilled', 'name': 'tortillas, cut into wedges'}]
steps: Boil broad beans in salted water for 4-5 minutes until tender. Drain, refresh in cold water and drain. Shell beans., In a large bowl, whisk lemon juice and oil. Mix in chilli, sprouts and all beans, then season. Place in bowls. Top with egg and eschalot. Serve with tortillas.

name: Red onion and polenta skillet bread
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onions, cut into 1cm-thick slices crossways'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) pitted kalamata olives'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) milk'}, {'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) polenta'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh rosemary'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Ward’s Baking Powder'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Balsamic', 'name': 'glaze, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Heat oil and half the butter in an 18.5cm (base measurement) ovenproof frying pan over medium-low heat. Arrange onion in pan. Season. Cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Add olives. Remove from heat., Bring 375ml (1 1/2 cups) milk just to a simmer in a saucepan over medium heat. Add polenta in a thin steady stream, stirring constantly. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until thick. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining butter. Season. Whisk eggs, parmesan, rosemary, baking powder and remaining milk in a jug. Stir into polenta. Carefully pour over onion. Bake for 25 minutes or until firm to touch. Cool slightly in pan. Turn onto a platter. Drizzle over balsamic glaze.

name: Martha's mango coconut cream tart
steps: Make Pate Brisee: Pulse flour, salt, and caster sugar in a food processor until combined. Add butter. Pulse for 8 to 10 seconds or until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Drizzle iced water over mixture. Pulse until mixture holds together when pressed between 2 fingers (dough should not be sticky). If dough is too dry, add more iced water, 1 tablespoon at a time, and pulse. Shape dough into a disc and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm., Preheat oven to 190°C/170°C fan-forced. Grease a 30cm-round fluted loose-based flan tin. Stand dough at room temperature for 5 minutes. Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface into a 3mm-thick 38cm round. Place dough into prepared tin, pressing wellinto side. Trim edge. Prick bottom all over with a fork. Freeze for 20 minutes or until hard. Line dough with baking paper, extending paper 5cm from edge of tin. Fill with ceramic pie weights or uncooked rice. Bake for 30 minutes or until edge of pastry begins to turn golden. Remove weights or rice and paper. Reduce temperature to 160°C/140°C fan-forced. Cover edge loosely with foil and bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 20 minutes., Make Filling: Combine sugars, salt, and polenta in a medium bowl. Whisk in eggs, egg yolk and vanilla. Add melted butter and coconut. Mix. Spread into tart shell. Bake for 22 to 24 minutes or until light golden and just set. Cool completely., Make Topping: Peel and halve mangoes. Brush with lemon juice. Thinly slice each half crossways. Using an electric mixer, beat cream and icing sugar together until medium peaks form. Spread one-third of cream over top of filling. Spoon remaining cream into a piping bag with a 1.5cm-fluted nozzle. Pipe swirls of cream on top of filling, leaving space for mango. Twist mango slices into spirals and place between cream swirls. Place glucose syrup and water in a small saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring, until combined. Brush mango with syrup. Chill tart for up to 4 hours or until cold.

name: Broccoli, bacon and quinoa fritter slice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '175', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'shortcut bacon rashers, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cauliflower florets'}, {'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'broccoli florets'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cooked quinoa'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chilli, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salad', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan-forced. Grease an 18cm x 28cm slice pan. Line base and sides with baking paper, extending paper 3cm above edge on all sides., Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add bacon. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until golden. Add onion and garlic. Cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Remove from heat. Add lemon rind. Stir to combine. Set aside to cool., Meanwhile, place cauliflower and broccoli in a metal steamer over a saucepan of simmering water. Cover. Steam for 7 to 10 minutes or until tender. Transfer to a bowl. Cool for 10 minutes. Reserve half the cauliflower and broccoli florets. Place remaining florets in a food processor. Pulse until roughly chopped (do not over-process). Transfer to a bowl. Add reserved florets., Add egg, milk, our, bacon mixture, parsley, mint, peas, quinoa, chilli and salt. Season with pepper. Spread into prepared pan. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until golden and rm to the touch. Stand for 15 minutes., Lift fritter from pan. Cut into 8 pieces. Serve with salad leaves.

name: Spicy honey lime chicken bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece fresh ginger, peeled, cut into matchsticks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'fresh red chilli, thinly sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Chinese five spice'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'chicken drumsticks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '700g) baby red cabbage, cut into 8 wedges'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thinly', 'name': 'sliced green shallot, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'rice, to serve'}]
steps: Combine soy sauce, honey, lime, ginger, chilli, garlic and Chinese five spice in a large bowl. Add chicken. Turn to coat. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for at least 2 hours, or up to 8 hours, to marinate., Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan forced. Heat a large flameproof roasting pan over medium-high heat. Drain chicken from marinade, reserving marinade. Spray chicken well with olive oil. Cook, turning, for 2 minutes or until browned., Add cabbage. Pour over reserved marinade. Roast for 35 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Sprinkle with shallot. Serve with rice.

name: Oven-braised savoury steak
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dry mustard powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt and pepper'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'pieces', 'name': 'beef oyster blade steak'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onion, cut into fine rings'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 140C., On a sheet of paper, mix together flour, mustard, salt and pepper cayenne., Cut the steak in halves or leave whole, rub into flour mix, pressing the flour in hard to each piece of meat., Grease casserole dish, place a layer of meat, a layer of onion. Repeat., Make Sauce: Mix Worcestershire sauce, tomato sauce, sugar, vinegar, and stock cubes. Take 1 1/2 tbs of the flour mixture you rubbed the steak in and mix with a little water. Then add with the sauces. Mix and pour all mixture over the steak., Grease some aluminium foil or baking paper, place over casserole dish and then put the lid on firmly., Bake in oven for 2 1/2hrs. Check half way to see if it needs a little water, the less water the richer the flavor., Serve with rice or mashed potatoes and greens

name: Vegan stuffed roast pumpkin
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.8', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'whole butternut pumpkin'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onions'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red capsicums deseeded, cut into 1cm-thick strips'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'yellow capsicums, deseeded, cut into 1cm-thick strips'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'pure maple syrup'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can brown lentils, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'pine nuts'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'asparagus, trimmed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'rocket, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Balsamic', 'name': 'vinegar, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 190C/170C fan forced. Line a large baking tray with baking paper. Cut pumpkin1.8kg whole butternut pumpkin in half lengthways. Scoop out seeds. Place the pumpkin, cut-side up, on prepared tray. Lightly spray with oil1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil. Season. Roast for 1 hour 10 minutes or until tender. Cut 1 onion into wedges. Thinly slice the remaining onion2 red onions. Set aside pumpkin to cool then scoop out flesh from each pumpkin half, leaving a 3cm-thick shell. Reserve flesh., Meanwhile, heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Cook sliced onion, stirring, for 3 minutes or until softened. Add the garlic3 garlic cloves, thinly sliced and paprika1 tsp smoked paprika. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add capsicum and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until just tender. Stir in vinegar2 tbsp red wine vinegar and maple syrup2 tsp pure maple syrup. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 10-15 minutes or until caramelised., Add lentils400g can brown lentils, rinsed, drained and reserved pumpkin to onion mixture. Season. Stir. Set aside to cool slightly., Blanch spinach150g baby spinach in boiling water. Drain. Refresh under cold running water. Squeeze out excess liquid then coarsely chop. Stir through the lentil mixture with pine nuts2 tbsp pine nuts., Divide lentil mixture between pumpkin shells. Carefully join halves and use kitchen string to tie at 2cm intervals. Return pumpkin to tray. Add onion wedges. Roast for 20 minutes or until just tender, adding asparagus halfway through cooking. Set aside for 5 minutes. Remove string. Cut into 6 thick slices. Arrange on serving plates with asparagus2 bunches asparagus, trimmed, onion and rocketBaby rocket, to serve. Drizzle over balsamicBalsamic vinegar, to serve.

name: Mexican street salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red capsicum, quartered'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'chicken breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'smoky chipotle Mexican seasoning'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'corncob', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can black beans, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh coriander'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'shallots, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Praise Deli Style Lime & Chilli Vinaigrette, plus extra, to drizzle'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomato medley, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocado', 'name': ', chopped'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'feta, sliced'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket'}]
steps: Preheat an oven grill on high. Place the capsicum, skin side up, on a baking tray. Spray with oil. Grill for 3-5 minutes or until the skin blackens and blisters. Transfer to a bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside for 5 minutes (this will make the skin easier to remove). Peel the skin and discard. Thickly slice capsicum., Meanwhile, place chicken in a glass or ceramic bowl. Sprinkle with seasoning and drizzle with 1 tbs oil. Toss chicken until coated., Preheat a barbecue grill or chargrill pan on medium. Remove husks and spray corn with oil. Cook corn and chicken, turning corn often and chicken halfway, for 8-10 minutes or until chicken is just cooked though and corn is tender. Transfer chicken to a plate. Cover with foil. Set aside for 5 minutes to rest. Place corn on a chopping board., Cut the corn kernels from the cobs and place in a bowl. Add the beans, coriander, shallot, onion and dressing and toss until well combined. Spoon onto a platter. Top with the capsicum, tomato, avocado and feta. Slice the chicken and place on the platter. Top with the rocket and drizzle with extra dressing to serve.

name: Tuna & ginger noodle salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '400g) tuna steaks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) mirin (rice wine)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'salt-reduced soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried soba noodles'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow peas, ends trimmed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of caster sugar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'pickled ginger, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander leaves, to garnish'}]
steps: Place tuna in bowl. Combine the fresh ginger and half the mirin, lime juice and soy sauce in a bowl. Pour over tuna. Place in the fridge for 20 minutes to marinate., Cook the noodles following packet directions, adding the snow peas in the last 2 minutes of cooking. Drain. Place in a bowl. Add half the oil and toss to coat., Combine sugar, remaining mirin, lime juice, soy sauce and oil in a screw-top jar., Spray a non-stick frying pan with olive oil spray. Place over high heat. Cook tuna for 1-2 minutes each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Thinly slice., Stir the pickled ginger, spinach and half the dressing into the noodle mixture. Divide among serving bowls. Top with tuna and coriander. Drizzle over the remaining dressing to serve.

name: Boston baked beans
ingredient: [{'quantity': '550', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried great northern or cannellini beans, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onions, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'litre', 'name': 'Massel salt reduced chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'ham bone'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'maple syrup'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Buttered', 'name': 'toasted crusty bread, to serve'}]
steps: Place beans in a large bowl. Cover with cold water. Set aside for 8 hours or overnight to soak. Rinse under cold water. Drain., Preheat oven to 160C/140C fan-forced. Heat oil in a large, heavy-based, flameproof casserole dish over medium heat. Cook onion, stirring occasionally, for 8 minutes or until softened. Add garlic and thyme. Cook for 2 minutes or until fragrant. Add tomato, stock, beans and ham bone. Season with salt and pepper. Cover. Bring to boil. Transfer to oven. Bake for 3 hours, stirring occasionally, until beans are just tender. Cool., Transfer ham bone to a chopping board. Remove and discard rind, bone and fat. Shred ham., Divide mixture in two. Refrigerate half the mixture for other recipes., Place remaining half of bean mixture, syrup, mustard, sugar and sauce in a large heavy-based saucepan over medium heat. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 20 to 25 minutes, stirring occasionally (see note), or until heated., Serve beans with buttered toast.

name: Lip-smacking lamb with mint bread sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Kipfler potatoes, scrubbed, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'lamb', 'name': 'loin chops'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 230C/210C fan forced. Line a large baking tray or roasting pan with baking paper. Bring potato to the boil in a large saucepan of boiling salted water over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-high. Simmer for 6 minutes or until just tender. Drain., Combine potato and onion on prepared tray. Drizzle with 1 tbs of the oil. Season. Toss to combine. Roast for 10 minutes. Toss beans in 2 tsp of the oil. Season and add to tray. Roast for a further 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender., Meanwhile, for the bread sauce, combine bread and milk in a jug. Stand for 2 minutes. Add mint, garlic, lemon rind and juice, oil and water. Season. Use a stick blender to process until smooth., Heat a chargrill or barbecue on medium-high. Toss lamb in remaining oil and season. Cook, turning, for 5-6 minutes for medium or until cooked to your liking. Rest for 2 minutes. Serve with roast vegetables and sauce.

name: Cheat's Turkish pizzas
ingredient: [{'quantity': '280', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet garlic naan bread'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'thick', 'name': 'lamb sausages'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated mozzarella'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fetta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'cos lettuce, leaves torn'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'radishes', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'small fresh mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sumac', 'name': ', to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sriracha', 'name': 'chilli sauce, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan-forced. Line 2 large baking trays with baking paper. Arrange bread on trays., Finely chop half the onion. Remove and discard casing from sausages. Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Crumble sausage in pan and add onion. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes or until sausage is browned. Arrange sausage mixture evenly over bread. Sprinkle with cheeses. Make a slight indent in centre of toppings on bread. Bake for 3 minutes. Break an egg into each indent. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until white is set but yolks are still runny., Meanwhile, thinly slice remaining onion. Place lettuce, radish, mint and onion in a large bowl. Drizzle over vinegar and remaining oil. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine., Sprinkle eggs with sumac. Drizzle pizzas with sriracha and sprinkle with parsley. Serve with salad and lemon wedges.

name: Lindor dumplings
ingredient: [{'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'assorted', 'name': 'Lindor chocolate balls'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) plain flour, plus 75g (1/2 cup), extra, to dust'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '160', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2/3 cup) milk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vegetable', 'name': 'oil, to deep-fry'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Double', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}]
steps: Place the Lindor balls on a baking tray. Place in the freezer for 4-6 hours or until very firm., Combine the flour, baking powder and cinnamon in a bowl. Make a well in the centre. Whisk the milk, eggs and caster sugar in a separate bowl. Pour the milk mixture into the well. Stir to make a smooth batter. Set aside for 10 minutes or until needed., For the butterscotch sauce, place the brown sugar, thickened cream and butter in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring, for 2-3 minutes or until smooth. Set aside, covered, to keep warm., Place the extra flour in a small bowl. Pour enough oil into a small saucepan to come 5cm of the way up the side and heat over medium-high heat (the oil is ready when a small piece of bread sizzles on contact). Working in 2-3 batches, roll the frozen Lindor balls in the extra flour, then dip in the batter to coat. Carefully lower the balls, 1 at a time, into the hot oil. Cook for 1-2 minutes, turning, or until golden. Use a slotted spoon to transfer to a plate lined with paper towel to drain., Pour the butterscotch sauce into serving bowls. Top with the Lindor dumplings. Serve with the double cream.

name: Chicken nuggets with mustard sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '500g) single chicken breast fillets, trimmed, chopped'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) fresh breadcrumbs made from day-old bread'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) dried (packaged) breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) cornflake crumbs (Kelloggs brand)'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C. Line 2 baking trays with non-stick baking paper., Place the chicken in the bowl of a food processor and process until finely chopped. Transfer to a large bowl. Add the fresh breadcrumbs and chives and mix with a wooden spoon until well combined. Season with salt and pepper., Shape 1 tablespoon of chicken mixture into a small patty and place on lined tray. Repeat with remaining mixture. Place the flour and egg in separate bowls. Combine the breadcrumbs and cornflake crumbs in a bowl. Toss each patty in the flour and shake off any excess. Dip in the egg, allowing the excess to run off, then in the breadcrumb mixture, pressing firmly to coat. Place on lined baking trays., Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes, turning nuggets once during cooking, or until cooked through., Meanwhile, to make the mustard sauce, combine the sour cream and mustard in a small bowl. Taste and season with salt., Serve chicken nuggets with mustard sauce.

name: Apple tarte tatin
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla bean paste'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(75g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'frozen puff pastry'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cr', 'name': 'éme fraîche, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Combine the apple, lemon juice and vanilla in a medium bowl., Place the sugar in an 18cm (base measurement) ovenproof frying pan over high heat and cook, stirring occasionally with a wooden spoon, for 5 mins or until the sugar melts and is golden brown. Remove from heat. Sprinkle the butter over the melted sugar and swirl the pan to combine. Arrange the apple, cut-side up, over the butter mixture in the pan. Drizzle with any juices from the bowl., Place 1 pastry sheet on a clean work surface. Top with the remaining pastry to make a stack. Using a plate as a guide, cut a 25cm disc from the pastry. Place over the apple in the pan and quickly tuck the pastry edge into the side of the pan with a spoon., Bake for 20-25 mins or until pastry is puffed and golden brown. Set aside for 2 mins to rest. Place a serving plate over the top of the pan. Carefully invert the tart onto the plate. Cut into wedges and serve immediately with créme fraîche.

name: Traditional plum pudding
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '375g pkt raisins, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '300g pkt currants'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sultanas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '170g pkt craisins (dried cranberries)'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) rum'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Melted', 'name': 'butter, to grease'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) firmly-packed brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '175', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 1/2 cups) fresh breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'mixed spice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Warmed', 'name': 'custard, to serve'}]
steps: Combine raisins1 x 375g pkt raisins, coarsely chopped, currants1 x 300g pkt currants, sultanas150g sultanas, craisins1 x 170g pkt craisins (dried cranberries) and rum250ml (1 cup) rum in a bowl. Set aside for 6 hours to macerate., Brush a 2L (8-cup) capacity pudding basin with melted butterMelted butter, to grease to grease. Line the base with non-stick baking paper., Use an electric beater to beat the butter250g butter, at room temperature and sugar200g (1 cup) firmly-packed brown sugar in a bowl until pale and creamy. Add eggs4 eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition (mixture may appear curdled). Stir in breadcrumbs175g (2 1/2 cups) fresh breadcrumbs, combined flours75g (1/2 cup) self-raising flour|75g (1/2 cup) plain flour, mixed spice1 tsp mixed spice and cinnamon1 tsp ground cinnamon. Add the raisin mixture and stir until combined. Spoon into basin., Place an upturned heatproof saucer in the base of a saucepan. Fill one-third of the saucepan with boiling water and bring to a simmer over low heat., Cut a 30cm-square piece of non-stick baking paper and a 30cm-square piece of foil. Place paper on foil and fold to make a pleat in the centre. Place over basin, foil-side up. Tie a double piece of kitchen string around basin to secure. To make a handle, tie a double piece of string loosely over the top of the basin., Lower the basin onto the saucer in saucepan. Add enough boiling water to reach two-thirds of the way up the basin. Simmer, covered, over low heat, adding boiling water when necessary, for 4 hours or until a skewer inserted in the centre of the pudding comes out clean., Remove basin from pan. Set aside for 5 minutes. Pour over custardWarmed custard, to serve to serve.

name: Lamb sausage pilaf
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) Basmati rice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sweet paprika'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3 cups) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '500g) cauliflower, cut into florets'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, topped, halved diagonally'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'lamb', 'name': 'sausages (North African style)'}]
steps: Heat the oil1 tbsp olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion1 brown onion, halved, thinly sliced and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until soft. Add the rice300g (1 1/2 cups) Basmati rice, cumin2 tsp ground cumin, coriander2 tsp ground coriander, paprika1/2 tsp sweet paprika and turmeric1/4 tsp ground turmeric and stir to combine., Add stock750ml (3 cups) chicken stock and cauliflower1/2 (about 500g) cauliflower, cut into florets and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook, covered, for 10 minutes. Add beans150g green beans, topped, halved diagonally and cook, covered, for 5 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender. Use a fork to separate the grains., Meanwhile, cook the sausages6 lamb sausages (North African style) in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat for 15 minutes or until cooked through., Thickly slice the sausages. Add to the rice mixture and stir to combine. Divide among serving dishes to serve.

name: Beef and lemon grass stir-fry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g pkt dried thin rice noodles'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lean beef strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, halved, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh lemon grass'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, topped, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) sweet chilli sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Place the noodles in a heatproof bowl and cover with plenty of boiling water. Set aside for 5 minutes or until noodles are tender. Drain well., Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Add one-third of the beef and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until brown. Transfer to a heatproof bowl. Repeat, in 2 more batches, with the remaining beef., Add the onion, lemon grass and ginger to the wok and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until onion softens. Return beef to the wok with the beans and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the noodles, sweet chilli sauce, fish sauce and lime juice and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes or until heated through. Divide the noodles among serving bowls and serve with lime wedges.

name: Grilled corn and chorizo salad
