ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '500g) corncobs, husks and silk removed'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt flakes'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '250g) chorizo sausages, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '85', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) blanched almonds, toasted, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}]
steps: Cook the corn in a large saucepan of salted boiling water for 10 minutes or until cooked through. Drain., Preheat a barbecue on high. Brush the corn with half the oil. Sprinkle with salt, cayenne pepper and paprika. Cook on the barbecue grill, turning occasionally, for 10-15 minutes or until lightly charred. Set aside for 10 minutes to cool slightly., Use a small sharp knife to cut down the length of 1 corncob, close to the core, to remove the kernels. Transfer to a serving bowl. Repeat with the remaining corncobs., Cook the chorizo on the barbecue flat plate for 1 minute each side or until golden. Add the chorizo, almond, parsley, chives, vinegar and remaining oil to the corn and toss to combine.

name: Mexican pancakes
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef mince'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet reduced-salt taco seasoning mix'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eg', 'name': 'g'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh coriander'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'avocado, mashed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'tomato, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sour cream'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Extra', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Lightly spray a medium frying pan with oil. Heat over high heat. Add mince. Cook, breaking up mince with a wooden spoon, for 5 minutes or until browned. Add seasoning mix. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add ¾ cup cold water. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes or until mixture is thick. Remove from heat. Cover to keep warm., Meanwhile, combine flour and a pinch of salt in a bowl. Make a well in centre. Whisk milk and egg in a jug. Pour milk mixture into flour mixture. Whisk until smooth. Stir in half the chopped coriander., Heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Brush pan with a little melted butter. Pour 1/3 cup batter into pan. Swirl pan to cover base. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes or until bubbles appear on surface. Turn. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until golden and cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Cover with foil to keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter to make 4 pancakes., Combine avocado, tomato, lime juice and remaining coriander in a bowl. Place pancakes on plates. Top with mince mixture, guacamole and sour cream. Serve topped with extra coriander.

name: Fig tarte fine
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'sheet', 'name': 'butter puff pastry, slightly-thawed'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'almond meal'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'figs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'apricot jam, warmed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vanilla', 'name': 'ice-cream, to serve'}]
steps: Line a baking tray with baking paper. Cut four 12cm discs from puff pastry. Place on prepared tray. Sprinkle almond meal evenly over pastry. Place in the fridge for 20 minutes to rest., Preheat the oven to 200C/180C fan forced., Slice 4 fresh figs and arrange over the pastry. Bake for 20 minutes or until the pastry is puffed and golden., Brush with 2 tablespoons warmed apricot jam. Top with vanilla ice-cream.

name: Baby salmon with saffron and fennel pilaf
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'saffron threads'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) boiling water'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fennel seeds'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) Basmati rice'}, {'quantity': '435', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 3/4 cups) water'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'dill, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '1.8kg each) whole baby salmon, scaled, gutted'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Dill', 'name': 'sprigs, to garnish'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Place saffron in a small heatproof bowl. Pour over the boiling water and set aside for 5 minutes to infuse., Meanwhile, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat until foaming. Add onion and fennel seeds and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until onion softens. Add rice and stir to coat. Add the water and saffron mixture and stir to combine. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and cook, covered, for 13 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat. Use a fork to separate the grains. Set aside for 15 minutes to cool slightly. Add dill and stir to combine., Preheat oven to 180°C. Wash fish inside and out under cold water. Pat dry with paper towel. Season with salt and pepper and rub into skin. Spoon pilaf among salmon cavities. Wrap each fish in foil and place in a large roasting pan., Bake in preheated oven for 35 minutes or until fish flakes when tested with a fork. Remove from oven. Place each salmon on a serving platter. Garnish with dill sprigs and serve with lemon wedges.

name: Slow cooker Mongolian lamb shanks
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Australian Lamb Shanks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cornflour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'canola oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', peeled, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated ginger'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(110g) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sriracha or chilli sauce (optional)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced lengthways'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'jasmine rice, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'choy sum, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thinly', 'name': 'sliced red chilli (optional), to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Coriander', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Place the lamb and cornflour in a large bowl and toss to combine. Heat the oil in a large frying pan over high heat. Cook the lamb, turning occasionally, for 5 mins or until brown all over. Transfer to a slow cooker., Add onion, carrot, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sugar, sriracha or chilli sauce, if using, and 1/2 cup (125ml) water to the slow cooker. Season. Cover and cook for 4 hours on high (or 6 hours on low) or until lamb is falling off the bone., Meanwhile, place the spring onion in a small bowl of iced water. Set aside for 10 mins to curl., Divide the rice evenly among serving bowls. Top with the lamb mixture and choy sum. Sprinkle with the spring onion, chilli, if using, and coriander.

name: Passionfruit & white chocolate mousse with shortbread hearts
ingredient: [{'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'white chocolate, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) fresh passionfruit pulp'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', separated'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Whipped', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'passionfruit pulp, extra, to serve'}]
steps: Place the chocolate and passionfruit in a heatproof bowl over a saucepan of simmering water (make sure the bowl doesn't touch the water). Use a metal spoon to stir for 3-4 minutes or until the chocolate melts and the mixture is smooth. Set aside for 5 minutes to cool. Add the egg yolks and whisk until combined., Use an electric beater to beat the cream in a bowl until soft peaks form. Use a metal spoon to fold in the chocolate mixture., Use a clean electric beater to beat the egg whites and sugar in a clean, dry bowl until firm peaks form. Fold the egg white mixture into the chocolate mixture until combined. Divide the mousse among two 250ml (1-cup) capacity serving dishes. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 4 hours or until set., Meanwhile, to make the shortbread: place the butter and sugar in the bowl of a food processor and process until pale and creamy. Add the flour, rice flour, vanilla and salt, and process until the dough just comes together. Turn out dough onto a lightly floured surface and gently knead until smooth. Shape into a disc, cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 30 minutes to rest., Preheat oven to 190°C. Grease a baking tray lightly with oil. Halve the dough. Roll out 1 portion on a lightly floured surface until 3mm thick. Use a 7.5cm-diameter heart-shaped pastry cutter to cut 20 hearts. Place on tray. Repeat with remaining dough., Sprinkle the biscuits lightly with extra sugar. Bake in oven for 10 minutes or until golden. Set aside on the tray for 5 minutes to cool before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely., Top mousse with cream and passionfruit. Serve with shortbread.

name: Vegan sweet potato noodles with crispy kale
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'kale'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'pine nuts'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) extra virgin olive oil, plus extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'garlic cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', rind finely grated'}, {'quantity': '700', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sweet potato, peeled, cut into noodles using a spiraliser'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 150C/130C fan forced. Tear the kale into bite-sized pieces, discarding the stems. Place on 2 large baking trays. Spray with olive oil. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until just crisp. Set aside to cool., Meanwhile, spread the pine nuts over a baking tray and roast for 3-5 minutes or until golden. Set aside to cool., Combine the oil, garlic, chilli and lemon rind in a large, deep frying pan. Cook over medium-low heat for 3 minutes or until the garlic starts to sizzle. Add the sweet potato noodles and increase the heat to medium-high. Cook, tossing the noodles, for 5 minutes or until the noodles are tender. Add half the kale and toss to combine., Divide the noodle mixture among serving bowls. Crumble the remaining kale and sprinkle over the top, along with the pine nuts. Drizzle with a little extra olive oil.

name: Mango lassi
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'honey-flavoured yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen mango, chopped'}]
steps: Combine the milk500ml milk, yoghurt250g honey-flavoured yoghurt and mango500g frozen mango, chopped in a blender. Blend well to combine. Serve.

name: Tuscan tomato & bread soup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': 'Mutti Whole Peeled Tomatoes 400g'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chilli, seeds removed, chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'day-old sourdough bread, crusts removed, cubed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped basil, plus extra small leaves to serve'}]
steps: Place tomatoes, chilli, garlic, sugar, 1 tablespoon oil, 1 cup (250ml) water and some salt and pepper in a saucepan and bring to the boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low, then cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until the tomatoes break down slightly., Meanwhile, place the bread in a bowl and drizzle with the vinegar. Set aside for 10 minutes to soften., Add the bread mixture and basil to the soup and stir well to combine. Cover and simmer over low heat for a further 5 minutes or until the soup thickens., Using a stick blender, blend the soup until smooth. (Alternatively, cool slightly, puree in ba puree in batches in a blender, then reheat over medium heat.), Serve hot, drizzled with remaining oil and garnished with small basil leaves.

name: Pork bulgogi
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pork fillet, sliced thinly'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'salt-reduced soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', halved lengthways, thinly sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'broccolini, cut into 3cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow peas'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'oyster sauce'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried rice stick noodles'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander sprigs'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'apple, thinly sliced'}]
steps: Combine pork, garlic, ginger, chilli, sesame oil, sugar, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil and 1/2 the soy sauce in a bowl. Turn to coat., Heat 1 tablespoon of the remaining vegetable oil in a large frying pan over high heat. Cook carrot and broccolini, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until tender. Transfer to a bowl., Heat remaining oil in same frying pan over high heat. Remove pork from marinade. Reserve marinade. Cook pork, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until cooked through., Add carrot mixture, snow peas, pork marinade, oyster sauce and remaining soy sauce to pan. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until warmed through and vegetables are tender., Meanwhile, cook noodles following packet directions. Drain. Divide noodles among serving plates. Top with pork stir-fry and coriander. Serve with lime wedges and fresh apple slices

name: Lamb patties with pita bread and tzatziki
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lean lamb mince'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(50g) dried breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Moroccan spice mix (see note)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'pita', 'name': 'bread pockets, warmed, split'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tomatoes', 'name': ', sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'wild rocket leaves'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'low-fat tzatziki (see note)'}]
steps: Combine the lamb, breadcrumbs, Moroccan spice mix, garlic, egg and a little salt and pepper in a bowl. Divide the mixture into twelve 5cm patties., Heat oil in a pan over medium-low heat. In batches, cook the patties for 3 minutes each side until browned and cooked through. Fill pita pockets with patties, tomato, rocket and a generous spoonful of tzatziki. Serve with remaining tzatziki.

name: Chicken and cabbage salad with yoghurt herb dressing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'barbecued', 'name': 'chicken, skin removed, meat shredded'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'cabbage, shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red capsicum, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', peeled, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Wholegrain', 'name': 'bread, to serve'}]
steps: Combine chicken, cabbage, capsicum, carrot, onion and raisins in a bowl., Make yoghurt herb dressing Whisk yoghurt, 1/4 cup orange juice, vinegar, tarragon and salt and pepper in a bowl until well combined. Pour over salad. Toss to combine. Serve.

name: Hoisin eggplant, prawn and bok choy stir-fry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'eggplants (300g), halved lengthways, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'king prawns, peeled (tails intact), deveined'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece ginger, grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'baby bok choy (500g), roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'hoisin sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'rice vinegar*'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'jasmine rice, to serve (optional)'}]
steps: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a wok or large frypan over medium-high heat. Add eggplant and cook, stirring occasionally, for 3-4 minutes until softened and lightly browned., Add remaining oil, prawns, ginger and garlic to wok. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until prawns have changed colour., Reduce heat to medium, then add bok choy, hoisin and rice vinegar and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until the bok choy is just wilted and the mixture is coated with sauce. Serve the stir-fry with steamed rice if desired.

name: Orange coconut sago with lychees and passionfruit
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sago, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can coconut cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated orange rind'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '565', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can lychees in syrup, drained'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'passionfruit, halved'}]
steps: Place sago in a large saucepan with 2 cups cold water. Set aside to soak for 30 minutes., Add coconut cream to sago over medium heat. Bring to the boil. Cook, stirring, for 15 minutes or until sago is translucent and tender. Stir in orange rind and 1/2 cup sugar. Set aside for 15 minutes to cool slightly., Meanwhile, combine lychees, passionfruit and remaining sugar in a bowl. Spoon sago into serving bowls. Top with lychee mixture. Serve.

name: Rustic apple and spelt tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '175', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'white spelt flour'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'wholemeal spelt flour'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon, plus extra, to sprinkle'}, {'quantity': '35', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) panela sugar'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) Cobram Estate extra virgin olive oil light flavour'}, {'quantity': '90', 'unit': None, 'name': '-100ml chilled water'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'small', 'name': '(about 410g) Granny Smith apples, peeled, quartered, cored'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'apricot jam'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Low', 'name': '-fat Greek yoghurt, to serve (optional)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Cobram Estate extra virgin olive oil light flavour, extra'}]
steps: Place the flours, cinnamon and 1 tbs of the panela sugar in a large bowl. Stir to combine. Make a well in the centre. Add the oil, in a slow steady stream, stirring with a fork until incorporated and small lumps form. Add 90ml of the water. Use a wooden spoon to stir until a tacky dough forms, adding more water if necessary., Turn onto a lightly floured surface and briefly knead until just smooth. Shape into a disc. Enclose in plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 1 hour to rest., Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 180C/160C fan forced. Cut each apple quarter into 4 thin slices. Place in a bowl. Add the lemon juice and 1 tablespoon of the panela sugar. Toss to coat., Roll out dough on a lightly floured sheet of baking paper to a 30cm disc. Carefully transfer the dough on the paper to a large baking tray. Spread with the jam, leaving a 3-4cm border around the edge. Top with apple slices, arranging in concentric circles. Fold edge over the filling, roughly pleating. Brush pastry edges with extra oil. Sprinkle the pastry and apple with remaining sugar. Bake for 45 minutes or until golden and crisp. Cool on tray. Sprinkle with extra cinnamon. Serve at room temperature with yoghurt, if desired.

name: Sesame vegetable omelette
ingredient: [{'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried rice vermicelli noodles'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet rainbow salad mix (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chilli, deseeded, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds, toasted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'oyster sauce'}]
steps: Place noodles and salad mix in a bowl. Cover with boiling water. Stand for 4 to 5 minutes or until noodles are tender. Drain. Add coriander, onion and chilli to noodles. Toss to combine., Meanwhile, whisk eggs, soy and sesame seeds together in a large jug., Heat 1/2 teaspoon oil in a medium, nonstick frying pan over medium heat. Pour in 1/4 egg mixture. Tilt pan to cover base. Cook for 1 minute or until just set., Top 1 side egg mixture with 1/4 noodle mixture. Cook for 1 minute or until egg has set. Fold over to enclose filling. Slide onto a plate. Cover to keep warm. Repeat with remaining oil, egg mixture and noodle mixture to make 4 omelettes., Combine oyster sauce and 2 tablespoons cold water. Drizzle omelettes with oyster sauce mixture. Serve.

name: Curried pumpkin and chickpea soup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'curry powder'}, {'quantity': '1.75', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, peeled, cut into 1.5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cans chickpeas, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'Massel chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Tamar', 'name': 'Valley Greek Style Yoghurt, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander sprigs, to serve'}]
steps: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes or until onion has softened. Add curry powder. Cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add pumpkin. Stir to coat., Using a fork, crush half the chickpeas. Add crushed chickpeas, stock and 1 cup cold water to pan. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, partially covered, for 30 minutes or until pumpkin is very tender and soup has thickened. Stir in remaining chickpeas. Ladle into bowls. Top with yoghurt and coriander. Serve.

name: Sticky date puddings
ingredient: [{'quantity': '175', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dates, pitted, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'bicarbonate of soda'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter, softened, plus extra to grease'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'light brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '170', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'self-raising flour, sifted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thick', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Place dates in a pan with 180ml water and bring to the boil. Add bicarbonate of soda and set aside for 15 minutes (it will bubble fiercely then settle down)., Cream together butter and sugar until pale. Add vanilla and 1 tablespoon of flour, and stir to combine. Add eggs one at a time, beating until smooth. Use a metal spoon to gently fold in remaining flour and stir in the date mixture (it may look a little curdled at this stage)., Grease six 250ml (1-cup capacity) dariole moulds with butter and pour in pudding mixture. Bake for 25 minutes until cooked through. Set aside for 5 minutes before turning out., To make the sauce, mix ingredients in a pan over low heat until butter has melted. Cool slightly before pouring over puddings. Serve with cream.

name: Chargrilled chicken with rice, spinach and pea pulao
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'single', 'name': 'chicken breast fillets, fat trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1 2.5', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece cinnamon stick'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cardamom seeds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) Basmati rice, rinsed well'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) Vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'English spinach leaves, washed, drained, stems trimmed, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '110', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2/3 cup) frozen peas, thawed'}, {'quantity': '130', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) skim milk natural yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh coriander'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}]
steps: Heat a chargrill over medium-high heat. Brush each chicken2 single chicken breast fillets, fat trimmed fillet with 1/2 teaspoon of the oil1 tbsp vegetable oil and cook on preheated chargrill for 4 minutes each side or until just cooked through. Transfer to a plate, cover with foil and set aside., Meanwhile: heat remaining oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add cinnamon1 2.5cm piece cinnamon stick, cloves5 cloves, cumin1 tsp cumin seeds and cardamom1/4 tsp cardamom seeds, and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add onion1 large brown onion, thinly sliced and garlic2 garlic cloves, thinly sliced, and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until onion softens., Add the rice200g (1 cup) Basmati rice, rinsed well and mix well. Stir in the stock500ml (2 cups) Vegetable stock, salt and pepperSalt & freshly ground black pepper. Bring to the boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low, cover tightly and cook for 20 minutes without lifting the lid., Remove from the heat. Use a fork to quickly and gently stir the spinach10 large English spinach leaves, washed, drained, stems trimmed, roughly chopped and peas110g (2/3 cup) frozen peas, thawed through the pulao. Replace the lid and set aside for 10 minutes., Combine the yoghurt130g (1/2 cup) skim milk natural yoghurt, fresh coriander2 tbsp chopped fresh coriander and ground coriander1/2 tsp ground coriander in a small bowl, and season with salt and pepper. Set aside. Thinly slice the chicken across the grain. Serve the pulao topped with the chicken and a dollop of coriander2 tbsp chopped fresh coriander yoghurt.

name: Bitter green salad with currant dressing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'white balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'currants'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'oakleaf lettuce, leaves separated'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'raddichio', 'name': 'lettuce, leaves separated'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'fennel bulb, thinly sliced'}]
steps: Combine the oil, vinegar and currants in a small bowl. Season. Set aside for 15 minutes to macerate., Place the lettuces and fennel in a large bowl. Drizzle with the dressing. Toss to combine. Serve immediately

name: Chargrilled sweet corn salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sweet', 'name': 'corn, husks and silk removed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground pepper'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow pea sprouts'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'avocados', 'name': ', halved, stone removed, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'feta, crumbled'}]
steps: Heat a chargrill pan over a medium-high heat. Spray the corn with olive oil. Cook on the chargrill, turning often, for 8 minutes or until golden., Stand a cob on one end and slice downwards with a knife as close as possible to the cob to remove the kernels. Repeat with the second cob. Mix the lime juice, extra virgin olive oil, salt and pepper until well combined., Divide the snow pea sprouts, avocado and warm corn kernels among serving dishes. Drizzle with the dressing and scatter the feta to serve.

name: Baileys mousse cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup, firmly packed) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate, chopped'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dark cocoa powder, plus extra, to dust'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream, whipped'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 160C/140C fan forced. Grease a 20cm springform pan and line the base and side with baking paper., Combine the butter, sugar and dark chocolate in a small saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes or until melted and smooth. Set aside to cool slightly., Meanwhile, sift the flours and cocoa powder into a medium bowl and make a well in the centre. Add the butter mixture and whisked egg. Quickly stir to combine. Transfer to the prepared pan and smooth the surface. Bake for 25 minutes or until the cake springs back when lightly touched. Set aside in the pan to cool completely., To make the mousse, pour the Baileys into a microwave-safe bowl and sprinkle with the gelatine. Set aside for 2-3 minutes to soften. (Use your fingertip to gently submerge the gelatine into the liquid if it settles on the surface but do not stir). Microwave on High for 20 seconds or until hot. Use a fork to whisk until gelatine dissolves. Set aside to cool slightly., Place the milk chocolate in a medium bowl. Add the egg yolks and stir until just combined. Place the egg whites in another bowl and use electric beaters to beat until soft peaks form. Use a large metal spoon to fold the egg whites through the chocolate mixture. Fold through the cream. Pour over the Baileys mixture and fold to combine. Pour mousse mixture over the cooled cake (still in the pan) and place in the fridge for 6 hours or until set. Dollop with the cream and sprinkle with extra cocoa to serve­.

name: Sticky Irish-whiskey short ribs
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'beef short ribs'}, {'quantity': '1 1/3', 'unit': 'firmly', 'name': 'packed cups (330g) muscovado sugar or dark brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) HP sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) Irish whiskey or regular whiskey'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) malt vinegar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'thyme', 'name': 'sprigs, leaves picked'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'star', 'name': 'anise'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 160C., Place the ribs in a roasting pan just large enough to fit them snugly. Season., Whisk the sugar, garlic, sauces, whiskey, vinegar, thyme and star anise in a bowl., Pour over the ribs, then cover with foil., Roast ribs for 1.5 hours, then remove foil and cook, basting frequently, for a further 1.5 hours or until meat is tender and falling off the bone. Transfer ribs to a plate and cover loosely with foil to keep warm., Place the roasting pan over medium heat and stir the cooking juices until they are reduced and syrupy. Pour sauce over ribs to serve.

name: Noodle omelette
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions (shallots), thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cold water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '85g pkts Indomie Mi Goreng Instant Noodles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cucumber', 'name': ', peeled into ribbons'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled into ribbons'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cherry', 'name': 'tomatoes, quartered, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Spring', 'name': 'onions (shallots), thinly sliced, extra, to serve'}]
steps: Combine egg, spring onion and water in a bowl. Heat 1 tsp oil in a wok over medium heat. Add one-quarter of the egg mixture. Swirl to coat. Cook for 2 minutes or until just set. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining oil and egg mixture to make 4 omelettes., Prepare the noodles following packet directions. Transfer to a bowl. Add cucumber and carrot. Toss to combine., Divide omelettes among plates. Top with noodle mixture, tomato and spring onion. Fold the omelettes in half.

name: Pumpkin and zucchini 'no pasta' lasagne
ingredient: [{'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, unpeeled, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'zucchini, peeled into ribbons'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lean beef mince (see notes)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sundried tomatoes (not in oil), roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '410', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can crushed tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried red lentils, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh oregano leaves'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'tub smooth low-fat ricotta'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'natural seed mix with pine nuts, toasted'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Line 2 large baking trays with baking paper., Place pumpkin, in a single layer, on trays. Spray with oil. Roast for 10 minutes or until just tender. Transfer to a plate. Place zucchini, in a single layer, on trays. Spray with oil. Roast for 5 minutes or until just tender., Meanwhile, heat oil in a large, heavybased saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until onion has softened. Add garlic. Cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add mince. Cook, breaking up lumps with a wooden spoon, for 6 minutes or until browned. Add cinnamon, allspice, sundried and crushed tomatoes, lentils and 2 1/2 cups water. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, partially covered, for 10 minutes. Uncover. Cook for a further 10 minutes or until lentils are tender and mixture is thick. Remove from heat. Stir in oregano., Combine ricotta, egg and 1/2 the parmesan in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper., Grease a 6cm-deep, 21cm x 26.5cm (top), 8-cup-capacity baking dish. Spoon 2 cups mince mixture over base of pan. Spread with 1/2 the ricotta mixture. Top with 1/2 the pumpkin and 1/2 the zucchini. Top with remaining mince mixture, ricotta mixture, pumpkin and zucchini. Sprinkle with remaining parmesan. Season with salt and pepper. Cover with baking paper, followed by foil. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove foil and baking paper. Bake for a further 10 to 15 minutes or until golden. Stand for 10 minutes. Serve sprinkled with seed mix.

name: Strawberry and Pimm’s crumble
ingredient: [{'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'strawberries, halved'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) Pimm’s No.1 or orange juice'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(165g) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(150g) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped, softened'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Place the strawberry in a 6-cup (1.5L) baking dish. Add Pimm’s or orange juice and 2 tsp of the sugar and stir to combine., Combine flour and remaining sugar in a small bowl. Add the butter and use your fingertips to rub the butter into the flour mixture until mixture resembles coarse breadcrumbs. Sprinkle over the strawberry mixture in the dish., Bake for 30 mins or until the top is golden brown and strawberry is tender. Set aside for 5 mins to cool slightly.

name: Prawns with romesco dip
ingredient: [{'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) blanched almonds'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'bought chargrilled capsicum, drained'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sweet paprika'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) bought aioli (see note)'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'cooked prawns, peeled leaving tails intact'}]
steps: Process the almonds in a food processor until finely chopped. add the capsicum and paprika, and process until a smooth paste forms., Transfer the almond mixture to a bowl and stir in the aioli. Season with salt and pepper., Serve the prawns with the sauce and lemon wedges.

name: Sticky pomegranate chicken with couscous salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'chicken wing nibbles'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pomegranate molasses'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'zucchini, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'wholemeal couscous'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'boiling water'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed salad leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pomegranate', 'name': ', seeds removed'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan-forced. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper. Place chicken on 1 prepared tray. Combine molasses, thyme and 1⁄2 the oil in a small jug. Drizzle over chicken. Toss to coat. Bake, turning occasionally, for 40 minutes or until golden and cooked through., Meanwhile, place onion and zucchini on remaining tray. Add to oven in the last 20 minutes of chicken cooking time. Season with salt and pepper., Place couscous in a large heatproof bowl. Add boiling water. Cover. Set aside for 5 minutes. Fluff couscous with a fork to separate grains. Add salad leaves, zucchini mixture, lemon juice, remaining oil and 1/2 the pomegranate seeds. Toss to combine. Serve chicken with couscous salad, sprinkled with remaining pomegranate seeds.

name: Cream hearts
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cream cheese'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mascarpone cheese'}, {'quantity': '160', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Greek Style Yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eggwhit', 'name': 'e'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'White', 'name': 'rose petals (for decoration only)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Silver', 'name': 'cachous, to garnish'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'raspberries, to serve (optional)'}]
steps: Line eight 125ml coeur a la creme moulds with squares of damp muslin, making sure fabric overhangs moulds. Place the cream cheese in bowl of an electric mixer and beat until smooth. Add 1/2 cup (110g) of sugar and beat until sugar dissolves. Add mascarpone and yoghurt, beat until combined, then fold in cream until just incorporated. Spoon mixture into moulds, pressing into corners, then fold muslin over mixture, pressing down well. Place on a tray and chill for at least 4 hours or overnight., Half an hour before serving, lightly whisk the eggwhite and spread the remaining caster sugar on baking paper. Brush the eggwhite on both sides of each petal with a pastry brush, then lightly press into the sugar. Leave to dry for 30 minutes., Invert hearts onto serving plates, remove muslin and press a few cachous onto each. Decorate with petals (do not eat) and serve with berries if desired.

name: Easy fish chowder
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Australian Made Thin Sliced Streaky Bacon, rind removed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'onions', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'stalks, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(500ml) milk, hot'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'desiree or pontiac potatoes, peeled, cut into 1cm chunks'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(375ml) fish stock'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'canned corn kernels, drained'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'boneless white fish (such as perch or cod), cut into bite-size chunks'}, {'quantity': '24', 'unit': 'mussels', 'name': ', scrubbed, debearded (optional)'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thick cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped flat-leaf parsley, to garnish'}]
steps: Heat the oil in a large saucepan, add the bacon and cook over medium heat until starting to crisp. Add onion and cook until it starts to soften, then add celery and garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes to soften. Add the flour and cook for 1 minute. Stir in hot milk, add potatoes and stock and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the corn and fish, and cook for a further 5 minutes or until fish is opaque. If using mussels, add during the last 2 minutes of the fish's cooking time (discarding any that haven't opened). Stir in cream, and season with salt and pepper. Serve in deep bowls sprinkled with the parsley.

name: Pork stir-fry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'jasmine rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pork stir-fry strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow peas, trimmed, halved diagonally lengthways'}, {'quantity': '425', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can baby corn spears, drained'}, {'quantity': '190', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'jar Thai chilli jam stir-fry paste'}]
steps: Place rice into a sieve. Rinse under cold water. Bring 3 cups of water to the boil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add rice. Cover tightly. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 15 minutes. Turn off heat. Stand for 5 minutes., Meanwhile, heat a wok over high heat until hot. Add 1 teaspoon of oil. Swirl to coat. Add one-third of the pork. Stir-fry for 1 minute or until browned. Remove to a plate. Repeat twice with oil and remaining pork., Add remaining 1 teaspoon of oil and onion to wok. Stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add snow peas. Stir-fry for 1 minute., Return pork to wok with corn and stir-fry paste. Stir-fry for 2 minutes or until heated through. Serve with rice.

name: Chilli con carne
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'lean beef mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '35', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt chilli seasoning'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': 'Mutti Polpa Finely Chopped Tomatoes 400g'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can red kidney beans, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Mutti Double Concentrate Tomato Paste'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'white rice, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Reduced', 'name': '-fat sour cream, to serve'}]
steps: Heat the oil in a large frying pan over high heat. Cook the mince, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up any lumps, for 4 minutes or until well browned., Add the onion and cook, stirring often, for 3-4 minutes or until soft. Add the seasoning, tomato, beans and tomato paste. Cook, stirring often, for 2-3 minutes or until the sauce thickens., Divide the rice and mince mixture among serving bowls. Top with coriander leaves and serve with sour cream.

name: Apple and rhubarb crumble
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': '(425g) rhubarb, trimmed, cut into 2cm pieces (see note)'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'granny', 'name': 'smith apples, peeled, cored, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'orange rind, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chilled, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'thickened', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Grease a 1.5-litre (6-cup-capacity) ovenproof dish., Combine rhubarb1 bunch (425g) rhubarb, trimmed, cut into 2cm pieces (see note), apple3 granny smith apples, peeled, cored, thinly sliced, caster sugar2 tbsp caster sugar, orange rind1 tsp orange rind, finely grated and juice2 tbsp orange juice in prepared dish. Bake, covered, stirring once, for 30 minutes or until fruit is just tender. Remove from oven., Meanwhile, combine flour1 cup self-raising flour and brown sugar2/3 cup brown sugar in a large bowl. Add butter80g butter, chilled, chopped. Using your fingertips, rub butter into flour mixture until mixture resembles coarse breadcrumbs. Sprinkle over rhubarb and apple mixture., Bake, uncovered, for 25 to 30 minutes or until crumble is golden brown. Serve with thickened creamthickened cream, to serve.

name: Upside-down jam cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '455', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'jar raspberry jam'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '215', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3/4 cup) milk'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Grease a 5cm-deep, 23cm square cake pan. Line base and sides with baking paper., Spread the jam455g jar raspberry jam over the base of the prepared pan to evenly coat. Place in the freezer for 15 minutes or until required., Use electric beaters to beat the butter200g butter, at room temperature, sugar215g (1 cup) caster sugar and vanilla2 tsp vanilla extract in a bowl until pale and creamy. Add eggs2 eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in half the flour300g (2 cups) self-raising flour, then half the milk185ml (3/4 cup) milk. Repeat with remaining flour and milk until mixture is well combined., Dollop the batter over the jam. Use a spatula to smooth the surface. Bake for 1 hour or until a skewer inserted into the centre of cake comes out clean. Set aside in the pan for 10 minutes., Carefully invert the cake onto a serving plate. Cut into pieces to serve.

name: Tropical fruit salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can coconut cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece fresh ginger, grated'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pineapple, peeled, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'lychees', 'name': ', peeled, seeds removed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'gold', 'name': 'kiwifruit, peeled, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'mangoes, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'passionfruit', 'name': ', halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lime rind'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded coconut, toasted'}]
steps: Combine cream, sugar, lime juice and ginger in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 5 to 8 minutes or until mixture has slightly thickened. Set aside to cool., Combine pineapple, lychees, kiwifruit, mango, passionfruit pulp and lime rind in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Toss to combine. Drizzle with coconut cream mixture. Sprinkle with coconut. Serve.

name: Pumpkin & goat's cheese risotto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'leek (white part only), finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pumpkin, peeled, diced into 1cm pieces'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Zest', 'name': 'of 1 lemon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '900', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'arborio rice'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60g) frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': "soft goat's cheese, crumbled"}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'rocket leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Melt butter20g unsalted butter in a deep frypan over low heat. Cook leek1 large leek (white part only), finely chopped for 2-3 minutes until softened. Add garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed, pumpkin500g pumpkin, peeled, diced into 1cm pieces, half the zestZest of 1 lemon and half the thyme1 tbsp chopped thyme leaves, then stir to coat. Add wine100ml dry white wine, cover and cook for 10 minutes or until pumpkin is almost cooked., Meanwhile, bring stock900ml chicken stock to the boil in a pan. Reduce heat to very low and simmer., Add the rice250g arborio rice to pumpkin mixture and cook for 1-2 minutes to coat the grains. Add stock 1 ladleful at a time, allowing each to be absorbed before adding the next. Continue for 12 minutes, stirring constantly, until stock is absorbed and rice is cooked but firm to the bite. Season to taste. Stir in peas1/2 cup (60g) frozen peas and half the cheese100g soft goat's cheese, crumbled., Serve topped with the remaining zest, thyme, cheese and rocketBaby rocket leaves, to serve.

name: Layered pesto torta dip
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh ricotta, drained'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'tub mascarpone'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1⁄3 cup) pine nuts, toasted'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'small basil leaves, to serve (optional)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pita', 'name': 'crisps, to serve'}]
steps: To make the pestos, place all the tomato pesto ingredients150g semi-dried tomatoes, drained|2 garlic cloves|2 tbsp fresh lemon juice|2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil or oil from semi-dried tomatoes in a food processor. Process until almost smooth. Season. Transfer to a bowl. Clean the processor then repeat to make the basil pesto1 cup firmly packed fresh basil leaves|20g (1⁄4 cup) finely grated parmesan|2 tbsp pine nuts, toasted|1 garlic clove|2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil., Use electric beaters to beat ricotta500g fresh ricotta, drained in a bowl until smooth. Beat in the mascarpone250g tub mascarpone. Add the lemon rind1 tbsp finely grated lemon rind. Season. Beat until combined., Line a shallow 1L (4 cup) bowl with 2 layers of plastic wrap, allowing wrap to overhang side. Spoon over one-third of the ricotta mixture. Smooth the surface. Press with back of a spoon to remove air pockets. Top with basil pesto. Smooth the surface. Top with half of the remaining ricotta mixture. Smooth the surface. Top with tomato pesto. Smooth the surface. Top with the remaining ricotta mixture., Fold over the wrap. Place a plate on top then heavy cans to compress. Place in the fridge overnight to chill., Turn the torta onto a plate and arrange pine nuts55g (1⁄3 cup) pine nuts, toasted in rows on top. Season with pepper and top with basil, if using. Serve with crispsPita crisps, to serve.

name: Tatsoi salad with sesame dressing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tahini (see notes)'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'light soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'telegraph', 'name': 'cucumber, peeled, cut in half, seeded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'tatsoi, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen edamame, thawed, shelled (see notes)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'white sesame seeds'}]
steps: Combine the tahini, soy sauce, garlic and lemon juice in a small bowl. Add the peanut oil and mix thoroughly until emulsified. Add a small amount of water if dressing is too thick. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground white pepper. Set aside., Trim green part of spring onion and discard. Thinly slice white bulb lengthways. Thinly slice cucumber widthways. Arrange tatsoi on a platter and scatter spring onion, cucumber and edamame over, then sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve salad with sesame dressing.

name: Lamb skewers with crunchy salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '500g lemon and garlic marinated lamb skewers'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '520g pkt crunchy salad mix'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumbers, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g punnet grape tomatoes, halved lengthways'}]
steps: Preheat a barbecue grill or chargrill on medium. Spray both sides of the lamb with olive oil spray., Add the lamb to the grill and cook for 4 minutes each side for medium or until cooked to your liking., Meanwhile, place the salad mix and dressing from the packet in a large bowl. Add the cucumber and tomato, and toss until well combined., Divide the salad among serving bowls. Top with the lamb to serve.

name: Meatballs with couscous salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'extra-lean beef mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'beef stock powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'garlic pepper steak seasoning'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'couscous'}, {'quantity': '1 2/3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'boiling water'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chickpeas, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'mint leaves, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley leaves, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', rind finely grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Sunbeam raisins, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'roma', 'name': 'tomatoes, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fat-free natural yoghurt'}]
steps: Combine mince800g extra-lean beef mince, stock powder2 tsp beef stock powder and steak seasoning2 tsp garlic pepper steak seasoning in a large bowl. Mix well. Roll tablespoons mince into balls., Place couscous1 cup couscous in a large, heatproof bowl. Cover with boiling water1 2/3 cups boiling water. Cover bowl and stand for 3 to 4 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir with a fork to seperate grains., Heat a large, non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Spray meatballs with oilolive oil cooking spray. Cook, turning often, for 10 to 15 minutes or until browned and cooked through., Meanwhile, add chickpeas400g can chickpeas, drained, rinsed, mint1/2 cup mint leaves, chopped, parsley1/4 cup flat-leaf parsley leaves, coarsely chopped, lemon rind1 lemon, rind finely grated, juiced, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, onion1 small red onion, finely chopped, raisins1/2 cup raisins, finely chopped and tomatoes2 roma tomatoes, finely chopped to couscous. Stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon couscous salad into bowls. Top with meatballs and 1 tablespoon yoghurt. Season with pepper. Serve.

name: Indian lamb pilaf
ingredient: [{'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) korma curry paste'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'natural yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lamb leg steaks, cut into 3cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/3 cups) Basmati rice, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cardamom', 'name': 'pods, crushed'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'whole', 'name': 'cloves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'stick'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Large', 'name': 'pinch of saffron'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Flaked', 'name': 'almonds, toasted, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander sprigs, to serve'}]
steps: Combine curry paste80g (1/3 cup) korma curry paste and 90g (1/3 cup) of yoghurt300g natural yoghurt in a glass or ceramic bowl. Stir in the lamb600g lamb leg steaks, cut into 3cm pieces. Set aside to marinate., Meanwhile, melt butter20g butter and oil1 tsp vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook onion1 brown onion, halved, thinly sliced, stirring occasionally, for 7 minutes or until browned. Add garlic2 garlic cloves, finely chopped and ginger2 tsp finely chopped fresh ginger and cook for 1 minute or until aromatic., Increase heat to high and add lamb mixture. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Stir in rice270g (1 1/3 cups) Basmati rice, rinsed, drained, cardamom6 cardamom pods, crushed, cloves6 whole cloves, cinnamon1 cinnamon stick and saffronLarge pinch of saffron. Add the stock500ml (2 cups) chicken stock. Bring to the boil. Stir. Cover and reduce heat to low. Cook for 15 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Set aside, covered, for 5 minutes to steam. Use a fork to separate the grains. Season with salt., Divide among serving plates. Sprinkle with almondsFlaked almonds, toasted, to serve. Add remaining yoghurt and top with corianderFresh coriander sprigs, to serve.

name: Easter egg tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '133g packet Oreo biscuits'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted, plus 25g, extra, melted'}, {'quantity': '155', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt flakes'}, {'quantity': '160', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted roasted peanuts'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C fan forced. Grease the base and side of a 20cm round springform pan and line base and side with baking paper. Place the biscuits and a pinch of salt in a food processor and process until finely crushed. Add the melted butter and process until well combined. Transfer the mixture to the prepared pan and press mixture firmly and evenly over the base and up side of pan. Bake for 10 minutes or until firm. Set aside to cool., Stir the sugar and 60ml (1/4 cup) water in a small saucepan over low heat until the sugar dissolves. Increase heat to medium and bring to the boil. Cook, without stirring, for 10 minutes or until golden. Remove from heat., Meanwhile, place the cream in a microwave-safe bowl and microwave on Medium for 2 minutes. Add the extra butter and stir until combined. Carefully add the cream mixture and salt flakes and place over medium heat. Cook for 3 minutes or until mixture thickens slightly. Remove from heat and transfer to a heatproof bowl. Set aside to cool completely then stir through the peanuts. Pour into the cooled tart shell., To make the topping, place the dark chocolate in a small heatproof bowl. Pour the cream into a small saucepan and place over medium heat. Bring to a simmer then pour the hot cream over the chocolate. Stir until the chocolate melts and the mixture is smooth. Spread the topping over the caramel layer. Place in the fridge for 2 hours or until set. Decorate with the mini eggs in a circular pattern to serve.

name: Turkey and butternut pie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lean turkey mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can crushed tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fresh thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', grated'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, cut into 2cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, chopped'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'canned butter beans, rinsed, drained'}]
steps: Heat oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook onion, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add mince and cook, stirring to break up lumps, for 3 minutes or until browned. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute., Add tomatoes, thyme and carrot and bring to the boil. Reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 15 minutes. Add green beans and simmer for 6–8 minutes or until beans are tender. Season with salt and pepper., Meanwhile, boil, steam or microwave pumpkin until tender. Drain. Add butter beans to pumpkin and roughly mash with a fork. Season with salt and pepper., Preheat grill on high. Spoon turkey mixture into four 1 1/2-cup (375ml) capacity ovenproof dishes. Top with pumpkin and bean mash. Grill for 1–2 minutes or until golden. Serve.

name: Caraway meatballs with cabbage salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '425', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lean beef mince'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) dried (packaged) breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caraway seeds'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'yellowbox honey'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '250g) red cabbage, hard core removed, shredded'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '250g) green cabbage, hard core removed, shredded'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'coarsely chopped walnut halves'}]
steps: Kids' task: Combine mince, breadcrumbs, egg and caraway seeds in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Divide mince mixture into 16 equal portions and roll each portion into a ball., Heat oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the meatballs and cook, turning occasionally, for 7-8 minutes or until cooked through. Add the honey and cook, stirring, until the meatballs are evenly coated., Cook cabbage in a steamer over a saucepan of simmering water for 3 minutes or until tender. Transfer to a heatproof bowl. Add chives and walnuts and toss to combine. Divide salad among serving plates. Top with meatballs and drizzle with pan juices.

name: Lamb shank and cannellini bean casserole
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'lamb', 'name': 'shanks'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '21', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, halved and cut into 8 wedges'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'whole', 'name': 'cloves garlic, peeled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'rosemary leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans Italian tomatoes, crushed'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) red wine'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can cannellini beans, drained and rinsed'}]
steps: Season lamb shanks with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large heavy based pan. Brown lamb shanks two at a time for 2 mins, transfer to a plate. Saute onion, garlic and carrot for 3-4 mins., Return shanks to pan. Add rosemary, tomatoes, water and red wine. Cover and simmer over a medium-low heat for 30 minutes. Remove lid, simmer for a further 1-1 1/2 hours until the lamb is tender. Add beans, warm through and serve with mashed potato or polenta.

name: Lychee and mango sorbet
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '565', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can lychees in syrup, drained'}, {'quantity': '425', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can mango slices in light syrup, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggwhites', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}]
steps: Combine sugar and 1 1/4 cups warm water in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until sugar is dissolved. Simmer, without stirring, for 10 minutes or until mixture thickens slightly. Remove from heat. Transfer to a heatproof bowl. Cool completely., Place lychees and mango in a processor or blender. Process until smooth. Press through a sieve into a bowl. Discard pulp. Add sugar mixture to fruit mixture. Stir to combine. Pour into a 3cm-deep, 20cm x 30cm (base) lamington pan. Cover and freeze for 1 to 2 hours or until almost firm., Transfer mixture to a food processor. Add eggwhites. Process until smooth but not melted. Pour mixture into a 6cm-deep, 11.5cm x 21.5cm (base) loaf pan. Cover and freeze for 3 hours or until firm. Serve.
nutrition: calories: 250, fat: nan, carbs: 59.0g, protein: 2.0g, servings: 4

name: Mango & lime sorbet with lime wafers
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '300g pkt frozen mango cheeks, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lime rind'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'white'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lime rind, extra'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C. Line four baking trays with non-stick baking paper., To make the sorbet, place the mango, lime rind and lime juice in the bowl of a food processor and process until almost smooth. Press firmly into a metal container, cover with foil and place in the freezer for 25 minutes or until firm., Meanwhile, use an electric beater to whisk egg white in a clean, dry bowl until soft peaks form. Gradually add sugar and whisk until dissolved. Stir in flour, butter and extra lime rind., Spoon 4 teaspoonfuls of mixture onto each of the prepared trays and spread into 7cm-diameter discs. Bake half the wafers in oven, swapping trays halfway through cooking, for 5 minutes or until golden. Repeat with the remaining wafers., Spoon the sorbet into serving bowls and serve with wafers.

name: Slow-cooker beef with tomato chutney
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'gravy beef, trimmed, cut into 3cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'brown onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato chutney'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'carrots, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'stalks, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 1/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'beef stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dried', 'name': 'bay leaf'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'rice, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chopped', 'name': 'fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Heat half the oil1 tbsp olive oil in large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook beef800g gravy beef, trimmed, cut into 3cm pieces, in 2 batches, for 5 minutes or until browned. Transfer to the bowl of a 5.5 litre slow cooker., Heat remaining oil in frying pan. Add onion1 medium brown onion, chopped. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until just soft. Transfer to slow cooker., Add chutney1/2 cup tomato chutney, soy sauce1/3 cup soy sauce, sugar2 tbsp brown sugar, carrot2 medium carrots, chopped, celery3 celery stalks, chopped, stock1 1/4 cups beef stock, bay leaf1 dried bay leaf and thyme4 sprigs fresh thyme to slow cooker. Season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine., Cover with lid. Cook on low for 7 hours, or high for 4 hours, or until beef is tender. Remove and discard bay leaf and thyme., Serve beef with sauce on steamed riceSteamed rice, to serve and sprinkle with parsleyChopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves, to serve.

name: Crispy skinned turkey breast with hazelnut and sage butter sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'baby cream delight potatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'fresh sage'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Western Star Original Butter, softened (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1.6', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'single turkey breast'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onions, halved, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eschalots', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'skinless hazelnuts, toasted, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'green beans, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced., Place potatoes in large saucepan. Cover with cold water. Bring to the boil over high heat. Boil for 5 minutes. Drain., Remove leaves from 1 bunch of sage and finely chop (you need 2 tablespoons). Place garlic, chopped sage and 250g butter in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper as required. Mash with a fork until combined. Using your fingers, gently loosen turkey skin at narrow end of breast. Gently push butter mixture between skin and breast. Rub skin to distribute butter mixture. Secure skin with toothpicks. Place in a large, flameproof roasting pan. Place potatoes around turkey. Season with salt and pepper as required., Roast for 40 minutes, basting turkey and potatoes with pan juices twice during cooking. Add onion to pan. Roast for a further 30 minutes or until juices run clear when thickest part of turkey is pierced with a skewer., Transfer potatoes to a serving bowl. Cover with foil to keep warm. Transfer turkey and onion to a plate. Cover loosely with foil. Stand for 15 minutes., Meanwhile, remove leaves from remaining bunch of sage (you’ll need 1/3 cup). Skim fat from pan juices. Place roasting pan over medium heat. Add remaining butter. Cook until melted and foaming. Add eschalot. Cook for 2 minutes or until softened. Add sage and hazelnuts. Cook for a further 4 to 5 minutes or until sage is crisp., Slice turkey. Place turkey and onion on a serving plate. Spoon over hazelnut and sage butter sauce. Serve with potatoes and beans.

name: Roast chicken with chorizo and herbs
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': '(about 1.1kg each) whole fresh chickens'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chorizo sausage, cut into 5mm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'dried', 'name': 'bay leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sweet paprika'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sea', 'name': 'salt flakes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh marjoram leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Rocket', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Rinse the chickens inside and out under cold running water. Pat dry with paper towel. Place 1 chicken on a clean work surface. Run your fingers under the skin of the breast and thighs to loosen and create pockets. Arrange half the chorizo slices, in a single layer, inside the pockets. Repeat with the remaining chicken and chorizo slices. Divide the bay leaves between the chicken cavities. Place the chickens in a large roasting pan., Combine the olive oil and paprika in a small bowl. Drizzle over the chickens and rub to coat. Season with sea salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the marjoram and thyme., Preheat oven to 190°C. Roast the chickens in oven, basting occasionally with the pan juices, for 1 1/4 hours or until the chickens are golden and the juices run clear when the thickest part of the thigh is pierced with a skewer. Cover with foil. Set aside for 20 minutes to rest., Use poultry shears or sharp kitchen scissors to cut the chickens into pieces. Place on a serving platter. Drizzle over the pan juices. Top with the rocket and serve with lemon wedges.

name: Lamb-stuffed onions with parmesan breadcrumbs
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onions, unpeeled'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lamb mince'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) passata (tomato pasta sauce)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'shredded parmesan'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'pine nuts'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Place the onions in a large saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 15 minutes or until the onions are tender. Drain. Transfer to a clean work surface. Set aside for 20 minutes to cool., Meanwhile, heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the mince and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up any lumps, for 5 minutes or until the mince changes colour. Add the cinnamon and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds or until aromatic. Add the passata and cook, stirring, for 2-3 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Stir in the parsley. Season with salt and pepper., Peel the onions. Use a small sharp knife to trim the base and top of each onion and discard. Use a teaspoon to scoop out the flesh, leaving a 1cm shell. Reserve 100g (about 1/2 cup) of onion flesh and finely chop. Place the onion shells in a baking dish., Add the reserved onion to the mince mixture and stir until well combined. Spoon the mince mixture among the onion shells., Combine the breadcrumbs, parmesan and pine nuts in a small bowl. Sprinkle the breadcrumb mixture over the tops of the onions. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until onions are golden and tender. Serve immediately.

name: Lamb couscous burgers with hummus and couscous tabouli
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, halved, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Middle Eastern spice (McCormick brand)'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) cold water'}, {'quantity': '190', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) couscous'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lamb mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g punnet cherry tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'loosely packed coarsely chopped fresh mint'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'loosely packed coarsely chopped fresh continental parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '40cm long) Turkish pide, cut crossways into 4 equal portions, each portion split'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mixed', 'name': 'lettuce leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'bought marinated chargrilled eggplant, drained on paper towel, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Bought', 'name': 'hummus, to serve'}]
steps: Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until soft. Add the spice mix and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add the water and bring to the boil. Remove from heat. Add the couscous and stir with a fork to combine. Cover and set aside for 2 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Stir with a fork to separate the grains. Set aside for 2 minutes to cool., Combine one-third of the couscous with the mince and egg in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Divide mixture into 4 portions and shape into 10cm patties., Heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the patties and cook for 3 minutes each side or until brown and cooked through. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil to keep warm., Meanwhile, combine the remaining couscous, tomato, mint, parsley and lemon juice in a medium bowl.
