Taste and season with salt and pepper., Toast pide. Place 1 pide half, cut-side up, on each serving plate. Top with lettuce, eggplant and patties. Top with a dollop of hummus and serve with remaining pide and tabouli.

name: Barbecued T-bone steaks with jacket potatoes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sour cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'prepared horseradish'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': '(150g each) sebago potatoes'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '300g each) beef T-bone steaks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Beetroot', 'name': 'relish, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Green', 'name': 'salad, to serve'}]
steps: Combine sour cream and horseradish in a small bowl. Cover. Refrigerate until it is required., Preheat oven to 220 ̊C/200 ̊C fan-forced. Using a fork, prick the potatoes all over. Place on the outside edge of microwave turntable. Microwave on HIGH (100%) for 6 minutes. Transfer to a baking tray. Bake for 30 minutes or until the skin is crisp., Meanwhile, preheat the barbecue chargrill on high heat. Rub steaks with oil and season with salt and pepper. Chargrill steaks for 4 minutes each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate. Cover loosely with foil. Set aside for 5 minutes to rest., Cut a small cross in the top of each potato, being careful not to cut the whole way through. Using a tea towel, hold each potato and carefully squeeze the base gently to open top. Top steaks with beetroot relish. Serve with the green salad and potatoes topped with horseradish cream.

name: Lemon gelato
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'milk'}]
steps: Cut lemons in half lengthways. Using a small sharp knife, cut between fruit and pith (this makes it easier to remove pulp later). Juice lemons. Remove pulp from lemon shells. Set shells aside., Place 1 cup of lemon juice and 1/2 cup of sugar into a saucepan over mediumhigh heat. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until syrup comes to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 15 minutes or until syrup has reduced by half. Pour into a bowl to cool., Using an electric mixer, beat eggs and remaining 1/2 cup sugar in a bowl for 4 minutes or until pale and thick. Stir in milk. Transfer to a saucepan. Cook, stirring, over medium heat for 8 minutes or until custard thickens and coats the back of a metal spoon (don't allow mixture to come to the boil). Remove from heat., Stir lemon syrup into custard. Pour into a 4-cup capacity airtight container. Set aside to cool. Cover and freeze for 5 to 6 hours or until almost set., Transfer to a food processor. Process until smooth. Spoon into reserved lemon shells. Smooth tops. Cover with plastic wrap. Freeze for 4 hours or until firm. Use a hot knife to cut shells in half. Serve.

name: Spiced iced coffee
ingredient: [{'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) instant coffee granules'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': '-piece fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '7cm cinnamon stick'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'whole', 'name': 'cloves'}, {'quantity': '1.25', 'unit': 'L', 'name': '(5 cups) boiling water'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) sweetened condensed milk'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Crushed', 'name': 'ice, to serve'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) Kahlua liqueur (optional)'}]
steps: Place the coffee, ginger, cinnamon stick and cloves in a large heatproof jug. Stir in the water. Set aside to cool completely., Strain the coffee mixture through a fine sieve into a clean jug. Discard the ginger, cinnamon stick and cloves., Add the condensed milk to the jug and stir to combine., Fill serving glasses with ice. Top with the coffee mixture and Kahlua, if desired. Stir to combine. Serve immediately.

name: Mixed herb and lemon lamb with spring vegetables
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', rind finely grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'coarsely chopped fresh rosemary'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'coarsely chopped fresh oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'garlic clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '125g lamb leg steaks, excess fat trimmed'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'broad beans, shelled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'asparagus, woody ends trimmed, cut in half diagonally'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, topped, halved crossways'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh peas, shelled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'fresh red chilli, deseeded, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'capers, rinsed, drained, finely chopped'}]
steps: Combine 2 teaspoons of the oil1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil with the lemon1 lemon, rind finely grated, juiced juice, rosemary1 tbsp coarsely chopped fresh rosemary, oregano1 tbsp coarsely chopped fresh oregano, garlic1 large garlic clove, crushed and water1 tsp water in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Season with pepperSalt & freshly ground black pepper. Add the lamb4 x 125g lamb leg steaks, excess fat trimmed and turn to evenly coat. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 30 minutes to develop the flavours., Cook the broad beans300g broad beans, shelled in a small saucepan of salted boiling water for 5 minutes or until tender. Drain. Refresh under cold running water. Remove skins and set aside in a bowl., Preheat a chargrill on high. Heat the remaining oil in a medium frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the asparagus1 bunch asparagus, woody ends trimmed, cut in half diagonally, beans200g green beans, topped, halved crossways and peas400g fresh peas, shelled, and cook, tossing gently, for 4 minutes or until bright green and tender crisp. Add the broad beans, stock2 tbsp chicken stock or water, lemon rind, chilli1 small fresh red chilli, deseeded, finely chopped and capers1 tbsp capers, rinsed, drained, finely chopped, and season with salt and pepper. Gently toss for a further 1 minute. Remove from heat. Transfer to a bowl and cover with foil to keep warm., Cook lamb steaks on preheated grill for 3 minutes each side for medium-rare or until cooked to your liking., Spoon the bean mixture among serving plates. Top with lamb and serve immediately.

name: Garlic and thyme chicken skewers
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'chicken', 'name': 'breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dark brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket leaves'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'punnet cherry tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh continental parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shaved parmesan'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil, to grease'}, {'quantity': '567', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Original Mission Wraps'}]
steps: Remove tenderloin from each chicken breast. Cut each tenderloin in half diagonally. Cut chicken into 4-5 strips diagonally. Combine garlic, lemon rind, lemon juice, oil, thyme and sugar in a bowl. Add chicken and mix well to coat. Thread 2-3 chicken pieces onto each skewer. Place in an airtight container in the fridge overnight to marinate., Combine rocket, tomato, parsley and parmesan in a bowl. Combine oil and lemon juice in a bowl. Drizzle over salad. Season with salt and pepper. Toss gently to combine., Preheat a barbecue grill and flat plate on medium-high. Brush flat plate with oil. Cook skewers on grill, turning, for 2-3 minutes or until cooked. Cook wraps on flat plate for 1 minute each side or until warm and lightly browned., Serve the skewers with the wraps and salad.

name: Salmon and pea pasta bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried bow tie pasta'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'reduced-fat spread'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'stalk, trimmed, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'reduced-fat milk, warmed'}, {'quantity': '415', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can red salmon, drained, flaked'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'frozen peas, corn and carrot mix'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated reduced-fat tasty cheese'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried wholegrain breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'vegetables, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced. Lightly grease a 5cm-deep, 28cm x 20.5cm ovenproof baking dish., Cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling, salted water, following packet directions, until tender. Drain. Refresh under cold water. Return to pan., Melt spread in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and celery. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until softened. Add flour. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until bubbling. Gradually add milk, stirring. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until thickened. Add to pasta. Stir in salmon, lemon juice, pea mixture and half the cheese. Spoon into prepared dish., Combine parsley, breadcrumbs and remaining cheese in a small bowl. Sprinkle over pasta mixture. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden. Serve with vegetables.

name: Chocolate tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chilled butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(150g) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60g) icing sugar mixture'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(30g) almond meal'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(30g) cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'yolk'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Raspberries', 'name': ', to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thin', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}]
steps: Place the butter, flour, icing sugar, almond meal and cocoa powder in the bowl of a food processor and process until mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add the egg yolk and process until mixture just comes together. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and gently knead until almost smooth. Shape into a disc. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 30 minutes to rest., Preheat oven to 200°C. Roll pastry on a lightly floured surface to a 4mm-thick disc. Line the base and side of a 23cm (base measurement) round, fluted tart tin with removable base. Use a sharp knife to trim the edges. Place in the fridge for 15 minutes to rest., Place the tart tin on an oven tray. Line the pastry with baking paper and fill with rice or beans. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes. Remove the rice or beans and bake for a further 5 minutes or until pastry is just cooked through. Reduce oven temperature to 160°C., Meanwhile, to make the filling, combine the yolks, custard powder and sugar in a saucepan. Add the chocolate, cream and milk and place over low heat. Cook, occasionally whisking with a balloon whisk, for 5 minutes or until chocolate melts and mixture is smooth. Remove from heat., Pour the chocolate custard mixture into the pastry case. Bake in oven for 20 minutes or until custard is just set. Remove from oven and set aside to cool completely. Place in the fridge to chill., Place on a serving plate. Top with raspberries and serve with thin cream.

name: Creamy pork fillet with brandy and prunes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) pitted prunes'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) brandy'}, {'quantity': '15', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pork fillet, trimmed, cut into 1cm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'French', 'name': 'shallots, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) light thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'heaped', 'name': 'tbsp jellied cranberry sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green round beans, steamed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'French', 'name': 'bread stick (baguette), to serve'}]
steps: Place prunes and brandy in a bowl. Set aside for 5 minutes to develop the flavours., Meanwhile, heat the butter and half the oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Season the pork. Add half the pork to the pan and stir for 1-2 minutes or until brown. Transfer to a bowl. Repeat with the remaining pork., Heat the remaining oil in the pan over medium-low heat. Add shallot and stir for 4 minutes or until soft. Stir in prune mixture. Cook for 1 minute or until reduced by half. Add cream and cranberry sauce. Stir for 2 minutes or until dissolved. Bring to a simmer. Add pork and stir for 3 minutes or until just cooked through. Divide among plates. Season and sprinkle with the chives. Serve with the beans and bread.

name: Orange chocolate and chilli mug cakes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(150g) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(25g) cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(75g) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground chilli'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(65g) dark chocolate chips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'grated orange rind'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(180ml) milk'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) orange juice'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Orange', 'name': 'slices, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Ice', 'name': '-cream, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chocolate', 'name': 'sauce, to serve'}]
steps: Combine the flour, cocoa powder, sugar, chilli and chocolate in a large bowl. Make a well in the centre. Combine the orange rind, oil, milk and orange juice in a jug and whisk until well combined. Pour the orange mixture into the centre of the flour mixture and whisk until well combined., Divide the mixture among for 1 1/3-cup (330ml) capacity microwave-safe mugs., Place the mugs on the outer edge of microwave plate and cook on high (100%) for 1 min 30 secs. Cook on high (100%) for a further 30 secs. Repeat until the mug cakes are puffed and tops are springy to touch. (It should take around 2 mins 30 secs in total.), Serve the mug cakes with the extra orange, ice-cream and chocolate sauce.

name: Minestra primavera
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'prosciutto, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) white wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'fresh peas, podded (to give 2 cups)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'broad beans, podded, blanched'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'asparagus, cut into 3cm lengths'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Grated', 'name': 'parmesan, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sourdough', 'name': 'bread, to serve'}]
steps: For chicken stock, place all ingredients in a stockpot, cover with 2L (8 cups) cold water and bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 1-2 hours, skimming the surface occasionally. Strain. Reserve 1L (4 cups) stock. (Remaining stock will keep in airtight containers for up to 1 week in the fridge or frozen for up to 3 months)., Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Cook onion and garlic, stirring, for 4-6 minutes until soft. Add prosciutto and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add flour and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Gradually stir in wine, then add 1 cup (250ml) reserved stock and simmer for 8 minutes or until thickened. Meanwhile, in a separate pan, bring remaining 3 cups (750ml) stock to the boil. Add peas and cook for 3 minutes. Squeeze broad beans from their skins, then add to the pan along with asparagus and cook for 2 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in wine mixture. Cool slightly., Whiz 1 cup (250ml) soup in a blender until smooth. Stir the puree through remaining soup, season and gently reheat., Divide soup among bowls, scatter with parmesan and serve with sourdough.

name: Croque monsieur strata
ingredient: [{'quantity': '550', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'loaf white sourdough bread, \u2028cut into 4cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'leftover ham, coarsely chopped \u2028(from glazed ham, see related recipe)'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) coarsely grated gruyère'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) milk'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh chives, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'herbs, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan forced. Grease a 19 x 29cm (base measurement) ovenproof dish well with butter. Spread half of the bread pieces over the base of the prepared dish. Top with three-quarters of the ham. Sprinkle with half of the cheeses. Top with the remaining bread pieces and scatter over the remaining ham., Whisk the eggs, milk, cream, mustard  and chives together in a large jug. Season. Pour the egg mixture evenly over the dish. Allow to stand for 30 minutes to soak. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Bake  for 1 hour or until golden and set (cover with foil if overbrowning). Stand for 10 minutes. Serve sprinkled with baby herbs.

name: Lemon chicken pasta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cornflour'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can light & creamy evaporated milk'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '400g) single chicken breast fillets, cut into thin strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'garlic cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) frozen peas, thawed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coarsely chopped fresh continental parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fettuccine'}]
steps: Combine the cornflour and 1 tablespoon of the evaporated milk in a medium bowl. Gradually stir in the remaining evaporated milk., Heat a large non-stick frying pan over high heat. Spray with olive oil spray to lightly coat. Add one-third of the chicken and cook, turning occasionally, for 2-3 minutes or until golden brown. Transfer to a heatproof bowl. Repeat, in 2 more batches, with the remaining chicken, reheating the pan between batches., Reduce heat to medium. Spray the base of the frying pan with olive oil spray to coat. Add the onion and cook, stirring, for 1-2 minutes or until soft. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until aromatic. Increase heat to medium-high. Add the milk mixture and peas and cook, stirring, for 2-3 minutes or until sauce boils and thickens., Add the chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, for 1 minute or until heated through. Remove from heat. Add the lemon rind, parsley and thyme. Taste and season with salt and pepper., Meanwhile, cook the fettuccine in a large saucepan of salted boiling water following packet directions or until al dente. Drain well and return to pan. Add the sauce to the fettuccine and gently toss to combine., Spoon the pasta among serving bowls and serve immediately.

name: Vodka with crushed lime & mint
ingredient: [{'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup, firmly packed) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '24', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'limes', 'name': ', quartered'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'vodka'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Soda', 'name': 'water, chilled, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Ice', 'name': 'cubes, to serve'}]
steps: Divide the sugar, mint and lime among serving glasses. Use the end of a rolling pin to gently pound until lime is crushed., Pour vodka among glasses. Top with soda water and ice. Serve.

name: Pea and ham pasta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'thin spaghetti pasta'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'thin prosciutto slices'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'French', 'name': 'shallot, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt frozen baby peas'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) Bulla Cooking Cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'baby rocket leaves'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pecorino', 'name': ', shaved, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Small', 'name': 'mint leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Cook the pasta in a large saucepan of boiling water following packet directions until pasta is al dente. Drain, reserving 80ml (1/3 cup) of the cooking liquid. Return the pasta to the saucepan., Heat oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook prosciutto, in 2 batches, for 1-2 minutes, turning, until crisp. Drain on paper towel, reserving the oil in the pan. Add shallot to the pan. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes until soft. Stir in peas and cook for 5 minutes or until bright green and tender., Reserve 1/2 cup pea mixture. Process remaining pea mixture, cream and 2 tbs of the cooking liquid in a food processor until almost smooth. Season. Add processed pea mixture, reserved pea mixture, rocket, chopped mint and remaining cooking liquid to pasta. Toss to combine., Divide the pasta mixture among serving plates. Break prosciutto into shards. Sprinkle over pasta. Serve topped with cheese and small mint leaves.

name: Waffle fingers with banana custard
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'store', 'name': 'bought waffles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'vanilla custard'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'ripe', 'name': 'bananas'}]
steps: Toast waffles following packet directions or until warm and slightly crisp. Cut into 2cm-thick pieces lengthways., Place coconut in a small saucepan over medium heat and cook, stirring, for 3-5 minutes or until toasted. Transfer to a plate., Add vanilla custard to the pan. Stir over medium-low heat for 2-3 minutes or until warm., Divide 4 ripe bananas, peeled, sliced, among serving bowls. Pour custard over the banana and sprinkle with coconut. Serve with waffle fingers.

name: Apple and strawberry juice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red apple'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 punnet) strawberries'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Ice', 'name': 'cubes'}]
steps: Halve 1 large red apple and remove the core. Cut each half into 4 wedges., Wash 250g (1 punnet) strawberries and remove hulls. Process the fruit in a juice extractor. Pour the juice over ice cubes in serving glasses. Serve immediately.

name: Buttermilk fried chicken burger
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Cajun seasoning'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) buttermilk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '300g Lilydale chicken breasts, halved horizontally'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'whole egg mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'tabasco sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'green chilli, seeded, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'cabbage, finely shredded'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'cabbage, finely shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'carrot, coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Juice', 'name': 'and zest of 1 lime'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vegetable', 'name': 'oil or canola oil, for deep frying'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'brioche', 'name': 'rolls, split'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'cos lettuce, leaves separated'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'dill', 'name': 'pickles, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Shoestring', 'name': 'fries, to serve'}]
steps: Whisk flour, Cajun seasoning, pepper, and salt in a shallow bowl. Combine buttermilk and eggs in another shallow bowl., Working with 1 piece at a time, coat chicken in flour mixture, shaking off excess. Dip in buttermilk, allowing excess to drip back into bowl. Coat again in flour mixture, shaking off excess. Set aside on a plate lined with baking paper., Combine garlic, mayonnaise, and tabasco in a small bowl. In a separate bowl, combine onion, chilli, cabbage, carrot and lime juice and zest., Pour oil into a large heavy frying pan to a depth of 1 ½ cm. Heat over medium heat until oil is hot (test with a small piece of bread – when bread bubbles and turns golden brown the oil is ready). Fry the chicken, in batches, until golden brown and cooked through, about 4 to 5 minutes per side. Transfer to a wire rack set over a baking tray; season lightly with extra salt., Spread rolls with spicy mayonnaise. Top with lettuce, pickles, cabbage slaw and chicken. Serve with shoestring fries.

name: White chocolate & raspberry self-saucing pudding
ingredient: [{'quantity': '190', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/4 cups) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2/3 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) milk'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eg', 'name': 'g'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'white chocolate, coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) frozen raspberries'}, {'quantity': '310', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/4 cups) lemonade'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla essence'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pure', 'name': 'icing sugar, to dust'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thickened', 'name': 'cream or ice-cream, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Sift the flour into a large bowl. Reserve 2 tablespoons of caster sugar. Stir the remaining caster sugar into the flour. Whisk the milk, butter and egg in a jug until combined. Add to the flour mixture. Stir until combined., Fold in chocolate and raspberries. Spoon the mixture into a 2L (8-cup) capacity baking dish. Smooth the surface. Sprinkle over the reserved sugar., Combine lemonade and vanilla in a jug. Pour mixture over the back of a spoon onto pudding mixture. Bake for 50-55 minutes or until a skewer inserted halfway into the centre comes out clean. Set aside for 10 minutes to cool slightly. Dust with icing sugar. Serve with cream or ice-cream.

name: Couscous and vegetable bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggplant, thinly sliced lengthways'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', thinly sliced lengthways'}, {'quantity': '410', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can diced tomatoes (with basil and garlic)'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can lentils, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, cut into 3mm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'uncooked couscous'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mozzarella cheese, sliced into rounds'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Grease a 6cm-deep, 21cm x 21cm baking dish., Heat a chargrill or non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Spray eggplant with oil. Cook, in batches, for 3 to 4 minutes each side or until browned and tender. Place on a plate. Spray zucchini with oil. Cook, in batches, for 2 to 3 minutes each side or until browned and tender. Place on a plate., Combine tomato and lentils in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper., Place one-third eggplant, in a single layer, in prepared dish. Top with one- third zucchini. Arrange half the pumpkin, in a single layer, over zucchini. Sprinkle over half the couscous. Dollop one-third tomato mixture over couscous. Repeat layers once. Arrange remaining eggplant, in a single layer, over tomato mixture. Top with remaining zucchini. Spread with remaining sauce. Arrange cheese over tomato mixture. Cover with foil., Bake for 30 minutes. Remove foil. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until cheese is melted and golden. Stand for 10 minutes. Serve.

name: One-pan creamy chicken pesto pasta bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Chicken Breast Fillets sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Massel chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'dried spiral pasta'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles pistachios'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'head broccoli, cut into small florets'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'perfect bakes grated cheese'}]
steps: Heat 1 tbsp of the oil1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil in a large, deep (25cm base) ovenproof frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook onion1 brown onion, finely chopped, stirring, for 5 minutes or until soft. Add chicken2 Chicken Breast Fillets sliced. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until chicken just changes colour. Add garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed. Cook for 30 seconds. Add stock1 cup chicken style liquid stock, 3/4 cup water and pasta3 cups dried spiral pasta. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Simmer for 10 minutes or until pasta is almost cooked., Meanwhile, place pistachio80g pistachios, basil1 cup fresh basil leaves and parsley3/4 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves in a small food processor. Process until finely chopped. Add remaining 2 tbs oil and lemon juice1/4 cup lemon juice. Process until well combined., Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan-forced., Add cream3/4 cup thickened cream and pesto to pasta mixture. Season well. Stir to combine. Stir in broccoli1 small head broccoli, cut into small florets and spinach100g baby spinach. Sprinkle with cheese1 1/2 cups perfect bakes grated cheese. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until cheese is golden. Serve with extra parsley, basil and lemon zest, if you like.

name: Teriyaki beef and eggplant with soba noodles
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sake'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'mirin seasoning'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': '-piece ginger, peeled, cut into matchsticks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggplant, halved lengthways, cut into 2cm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '300g each) Coles Finest Carbon Neutral Beef Porterhouse Steak'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen edamame or broad beans'}, {'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'soba noodles'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow peas, thinly sliced lengthways'}]
steps: Place soy sauce, sake, mirin and sugar in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 mins or until sugar dissolves and sauce thickens slightly. Remove from heat. Stir in ginger., Heat a chargrill on high. Brush both sides of eggplant with a little of the soy sauce mixture. Cook eggplant on grill for 2 mins each side or until lightly charred and caramelised. Transfer to a plate. Reserve half the remaining soy sauce mixture in a bowl. Brush beef with the remaining soy sauce mixture. Cook on grill for 2-3 mins each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil. Set aside for 5 mins to rest., Meanwhile, cook the edamame or broad beans in a saucepan of boiling water for 2 mins or until heated through. Refresh under cold water. Drain well. Peel and place in a large bowl., Cook the noodles in a large saucepan of boiling water for 3 mins. Add the snow peas. Cook for 1 min or until noodles and snow peas are tender. Drain well. Add to the edamame or broad beans in the bowl. Drizzle with the reserved soy sauce mixture and toss to combine., Thinly slice the beef. Divide the noodle mixture, beef and eggplant among serving bowls.

name: Chargrilled ham and vegetable salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '650', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Butternut pumpkin, peeled, deseeded, cut into 1.5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'crusty bread, torn into coarse pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemo', 'name': 'n'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, halved, deseeded, cut into 1cm-thick strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '125g pkt Hans Gourmet Monaco Deluxe Ham'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'endive lettuce, leaves separated, coarsely torn'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) baby rocket leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '200g punnet grape tomatoes, quartered'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) 99% Fat Free Caesar Dressing'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray with non-stick baking paper., Place pumpkin on tray. Spray with olive oil spray. Roast for 15 minutes. Add bread to tray and spray lightly with olive oil spray. Cook for a further 15 minutes or until both are golden., Meanwhile, use a zester to remove the rind from the lemon. (Alternatively, use a vegetable peeler to peel rind from lemon. Use a small sharp knife to remove white pith from the rind. Cut rind into very thin strips.), Cook beans in a saucepan of salted boiling water for 2 minutes or until bright green and tender crisp. Refresh under cold water. Drain., Preheat a chargrill on high. Spray with olive oil spray. Cook capsicum for 3 minutes each side or until charred. Transfer to a plate. Cook ham for 2 minutes each side or until charred., Place the lettuce, rocket, pumpkin, bread, beans, capsicum and tomato in a bowl. Toss to combine. Divide among serving bowls. Coarsely tear the ham. Top salad with ham and lemon rind. Drizzle over dressing to serve.

name: Fruity coconut gratin
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '820g can peach slices, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '415g can raspberries in syrup, drained'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) bought vanilla custard'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(about 5) Coconut Macaroons'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Spread the peach over the base of a 1.5L (6-cup) capacity ovenproof dish. Scatter over the raspberries., Pour the custard over the peach and raspberries. Crumble the macaroons over the custard., Bake in oven for 15 minutes or until the custard bubbles and the crumble is golden. Serve.

name: Poached chicken with braised cos and champ potatoes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '800g) chicken breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'white', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried rosemary'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'Massel salt reduced chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'cos lettuces, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen peas'}]
steps: Make champ potatoes: Cook potato in a large saucepan of boiling water for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain. Return to the pan. Mash until smooth. Add milk, onion, spinach and butter. Season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine., Meanwhile, heat oil in a large, deep frying pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken. Cook for 2 minutes each side or until light golden. Transfer to a plate., Reduce heat to medium. Add onion, garlic and rosemary. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until onion is tender. Return chicken to pan. Add stock. Cover. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Carefully transfer chicken to a chopping board. Thickly slice chicken. Add cos and peas to pan. Simmer for 3 minutes., Serve chicken with sauce, cos, peas and champ potatoes.

name: Apple pie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cornflour'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chilled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', separated'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Whipped', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}]
steps: Place flours, butter and 1/4 cup sugar in a food processor. Process until mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add egg yolk and 1/4 cup cold water. Process until pastry just comes together. Turn pastry onto a lightly floured surface. Knead gently until smooth. Wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until firm., Meanwhile, make apple filling: Place apples and 1/3 cup cold water in a baking classics saucepan. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, covered, for 5 to 7 minutes or until apples are tender. Drain. Return apples to pan. Stir in sugar, cinnamon and lemon juice. Set aside., Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Grease a 3cm-deep, 20cm (base) round glass or ceramic pie dish., Place two-thirds of the pastry between 2 sheets of baking paper. Roll out into a 30cm round. Line base and sides of prepared dish with pastry. Trim edges. Spoon in filling. Brush edge with a little eggwhite. Place remaining pastry between 2 sheets of baking paper. Roll out until large enough to cover dish. Cover filling with pastry. Press edges together. Trim excess., Make 2 cuts in top for steam to escape. Brush with remaining eggwhite. Sprinkle with remaining sugar. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until golden. Serve with cream.

name: Gluten-free rogan josh steak sandwiches
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'gluten-free rogan josh curry paste (see notes)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'canola oil'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'beef', 'name': 'sizzle steaks'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'Abbott’s Village Bakery Gluten-free Mixed Seeds Loaf'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain Greek-style yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, very thinly sliced into rounds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'carrots, peeled into long thin ribbons'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumbers, peeled into long thin ribbons'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'small fresh coriander sprigs'}]
steps: Preheat a large, non-stick chargrill pan over medium-high heat., Combine curry paste and 1/2 the oil in a large bowl. Add the steaks, rubbing to coat all over., Chargrill steaks, 2 at a time, for 1 minute each side or until browned and just cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Cover loosely with foil. Stand for 2 minutes to rest., Meanwhile, drizzle bread slices with remaining oil. Chargrill, in 2 batches, for 1 minute each side or until charred., Spread 4 slices of grilled bread with yoghurt. Top with onion, steak, carrot, cucumber and coriander sprigs. Top with remaining grilled bread slices. Serve.

name: Tomato and basil agnolotti
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt'}, {'quantity': '625', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh ricotta and spinach agnolotti pasta'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'parmesan cheese, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'basil leaves, finely shredded'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place tomatoes on tray. Spray with oil. Sprinkle with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes or until skins begin to split., Meanwhile, cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling, salted water for 5 minutes or until tender. Drain., Return pasta to pan over low heat. Add tomatoes, parmesan and basil. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Serve.

name: Creamed rice with cherries and meringue crumble
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '420g cans vanilla creamed rice'}, {'quantity': '425', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can stoneless black cherries, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(', 'name': '15g each) meringue nests, crushed'}]
steps: Pour rice into a saucepan. Heat over medium heat for 5 to 6 minutes or until it comes to a simmer. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, uncovered, for 8 to 10 minutes or until thick and creamy., Meanwhile, mash cherries lightly with a fork., Remove pan from heat. Add cherries to rice. Stir to combine. Spoon into serving bowls. Sprinkle with crushed meringue. Serve.

name: Tandoori meatballs with turmeric rice salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'basmati rice'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'turkey mince'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tandoori paste'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh coriander leaves, plus extra leaves to serve'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet golden supergreen salad kit (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Plain', 'name': 'Greek-style yoghurt, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mango', 'name': 'chutney, to serve'}]
steps: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add garlic and turmeric. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add rice. Stir to coat. Add 3 cups water. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Cook for 12 to 15 minutes or until rice is almost tender. Remove from heat. Stand, covered, for 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork to separate grains. Transfer to a large bowl to cool slightly., Meanwhile, place mince, breadcrumbs, egg, tandoori paste and 2 tablespoons coriander in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Mix well. Roll level tablespoons of mince mixture into balls., Heat remaining oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook meatballs, turning, for 7 to 8 minutes or until browned and cooked through., Add salad mix with dressing and almonds to rice. Add cucumber and remaining coriander. Toss to combine. Divide rice mixture among serving bowls. Top with meatballs, yoghurt and chutney. Sprinkle with extra coriander. Serve.

name: Tray-baked coq au vin
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.8', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'whole chicken, cut into 8 pieces'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'French', 'name': 'shallots, peeled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'bulbs, halved'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'thyme sprigs'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sliced pancetta'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Swiss brown mushrooms, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) white wine'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mashed', 'name': 'potato, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'parsley, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan forced. Place the chicken1.8kg whole chicken, cut into 8 pieces, shallots10 French shallots, peeled, garlic2 garlic bulbs, halved, thyme10 fresh thyme sprigs, pancetta100g sliced pancetta and mushrooms200g Swiss brown mushrooms, thickly sliced in a large, deep baking dish. Season. Drizzle with the oil2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil. Roast for 20 minutes or until chicken is starting to brown. Add  the wine250ml (1 cup) white wine and stock250ml (1 cup) chicken stock. Cook for  a further 20 minutes or until the  chicken is golden and tender., Divide the chicken mixture between serving plates. Whisk butter25g butter into the chicken juices and drizzle over the  chicken. Serve with mashed potatoMashed potato, to serve  and sprinkle with parsleyBaby parsley, to serve.

name: Triple-choc neenish-ish tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet McVitie’s Milk Chocolate Digestives'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted, cooled'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate (45% cocoa), chopped (see note)'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'white chocolate, chopped'}, {'quantity': '105', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) raspberry jam'}]
steps: Break up biscuits into a food processor and process until mixture resembles crumbs. Add the butter and process until well combined. Tip mixture into an 11 x 34cm fluted tart tin with removable base. Use the back of a spoon and a straight-sided glass to spread and press the biscuit mixture firmly over the base and up sides of the tin. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge to chill until firm. Spread jam over the base and return to the fridge until required., To make the mock cream, combine the sugar and 80ml (1/3 cup) water in a small saucepan. Stir over low heat (do not boil) until the sugar dissolves. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes or until slightly syrupy. Pour into a bowl and set aside to cool to room temperature., Meanwhile, place 1 tablespoon of water in a small microwave-safe bowl. Sprinkle with the gelatine and stir to combine. Microwave for 10 seconds (do not overheat). Use a fork to whisk until the gelatine dissolves. Cool to room temperature, then stir into the sugar syrup., Use electric beaters to beat the butter and vanilla in a bowl until creamy. With the motor running, add the sugar mixture a little at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat until very light and pale in colour. Dollop the cream over the jam in the tart shell, then spread evenly to cover. Smooth the surface. Place in the fridge for 20 minutes or until firm., Combine the dark chocolate with 60ml (¼ cup) of the cream in a microwave-safe bowl. Heat in the microwave in 30-second bursts until chocolate is just soft. Stir until melted and combined. You can also place the chocolate and cream in a heatproof bowl over a saucepan of simmering water (make sure the bowl doesn’t touch the water). Use a metal spoon to stir occasionally until the chocolate melts and mixture is smooth. Transfer mixture to a clean bowl to cool to a thick, spreadable consistency. Repeat with white chocolate and remaining cream (the white chocolate mixture will take longer to cool and thicken)., Spread the dark chocolate mixture over half the tart, lengthways. Place in the fridge until set. Repeat with white chocolate. Place in the fridge until set. Remove from the tart tin and cut into slices to serve.

name: Lasagne
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, halved, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'extra-lean beef mince'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) Vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '140g ctns tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried mixed herbs'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) fat-free milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'sheet', 'name': '(20 x 45cm) fresh lasagne'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) light shredded mozzarella'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'rocket, ends trimmed, washed, dried'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 230°C. Heat oil1 tbsp olive oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add onion1 brown onion, halved, finely chopped and mince500g extra-lean beef mince and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until mince changes colour. Add the stock250ml (1 cup) Vegetable stock, tomato paste2 x 140g ctns tomato paste and mixed herbs2 tsp dried mixed herbs. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes., Meanwhile, place flour1 1/2 tbsp plain flour in a saucepan and gradually stir in milk375ml (1 1/2 cups) fat-free milk. Place over medium heat and cook, stirring, until sauce thickens., Cut lasagne sheet1 sheet (20 x 45cm) fresh lasagne into 3 rectangles to fit a 12 x 22cm (base measurement) 1.25L (5-cup) capacity baking dish. Place 1 lasagne sheet, half the beef, 2 tablespoons sauce and 40g (1/3 cup) mozzarella in the dish. Repeat. Top with remaining lasagne sheet, sauce and mozzarella120g (1 cup) light shredded mozzarella. Bake in oven for 15 minutes. Serve with rocket1 bunch rocket, ends trimmed, washed, dried.

name: Bread & butter croissants with raspberry & chocolate
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pouring cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Toblerone milk chocolate, broken into pieces'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Bakery Mini Croissants'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': 'frozen', 'name': 'raspberries'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Icing', 'name': 'sugar, to dust, optional'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan forced. Grease four 250ml (1 cup) ovenproof dishes., Whisk the cream, caster sugar, vanilla and eggs in a large jug. Cut each croissant in half horizontally and then in half crossways. Place the croissants in the prepared dishes. Pour over the egg mixture and set aside for 10 minutes to soak. Place the chocolate and raspberries on top of and between the slices of croissant. Bake for 25 minutes or until golden and set. Dust with icing sugar, if desired.

name: Red onion jam
ingredient: [{'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(about 6) red onions, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup, firmly packed) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'white wine'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) balsamic vinegar'}]
steps: Heat the oil in a large heavy-based saucepan over medium heat. Cook the onion, stirring, for 2 minutes. Cover and reduce heat to low. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes or until the onion is soft., Add the sugar, wine and vinegar and bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook for 20 minutes or until the mixture thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a sterilised jar. Seal and invert for 2 minutes. Set aside to cool.

name: Apple cinnamon teacake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '65', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eg', 'name': 'g'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'self-raising flour, sifted'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'granny smith apple, cored, thinly sliced'}]
steps: Pre-heat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Grease a 4.5cm deep, 20cm round cake pan. Line base and side with baking paper., Using an electric mixer, beat butter, sugar, egg and vanilla together for 2 minutes or until combined. Stir in half the flour, then half the milk. Repeat with remaining flour and milk. Spoon mixture into prepared pan. Level top. Arrange apple slices on top., Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean. Stand in pan for 5 minutes. Turn, top-side up, onto a wire rack., Make topping: Combine cinnamon and sugar in a bowl. Brush hot cake with butter. Sprinkle with cinnamon mixture. Cool. Serve.

name: Chocolate hazelnut gateau
ingredient: [{'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '59g eggs, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cornflour'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'roasted hazelnuts, roughly chopped'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C?. Grease and line a 24cm (base) springform cake pan., Using an electric mixer, beat eggs and sugar on high speed for 8 to 10 minutes, or until pale and thick. Sift flour, cocoa and cornflour over egg mixture., Using a large metal spoon, gently fold ingredients together until just combined. Fold in milk. Spoon mixture into prepared cake pan., Bake for 40 to 45 minutes, or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Turn onto a wire rack to cool., Make ganaches: Place milk chocolate and cream into a heatproof bowl over a saucepan of simmering water. Stir constantly with a metal spoon until smooth. Remove from heat. Refrigerate until thick enough to spread. Repeat step 5 with dark chocolate and cream., Make petals: Line a baking tray with baking paper. Use a small brush to paint petals with eggwhite. Sprinkle with sugar. Place onto tray until set., Using a serrated knife, slice cake into 4 even rounds. Place bottom round onto a serving plate. Spread with one-third of the milk chocolate ganache. Sprinkle with one-third of the hazelnuts. Repeat twice more, finishing with cake. Spread top and sides of cake with dark chocolate ganache. Decorate with sugared petals.

name: Lamb pide with beetroot dip
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lamb mince'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'shallots', 'name': ', trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh mint'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '225g can sliced beetroot, drained'}, {'quantity': '130', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) natural yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'Turkish', 'name': 'bread rolls'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the mince and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up any lumps, for 3 minutes or until the mince changes colour. Add the shallot, garlic, tomato paste, lemon rind, lemon juice, 2 teaspoons of cumin and 1 teaspoon of coriander. Cook, stirring, for 3-4 minutes or until mince is cooked through. Stir in the mint. Set aside to cool slightly., Place the beetroot, yoghurt, remaining cumin and remaining coriander in the bowl of a food processor. Process until smooth., Cut an oval piece from the top of each bread roll to make a shell. Reserve bread. Place bread shells on a large baking tray. Fill with mince mixture. Add the reserved bread to the tray. Bake for 5 minutes or until crisp. Thickly slice. Serve pide with beetroot dip, lemon wedges and reserved bread for dipping.

name: Roast beef with horseradish labne and spicy tomato relish
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'beef Scotch fillet roast'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh rosemary, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh thyme, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baguette', 'name': ', to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mixed', 'name': 'salad leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Make Horseradish labne: Combine yoghurt and horseradish cream in a bowl. Line a large sieve with 2 layers of paper towel, allowing the sides to overhang. Place sieve over a large bowl. Spoon yoghurt mixture into sieve. Fold over excess paper towel to cover. Refrigerate for 24 hours or up to 2 days to strain., Make spicy tomato relish: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Place tomato and chilli on a baking tray. Drizzle with 1/2 the oil. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden and tender. Remove and discard tomato skins. Chop chilli. Heat remaining oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion and garlic, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add tomato, chilli, vinegar and sugar. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until thick. Set aside to cool., Place beef in a baking dish. Drizzle over oil. Season with pepper. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon each of rosemary and thyme. Roast for 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer beef to a plate. Cover with foil. Rest for 15 minutes. Thinly slice., Sprinkle beef with remaining herbs. Serve on baguette with labne, relish and salad.

name: Broccoli, potato and blue cheese soup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'leek', 'name': ', pale section only, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brushed', 'name': 'potato, peeled, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'head broccoli, stems included, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(1L) vegetable stock or chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Castello blue cheese, crumbled'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Small', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Toasted', 'name': 'baguette slices, to serve'}]
steps: Heat 2 teaspoons of the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion, leek, potato and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 5 mins or until onion softens. Add the wine and bring to the boil. Cook for 2 mins or until wine reduces by half., Add the broccoli and stock. Increase heat to high and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 mins or until broccoli is very tender. Remove from heat and set aside for 10 mins to cool slightly., Add half the cheese to the broccoli mixture. Place in a blender and blend until smooth. Return to the saucepan and place over low heat. Season with salt and pepper., Divide the soup among serving bowls. Top with remaining cheese and the parsley. Drizzle with remaining oil. Serve with the baguette slices.

name: Mexican loaded chips
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'large Maris Piper, Mr Chips or Daisy Chipper potatoes'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Australian No Added Hormones 3 Star Beef Mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt taco spice mix'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) mild salsa'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(120g) grated tasty cheddar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomato, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocado', 'name': ', seeded, peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80g) sour cream'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander leaves'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a large baking tray with baking paper., Use a fork to prick the potatoes all over. Place on a plate lined with baking paper. Cook in the microwave on high (100%) for 10 mins or until almost tender. Transfer to a clean work surface. Cut potatoes lengthways into thick wedges. Pat dry with paper towel. Arrange in a single layer on the lined tray. Lightly spray potato wedges with olive oil spray. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake for 45 mins or until potato wedges are golden and tender., Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large frying pan over high heat. Add the mince and half the onion and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up any lumps, for 5 mins or until mince changes colour. Add the taco spice mix and cook for 1 min. Add the salsa and 1/2 cup (125ml) water. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook, stirring occasionally, for 3-5 mins or until mixture thickens., Sprinkle the potato wedges with two-thirds of the cheddar. Bake for 5 mins or until cheddar is melted. Spoon over the mince mixture. Sprinkle with the remaining cheddar and bake for 5 mins or until cheddar is melted., Combine the tomato, avocado, lime juice and remaining onion in a small bowl. Season. Spoon over the potato wedges and top with a dollop of sour cream. Serve sprinkled with coriander leaves.

name: Gluhwein
ingredient: [{'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3/4 cup) orange juice'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'orange', 'name': ', rind peeled'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'sticks'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'whole', 'name': 'cloves'}, {'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'L', 'name': '(6 cups) red wine'}]
steps: Combine orange juice, sugar, orange rind, cinnamon and cloves in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir for 3-4 minutes or until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. Cover. Set aside for 30 minutes to develop flavours., Add wine. Place pan over low heat and cook until just before boiling. Pour into heatproof glasses.

name: Marinated Dijon rice salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2/3 cup) brown rice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'white balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': '½ red onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, trimmed, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'zucchini, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can no-added-salt lentils, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can no-added-salt four bean mix, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, quartered'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'feta, finely chopped'}]
steps: Cook the rice140g (2/3 cup) brown rice in a large saucepan of boiling water for 25 minutes or until tender. Drain well. Set aside to cool slightly., Meanwhile, place the lemon juice2 tbsp fresh lemon juice, balsamic1 tbsp white balsamic vinegar, oil1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil and mustard2 tsp Dijon mustard in a small jar. Cover with a tight-fitting lid and shake until well combined., Place the rice and onion½ red onion, finely chopped in a large bowl. Add half the dressing and stir until combined. Set aside for 10 minutes to allow flavours to develop., While the rice and onion is standing, cook the green beans200g green beans, trimmed, sliced in a steamer basket over a saucepan of simmering water for 2 minutes or until bright green and just tender, adding the zucchini1 large zucchini, finely chopped in the last 30 seconds of cooking. Refresh under cold running water and drain., Add the green beans, zucchini, lentils400g can no-added-salt lentils, rinsed, drained, four bean mix400g can no-added-salt four bean mix, rinsed, drained, tomato150g cherry tomatoes, quartered and feta80g feta, finely chopped to the rice mixture. Add the remaining dressing and gently toss until combined. Season and serve

name: Pesto salmon filo parcels
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'leek', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'filo pastry'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '120g each) skinless salmon fillets'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Barilla Pesto Genovese'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mixed', 'name': 'salad, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan forced. Line a large baking tray with baking paper. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil and half the butter in a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add the leek and garlic, and cook, stirring, for 3-4 minutes or until the leek is soft and lightly golden. Add the spinach and cook, stirring, for 1-2 minutes or until just wilts. Remove from heat and drain any excess liquid., Melt remaining oil and butter in a small dish in the microwave for 20 seconds on high. Place one sheet of filo on a clean work surface. Brush lightly with the oil mixture. Top with another sheet. Fold in half crossways. Repeat with the remaining pastry sheets and oil mixture., Divide the leek and spinach mixture among the pastry rectangles. Top with a piece of salmon. Spoon 1 tablespoon of pesto onto each piece of salmon. Bring the long pastry edges together and fold to create a seam. Tuck ends in to create a parcel. Place on the lined tray. Brush the pastry with the remaining oil mixture. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until puffed and golden. Serve with mixed salad.

name: Pollo alla diavola
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': 'thyme sprigs, half chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'rosemary, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) extra virgin olive oil, plus extra to drizzle'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) white wine'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Juice', 'name': 'of 1 lemon, plus 1 extra lemon, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '500g spatchcocks, butterflied (see Notes)'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby green beans'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh marjoram, chopped'}]
steps: Combine the garlic, chilli, chopped lemon thyme, rosemary, oil, wine and lemon juice and slices together in a bowl. Place the spatchcocks in a shallow dish, then pour over marinade. Cover with plastic wrap and chill for at least 1 hour., Preheat the oven to 200C and bring the spatchcocks to room temperature., Drain spatchcocks from the marinade. Place on a large baking tray and top with the lemon slices and remaining lemon thyme sprigs. Cook for 35-40 minutes until golden and juices run clear when the thickest part of the thigh is pierced with a skewer. Remove from oven and rest, loosely covered with foil, for 5 minutes., Meanwhile, blanch green beans in boiling salted water for 5 minutes or until tender. Drain, then drizzle with a little oil and sprinkle over marjoram., Halve spatchcocks and divide among plates. Serve with the green beans.

name: Warm spiced wine
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'L', 'name': '(6 cups) dry red wine'}, {'quantity': '225', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) white sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'whole', 'name': 'dried dessert figs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'granny', 'name': 'smith apple, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'orange', 'name': ', quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '7cm cinnamon stick'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'vanilla', 'name': 'bean, split'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'whole', 'name': 'cloves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brandy'}]
steps: Combine wine, sugar, figs, apple, orange, cinnamon, vanilla and cloves in a large saucepan and bring to the boil over high heat. Gently boil, stirring occasionally, for 12 minutes or until mixture thickens slightly., Remove from heat. Stir in brandy and cover with foil. Set aside for 10 minutes to develop the flavours., Strain through a sieve into a serving bowl. Ladle into glasses and serve.

name: Creamy mushroom gnocchi
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed mushrooms (such as cup, brown or shiitake), thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'kale & baby spinach leaves'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'wholegrain mustard'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt potato gnocchi'}]
steps: Spray a non-stick frying pan with olive oil spray. Heat over high heat. Add the mushroom400g mixed mushrooms (such as cup, brown or shiitake), thinly sliced and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 mins or until the mushroom begins to brown. Add the kale and spinach120g kale & baby spinach leaves, cream300ml thickened cream and mustard1 tbsp wholegrain mustard and cook, stirring, for 2-3 mins or until the spinach just wilts., Meanwhile, cook the gnocchi500g pkt potato gnocchi in a saucepan of boiling water following packet directions. Drain well., Add the gnocchi to the mushroom mixture in the pan and carefully toss to combine. Season., Divide the gnocchi mixture evenly among serving bowls.

name: Lemon sour cream butter cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, softened, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(220g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', rind finely grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Australian Free Range Eggs, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(300g) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(120g) sour cream'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'zest, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C. Grease a 10cm x 20cm loaf pan and line the base and 2 long sides with baking paper, allowing the sides to overhang., Use an electric mixer to beat butter, sugar and lemon rind in a bowl until pale and creamy. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the flour, sour cream and lemon juice, in alternating batches, stirring until just combined. Spoon into the prepared pan and smooth the surface., Bake for 50 mins-1 hour or until a skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 mins before turning onto a wire rack to cool completely., To make the lemon icing, stir the icing sugar and lemon juice in a bowl until a smooth paste forms. Spread over the top of the cake, allowing it to drizzle down the sides. Set aside for 30 mins to set. Sprinkle with lemon zest.

name: Spicy African-style vegetable stew
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'baby eggplant, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, halved, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '175', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet vine sweet minicaps, halved, seeded (see Notes)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', halved, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'African grill spice mix (see Notes)'}, {'quantity': '410', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can tomato puree'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', halved, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves, chopped plus extra leaves to serve'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chilli, seeded, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'flaked almonds, toasted'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain Greek-style yoghurt'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Couscous', 'name': ', to serve'}]
steps: Quarter eggplant lengthways. Cut in half crossways., Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion, minicaps, carrot and eggplant. Cook, stirring, for 10 minutes or until vegetables soften. Add spice mix. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until fragrant., Add tomato puree and 1 cup water. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add zucchini. Stir to combine. Simmer for a further 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender and sauce thickens. Stir in coriander., Sprinkle with chilli, extra coriander and almonds. Serve with yoghurt and couscous.

name: Chicago deep-dish pizza
ingredient: [{'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 1/2 cups) Anchor Lighthouse Bread & Pizza Plain Flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': '(7g/1 sachet) dried yeast'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Large', 'name': 'pinch of caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) warm water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', trimmed, thinly sliced lengthways'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh ricotta'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Polenta', 'name': ', to dust'}, {'quantity': '65', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) bought tomato pesto'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) Perfect Italiano Pizza Plus cheese'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'slices prosciutto, torn lengthways into thick strips'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'bought chargrilled capsicum, cut into 1.5cm strips'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': 'cherry', 'name': 'truss tomatoes'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'spinach leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Combine flour, yeast and sugar in a bowl. Stir in salt and make a well in the centre. Add water and oil and stir to combine. Use your hands to bring dough together in the bowl., Turn the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 10 minutes or until smooth and elastic. Spray a bowl with oil. Add the dough and turn to coat. Cover with a damp tea towel and set aside in a warm place for 40 minutes or until the dough doubles in size., Meanwhile, spray a large non-stick frying pan with oil. Cook half the zucchini for 2-3 minutes each side or until tender. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel. Repeat with remaining zucchini. Combine the ricotta, basil, chive and lemon rind in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper., Punch down the dough with your fist. Knead for 30 seconds or until the dough is original size. Divide the dough into 2 portions. Cover 1 portion with a damp tea towel. Roll out the other portion to about 24cm., Preheat oven to 230°C. Spray a deep, 20cm (base measurement) ovenproof frying pan with oil. Sprinkle the pan with polenta, shaking off any excess. Place the dough over the base and 1cm up the side of the pan., Spread the dough with half the pesto, leaving a 1cm border. Sprinkle with one-quarter of the cheese. Top with half the zucchini, half the prosciutto and half the capsicum. Top with half the ricotta mixture and half the tomato. Bake for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with one-third of the remaining cheese. Bake for 5 minutes or until the base is crisp. Repeat with the remaining dough, sauce, cheese, zucchini, prosciutto, capsicum, ricotta mixture and tomato to make a second pizza. Serve with spinach leaves.

name: Crispy-skinned salmon
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '200g each) salmon fillets, skin on'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'salt flakes'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'chat potatoes, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salad', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Place salmon, skin side up, on a plate. Drizzle with oil. Rub salt into skin., Heat a large, non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add salmon, skin side down. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until skin is crisp. Turn. Cook, covered for 4 to 5 minutes for medium or until cooked to your liking., Serve with potatoes and salad leaves.
nutrition: calories: 480, fat: 30.3g, carbs: nan, protein: 49.4g, servings: 4

name: Chargrilled vegetable and haloumi salad
