ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'zucchini, trimmed, cut into 1cm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicums, cut into 2cm-wide strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': '(450g) eggplant, trimmed, quartered lengthways, cut into 1cm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onions, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'haloumi, cut into 8 slices'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach leaves'}]
steps: Place zucchini, capsicum, eggplant and onion in a large bowl. Add 1/4 cup of oil and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Whisk together vinegar and 2 tablespoons of remaining oil. Set aside., Preheat a chargrill pan on high heat. Grill vegetables for 2 to 3 minutes each side or until tender and lightly charred. Remove to a plate and set aside. Return pan to high heat. Brush haloumi slices with remaining oil. Grill haloumi for 1 to 2 minutes each side or until lightly charred., Place vegetables, haloumi and spinach in a large bowl. Pour over reserved dressing. Toss to combine. Divide salad between serving plates. Season with pepper. Serve.

name: Hazelnut pinwheels
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Melted', 'name': 'butter, to grease'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) whole hazelnuts'}, {'quantity': '175', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', separated'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar, extra'}, {'quantity': '155', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) chocolate hazelnut spread (Nutella brand)'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Brush a 24 x 30cm (base measurement) Swiss roll pan with melted butter to lightly grease. Line with non-stick baking paper, cutting to fit the corners., Spread hazelnuts evenly over a baking tray and cook in preheated oven for 5 minutes or until toasted. Place in a clean tea towel and rub to remove skins. Finely chop. Set aside., Use an electric beater to beat sugar and egg yolks in a bowl until thick and pale. Use a metal spoon to fold flour and hazelnuts into the egg mixture., Use an electric beater to whisk egg whites in a clean, dry bowl until soft peaks form. Use a metal spoon to fold egg whites into hazelnut mixture. Spoon into prepared pan and bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Remove from oven and cover with a clean tea towel. Set aside for 30 minutes to cool. Remove baking paper from cake., Meanwhile, use an electric beater to beat cream until soft peaks form., Cut a piece of non-stick baking paper slightly larger than the cake. Sprinkle paper with the extra sugar. Place cake onto the paper. Spread chocolate hazelnut spread and cream over the top. Use a serrated knife to trim edges. Starting with a long edge closest to you, firmly roll to form a log. Wrap the baking paper around the log and place, seam-side down, on a tray. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 30 minutes to chill. Slice to serve.

name: Thai green curry with mussels
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'coriander'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'stalk', 'name': 'lemongrass'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'green chilli'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'pot-ready mussels (see note)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': 's'}]
steps: To make rice, heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add rice and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until coated. Add 500ml (2 cups) water and coconut milk, and bring to a simmer, stirring. Cover with a tight-fitting lid, reduce heat to low and cook for 10 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat and stand, covered, for 10 minutes., Meanwhile, wash coriander. Roughly chop half the coriander stalks with garlic, ginger, white part of lemongrass, 3 spring onions and chilli, then process in a food processor to a paste., Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add paste and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until fragrant. Add coconut milk, sugar and fish sauce. Increase heat to high and bring to the boil. Add mussels, cover with a lid and cook, shaking pan occasionally, for 5 minutes or until mussels open., Squeeze over juice from limes and tear over coriander leaves. Thinly slice remaining spring onions on the diagonal and scatter over mussels. Using a fork, fluff up rice and serve immediately with mussel curry.

name: Baked salmon in sauce Provencal
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onions, halved, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely shredded basil, plus extra leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': '225', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) pitted kalamata olives, halved'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '220g pieces salmon fillet, pin-boned, skinned'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'green beans and'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'roasted', 'name': 'Chat potatoes, to serve'}]
steps: Heat oil in a large saucepan over high heat. Add garlic and onions, and cook, stirring, for 4 minutes or until onions have softened. Add wine and cook for 5 minutes or until reduced by half. Add tomato paste and cook, stirring, for 1 minute, then add canned tomatoes, basil and two-thirds of the olives. Stir to combine and season with salt and pepper. Bring to the boil, then remove pan from heat., Preheat oven to 200C. Pour sauce Provençal into a deep, 23cm x 30cm ovenproof dish. Place salmon in sauce, then cover loosely with foil. Bake for 15 minutes or until fish is just cooked. Stand for 5 minutes before serving., Divide salmon among plates, spoon over sauce and scatter with remaining olives and extra basil. Serve with green beans and roasted chat potatoes.

name: Tortilla
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'desiree potatoes, peeled, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}]
steps: Place potatoes, onions and oil in a deep, 22cm (base) non-stick frying pan over low heat. Cook for 20 minutes or until potatoes tender but not coloured. Remove from heat., Lightly beat eggs in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Pour over potato mixture. Working quickly, shake pan to distribute egg evenly., Increase heat to medium and cook for 5 minutes or until partially set. Preheat grill on medium. Place frying pan under grill and cook further 5 minutes or until set and lightly golden. Serve.

name: Mexican potatoes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'sebago potatoes, peeled, cut into 2cm cubes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': 'Mutti Polpa Finely Chopped Tomatoes 400g'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'COON Mexican style shredded cheese'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander leaves'}]
steps: Preheat oven 180°C. Place potatoes in a large saucepan. Cover with cold water. Bring to the boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium and simmer, partially covered, for 5 to 6 minutes or until just tender. Drain., Heat oil and butter in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add garlic, chilli and potatoes. Cook for 5 to 10 minutes or until potatoes begin to turn golden. Stir in tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper and bring to the boil., Spoon potato mixture into a 6-cup capacity, 5cm deep, 15cm x 24cm (base) baking dish., Sprinkle with cheese and bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until potatoes are tender and cheese is golden and melted. Sprinkle with coriander and serve.

name: Crispy salmon strips with saffron mayo
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Oil', 'name': 'for deep frying'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'whole salmon fillet, skinless'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}]
steps: . Heat oil on medium in a deep heavy pot or a deep fryer. Slice the salmon fillet into 2.5 cm wide strips (approx. 12 strips). Place the flour onto a plate to prepare coating the salmon strips. Place the egg in a separate bowl. To make the crispy coating, place the panko bread crumbs, Mil Lel Parmesan Cheese, dill and cracked pepper into a shallow bowl and combine well., Dip each salmon strip into the flour, shaking off any excess. Then dip into the egg mix, finish by placing each strip into the coating mix. Press firmly to coat well., Fry the strips for 2-3 minutes or until desired doneness. Fry in batches, and place on a tray lined with paper towels., To make the mayo, place the saffron threads and the warm water into a small mixing bowl and allow to hydrate. Then add the remainder of the ingredients and mix to combine well., To serve, place greens on a serving platter and top with the salmon strips and shaved radish. Serve with the mayo on the side to retain the crispy coating.

name: Lamb, sweet potato and fetta salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sweet potato, peeled and sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'salt', 'name': 'and cracked black pepper'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'roma', 'name': 'tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'cooked lamb, warmed'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Greek fetta, roughly crumbled'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 190°C. Place the sweet potato on a baking tray lined with non-stick baking paper and drizzle with a little olive oil, salt and pepper. Cook for 10 minutes., Add the tomatoes to the baking tray, drizzle with a little more oil, and season with salt and pepper. Cook for a further 15 minutes or until the sweet potato and tomato is tender. Remove, set aside and keep warm., Combine the 2 tablespoons of olive oil and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper to taste., To serve, arrange the sweet potato and tomatoes on serving plates along with the lamb, rocket and fetta. Drizzle with dressing and serve.

name: Christmas cheer
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'passionfruit', 'name': ', halved'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'peach schnapps'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'vodka'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chilled cranberry juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ice cubes'}]
steps: Strain passionfruit pulp to remove seeds. Place half each of the schnapps, vodka, cranberry juice, passionfruit juice and ice in a cocktail shaker. Cover and shake well. Strain mixture into 2 glasses. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Serve.

name: Two-tone chocolate mousse
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '200g pkt dark cooking chocolate, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', at room temperature, separated'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'good-quality milk chocolate, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Double', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'White', 'name': 'chocolate, shaved, to serve'}]
steps: Use a clean electric beater to beat the thickened cream in a medium bowl until firm peaks form., Place the dark chocolate in a small heatproof bowl over a saucepan half-filled with simmering water (make sure the bowl doesn't touch the water). Stir with a metal spoon until chocolate melts. Remove from heat. Stir in 2 egg yolks (the mixture will become firm)., Divide the cream into 2 equal portions. Set aside 1 portion. Use a large metal spoon to stir half of 1 cream portion into the dark chocolate mixture until well combined. Add the remaining half and fold to combine. Repeat with the milk chocolate and the remaining egg yolks and cream., Use an electric beater to beat the egg whites in a large clean, dry bowl until soft peaks form. Gradually add the sugar, 1 tablespoonful at a time, beating constantly until the sugar dissolves and the mixture is thick and glossy., Fold half the egg white mixture into dark chocolate mixture until just combined. Fold the remaining egg white mixture into the milk chocolate mixture until just combined. Spoon the dark chocolate mixture among four 250ml (1-cup) capacity serving glasses. Top with the milk chocolate mixture., Place on a tray. Cover. Place in fridge for 3 hours or until set. Top with double cream and shaved white chocolate to serve.

name: Baked chickpea & lemon falafel with tahini dressing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'bicarbonate of soda'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Zest', 'name': 'and juice of 1 lemon'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans chickpeas, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil, plus extra to brush'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(90g) tahini'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'rocket or baby spinach leaves'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'punnet mixed heirloom tomatoes, halved'}]
steps: To make falafel, whiz cumin, coriander, garlic, flour, bicarbonate of soda, lemon zest, chickpeas, parsley and half the onion in a food processor to a coarse paste., Using 2 tablespoonfuls mixture for each falafel, form into 12 walnut-sized balls., Cover and chill for 30 minutes to firm up., Preheat the oven to 200C and line a baking tray with baking paper., Place falafel on the baking tray. Press the tops to flatten slightly, then brush with extra oil. Bake, turning halfway through, for 25 minutes or until golden., Remove and set aside to cool slightly., Meanwhile, to make the tahini dressing, whisk oil, tahini, honey, lemon juice and 2 tbs water together in a bowl. Season and set aside until ready to serve., Combine rocket, tomato and remaining onion on a platter. Top with cooled falafel and serve with the tahini dressing.

name: Individual baked pumpkin, feta and leek risottos
ingredient: [{'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'sage leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'leek', 'name': ', white part only, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, peeled, seeded, cut into 1cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(220g) arborio rice'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(750ml) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'toasted pine nuts'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely shredded sage'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fetta, crumbled'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Melt the butter40g butter in a medium frying pan over medium heat until foaming. Add the sage leaves8 fresh sage leaves and cook for 1 minute or until crisp. Use tongs to transfer to a plate. Add the leek1 leek, white part only, thinly sliced, garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed and pumpkin200g butternut pumpkin, peeled, seeded, cut into 1cm pieces and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until leek softens. Remove from heat., Spoon the leek mixture evenly among four 1 1/2 cup (375ml) ramekins. Divide the rice1 cup (220g) arborio rice evenly among ramekins. Pour over the wine1/2 cup (125ml) dry white wine and stock3 cups (750ml) chicken stock and gently stir to combine. Place on a baking tray and cover each dish with foil or a lid., Bake in preheated oven, stirring occasionally, for 30-35 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender yet firm to the bite. Remove from oven., Add pine nuts2 tbsp toasted pine nuts and sage1 tbsp finely shredded sage to each risotto and gently stir until just combined. Add the feta50g fetta, crumbled and stir until just combined. Top with fried sage leaves and serve immediately.

name: Fried eggplant slices with Sicilian pesto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '115', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/4 cups) dried breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '350g) eggplant, cut lengthways into 2mm thick slices'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Light', 'name': 'olive oil, to shallow-fry'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Rocket', 'name': '& parmesan salad, to serve'}]
steps: To make pesto, process tomato, almonds and garlic in a food processor until coarsely chopped. Add basil, parsley and chilli flakes. Process until finely chopped. With the motor running, add oil in a slow, steady stream. Transfer to a bowl. Stir in pecorino. Season., Place flour in a dish. Place egg in a separate dish. Place breadcrumbs on a plate. Coat eggplant in flour. Dip into egg, then into breadcrumbs, pressing to coat., Add oil to a frying pan to reach a depth of 1cm. Heat over medium-high heat. Cook eggplant, in 3 batches, for 1 minute each side or until golden. Serve with pesto and salad.

name: Bacon mac and cheese zucchini slice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'macaroni'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'middle', 'name': 'bacon rashers, trimmed, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1 3/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'zucchini, grated'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated tasty cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mixed', 'name': 'salad, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan-forced. Grease a medium baking dish., Cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling salted water until al dente, adding peas during last minute of cooking. Drain., Meanwhile, heat oil in a medium frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook bacon for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until crisp. Drain on paper towel., Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add flour. Cook, stirring for 1 minute or until mixture bubbles. Remove from heat. Gradually add milk, stirring constantly until smooth. Return to medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly until mixture bubbles and thickens. Add parmesan and 1/4 cup tasty cheese. Stir until smooth. Stir in egg., Combine pasta mixture, white sauce, zucchini and half of the bacon in large bowl. Season. Spoon into prepared dish. Top with remaining tasty cheese. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until cheese is golden. Stand 15 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining bacon and basil. Serve with salad.

name: Green tea ice cream
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'pure (thin) cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Chinese green tea leaves (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(220g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'yolks'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'white chocolate, chopped'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Edible', 'name': 'dried rose petals, to garnish (see note)'}]
steps: Place pure cream, tea and 1/4 cup (55g) sugar in a pan over low heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Increase heat to medium and bring to just below boiling point. Remove from heat and stand for 1 hour., Strain infused cream through a sieve into a clean pan, pressing down on the tea., Return to medium heat and bring to just below boiling point. Remove from heat., Beat yolks and remaining 3/4 cup (165g) sugar with electric beaters until thick and pale. Stir hot cream mixture into yolk mixture, then return to a clean pan. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, for 5-6 minutes until thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Transfer to a bowl and cover the surface with plastic wrap. Chill. Beat thickened cream until soft peaks, then fold into the cooled custard. Churn in an ice cream machine according to manufacturer’s instructions. (Alternatively, pour mixture into a shallow container and freeze for 2 hours or until frozen at edges., Beat with electric beaters, then refreeze. Repeat 2 or 3 times.) Transfer to a plastic container and freeze until firm., Meanwhile, line 2 baking trays with lightly greased foil. Place white and dark chocolate in separate bowls set over pans of simmering water (don’t let the bowls touch the water), stirring until smooth. Pour onto separate lined trays and scatter rose petals over the white chocolate. Chill, then break into shards and set aside. Scoop ice cream into bowls, garnish with the chocolate shards and serve.

name: Fennel-roasted twice-cooked pork belly
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt flakes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fennel seeds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '800g each) pieces pork belly, scored'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onions, sliced into thick rings'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'fresh rosemary sprigs'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'apple sauce, to serve, optional'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 160C/140C fan forced. Place the salt3 tsp sea salt flakes and fennel seeds1 tsp fennel seeds in a mortar and pound with a pestle until combined. Rub the salt mixture over the scored rind of the pork2 (about 800g each) pieces pork belly, scored, rubbing well into the cuts., Place the onion2 brown onions, sliced into thick rings and rosemary4 large fresh rosemary sprigs in a baking dish. Top with the pork and pour the stock500ml (2 cups) chicken stock around the pork in the pan. Cover with a piece of baking paper and seal the dish tightly with foil. Roast for 3 hours or until pork is very tender., Transfer the pork to a tray. Set aside to cool. Place a sheet of baking paper on top of the pork. Top with a heavy tray, then some cans to weigh it down. Place in the fridge overnight., Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan forced. Cut the pork into squares. Place on a baking tray. Roast for 25-30 minutes or until golden and crackled. Serve with apple sauce apple sauce, to serve, optional, if using.

name: Mexican bowl with turmeric fish and spicy mango salsa
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'mango', 'name': ', cheeks removed, flesh chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh coriander, plus extra leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'fresh red chillies, deseeded, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '125g firm white fish fillets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can black beans, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'trimmed kale, chopped'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) cooked quinoa, warmed'}]
steps: Combine the mango, coriander, lime juice and half the chilli in a bowl. Set aside. Dust the fish fillets with the turmeric to lightly coat., Heat 2 tsp oil in a large non-stick frying pan or wok over medium-high heat. Cook the garlic and remaining chilli, stirring, for 1 minute or until aromatic. Add the beans and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until warmed through. Add the kale and use tongs to toss for 2 minutes or until just wilted. Cover to keep warm., Heat the remaining 2 tsp oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook the fish for 2-3 minutes each side or until golden and cooked through., Divide the quinoa among serving bowls. Top with the kale mixture, fish and mango salsa. Serve sprinkled with extra coriander.

name: Tomato & onion salad with tamarind
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'tamarind puree'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'hot water'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'fresh green chilli, deseeded, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves, coarsely chopped'}]
steps: Combine the tamarind puree, sugar and water in a smallbowl. Taste and season with salt., Combine the tomato, cucumber, onion and chilli in a mediumbowl. Add the tamarind mixture and toss to combine., Add the coriander and stir until just combined. Serve.

name: Flourless chocolate cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Melted', 'name': 'reduced-fat dairy spread, to grease'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) hot water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'instant coffee powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'boiling water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '100g pkt almond meal'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', separated'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Strawberries', 'name': ', washed, sliced, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Brush a round 22cm (base measurement) cake pan with melted dairy spread to lightly grease. Line the base with non-stick baking paper., Combine the cocoa powder and hot water in a medium bowl. Combine the instant coffee powder and boiling water in a cup. Add the coffee to the cocoa mixture and stir until combined., Add almond meal, sugar and egg yolks to cocoa mixture, and stir until well combined., Use an electric beater to whisk egg whites in a clean, dry bowl until soft peaks form. Use a metal spoon to fold a spoonful of egg whites into cocoa mixture until combined. Gently fold in remaining egg whites until just combined., Pour mixture into prepared pan. Place cake pan in a roasting pan. Pour enough boiling water into the roasting pan to reach two-thirds of the way up the side of the cake pan. Bake in preheated oven for 40 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean. Remove from oven. Remove cake pan from water bath and set aside for 20 minutes to cool. Turn cake onto a wire rack and remove paper. Set aside for a further 20 minutes or until cooled to room temperature., Cut cake into wedges and carefully transfer to serving plates. Serve with strawberries.

name: Roast turkey with capsicum, almond and rice stuffing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'whole turkey'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'Massel chicken style liquid stock'}]
steps: Make stuffing: Place stock in a saucepan. Cover. Bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Simmer until needed. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until soft. Add rice. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute., Add 1/3 cup stock. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until stock has absorbed. Repeat with remaining stock, 1/3 cup at a time, until all liquid has absorbed and rice is tender and creamy (this will take about 25 minutes). Stir in parsley, mint, rosemary, capsicum and almonds. Season with salt and pepper., Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Remove and discard neck from turkey. Rinse turkey (including cavity) under cold water. Pat dry inside and out with paper towel. Loosely fill large cavity with stuffing. Tie legs together with kitchen string., Place turkey on a greased wire rack in a large, flameproof roasting pan. Pour 2 cups cold water into pan. Brush turkey with oil. Season with salt. Cover pan tightly with lightly greased foil. Roast for 2 hours. Remove foil. Roast for 40 to 50 minutes or until turkey is browned and juices run clear when thigh is pierced with a skewer. Transfer to a platter or board. Cover loosely with foil. Stand for 10 minutes., Meanwhile, skim liquid from pan, leaving 2 tablespoons in pan. Place pan over high heat. Add flour. Cook, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until bubbling. Slowly add stock. Cook, stirring, for 5 to 6 minutes or until thickened. Strain into a jug., Remove and discard string from turkey. Serve with stuffing, gravy, and Garlic and fennel roast potatoes (see related recipe).

name: Lemon meringue croissant pie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'mini', 'name': 'croissants, cut in half horizontally'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'custard powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(½ cup) milk'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '420', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'tub lemon curd'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan forced. Place croissants on a large baking tray. Bake for 5 minutes then transfer to a wire rack to cool., Whisk the custard powder, sugar and milk in a saucepan until smooth. Stir in the cream. Place over medium-low heat and cook for 2-3 minutes, whisking slowly then more vigorously as the mixture thickens and comes to a simmer. Continue to cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Whisk in lemon curd until combined. Set aside to cool, whisking occasionally to release any heat and help prevent a skin forming., Meanwhile, grease a 26cm x 16cm slice pan and line with baking paper, allowing the paper to overhang the long sides. Arrange enough croissant bottoms, cut side up, over the base of the prepared pan to cover neatly, cutting small pieces from leftover croissant to fill any gaps., Drop spoonfuls of custard over the croissant layer and gently spread to cover evenly. Arrange croissant tops, cut side down, over the custard (there may be some leftover, and don’t worry about gaps.) Place in the fridge for 2 hours to set., To make the meringue, place the sugar and water in a saucepan over high heat. Bring to the boil, stirring occasionally, until the sugar dissolves. Continue to boil until the syrup reaches 112°C on a candy thermometer, or soft ball stage., Place the egg whites and a pinch of salt in an electric mixer and whisk to soft peaks. Pour in the hot syrup in a thin stream, whisking continuously. Add lemon juice, then beat for 10-15 minutes, or until mixture is thick and the bowl is cool., Spread meringue over the croissants and rough the surface. Place under a hot grill or use a blow torch to brown the top. Remove from the pan and cut into 15 squares to serve.

name: Chocolate pecan cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Melted', 'name': 'butter, to grease'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) pecans'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'omega', 'name': '-3 enriched eggs, lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'canola oil'}, {'quantity': '110', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2/3 cup) wholemeal self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '35', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Icing', 'name': 'sugar mixture, to dust'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 170°C. Brush a round 20cm (base measurement) cake pan with melted butter to lightly grease. Line base and side with non-stick baking paper., Place the pecans in the bowl of a food processor and process until finely chopped., Use an electric beater to beat eggs in a large bowl until fluffy. Gradually add sugar and beat until thick and pale. Pour in the oil and beat until just combined., Sift flour and cocoa over egg mixture. Add the husks and pecans. Use a metal spoon to gently fold until just combined., Pour into prepared pan. Bake in oven for 35 minutes or until surface is dry and cake springs back when touched. Set aside for 5 minutes. Turn onto a wire rack to cool. Dust with icing sugar to serve.

name: Healthy banana bread
ingredient: [{'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) coconut flour'}, {'quantity': '160', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/4 cups) wholemeal spelt flour'}, {'quantity': '3 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) desiccated coconut'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) coconut or rapadura sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'bananas, mashed (310g flesh), plus 1 extra, for decoration'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '160', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2/3 cup) oat, soy or rice milk'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Maple', 'name': 'syrup, to serve (optional)'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/ 160C fan forced. Grease and line a 7.5cm deep, 22.5 x 8.5cm (base measurement) loaf pan with non-stick baking paper, allowing the long sides to overhang., Combine the flours, baking powder, coconut, cinnamon and sugar in a large bowl. Make a well in the centre. Add the banana, eggs, oil and milk and stir to combine. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan. Smooth surface. Very finely slice the remaining banana. Place banana slices, overlapping each over, to cover the entire surface of the loaf., Bake for 45-55 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean when inserted in the centre. Slice and serve with a drizzle of maple syrup if desired.

name: Pork with mango and chilli salsa
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'mangoes', 'name': ', peeled and stone removed, cut into 1cm cubes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chilli, seeded and finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped coriander'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'salt', 'name': 'and cracked black pepper'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'pork', 'name': 'medallions, trimmed (see note)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'salad', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Place mango, chilli, red onion, lime juice, coriander, salt and pepper in a small bowl and toss gently to combine. Cover and refrigerate until required., Heat a non-stick frying pan or stovetop grill over medium-high heat. Spray the pork with oil spray and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook for 3 minutes on each side or until golden and cooked to your liking., To serve, divide the pork among serving plates and top with mango salsa. Serve immediately with a simple salad.

name: Sushi-stuffed ocean trout with wasabi butter
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red chillies, seeded, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh grated ginger'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cooked sushi rice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'seasoned rice wine vinegar (see Notes)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh coriander'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': None, 'name': '-2kg trout boned, butterflied (ask your fishmonger to do this)'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'of nori (see Notes)'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'makrut', 'name': 'lime leaves, shredded'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sliced pickled ginger'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C., Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a saucepan over low heat. Add the onion, chilli and ginger and cook for 2-3 minutes until onion just softens. Transfer to a bowl and add the cooked rice, rice vinegar, coriander and fish sauce., Open out fish from centre cut and stuff cavity with the rice mixture. Bring sides together to enclose filling. Lay out nori sheets on the work surface, edges slightly overlapping, to make a large square. Place the stuffed fish in the middle then fold up nori sides to enclose. Use remaining oil to rub over nori so it attaches to the skin. Transfer to a lightly greased baking tray and bake for 30-40 minutes (depending on size of fish. To test, stick a skewer into the flesh, it should give easily). Set aside to rest., Place butter, lime juice and makrut lime leaves in a saucepan over medium heat, whisk gently until the butter has melted and sauce starts to sizzle., Thickly slice the fish and serve drizzled with sauce and with pickled ginger on the side.

name: Beef and sweet potato hash bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', peeled, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'extra lean beef mince'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'no-added-salt tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sweet paprika'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried oregano leaves'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt frozen Birds Eye Sweet Potato Veggie Rice'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'oregano leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan forced. Heat the oil2 tsp extra virgin olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add onion1 brown onion, finely chopped and carrot2 carrots, peeled, cut into 2cm pieces. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Increase heat to high. Add mince500g extra lean beef mince and cook, breaking up any lumps with a wooden spoon, for 5 minutes or until browned. Add garlic3 garlic cloves, crushed, tomato paste2 tbsp no-added-salt tomato paste, paprika1 tsp sweet paprika and 1 tsp dried oregano. Cook, stirring, for 1-2 minutes or until aromatic., Add tomato400g can cherry tomatoes, vinegar2 tsp balsamic vinegar and 80ml (1/3 cup) water to the pan and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes. Add beans200g green beans, coarsely chopped and simmer for 5 minutes or until tender and mixture has thickened. Season., Meanwhile, place the sweet potato rice500g pkt frozen Sweet Potato Veggie Rice in a microwave-safe dish. Cover and microwave on High for 5 minutes or until almost tender. Drain. Combine the sweet potato rice, parmesan20g (1/4 cup) finely grated parmesan and remaining dried oregano in a bowl. Season., Transfer mince mixture to prepared dish. Top with sweet potato mixture. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden. Sprinkle with fresh oregano leaves to serve.

name: Greek haloumi and cauliflower gyros
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'cauliflower, cut into florets'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'haloumi, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain Greek-style yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'cos lettuce, leaves separated'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'radishes', 'name': ', trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pitted kalamata olives, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', cut into wedges'}]
steps: Make Flatbreads. Whisk flour and salt in a bowl. Add yoghurt and 1⁄4 cup water. Mix to form a dough. Turn onto a lightly floured surface. Knead for 3 minutes or until smooth. Return to bowl. Cover with plastic wrap. Set aside for 20 minutes to rest., Meanwhile, combine lemon rind and juice, garlic, oregano and 2 tablespoons oil in a large bowl. Season. Add cauliflower. Toss to coat. Stand for 10 minutes., Divide dough into 4 equal portions. Shape each into a ball. On a lightly floured surface, roll out each to form a 4mm-thick oval. Layer ovals between sheets of baking paper to prevent sticking together. Cover with plastic wrap to prevent drying out., Preheat a barbecue grill on medium heat. Cook cauliflower, turning, for 5 to 6 minutes or until lightly charred and just tender. Transfer to a plate. Cover to keep warm., Brush flatbreads with remaining oil. Cook, in batches, for 1 minute each side or until lightly charred and cooked through. Transfer to a baking tray. Cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Add haloumi to grill. Cook for 1 minute each side or until lightly golden, Spread flatbread with a little yoghurt. Top with lettuce, radish, cucumber, cauliflower, haloumi and olives. Serve with lemon wedges and remaining yoghurt.

name: Pina colada meringue tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 2/3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(250g) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dessicated coconut'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60g) pure icing sugar, sifted'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cold unsalted butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'yolk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) coconut cream'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'titanium', 'name': '-strength gelatine leaves'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'pure (thin) cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla bean paste'}]
steps: To make pastry, place flour, coconut and icing sugar in a bowl and whisk to combine. Add butter and rub in until fine crumbs. Add egg yolk and 2 tbs iced water, and mix to combine. Knead lightly to combine, then bring together in a ball. Enclose in plastic wrap and chill for 2 hours., Preheat oven to 200C., Roll out pastry on a lightly floured work surface and use to line base and side of a 24cm loosebased fluted tart pan, trimming excess. Line with baking paper and pastry weights, then place on a baking tray and bake for 20 minutes or until golden. Remove weights and paper, and bake for 20 minutes or until golden and dry. Set aside to cool., For the jam, place pineapple, sugar, rum and lime juice and zest in a food processor and pulse until finely chopped. Transfer to a saucepan over medium heat and cook, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes or until golden and reduced. Remove from heat. Set aside to cool, then spread over cooled tart base., To make coconut layer, place coconut cream and caster sugar in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Soak gelatine in cold water for 5 minutes to soften, then squeeze out excess water. Bring coconut cream to just below boiling and add gelatine, stirring until dissolved. Stir through cream and vanilla. Pour over pineapple jam and chill for 3 hours or until set., When ready to serve, make the Italian meringue. Place sugar and 150ml water in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Place eggwhites and cream of tartar in a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. Heat sugar mixture until it reaches 90°C on a sugar thermometer, then start whisking eggwhites on medium speed. Continue heating sugar mixture to 121°C. Whisk eggwhites to just before stiff peaks, then, with the motor running, add sugar syrup in a thin, steady stream. Whisk for 10 minutes or until mixture is stiff, glossy and cool., Spread over tart with a palette knife. Caramelise top of tart with a kitchen blowtorch and serve immediately.

name: Prawn and avocado tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'filo pastry'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon-infused extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '650', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'large green prawns, peeled, deveined'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) fruity white wine, such as riesling'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt flakes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocado', 'name': ', cut into 1cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'fresh red chilli, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '90', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) Tamar Valley Greek Style Yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '85', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) Praise Whole Egg Mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': ', rind finely grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed baby tomatoes, halved'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200oC. Grease a 34 x 11cm (base measurement) fluted tart tin, with removable base. Place filo on a clean work surface. Cover with a clean tea towel, then a damp tea towel. Reserve 1 tablespoon oil. Brush 1 sheet of filo with a little of the remaining oil. Top with another sheet of filo and brush with oil. Repeat with remaining filo and oil. Line the prepared tin with the filo stack. Use scissors to trim excess, leaving 1cm above the side of the tin. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden and crisp. Transfer the tart case in the pan to a wire rack to cool., Bring prawns, wine and salt to a simmer in a saucepan over medium heat. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 3 minutes or until the prawns curl and change colour. Transfer prawn mixture to a bowl and place in the fridge for 3-4 hours or until cold., Combine the avocado, onion, coriander and chilli in a large bowl. Season. Gently toss to combine. Combine the yoghurt, mayonnaise and lime rind in a small bowl. Combine the lime juice, sugar and reserved oil in a small bowl. Season., Transfer the filo case to a platter. Gently press the back of a spoon over the base to lightly crush and flatten. Fill with avocado mixture and tomato. Drain prawns. Place on top of tart. Pour over lime juice mixture. Serve with mayonnaise mixture.

name: Zucchini spaghetti with tomato sauce recipe
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': '¼ cup (60ml) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed medley tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chickpeas, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chilli, seeded, thinly sliced (optional)'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'zucchini, cut into long matchsticks'}]
steps: Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add tomato and cook, tossing, for 5-7 mins or until the tomato begins to collapse. Use the back of a wooden spoon to lightly crush., Add the chickpeas and chilli, if using, to the tomato in the pan and cook, stirring, for 1-2 mins or until heated through. Add the zucchini and cook, tossing, for 1-2 mins or until zucchini mixture is just heated through. Divide among serving bowls. Season.

name: Lentil and mushroom bolognaise
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, peeled, \u2028coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'stick, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, halved'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'bay leaves or dried bay leaves'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': '(about 385g) field mushrooms, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) French green lentils'}, {'quantity': '410', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chopped tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'btl tomato pasta sauce'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt dried wholemeal spaghetti'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Finely', 'name': 'grated pecorino, (or vegetarian hard cheese) to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chopped', 'name': 'fresh continental parsley leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Process onion1 brown onion, peeled,  coarsely chopped, carrot1 carrot, peeled, coarsely chopped, celery1 celery stick, coarsely chopped and garlic2 garlic cloves, halved in a food processor until finely chopped (but not a paste). Heat 1 1⁄2 tbs of the oil2 1/2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion mixture and bay leaves2 fresh bay leaves or dried bay leaves. Season. Cook, stirring, for 6 minutes or until soft. Transfer to a bowl., Meanwhile, process mushrooms4 large (about 385g) field mushrooms, coarsely chopped in food processor until finely chopped (but not a paste). Heat remaining oil in pan over high heat. Cook mushrooms, stirring, for 3 minutes or until soft., Stir onion mixture and lentils200g (1 cup) French green lentils into mushroom. Stir in tomato410g can chopped tomatoes, stock375ml (1 1/2 cups) vegetable stock and pasta sauce400g btl tomato pasta sauce. Reduce heat to low. Cook, covered, stirring occasionally, for 45 minutes or until lentils are tender. Season., While the lentils are cooking, cook pasta375g pkt dried wholemeal spaghetti in a large saucepan of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain., Top spaghetti with bolognaise and sprinkle with pecorinoFinely grated pecorino, (or vegetarian hard cheese) to serve and parsleyChopped fresh continental parsley leaves, to serve.

name: Reuben sausage roll
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Finest sausages - Angus beef'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sour cream'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped dill'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'white rolls'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'Swiss', 'name': 'cheese slices'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'sauerkraut'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'gherkins', 'name': ', sliced'}]
steps: Heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium-low heat. Cook the sausages, turning occasionally, for 12 minutes or until golden and cooked through., Meanwhile, combine the sour cream, mayonnaise and dill in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper., Halve the rolls lengthways leaving one side joined. Divide the cheese, sauerkraut, sausages and gherkins among the rolls and top with the dill sauce.

name: Parmesan-crusted chicken with roast pumpkin salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried panko breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '(', 'name': '750g total) chicken tenderloins'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Alfa', 'name': 'One rice bran oil, for shallow-frying'}]
steps: Combine breadcrumbs and parmesan on a large plate. Season with salt and pepper. Place flour in a large bowl. Place egg in a shallow bowl., Toss 1 chicken piece in flour, shaking off excess. Dip in egg. Coat in breadcrumb mixture. Place on a plate. Repeat with remaining chicken, flour, egg and breadcrumb mixture. Cover, refrigerate for 10 minutes., Remove chicken from the fridge. Pour enough oil into a deep frying pan to come 5mm up side of pan. Heat over medium-high heat. Cook chicken, in 2 batches, for 3 minutes each side or until golden and cooked through. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel to drain. Slice., Meanwhile, make Pumpkin salad: Squeeze 1 garlic clove from skin. Discard skin. Place garlic into a small bowl. Add vinegar and oil. Whisk to combine. Combine spinach, onion, pumpkin and pine nuts in a large bowl. Drizzle vinegar mixture over spinach mixture. Toss to combine. Serve chicken tossed through salad.

name: Spicy caponata bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'brown onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'eggplant, cut into 1.5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, cut into 1.5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chilli powder'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chopped tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh basil leaves, torn'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'capers, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can borlotti beans, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Extra', 'name': 'basil leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200 C/180 C fan-forced., Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add onion1 small brown onion, chopped. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add eggplant1 baby eggplant, cut into 1.5cm pieces and capsicum1 red capsicum, cut into 1.5cm pieces. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until eggplant is golden. Add garlic3 garlic cloves, crushed and chilli powder1/4 tsp chilli powder. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until fragrant., Add tomatoes400g can chopped tomatoes, stock1/2 cup chicken stock, basil1/3 cup fresh basil leaves, torn, capers2 tsp capers, drained, rinsed and beans400g can borlotti beans, drained, rinsed. Season with salt and pepper. Stir gently to combine. Bring to the boil. Carefully transfer mixture to a 6 cup-capacity ovenproof dish., Combine breadcrumbs1/2 cup fresh breadcrumbs, parmesan1/3 cup grated parmesan and remaining oil in a bowl. Sprinkle over bean mixture. Season with pepper., Bake for 20 minutes or until top is golden. Serve sprinkled with extra basilExtra basil leaves, to serve.

name: Beef and vegetable pie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'beef stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', grated'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'sheet frozen ready-rolled shortcrust pastry, partially thawed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'sheet', 'name': 'frozen ready-rolled puff pastry, partially thawed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Tomato', 'name': 'sauce, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Oven', 'name': 'fries, to serve'}]
steps: Combine worcestershire sauce1 tbsp worcestershire sauce, tomato sauce2 tbsp tomato sauce and stock2/3 cup beef stock in a jug. Set aside. Heat oil1 tbsp olive oil in a large, non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add onion1 brown onion, finely chopped. Cook, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until tender. Increase heat to medium-high. Add mince500g beef mince. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until browned. Add carrot1 carrot, peeled, grated, zucchini1 zucchini, grated and peas1/2 cup frozen peas. Stir to combine. Add flour2 tbsp plain flour. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute., Gradually add stock mixture. Bring to the boil, stirring constantly. Set aside to cool completely., Preheat oven and a baking tray to 210°C. Lightly grease a 4cm-deep, 20cm (base) pie dish. Line base and sides with shortcrust pastry1 large sheet frozen ready-rolled shortcrust pastry, partially thawed. Spoon cold mince mixture into pastry case. Brush pie edges lightly with egg1 egg, lightly beaten. Place puff pastry sheet1 sheet frozen ready-rolled puff pastry, partially thawed filling to cover. Trim excess pastry and pinch edges together to seal. Brush pie top with egg. Using a sharp knife, make 2 small cuts in pie top., Place pie on hot baking tray (see tip). Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until top is golden. Serve with sauceTomato sauce, to serve and friesOven fries, to serve.

name: Cajun steak with succotash salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'beef', 'name': 'sirloin steaks, trimmed of excess fat'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'orange', 'name': ', zested, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'mint', 'name': 'leaves, plus extra to garnish'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'white wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can corn kernels, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can red kidney beans, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tomatoes', 'name': ', seeds removed, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'piece', 'name': 'roasted capsicum*, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'light sour cream, to serve'}]
steps: Mark steaks in a criss-cross pattern (so marinade penetrates). Mix zest, juice, chilli, oregano, mustard and 2 crushed garlic cloves in a dish. Season and add steaks. Set aside to marinate while you prepare the salad. Puree mint, oil, vinegar and remaining garlic in a blender. Toss with remaining ingredients, except cream., Heat a lightly oiled chargrill or frypanon medium-high heat. Cook steaks for 1-2 minutes each side for medium-rare (or to your liking). Rest steaks briefly, then serve with succotash, drizzled with pan juices and topped with sour cream and extra mint.

name: Roasted greens with soy and sambal oelek drizzle
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Chinese five spice powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'broccolini, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'gai lan (see note), trimmed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sambal oelek'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'salt-reduced soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'rice wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped unsalted roasted peanuts'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Grease a large baking tray with sides., Combine five spice and oils in a small bowl. Place broccolini and gai lan on prepared tray. Drizzle with oil mixture. Roast for 10 minutes or until vegetables are bright green and just tender., Combine sambal oelek, soy sauce, vinegar and sugar in a small bowl. Drizzle sambal oelek mixture over vegetables. Sprinkle with peanuts. Serve.

name: Baked lemon cheesecake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '115', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chilled butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'yolk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'apricot jam'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Whipped', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray with non-stick baking paper. Place the flour, butter and sugar in the bowl of a food processor and process until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add the egg yolk and water and process until dough just starts to come together., Turn the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Roll out the dough between 2 sheets of baking paper to a 24cm-diameter disc. Place on the lined tray. Use a fork to prick pastry all over. Place in the fridge for 10 minutes to rest. Bake in oven for 12 minutes or until golden. Set aside to cool., Reduce oven temperature to 160°C. Line the base and side of a 23cm (base measurement) springform pan with non-stick baking paper. Place the pastry disc in the base of the pan. Trim edges of the pastry to fit. Spread with the jam., To make the filling, use an electric beater to beat the cream cheese, sugar, cornflour and lemon rind in a bowl until pale and creamy. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition until well combined. Add lemon juice and beat to combine. Transfer to a bowl. Use a clean electric beater to beat the cream in a bowl until soft peaks form. Fold into the cream cheese mixture. Pour over the pastry base. Bake in oven for 1 hour 10 minutes. Turn oven off. Leave the cheesecake in oven, with door ajar, until cooled completely., Meanwhile, to make the lemon syrup, use a zester to remove the rind from the lemon. (Alternatively, use a vegetable peeler to peel the rind from lemon. Use a small sharp knife to remove white pith from rind. Cut rind into very thin strips.) Place the rind in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to the boil over high heat. Drain. Repeat 3 more times. Transfer to a bowl. Add the sugar and water to the pan. Stir over low heat until the sugar dissolves. Bring to a simmer and cook, without stirring, for 20 minutes or until the syrup thickens. Stir in the lemon rind. Set aside to cool completely., Cut the cheesecake into wedges. Top with whipped cream and drizzle over the lemon syrup to serve.

name: Tiramisu
ingredient: [{'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3/4 cup) strong espresso coffee'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) marsala'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'savoiardi', 'name': '(sponge finger biscuits), halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '375g ctn reduced-fat smooth ricotta'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'white'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cocoa', 'name': 'powder, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Strawberries', 'name': ', hulled, washed, quartered, to serve'}]
steps: Combine the coffee and half the marsala in a bowl. Dip the biscuits, 1 at a time, into the coffee mixture and use to line the bases of eight 125ml (1/2-cup) capacity serving glasses. Drizzle with the remaining coffee mixture., Combine ricotta, brown sugar and remaining marsala in a medium bowl. Use a balloon whisk to whisk together the egg white and caster sugar in a clean, dry bowl until soft peaks form. Use a metal spoon to fold egg white into the ricotta mixture. Spoon ricotta mixture among serving glasses. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 2 hours to chill., Sprinkle tiramisu with cocoa powder and top with strawberries to serve.

name: Garlic prawn, lemon and feta spaghetti
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'spaghetti'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': '(', 'name': '500g) green king prawns, peeled (tails intact), deveined'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely-grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roughly-chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'low-fat feta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'crusty', 'name': 'bread, to serve'}]
steps: Cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling water, following packet directions, until tender., Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large, non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add onion. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until tender. Add prawns and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until prawns are just pink. Add wine. Bring to the boil. Simmer, uncovered, for 1 minute or until prawns are just cooked through. Remove from heat. Add lemon rind and juice., Drain pasta. Return to pan over low heat. Add prawn mixture, remaining oil, parsley and feta. Season with pepper. Toss to combine. Serve with crusty bread.

name: Slow cooker gravy chicken
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onion, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '4 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chicken gravy powder'}, {'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3/4 cup) cooking cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chicken stock powder'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'thyme', 'name': 'sprigs'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mashed', 'name': 'potato, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cooked', 'name': 'peas, to serve'}]
steps: Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook for 5 minutes, turning halfway, until golden brown. Transfer to a slow cooker. Reduce the heat to medium and add the onion to the frying pan. Cook, stirring often, for 3-4 minutes or until the onion is soft and lightly golden. Transfer to the slow cooker., Place the gravy powder in a large heatproof jug and add enough boiling water to make up to 375ml (1 1/2 cups). Add the cream, Worcestershire sauce, stock powder and thyme and stir until well combined. Pour over the chicken in the slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours., Turn off the slow cooker. Use 2 large forks to shred the chicken. Stir to combine the chicken with the gravy. Serve with mashed potato and peas.

name: Roast chicken with honey-glazed carrot, potato and silverbeet
ingredient: [{'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(about 3 stalks) silverbeet, stalks removed, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'brushed potatoes, well washed, peeled and cut into 2.5cm dice'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Brand Butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Coles Brand Chicken Stock'}, {'quantity': '1.6', 'unit': None, 'name': '-1.8kg whole chicken'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil, for drizzling, plus 2 tbsp extra'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'carrots, peeled, diagonally sliced into 2cm thick slices'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece fresh ginger, peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Coles Brand Ground Cumin'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Coles Brand Ground Coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles Smart Buy Honey'}]
steps: For the Chicken: Preheat oven to 180C or 160C fan-forced., Rinse the chicken with cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle over some oil and rub over the chicken. Place chicken on a small rack in a large baking dish. Tie the legs together with string. Roast for 50-60 mins. When the chicken is done, its skin will be crisp and golden and a meat thermometer will register 82C when inserted into the thickest part of the thighs. Allow the chicken to rest after cooking for at least 15 mins before serving., For the Honey Glazed Carrots, Potatoes and Silverbeet: While chicken is cooking, heat a heavy-based medium-sized frying pan over high heat until hot. Add the oil, carrots and potatoes. Reduce heat to medium-high and allow vegetables to cook undisturbed for about 5-7 mins until they start to brown., Add the ginger and spices. Cook for a further 5 mins over low-medium heat, tossing occasionally until vegetables are browned on all sides., Add the honey, cook for 2 mins, or until slightly caramelised. Add the butter and allow to melt completely. Stir in the flour and cook for 1 min, pour in the chicken stock and continue to stir until completely incorporated and just thickened, about 2 mins. Add the silverbeet and toss gently until completely wilted., Serve the chicken on your favourite platter accompanied by honey glazed carrots, potatoes and silverbeet.

name: Spinach and feta fritters
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen chopped spinach, thawed'}, {'quantity': '1 2/3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(410ml) buttermilk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Brand Australian Free Range Egg'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted, cooled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(300g) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'bicarbonate of soda'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fetta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry truss tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'basil pesto'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocado', 'name': ', stoned, peeled, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'small basil leaves'}]
steps: Use your hands to squeeze excess moisture from the spinach., Whisk the buttermilk, egg and butter in a jug. Sift the flour and bicarbonate of soda in a bowl. Make a well in the centre. Add the buttermilk mixture and whisk until just combined. Stir in the spinach and fetta. Season with pepper., Spray a large non-stick frying pan with oil. Heat over medium heat. Spoon two 1/4-cup (60ml) portions of batter into the pan. Cook for 2 mins or until golden underneath. Turn and cook for 2 mins or until cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter, spraying the pan between batches., Meanwhile, preheat grill on high. Place tomatoes on a baking tray lined with foil and spray with oil. Cook under grill for 5 mins or until skin softens and tomatoes start to collapse., Combine the pesto and oil in a small bowl. Serve fritters with tomatoes and avocado, drizzled with the pesto mixture and sprinkled with basil.

name: Ham, salami and cheese stromboli
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt flakes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 3/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'bread and pizza plain flour, plus extra for dusting'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '7g sachet dried yeast'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato pasta sauce'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'shaved ham'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'shaved hungarian salami'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roasted red capsicum strips, chopped'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'basil leaves, torn'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pizza cheese, grated'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salad', 'name': ', to serve'}]
steps: Combine 2/3 cup warm water, oil, salt and sugar in a jug. Whisk with a fork to dissolve sugar., Sift flour into a bowl. Add yeast. Stir to combine. Make a well. Add water mixture. Mix to form a soft dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead for 10 minutes or until smooth and elastic. Transfer to a lightly oiled bowl. Cover with lightly oiled plastic wrap. Stand in a warm place for 1 hour or until dough has doubled in size., Using your fist, punch down dough. Knead on a lightly floured surface until smooth. Roll out dough between 2 sheets of baking paper to form a 22cm x 30cm rectangle. Remove top sheet of paper. Spread sauce over dough, leaving a 2cm border. Top with ham, salami, capsicum and basil. Sprinkle with cheese., Fold dough edges over at both short ends. With 1 long side facing you, fold 1/3 dough over 2/3 of the filling. Fold dough over again to completely cover filling. Carefully roll the stromboli so the seam side is on the bottom. Transfer stromboli, still on the baking paper, to a baking tray. Cover with lightly oiled plastic wrap. Stand in a warm place for 30 minutes., Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 220C/200C fan-forced., Bake stromboli for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden and cooked through. Stand for 5 minutes before slicing thickly. Serve with rocket, kalamata olive, basil and parmesan salad.

name: Lamb shanks with dates and pumpkin
ingredient: [{'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Jap pumpkin, peeled, deseeded'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3 cups) boiling water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Massel', 'name': 'chicken style stock cubes, crumbled'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Plain', 'name': 'flour, to coat'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'lamb', 'name': 'shanks, French trimmed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) dry red wine'}, {'quantity': '1 400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can whole peeled tomatoes, crushed'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) whole pitted dried dates, halved'}, {'quantity': '1 7', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'cinnamon stick'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley'}]
steps: Use a sharp knife to cut pumpkin lengthways into four 2cm-thick wedges. Cut each wedge in half crossways. Combine the boiling water and crumbled stock cubes in a heatproof jug. Stir to combine and set aside until required., Place the flour on a large plate and coat the lamb shanks all over with the flour. Shake off any excess. Heat the oil in a large heatproof casserole dish over medium-high heat. Add the lamb and cook, turning occasionally, for 2-3 minutes or until well browned. Remove from pan and set aside., Add onion to pan and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until onion is soft. Return lamb shanks to pan with reserved chicken stock, red wine, tomatoes, dates and cinnamon stick, and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, covered, turning lamb shanks occasionally, for 45 minutes., Add the pumpkin and simmer, uncovered, for 35 minutes or until the pumpkin is tender and sauce thickens slightly. Divide the mashed potato among serving plates. Top with lamb shanks mixture and sprinkle with parsley.

name: Spring onion frittata with smoked ocean trout
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'mirin (see note)'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, chopped, plus extra to serve'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sunflower oil'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'smoked ocean trout'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Coriander', 'name': 'sprigs, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Toasted', 'name': 'sesame seeds, to serve'}]
steps: Whisk 2 eggs with 2 teaspoons mirin and 2 tablespoons spring onion, and season with freshly ground black pepper., Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a small frypan over medium-low heat, swirling the pan to coat the base and sides. Add the egg mixture and cook for 4-5 minutes until the base is slightly set. Cook, occasionally drawing back the edges with a spatula to allow the uncooked egg to spill over onto the pan, for a further 1-2 minutes. When egg is set on top, slide onto a plate and keep warm. Repeat with remaining egg, mirin, spring onion and oil to make 3 more frittatas., To serve, top each frittata with a quarter of the smoked ocean trout and garnish with coriander, sesame seeds and extra spring onion.

name: Butter beans with anchovy breadcrumbs
ingredient: [{'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) fresh breadcrumbs (made from day-old bread)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'drained', 'name': 'anchovy fillets, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter beans, trimmed'}]
steps: Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Cook breadcrumbs, stirring, for 2-3 minutes or until light golden. Add garlic and anchovy. Cook, stirring, for 1-2 minutes or until aromatic and breadcrumbs are golden. Stir in parsley and season to taste with salt and pepper., Cook beans in a saucepan of salted boiling water for 2-3 minutes or until tender-crisp. Drain and refresh under cold running water. Drain. Place in a serving platter and sprinkle with breadcrumb mixture.

name: Chocolate honeycomb self-saucing pudding
