ingredient: [{'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 1/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'self-raising flour, sifted'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cocoa powder, sifted'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '50g Violet Crumble chocolate bars, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'boiling water'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vanilla', 'name': 'ice-cream, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced., Combine caster sugar, flour and 2 tablespoons cocoa in a bowl. Stir in milk, melted butter and half the Violet Crumble bar. Spoon mixture into an 8-cup capacity ovenproof dish., Sift remaining cocoa over mixture. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Place on a baking tray. Pour the boiling water over the back of a large metal spoon to cover pudding. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until top has set. Sprinkle pudding with remaining Violet Crumble bar. Stand for 5 minutes. Serve immediately with ice-cream.

name: Potato, prawn and chorizo pizza
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pack', 'name': '(200g) Coles medium thin & crispy pizza bases'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coarsely grated mozzarella'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '80g chat potatoes, very thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'chorizo', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'medium raw prawns from the deli, peeled'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'pitted olives'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'shaved parmesan'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'Coles prosciutto, freshly sliced from the deli, torn into thick strips'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mixed', 'name': 'salad leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220. Divide the pizza bases between two baking trays. Sprinkle the mozzarella over the bases. Arrange the potato slices on top then top with the chorizo, prawns and olives. Bake, swapping the position of the trays halfway through, for 10-15 minutes or until the potato is tender and the crust is golden., Season with pepper and top with the parmesan and prosciutto. Slice and serve with mixed salad leaves.

name: Broccolini wraps
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'broccolini'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'prosciutto'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'fresh red chilli, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', zest finely grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) panko breadcrumbs'}]
steps: Cook the broccolini in a large saucepan of boiling water for 5 mins or until tender- crisp. Drain and set aside to cool slightly. Divide into 6 bundles. Wrap each bundle with prosciutto., Heat 1 1/2 tbs of the oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Cook the bundles, turning often, for 3 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a plate., Add the remaining oil to the pan. Add the garlic, chilli and lemon zest. Stir for 1 minute or until aromatic. Add the breadcrumbs. Stir for 4 minutes or until golden. Drizzle the broccolini wraps with lemon juice and sprinkle with panko mixture.

name: Pesto and semi-dried tomato pasta bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried elbow pasta'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'basil pesto'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Bulla Cooking Cream'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'drained and chopped semi-dried tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '225', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'jar marinated antipasto, drained'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'panko breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'pine nuts'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Shredded', 'name': 'fresh basil leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Cook pasta following packet directions. Drain well., Combine pesto and cream in a large bowl. Add pasta, tomatoes and antipasto. Stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper., Preheat grill on medium-high heat., Spoon the pasta mixture into a 6-cup-capacity flameproof baking dish. Combine breadcrumbs, parmesan and pine nuts in a bowl. Sprinkle over pasta. Spray with oil. Grill for 2 to 3 minutes or until golden. Serve sprinkled with basil.

name: Meatball pasta with salsa verde
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lean beef mince'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(25g) finely grated parmesan, plus extra to serve'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80g) fresh ricotta'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(70g) fresh breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'long pasta (we used mparrettati)'}]
steps: Place the mince, parmesan, ricotta, egg and breadcrumbs in a bowl and season with salt and pepper. Mix well to combine, then roll into 24 walnut-sized balls. Chill for 10 minutes., Meanwhile, for the salsa verde, place garlic, capers, anchovies, mustard and vinegar in a food processor. Roughly chop herbs, then add to the processor and pulse until a coarse paste. With the motor running, add oil in a thin, steady stream until smooth and emulsified. Season and set aside., Heat oil in a frypan over medium-high heat. In batches, cook meatballs, turning, for 5 minutes or until cooked through., Meanwhile, cook the pasta in boiling, salted water according to the packet instructions or until al dente. Drain., Toss the pasta with the meatballs and salsa verde. Divide among bowls, sprinkle with extra parmesan and serve.

name: Cauliflower pizzas with pumpkin and prosciutto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'head', 'name': '(1.2kg) cauliflower, cut into small florets'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'almond meal'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'pizza cheese, grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried mixed herbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, peeled, cut into 2cm cubes'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Mutti Tomato Passata'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pizza cheese, grated, extra'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'gluten-free prosciutto, torn'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh ricotta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh basil leaves'}]
steps: Process cauliflower in a food processor until very finely chopped (you'll need 4 cups in total). Place in a microwave-safe bowl. Add 2 tablespoons water. Cover bowl loosely with plastic wrap. Microwave on HIGH (100%) for 8 minutes or until tender. Transfer cauliflower to a large sieve. Drain, pressing cauliflower with the back of a spoon to remove as much liquid as possible. Transfer cauliflower to a large bowl. Cool for 15 minutes., Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan-forced. Line 2 large baking trays with baking paper., Add egg, almond meal, pizza cheese and dried herbs to cauliflower. Season well with salt and pepper. Stir to combine. Divide mixture into 4 equal portions. Place 2 portions onto each prepared tray. Flatten each portion to form a 15cm circle, making the sides a little thicker to form the crust., Bake bases for 15 minutes or until golden., Meanwhile, heat oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook pumpkin, turning, for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden and tender., Spread bases with passata. Sprinkle with extra pizza cheese. Top with pumpkin, prosciutto and ricotta. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top with basil. Serve immediately.

name: Broccolini, garlic and lemon sauce with agnolotti
ingredient: [{'quantity': '625', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Latina™ Fresh Filled Pasta, Spinach & Ricotta Agnolotti'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'broccolini, cut into 5cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', zested, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'toasted pinenuts'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'round mint leaves'}]
steps: Cook Latina™ Fresh Filled Pasta, Spinach & Ricotta Agnolotti following packet directions until al dente. Add broccolini and cook for a further 1 minute or until bright green and tender. Drain well., Meanwhile, melt butter in a large frying pan over high heat until foaming. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add pasta mixture, lemon juice and half the zest, chill, pine nuts and half the mint and toss to combine. Taste and season with salt and pepper., Divide among serving plates and top with remaining lemon zest and mint. Serve immediately.

name: Banana bread and choc pudding
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'banana bread, store-bought'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Lindt Excellence 70% Cocoa Dark Chocolate, broken into squares'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pecans, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(100g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vanilla', 'name': 'ice-cream, to serve'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caramel, warmed (see Notes)'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C fan forced. Cut the banana bread into 1.5cm squares. Divide half the bread among four 250ml (1 cup) ovenproof dishes. Top each dish with a square of chocolate. Top with the remaining bread. Press the remaining chocolate in between the bread pieces., Whisk the cream, milk, vanilla, eggs and 2 tbs sugar in a large jug. Pour over the puddings. Set aside for 10 minutes to soak., Meanwhile, for the pecan toffee, line a baking tray with baking paper and spread the prepared tray with 45g (1⁄3 cup) of the pecans. Place the remaining 100g sugar in a small non-stick frying pan. Cook over low heat for 4-5 minutes or until deep golden. Pour over the pecans. Set aside for 5 minutes to set. Break into shards., Sprinkle the puddings with the remaining pecans. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden and custard is set. Serve with a scoop of vanilla ice-cream and drizzle with the warm caramel. Top with a pecan toffee shard.

name: Polenta-topped beef pot pies
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red capsicums, chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef mince'}, {'quantity': '35', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sachet taco seasoning (see note)'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'instant polenta'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated tasty cheese'}]
steps: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add capsicum. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until just softened. Add mince. Cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up mince, for 6 to 8 minutes or until browned. Add taco seasoning mix. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add tomato and 1 cup cold water. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes or until thickened., Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Place 2 1/2 cups cold water in a saucepan over high heat. Add remaining oil. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add polenta in a slow, steady stream, stirring constantly, until combined. Cook, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until smooth and thick. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese. Season with salt and pepper., Divide mince mixture among four 1/2-cup-capacity ovenproof dishes. Top each with polenta, spreading to partially cover mince. Place dishes on a large baking tray., Bake for 20 minutes or until golden and bubbling around the edges. Serve.

name: Pawpaw & banana with coconut ice-cream
ingredient: [{'quantity': '65', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'pawpaw', 'name': ', deseeded, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'ripe', 'name': 'bananas, chopped'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'scoops', 'name': 'vanilla ice-cream'}]
steps: Place coconut in a large non-stick frying pan and cook, stirring, over medium-high heat for 1 minute or until golden brown (see microwave tip). Remove from heat and transfer to a plate. Set aside for 10 minutes to cool., Arrange the pawpaw and banana among serving bowls. Roll the ice-cream scoops in the coconut to coat. Place two scoops in each serving bowl.

name: Spiced carrot and pumpkin tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': '(375g) carrots, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pure cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'maple syrup'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'hazelnut meal'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Whipped', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}]
steps: Make pastry Place flour, sugar and butter in a food processor. Process until mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add yolks and chilled water. Process until mixture just comes together. Turn onto a lightly floured surface. Knead gently until smooth. Shape into a disc. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm., Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Grease a 4cm-deep, 23cm loose-based flan tin. Roll pastry out between 2 sheets of baking paper until 3mm-thick. Line base and side of prepared tin with pastry. Trim edges. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until firm., Meanwhile, place carrot and pumpkin in a microwave-safe dish. Cover. Microwave on high (100%) for 7 minutes, stirring halfway through cooking time, or until carrot and pumpkin are tender. Drain well. Set aside to cool completely., Place prepared tin on a baking tray. Line pastry case with baking paper. Fill with ceramic pie weights or uncooked rice. Bake for 15 minutes or until edges are golden. Remove paper and weights or rice. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden. Cool., Combine cinnamon, nutmeg and allspice in a bowl. Reserve 1/2 teaspoon. Process carrot mixture until finely chopped. Add cream, eggs, sugar, maple syrup, hazelnut meal, flour and spice mixture to carrot. Process to combine. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes or until just set. Cool for 15 minutes. Cover. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or until cold. Serve topped with cream and sprinkled with reserved spice mixture.

name: Beef sausage, tomato and cheese sandwich
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'thick', 'name': 'lean beef sausages'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'white bread'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'shredded iceberg lettuce'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'reduced-fat sliced tasty cheese'}]
steps: Heat oil in a medium frying pan over medium-high heat. Add sausages. Cook, turning, for 6 to 8 minutes or until browned and cooked through. Set aside to cool. Thinly slice., Place 4 pieces of bread on a flat surface. Spread with sauce. Top with lettuce, cheese and sausage. Sandwich with remaining bread. Cut each sandwich in half. Serve.

name: Bunny cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'desiccated coconut'}, {'quantity': '1 1/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'white', 'name': 'marshmallow puff (see notes)'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Clinkers', 'name': '(see notes)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Rich', 'name': 'chocolate fudge writing icing'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'musk', 'name': 'stick, halved crossways'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mini', 'name': 'foil-wrapped chocolate Easter eggs (optional), to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Grease a 7cm-deep, 20cm round cake pan. Line base and side with baking paper., Using an electric mixer, beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg. Beat until combined. Add 1/2 the coconut, flour and milk, stir until just combined. Add remaining coconut, flour and milk. Stir until just combined. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Cool in pan for 5 minutes. Turn, top-side up, onto a wire rack to cool completely., Make Buttercream Using electric mixer, beat butter until pale and fluffy (about 5 minutes). Gradually add icing sugar and milk, beating constantly until combined., Using a serrated knife, cut cake in half to make 2 semi-circles. Spread 1 cake half with ¼ cup buttercream. Sandwich with remaining cake half and place, cut-side down, on a cake board. Cover cake and marshmallow puff with icing. Press marshmallow onto 1 end of cake to form a tail. Pat cake and marshmallow with coconut to coat all over., Cut Clinkers in half crossways. Discard 1 pink piece. Push remaining pink piece of Clinker, cut-side up, into icing to form a nose on the front of cake. Lightly press remaining pieces of Clinker onto front of cake to form eyes. Use writing icing to form pupils. Thinly slice musk stick pieces lengthways. Lightly press 3 pieces on each side of the nose to form whiskers. Push fabric ears into top of cake (see notes). Arrange Easter eggs around bunny, if using. Serve.

name: Slow-cooker Moroccan lamb and barley stew
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1.8', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'lamb half leg roast, fat trimmed, cut into 3cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onions, halved, sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'stick'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'Massel beef style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dried', 'name': 'bay leaf'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'harissa paste'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pearl barley, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried apricots'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain Greek-style yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped preserved lemon rind'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'green beans, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Toasted', 'name': 'natural sliced almonds, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add half the lamb to the pan. Cook, turning, for 3 minutes or until browned all over. Transfer to slow cooker. Repeat with 2 teaspoons oil and remaining lamb., Reduce heat to medium. Heat remaining oil in pan. Add onion. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add garlic, cumin, coriander and cinnamon to pan. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until fragrant. Transfer onion mixture to slow cooker. Add stock, bay leaf and harissa to slow cooker. Stir to combine. Cover with lid. Cook on LOW for 7 hours (or HIGH for 3 hours 30 minutes), adding barley and apricots in the final hour of cooking time., Combine yoghurt and preserved lemon in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Divide lamb mixture and beans among serving bowls. Top with yoghurt mixture, almonds and parsley. Serve.

name: Antipasto salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '330', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(18 slices) marinated chargrilled eggplant'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'marinated mixed chargrilled capsicum, torn into strips'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'semi-dried tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'ctn South Cape Persian Fetta'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'balsamic glaze'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket leaves'}]
steps: Arrange the eggplant, capsicum and tomato on a large serving platter., Carefully drain the feta, reserving the oil. Whisk the reserved oil and balsamic glaze in a bowl until well combined. Drizzle over the vegetables, reserving 1 tablespoon of the dressing. Crumble the feta and sprinkle over the vegetables., Combine the reserved dressing and rocket in a bowl. Top the vegetables with the rocket mixture.

name: Minted blueberry granita
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'punnets', 'name': '(600g) blueberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(220g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'mint, leaves picked, plus extra leaves to serve'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'icing sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'limoncello* liqueur (optional)'}]
steps: Place a 1-litre (4-cup) loaf pan in the freezer. Place 2 punnets (400g) blueberries, caster sugar and 2 cups (500ml) water in a pan over low heat and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10-12 minutes until sugar dissolves and blueberries are just beginning to break down. Add the mint and lime juice, then cool slightly., Blend the blueberry mixture until smooth, then pass through a fine sieve and cool to room temperaturePour. into the chilled loaf pan, cover and freeze overnight., Toss the remaining berries with icing sugar and limoncello, if using., To serve, scrape granita with a spoon and layer in serving glasses with blueberries and extra mint.

name: Japanese pickled vegetables
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'Lebanese cucumber, halved lengthways, thinly sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Dutch', 'name': '(baby) carrots, trimmed, peeled, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'radish', 'name': ', trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) rice wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'water'}]
steps: Combine the cucumber and salt in a small bowl. Set aside for 30 minutes to soften. Drain and rinse under cold running water. Pat dry. Combine the cucumber, carrot, radish and chilli flakes in a heatproof bowl., Place the vinegar, sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to the boil. Cook, stirring, until sugar dissolves. Pour vinegar mixture over the cucumber mixture. Set aside to cool. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 4 hours or overnight to develop the flavours.

name: Choc-chunk pear and raspberry cobbler
ingredient: [{'quantity': '825', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can pear halves in syrup, drained, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cornflour'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh raspberries'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'firmly packed brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'mixed spice'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate (70% cocoa), chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 3/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'thickened cream'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 200C/180C fan forced. Place the pear, cornflour, 200g raspberries, 1/4 cup sugar and 1/2 tsp mixed spice in a bowl. Gently stir to combine. Spoon two-thirds of the mixture into a 1.5L (6 cup) baking dish or ovenproof frying pan., Combine the self-raising flour, 80g chocolate and remaining 1/4 cup sugar and 1/2 tsp mixed spice in a bowl. Make a well in the centre. Slowly pour the cream into the well, stirring until combined (the dough will be wet)., Spoon dough over the pear mixture. Top with the remaining pear mixture, arranging the pears around the edge of the pan. Sprinkle with the raspberries and remaining chocolate., Bake for 45-50 minutes or until golden and bubbling. Stand for 15 minutes. Serve with ice-cream, cream or custard, if you like.

name: Mango and coconut noodle salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried rice vermicelli noodles'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'mangoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'Lebanese cucumber, seeded, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh Thai basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'coconut flakes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'green chilli, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roasted salted cashews, finely chopped'}]
steps: Make Coconut dressing: Place sugar in a large heatproof bowl. Add boiling water. Stir until sugar has dissolved. Stir in remaining ingredients. Set aside., Cook noodles following packet directions. Drain. Refresh under cold running water. Drain well. Add to coconut dressing. Toss to combine., Cut 2 cheeks from each mango. Using a small sharp knife, cut the flesh of 1 mango cheek in half, without cutting through the skin. Using a large metal spoon, scoop half the flesh out of the mango, leaving remaining half within the skin. Repeat with remaining mango cheeks. Thinly slice scooped mango flesh., Add sliced mango and coriander to noodles. Toss until well combined. Place mango cheeks cut-side up on a serving platter. Using the picture as a guide, thread 1 skewer through each mango. Divide noodle mixture among mango. Sprinkle with cucumber, basil, coconut flakes, chilli and cashews. Serve.

name: White chocolate and coconut mousse
ingredient: [{'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'white chocolate, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'coconut essence'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', separated'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'raspberries, to serve'}]
steps: Place chocolate and cream in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high (100%) for 1 to 2 minutes, stirring with a metal spoon halfway through cooking, or until smooth. Stir in coconut essence. Cool for 5 minutes., Stir in egg yolks until just combined. Using an electric mixer, beat eggwhites in a separate bowl until stiff peaks form. Fold eggwhite, in 2 batches, into chocolate mixture., Spoon mixture into six glasses. Cover. Refrigerate for 3 hours or until just set. Serve topped with raspberries.

name: Healthy vegetarian nachos
ingredient: [{'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '28g corn tortillas, each cut into 12 wedges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'fresh red chilli, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika, plus extra to sprinkle'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red capsicum, deseeded, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'zucchini, chopped'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can black beans, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, sliced into 1cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '130', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) natural yoghurt'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Line 2 large baking trays with baking paper., Place the tortilla wedges on the prepared trays and lightly spray with oil. Bake for 12-15 minutes, turning once, or until golden and crisp. Set aside., Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add the chilli, cumin and paprika and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until aromatic. Add the capsicum and zucchini and cook, stirring for 1 minute or until softened slightly., Add black beans, tomatoes and 80ml (1/3 cup) water to the saucepan and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes or until thickened. Add the green beans and simmer for 2 minutes or until just tender., Serve the bean mixture with the tortilla crisps, topped with yoghurt and coriander. Serve with a wedge of lime and sprinkle lightly with paprika if desired.

name: Simple Moroccan chicken
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken thigh fillet, cut into 2cm dice'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': '(1/4 cup) flour (seasoned with salt and pepper)'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'onions', 'name': ', sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sumac (see Notes)'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': '(1/4 cup) sultanas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'toasted pine nuts (see Notes)'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': '(1/4 cup) chopped fresh coriander'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Juice', 'name': 'of 1 lemon, plus wedges to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Couscous', 'name': ', to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Greek', 'name': 'Style Yoghurt, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'bread, to serve'}]
steps: Toss chicken500g chicken thigh fillet, cut into 2cm dice in the flour3 tbsp (1/4 cup) flour (seasoned with salt and pepper). Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large frypan over high heat until hot, then cook chicken in batches until golden and set aside., Heat remaining oil in pan. Add onions2 onions, sliced, reduce heat to medium and cook for 10 minutes, stirring, until golden and softened. Return chicken to pan with spices2 tsp ground cinnamon|1/4 tsp ground cloves|2 tsp sumac (see Notes), sultanas3 tbsp (1/4 cup) sultanas and stock1 cup (250ml) chicken stock. Reduce heat to low and cook for 5 minutes until heated through and thickened slightly. Stir in pine nuts50g toasted pine nuts (see Notes), coriander3 tbsp (1/4 cup) chopped fresh coriander and lemon juiceJuice of 1 lemon, plus wedges to serve. Serve with couscousCouscous, to serve, yoghurtGreek Style Yoghurt, to serve, breadLebanese bread, to serve and lemon.

name: Beef mince pasta bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'spiral pasta'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef mince'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'middle', 'name': 'bacon rashers, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'zucchinis', 'name': ', grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'minced chilli'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Massel chicken style stock powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'can', 'name': '(420g) tomato soup'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated cheese'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220C., Cook pasta500g spiral pasta according to packet directions., Meanwhile, in a pot, brown mince500g beef mince, bacon5 middle bacon rashers, diced and onion1 onion, chopped. Add carrots2 carrots, grated, zucchini2 zucchinis, grated, garlic1 tsp minced garlic, chilli1/4 tsp minced chilli, stock powder2 tsp chicken style stock powder, soup1 can (420g) tomato soup, tomato paste2 tbsp tomato paste and water1/2 cup water. Simmer for 10 minutes., Drain pasta and pour into a large ovenproof 4 litre (16 cup capacity) baking dish. Pour mince mix over the top and stir through. Sprinkle grated cheese1.5 cup grated cheese over the top., Bake in the oven until the cheese melts, about 10-20 minutes.

name: Teriyaki mushroom steaks with ramen noodles
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '150g packets shelf-stable ramen noodles'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'white miso paste'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'mirin'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece fresh ginger, peeled, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'portobello mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'teriyaki marinade'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cooking sake'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'pak choy, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '410', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can baby corn, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chillies, thinly sliced'}]
steps: Place noodles in a heatproof bowl. Cover with boiling water. Stand for 2 minutes. Separate noodles with a fork. Drain. Combine miso paste, mirin, ginger and 2 tablespoons water in a small bowl., Meanwhile, heat oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms. Cook for 3 minutes each side or until golden. Add teriyaki marinade, sake, garlic and 1/4 cup water. Cook for 5 minutes, turning halfway, or until sauce thickens slightly and mushrooms are tender. Transfer mushrooms and pan juices to a heatproof bowl. Cover to keep warm., Add pak choy and corn to pan. Cook, tossing occasionally, for 2 minutes or until starting to wilt. Add noodles and miso mixture. Cook, tossing, for 2 minutes or until heated through and pak choy is just tender., Divide noodle mixture among serving bowls. Top with mushrooms and chilli. Serve.

name: Warm chicken, pumpkin and fetta pasta salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, peeled and seeded, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'barbecue chicken'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'penne rigate'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'roughly crumbled Greek fetta'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) olive oil, extra'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Place pumpkin, oil, salt and cracked black pepper in a large bowl and toss to combine. Transfer to a large baking tray lined with non-stick baking paper and cook for 15-20 minutes or until tender and lightly golden. Remove and set aside., Meanwhile, remove the meat from the chicken (you should have around 400g meat). Cover and set aside., Cook the penne in a large saucepan of salted boiling water according to packet instructions or until al dente. Drain and return to pan. Add the chicken, fetta and rocket., Whisk together the lemon juice, extra olive oil, salt and cracked black pepper and add to the pasta, tossing to coat evenly. Transfer to a serving bowl and top with pumpkin. Serve immediately or see note below.

name: Vegan chilli stir-fry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chilli paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'salt-reduced gluten-free soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'firm tofu, drained, cut into 1.5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'gluten-free cornflour'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'macadamia oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'sticks, thinly sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'broccolini, cut into long thin florets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, deseeded, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) cooked quinoa (about 150g uncooked)'}]
steps: Combine the chilli paste1 tsp chilli paste, 1 tbsp soy sauce and 2 tsp vinegar in a shallow glass or ceramic dish. Add the tofu450g firm tofu, drained, cut into 1.5cm pieces and turn to coat. Set aside, turning occasionally, for 5 minutes to marinate., Meanwhile, combine cornflour1 tsp gluten-free cornflour, remaining soy sauce and vinegar in a small bowl until smooth. Add the stock80ml (1/3 cup) vegetable stock and stir to combine., Heat 1 tsp oil in a wok over high heat. Add the tofu and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a plate., Heat the remaining oil in the wok then add the onion1 red onion, cut into thin wedges and celery4 celery sticks, thinly sliced diagonally. Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes or until softened then add the broccolini1 bunch broccolini, cut into long thin florets and capsicum1 red capsicum, deseeded, thinly sliced. Stir-fry for 2 minutes or until softened. Return the tofu to the wok. Pour in the stock mixture and stir-fry for 1 minute or until well combined. Add the spinach75g baby spinach and stir until just wilted. Serve with the quinoa300g (2 cups) cooked quinoa (about 150g uncooked).

name: Ham, mushroom and semi-dried tomato pie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'leeks', 'name': ', trimmed, halved lengthways, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'button mushrooms, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) milk'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) coarsely grated cheddar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '245', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'broccoli, cut into florets'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'piece ham off the bone, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'semi-dried tomatoes, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'White', 'name': 'pepper, to season'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': '(25 x 25cm) of frozen puff pastry, just thawed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', whisked'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sesame', 'name': 'seeds, for topping'}]
steps: Heat butter and oil in a saucepan over medium heat until butter melts. Cook the leek and mushroom, stirring occasionally, for 8 minutes or until soft. Add the flour and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Gradually add the milk, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon until smooth. Place over medium-high heat. stir with a wooden spoon for 2-3 minutes or until sauce thickens and comes to the boil. Add cheddar and mustard. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until cheddar melts., Place broccoli in a heatproof bowl and cover with boiling water. Set aside for 1 minute or until bright green and tender crisp. refresh under cold water. Drain. Add broccoli, ham and tomato to sauce and stir to combine. Season with salt and white pepper. Set aside to cool slightly before assembling pies., How to assemble the pies: Use six 330ml (1 1/3-cup) capacity ovenproof dishes as a guide to cut 6 discs from 3 sheets (25 x 25cm) of frozen puff pastry, just thawed. Divide the filling among the dishes. Brush top edges of dishes with whisked egg, top with pastry discs and lightly press to seal. Brush the tops with the egg. Sprinkle sesame seeds over the top. Place pies on a baking tray. Bake at 200°C for 20-25 minutes or until pastry is puffed and golden.

name: Quick sticky chicken crunchy noodle salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'cos lettuce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken mince'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) Ayam Honey and Soy Marinade and Sauce'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet qukes (baby cucumbers)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocad', 'name': 'o'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carro', 'name': 't'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'fresh red chilli (optional)'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet fried noodles'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) Kewpie Japanese Dressing Roasted Sesame'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander sprigs, to serve'}]
steps: Heat a large frying pan over high heat., While the pan heats up, separate the lettuce leaves and wash well. Arrange on a serving platter., Pour the oil into the hot pan. Add the chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, for 3-4 minutes or until the chicken changes colour. Add the sauce and cook, tossing, for 2-3 minutes or until any excess liquid has evaporated and the sauce coats the chicken. Remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly., Meanwhile, thickly slice the baby cucumbers diagonally. Peel and thinly slice the avocado. Peel then shred the carrot into long strips and thinly slice the chilli, if using., Arrange the chicken mixture, cucumber and carrot on the platter. Scatter over the noodles. Top with the avocado and drizzle over the sesame dressing. Sprinkle with coriander and chilli, if using.

name: Fresh summer pasta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried farfalle (bow‑tie) pasta'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1⁄2 cup) extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': '⁄2 tsp chilli flakes, plus extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'tomato medley mix, halved or quartered if large'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'tub burrata, drained, torn'}, {'quantity': '45', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1⁄4 cup) pine nuts, toasted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': '⁄2 cup fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': '-3 tsp balsamic glaze, to taste'}]
steps: Cook the pasta375g dried farfalle (bow‑tie) pasta in a large saucepan of salted boiling water following packet directions until al dente. Drain., Meanwhile, heat oil125ml (1⁄2 cup) extra virgin olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the onion1 small red onion, finely chopped, garlic4 garlic cloves, crushed and chilli1⁄2 tsp chilli flakes, plus extra, to serve. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until onion softens. Increase heat to high. Add the tomato600g tomato medley mix, halved or quartered if large. Cook, stirring gently, for 2 minutes or until just softened. Season., Add the pasta to the pan. Cook, tossing gently, for 2 minutes or until heated through. Divide among serving plates. Top with the burrata100g tub burrata, drained, torn, pine nuts45g (1⁄4 cup) pine nuts, toasted, basil1⁄2 cup fresh basil leaves, extra chilli and balsamic2-3 tsp balsamic glaze, to . Serve immediately.

name: Chicken with pine nut stuffing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach leaves, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1.7', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'whole chicken'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh multigrain breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'toasted pine nuts'}, {'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'mixed vegetables (such as potatoes, parsnip and carrots)'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add garlic and onion. Cook, stirring often, for 4 minutes or until soft. Add spinach. Cook for 1 minute. Cool., Meanwhile, rinse chicken. Pat-dry inside and out with paper towels. Season cavity with salt and pepper. Rub skin with 1 tablespoon of oil, and salt and pepper., Combine thyme, breadcrumbs, cooled spinach mixture, nuts, and salt and pepper. Mix well. Lift the skin at cavity end of chicken breast. Gently separate skin from flesh on chicken breasts. Press 1/3 cup of stuffing under skin. Massage skin with your fingertips to distribute stuffing. Fill chicken cavity with remaining stuffing. Tie legs together with cooking string., Place chicken, breast-side up, into a roasting pan. Arrange vegetables around chicken. Brush chicken and vegetables with remaining oil. Roast for 1 hour or until juices run clear when thickest part of chicken is pierced with a skewer and vegetables are crisp and tender. Remove from oven. Cover with foil. Stand for 10 minutes. Serve chicken with vegetables.

name: Cauliflower and millet mash
ingredient: [{'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'millet, rinsed, drained (see notes)'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cauliflower', 'name': 'head, cut into florets'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil, plus extra to serve'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'roughly chopped fresh chives'}]
steps: Melt butter in a frying pan over medium heat. Cook onion, stirring, for 8 minutes or until softened but not browned. Add garlic. Cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Remove from heat., Meanwhile, place millet and 2 1/2 cups water in a medium saucepan over high heat. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer, covered, for 20 minutes or until millet is almost tender., Add cauliflower. Simmer, covered, for a further 20 minutes or until millet and cauliflower are tender., Add oil and onion mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Using a food processor or stick blender, process until smooth. Stand for 10 minutes to allow mash to thicken. Drizzle with extra oil and sprinkle with chives. Serve (see notes).

name: Middle Eastern style fish with green bean and chickpea salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) currants'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) pine nuts, toasted'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) tahini'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) water'}, {'quantity': '90', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) Tamar Valley Greek Style Yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'skinless', 'name': 'firm white fish fillets'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Ground', 'name': 'cumin, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Grilled', 'name': 'lemon halves, to serve'}]
steps: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large frying pan over low heat. Add the onion and season with salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes or until golden and soft. Stir in the vinegar. Cook for 10 minutes or until caramelised. Remove from heat. Stir in the currants and pine nuts., Meanwhile, combine the tahini, lemon juice and water in a small bowl until smooth. Stir in the yoghurt and garlic. Season with salt., To make the green bean and chickpea salad, combine the oil, lemon juice and mustard in a screw-top jar. Season. Shake to combine. Cook the beans in a saucepan of boiling water for 1-2 minutes or until bright green and tender crisp. Refresh under cold water. Drain. Combine the beans, chickpeas and parsley in a large bowl. Drizzle over the dressing and toss to combine., Heat butter and remaining oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Cook fish for 3-5 minutes each side or until cooked through., Divide the bean mixture among plates. Top with the fish and spoon over the sauce. Sprinkle with a little cumin and top with onion mixture. Serve with grilled lemon halves.

name: Raspberry & pistachio ice-cream pudding
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2.25', 'unit': 'L', 'name': 'Streets Blue Ribbon Vanilla Ice-Cream, softened'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '125g punnets fresh raspberries'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted pistachio kernels, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'rosewater essence (see note)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Honey', 'name': ', to drizzle'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'raspberries, extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Unsalted', 'name': 'pistachio kernels, extra, finely chopped, to serve'}]
steps: Line a 2.5L (10-cup) capacity pudding basin with a double layer of plastic wrap, allowing the sides to overhang., Place the ice-cream in a large bowl. Gently fold in the raspberries, pistachio and rosewaterTransfer. to the prepared basin. Cover the surface with overhanging plastic wrap. Place in the freezer for 8 hours or overnight until firm., Place a serving platter in the freezer to chill slightly. Turn the pudding onto the platter. Remove the plastic wrap and place in the freezer for 20 minutes or until firm., Drizzle over honeyTop. with extra raspberries and pistachio.

name: Snow pea & ginger stir fry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'asparagus, cut into 4cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby corn, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow peas, trimmed, halved diagonally'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Kikkoman soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': "Chang's sesame oil"}]
steps: Heat oil in a wok or frying pan over a medium-high heat. Add asparagus and corn, and stir-fry for 3 minutes. Add the snow peas, ginger and garlic and stir-fry a further 1 minute., Add the soy sauce and cook for 1 minute. Toss through the sesame oil. Serve immediately, as an accompaniment to your favourite beef, lamb or chicken dish.

name: Cherry vanilla soda
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherries, halved, pitted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'vanilla', 'name': 'bean, split'}, {'quantity': '1 1/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'litres', 'name': 'soda water, chilled'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Ice', 'name': 'cubes, to serve'}]
steps: Place cherries, vanilla bean, sugar, lemon juice and 1 1/4 cups cold water in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until sugar has dissolved. Increase heat to high. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 35 to 40 minutes or until slightly thickened. Remove from heat. Cool. Strain through a fine sieve into a bottle or jug. Discard cherries and vanilla bean. Refrigerate, covered, for 30 minutes or until chilled., Add 2 tablespoons fruit syrup to each glass. Top with soda water. Serve with ice.

name: Pumpkin gnocchi with leek & basil butter
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'coliban (washed) potatoes'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, deseeded, quartered'}, {'quantity': '115', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) plain flour'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with non-stick baking paper. Place potatoes and pumpkin on the tray and bake in oven for 1 hour or until tender. Set aside for 20 minutes to cool., Peel the potatoes and pumpkin and place in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Use a potato masher or fork to mash until smooth., Add the flour and stir with a wooden spoon until combined. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Divide dough into 4 portions. Roll 1 portion into a 2cm-diameter log. Use a lightly floured knife to cut into 2cm pieces. Place on the lined tray. Repeat with remaining dough portions., Roll each piece of dough into a ball. Roll each ball over the back of a lightly floured fork. Place on the tray., To make the leek & basil butter, heat the oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the leek and cook, stirring, for 1-2 minutes or until golden. Use a slotted spoon to transfer to a plate lined with paper towel. Add the basil and chilli to the pan and cook for 1 minute or until crisp. Transfer to the plate. Add butter to the pan and stir for 1-2 minutes or until melted and golden. Pour into a small jug and cover to keep warm., Bring a saucepan of water to the boil over high heat. Add one-quarter of the gnocchi and cook for 2-3 minutes or until the gnocchi rises to surface. Use a slotted spoon to transfer to serving plates. Repeat with remaining gnocchi. Drizzle over butter and top with leek, basil and chilli to serve.

name: Lentil and roast capsicum tabouli
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'burghul'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'boiling water'}, {'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chargrilled capsicum, drained, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can lentils, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'slices, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'parsley leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Combine burghul and boiling water in a large heatproof bowl. Cover. Stand for 15 minutes or until water has absorbed., Add capsicum, parsley, mint, lentils, lemon rind, lemon juice, chilli and oil. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Top with lemon slices and parsley. Serve.

name: Harissa-roasted salmon with sumac mayonnaise
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '900g each) salmon fillets'}]
steps: To make harissa, place chillies in a bowl and cover with boiling water. Soak for 30 minutes. Drain well. Place coriander seeds, caraway and cumin in a frying pan over low heat; cook, tossing, for 1 minute or until aromatic. Place chilli, spices, coriander leaves, garlic, and mint in a food processor and process until finely chopped. With the motor running, add oil in a thin, steady stream. Season with salt and pepper., Preheat oven to 200°C. Place 1 salmon fillet, skin-side down, on a work surface. Spread evenly with the harissa. Top with remaining fillet, skin-side up. Tie with string at 5cm intervals to secure. Place on a large oven tray. Roast for 30 minutes for medium or until cooked to your liking. Remove from oven and set aside for 5 minutes to rest., Meanwhile, to make sumac mayonnaise, place egg yolks, lemon juice, mustard powder and sumac in the bowl of a food processor; process until combined. With the motor running, gradually add oil in a thin, steady stream until thick and pale. Taste and season with salt and pepper., Place the salmon on a large serving platter. Serve with sumac mayonnaise.

name: Tofu & noodle salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2 200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkts Thai-flavoured firm tofu'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '1 300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt fresh thin egg noodles'}, {'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Chinese cabbage, core removed, finely shredded'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', peeled, coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'shallots, trimmed, thinly sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow pea sprouts, stems trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Freshly', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}]
steps: Cut each tofu square in half diagonally. Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the tofu and cook for 1 minute each side or until slightly crisp and heated through. Transfer to a large plate lined with paper towel. Cover loosely with foil to keep warm., Meanwhile, bring a saucepan of salted water to the boil. Add noodles and cook for 2 minutes or until tender. Drain. Place in a bowl with cabbage, carrots, green shallots, snow pea sprouts and tofu, and toss to combine., Whisk the lemon juice and soy sauce in a small jug to combine. Taste and season with pepper. Pour the lemon dressing over the salad and toss to combine well. Divide the salad among serving bowls and serve immediately.

name: Cauliflower toast
ingredient: [{'quantity': '420', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cauliflower, cut into florets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) coarsely grated mozzarella'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'basil pesto'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Micro', 'name': 'herbs, to serve (optional)'}]
steps: Process the cauliflower in a food processor until it resembles rice. Place in a non-stick frying pan and cook over medium heat, stirring often, for 5 minutes or until tender. Transfer to a bowl and set aside to cool. Wipe the pan clean., Add the parmesan and egg to the cauliflower. Divide mixture into 4 portions. Spray the pan with oil and return to medium heat. Place 2 portions of the cauliflower mixture in the pan and use a spatula to press each into a square. Cook for 4 minutes or until lightly golden. Carefully turn. Press into shape. Cook for 3 minutes. Top 1 cauliflower square with half the mozzarella and half of the pesto. Cover with the other square. Cook until cheese melts. Transfer to a plate., Repeat with the remaining cauliflower mixture mozzarella and pesto to create another toastie. Cut in half to serve.

name: Salmon and dill quiches
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'frozen shortcrust pastry, thawed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'light cream or milk'}, {'quantity': '210', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can John West Salmon, drained, flaked'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dill, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', finely grated and juiced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Rocket', 'name': 'salad, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C. Lightly grease 4 x 9.5cm fluted or plain pie pans., Cut 4 x 14cm rounds from pastry. Ease pastry into prepared dishes, extending over edge. Chill for 10 mins. Trim., Line pastry cases with baking paper. Fill with dried beans or rice. Bake for 10 mins. Remove paper and filling. Bake cases for a further 5 mins. Allow to cool., In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, cream, salmon, dill, lemon zest and juice. Season to taste. Pour mixture evenly between pastry cases. Arrange on an oven tray., Bake for 15-20 mins, or until filling is golden and set. Serve warm or cold, topped with rocket salad.

name: Roast chicken with tarragon & mustard cream
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '1.2kg each) whole chickens'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'fresh tarragon'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, peeled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', halved'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) verjuice'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) pouring cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'wholegrain mustard'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Rinse the chicken2 (about 1.2kg each) whole chickens inside and out under cold running water. Pat dry with paper towel. Place on a rack in a flameproof roasting pan. Reserve 2 tarragon sprigs. Chop the remaining tarragon. Insert 1 reserved tarragon sprig, 2 garlic cloves and half a lemon1 lemon, halved into the cavity of each chicken. Use unwaxed white kitchen string to tie the legs together. Brush chickens with some of the melted butter50g butter, melted. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with half the chopped tarragon., Roast for 30 minutes. Brush with some of the melted butter. Roast for a further 45 minutes, brushing occasionally with melted butter, or until golden brown and the juices run clear when the thighs are pierced with a skewer. Transfer to a platter. Cover with foil and set aside to rest., Pour the pan juices from the roasting pan into a small jug. Skim to remove any excess fat. Add the verjuice60ml (1/4 cup) verjuice to the roasting pan. Place over medium heat. Simmer, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes or until reduced by half. Add the reserved pan juices and stock500ml (2 cups) chicken stock. Simmer, stirring, for 5 minutes or until the liquid is reduced slightly. Stir in the cream125ml (1/2 cup) pouring cream and simmer for 5 minutes or until thickened slightly. Strain the mixture into a large jug. Stir in the mustard1 tbsp wholegrain mustard and parsley1/4 cup chopped fresh continental parsley. Serve with the chicken.

name: Turkish pizza with tomato and mint
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Australian 3 star beef mince'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'allspice'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) beef stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh flat-leaf parsley, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'toasted pine nuts'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Mission round plain pizza bases'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Perino grape tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'small fresh mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(95g) natural yoghurt'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook, stirring, for 5 mins or until onion softens. Add beef mince and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up any lumps, for 5 minutes, or until the meat is browned. Add spices and stock. Cook for 5 mins or until the liquid is almost absorbed. Add parsley and pine nuts and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper., Place pizza bases on baking trays lined with baking paper. Spread with tomato paste and top with mince mixture. Bake for 15-20 mins or until base is golden and crisp., To serve, top pizzas with tomato and mint leaves and a dollop of yoghurt.

name: Pancetta wrapped barramundi
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'lemons'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'capers, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely-chopped chives'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'barramundi fillets, cut into 12 pieces'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'thin', 'name': 'slices pancetta'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed salad leaves'}]
steps: Grate rind and juice 1 lemon. Cut remaining lemon into wedges and set aside. Combine grated lemon rind, butter, capers and chives together in a bowl. Season fish fillets with salt and pepper. Spread chive butter over both sides fish. Wrap 1 piece pancetta around centre of each piece of fish (see note)., Heat a large, heavy-based, non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook fish, in batches, for 2 to 3 minutes each side or until just cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Cover loosely with foil to keep warm., Place salad leaves and 1/4 cup lemon juice in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Serve fish with salad leaves and lemon wedges.

name: Sausages with Asian coleslaw
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'chicken', 'name': 'sausages'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}]
steps: Preheat a barbecue plate on medium heat. Lightly spray sausages with oil. Cook sausages, turning frequently, for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden and cooked through., Make Asian coleslaw: Meanwhile, combine snow peas, beansprouts, carrot, capsicum and coriander in a large bowl. Serve with sausages.

name: Loaded hasselback potatoes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'Red', 'name': 'Royale potatoes'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Australian 4 Star Beef Mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'taco seasoning'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(80g) Coles Australian Shredded Tasty Cheddar'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80g) sour cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C. Place 1 potato on a clean work surface. Place a chopstick on the board along each side of the potato. Use a large sharp knife to thinly slice the potato down to the level of the chopsticks (this stops you from cutting all the way through). Repeat with remaining potatoes. Place cut-side up on a baking tray. Season. Bake for 1 hour or until potatoes are tender., Meanwhile, heat a non-stick frying pan over high heat. Cook mince, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up lumps, for 5 mins or until cooked through. Add taco seasoning and 1/4 cup (60ml) water. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 5 mins or until mixture thickens., Spoon the mince mixture onto the potatoes, pushing into the cuts. Sprinkle with the cheddar. Bake for a further 10-15 mins or until cheddar melts and is golden brown. Top with sour cream and sprinkle with spring onion.

name: Pork with orange and ginger sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dry sherry'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'salt-reduced soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '300g each) pork fillets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cornflour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cold water'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Massel vegetable stock powder'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) hot water'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) orange juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': '-piece fresh ginger, peeled, cut into thin matchsticks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dry sherry, extra'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'navel', 'name': 'oranges, segmented'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'Asian greens, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C. Combine the sesame oil, sherry and 1 tablespoon soy sauce in a dish. Add pork. Turn to coat. Cover. Place in fridge for 30 minutes to marinate., Dissolve cornflour in the cold water. Dissolve stock powder in the hot water. Combine mixtures in a jug. Stir in orange juice, honey, and remaining soy sauce., Heat a frying pan over high heat. Spray with oil. Drain pork. Cook for 2 minutes each side. Roast on a baking tray for 10-12 minutes for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate. Cover with foil. Rest for 5 minutes., Heat frying pan over medium heat. Stir in ginger for 1 minute. Stir in extra sherry for 1 minute. Stir in honey mixture for 2 minutes or until sauce thickens. Add orange. Slice pork and spoon over sauce. Serve with greens.

name: Tray-roasted chicken with potatoes and garlic gravy
ingredient: [{'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'thyme sprigs'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '220g each) chicken marylands'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'chat potatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'pickling', 'name': 'onions, peeled, halved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'rosemary sprigs'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'De Bortoli white wine'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '35', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sachet onion and mushroom gravy mix'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/200°C fan-forced. Remove leaves from 3 thyme sprigs. Place chicken, potato, onion, remaining thyme sprigs, rosemary sprigs and garlic (unpeeled) in a large baking tray. Drizzle with wine and oil. Sprinkle chicken with thyme leaves. Roast for 30 minutes. Remove garlic. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Carefully squeeze garlic flesh from skins. Discard skins., Make gravy following packet directions. Add garlic. Whisk to combine. Remove baking tray from oven. Remove and discard thyme and rosemary sprigs., Serve chicken with potato, onion and garlic gravy.

name: Barbecued Spanish-style lamb
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Coles Australian Lamb Leg Boneless Roast Range'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby white potatoes, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onions, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, seeded, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'vine-ripened cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80g) kalamata olives'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Flat', 'name': '-leaf parsley leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Bakery Stone Baked Pane Di Casa bread, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat a covered barbecue on medium. (Alternatively, preheat oven to 200C.), Combine the lemon juice, half the oil, garlic and paprika in a small bowl. Season well. Rub all over the lamb to coat. Place the lamb, potato, onion and capsicum in a disposable baking dish., Roast in covered barbecue using indirect heat for 40 mins. Add the tomatoes and olives and cook for 20 mins or until the vegetables are tender and lamb is cooked to your liking. (Alternatively, cook in oven for 40 mins. Add the tomatoes and olives and cook for 20 mins or until the vegetables are tender and lamb is cooked to your liking.) Transfer the lamb to a serving plate. Cover with foil and set aside for 10 mins to rest., Sprinkle the lamb with parsley. Serve with the tomato mixture and bread.

name: Herb and raw beetroot tabouli
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'burghul, rinsed, drained (see note)'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beetroot, peeled, coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'roughly chopped fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'roughly chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'roughly chopped fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh dill'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pepitas, toasted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'slivered almonds, toasted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds,  toasted'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}]
steps: Place burghul in a large heatproof bowl. Cover burghul with boiling water. Stand, covered, for 10 minutes to soften., Line a sieve with a clean tea towel. Drain burghul through sieve. Bring up sides of tea towel and squeeze to remove as much moisture from burghul as possible. Set aside for 30 minutes to cool., Place burghul, beetroot, basil, parsley, coriander, dill, pepitas, almonds, sesame seeds, oil and juice in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Serve.

name: Stir-fried vegetable rice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '225', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'jasmine rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', cut into thin sticks'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'thin French beans, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'asparagus, woody ends trimmed, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'carrot, peeled, cut into thin strips'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'green curry paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Thai basil leaves (see Notes)'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'shallots', 'name': '(spring onions), sliced'}]
steps: Cook the rice in a saucepan of boiling, salted water, then drain well. Allow to cool, then refrigerate overnight., Blanch the zucchini, beans, asparagus, peas and carrot in boiling, salted water for 1 minute, then drain, refresh under cold water and set aside., Heat the oil in a wok over high heat, then add the curry paste and stir-fry for a few seconds or until fragrant. Add onion, garlic and ginger, and cook for, 1 minute. Add the blanched vegetables and cook for 2-3 minutes or until just tender. Add the rice and heat through, then stir in the fish and soy sauce, basil leaves and shallots.

name: Mexican beef roast with charred tomato salsa
ingredient: [{'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef eye round roast'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '40g sachet chilli con carne recipe base'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, unpeeled'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'white onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sliced pickled jalapenos, finely chopped (optional)'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'mini', 'name': 'white corn tortillas'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Shredded', 'name': 'lettuce, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Reduced', 'name': '-fat grated cheddar, to serve'}]
steps: Place beef in a shallow glass or ceramic dish. Sprinkle with seasoning. Rub all over to coat. Refrigerate for 1 hour, if time permits., Preheat oven to 220°C/200°C fan-forced. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place beef on prepared tray. Roast for 45 minutes for medium or until cooked to your liking., Meanwhile, heat a medium frying pan over medium heat. Add tomatoes and garlic. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes or until charred and garlic is tender. Peel garlic. Place tomatoes and garlic in a food processor. Pulse until finely chopped. Transfer to a bowl. Stir in onion, coriander and jalapenos., Thinly slice beef. Serve beef with tortillas, salsa, lettuce and cheese.

name: Pistachio & mustard crusted beef with quince jus
ingredient: [{'quantity': '215', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) pistachio kernels'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'firmly packed fresh continental parsley leaves, chopped'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) coarse sourdough breadcrumbs (made from day-old bread)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '2.5kg each) beef standing rib roasts (4 cutlets on each), French trimmed'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3 cups) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '100g ctns quince paste'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Process pistachio215g (1 1/2 cups) pistachio kernels, parsley1 cup firmly packed fresh continental parsley leaves, chopped and breadcrumbs70g (1 cup) coarse sourdough breadcrumbs (made from day-old bread) in a food processor until coarsely chopped. Add the mustard2 tbsp Dijon mustard and egg2 eggs, lightly whisked and process until well combined. Season with salt and pepper., Use kitchen string to tie the beef2 (about 2.5kg each) beef standing rib roasts (4 cutlets on each), French trimmed crossways, in 3 places, between the bones. Place in a large roasting pan. Press the pistachio mixture firmly over the beef to coat., Cover the crust loosely with foil. Roast for 10 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 180ºC. Roast for a further 2 hours for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a serving platter and cover with foil. Set aside for 5 minutes to rest., Meanwhile, heat the stock750ml (3 cups) chicken stock and quince paste2 x 100g ctns quince paste in the roasting pan over medium heat, stirring with a flat-edged wooden spoon to dislodge any bits that have cooked onto the base. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 5-10 minutes or until reduced by half. Season with salt and pepper. Strain sauce through a fine sieve into a jug. Use a spoon or paper towel to remove any excess fat from the surface., Serve the beef with the sauce.

name: Snapper with radicchio & witlof salad
