ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'radicchio', 'name': ', leaves torn'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'witlof', 'name': ', leaves separated (see Notes)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'artichoke hearts in oil, drained, quartered (see Notes)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '180g skinless snapper fillets'}]
steps: Shake the vinaigrette ingredients in a screw-top jar. Toss the leaves and artichoke with half the dressing., Heat oil in a large, non-stick frypan over medium-high heat. Cook fish for 2-3 minutes each side until just cooked. Divide salad among plates and top with fish. Drizzle with remaining dressing and season with pepper.

name: Pina colada pie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet butternut snap biscuits'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'desiccated coconut'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '440', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can crushed pineapple, drained (see notes)'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lemon curd'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '165', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Finely', 'name': 'grated lemon rind, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Roasted', 'name': 'coconut chips, to serve'}]
steps: Grease a 2.5cm-deep, 11.5cm x 34cm (base) loose-based fluted tart pan. Process biscuits and coconut until fine crumbs. Add butter. Process until just combined. Press mixture over base and side of prepared pan. Refrigerate for 30 minutes., Drain pineapple on paper towel. Pat dry. Combine pineapple and lemon curd in a bowl. Spoon over biscuit base, spreading to level. Refrigerate for 1 hour., Using an electric mixer, beat cream, coconut milk and caster sugar until soft peaks form., Remove tart from pan and place on serving plate. Dollop with cream (see notes). Sprinkle with lemon rind and coconut chips. Serve.

name: Osso bucco risotto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '2.2kg) Coles Australian No Added Hormones Beef Osso Bucco'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried Italian herbs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'sticks, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) red wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) salt-reduced beef stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans crushed tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'dried', 'name': 'bay leaves'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(150g) Coles Arborio Rice'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80g) pitted Sicilian green olives, sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'rosemary', 'name': 'sprigs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon zest'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(40g) finely grated parmesan'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 160°C. Place the beef, flour and Italian herbs in a large bowl. Toss to coat. Season. Heat oil in an 8-cup (2L) ovenproof casserole pan over medium-high heat. Cook the beef, in batches, for 2 mins each side or until browned. Transfer to a plate., Add the onion, carrot, celery and garlic to the pan. Cook, stirring, for 2 mins or until the onion softens slightly. Add wine. Bring to a simmer. Cook for 5 mins or until wine reduces slightly. Stir in the stock, crushed tomatoes and bay leaves. Return the beef to the pan. Cover and bake for 2 hours., Transfer the beef to a plate. Stir the rice into the tomato mixture. Return the beef to the pan. Bake, covered, for 40 mins or until the beef and rice are tender. Stir in half the olive. Top with the remaining olive, rosemary, lemon zest and parmesan.

name: Korean beef bowl
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'brown rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'rice bran oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece fresh ginger, peeled, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lean beef mince'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Korean BBQ bulgogi sauce and marinade'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumbers, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'roasted peanuts, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sriracha', 'name': 'chilli sauce, to serve'}]
steps: Cook rice following absorption method on packet., Meanwhile, heat wok over medium-high heat. Add 1 teaspoon oil. Swirl to coat. Add egg. Swirl to coat base of wok. Cook, without stirring, for 1 minute or until set. Transfer to a chopping board. Roll up. Thinly slice., Add remaining oil to wok. Add garlic and ginger. Stir-fry for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Increase heat to high. Add mince. Cook, breaking up mince with a wooden spoon, for 6 to 8 minutes or until browned and cooked through. Add bulgogi sauce. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until sauce has boiled and reduced., Using a julienne peeler, cut carrots into long thin strips, or thinly slice., Divide rice among serving bowls. Top with mince mixture, carrot, cucumber, omelette, onion, peanuts and sesame seeds. Drizzle with chilli sauce. Serve.

name: Banana honey loaf
ingredient: [{'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'wholemeal self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'bicarbonate of soda'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'firmly-packed brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'ripe', 'name': 'bananas, peeled, mashed'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line base and sides of a 7cm-deep, 10.5cm x 20.5cm (base) loaf pan with baking paper, allowing a 2cm overhang at both long ends., Combine butter100g butter, chopped and honey1/3 cup honey in a heatproof, microwave-safe bowl. Microwave, uncovered, on MEDIUM (50%) for 1 to 2 minutes or until melted., Sift flours2 cups wholemeal self-raising flour|1 cup plain flour, bicarbonate of soda1 tsp bicarbonate of soda, baking powder1 tsp baking powder, cinnamon1 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon and saltPinch salt into a large bowl (add husks from sieve). Stir in sugar1/2 cup firmly-packed brown sugar., Combine milk1 cup milk, egg2 eggs, lightly beaten and banana2 ripe bananas, peeled, mashed in a large jug. Whisk with a fork until well combined. Add banana mixture and honey mixture to dry ingredients. Stir with a metal spoon until just combined., Pour mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 60 to 70 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Cool loaf in pan for 10 minutes. Lift onto a wire rack to cool completely. Slice and serve.

name: Indian kofta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lean beef mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece fresh ginger, peeled, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tandoori paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'mango chutney'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a large baking tray with baking paper., Combine mince, ginger, garlic, onion, tandoori, chutney, and salt and pepper in a large bowl. Mix with clean hands until well combined. Roll tablespoonfuls of mixture into balls. Place onto baking tray. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until cooked., To make yoghurt sauce: Place 1/2 cup yoghurt and mint leaves into the bowl of a food processor. Process until mint is finely chopped and sauce is green. Transfer to a bowl. Add remaining yoghurt, chutney and salt. Stir to combine., Serve kofta with basmati rice, pappadams and yoghurt sauce. Garnish with mint leaves.

name: Giant vegetarian ‘sausage’ rolls
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, peeled, deseeded, cut into 2.5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '500g) cauliflower, cut into florets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Chopped Kale'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can lentils, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'feta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'frozen puff pastry, just thawed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sesame', 'name': 'seeds, to sprinkle'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Tomato', 'name': 'chutney, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan forced and line 2 baking trays with baking paper. Arrange the pumpkin on 1 prepared tray. Arrange the cauliflower on the other prepared tray. Spray vegetables with oil and bake for 30 minutes or until tender and golden. Set aside to cool., Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Cook the onion, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until soft and lightly golden. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds or until aromatic. Add the kale and lemon juice and cook, tossing, for 3 minutes or until the kale is wilted. Transfer mixture to a large bowl. Set aside to cool slightly., Add the cooled roasted vegetables, lentils and feta to the kale mixture. Season to taste. Divide into 2 equal portions., Place a sheet of pastry on a clean work surface. Place 1 portion of filling on the pastry, about 4cm from the edge closest to you, in a log shape. Brush the far edge of pastry with egg. Carefully roll up from the front to enclose the filling. Place on a baking tray lined with baking paper. Repeat with the remaining pastry and filling., Brush rolls with remaining egg. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake for 40 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown. Slice and serve with tomato chutney.

name: Lamb scottadito with spinach alla romana
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'English spinach'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil, plus extra to brush'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, very thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'pine nuts, toasted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sultanas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'french', 'name': '-trimmed lamb cutlets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', quartered, to serve'}]
steps: Trim thick stalks off spinach. Wash well. Heat a large, dry non-stick frypan on high heat., Add spinach, turning with tongs as it wilts down. Keep the pan over high heat to evaporate any water. Remove the spinach when softly wilted. Drain on paper towel., Preheat barbecue or grill on high. Heat oil in the same pan over medium-high heat and gently fry garlic until golden., Immediately return spinach to pan with pine nuts and sultanas, tossing quickly until hot and well-dressed. Divide among warm plates and scatter with lemon zest., Meanwhile, brush lamb with oil and season. Grill very quickly on a chargrill or barbecue over high heat for 1-2 minutes each side until they are scorched and sizzling hot. Serve with spinach and lemon.

name: Creamy chicken and spinach bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'penne rigate'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken mince'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, peeled, grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh sage'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'creamy original soy milk (we used Vitasoy brand)'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cornflour'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'potato chips, roughly crushed'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Cook pasta250g penne rigate in a large saucepan of boiling, salted water, following packet directions, until tender. Drain. Cover to keep warm., Meanwhile, heat oil1 tbsp olive oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add onion1 brown onion, chopped. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until onion is tender. Add mince500g chicken mince. Cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up mince, for 10 minutes or until browned. Add pumpkin300g butternut pumpkin, peeled, grated, sage1 tbsp chopped fresh sage, stock1/2 cup Chicken stock and soy milk2 cups creamy original soy milk (we used Vitasoy brand). Simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes or until pumpkin is just tender., Combine cornflour1 1/2 tbsp cornflour and 2 tablespoons of warm water. Stir into sauce. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until sauce boils and thickens. Add spinach150g baby spinach and pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine., Spoon mixture into a 12-cup capacity ovenproof dish. Sprinkle with chips50g potato chips, roughly crushed. Bake for 15 minutes or until chips are golden.

name: Raspberry and coconut bliss balls
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coconut flakes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Freedom Foods Barley+ Traditional Porridge oats'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pepita and sunflower seed mix'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'almond kernels'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cashew spread'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen raspberries'}]
steps: Place 1/2 the coconut flakes in a food processor. Process until roughly chopped. Transfer to a shallow bowl. Set aside., Place oats, seed mix, almonds, cashew spread, honey, vanilla, raspberries and remaining coconut in a food processor. Process until mixture is finely chopped and just comes together., Roll 1 level tablespoon of mixture into balls. Roll in coconut to lightly coat. Place on a large plate. Refrigerate for 20 minutes or until firm. Serve.

name: Poached chicken salad with maple-baked pears
ingredient: [{'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'litre', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'packham pears, quartered, cored, stems intact'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'maple syrup'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'walnuts'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'parmesan, shaved'}]
steps: Place chicken600g chicken breast fillets in a large saucepan. Cover with chicken stock1 litre chicken stock. Bring to the boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stand for 15 minutes. Remove from saucepan. Cool. Thinly slice., Meanwhile, preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced. Place pears3 small packham pears, quartered, cored, stems intact on a baking paper-lined tray. Drizzle with maple syrup1/2 cup maple syrup. Bake for 35 minutes or until pears are caramelised and tender, adding walnuts2/3 cup walnuts to tray halfway through cooking time., Arrange rocket80g baby rocket in a large serving dish. Top with onion1/2 red onion, thinly sliced, pears, walnuts and chicken., Whisk oil1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil and vinegar2 tbsp red wine vinegar together. Drizzle over the salad. Scatter with parmesan50g parmesan, shaved and leftover pan juices from the pears. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

name: Lamb cutlets with char-grilled vegetable couscous
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'lamb', 'name': 'cutlets, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'button', 'name': 'mushrooms, quartered'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'onions', 'name': ', cut into eighths'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, seeded, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'couscous'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': "hot Campbell's Real Stock Vegetable"}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onion, sliced'}]
steps: Brush cutlets with half the oil and toss in combined spices. Arrange on a tray and chill until required. Preheat char-grill on high., Place couscous in a bowl and pour stock over. Cover for 5 minutes until stock is absorbed. Fluff with a fork. Season to taste and mix onion through., Brush vegetables with remaining oil and char-grill 1-2 minutes each side. Toss through couscous. Char-grill lamb for 2-3 minutes each side and serve with couscous.

name: Fish with chilli lime noodle salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet fresh hokkien noodles'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chilli, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sweet chilli sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen dory fish fillets, thawed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Toasted', 'name': 'unsalted cashew nuts, to serve'}]
steps: Place noodles in a heatproof bowl. Cover with boiling water. Set aside for 2 to 3 minutes or until tender. Separate with a fork. Drain. Return to bowl. Add onion, chilli and coriander. Toss to combine., Combine chilli sauce, lime juice and fish sauce in a jug. Reserve 2 tablespoons sauce mixture. Add remaining mixture to noodles. Toss to combine., Spray a frying pan with oil. Heat over medium-high heat. Cook fish for 2 to 3 minutes each side or until cooked through., Divide noodle mixture and fish between bowls. Top with reserved sauce mixture and nuts. Serve.

name: Club sandwich salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Bakery white sourdough baguette'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'pancetta', 'name': 'slices'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '150g each) Coles RSPCA Approved chicken breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Brand Australian free range eggs'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(100g) whole-egg mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'white wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'wholegrain mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'oakleaf', 'name': 'lettuce, leaves separated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocado', 'name': ', stone removed, peeled, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped chives'}]
steps: Heat a barbecue grill or chargrill on medium-high. Use a serrated knife to cut baguette diagonally into 5mm-thick slices. Brush with a little of the oil. Cook on grill for 1 min each side or until lightly toasted. Transfer to a plate., Cook the pancetta on grill for 1 min each side or until crisp. Transfer to a plate. Break into shards. Brush chicken with remaining oil. Cook for 5 mins each side or until golden and cooked through. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil. Set aside for 5 mins to rest. Thinly slice., Meanwhile, cook the eggs in a small saucepan of boiling water for 7 mins for semi-soft yolks or until cooked to your liking. Refresh under cold water. Peel eggs and cut in half., Combine the mayonnaise, vinegar and mustard in a small bowl., Arrange the lettuce and avocado on a large serving plate. Top with the baguette, pancetta and chicken. Drizzle with the dressing and top with egg. Season with pepper and sprinkle with chives to serve.

name: Impossible zucchini and salami quiche
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'salami (we used: red wine garlic salami - see note)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '3 cheese blend'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry truss tomatoes, cut into 4 small bunches'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', very thinly sliced'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Grease a 21cm (base) pie dish., Chop 200g salami. Heat oil in a medium frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook onion, stirring, for 4 minutes or until softened. Add chopped salami. Cook, stirring for 2 minutes or until starting to crisp. Remove from heat. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel. Cool 10 minutes., Whisk eggs, milk, flour and cheese in a bowl. Add onion mixture. Stir to combine. Pour into prepared dish. Top with cherry tomatoes and zucchini slices. Fold remaining salami into bundles and place in egg mixture. Bake for 45 minutes or until centre has set. Stand 10 minutes. Serve

name: Parmesan-crumbed artichokes with basil aioli
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '170g jars marinated artichoke hearts, drained'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) fresh breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) good quality aioli'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'firmly packed fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vegetable', 'name': 'oil, for deep-frying'}]
steps: Line a baking tray with baking paper. Gently pat the artichokes dry with paper towel., Place the flour on a plate. Place the egg in a shallow bowl. Combine breadcrumbs and parmesan in a separate shallow bowl. Dust 1 artichoke in the flour. Shake off excess. Dip in the egg, then in the breadcrumb mixture, pressing firmly to coat. Place on the prepared tray and repeat with the remaining artichokes, flour, egg and breadcrumb mixture. Place in the fridge to chill for 1 hour or until firm., Meanwhile, blend the aioli and 1/2 cup of basil leaves in a blender until well combined and smooth., Add oil to a large, deep saucepan to reach a depth of 12cm. Heat to 180C over medium-high heat (when the oil is ready a cube of bread turns golden brown in 15 seconds). Deep-fry the artichokes, in 3 batches, for 1 1/2 minutes or until crisp and golden. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel to drain., Carefully deep-fry remaining basil leaves, a few at a time, for 10 seconds or until crisp. Drain on paper towel. Repeat with remaining basil leaves., Transfer the artichokes to a platter. Sprinkle with the deep-fried basil leaves. Serve with the basil aioli.

name: Lamb cutlets with chickpea and zucchini curry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'zucchinis'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onio', 'name': 'n'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) olive oil, plus extra, to cook'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Patak’s Eggplant Pickle, (see note) plus extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans chickpeas'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'lamb', 'name': 'cutlets'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Coriander', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Greek', 'name': '-style yoghurt, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pappadums', 'name': ', to serve'}]
steps: Cut zucchinis into 1.5cm pieces. Peel onion and garlic, then finely chop. Toss zucchinis with oil, spices and 1 teaspoon salt in a bowl until combined., Heat a heavy-based frying pan over medium heat. Add zucchini mixture and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until it starts to soften. Add onion and garlic, and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes, then add tomato paste and eggplant pickle, and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Drain chickpeas, rinse, then drain again. Add to pan with 250ml (1 cup) water and simmer for 8 minutes or until chickpeas are warmed through., Meanwhile, heat a large, heavy-based frying pan over high heat. Rub lamb with a little oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 1 minute each side for medium or until cooked to your liking., Scatter coriander over curry and serve with lamb cutlets, extra eggplant pickle, yoghurt and pappadums.

name: Sticky honey-soy wings
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'salt-reduced soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '(', 'name': '1.5kg) chicken wings'}]
steps: Combine soy sauce, honey, brown sugar, garlic and oil in a jug., Cut wing tips from wings and discard (see note). Place wings in an oven-proof dish. Pour over soy sauce mixture. Turn to coat. Cover, refrigerate for 2 hours, if time permits., Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Bake wings in marinade, for 50 minutes to 1 hour, turning wings and basting with marinade halfway during cooking, or until golden and cooked through., Meanwhile, make Noodle stir-fry: Cook noodles following packet directions. Drain. Heat oil in a wok or large frying pan. Cook capsicum and corn, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until just starting to soften. Add onion and snow peas. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until snow peas are bright green and tender. Add noodles and sauce. Cook for 1 minute or until heated through., Serve chicken with noodle stir-fry.

name: Vodka mojito
ingredient: [{'quantity': '240', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Smirnoff Red Vodka'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'limes', 'name': ', cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh mint'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'soda water'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Ic', 'name': 'e'}]
steps: Combine Smirnoff vodka, juice of 2 limes, sugar and mint in a jug., Stir to combine and dissolve the sugar., Add ice and stir again., Top with soda water and stir once more., Garnish with a mint sprigs.

name: Healthy fried rice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'Chinese', 'name': 'cabbage, shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', cut into matchsticks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red capsicum, seeds removed, sliced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cooked brown rice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'light soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'ketjap manis*, plus extra to drizzle'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cashew nuts, lightly toasted'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced on the diagonal'}]
steps: Heat oil in a large wok over high heat. Add cabbage, carrot and capsicum, and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes., Add rice and cook for a further 2 minutes. Add soy, ketjap manis, cashews and half the spring onions, toss to combine., To serve, garnish with remaining onions and drizzle with extra ketjap manis.

name: Iced coconut towers
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/4 cups) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '360', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'white chocolate, melted'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 1/3 cups) self-raising flour, sifted'}, {'quantity': '115', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3⁄4 cup) plain flour, sifted'}, {'quantity': '170', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) desiccated coconut, plus extra to sprinkle'}, {'quantity': '650', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 1/2 cups) Greek Style Yoghurt'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pink', 'name': 'food colouring'}, {'quantity': '453', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'ctn bought vanilla frosting'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'raspberry or strawberry jam'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 160C/140C fan forced. Grease and line four 19 x 29cm (base measurement) slab pans with baking paper. Use electric beaters to beat the butter, sugar and vanilla in a bowl until pale and creamy. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition., Transfer the mixture to a large bowl. Use a large metal spoon to fold in the chocolate. Fold in the flours and coconut alternately with the yoghurt until just combined and smooth. Divide among 4 bowls., Tint each bowl a different shade of pink. Spread each batch into a prepared pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until just firm to touch. Set aside to cool completely., Use a round 7.5cm cutter to cut 8 discs from each cake. Sandwich frosting between different coloured discs to make 8 towers., For the marshmallow, stir sugar and water in a saucepan over low heat for 3 minutes or until dissolved. Increase heat to medium high and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 4 minutes. Dissolve gelatine in boiling water. Add to the sugar syrup and stir until completely dissolved. Set aside to cool slightly., Use electric beaters to beat egg whites in a bowl until firm peaks form. Gradually beat in the sugar syrup mixture in a thin, steady stream. Continue to beat for 10-15 minutes or until the mixture has cooled and is thick and glossy. Tint with pink food colouring. Pipe mixture in a circle on the top of each cake. Sprinkle with extra coconut. Spoon the jam into the centre.

name: Quinoa crumbed fish with vegie chips
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sweet potato, peeled, cut into batons'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beetroot, trimmed, peeled, cut into batons'}, {'quantity': '45', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) rice flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eg', 'name': 'g'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '90', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) quinoa flakes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'baby capers, rinsed, drained, chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'flathead fish fillets'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'salad leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'herbs, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/200°C fan forced. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place potato and beetroot on tray. Spray with oil. Roast for 25-30 minutes or until golden., Meanwhile, place the flour in a shallow bowl. Season. Whisk the egg and milk in a separate bowl. Combine the quinoa flakes, lemon rind, chives and capers in a third bowl. Coat a fish fillet in flour, dip in egg mixture, then in quinoa mixture. Repeat with the remaining fish., Heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Spray with olive oil. Cook the fish, in batches, for 2-3 minutes each side or until golden brown and cooked through, spraying with a little more oil if necessary. Divide the vegetable chips and salad leaves among plates, top with fish and sprinkle with herbs.

name: Sticky drumsticks
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '1.2kg) chicken drumsticks'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) honey'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'wholegrain mustard'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sweet paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) slivered almonds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'broccolini, ends trimmed, diagonally cut into 4cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'thick soya sauce'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'Basmati rice, to serve'}]
steps: Use a small sharp knife to cut 3 slashes, about 3cm long and 1cm deep, in the thickest part of each chicken drumstick. Combine the honey, vinegar, mustard, garlic, paprika, oregano and sesame seeds in a large bowl. Add the chicken and gently toss to coat. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 4 hours to develop the flavours., Preheat oven to 200°C. Place the chicken in a roasting pan and drizzle with remaining marinade. Season with salt and pepper. Bake in preheated oven, turning occasionally, for 45 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through., Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large frying pan over high heat. Add the almonds and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until just toasted. Use a slotted spoon to transfer almonds to a plate. Add the broccolini to the pan and cook, turning occasionally, for 2 minutes or until bright green and tender crisp. Add the soya sauce and almonds and gently toss for 1 minute or until heated through., Spoon steamed rice among serving plates. Top with chicken and broccolini mixture, and serve immediately.

name: Bagel with creamy scrambled eggs and ham
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'plain', 'name': 'bagels, halved'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) milk or cream'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'softened butter, plus extra for spreading'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '100g Primo English Ham'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped chives'}]
steps: Lightly toast bagels until golden. Meanwhile, whisk eggs and milk or cream in a large bowl. Melt butter in a medium, non-stick frying pan. Add egg mixture and cook over a medium-low heat, gently moving the eggs from one side of the pan as they cook. Don’t over-stir. When almost cooked but still looking a little wet, remove from heat., Spread bagels with butter. Place on serving plates. Top with ham slices. Spoon over eggs and scatter with chives. Serve with cracked pepper.

name: Caramelised onion and rosemary quiche
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'sheet', 'name': '(29 x 29cm) frozen ready-rolled shortcrust quiche pastry, just thawed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'brown onions, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh rosemary'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': "goat's cheese, crumbled"}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a 3.5cm-deep, 22.5cm (base measurement) fluted tart tin with pastry and trim any excess. Place in the fridge for 10 minutes to rest., Cover pastry base with baking paper and fill with pastry weights or rice. Bake in oven for 15 minutes. Remove the paper and weights or rice. Bake for a further 10 minutes or until crisp. Remove from oven. Reduce oven temperature to 180°C., Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium-low heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, for 40 minutes or until dark golden brown and caramelised. Set aside to cool slightly., Add the rosemary to the onion and stir until well combined. Spread the onion mixture over the base of the pastry case. Sprinkle with goat's cheese., Whisk together the cream and eggs in a medium jug. Season with salt and pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the onion mixture. Bake in oven for 45 minutes or until set. Serve warm or at room temperature.

name: Greek rissoles
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lamb mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh oregano leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sliced black olives, chopped'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Greek feta, cut into 12 cubes'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'white rice, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Shredded', 'name': 'baby cos lettuce leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Tzatziki', 'name': 'dip, to serve'}]
steps: Combine mince, oregano, lemon rind, olives, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Using clean hands, shape mixture into 12 balls. Using the palm of your hand, flatten balls. Wrap around feta cubes and shape into 1.5cm-thick rissoles. Place on a plate., Cook rissoles, in a large frying pan sprayed with oil, over medium-high heat, for 3 to 4 minutes each side or until cooked through., Combine rice and lettuce. Serve rissoles with rice mixture and tzatziki.

name: Poached nashi in lemon grass & ginger syrup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) water'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': '-piece fresh ginger, peeled, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'stem', 'name': 'lemon grass, pale section only, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'nashi'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vanilla', 'name': 'ice-cream, to serve'}]
steps: Combine the water, sugar, ginger and lemon grass in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until sugar dissolves. Bring to the boil. Add the nashi. Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, turning occasionally, for 20 minutes or until nashi are tender., Divide nashi among bowls. Strain syrup through a fine sieve into a jug. Drizzle nashi with syrup and serve with ice-cream.

name: Goulash meatball pie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves, plus extra leaves to serve'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh chives, plus extra to serve'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sweet paprika'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can crushed tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Massel beef style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sour cream'}, {'quantity': '330', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'jar whole roasted peppers, drained well, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'frozen shortcrust pastry, partially thawed'}]
steps: Combine mince, breadcrumbs, parsley, chives, 2 teaspoons paprika and 1/2 the egg in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Roll level tablespoons of mixture into balls. Place on a plate. Refrigerate for 15 minutes., Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook meatballs, in 2 batches, turning occasionally, for 5 minutes or until browned and almost cooked through. Transfer to a plate., Add onion to pan. Cook for 5 minutes or until softened. Add garlic and remaining paprika. Cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add tomatoes and stock. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 10 to 15 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream and peppers. Return meatballs to pan. Toss to coat in sauce. Set aside to cool., Meanwhile, preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Place a baking tray in oven., Grease a 4.5cm-deep, 20cm x 30cm metal roasting pan. Line base and side with 2 pastry sheets, joining and trimming to fit (reserve trimmings). Line pastry with baking paper. Fill with pie weights or uncooked rice. Blind-bake for 10 minutes. Remove weights or rice and baking paper. Bake for a further 5 to 10 minutes or until pastry is golden. Cool for 20 minutes., Spoon meatball mixture into pastry case. Using 5cm, 5.5cm and 7cm round cutters, cut rounds from remaining pastry and trimmings. Arrange pastry rounds on filling. Brush pastry with remaining egg. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until pastry is golden. Stand for 5 minutes. Serve.

name: Cherry and custard dolce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) freshly brewed espresso coffee'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) water'}, {'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3/4 cup) amaretto liqueur'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'ctn thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', separated'}, {'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2/3 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g ctns mascarpone'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt frozen pitted cherries, thawed (see note)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g pkts savoiardi (sponge finger biscuits)'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '70% cocoa dark chocolate, coarsely grated'}]
steps: Combine coffee, water and 125ml (1/2 cup) amaretto in a bowl. Set aside to cool., Use an electric beater to beat the cream in a large bowl until firm peaks form., Use a clean electric beater to beat the egg yolks and sugar in a large bowl until thick and creamy. Use a metal spoon to gently fold in the cream, mascarpone and remaining amaretto., Use a clean electric beater to beat the egg whites in a bowl until soft peaks form. Gently fold into the cream mixture., Reserve one-third of cherries. Halve remaining cherries. Dip biscuits in the coffee mixture to coat. Arrange one-third of the biscuits over the base of a 3L (12-cup) capacity glass serving dish. Top with one-third of the mascarpone mixture, half the cherry and one-third of the chocolate. Top with half the remaining biscuits, the remaining cherry and half the remaining chocolate. Top with the remaining biscuits and mascarpone mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 6 hours or overnight. Top with the reserved cherries. Sprinkle with the remaining chocolate.

name: Turkey carbonara
ingredient: [{'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'bacon', 'name': 'rashers, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'pine nuts'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', beaten'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(25g) finely grated parmesan, plus extra to serve'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'spaghetti'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(320g) shredded cooked turkey'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped flat-leaf parsley, plus extra to serve'}]
steps: Melt the butter in a deep frypan over medium-low heat. Add the bacon and cook until just starting to crisp. Add the pine nuts and cook, stirring, for a further minute or until they start to brown., In a bowl big enough to hold the cooked pasta, whisk together the eggs, cream, garlic and parmesan. Add bacon and pine nuts, and season with salt and pepper., Cook the pasta according to packet instructions, then drain well. Immediately add the hot pasta to the egg mixture and toss for 1 minute, allowing the heat from the pasta to cook the sauce. Stir through the turkey and parsley, and serve topped with extra parmesan and parsley.

name: Lamb stir-fry with coconut rice (gluten-free)
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tamari*'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'bicarbonate of soda'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'arrowroot*'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sunflower oil'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lamb backstrap, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece ginger, cut into thin strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chilli, seeds removed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, cut into matchsticks'}, {'quantity': '175', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow peas, ends trimmed, halved diagonally'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thinly', 'name': 'sliced spring onions, to garnish'}]
steps: To make rice, mix cream with 180ml water. Place rice and liquid in a large pan with 1 teaspoon salt and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low, simmer for 10 minutes, then drain., Meanwhile, combine tamari, soda and arrowroot in a small bowl until smooth, then set aside. Heat half the oil in a wok over high heat and cook lamb in batches until browned. Remove and set aside., Heat remaining oil and add ginger, chilli and carrot. Stir-fry for 1 minute, then return lamb to wok with snow peas and tamari mixture, and toss for a further minute. Serve with coconut rice and garnish with spring onions.

name: Lemon and blueberry vegan tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(225g) cashews'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(160g) whole almonds'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(35g) pistachios'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(40g) shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of salt'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'dates, pitted, chopped'}, {'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can coconut cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', rind finely grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) maple syrup'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Blueberries', 'name': ', to decorate'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thyme', 'name': 'sprigs, to decorate'}]
steps: Place the cashews in a large bowl. Pour over enough boiling water to cover. Set aside for 4 hours to soak., Lightly grease a 24cm (base measurement) fluted tart tin with removable base. Line the base with baking paper. Place on a baking tray., Place almonds, pistachios, shredded coconut and salt in a food processor. Process until finely chopped. Add dates and process until very finely chopped and mixture holds together when pinched. Spoon into prepared tin. Use the back of a metal spoon to push the mixture evenly over base and side of the tin. Place in the freezer to set., Drain the cashews and place in a blender. Add coconut cream, lemon rind, lemon juice and maple syrup. Blend until very smooth and creamy. Add turmeric and blend until smooth. Pour into the tart case in tin. Gently tap on the bench to smooth the surface. Place in freezer for 2 hours or until firm., Meanwhile, to make the candied lemon, line a baking tray with baking paper. Place lemon, sugar and 1 1/2 cups (375ml) water in a frying pan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook, turning lemon occasionally, for 20 mins or until rind is translucent. Transfer the lemon to the lined tray. Increase heat to medium-high. Bring syrup in the pan to the boil. Cook for 3-5 mins or until syrup thickens. Set aside to cool completely., Transfer tart to a serving plate. Top with candied lemon, blueberries and thyme. Drizzle with the lemon syrup.

name: Seared sesame tuna on pickled cucumber salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '500g) green cucumbers, ends trimmed, thinly sliced crossways'}, {'quantity': '2 130', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkts fresh baby corn, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'drained pickled ginger (Buderim Ginger brand), chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'wasabi paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '200g each) tuna steaks'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}]
steps: Cook the cucumber in a medium saucepan of boiling water for 2 minutes or until tender. Use a slotted spoon to transfer to a colander and refresh under cold running water. Drain well. Transfer to a large bowl. Return the water to the boil and add the corn. Cook, uncovered, for 2 minutes or until tender. Drain, refresh under cold running water and drain well. Add the corn and ginger to the cucumber, and set aside until required., Place the lemon juice, wasabi paste, garlic and 80ml (1/3 cup) of the peanut oil in a small bowl. Use a fork to whisk until well combined. Set aside until required., Cut each tuna steak in half crossways. Place the sesame seeds on a plate. Evenly coat each side of the tuna pieces with the sesame seeds. Season both sides with salt and pepper., Heat 1 tablespoon of the remaining oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add half the tuna and cook for 1 1/2 minutes each side for rare or until cooked to your liking and the sesame seeds are toasted. Transfer to a plate and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with remaining oil and tuna., Drizzle half the wasabi dressing over the cucumber mixture and toss gently until well coated. Taste and season with salt and pepper., Divide the pickled cucumber salad among serving plates and top with the tuna. Drizzle with the remaining dressing and serve immediately.

name: Five-spice chicken wings
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'light soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dry sherry'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Chinese Five Spice'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of white pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'chicken wings'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'white, lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) cornflour'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vegetable', 'name': 'oil, to deep-fry'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander sprigs, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Hot', 'name': 'chilli sauce, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Combine the soy sauce, sherry, Chinese five spice and pepper in a glass or ceramic dish. Season with salt. Add the chicken and turn to coat. Cover. Place in the fridge for 30 minutes to marinate., Add the egg to the chicken and toss to coat. Place the combined flour in a large bowl. Add the chicken and toss to coat., Add enough oil to a wok to reach a depth of 10cm. Heat to 190°C over high heat (when oil is ready a cube of bread will turn golden brown in 10 seconds). Add half the chicken and cook, turning occasionally, for 7 minutes or until golden and cooked through. Use a wire mesh ladle or tongs to transfer to a plate lined with paper towel. (See tip) Repeat with the remaining chicken, reheating the wok between batches., Transfer the chicken wings to a serving platter. Top with coriander sprigs. Serve immediately with sauce and lime wedges.

name: Potatoes in red wine
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'small red rascal potatoes, cut into thirds (see note)'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) red wine'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'thyme sprigs'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Large', 'name': 'pinch of ground fennel'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sea', 'name': 'salt flakes'}]
steps: Combine the potato, wine, thyme and fennel in a saucepan. Add enough cold water to almost cover. Season with sea salt and pepper. Cover the surface of the potato loosely with a piece of foil., Place the pan over high heat and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-high. Cook for 15 minutes or until the potato is tender. Drain. Serve.
nutrition: calories: 172, fat: nan, carbs: 26.0g, protein: 2.8g, servings: 6

name: Prawn, avocado and lime crostini with rouille
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cooked peeled prawns'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocado', 'name': ', halved, stone removed, peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'coarsely chopped fresh coriander'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '12cm baguette (French breadstick), diagonally cut into 1.5cm-thick slices, toasted'}]
steps: To make the rouille, combine chilli and boiling water in a heatproof bowl and set aside for 5 minutes to soak. Add the bread and vinegar and stir to combine., Transfer the chilli mixture to the bowl of a food processor. Add the garlic, salt and egg yolk and briefly process until mixture is well combined. With the motor running, gradually add the oil in a thin steady stream and process until mixture is thick and glossy. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Transfer the rouille to a bowl. Place plastic wrap directly on the surface of the rouille and store in the fridge until required., Combine the prawns, avocado, lime juice and coriander in a large bowl. Taste and season with salt and pepper., Spread the toasted baguette evenly with rouille and top with prawn mixture. Divide crostini among serving plates and serve immediately.

name: Carrot and pineapple daisy cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vegetable', 'name': 'oil, to grease'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '255', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/4 cups, firmly packed) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '440g can crushed pineapple, well drained'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) coarsely grated carrot'}, {'quantity': '115', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) coarsely chopped walnuts'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3/4 cup) vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '22', 'unit': 'thin', 'name': 'savoiardi sponge finger biscuits'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 160°C. Brush a 22cm (base measurement) round cake pan with oil to grease. Line the base with non-stick baking paper., Combine the flour, sugar and nutmeg in a large bowl. Add the pineapple, carrot and walnut, and stir until well combined., Whisk together the eggs and oil in a large jug. Add to the flour mixture and stir until well combined., Spoon into the prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour 30 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Set aside in the pan for 10 minutes to cool before turning onto a wire rack to cool completely. (See tip 1), To make the cream cheese icing, use an electric beater to beat the cream cheese and icing sugar until pale and creamy. Gradually add the milk and beat until well combined., Use a large serrated knife to cut the cake in half horizontally. (See tip 2) Place the base of the cake, cut-side up, on a serving plate or cake stand. Top with one-quarter of the icing and spread to the edge. Top with the remaining cake. Spread the remaining icing over the top and side of the cake. Arrange the biscuits, side-by-side, around the side of the cake. Tie a piece of ribbon around the cake to secure. Arrange the daisies on top of the cake to decorate.

name: Orange and balsamic beetroot
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'beetroot'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C. Combine vinegar, orange juice, sugar, oil, and salt and pepper in a jug. Whisk to combine. Pour into a baking dish., Trim beetroot stalks, leaving 3cm attached. Gently scrub beetroot (don't peel). Pat-dry with paper towels., Add beetroot to baking dish, tossing to coat with orange juice mixture. Cover with foil. Roast for 1 hour or until just tender. Cut beetroot in half. Serve drizzled with pan juices.

name: Roast tomato and prosciutto salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'Roma', 'name': 'tomatoes, quartered lengthways'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'prosciutto'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'ciabatta', 'name': 'bread loaf'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'watercress, cut into small sprigs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocado', 'name': ', sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'parmesan cheese, shaved'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a shallow roasting pan with baking paper. Arrange tomato in pan. Spray lightly with oil. Roast on lower oven shelf for 40 minutes or until light golden., Meanwhile, place prosciutto in a single layer on a lightly greased baking tray. Roast on shelf above tomato for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden and crisp. Transfer to a wire rack to cool., Combine 2 tablespoons oil and garlic in a small bowl. Cut twelve 1cm-thick slices from ciabatta loaf. Brush both sides with oil mixture. Place bread in a single layer on baking tray. Bake on shelf above tomato for 10 minutes or until crisp and lightly toasted. Set aside to cool. Break prosciutto into pieces., Place roast tomato on toast. Arrange on plates with watercress, avocado and prosciutto. Combine vinegar and remaining oil in a jug. Drizzle over salads. Top with parmesan. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

name: Chicken paillards with radicchio slaw (gluten-free)
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'radicchio', 'name': ', finely shredded'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'stalks, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Granny', 'name': 'Smith apples, cut into matchsticks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'basil leaves, shredded'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'walnuts, toasted'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) extra virgin olive oil, plus 1 tbsp to cook chicken'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'chicken', 'name': 'breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Place the radicchio, celery, apple, basil and walnuts in a bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together the vinegar, oil and mustard. Season to taste, then toss with the salad ingredients and set aside., Cut each chicken breast through the centre into 2 thin fillets. Place each fillet between 2 pieces of plastic wrap and pound with a meat mallet or rolling pin until thin. Season with salt and pepper., Melt the butter with the extra tablespoon of oil in a large frypan over high heat. Add the chicken and cook for 2 minutes on each side or until golden and cooked through., Divide the chicken and salad among 4 plates and serve with lemon wedges.

name: Warm salted caramel pots
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(110g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla bean paste'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt flakes'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) milk'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Brand Australian Free Range Egg yolks'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Almond', 'name': 'biscotti or almond bread (optional), to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 150C. Place six 1/2-cup (125ml) ovenproof dishes in a roasting pan., Place the sugar in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring with a wooden spoon, for 6-7 mins or until sugar dissolves and becomes a golden caramel colour. Remove from heat. Carefully add the cream (be careful as the caramel may bubble). Place the pan over low heat. Cook, stirring for 3 mins or until any hard caramel has dissolved and mixture is smooth. Add the vanilla, salt and milk and stir to combine. Remove from heat., Whisk the egg yolks in a medium bowl. Gradually add the hot cream mixture, whisking constantly, in a thin, steady stream until combined. Strain through a fine sieve. Divide evenly among the prepared dishes. Pour enough boiling water into the pan to come halfway up the side of each dish. Bake for 25-30 mins or until custards are almost set. Set aside for 30 mins to cool. Place in the fridge to chill., To make the chocolate sauce, combine the chocolate, cream and sugar in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring, for 2-3 mins or until chocolate melts and sauce is smooth. Set aside to cool slightly., Pour the warm chocolate sauce over the caramel pots. Serve with almond biscotti or almond bread, if desired.

name: Lemon Weet-Bix slice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '175', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '165', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'Weet', 'name': '-Bix, crushed'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '85', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) desiccated coconut'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '395g cans sweetened condensed milk'}, {'quantity': '310', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/4 cups) strained lemon juice'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Grease a 20 x 30cm slice pan and line the base and sides with baking paper, allowing the two long sides to overhang., Place butter175g butter, melted, sugar165g (3/4 cup) caster sugar, Weet-Bix3 Weet-Bix, crushed, flour150g (1 cup) self-raising flour and coconut85g (1 cup) desiccated coconut in a large bowl and stir to combine. Spread mixture over the base of the prepared pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until light golden. Set aside to cool., Whisk condensed milk2 x 395g cans sweetened condensed milk and lemon juice310ml (1 1/4 cups) strained lemon juice together in a bowl until smooth and combined. Pour over the Weet-Bix base. Bake for 20 minutes or until edges are slightly bubbling and the top layer is set. Set aside to cool to room temperature, then place in the fridge overnight to chill., Cut into pieces to serve.

name: Zucchini & pistachio spice cake with lime frosting
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(185ml) sunflower oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(220g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(75g) unsalted pistachios, finely chopped, plus 1/4 cup (35g) slivered unsalted pistachios to decorate'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60g) almond meal'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'grated zucchini (about 3-4)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground mixed spice'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'bicarbonate of soda'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(225g) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(75g) plain flour'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 170°C. Grease a 22cm springform pan and line base and sides with baking paper., Using an electric mixer with whisk attachment, beat the oil, sugar, eggs and vanilla until thick. Stir in chopped nuts, meal, zucchini and spices. Sift over soda and flours, and stir to combine. Pour into pan and bake for 70 minutes or until a skewer inserted in centre comes out clean. Cool in pan for 20 minutes, then turn onto a wire rack and cool completely., For frosting, use electric beaters to beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. With motor running, gradually add cheese, beating well between additions. Add zest and juice and beat until smooth., Using a bread knife, slice the cake into two rounds and set aside top. Spread a third of the frosting over the bottom half, then replace top and spread cake with remaining frosting. Decorate with slivered pistachios.

name: Potato wedges with sweet chilli yoghurt
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '650g) potatoes, such as pontiac, sebago or King Edward'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': '(about 550g) orange sweet potato (kumara), peeled, halved crossways'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray, to coat'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 230°C. Line a large baking tray with a layer of non-stick baking paper., Cut potatoes and sweet potato into 1.5cm-thick wedges. Place potatoes in a large oven bag with water, adjusting until they are 2-3 deep when the bag is laid flat. Twist the opening to close., Place the bag directly on the microwave turntable and cook on High/ 800watts/100% for 7-8 minutes or until firm but tender., Use scissors to snip one corner of the bag and drain. Carefully untwist the bag, and spread potatoes on the lined tray in a single layer. Spray potatoes with olive oil spray to lightly coat., Roast in preheated oven for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Turn the potatoes and spray with olive oil to lightly coat. Roast for a further 15-20 minutes or until tender and crisp., Meanwhile, to make the sweet chilli yoghurt, combine the yoghurt and sweet chilli sauce in a small bowl. Taste and season with salt and pepper., Season wedges with salt and pepper and serve immediately with the sweet chilli yoghurt.

name: Italian chicken meatloaves with mash
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Steggles chicken breast mince'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pork mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roughly chopped fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped sun-dried tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'pine nuts, toasted, chopped'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'prosciutto'}, {'quantity': '1.1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'desiree potatoes, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mixed', 'name': 'salad, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Combine mince, garlic, chilli, breadcrumbs, egg, basil, tomato and pine nuts in a bowl., Grease an 8-hole, 3/4 cup-capacity mini loaf pan. Line each pan hole with 1 slice of prosciutto, allowing sides to overhang. Press mince mixture into prepared pan holes. Fold prosciutto over to enclose filling., Bake meatloaves for 25 to 30 minutes or until juices run clear when tested with a skewer., Meanwhile, place potato in a saucepan. Cover with cold water. Bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain (see note). Return potato to pan. Add butter and half the milk. Mash. Gradually add remaining milk, mashing until smooth. Season., Serve meatloaves with mash and salad.

name: Wholemeal pasta spirals with rocket pesto, green beans and potatoes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chat potatoes, quartered'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'wholemeal pasta spirals'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, trimmed, halved'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'tub rocket and cashew pesto (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(25g) freshly grated parmesan'}]
steps: Place potatoes in a large pan of cold, lightly salted water, bring to the boil and cook for 5 minutes. Add the pasta and cook for a further 5 minutes, then add the beans and cook for a further 2 minutes or until the beans, potatoes and pasta are all just tender., Drain well, reserving 1/3 cup (80ml) cooking liquid, then return pasta, potatoes, beans and reserved water to the pan. Add the pesto and stir well until evenly coated. Season well, then divide among 4 bowls, top with parmesan, and serve.

name: Barramundi in banana leaf with coconut rice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(265g) sticky rice (see notes)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'grated palm sugar or brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'grated ginger'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '200g skinless barramundi fillets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'limes', 'name': ', sliced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'fresh banana leaves (see notes)'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'makrut', 'name': 'lime leaves, finely shredded'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chillies, thinly sliced'}]
steps: Rinse rice, then soak in a bowl of cold water for 1 hour. Combine fish sauce, sugar and 1 tbs ginger in a bowl, then brush over fish., Set aside for 15 minutes to marinate., Heat oil in a frypan over medium heat and cook garlic, remaining 1 tbs ginger and half the spring onion for 2 minutes or until fragrant. Add the rice and stir to coat. Add 1 1/4 cups (310ml) hot water along with the coconut milk. Season and cook, covered, over low heat for 20 minutes or until rice is cooked., Preheat barbecue to high. Place 2 lime slices in the centre of each banana leaf and top with a fish fillet and lime leaf. Fold up to form parcels and enclose in foil to seal. Barbecue, turning, for 12 minutes or until cooked. Top with chilli and remaining spring onion, then serve with rice.

name: Luscious little lemon puddings
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon zest, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) pouring cream'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 160°C. Grease 4 x125ml ramekins., Prepare a water bath. (see note), Whisk eggs and sugar until thick, then stir in the juice and zest and gently whisk in the cream. Pour into 4 x 125ml ramekins and bake in the water bath for 20-25 minutes or until just set. Remove the puddings and cool, then cover and refrigerate until needed., Serve puddings at room temperature, dusted with icing sugar.

name: Beef and potato curry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onions, quartered'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles beef stir fry strips'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Valcom massaman curry paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400ml TCC coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Edgell tiny taters, drained and halved (see tip, below)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen beans'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g pkts Coles Brand microwave basmati rice'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mango', 'name': 'chutney, to serve'}]
steps: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and beef strips and cook, stirring, for 5 mins, or until browned. Add curry paste and coconut milk and cook, covered, for 20 mins, or until beef is tender., Add potatoes and beans and cook for 5 mins more, until heated through. Serve with cooked rice and mango chutney.

name: Milk tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(500ml) milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'stick'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', separated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cornflour'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour, sifted'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter softened'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'icing sugar, to dust'}]
steps: For pastry, preheat oven to 180°C. Lightly grease a 24cm loose-bottomed tart pan. Whiz flour, icing sugar and butter in a food processor until mixture resembles breadcrumbs. Add the egg, process just until mixture forms a smooth ball. Cover in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Roll out dough on a lightly floured work surface, then line pan. Trim off any excess pastry, then refrigerate for 10 minutes. Line tart pan with baking paper, fill with rice or pastry weights and bake for 10 minutes. Remove paper and weights and bake for 5 minutes., Place milk and cinnamon stick in a pan. Bring to scalding boil, remove from heat, then allow to infuse for 10 minutes. Reduce oven to 170°C. Place yolks, flours, sugar and baking powder in a bowl, add a little infused milk, stir to form a paste. Stir in remaining milk, discard cinnamon, return mixture to pan over very low heat and cook for 5 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat, beat in butter, cover top with baking paper and cool., Whisk eggwhites, then fold into custard. Pour custard into pastry case and bake for 25 minutes or until the filling is set and slightly puffed. Remove, cool slightly, and sift combined cinnamon and icing sugar over top. Serve with fruit and cream, if desired.

name: Fairy bread jelly cheesecake roll
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'boiling water'}, {'quantity': '85', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet Aeroplane lime jelly crystals'}, {'quantity': '85', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Aeroplane watermelon jelly crystals'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', separated'}, {'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2/3 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) rainbow sprinkles'}]
steps: Pour half the boiling water400ml boiling water into a heatproof jug. Stir in lime jelly crystals85g packet lime jelly crystals until dissolved. Pour into a 13cm square airtight container. Place in the fridge for 3 hours or until set. Repeat with watermelon jelly crystals85g pkt watermelon jelly crystals and remaining boiling water., Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan forced. Brush a 24 x 30cm Swiss roll pan with melted butter50g butter, at room temperature and line with baking paper., Use electric beaters to beat egg4 eggs, separated yolks, sugar140g (2/3 cup) caster sugar and vanilla1 tsp vanilla extract in a bowl until a ribbon trail forms when the beaters are lifted., Use clean beaters to beat egg whites in a clean, dry bowl until soft peaks form. Fold into yolk mixture. Sift over flour75g (1/2 cup) plain flour and use a metal spoon to gently fold until combined., Pour into prepared pan. Smooth surface. Bake for 15 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Cover with baking paper then a damp tea towel and set aside., Place a clean tea towel on a flat work surface. Top with a sheet of baking paper. Cover with sprinkles60g (1/2 cup) rainbow sprinkles. Turn out warm cake onto sprinkles. Peel away the paper from base of cake. Starting from 1 long side, roll up the warm cake. Set aside, seam side down, for 20 minutes or until almost cooled. Gently unroll cake. Set aside to cool completely., To make cheesecake filling, use electric beaters to beat the cream cheese250g packet cream cheese, chopped, at room temperature, butter and vanilla1 tsp vanilla extract in a bowl until smooth and well combined. Gradually beat in icing sugar80g (1/2 cup) icing sugar mixture until fluffy., Cut jelly into 2cm cubes. Spoon 1 ⁄3 cup cheesecake mixture into a piping bag with fluted nozzle and reserve. Evenly spread cake with remaining cheesecake mixture, leaving a 2cm border. Top with 12-14 of each jelly cube flavour. Roll up the cake to enclose filling. Transfer to a serving plate, seam side down. Pipe reserved cheesecake mixture along top. Decorate with remaining jelly cubes.

name: Creamy french onion eggs
ingredient: [{'quantity': '90', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) french onion dip'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) pre-grated 3 cheese blend'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sourdough', 'name': 'bread slices, toasted, to serve'}]
steps: Combine the dip90g (1/3 cup) french onion dip and cream2 tbsp thickened cream in a bowl., Heat the oil1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the spinach200g baby spinach and cook, stirring occasionally, for 2-3 minutes or until the spinach starts to wilt. Move the spinach to make 4 indents. Crack an egg4 eggs into each indent. Dollop the dip mixture over the top and sprinkle with cheese55g (1/2 cup) pre-grated 3 cheese blend. Cover and cook for 3 minutes for runny eggs. Serve on breadSourdough bread slices, toasted, to serve.

name: Spiced chicken bake with cumin pumpkin puree
