ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'fresh curry leaf sprigs, leaves stripped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'garlic cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'brown mustard seeds'}, {'quantity': '1 1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'turmeric'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'light extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '1.4kg) skinless chicken thigh cutlets, excess fat trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red onion, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Juice', 'name': 'of 1/2 lemon'}, {'quantity': '1.2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Kent pumpkin, peeled, deseeded, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'green beans, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fried', 'name': 'curry leaves, to serve (optional)'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 210C/190C fan forced. Line 2 large baking trays with baking paper. Place curry leaves, garlic, mustard seeds, turmeric, chilli and 1 tablespoon oil in a large bowl. Add chicken and onion and toss to coat. Place on 1 prepared tray. Drizzle with juice. Season. Place pumpkin on remaining prepared tray. Drizzle with remaining oil. Sprinkle with cumin. Season. Toss to coat., Roast chicken on top oven shelf, basting occasionally with pan juices, for 45-50 minutes or until browned and cooked through. Roast pumpkin on bottom oven shelf, turning once, for 40 minutes or until tender., Place pumpkin in a heatproof bowl. Use a stick blender to puree until smooth. Serve chicken with pumpkin puree, beans and fried curry leaves, if using.

name: Classic nicoise salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'new potatoes'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, trimmed, halved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'cos lettuces, leaves separated'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'anchovy', 'name': 'fillets, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'nicoise', 'name': 'or other small black olives'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped flat-leaf parsley'}]
steps: Place eggs in a small pan of cold water and bring to the boil. Cook for 4-5 minutes, then plunge immediately into iced water and leave to cool., Meanwhile, place potatoes in a pan of cold salted water and bring to the boil. Simmer for 10 minutes or until tender, adding beans in the final 2 minutes of cooking. Drain and refresh beans in iced water. When potatoes are cool enough to handle, halve or quarter, if large., For dressing, whisk vinegar, mustard, garlic, sugar, sea salt and freshly ground black pepper in a small bowl. Gradually add the oil, whisking until thick., Peel eggs and cut into quarters. Place lettuce in a bowl with egg, potatoes, beans, anchovies, olives and parsley., To serve, pour over the dressing and gently toss to combine.

name: Asparagus with lemon aioli
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'asparagus, trimmed, halved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt'}]
steps: Make lemon aioli: Combine mayonnaise, lemon juice and garlic in a bowl., Heat a barbecue plate or chargrill over medium-high heat. Combine asparagus and oil in a bowl. Cook asparagus in batches, turning, for 2 minutes or until browned and just tender. Return to bowl. Add sea salt. Toss to combine. Serve with aioli.

name: One-pan taco pull-apart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried oregano leaves'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef mince'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can black beans, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'jalapeno chilli, finely chopped, plus extra, sliced, to serve'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh coriander leaves, plus extra sprigs to serve'}, {'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet jumbo tortillas'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'sour cream, plus 1/4 cup extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'grated tasty cheese'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'medium chunky salsa'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '285g jar piquillo peppers, chopped'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, quartered'}]
steps: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a 23cm (base) frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook onion, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add garlic, cumin, paprika and oregano. Cook for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add mince. Cook, breaking up mince with a wooden spoon, for 5 minutes or until browned all over., Add tomato paste and 1/4 cup water. Stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Add beans. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes. Stir in chilli and coriander. Transfer to a bowl. Set aside for 15 minutes to cool., Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Wipe frying pan clean. Drizzle with remaining oil., Place 1 tortilla on a board. Spread with 1/4 cup sour cream. Top with 1/3 cup mince mixture and sprinkle with 1/3 cup cheese. Roll up tortilla tightly. Trim and discard ends. Cut into 4 equal lengths. Arrange rolls, upright, around edge of pan, sitting snugly. Repeat with remaining tortillas, sour cream, mince mixture and cheese, to create 2 rings, leaving a hole in the centre. Sprinkle tortillas with remaining cheese., Combine salsa and peppers in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon into centre of frying pan. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until tortillas are golden and cheese is melted. Stand for 5 minutes., Meanwhile, make Guacamole Place avocado and lime juice in a bowl. Using a fork, mash until smooth. Season well with salt and pepper. Stir in coriander., Serve pull-apart with guacamole, tomato, extra sour cream, chilli and coriander.

name: Smoked salmon bagel pizza
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'Lighthouse Bread & Pizza Plain Flour, plus extra for dusting'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'instant dried yeast'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'warm water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil, plus extra to serve'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'poppy seeds'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cream cheese, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh dill, plus extra sprigs to serve'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'thinly sliced smoked salmon'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'baby capers, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket'}]
steps: Combine flour, yeast and salt in a bowl. Add water and oil. Stir to combine. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until dough comes together. Place dough in a large, lightly greased bowl. Cover with greased plastic wrap. Stand in a warm place for 1 hour or until dough doubles in size., Preheat oven to 240C/220C fan-forced. Grease a 20cm x 30cm lamington pan with oil. Punch dough down. Place in prepared pan. With oiled hands, press dough out to edges of pan. Sprinkle with seeds. Bake for 12 to 14 minutes or until golden. Stand in pan for 5 minutes. Carefully turn, top-side up, onto a board or platter., Combine cream cheese and dill in a bowl. Dollop small spoonfuls of cream cheese mixture over pizza base. Top with salmon, onion, capers and lemon. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Drizzle with extra oil and top with rocket and extra dill. Serve immediately.

name: Chicken and waldorf salad dinner bowl
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'walnuts'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'whole-egg mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'apple cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fennel seeds, finely crushed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'chicken breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'oak leaf lettuce, leaves separated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'apples, unpeeled, thinly sliced into rounds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': 'celery, diagonally sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'seedless red grapes, quartered'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place walnuts on prepared tray. Drizzle with honey. Toss to coat. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden and crisp., Meanwhile, combine mayonnaise and vinegar in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper., Combine oil, lemon rind and fennel seeds in a glass or ceramic bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Add chicken, rubbing to coat. Heat a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes each side or until cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Cover loosely with foil. Stand for 5 minutes to rest. Thickly slice., Arrange lettuce, apple, celery, chicken, grapes and walnuts in serving bowls. Drizzle with dressing. Sprinkle with chives. Serve.

name: Orange poppyseed cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) milk'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'poppy seeds'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'softened unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(220g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Finely', 'name': 'grated zest of 3 oranges'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) freshly squeezed orange juice'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(375g) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'baking powder'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Grease a 24cm cake pan and line base with baking paper., Place milk in a bowl and stir in poppy seeds. Stand for 20 minutes., Beat butter, sugar and vanilla in the bowl of an electric mixer until light and pale. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each. Gently fold in zest, juice and poppyseed mixture. Sift fl our and baking powder over top and fold in. Spoon mixture into pan and bake for 45-50 minutes or until a skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean. Cool cake in pan for 5 minutes, then turn out onto a plate., Meanwhile, place syrup ingredients in a pan over medium heat and stir until sugar dissolves and butter melts. Turn heat to high and simmer for 2 minutes. While cake is still warm, pierce holes in top with a skewer and pour over the hot syrup and zest. Serve warm or cold.

name: Moroccan tagine
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'gravy beef, trimmed, cut into 3cm cubes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'carrots, peeled, halved, sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'stalks, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Moroccan seasoning'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'dried', 'name': 'bay leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'stick'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'beef stock'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chickpeas, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mashed', 'name': 'potato, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Green', 'name': 'beans, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'green beans'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Heat half the oil2 tbsp olive oil in a large, heavy-based, flameproof casserole dish over medium-high heat. Cook beef750g gravy beef, trimmed, cut into 3cm cubes, in batches, for 5 to 6 minutes or until browned. Transfer to a bowl., Heat remaining oil in dish. Add onion1 large brown onion, finely chopped, garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed, carrot2 medium carrots, peeled, halved, sliced and celery2 celery stalks, chopped. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until onion has softened. Return beef to dish. Add flour2 tbsp plain flour and seasoning1 1/2 tbsp Moroccan seasoning. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add bay leaves2 dried bay leaves and cinnamon1 cinnamon stick., Stir in stock2 cups beef stock and tomatoes400g can diced tomatoes. Cover dish. Bring to the boil. Transfer to oven. Bake for 1 hour 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Stir in chickpeas400g can chickpeas, drained, rinsed. Bake for 30 minutes or until beef is tender. Remove and discard cinnamon and bay leaves. Serve with mashMashed potato, to serve and beansGreen beans, to serve|Steamed green beans.

name: Spiced mushrooms with tomato walnut dressing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'loaf', 'name': 'Turkish bread, halved widthways then lengthways'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, halved'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mushrooms, such as field, cup, Swiss brown, button and portobello, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket leaves'}]
steps: Preheat barbecue grill to medium-high. For dressing, cook capsicum, turning often, for 15 minutes or until skin blackens. Transfer to a bowl. Cover and set aside to cool. Peel and seed then finely chop flesh. Combine capsicum and remaining ingredients in a bowl and season to taste with salt and pepper., Brush bread with oil then rub with cut side of garlic. Barbecue for 1-2 minutes each side or until toasted., For rub, brush mushrooms with oil. Place in a bowl. Sprinkle with ras el hanout and season to taste then toss to combine. Barbecue mushrooms for 3-5 minutes each side or until tender., To serve, top bread with mushrooms and rocket, then spoon over dressing.

name: Vegan rice pudding with pomegranate roasted apples recipe
ingredient: [{'quantity': '405', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3 cups) cooked brown rice'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'unsweetened almond and coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'canned reduced-fat coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'pure maple syrup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla bean paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}]
steps: To make roasted apples, preheat the oven to 200C/180C fan forced. Place the apple in a baking dish. Place the cornflour and 1 tablespoon pomegranate juice in a small jug. Stir until smooth. Add the maple syrup, lemon juice, vanilla and remaining pomegranate juice. Stir to combine. Pour over apples and stir to coat., Cover dish with foil. Bake for 40 minutes or until the apple is just tender. Remove the foil and bake for a further 5-10 minutes or until the apple is caramelised and golden., Meanwhile, combine the rice, almond and coconut milk, coconut milk, maple syrup, vanilla and cinnamon in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to the boil then reduce heat to low. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes or until thick and creamy., Divide half the rice among 6 serving glasses. Spoon over a little pomegranate syrup from the apple. Top with remaining rice. Arrange apple on top then drizzle over more syrup to serve.

name: Penne with braised lamb
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sticks', 'name': 'celery, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chopped tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cooked lamb shank meat (see related recipe)'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'penne rigate'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'basil leaves, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Shaved', 'name': 'parmesan cheese, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Basil', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic, carrot and celery. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 4 to 5 minutes or until vegetables are soft. Add tomato paste. Stir until well combined. Add tomatoes, lamb shank meat and 1 cup cold water. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until sauce thickens., Meanwhile, cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling, salted water following packet directions, until tender. Drain., Spoon pasta into bowls. Stir basil through braised lamb. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon over pasta. Top with shaved parmesan and basil leaves. Serve.

name: Rainbow root vegies with chilli garlic toasts
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'beetroot, stems trimmed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'washed', 'name': 'potatoes, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'Dutch carrots, trimmed, peeled'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'leeks', 'name': ', pale section only, trimmed, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'vine-ripened cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can lentils, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil, extra'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped basil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'watercress, sprigs picked'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(45g) hazelnuts, toasted, coarsely chopped'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Wrap each beetroot in foil. Place on a baking tray. Bake for 1 hour or until tender. Set aside to cool slightly., Meanwhile, grease a baking tray. Arrange potato, carrots and leek in a single layer on the prepared tray. Drizzle with oil. Season. Toss to coat., Bake, turning once during cooking, for 30 mins. Add garlic and tomatoes to the tray. Bake for a further 15 mins or until vegetables are tender., To make the chilli garlic toasts, preheat a barbecue grill or chargrill on high. Combine the butter, garlic and chilli in a bowl. Spread the butter mixture over bread slices. Cook on grill for 2-3 mins each side or until charred., Wearing rubber gloves to avoid staining your hands, peel the beetroot and cut into quarters. Combine the lentils, extra oil and basil in a bowl. Season. Arrange the lentil mixture, tomato mixture, beetroot, watercress and toast on a serving platter. Sprinkle with hazelnut.

name: Crispy roast pork shoulder (porchetta)
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'pork shoulder, skin on'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caraway seeds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fennel seeds'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coarsely chopped oregano'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coarsely chopped flat-leaf parsley'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'coarsely chopped rosemary'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sea salt flakes'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) Chicken stock'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 130C. Place pork on2.5kg pork shoulder, skin on a clean work surface. Use a sharp knife to score the rind in 1cm intervals. Pat the skin dry with paper towel. Turn pork skin-side down. Use a large sharp knife to cut from the centre out, horizontally, until you get to the short end. Repeat with the remaining side. Open pork out like a book., Place caraway1 tsp caraway seeds and half the fennel seeds1 tbsp fennel seeds in a small frying pan over low heat. Cook, tossing, for 1 minute until aromatic. Transfer to a mortar and gently pound with a pestle until lightly crushed. Add the oregano1/2 cup coarsely chopped oregano, parsley1/4 cup coarsely chopped flat-leaf parsley and rosemary2 tbsp coarsely chopped rosemary and gently pound until a coarse paste forms. Spread the paste evenly over the cut side of the pork. Fold sides in and roll pork to enclose filling. Use kitchen string to tie pork at 2cm intervals. Place in a roasting pan. Rub with oil1 tbsp olive oil and sprinkle the skin evenly with salt2 tbsp sea salt flakes and the remaining fennel seeds. Rub into the skin. Roast for 3 hours or until pork is cooked through and tender., Increase heat to 240C. Pour the combined wine1/2 cup (125ml) dry white wine and stock1/2 cup (125ml) Chicken stock around the pork. Roast for a further 30 minutes or until skin is golden brown and crisp. Remove from oven. Set aside, covered, for 10 minutes to rest. Cut into slices to serve.

name: Microwave chocolate self-saucing pudding
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teasponns', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'self raising flour, sifted'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cocoa powder, sifted'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'milk chocolate, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 3/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'boiling water'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Caramel', 'name': 'ripple or honeycomb ice-cream, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Icing', 'name': 'sugar, to serve'}]
steps: Place milk and butter in a 6cm-deep, 8 cup-capacity, microwave-safe dish. Microwave on high (100%) for 1 minute and 30 seconds, stirring halfway through cooking, or until butter has melted., Stir in vanilla, caster sugar, flour and 2 tablespoons cocoa powder. Level top with a spatula. Press chocolate into batter. Sprinkle with remaining cocoa powder and brown sugar. Pour boiling water over the back of a large metal spoon to cover batter., Place dish on an upturned microwave-safe plate. Cook, uncovered, on medium (50%) for 10 to 13 minutes or until a skewer inserted into edge of pudding comes out clean. Set aside for 1 minute. dust with icing sugar. Serve with ice-cream.

name: Blonde sangria
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '750ml btl fruity white wine (such as moscato), chilled'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) fresh pineapple juice, chilled'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) fresh orange juice, chilled'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) vanilla-flavoured vodka'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'apple, cored, cut into 1cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'strawberries, washed, hulled, quartered'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves, torn'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Ice', 'name': 'cubes, to serve'}]
steps: Combine the wine, pineapple juice, orange juice, vodka, apple, strawberry and mint in a large serving bowl or jug., Divide the ice among serving glasses. Top with the sangria. Serve immediately.

name: Slow-cooker osso bucco with gremolata
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles White Plain Flour'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '(', 'name': '1.2kg) veal osso bucco'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'brown onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'carrots, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'stalks, chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': 'Mutti Polpa Finely Chopped Tomatoes 400g'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Coles Tomato Paste'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'beef stock'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'fresh thyme'}]
steps: Place flour2 tbsp White Plain Flour in a large snap-lock bag. Add half the veal8 (1.2kg) veal osso bucco. Seal. Shake to coat. Remove from bag. Shake off excess flour. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining veal., Heat oil1 tbsp olive oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook veal, in batches, for 3 minutes each side or until browned. Transfer to a plate. Add onion1 medium brown onion, chopped, carrot2 medium carrots, peeled, chopped, celery4 celery stalks, chopped and garlic4 garlic cloves, finely chopped to pan. Cook, stirring, for 4 minutes or until onion has softened. Add wine1/2 cup red wine. Bring to the boil. Boil for 2 minutes or until reduced by half. Transfer to the bowl of a 5 litre slow-cooker. Add veal, tomato2 x Polpa Finely Chopped Tomatoes 400g, tomato paste1/4 cup Tomato Paste, stock1/2 cup beef stock and thyme4 sprigs fresh thyme. Cover. Turn slow-cooker on low. Cook for 6 hours or until veal is tender. Season with salt and pepper., Make gremolata: Place parsley1/3 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves, lemon rind2 tsp finely grated lemon rind and garlic1 garlic clove, crushed in a bowl. Stir to combine., Serve osso bucco with gremolata.

name: Chipotle pork, potato and capsicum tray bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chipotle in adobo sauce (more to taste, if desired)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried oregano leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'pork', 'name': 'cutlets'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'chorizo', 'name': ', thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'desiree potatoes, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, cut into thick strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'yellow', 'name': 'capsicum, cut into thick strips'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) Massel chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': ', juiced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sour', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'oregano sprigs, to serve'}]
steps: Combine the chipotle, paprika, cumin, dried oregano, garlic, honey and 2 tbs oil in a large bowl. Add pork and chorizo. Toss to coat. Transfer to a large sealable glass or plastic container., Place potato, onion, capsicum in another large sealable glass or plastic container., Freeze containers for up to 3 months or until night before using. Defrost overnight in fridge., Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan forced. Place contents of vegetable container in a large roasting pan. Drizzle with remaining oil. Season. Bake for 20 minutes. Add contents of pork container. Season. Add stock. Cook for 25-30 minutes or until pork is cooked and veg is tender. Pour over juice. Serve with lime wedges, sour cream and fresh oregano.

name: Risi e bisi
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.375', 'unit': 'L', 'name': '(5 1/2 cups) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '175', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt rindless bacon, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '295', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/3 cups) arborio rice'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) white wine'}, {'quantity': '205', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/3 cups) frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'basil leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Place the stock1.375L (5 1/2 cups) chicken stock in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to the boil, then reduce heat to low and hold at a simmer., Meanwhile, heat the oil1 tbsp olive oil in a large, heavy-based saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook the bacon175g pkt rindless bacon, coarsely chopped and garlic2 garlic cloves, finely chopped, stirring, for 3 minutes or until bacon is crisp. Reduce heat to medium. Stir in the rice295g (1 1/3 cups) arborio rice. Cook for 1 minute or until the grains appear slightly glassy. Add the wine125ml (1/2 cup) white wine and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until almost absorbed., Add a ladleful (about 1/2 cup) of stock. Stir until liquid is absorbed. Continue adding stock, a ladleful at a time, stirring until liquid is absorbed before adding the next ladleful. Cook for 20 minutes or until rice is tender yet firm to the bite and risotto is creamy. Remove from heat. Add peas205g (1 1/3 cups) frozen peas, butter20g butter, lemon juice2 tbsp fresh lemon juice, lemon rind1 tsp grated lemon rind and 1/2 cup of parmesan60g (3/4 cup) finely grated parmesan. Cover. Set aside for 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper. Stir. Top with the remaining parmesan and basilFresh basil leaves, to serve.

name: Salt and pepper pork with Asian greens
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cornflour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sea salt flakes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cracked black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Chinese five-spice'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '150g each) pork loin medallions, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'oyster sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'baby choy sum, steamed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Broccolini', 'name': ', to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Combine cornflour, salt, pepper and spice in a large snap-lock bag. Add pork. Shake to coat., Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook pork for 3 to 4 minutes each side or until cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Cover loosely with foil to keep warm., Add oyster sauce, honey and 2 tablespoons cold water to pan. Bring to the boil, stirring. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 2 minutes or until thickened. Cut pork into 1cm-thick slices. Drizzle with sauce mixture. Serve with choy sum, broccolini and lime wedges.

name: Roast pork cutlets with creamy mustard sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Desiree potatoes, unpeeled, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, deseeded, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'wholegrain mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '250g each) rindless pork loin cutlets'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley leaves, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': ', to season'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Place potatoes800g Desiree potatoes, unpeeled, cut into wedges and capsicum2 red capsicum, deseeded, thickly sliced in a large roasting pan. Combine mustard1/4 cup wholegrain mustard, oil1 tbsp olive oil, stock1/3 cup chicken stock and salt and pepper in a jug. Pour over vegetables. Toss to combine., Place pork cutlets4 (250g each) rindless pork loin cutlets on top of vegetables. Season with salt and pepper. Roast for 30 minutes or until pork is just cooked through. Transfer pork to a plate. Cover with foil and stand for 10 minutes., Meanwhile, add cream1/2 cup thickened cream and parsley1/4 cup flat-leaf parsley leaves, chopped to vegetables in pan. Stir to combine. Return to oven for 10 minutes or until heated through., Place vegetables and pork onto plates. Spoon over creamy mustard sauce. Serve.

name: Crunchy spinach and ricotta filo pie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '280', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'filo pastry'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh ricotta'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'feta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}]
steps: Heat oil in a large deep frying pan over medium heat. Add spinach. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until just wilted. Transfer to a plate. Cool for 20 minutes. Place spinach in a sieve over a bowl. Using the back of a large spoon, press liquid from spinach., Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced. Brush the base and side of a 20cm-round (base) springform pan with a little of the butter. Place 1 sheet of filo on a flat surface. Brush with butter. Carefully push filo into pan, butter-side down, to line base and side of pan, allowing filo to extend over edge of pan. Repeat layering with 5 more sheets of filo and butter in a clockwise pattern., Place ricotta, fetta and egg in a large bowl. Stir to combine (mixture will appear lumpy). Stir in spinach. Season with salt and pepper., Gently spoon mixture into prepared pan. Carefully scrunch sides of filo into pan to form a border. Brush 1 sheet of remaining filo with butter. Scrunch and place on one half of the filling to cover. Repeat with final filo sheet and butter to cover filling. Brush edges with any remaining butter. Place pan on a baking tray. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until golden. Stand for 10 minutes. Carefully remove from pan. Serve.

name: Seafood & asparagus sesame tempura
ingredient: [{'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'wasabi paste'}, {'quantity': '330', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 1/2 cups) cornflour'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) iced water'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sunflower', 'name': 'oil, to deep-fry'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'peeled green prawns, with tails intact'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen Tasmanian Salmon Fillets, thawed, cut diagonally into 1.5cm slices'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'asparagus, trimmed, cut diagonally into 6cm lengths'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'SunRice Japanese Style Sushi Rice, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Soy', 'name': 'sauce, to serve'}]
steps: Combine mayonnaise and wasabi., Whisk cornflour, sesame seeds, egg and water in a bowl. Add oil to a large saucepan to reach a depth of 10cm. Heat to 180°C over medium-high heat (when the oil is ready, a cube of bread turns golden in 15 seconds). Dip half the prawns in batter to coat. Add to oil. Cook for 2 minutes or until crisp and cooked through. Transfer to a platter lined with paper towel. Repeat with the remaining prawns and batter., Dip salmon in batter to coat. Add to oil. Cook for 2 minutes or until crisp and fish is just cooked through. Transfer to platter. Dip asparagus in batter to coat. Add to oil and cook for 1 minute or until crisp. Transfer to the platter., Serve the tempura with wasabi mayonnaise, rice and soy sauce.

name: Pork & bok choy stir-fry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'rice stick noodles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '415g) pork fillet, thinly sliced across the grain'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': '-piece fresh ginger, peeled, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'fresh red chilli, halved lengthways, deseeded, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) kecap manis'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'baby bok choy, leaves separated, washed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'coarsely chopped fresh coriander'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander leaves, to garnish'}]
steps: Place the noodles in a large heatproof bowl and cover with boiling water. Set aside for 5 minutes to soften. Stir with a fork to separate. Drain., Heat the oil in a wok or large frying pan over high heat until just smoking. Add half the pork and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining pork., Add the pork, ginger, garlic and chilli to the wok and stir-fry for 1 minute or until aromatic. Add the kecap manis and lime juice and bring to the boil. Add the noodles and bok choy, and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until bok choy just wilts. Add the coriander and gently toss to combine. Divide the noodles among serving bowls and sprinkle with coriander leaves to garnish. Serve immediately.

name: Golden syrup dumplings
ingredient: [{'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chilled cubed butter'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'thin cream'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'golden syrup'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}]
steps: Rub 60g chilled cubed butter into 1 1/2 cups self-raising flour using fingertips. Add 1 egg, lightly whisked, and 1/2 cup thin cream. Use your hands to mix until well combined. Shape into 16 balls., Place 2 1/2 cups water, 2/3 cup golden syrup, 2/3 cup brown sugar and 50g butter in a large saucepan. Stir over low heat until sugar dissolves., Increase heat and bring to a simmer. Carefully place the dumplings into the syrup. Cover and reduce heat to medium-low. Cook, covered, for 20-25 mins or until the dumplings are cooked. Serve dumplings with sauce.

name: Spicy apricot chicken wings with roasted broccoli salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'apricot jam'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chilli jam'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'chicken wing nibbles'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'heads', 'name': 'broccoli, cut into 1cm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'natural flaked almonds'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped dried apricots'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dried cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan-forced. Line 2 large baking trays with baking paper., Whisk jams and soy sauce together in a large bowl. Reserve 1⁄4 cup marinade. Add chicken. Stir to coat. Place a wire rack over 1 baking tray. Place chicken, skin-side up, on wire rack. Roast for 40 to 45 minutes, basting with reserved marinade during the last 15 minutes of cooking time., Meanwhile, place broccoli, in a single layer, on remaining tray. Combine garlic, chilli and 2 tablespoons oil in a small bowl. Drizzle oil over broccoli. Roast for 20 to 25 minutes, sprinkling with almonds halfway through cooking time. Season., Transfer broccoli mixture to a large bowl. Add rocket, dried apricots, cranberries and chives. Drizzle over lemon juice and remaining oil. Toss to combine., Divide broccoli mixture among serving plates. Top with wings. Serve.

name: Fresh pasta with basil pesto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(450g) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Brand Australian free range eggs'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Shaved', 'name': 'parmesan, to serve (or vegetarian hard cheese)'}]
steps: Sift flour and salt onto a clean work surface. Shape the flour into a round mound. Make a well in the centre. Crack eggs into the well. Use a fork to lightly whisk the eggs. Gradually blend a little of the flour into the egg mixture. Continue to gradually draw the flour into the centre until the mixture forms a dough. Knead firmly, turning frequently, for 10 mins or until smooth and elastic. Cover with plastic wrap. Place in the fridge for 1 hour to rest., Divide dough into 4 equal portions. Cover each portion with plastic wrap. Secure a pasta machine to the side of the work surface. Adjust rollers to the widest setting. Shape 1 dough portion into a flat rectangle and use a rolling pin to flatten slightly. Roll through the machine. Dust with extra flour. Fold in the shorter sides of the dough to meet in the centre to form a smaller rectangle. Feed through the machine again. Repeat 6 times., Reduce roller setting by 1. Roll dough through the machine. Continue reducing the setting and rolling until you reach the second-last setting and the pasta is about 1mm thick. Spread pasta sheet over a clean work surface dusted with flour. Sprinkle with flour and loosely roll up. Repeat with remaining dough., Use a large sharp knife to cut the pasta sheets crossways into 2cm-wide ribbons and lightly dust with flour., Meanwhile, to make the basil pesto, process the basil, parmesan, pine nuts and garlic in a food processor until finely chopped. With the motor running, gradually add the oil in a thin, steady stream until combined., Cook the pasta in a large saucepan of salted boiling water for 2-3 mins or until tender. Drain well. Return to pan and add the pesto. Toss to combine. Divide among serving bowls. Top with shaved parmesan and serve immediately.

name: Spiced fruit compote
ingredient: [{'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3/4 cup) water'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece orange rind'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) fresh orange juice'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup, firmly packed) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'quantity': '1 200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt dried fruit salad mix'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'dried', 'name': 'figs, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Granny', 'name': 'Smith apple, peeled, cored, cut into thin wedges'}]
steps: Combine water, orange rind, orange juice, sugar, cinnamon and cardamom in a saucepan over low heat. Stir until sugar dissolves. Increase heat to medium-high. Add dried fruit and figs, and simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, for 8 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low, add apple and simmer, uncovered, for 2 minutes or until tender. Spoon into serving bowls.

name: Parsley-crusted lamb with chickpea salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'drained capers, chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'lamb', 'name': 'rump steaks'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chickpeas, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumbers, halved lengthways, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocado', 'name': ', coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) fresh orange juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves'}]
steps: Combine parsley and capers in a shallow dish. Rub over lamb. Heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Spray with oil. Cook the lamb for 4-5 minutes each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil to keep warm., Place chickpeas, cucumber, avocado and onion in a bowl. Whisk the orange juice and oil in a jug. Season with salt and pepper. Pour over the salad. Toss to combine., Thickly slice the lamb. Divide salad among serving plates. Top with lamb and mint.

name: Middle Eastern whole stuffed pumpkin
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'kent (jap) pumpkin'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'brown rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'brown onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lamb mince'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'harissa'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chickpeas, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can lentils, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '80g packets pistachio kernels, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Tamar', 'name': 'Valley Greek Style Yoghurt, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 210°C/190°C fan-forced., Using a sharp knife, carefully cut a circle from top of pumpkin4kg kent (jap) pumpkin, leaving a 4cm border. Wrap pumpkin lid in foil. Place on a baking tray. Scoop seeds and membrane from pumpkin and discard. Place pumpkin, cut side-down, on baking tray. Cover with foil. Bake for 1 hour or until flesh is just tender., Meanwhile, cook rice2 cups brown rice following packet directions. Drain. Transfer to a bowl. Cover. Heat oil1 tbsp olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook onion2 medium brown onions, chopped, stirring, for 5 minutes or until soft. Add mince500g lamb mince. Cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up mince, for 6 minutes or until browned. Add harissa3 tsp harissa cumin2 tsp ground cumin, cinnamon1 tsp ground cinnamon, chilli flakes1 tsp dried chilli flakes, stock3/4 cup chicken stock, chickpeas400g can chickpeas, drained, rinsed and lentils400g can lentils, drained, rinsed. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes or until heated through. Season with salt. Add rice to lamb mixture. Stir in coriander1 cup fresh coriander leaves, chopped and half the pistachios2 x 80g packets pistachio kernels, chopped. Set aside., Transfer pumpkin to a board. Cut 1 cup flesh from inside pumpkin. Roughly chop flesh. Add to rice mixture. Fill pumpkin cavity with rice mixture, pressing down firmly with the back of a spoon (see note). Return lid to pumpkin. Wrap pumpkin in foil. Return to baking tray. Bake for 1 hour 30 minutes to 2 hours or until tender when pierced with a skewer. Stand for 5 minutes., Remove foil from pumpkin. Transfer to a plate (base will be quite soft). Cut into wedges. Dollop with yoghurt Greek Style Yoghurt, to serve. Sprinkle with remaining pistachios. Serve.

name: Lentil, olive and pumpkin lasagne
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white wine'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pumpkin, cooked, pureed'}, {'quantity': '415', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can lentils, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '425g cans chopped tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olives, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'fresh lasagne (100g total)'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'reduced-fat feta cheese, crumbled'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'rocket', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Heat a saucepan over medium heat. Spray with oilolive oil cooking spray. Add onion1 large brown onion, finely chopped. Cook for 5 minutes or until coloured., Add garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed, wine1/4 cup white wine, pumpkin400g pumpkin, cooked, pureed, lentils415g can lentils, drained, tomatoes2 x 425g cans chopped tomatoes, olives2 tbsp olives, finely chopped and stock1 cup vegetable stock. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer for 25 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in parsley1/2 cup flat-leaf parsley, chopped. Season with salt and pepper., Spoon quarter of lentil mixture into a 5cm deep, 20cm x 20cm ovenproof dish. Top with a lasagne sheet3 sheets fresh lasagne (100g total). Repeat twice with lentil mixture and lasagne. Spread remaining lentil mixture over lasagne., Sprinkle top with feta60g reduced-fat feta cheese, crumbled. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until cooked through. Stand for 5 minutes before slicing. Serve topped with rocketrocket leaves, to serve.

name: Marion's red braised lamb with egg noodles
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'boneless lamb shoulder, cut into 3cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': '-piece fresh ginger, peeled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, sliced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) Shaoxing wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'whole', 'name': 'star anise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'stick'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Chinese five spice'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) light soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dark soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '45', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup, lightly packed) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cornflour'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh thin Chinese egg noodles'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'soft', 'name': '-boiled eggs, peeled, halved'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sambal', 'name': 'oelek, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 170C/150C fan forced. Heat oil in a large flameproof casserole dish over medium-high heat. Cook the lamb, in batches, turning, for 4 minutes or until browned. Transfer to a plate and set aside., Use a small sharp knife to cut the ginger into matchsticks. Add ginger, onion and garlic to the dish. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until softened. Add wine and cook, scraping the base of the dish with a spoon, to deglaze., Return lamb to the dish along with star anise, cinnamon, five spice, pepper, soy sauces, tomato paste and brown sugar. Bake in preheated oven for 2 hours until lamb is very tender and pulls apart easily., For the sesame cucumber, place the cucumber in a bowl. Add the vinegar, oil and salt. Gently toss to combine. Cover and place in the fridge until ready to serve. Combine the cornflour and water. Set aside., Remove lamb from oven. Blot surface with paper towel to remove fat. Place dish over medium heat. Bring to boil. Stir in combined cornflour and water. Simmer for 2-3 minutes or until thickened slightly., Cook the noodles in a large saucepan of boiling salted water for 3-4 minutes or until tender. Drain. Divide among serving bowls. Top with braised lamb, cucumber and an egg half. Serve with sambal oelek.

name: Barbecued chicken with Japanese soy and tahini dressing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tahini'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Japanese soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'rice wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken thigh fillets, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, peeled, seeded, cut into 3mm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'oyster mushrooms (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'wombok, cut lengthways into 8 wedges'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Canola', 'name': 'oil spray or olive oil spray'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'toasted sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'sushi rice, to serve'}]
steps: Combine tahini, sesame oil, soy sauce, vinegar and sugar in a screw-top jar; shake well to combine. Place chicken in a bowl and pour over 2 tablespoons of tahini dressing. Set aside for 5 minutes to marinate., Heat a lightly greased barbecue or char-grill plate on high. Lightly spray pumpkin, mushrooms and wombok with oil spray. Add the pumpkin to the grill and cook for 3 minutes. Add the mushrooms and wombok and cook for a further 1 minute or until tender and lightly charred. Transfer vegetables to a plate and cover to keep warm., Drain chicken and lightly spray with oil. Cook on grill, turning, for 6 minutes or until browned and cooked through., Place the chicken and vegetables on serving plates. Drizzle with remaining dressing and sprinkle with sesame seeds and green onion. Serve immediately with steamed rice, if desired.

name: Star anise orange chicken with cherry seasoning
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '1.7kg  (size 17) chicken'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'orange', 'name': ', halved crossways'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'star', 'name': 'anise'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3 tbsp) butter, softened'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}]
steps: Place an oven rack on lowest shelf in the oven. Remove other racks. Preheat oven to 230°C., To make cherry seasoning, place breadcrumbs in a large bowl. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat until foaming. Add onion and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until soft. Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until aromatic. Set aside for 5 minutes to cool slightly. Add cooled butter mixture, cherries, parsley, eggs and sage to breadcrumbs. Season with salt and pepper, and stir with a spoon until well combined. Lightly brush an 8 x 20cm nut roll pan with melted butter to grease. Remove one end of nut roll pan. Stand upright and spoon in cherry seasoning. Smooth surface with back of spoon and seal firmly with lid., Briefly rinse the chicken cavity under cold running water. Pat dry inside and out with paper towel. Juice the orange halves. Place the orange halves and star anise in the cavity of the chicken. Place the chicken breast-side up in a small roasting pan and use your fingers to rub the butter over the skin. Drizzle with the orange juice and season with salt and pepper., Roast chicken in preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 190°C. Place filled nut roll pan upright in oven. Cook, basting chicken with pan juices occasionally, for 1 hour or until chicken is just cooked through and juices run clear when pierced with a skewer in thickest part of thigh. Remove chicken and seasoning from oven, holding base of nut roll pan. Cover chicken loosely with foil and set aside for 15 minutes to rest., Pour the pan juices into a medium saucepan. Cook, stirring, over low heat for 2 minutes or until heated through., Carefully remove one end of the nut roll pan and slide out the seasoning. Use a sharp knife to cut into 1cm-thick slices., To serve, use kitchen scissors to cut chicken in quarters. Divide cherry seasoning and chicken among serving plates. Drizzle with pan juices.

name: Chilli crab
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'green', 'name': '(uncooked) blue swimmer crabs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'long red chillies (or 1-2 fresh red birdseye chillies for extra heat), finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sweet chilli sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dry sherry'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'shallots, ends trimmed, thinly sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'firmly packed coarsely chopped fresh coriander'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'jasmine rice, to serve'}]
steps: Heat the oil2 tsp peanut oil in a large wok over high heat until just smoking. Add the crab4 green (uncooked) blue swimmer crabs and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes or until just cooked (the crabmeat will turn white when cooked)., Add the garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed, chilli2 fresh long red chillies (or 1-2 fresh red birdseye chillies for extra heat), finely chopped and ginger1 tbsp finely grated fresh ginger, and stir-fry for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add the tomato60ml (1/4 cup) tomato sauce and sweet chilli sauces2 tbsp sweet chilli sauce, sherry2 tbsp dry sherry and sugar1 tbsp brown sugar, and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes or until sauce boils and thickens slightly. Remove from heat. Add the green shallot6 green shallots, ends trimmed, thinly sliced diagonally and stir until just wilted. Add the coriander1/2 cup firmly packed coarsely chopped fresh coriander and toss until just combined. Spoon steamed rice among serving bowls. Top with chilli crab and serve immediately.

name: Affogato
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '30ml shots hot espresso coffee'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'hazelnut liqueur (we used Frangelico)'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'scoops', 'name': 'vanilla ice-cream'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Biscotti', 'name': ', to serve'}]
steps: Combine coffee and liqueur in a jug. Divide ice-cream between glasses., Divide coffee mixture between glasses. Serve with biscotti.

name: Strawberry crumbles
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'strawberries, hulled and halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'icing sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'vanilla', 'name': 'pod, split, seeds scraped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'mint, finely shredded'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'slivered almonds'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'rolled oats'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'maple syrup'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Coles Brand double cream'}]
steps: Place the strawberries into a bowl and add the icing sugar, vanilla and mint. Turn to combine, and set aside for 10 minutes, until slightly syrupy., Heat a dry non-stick frying pan over medium heat, and add the coconut. Cook, stirring with a heatproof spatula, for 1 min, until lightly golden. Transfer to a mixing bowl. Spread the almonds into the pan, and cook, stirring, for 2 mins, until golden. Add to the coconut., Melt the butter in the pan, and add the flour and oats. Cook, stirring, for 3 mins until lightly golden. Add the sugar and maple syrup and cook, stirring, a further 2 mins, until sticky and caramelised. Transfer to the bowl and stir until evenly combined., Divide strawberries between serving bowls, and sprinkle crumble mixture over. Serve drizzled with cream.

name: Miso-glazed salmon with ginger buckwheat noodles
ingredient: [{'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'white miso paste (see note)'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) tamari sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'mirin'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'buckwheat noodles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sunflower oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '125g each) salmon fillets'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'thinly sliced shallots (spring onions)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped roasted peanuts'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'pickled ginger'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mustard', 'name': 'cress, to serve'}]
steps: Combine honey, miso paste and 1 teaspoon of sesame oil in a bowl., In a separate bowl, whisk together tamari, lime juice, mirin and remaining sesame oil, then set the dressing aside., Cook noodles according to packet directions, drain and toss with dressing., Preheat oven to 200°C. Heat sunflower oil in an ovenproof frypan over medium heat. Add salmon and fry both sides for 1 minute or until lightly golden. Brush salmon with miso mixture, then transfer pan to oven and roast for 5 minutes or until cooked through., Toss shallots, nuts and ginger through noodles, then serve with the salmon garnished with mustard cress.

name: Chicken drumettes with warm pasta salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'wholegrain mustard'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken wing drumettes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried risoni pasta'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, cut into 2cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chargrilled red capsicum, chopped'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can corn kernels, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salad', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/200°C fan-forced. Line a large baking tray with baking paper. Combine honey, garlic, 2 tablespoons mustard and half the oil in a bowl. Place chicken in a bowl. Add half the honey mixture. Stir to coat., Place chicken on prepared tray. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, turning, basting with remaining honey mixture halfway through cooking, or until golden and cooked through., Meanwhile, cook pasta in a saucepan of boiling, salted water following packet directions, until tender, adding beans for the last 3 minutes. Drain., Whisk lemon juice, sugar, remaining mustard and remaining oil together in a bowl. Place pasta mixture, capsicum, corn and chives in a large bowl. Add lemon juice mixture. Stir to combine., Serve chicken with warm pasta salad and salad leaves.

name: Indian korma lamb shanks
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'lamb', 'name': 'shanks, french trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, halved, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Pataks Korma curry paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'beef stock'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'shredded fresh mint'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'Basmati rice, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Raita', 'name': 'or tzatziki, to serve'}]
steps: Heat half the oil1 tbsp olive oil in a large stock pot over medium-high heat. Add half of the lamb shanks6 lamb shanks, french trimmed and cook, turning occasionally, for 5 minutes or until brown. Transfer to a heatproof bowl. Repeat with remaining lamb., Heat the remaining oil in the pan. Add the onion1 brown onion, halved, cut into thin wedges and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until soft. Add the curry paste1/3 cup Pataks Korma curry paste and ginger2 tsp finely grated fresh ginger and cook, stirring for a minute or until aromatic., Add the stock2 cups beef stock and tomatoes400g can diced tomatoes, and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Return lamb shanks to the pan and cook, covered, for 2 hours or until lamb is tender and falls off the bone. Transfer lamb shanks to a heatproof bowl. Cover with foil to keep warm., Increase heat to high and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Stir in the peas1 1/2 cups frozen peas and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until heated through, then stir in the mint2 tbsp shredded fresh mint., Divide the riceSteamed Basmati rice, to serve among serving plates. Top with the lamb and drizzle with the sauce. Serve with raita or tzatzikiRaita or tzatziki, to serve dip.

name: Banana and blueberry cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'solidified coconut oil'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) coconut sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'lemon, rind finely grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '35', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) coconut flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'bananas'}, {'quantity': '85', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) almond meal'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'arrowroot (tapioca flour)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'gluten-free baking powder'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) light coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) frozen blueberries, thawed on paper towel'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Rice', 'name': 'malt syrup, to drizzle (optional)'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C fan forced. Grease base and side of a 19.5cm (base measurement) springform cake pan and line with baking paper., Use electric beaters to beat the coconut oil80g solidified coconut oil, sugar40g (1/4 cup) coconut sugar, lemon rind1 small lemon, rind finely grated, juiced and vanilla1 tsp vanilla extract in a bowl until pale and creamy. Beat in 1 egg and 1 tbs of the coconut flour35g (1/4 cup) coconut flour. Repeat with the remaining eggs and coconut flour35g (1/4 cup) coconut flour until combined (mixture may curdle slightly)., Thinly slice half a banana2 small bananas. Drizzle with a little lemon juice to prevent discolouration. Set aside. Use a fork to mash the remaining banana., Add the almond meal85g (3/4 cup) almond meal, arrowroot2 1/2 tbsp arrowroot (tapioca flour), baking powder2 tsp gluten-free baking powder, coconut milk125ml (1/2 cup) light coconut milk, mashed banana and 1 tbs lemon juice to coconut oil mixture. Stir until combined. Spoon into prepared pan and smooth the surface. Sprinkle with blueberries75g (1/2 cup) frozen blueberries, thawed on paper towel. Top with sliced banana. Bake for 50-55 minutes or until a skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely., Drizzle with rice malt syrupRice malt syrup, to drizzle (optional), if using.

name: Chicken garlic and herb broth
ingredient: [{'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'single', 'name': 'clove garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'litre', 'name': '(4 cups) Massel chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bay', 'name': 'leaves'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'fresh rosemary'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh continental parsley'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Freshly', 'name': 'ground pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'roast', 'name': 'chicken'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Grated', 'name': 'parmesan, to serve'}]
steps: Carefully press on the garlic cloves to bruise. Place the garlic, stock, wine and 300ml water in a saucepan. Add the bay leaves, thyme, rosemary and 8 parsley stalks to the pan. Season with a little pepper. Bring to the boil over a high heat. Reduce the heat and simmer, covered, for 15 minutes. Strain into a clean saucepan and discard the herbs and garlic., Remove the skin and bones from the chicken and shred the meat. Finely chop the remaining parsley leaves. Add the chicken and parsley to the stock, and stir over a medium heat until heated through. Serve topped with grated parmesan.

name: Broccoflower and blue cheese gratin
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'heads', 'name': '(1kg) broccoflower, cut into florets'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(35g) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(375ml) a2 milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(100g) coarsely grated Millel parmesan'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'slice', 'name': 'Tip Top 9 Grain bread, crusts removed'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'South Cape blue cheese, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Freshly', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Blanch broccoflower in salted boiling water for 1 minute. Drain well. Transfer to a 6-cup capacity oven-proof dish and set aside., Melt butter in medium saucepan. Add flour and cook, stirring for 1 minute. Gradually whisk in milk. Stir constantly, over medium heat, for about 5 minutes, or until mixture boils and thickens. Remove from heat and stir in half the parmesan. Spoon mixture over broccoflower., Cut bread into small chunky crumbs. Place in a bowl with remaining parmesan, blue cheese, and olive oil. Mix well. Sprinkle mixture evenly over gratin. Bake for about 10 minutes, or until golden. Season well with pepper and serve immediately.

name: Fennel and radish salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber, peeled into ribbons'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'radishes, trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'fennel, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'oakleaf', 'name': 'combo lettuce, leaves torn  (see note)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}]
steps: Place oil, lemon juice and sugar in a large bowl. Stir until sugar has dissolved. Season with salt and pepper. Add cucumber, radish and fennel. Toss to combine. Set aside for 5 minutes., Add lettuce to mixture. Toss to combine. Sprinkle with mint and parsley. Serve.

name: Fragrant lamb with fruit and nut couscous
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece ginger'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'green chillies'}, {'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) Tamar Valley Greek Style Yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '275g lamb backstraps'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh coriander, plus extra leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'lim', 'name': 'e'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) couscous'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2/3 cup) dried apricots'}, {'quantity': '45', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) pistachios'}]
steps: Peel ginger and garlic, then roughly chop with chillies. Process with yoghurt, cardamom and half each of the ground cumin and coriander in a food processor until smooth. Tip half the mixture into a bowl, then stir in 1 teaspoon turmeric and 1 tablespoon oil. Add lamb and turn to coat., To make dressing, trim large stalks from fresh coriander and discard, then add leaves and small stems to remaining yoghurt mixture. Add sugar and 1/4 teaspoon salt, squeeze in lime juice, then process until smooth. Set aside., Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add couscous, remaining spices and 1 teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until lightly toasted. Turn off heat. Using scissors, halve apricots and add to pan. Taking care as mixture will spit, stir in 310ml (1 1/4 cups) boiling water. Cover with a lid or foil and stand for 10 minutes or until water is absorbed., Meanwhile, heat a frying pan over medium–high heat. Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil, heat, then cook lamb for 4 minutes each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate and rest for 5 minutes., Roughly chop pistachios, scatter over couscous, then fluff up with a fork. Divide couscous among bowls. Cut lamb into slices and place on top. Drizzle with coriander dressing to serve.

name: Individual chunky beef pies
ingredient: [{'quantity': '700', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'gravy beef, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cup mushrooms, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh rosemary'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) Beef stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles Tomato Paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': '(25 x 25cm) frozen ready-rolled shortcrust pastry, just thawed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': '(25 x 25cm) frozen ready-rolled puff pastry, just thawed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Tomato', 'name': 'sauce, to serve'}]
steps: Place the beef700g gravy beef, cut into 2cm pieces in a large bowl and sprinkle with flour2 tbsp plain flour. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat., Heat half the oil2 tbsp olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add half the beef and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until browned. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with the remaining oil and beef, reheating the pan between batches., Add the mushroom250g cup mushrooms, quartered, onion1 brown onion, coarsely chopped, garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed and rosemary1 tsp chopped fresh rosemary to the pan, and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until the onion softens. Stir in the beef, stock375ml (1 1/2 cups) Beef stock and tomato paste2 tbsp Tomato Paste and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low. Cook, covered, for 1 hour. Uncover and cook, stirring occasionally, for a further 30 minutes or until the beef is tender. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Set aside for 1 hour to cool slightly. Transfer to a bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Place in the fridge for 2 hours to cool completely., Preheat oven to 210°C. Cut the shortcrust pastry sheets2 sheets (25 x 25cm) frozen ready-rolled shortcrust pastry, just thawed in half diagonally. Line 4 round 3cm-deep, 9.5cm (base measurement) pie tins with shortcrust pastry, allowing the sides to overhang. Brush the edges with a little egg1 egg, lightly whisked. Divide the beef mixture evenly among the pastry cases., Cut each puff pastry sheet2 sheets (25 x 25cm) frozen ready-rolled puff pastry, just thawed in half diagonally. Top the pies with puff pastry and trim excess. Use a fork to press the edges to seal. Brush the pies with the remaining egg. Cut a small cross in the centre of each pie. Place the pies on the baking tray and bake in oven for 30 minutes or until puffed and golden. Serve with tomato sauceTomato sauce, to serve.

name: Pork skewers with bean, pea & zucchini saffron rice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pork scotch fillet, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried oregano leaves'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of saffron threads'}, {'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt SunRice Long Grain White Rice in 90 seconds'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green round beans, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', halved lengthways, thinly sliced'}]
steps: Combine the pork600g pork scotch fillet, cut into 2cm pieces, garlic3 garlic cloves, crushed, paprika2 1/2 tsp smoked paprika, oregano1 tsp dried oregano leaves and lemon juice60ml (1/4 cup) lemon juice in a bowl. Set aside for 10 minutes to marinate. Thread onto soaked bamboo skewers., Preheat chargrill on high. Cook the skewers, in 2 batches, for 3 minutes each side or until just cooked. Transfer to a plate. Keep warm., Meanwhile, combine the stock80ml (1/3 cup) chicken stock and saffronPinch of saffron threads in a heatproof bowl. Cover and microwave on High/800watts/100% for 3 minutes. Set aside for 3 minutes to develop the flavours., Stir in the rice450g pkt Long Grain White Rice in 90 seconds, peas300g (2 cups) frozen peas, beans100g green round beans, halved and zucchini1 zucchini, halved lengthways, thinly sliced.
