Toss to combine. Cover and microwave on High/800watts/100%, stirring halfway through cooking, for 3 minutes or until rice is heated and vegetables are tender. Serve with the skewers.

name: Chicken lettuce coleslaw
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'barbecued', 'name': 'chicken, shredded (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'iceberg', 'name': 'lettuce, shredded'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', peeled, grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': 'celery, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'whole-egg mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}]
steps: Place chicken, lettuce, carrot and celery in a large bowl. Toss to combine., Place mayonnaise, lemon juice and garlic in a small bowl. Whisk to combine. Season with salt and pepper., Add mayonnaise mixture to chicken mixture. Toss to combine. Season with pepper. Serve.

name: Asparagus and smoked trout pasta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh egg fettuccine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'asparagus, trimmed, cut into 4'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'carton cream'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'smoked trout slices, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh dill, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Crusty', 'name': 'bread, to serve'}]
steps: Cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling salted water for 4-5 mins or according to packet instructions. Drain and keep warm., Meanwhile, heat oil in a large frying pan on high. Sauté onion and garlic for 3-4 mins until tender., Add asparagus and sauté for 1-2 mins. Stir in wine and simmer for 2-3 mins, until reduced by half. Blend in mustard and cream. Bring to the boil., Reduce heat and simmer for 1 min. Stir trout and dill through. Toss sauce through hot pasta. Season to taste and serve with crusty bread.

name: Creamy avocado and crab salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Coles brand whole egg mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated lime zest'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Good', 'name': 'pinch of cayenne pepper, plus extra to garnish'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '170g cans shredded crab meat, well drained'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can Coles brand corn kernels, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'onions', 'name': ', pale section only, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'ripe', 'name': 'medium avocados'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'coriander, sprigs picked'}]
steps: Combine the mayonnaise, lime juice, lime zest and cayenne pepper in a large bowl., Add the crab meat and stir until combined. Mix in the corn, cucumber and onion., Halve and remove the seed and skin from each avocado. Use a small knife to cut the flesh into 2cm pieces. Add to the bowl and mix gently to combine. Season with salt., Divide coriander among plates. Top with salad. Sprinkle with a little extra cayenne pepper.

name: Get-ahead tarragon chicken
ingredient: [{'quantity': '105', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) pearl barley'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '1.2kg chickens, each cut into 6 pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'sticks, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', peeled, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '175', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'short-cut bacon rashers, rind removed, cut into batons'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'French shallots, peeled, halved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Cream', 'name': 'Delight potatoes, peeled, cut into 1.5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'dried', 'name': 'bay leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Continental', 'name': 'Salt Reduced Chicken Stock Pot'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) boiling water'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) white wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh tarragon'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Crusty', 'name': 'bread, to serve'}]
steps: Place barley in a bowl. Cover with cold water. Set aside for 6 hours or overnight to soak. Drain., Preheat oven to 170C. Heat half the oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook the chicken, in 2 batches, turning, for 5 minutes or until browned. Transfer to a plate., Heat the remaining oil in the frying pan over medium heat. Cook the celery, carrot, bacon and shallot, stirring, for 5-6 minutes or until soft. Stir in the garlic for 1 minute or until aromatic. Transfer the vegetable mixture to a large, heavy-based roasting pan. Stir in the potato, barley and bay leaves. Arrange the chicken pieces on top., Dissolve stock in the boiling water. Add the stock, wine and tarragon to the frying pan over medium-high heat. Bring to the boil. Season. Pour over the chicken mixture. Cover the roasting pan tightly with 2 layers of foil. Bake for 1 hour or until the chicken is cooked through. Transfer the chicken to a plate and cover to keep warm. Bake the vegetables, covered, for a further 20 minutes or until tender. Serve the chicken and vegetables with bread.

name: Pumpkin and bacon rigatoni
ingredient: [{'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Kent pumpkin, peeled, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried rigatoni pasta'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Coles Brand Diced Bacon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tomatoes', 'name': ', chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely grated parmesan'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220C or 200C fan. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Toss pumpkin with 1 tsp oil. Season. Bake, turning once, for 30 mins or until tender and browned., Meanwhile, cook the rigatoni in a large saucepan of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain, reserving 1/3 cup cooking liquid., Heat remaining oil in a deep frying pan over high heat. Cook bacon, stirring, for 5 mins or until crispy. Reserve 1/4 cup bacon. Add onion to the pan and cook for 2-3 mins or until tender. Add cream and reserved cooking liquid. Simmer for 3 mins or until slightly thickened. Add pasta and toss to combine. Gently stir in pumpkin, tomato and half the basil. Sprinkle with parmesan, reserved bacon and remaining basil.

name: Ham and pineapple salad wraps
ingredient: [{'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'shaved ham, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '225g can pineapple pieces, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, halved, deseeded, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow pea sprouts, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) roasted unsalted cashews, chopped'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'butter', 'name': 'lettuce leaves'}]
steps: Combine the ham, pineapple, capsicum, snow pea sprouts, cucumber and cashews in a large bowl., Divide the salad mixture among the lettuce leaves and wrap up to enclose the filling.

name: Roast pork with Thai watermelon salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Australian Pork Leg Roast (about 3kg), rind on and bone in'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sea salt (flakes preferred)'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) rice wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(55g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'ginger, peeled, very finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'watermelon, rind removed, flesh cut into 5mm-thick triangular slices'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh small basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh small mint leaves'}]
steps: To prepare pork, the night before cooking, using a sharp knife or box cutter, deepen scoring on rind and extend existing scoring so that all of rind is scored. Be sure to cut all the way through rind and fat until you reach meat (do not cut through meat). Refrigerate pork, uncovered, for at least 12 hours and up to 2 days. Let stand at room temperature for 1 hour before cooking., Preheat oven to 250C (230C fan-forced). Rub sea salt into scored rind. Season cut-side of pork with salt and place pork, cut-side down, on a rack set in a roasting pan., Roast pork for 30 mins or until rind is crisp and golden. Reduce oven temperature to 160C (140C fan-forced) and roast for 2½ hours or until an instant-read thermometer inserted into centre of pork registers 65°C. Transfer pork to a carving board to rest for 20 mins., Meanwhile, to make watermelon salad, in a medium bowl, whisk lime juice, vinegar, sugar, fish sauce and ginger. Stir in onion and set aside at room temperature for 20 mins to soften onion., Place watermelon in a large shallow bowl. Spoon dressing over watermelon and turn gently to coat. Sprinkle with basil and mint., Using a sharp knife, cut crackling from pork. Thinly slice pork and arrange with crackling on another platter. Serve alongside watermelon salad.

name: Avocado, pancetta, herb & meatball salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'good', 'name': '-quality pork & herb chipolata sausages, casings removed'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'flat', 'name': 'pancetta slices'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'watercress, sprigs picked'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'avocados', 'name': ', chopped'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh redcurrants, stems removed (see note)'}]
steps: Roll the sausage meat into walnut-sized balls, then place in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to firm up., Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper., Place pancetta on the tray and bake for 8-10 minutes until crisp. Cool slightly on paper towel, then break into pieces., Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a frypan over medium heat and cook the meatballs, turning, for 5-6 minutes until golden and cooked through. Set aside and keep warm., Whisk Dijon mustard, vinegar and remaining 1/3 cup (80ml) oil in a bowl and season. Add watercress, avocado and pancetta, and toss gently to combine., To serve, arrange salad on a platter and scatter with meatballs and redcurrants just before serving.

name: One-pan cheesy French onion pork
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '(', 'name': '500g) pork loin steaks'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onions, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Massel Chicken Style Liquid Stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated gruyere cheese'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chopped', 'name': 'fresh flat-leaf parsley, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'broccolini, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Crusty', 'name': 'bread, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced., Heat oil in a large ovenproof frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook pork, in batches, for 2 minutes each side or until browned. Transfer to a plate., Melt butter in same pan. Add onion. Cook, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until just starting to soften. Add garlic. Cook for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add flour. Cook for 1 minute or until onion is well coated, adding a little extra butter if needed. Add wine. Simmer for 1 minute. Add stock, Worcestershire sauce, sugar and thyme. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to the boil., Cover pan. Bake for 10 minutes or until onion softens. Arrange pork on onion mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Season with pepper. Bake, uncovered, for 5 to 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and pork is just cooked through. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve with steamed broccolini and crusty bread.

name: Macaroni and haloumi fritters with Greek salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried macaroni'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '225', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet haloumi, cut into 1cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vegetable', 'name': 'oil, for shallow-frying'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby cucumbers, sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomatoes, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pitted kalamata olives, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves, roughly torn'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice, plus wedges, to serve'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried oregano'}]
steps: Cook macaroni in a large saucepan of boiling water following packet directions. Drain. Transfer to a large bowl. Cool for 30 minutes. Add egg, flour and milk. Season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine. Add haloumi and chives. Stir to combine., Pour enough vegetable oil in a large frying pan to come 5mm up side of pan. Heat over medium-high heat. Add 1/4 cup macaroni mixture to pan. Repeat 3 more times to make 4 fritters. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes each side or until golden and cooked through. Transfer to paper towel to drain. Repeat with remaining mixture to make 12 fritters., Place baby cucumber, tomato, olives, onion and mint leaves in a bowl. Whisk lemon juice, olive oil and oregano together in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle over salad. Toss to combine. Divide fritters and salad among serving plates. Serve with lemon wedges.

name: Macadamia-crusted fish with herb salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(300g) unsalted macadamias'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', zested, juiced, plus wedges to serve'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh flat-leaf parsley'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'chives'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '160g skinless barramundi fillets'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed salad leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C and line a tray with baking paper., Place nuts, garlic, zest, half the juice and 1 tablespoon oil in a small food processor and whiz into a coarse paste. Transfer to a bowl and season. Finely chop 2 tablespoons each parsley and chives and stir in., Place fish on tray and press nut mixture onto the top. Bake for 15-20 minutes until the crust is golden and the fish is opaque., Pick remaining parsley leaves and halve chives. Toss with salad leaves, remaining oil and lemon juice. Season, then serve with fish and lemon wedges.

name: Trifle tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', plus 1 egg yolk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'strawberry jam'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sponge finger biscuits (savoiardi)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dessert wine or sweet sherry'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'punnet', 'name': '(250g) strawberries'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream, whipped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Toasted', 'name': 'flaked almonds, to garnish'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'mint, to garnish'}]
steps: For pastry, whiz dry ingredients in a food processor to combine. Add butter and whiz until mix resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add vanilla and egg, and process until mix comes together in a smooth ball. Enclose in plastic wrap and chill for 30 minutes. Roll out 3-5mm thick on a lightly floured surface, then use to line a rectangular, 10cm x 33cm loose-bottomed tart pan. Chill for 15 minutes., Preheat oven to 200°C. Line tart with baking paper and fill with pastry weights or uncooked rice. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove paper and weights, then cool., Using a wooden spoon, beat egg, yolk, vanilla, sugar and flour in a bowl until combined. Heat milk on medium-high heat until just below boiling point. Pour milk over egg mixture, whisking continuously, then return to pan. Cook on very low heat, stirring, for 5-6 minutes until custard is thick and coats the back of a spoon. Cover surface with a sheet of baking paper to prevent a skin from forming. Cool., Remove cooled pastry from pan and spread with jam. Crumble sponge fingers or whiz in a processor until fine, then mix with wine. Spread over jam, patting down well. Halve 6 strawberries and set aside, then slice the rest thinly and lay over the tart. Fold 3 tablespoons cream into the cooled custard, then spread over berries. Dollop remaining cream over custard, then use a palette knife to spread evenly. When ready to serve, garnish with reserved berries, toasted almonds and mint.

name: Pork with avocado, cherry tomato and pepita salsa
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'firm', 'name': 'ripe avocado, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions (shallots), thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '45', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) pepitas, lightly toasted'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '125g each) pork loin steaks, excess fat trimmed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sweet paprika'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'steamed basmati rice'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'greens, (such as broccolini and snow peas), to serve'}]
steps: Combine the tomato, avocado, spring onion, pepitas, coriander, garlic, lime juice and oil in a bowl. Season with pepper., Preheat a barbecue grill or chargrill on medium-high. Spray with olive oil. Sprinkle both sides of pork with the paprika. Cook on grill for 2-3 minutes each side or until just cooked through. Transfer to a chopping board and cover with foil. Set aside for 3 minutes to rest., Cut the pork into 1cm-thick slices. Divide the rice and pork among plates. Top with tomato mixture. Serve with greens.

name: Ocean trout with coriander potato salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '480g) chat (small coliban) potatoes, quartered'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed salad leaves, washed, dried'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'fresh red chillies, deseeded, cut lengthways into thin strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sal', 'name': 't'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '125g each) ocean trout fillets'}, {'quantity': '110', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Delikatess mayonnaise (Thomy brand)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'roughly chopped fresh coriander'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh dill'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}]
steps: Cook the potatoes in a large saucepan of boiling water for 7-8 minutes or until just tender. Drain and refresh under cold running water until cooled slightly. Transfer the potatoes to a large bowl., Add the salad leaves, onion, chillies and oil to the potatoes. Gently toss until combined. Taste and season with salt., Place trout in a steamer over a medium saucepan of boiling water. Cover and steam for 5-6 minutes for medium-rare or until cooked to your liking., Combine the mayonnaise, coriander, dill, water and lemon juice in a small bowl. Taste and season with salt., Divide the potato salad among serving plates. Top with the trout and drizzle with the mayonnaise.

name: Pork, pistachio and prosciutto loaf
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fennel seeds'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pork and veal mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cups) fresh breadcrumbs (made from day-old bread)'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) unsalted pistachio kernels'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh rosemary'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': '(about 200g) prosciutto'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chunky', 'name': 'tomato relish, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Watercress', 'name': 'sprigs, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Spray a 7cm-deep, 11 x 21cm (base measurement) loaf pan with olive oil spray to grease., Heat oil in a frying pan over medium-low heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until soft. Add the garlic and fennel seeds and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until aromatic. Transfer to a large bowl. Set aside to cool., Add the mince, eggs, breadcrumbs, pistachios, rosemary and allspice to the onion mixture and stir until well combined. Season with salt and pepper., Arrange the prosciutto, overlapping slightly, over the base and 2 long sides of the prepared pan, allowing the sides to overhang. Press the mince mixture into the pan. Fold the prosciutto over to enclose the filling. Cover with foil and bake for 20 minutes. Remove the foil. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the juices run clear when a skewer is inserted into the centre., Cut into slices. Serve with relish and watercress.

name: Chicken tacos with chargrilled corn
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'corn', 'name': 'cobs, husks and silk removed'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Old El Paso™ Hard ‘N Soft Taco Kit'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(35g) panko breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'RSPCA Approved Australian Chicken Breast Fillets, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Canola', 'name': 'oil, to shallow-fry'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocado', 'name': ', stoned, peeled, mashed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'cos lettuce leaves, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Coriander', 'name': 'sprigs, to serve'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Combine onion and vinegar in a bowl. Set aside for 10 mins to soak. Drain well., Meanwhile, heat a chargrill on high. Brush corn with 2 tbs of salsa from taco kit. Cook, turning, for 8 mins or until charred. Cool slightly. Use a serrated knife to cut down the side of the corn to release the kernels., Combine the spice sachet from the taco kit with the breadcrumbs in a bowl. Place the egg in a shallow dish. Dip the chicken in the egg, then in breadcrumb mixture, turning to coat., Add enough oil to a large frying pan to come 5mm up side of pan. Heat over medium-high heat. Cook the chicken, in 2 batches, turning, for 6-8 mins or until golden and cooked through. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel., Heat taco shells and tortillas from taco kit following packet directions. Top with the avocado, lettuce, chicken, corn, onion and coriander. Spoon over the mayonnaise and remaining salsa from the taco kit. Serve with lime wedges.

name: Piselli con prosciutto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'prosciutto, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'leek, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'pkt frozen baby peas'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) white wine'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}]
steps: Heat the oil1 tbsp olive oil in a large heavy-based saucepan over medium-high heat. Add prosciutto6 slices prosciutto, coarsely chopped. Stir for 2 minutes or until golden. Add leek1 large leek, halved, thinly sliced and garlic2 garlic cloves, thinly sliced and stir for 4 minutes or until soft., Add peas1kg pkt frozen baby peas and stir for 1 minute or until coated. Add wine60ml (1/4 cup) white wine and cook for 1 minute or until almost evaporated. Stir in the stock80ml (1/3 cup) chicken stock. Cover. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 5-6 minutes or until peas are tender. Season with pepper. Top with butter20g butter, chopped.

name: Smoky roast chicken with 'sproutkraut'
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.8', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'whole chicken'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'orange', 'name': ', quartered'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika (pimenton)'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C. Pat chicken dry and season with salt. Place on wire rack set in a shallow roasting pan. Add 1 cup (250ml) water to pan, squeeze in orange juice, then add squeezed oranges, cut-side up, to rack. Roast for 20 minutes or until light golden. Combine butter, garlic and paprika. Remove chicken from oven and brush with butter mixture. Reduce oven to 160°C. Roast for a further 45 minutes or until cooked through. Rest, loosely covered with foil, for 10 minutes., Strain pan juices and transfer to a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes or until jus is thickened and reduced., Meanwhile, for the sproutkraut, heat oil in a frypan over medium heat. Cook onion for 3-4 minutes until softened. Add sugar and caraway seeds, and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant. Stir through the Brussels sprouts, vinegar, currants, 3 tsp salt and 1/3 cup (80ml) water, and cook for a further 5 minutes or until reduced. Stir through parsley and remove from heat., Drizzle chicken with jus and serve with sproutkraut.

name: Beef skewers with satay sauce & cucumber salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef rump steaks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'grated palm sugar (top tips)'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fish sauce (see top tips)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(about 1/2) pineapple'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'cos lettuce or'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'iceberg lettuce'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Roasted', 'name': 'unsalted peanuts, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'jasmine rice, to serve'}]
steps: To marinate beef: Using the claw technique (see Cutting Techniques, below), trim fat from beef and discard. Cut the beef across the grain into 5mm-thick strips. Place in a bowl. To make the marinade, squeeze the juice of 1 lime. Place in a jug with palm sugar, fish sauce, oil, spices and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Crush over the garlic, then stir until sugar dissolves. Pour marinade over beef and toss well to coat. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour., To make satay: sauce Place peanuts in a food processor and process in short bursts until roughly chopped. Place coconut milk in a wok or saucepan, bring to the boil over medium heat, then cook, stirring continuously, for 5 minutes or until it looks oily and slightly separated. Add curry paste and cook, stirring frequently, for 6 minutes. Stir in fish sauce, sugar and tamarind, bring to a simmer, then cook for 3 minutes. Add peanuts. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until thickened., To prepare salad ingredients: Using the bridge technique (see Cutting Techniques, below), cut the cucumber in half lengthwise, then into 5mm-thick slices. Place in a large bowl. Using the bridge technique, cut the pineapple in half widthwise, then place both pieces, cut-side down, on a chopping board. Using the claw technique, carefully cut off the skin and discard, then cut the flesh into 4 pieces. Cut off the core and discard, then cut the flesh into 3cm pieces. Add the pineapple to the cucumber., To make salad: Remove and discard outer leaves of lettuce. Tear leaves into pieces and add to cucumber and pineapple. Just before serving, squeeze the juice from the remaining lime over the salad. Scatter with the coriander leaves and peanuts, then toss to combine., To thread skewers: Drain skewers and remove the beef from the fridge. Carefully thread 4 beef strips lengthwise onto each skewer, then transfer skewers to a plate and set aside., To cook skewers: Preheat a barbecue or chargrill pan to high, then reduce heat to medium–high. Working in 2 batches, cook skewers, turning, for 4 minutes or until lightly charred and cooked through., To serve: Divide the cucumber salad, beef skewers and steamed rice among plates, then spoon satay sauce over skewers. Serve with any remaining satay sauce.

name: Roasted garlic mashed potatoes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, unpeeled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'sebago potatoes, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pure cream'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Place garlic on a baking tray. Roast for 20 minutes or until soft., Meanwhile, place potatoes in a large saucepan. Cover with cold water. Bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium. Cook, uncovered, for 8 to 10 minutes or until just tender. Drain. Return to pan. Squeeze roasted garlic flesh into pan. Add cream and butter. Mash until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

name: Steamed rice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'jasmine rice, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cold water'}]
steps: Place rice and water in a large saucepan. Cover. Bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer partially covered, for 12 to 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat. Stand for 5 minutes., Fluff rice with a fork to separate grains.

name: Baked brunch frittata
ingredient: [{'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'dried', 'name': 'bay leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1 1/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'grated cheddar cheese'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'Primo', 'name': 'middle bacon rashers, trimmed, chopped'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Crusty', 'name': 'bread, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'rocket, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced. Grease a 5cm-deep, 24cm x 34cm (base) baking dish. Line base and 2 long sides with baking paper, allowing a 2cm overhang., Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and bay leaves. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes or until onion has softened. Add flour. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until bubbling. Remove from heat. Gradually add 2 cups milk, whisking constantly until smooth. Return to heat. Add cheese and nutmeg. Cook, stirring, for 10 minutes or until sauce thickens. Remove from heat. Cool for 10 minutes. Discard bay leaves., Meanwhile, whisk eggs, cream and remaining milk together in a bowl. Add parsley and cheese mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine. Pour into prepared dish. Cover with foil. Bake for 40 minutes or until edges start to set., Meanwhile, heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Cook bacon for 3 to 4 minutes or until just golden., Remove foil from baking dish. Top frittata with tomato and bacon. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until just set in centre (see tip). Stand for 5 minutes. Top with parsley. Serve with bread and rocket.

name: Super-healthy pudding
ingredient: [{'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'raisins, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sultanas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '300g pkt currants'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) rum'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) apple juice'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Melted', 'name': 'butter, to grease'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '60% less fat margarine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'whites, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) fresh multigrain breadcrumbs (made from day-old bread)'}, {'quantity': '115', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) wholemeal plain flour'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) wholemeal self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Bought', 'name': 'low-fat vanilla custard, warmed, to serve'}]
steps: Place raisins, sultanas and currants in a glass or ceramic bowl. Stir in the rum and apple juice. Cover and set aside, stirring every few hours, for 6 hours to macerate., Brush a 2L (8-cup) capacity pudding basin with melted butter to grease. Line the base with non-stick baking paper., Use an electric beater to beat the margarine and sugar in a large bowl until pale and creamy. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the breadcrumbs, combined flour, nutmeg and cinnamon. Add the raisin mixture and stir to combine. Spoon into the prepared basin. Smooth the surface., Place an upturned heatproof saucer in the base of a large saucepan. Fill one-third of the saucepan with boiling water. Bring to a simmer over low heat., Cut a 30cm-square piece of non-stick baking paper and a 30cm-square piece of foil. Place the paper on top of the foil and fold to make a wide pleat in the centre. Place over the basin, foil-side up. Tie a double piece of kitchen string under the rim of the basin to secure foil. To make a handle, tie a double piece of string loosely over the top of the basin. Scrunch the paper and foil around the rim so they don't get wet., Use the handle to lower the basin onto the saucer in the saucepan. Add enough boiling water to reach two-thirds of the way up the side of the basin., Simmer, covered, adding more boiling water when necessary, for 4 hours or until a skewer inserted into the centre of the pudding comes out clean., Set aside for 5 minutes before turning out onto a serving plate. Cut into wedges and serve with custard.

name: Pang pang chicken and noodle salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.6', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'whole chicken, rinsed, dried'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece ginger, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bulb', 'name': 'garlic, halved widthwise'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumbers'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow peas, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'bean thread (cellophane) noodles (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'roasted cashews, chopped'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C. Place chicken in a roasting pan and place ginger and garlic in cavity. Tie legs together, brush with soy and add 200ml water to pan. Roast for 1 hour or until juices run clear when the thickest part of the thigh is pierced., Meanwhile, for dressing, whisk 2 teaspoons sesame oil with remaining ingredients and 2 tablespoons water., Using a vegetable peeler or Japanese mandolin, peel cucumbers into thin ribbons, working your way around seed core. Cut onions into 5cm lengths, then shred. Blanch snow peas in boiling water for 1 minute, drain and refresh. Add noodles to same water, remove from heat and soak for 5 minutes. Drain and cool under cold running water. Place noodles in a bowl and toss with remaining sesame oil., Finely shred chicken leg meat and discard skin and bones. Remove breasts with skin intact, then slice thickly., Toss vegetables, shredded chicken, coriander, cashews and three-quarters of the dressing in a bowl. Spoon noodles among bowls, top with chicken salad and slices of breast meat, and serve drizzled with remaining dressing.

name: Affogato Mexico
ingredient: [{'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) freshly brewed strong espresso coffee'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) gold tequila'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) coffee liqueur'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'scoops', 'name': 'vanilla ice-cream'}]
steps: Combine the coffee, tequila and coffee liqueur in a heatproof jug., Spoon the ice-cream among serving glasses. Pour over the coffee mixture and serve immediately.

name: Pork and pear salad with fennel baked ricotta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'piece fresh reduced-fat ricotta, coarsely crumbled'}, {'quantity': '2 1', 'unit': None, 'name': '⁄2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'lemon, rind finely  grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': '⁄2 tsp fennel seeds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'white balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'packet', 'name': '(about 450g) Bruemar Pork Loin Steaks with Garlic & Chive Seasoning'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'witlof', 'name': ', leaves separated'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby salad leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'pear, core removed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': '⁄2 small red onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can brown lentils, rinsed, drained'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan forced. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place ricotta on prepared tray. Drizzle with 2 teaspoons of the oil. Season. Sprinkle with lemon rind and fennel seeds. Bake for 12 minutes or until golden., Meanwhile, whisk the vinegar, mustard, 1 tablespoon lemon juice and 1 1⁄2 tablespoons remaining oil in a bowl. Season., Heat the remaining oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Cook the pork, turning, for 6-7 minutes or until just cooked through. Set aside for 3 minutes to rest. Slice pork., Combine the witlof, salad leaves, pear, onion, lentils, ricotta, pork and half the dressing in a bowl. Toss to combine. Divide among plates. Drizzle with remaining dressing.

name: Spiced pork sirloin with chickpea cream and quick braised kale
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Mexican chilli powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'paprika'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '200g Coles Australian pork sirloin steaks'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chickpeas, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1 3/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(435ml) salt-reduced chicken stock, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cumin seeds, coarsely crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'green kale (170g), stemmed, coarsely chopped'}]
steps: In a small bowl, mix the chilli powder, paprika, 1 tablespoon sea salt flakes and 2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper. Transfer the spice mixture to a plate and coat both sides of the pork in the mixture., Heat a large heavy frying pan over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and pork steaks to the pan and cook for 2-3 mins or until the pork is heavily caramelised on the bottom. Turn the pork over and add the butter to the pan. Baste the pork with the butter as it melts and cook the pork for 2-3 more mins or until the centre of the pork is cooked through and registers 60C on a meat thermometer. Set the pork aside to rest. Discard the fat from the pan and wipe the pan clean., Meanwhile, in a small heavy saucepan, combine the chickpeas and 3/4 cup (185ml) of the chicken stock. Cover and simmer over medium-low heat for 5 mins or until heated through. Transfer the mixture to a blender. Add the extra virgin olive oil and lemon juice and blend on high until smooth. Season the chickpea cream with salt., Return frying pan to medium-high heat and add the remaining 2 tbs olive oil. When the oil is hot, add the garlic and cumin seeds and cook, stirring frequently, for 30 seconds or until the garlic is light golden brown and toasted. Stir in the kale and sauté for 1 min or until wilted. Stir in the remaining 1 cup (250ml) chicken stock and bring the mixture to a simmer. Simmer for 3 mins or until kale is tender and the mixture is brothy. Season with salt and pepper., Slice the pork against the grain into 1/2 cm-thick slices and divide among 4 dinner plates. Serve with chickpea cream and the kale.

name: Penne with pumpkin, bacon and basil
ingredient: [{'quantity': '650', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, peeled and seeded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'salt', 'name': 'and ground black pepper, to taste'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'penne rigate'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'rashers', 'name': 'bacon, rind removed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'extra', 'name': '3 tbsp olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'torn basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'pinenuts, toasted'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'crumbled ricotta'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'shaved', 'name': 'parmesan, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C. Line an oven tray with baking paper. Cut the pumpkin into 2cm cubes and toss with the olive oil, salt and pepper. Place on the tray and cook for 20 minutes or until tender and golden. Remove and set aside., Meanwhile, cook the pasta in a large saucepan of salted boiling water according to packet instructions or until al dente. Drain and return to the pan to keep warm. Place the bacon in a non-stick baking pan under a hot grill and cook for 3-5 minutes or until golden. Tear into large pieces., To serve, toss the pasta with the pumpkin, bacon, basil, pinenuts, ricotta and extra olive oil. Serve with shaved parmesan.

name: Steak with ricotta mushrooms
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '75g each) flat mushrooms, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'balsamic and roasted garlic vinaigrette'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(', 'name': '225g each) thick beef porterhouse steaks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'asparagus, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh ricotta cheese, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh thyme leaves'}]
steps: Brush mushrooms with 2 tablespoons vinaigrette., Preheat a greased barbecue plate or chargrill over medium-high heat. Cut steaks in half horizontally to form 4 thin steaks. Season with salt and pepper., Cook steaks for 2 minutes each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate. Stand, covered, for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, cook mushrooms for 3 minutes each side or until tender. Cook asparagus, turning, for 2 minutes or until tender., Place mushrooms on plates. Top with ricotta. Sprinkle with thyme. Drizzle with remaining vinaigrette. Serve mushrooms with steak and asparagus.

name: Penne with chorizo and creamy tomato sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'penne rigate'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(', 'name': '250g) chorizo sausages, halved lengthways, chopped'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'rindless shortcut bacon rashers, chopped (for child-friendly version - see notes)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'tomato passata sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'light thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach (for child-friendly version - see notes)'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated reduced-fat mozzarella cheese (for child-friendly version - see notes)'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket'}]
steps: Cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling, salted water following packet directions until tender. Drain., Meanwhile, heat 1 teaspoon oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add chorizo. Cook, stirring, for 4 to 5 minutes or until crisp. Place on a plate lined with paper towel. Wipe pan clean. Return to medium heat. Add 1 teaspoon oil to pan. If making children's version, cook bacon for 3 minutes or until golden. Place on a plate lined with paper towel., Heat remaining oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until tender. Add tomato sauce and cream. Season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine. Return pasta to pan. Cook, stirring, for 4 to 5 minutes or until heated through., Add chorizo to remaining pasta in pan. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until heated through. Remove from heat. Add rocket. Toss to combine. Spoon pasta into bowls. Season with pepper. Serve.

name: Healthier lamb and vegetable souvlaki
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh oregano leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lamb leg steaks, sliced into 2cm-thick pieces'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'zucchini, cut into thick chips'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fine polenta'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'portobello', 'name': 'mushrooms, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red capsicum, cut into 3cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'green capsicum, cut into 3cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'wholemeal', 'name': 'low-carb wraps'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'cos lettuce, leaves separated, torn'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Low', 'name': '-fat plain Greek-style yoghurt, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Oregano', 'name': ', to serve'}]
steps: Combine oregano, lemon rind, garlic and 1 tablespoon oil in a bowl. Season. Add lamb. Toss to coat. Stand for 10 minutes., Meanwhile, preheat oven to 220C/200C fan-forced. Line a large baking tray with baking paper. Spray paper with oil. Place zucchini chips in a large shallow dish. Spray with oil. Add polenta and garlic powder. Toss to coat. Spread zucchini chips on prepared tray. Spray with oil. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden and crisp., Meanwhile, place mushroom and capsicum in a bowl. Add 1 tablespoon oil. Toss to coat. Thread lamb, capsicum and mushroom, alternately, onto skewers., Heat a barbecue grill on medium-high heat. Cook skewers for 3 to 4 minutes each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate. Cover loosely with foil. Set aside for 5 minutes to rest., Meanwhile, spray wraps with oil. Chargrill for 1 minute each side or until lightly charred., Combine tomato, onion and remaining oil in a bowl. Season. Top wraps with lettuce, kebabs and tomato mixture. Sprinkle with extra oregano and dollop with yoghurt. Serve with zucchini chips and lemon wedges.

name: Watermelon and coconut panna cotta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'seedless', 'name': 'watermelon'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar, plus extra 1 tbsp'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '725', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'pure (thin) cream'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'titanium', 'name': '-strength gelatine leaves (see notes)'}, {'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'punnet strawberries, hulled'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}]
steps: Cut the watermelon into 2 pieces and chop the flesh of 1 piece (to give about 500g). Whiz the chopped watermelon in a food processor with 1/4 cup (55g) sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla until a puree, then strain through a sieve, pressing down to extract as much juice as possible (you should have about 450ml juice)., Place watermelon juice in a saucepan with 600ml cream and 1/4 cup (55g) sugar, then place over medium heat, stirring to dissolve the sugar. Bring to just below boiling point, then remove from heat and stand for 15 minutes to infuse., Meanwhile, soak 4 gelatine leaves in cold water for 5 minutes to soften., Return the cream mixture to medium heat and bring back to just below boiling point, then remove from heat. Squeeze excess water from gelatine leaves, then add gelatine to the warm cream mixture, stirring to dissolve. Strain into a clean jug and cool. Pour into serving dishes, then cover and chill for 6 hours or until set., Soak remaining 2 gelatine leaves in cold water for 5 minutes to soften., Place coconut milk, 1/4 cup (55g) sugar and remaining 1/2 cup (125ml) cream and 1 teaspoon vanilla in a pan over medium-high heat and bring to just below boiling point. Squeeze excess water from the gelatine leaves, then add gelatine to the pan, stirring to dissolve. Strain into a clean jug and cool to room temperature., Pour coconut milk mixture over the set watermelon panna cottas and chill for a further 2 hours or until set., Using a vegetable peeler, thinly shave strawberries and remaining watermelon into ribbons. Toss with the sesame oil and extra 1 tablespoon sugar until glossy. Garnish the panna cottas with strawberries and watermelon, then serve immediately.

name: Baked orange and ricotta cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'sheet', 'name': 'frozen ready-rolled shortcrust quiche pastry, partially thawed'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'ricotta cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated orange rind'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'white chocolate, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen raspberries'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flaked almonds'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Using the base of a 22cm round springform pan as a guide, cut out a circle from pastry. Line base with pastry. Prick pastry all over with a fork. Bake for 20 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 170°C/150°C fan-forced., Meanwhile, process ricotta, orange rind, orange juice, sugar and eggs until almost smooth. Stir in chocolate. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Top with raspberries and almonds. Bake for 40 minutes or until just set. Cool. Cover and refrigerate overnight.

name: Pea and ham soup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet dried green split peas'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(1L) Massel chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'ham hock or bacon bones'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'stick', 'name': 'celery, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': 'and cracked black pepper'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Crusty', 'name': 'bread, to serve'}]
steps: Place split peas in a sieve and run under cold water for a minute or until water turns clear. Set aside. Place stock, 2L water, ham hock, vegetables and split peas in a large saucepan. Cook soup over medium high heat for 1 1/2 hours, skimming the surface occasionally to remove any foam. Remove from heat. Remove ham hock from the soup and set aside for 5 minutes., Meanwhile blend the soup with a hand-held blender until pureed. Remove fat from ham hock, shred meat roughly and return to the soup. Serve with crusty bread.

name: Orange & rosemary chicken
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '1kg each) whole fresh chickens'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated orange rind'}, {'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3/4 cup) fresh orange juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'wholegrain mustard (see note)'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'baby (Dutch) carrots, trimmed, peeled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'rosemary sprigs, halved crossways'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chopped', 'name': 'fresh continental parsley, to serve'}]
steps: Rinse chickens2 (about 1kg each) whole fresh chickens inside and out under cold running water. Pat dry with paper towel. Place 1 chicken, breast-side up, on a clean work surface. Use poultry shears or sharp kitchen scissors to cut the breast in half along the breastbone. Open the chicken. Cut along either side of the backbone and discard. Cut around the legs, between thigh and breast pieces. Repeat with remaining chicken., Combine the stock250ml (1 cup) chicken stock, orange rind1 tbsp finely grated orange rind, orange juice185ml (3/4 cup) fresh orange juice, sugar2 tbsp brown sugar, mustard1 tbsp wholegrain mustard (see note) and butter20g butter, melted in a jug., Preheat oven to 220ºC. Arrange the chicken in a large baking dish. Bake for 10 minutes or until chicken starts to brown. Reduce temperature to 180ºC. Add the carrots2 bunches baby (Dutch) carrots, trimmed, peeled and rosemary2 large rosemary sprigs, halved crossways, and pour over orange mixture. Cook, basting with pan juices every 10 minutes, for 35 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the skin is crisp., Transfer the chicken and carrots to a serving platter. Cover with foil and set aside for 5 minutes to rest. Pour the sauce from the pan into a jug and skim to remove fat. Pour a little sauce over the chicken and carrots. Sprinkle with the parsleyChopped fresh continental parsley, to serve. Serve with the remaining sauce.

name: Maple snags with mustard mash
ingredient: [{'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'maple syrup'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey wholegrain mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '500g) beef chipolata sausages'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'pontiac', 'name': 'potatoes, peeled, halved'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) thin cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped flat-leaf parsley'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 180°C., In a small bowl, combine the maple syrup with 2 tablespoons of the honey mustard and 1/3 cup (80ml) water., Sprinkle the onion over the base of a baking tray. Place the sausages on top and pour over the maple-syrup mixture. Roast for 30 minutes, basting with the pan juices from time to time and turning the sausages halfway through cooking., Meanwhile, cook the potatoes in a large saucepan of boiling salted water until tender, then drain well. Return to the pan with the butter and cream, and mash well. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Stir in the parsley and the remaining mustard., Serve the sausages on the mustard mash, topped with the onions and drizzled with pan juices.

name: Broccoli fried rice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Australian Free Range Eggs, lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'bacon', 'name': 'rashers, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Coles Australian Broccoli & Cauliflower Rice*'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(120g) frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) sriracha or chilli sauce'}]
steps: Heat a non-stick frying pan over high heat. Pour egg over the pan and swirl the pan to cover. Cook for 1 min or until just set. Transfer to a clean work surface. Roll into a log and thinly slice crossways., Add the bacon to the pan and cook, stirring, for 3 mins or until golden brown. Add the broccoli rice and peas and cook, stirring, for 3 mins or until heated through. Stir in half the sriracha or chilli sauce until well combined., Divide the rice mixture evenly among serving plates. Top with egg and drizzle with remaining sriracha or chilli sauce.

name: Risoni salad with grilled prawns, basil and roasted vegetables
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': '(350g) eggplant, trimmed, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'zucchini, trimmed, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, seeded, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) risoni'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', zested'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'peeled green prawns, tails intact'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'yellow grape tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh baby basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'basil pesto'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan forced. Line a large baking tray with baking paper. Place the eggplant, zucchini and capsicum on prepared tray and spray with oil. Roast for 20-25 minutes or until golden and tender., Meanwhile, cook the risoni in a large saucepan of lightly salted water until al dente, adding lemon zest for the last 30 seconds. Drain well., Heat a large non-stick frying pan over high heat. Spray with olive oil. Cook the prawns, in 2 batches, for 2-3 minutes, or until the prawns change colour., Place the risoni, roasted vegetables, prawns, tomato, basil, parsley, lemon juice and pesto in a large bowl. Toss gently to combine. Serve warm or at room temperature.

name: Pork with coleslaw & chargrilled potatoes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Baby Coliban (Chat) potatoes (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '320g) baby wombok (Chinese cabbage), finely shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, deseeded, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds, lightly toasted'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'pork', 'name': 'loin medallions'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Dijon', 'name': 'mustard, to serve'}]
steps: Cook the potatoes in a large saucepan of salted boiling water for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain. Set aside to cool slightly. Cut the potatoes in half., Meanwhile, combine the cabbage, zucchini, carrot, onion, capsicum and sesame seeds in a large bowl. Whisk together the mayonnaise and water in a small bowl. Add the mayonnaise mixture to the cabbage mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine., Preheat a chargrill on high. Brush the pork with a little oil. Drizzle the remaining oil over the potato. Cook the potato on grill for 8 minutes each side or until charred. While the potato is cooking, heat a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the pork and cook for 4 minutes each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate. Set aside for 3 minutes to rest. Divide the pork, potato and coleslaw among serving plates. Serve with mustard.

name: Low-cal pineapple cheesecake pots
ingredient: [{'quantity': '21', 'unit': None, 'name': '⁄2 tbsp caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2/3 cup) finely chopped fresh pineapple'}, {'quantity': '220', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'ctn extra-light cream cheese'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla bean paste'}, {'quantity': '170', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'ctn 98% fat-free cheesecake-flavoured yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'sheet', 'name': 'reduced-fat puff pastry, partially thawed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Low', 'name': '-fat milk, for brushing'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Ground', 'name': 'cinnamon, to serve'}]
steps: Heat 1 tablespoon of caster sugar in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook, shaking the pan occasionally, for 3 minutes or until the sugar dissolves. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 1 minute or until golden. Add the pineapple and stir for 3 minutes or until caramelised and sugar dissolves. Spoon among four 100ml capacity glasses. Set aside to cool completely., Use an electric beater to beat the cream cheese, vanilla and remaining caster sugar in a bowl until smooth and combined. Use a spoon to stir in half the yoghurt. Spoon among the prepared glasses. Place in the fridge for 4 hours or until set., Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan forced. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Cut four 2.5 x 8cm rectangles from the pastry. Place on the prepared tray. Brush with milk. Sprinkle with white sugar. Bake for 9-11 minutes or until golden and puffed. Cool., Insert a baked pastry rectangle into each glass. Top with the remaining yoghurt and sprinkle with cinnamon.

name: Beef and grilled vegetable moussaka
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': '(about 200g each) red capsicums, quartered, deseeded'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': '(about 1kg) eggplant, cut lengthways into 1cm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': '(about 500g) zucchini, trimmed, cut lengthways into 1cm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '45', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) dried (packaged) multigrain breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated reduced-fat cheddar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mixed', 'name': 'salad leaves, to serve'}]
steps: To make the meat sauce, brush a large non-stick frying pan with oil. Heat over medium-low heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook, stirring, for 7 minutes or until onion is soft. Increase heat to medium-high. Add the mince and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up any lumps, for 3 minutes or until the mince changes colour. Add the tomato and oregano, and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 30 minutes or until sauce thickens., Meanwhile, preheat grill on medium. Line a baking tray with foil. Place the capsicum, skin-side up, on the lined tray. Spray with olive oil spray. Cook under grill for 6 minutes or until charred and blistered. Transfer to a plastic bag and set aside for 5 minutes (this helps lift the skin). Peel and halve lengthways. Place half the eggplant on the lined tray. Spray with olive oil spray. Cook under grill for 4 minutes each side. Transfer to a plate. Repeat, in 2 more batches, with zucchini and remaining eggplant., To make the bechamel sauce, place the milk in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring just to a simmer. Remove from heat. Melt the dairy spread in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Remove from heat and stir in the flour. Place over medium heat and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until the mixture bubbles. Remove from heat. Gradually add the milk, whisking until smooth. Place over medium heat and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until the sauce thickens and comes to the boil. Simmer for 1 minute. Transfer to a heatproof bowl. Stir in nutmeg. Set aside for 5 minutes to cool slightly. Whisk in the egg., Preheat oven to 180°C. Line 2 baking trays with foil. Combine breadcrumbs, parmesan and cheddar in a bowl., Divide half the eggplant among six 500ml (2-cup) capacity freezerproof, ovenproof dishes. Arrange the zucchini over the eggplant. Spoon over half the meat sauce. Layer with the remaining eggplant, capsicum and remaining meat sauce. Spoon over the bechamel sauce and sprinkle with the breadcrumb mixture. (To freeze, see notes.), Bake in oven for 35-40 minutes or until set and golden. Set aside for 5 minutes to cool. Serve with mixed salad leaves.

name: Champagne oysters
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'champagne or sparkling white wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'shallots, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'double cream'}, {'quantity': '18', 'unit': 'natural', 'name': 'oysters, in the half shell'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Freshly', 'name': 'ground white pepper'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chopped', 'name': 'fresh chives, to serve'}]
steps: Place the champagne and shallot in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to the boil. Simmer for 5-8 minutes or until mixture reduces by half., Reduce heat to medium-low. Add the cream and any juice from the oyster. Season with white pepper. Simmer for 20 minutes or until the sauce reduces by half (you should have about 300ml of sauce)., Preheat the grill to high. Divide oysters, in their shells, among 6 small gratin dishes. Pour over cream sauce. Place the gratin dishes on a large tray. Cook under grill for 3 minutes or until oysters are golden and sauce bubbles. Cool for 2 minutes. Sprinkle with chives and serve.

name: Tomato, coriander and white bean salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fennel seeds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'coriander seeds'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'garlic clove, very thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) Colavita extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(400g) dried white beans, soaked in cold water overnight'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 150C., Using a mortar and pestle, crush fennel and coriander seeds coarsely. Place tomatoes, cut-side up, in a roasting pan. Scatter with seeds, sugar and garlic. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon oil then season to taste. Slow-roast tomatoes for 1 hour until tender and shrivelled. Cool., Meanwhile, cook drained beans in a saucepan of boiling water over medium heat for 45 minutes or until tender. Drain., Transfer beans to a bowl. Add vinegar, remaining oil, and cooled tomatoes. Toss gently to combine then season to taste.

name: Peperoni sott'olia
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red capsicums'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'yellow capsicums'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'baby capers'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Moro White Italian Dressing'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh continental parsley, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Extra', 'name': 'virgin olive oil, to drizzle'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'toasted pine nuts'}]
steps: Preheat a barbecue grill or chargrill pan on medium. Cook red and yellow capsicums, turning, for 25-30 minutes or until charred and tender., Transfer to a large heatproof bowl. Cover with plastic wrap. Set aside for 30 minutes to lift the skin. Peel, seed and cut into 1cm-thick strips., Combine the capsicum, olive oil, baby capers, Italian Dressing and continental parsley in a bowl. Season. Cover and place in the fridge for 8 hours to develop the flavours. Drizzle with a little extra virgin olive and sprinkle with toasted pine nuts.

name: One-pan coconut fish and rice recipe
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbs', 'name': 'coconut oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) basmati rice'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) salt-reduced chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3/4 cup) coconut milk, plus extra, to drizzle'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'fresh red chilli, deseeded, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': '⁄4 cup chopped fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': ', rind finely grated, halved'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '500g) skinless snapper fillets'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan forced. Heat the oil1 1/2 tbs coconut oil in an ovenproof frying pan over medium heat. Add onion1 small brown onion, finely chopped and garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until softened. Add the ground coriander1 tsp ground coriander and turmeric1 tsp ground turmeric. Cook for 1 minute or until aromatic. Stir in rice200g (1 cup) basmati rice for 1 minute or until coated. Stir in stock250ml (1 cup) salt-reduced chicken stock and 125ml (1/2 cup) coconut milk185ml (3/4 cup) coconut milk, plus extra, to drizzle. Bring to a simmer. Cover and bake for 15 minutes., Meanwhile, combine tomato100g cherry tomatoes, quartered, chilli1 long fresh red chilli, deseeded, finely chopped and coriander1 ⁄4 cup chopped fresh coriander leaves in a bowl. Squeeze over juice of half the lime1 lime, rind finely grated, halved. Season well., Place the fish4 (about 500g) skinless snapper fillets on top of the rice. Sprinkle with lime rind and squeeze over remaining lime half. Season fish. Cover and bake for 5 minutes. Drizzle fish with remaining coconut milk. Bake, uncovered for 5 minutes or until fish is just cooked through. Spoon over salsa and drizzle with a little extra coconut milk.

name: Chilli beef and bean tortilla wraps
ingredient: [{'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) beef stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Heart Smart beef mince'}, {'quantity': '1 425', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can crushed tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1 300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can red kidney beans (Edgell brand), rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'medium Mexican chilli powder blend (MasterFoods brand)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': None, 'name': '-12 20cm diameter Mexican tortillas (Buttercup brand), to serve'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra lite sour cream, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Shredded', 'name': 'lettuce, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chopped', 'name': 'green shallots, to serve'}]
steps: Place the stock80ml (1/3 cup) beef stock, onion1 large brown onion, chopped and garlic3 garlic cloves, crushed in a medium saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and cook, covered, for 10 minutes or until the onion softens. Increase heat to high, add the mince250g beef mince and cook, breaking up the mince with a wooden spoon, for 10 minutes or until mince changes colour., Stir in the undrained tomatoes1 425g can crushed tomatoes, kidney beans1 300g can red kidney beans (Edgell brand), rinsed, drained, tomato paste2 tbsp tomato paste, chilli powder blend2 tsp medium Mexican chilli powder blend (MasterFoods brand) and sugar1 tsp sugar, and bring to the boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and cook, partially covered, for 25 minutes or until the mixture is thick. Taste and season with salt and pepperSalt & freshly ground black pepper., To serve, spoon the mince mixture onto the tortillas8-12 20cm diameter Mexican tortillas (Buttercup brand), to serve, top with a dollop of sour cream3 tbsp extra lite sour cream, to serve, some lettuceShredded lettuce, to serve and green shallotsChopped green shallots, to serve, and roll up firmly.

name: Spiced carrot soup with coconut cream
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'light olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red chilli, seeds removed, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'carrots, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'sweet potato, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'makrut', 'name': 'lime leaves'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(1L) Massel chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Juice', 'name': 'of 1/2 lime'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'palm sugar (see Notes)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Thai fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'coconut cream'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thick cream'}]
steps: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat, add onion and cook for 2-3 minutes or until softened., Add garlic, chilli, ginger, carrot, sweet potato, lime leaves and stock. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes. Allow to cool slightly, then puree in a blender. Pass puree through a sieve, then season., Return to pan with lime juice, sugar and fish sauce and gently reheat. Whip creams until thick., Pour soup into glasses and top with coconut cream and a sprinkle of nutmeg, if desired.

name: Easy whole lemon cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'lemons', 'name': ', washed'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'light olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 2/3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Double', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Grease a 22cm (top) baba pan., Place lemons in a medium saucepan. Cover with cold water. Bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium, Cook for 50 minutes or until softened. Drain. Cool 20 minutes. Chop lemons, discarding seeds., Place lemon in a food processor. Process to a pulp. Add oil, eggs and vanilla. Process for 2 minutes or until smooth. Add sugar. Process to combine. Add flour and baking powder. Process until just combined. Pour into prepared pan. Level top. Bake for 50 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre of cake comes out clean. Cool in pan 15 minutes. Turn out onto a wire rack to cool., To make the lemon syrup, place 1 cup water and caster sugar in a medium frying pan. Stir over low heat until sugar dissolves. Increase heat to medium-high. Bring to a simmer. Add lemon slices. Cook for 5 to 6 minutes or until syrup thickens slightly and lemon is translucent. Cool 15 minutes., Place lemon slices on cake. Drizzle warm cake with warm syrup. Garnish with lemon. Serve with cream.

name: Chargrilled octopus
