ingredient: [{'quantity': '18', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '250g) cleaned baby octopus'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'garlic cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground mild paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'fresh red chilli, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Freshly', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of salt'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Wash the octopus18 (about 250g) cleaned baby octopus thoroughly under cold running water. Drain and pat dry with paper towel., Combine the white wine60ml (1/4 cup) dry white wine, oil2 tsp extra virgin olive oil, garlic2 large garlic cloves, crushed, paprika1 tsp ground mild paprika and chilli1 small fresh red chilli, finely chopped in a glass or ceramic bowl. Season with pepperFreshly ground black pepper and mix well. Add the octopus and toss to combine. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 30 minutes to marinate., Preheat a chargrill or barbecue grill on high. Drain the octopus and pour the marinade into a small saucepan. Cook the octopus on preheated chargrill or barbecue grill, turning once or twice, for 4-5 minutes or until the octopus curl and are just cooked through., Season the marinade with a little saltPinch of salt and bring to the boil over medium-high heat. Cook, uncovered, for 1 minute., Place octopus in a serving dish and pour over the marinade. Serve hot with lemon wedgesLemon wedges, to serve.

name: Roast vegetable, cheese & cranberry filo pie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Butternut pumpkin, peeled, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '300g) parsnips, peeled, coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onions, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'fresh red chilli, seeded, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dried cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Middle Eastern spice mix'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'silverbeet, white stems removed, leaves coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '325', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/4 cups) fresh ricotta'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'feta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'filo pastry'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Place the pumpkin, parsnip, onion, garlic and chilli in a roasting pan. Add oil and toss to coat. Roast, stirring halfway through cooking, for 20 minutes or until the pumpkin is tender. Stir in the cranberries and spice mix. Bake for 10 minutes or until cranberries soften slightly. Set aside to cool slightly., Cook the silverbeet in a saucepan of boiling water for 2-3 minutes or until wilted. Drain. Squeeze to remove excess liquid. Add to the pumpkin mixture and toss to combine., Combine ricotta and feta in a bowl., Brush a 25cm (base measurement) springform pan with a little butter. Place filo on a work surface. Cover with a dry tea towel, then a damp tea towel (this prevents it from drying out). Brush 1 filo sheet with a little butter. Place in the prepared pan, allowing sides to overhang. Repeat with 10 filo sheets and some butter, turning each slightly, to line the pan completely., Place half the pumpkin mixture into the filo case. Top with ricotta mixture, then remaining pumpkin mixture. Fold remaining filo sheet in half. Place on the pumpkin mixture. Fold over filo edges to enclose the filling. Brush with remaining butter and top with sesame seeds. Reduce oven temperature to 180ºC. Bake for 45 minutes or until golden. Set aside for 30 minutes to cool. Transfer to a serving plate.

name: Poached salmon with watercress mayonnaise
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'stalks, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'fennel bulb, sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'flat', 'name': '-leaf parsley stalks, bruised, plus 2 tbsp chopped leaves'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'white wine'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pared', 'name': 'zest of 1 lemon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'whole black peppercorns'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'piece skinless salmon fillet'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'chat potatoes, peeled'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}]
steps: Place carrot, celery, onion, fennel, parsley stalks, wine, lemon zest and peppercorns in a large saucepan or stockpot and cover with 3L water. Simmer over medium heat for 25 minutes. Line a sieve with muslin or a clean Chux, then strain stock in a deep, wide pan, discarding solids., Return stock to medium-low heat and bring to a gentle simmer. Add the salmon and poach for 10 minutes. Remove from heat, cover and leave the salmon to cool completely in the liquid to finish cooking., Meanwhile, for the mayonnaise, place the egg yolks, mustard and lemon zest and juice in a food processor and whiz to combine. With the motor running, add oil in a slow steady stream until thickened., Add the chopped watercress and 2 tablespoons warm water, then whiz to combine. Season, then chill until needed., Place the potatoes in a large saucepan of cold, salted water. Bring to the boil over medium-high heat, then cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain, then toss with parsley leaves and butter. Allow to cool slightly., Using 2 spatulas, carefully remove the salmon from the poaching liquid. Break the salmon into large pieces and arrange on a serving platter with the potatoes and lightly dressed watercress sprigs. Drizzle with the watercress mayonnaise, season with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper and serve.

name: Chocolate waffles with vanilla caramel sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate, chopped'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1 1/3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'thickened cream, whipped, \u2028to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Grated', 'name': 'dark chocolate, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 150°C/130°C fan-forced. Place a wire rack over a large baking tray and place in oven., Make Vanilla Caramel Sauce: Place brown sugar, butter, vanilla and cream in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until butter has melted and sugar has dissolved. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 10 minutes or until sauce is slightly thickened. Remove from heat., Preheat waffle maker following manufacturer’s directions., Place chocolate and butter in a large microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on MEDIUM (50%) for 2 minutes, stirring with a metal spoon halfway through, or until melted and smooth. Stand for 5 minutes to cool slightly., Whisk the eggs, milk and vanilla together in a large jug. Gradually add to chocolate mixture, stirring until smooth and combined. Sift flour and cocoa over mixture. Add caster sugar. Whisk until almost smooth and combined., Half-fill the waffle maker with batter. Close lid. Cook for 1 minute 30 seconds to 2 minutes or until cooked through. Transfer to wire rack in oven to keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter., Dollop the waffles with whipped cream and drizzle with a little vanilla caramel sauce. Serve with remaining vanilla caramel sauce and sprinkled with grated chocolate.

name: Turkey with apple and raisin stuffing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '5kg Ingham Whole Turkey'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'apples', 'name': ', halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cooked', 'name': 'vegetables of choice, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Place a rack into a large roasting dish. Pour ½ cup water into roasting dish. Wipe turkey inside and out with paper towel., To make stuffing, melt butter in a large non stick frying pan over medium heat. Add onion and bacon. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 4 minutes or until onion is soft. Remove from heat. Cool.Combine onion mixture, breadcrumbs, raisins, diced apple, sage, egg and salt and pepper in a large bowl., Fill upper and lower cavities of turkey with stuffing mixture. Tie legs together with kitchen twine and tuck wings under turkey., Place turkey onto a wire rack in a large roasting pan. Cook Ingham Whole Turkey as per packet instructions in a barbecue oven., Place apple halves, olive oil and butter in a large bowl and toss until apples are coated with oil mixture. Place into a large shallow ovenproof dish. Add apples to barbecue for last hour of cooking turkey. Stand cooked turkey on a chopping board covered for 10 minutes before carving or serving on a large platter. If serving on a platter, place apples around the turkey and serve with vegetables of choice.

name: Mixed pepper crusted steak with mushroom salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'whole black peppercorns'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dried green peppercorns'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Szechuan peppercorns (see note)'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '200g beef sirloin steaks, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eggwhite', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'portobello', 'name': 'mushrooms, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, halved'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, shredded'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}]
steps: Preheat a chargrill pan to medium-high., Coarsely crush all the peppercorns in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle. Transfer to a plate. Lightly brush each side of the steaks with eggwhite and press into the peppercorn mixture to coat. Season and set aside., Rub the mushroom with the garlic. Place in a bowl and toss with 2 tablespoons oil, then season. Chargrill for 2-3 minutes each side until charred. Set aside to cool., Chargrill steaks for 6-8 minutes, turning once, for medium-rare. Rest, loosely covered with foil, for 5 minutes., Meanwhile, toss mushroom, spring onion and spinach together. Whisk together Dijon, balsamic and remaining 2 tablespoons oil, season, then toss with the salad., Divide the steaks and mushroom salad among 4 plates and serve.

name: Roast chicken with soft polenta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(1 litre) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'instant polenta'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated parmesan (optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'roast', 'name': 'chicken'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thyme', 'name': 'leaves, for garnish'}]
steps: Bring stock4 cups (1 litre) chicken stock and milk1 cup (250ml) milk to the boil in a large saucepan. Gradually add polenta1 cup instant polenta in a steady stream and stir constantly for 3-5 minutes, being careful of mixture as it boils and splatters, until mixture is thick and creamy. Stir through parmesan1/2 cup grated parmesan (optional) and serve immediately with roast chicken1 roast chicken.

name: Baked salmon fillets with dukkah crumb
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(50g) fresh breadcrumbs (made from day-old bread)'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Table of Plenty Pistachio Dukkah'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coarsely chopped coriander'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '150g each) salmon fillets, skin-on'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'asparagus, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach leaves'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'soft feta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(95g) Greek-style yoghurt'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper., Combine the breadcrumbs, dukkah, coriander, half the oil, lemon rind and 1 tbs of the lemon juice in a medium bowl. Place the salmon, skin-side down, on prepared tray. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle the breadcrumb mixture evenly over the salmon, pressing down gently to coat. Bake salmon for 12-15 mins or until cooked to your liking., Meanwhile, heat a chargrill pan on high. Cook the asparagus for 2 mins or until tender. Remove from heat. Combine the asparagus, spinach and feta in a large bowl. Whisk the remaining oil and lemon juice in a small jug. Drizzle over salad and toss to combine., Divide the salad and salmon among serving plates and serve with a dollop of yoghurt and lemon wedges.

name: Spinach, thyme and hazelnut lasagne
ingredient: [{'quantity': '700', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'broccoli, thinly sliced lengthways'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'lasagne sheets'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated pizza cheese'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped roasted hazelnuts'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan-forced. Line 2 large baking trays with baking paper. Place broccoli slices, in a single layer, on trays. Brush with oil and season with pepper. Bake for 15 minutes., Sprinkle garlic and thyme over broccoli. Bake for 10 minutes or until broccoli is browned and tender., Meanwhile, make Spinach Béchamel: Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add flour. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Gradually stir in milk until smooth and combined. Bring to the boil, stirring. Stir in spinach. Cook for 2 minutes or until spinach is just wilted. Stir in parmesan and season with pepper., Reduce oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Grease a 6cm-deep, 19cm x 29cm ovenproof dish (10-cup capacity) with oil. Cut 1 lasagne sheet lengthways into 3 long strips. Line base of prepared dish with 1 lasagne sheet and 1 strip, trimming to fit. Arrange half the broccoli on top of lasagne sheet. Top with 1 cup of the béchamel., Repeat. Top with remaining pasta sheet and strip and pour over remaining spinach béchamel. Sprinkle with cheeses. Bake for 35 minutes, sprinkling with hazelnuts halfway through, or until top is golden and lasagne sheets are tender. Stand for 10 minutes. Serve with rocket.

name: Amaretto and cognac coffee
ingredient: [{'quantity': '160', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2/3 cup) thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'amaretto liqueur'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'cognac'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Freshly', 'name': 'brewed coffee, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Bought', 'name': 'caramel sauce, to serve'}]
steps: Use a balloon whisk or an electric beater to beat the cream in a bowl until soft peaks form., Divide the amaretto and cognac between serving glasses. Fill three-quarters of each glass with coffee., Top with the cream and drizzle over the caramel sauce. Serve immediately.

name: Barley salad with feta and pine nuts (vegetarian)
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(220g) pearl barley'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(55g) toasted pine nuts*'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pitted kalamata olives, halved'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'punnet cherry tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'wild rocket'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'feta, crumbled'}]
steps: Place barley in a saucepan with 1.5L (6 cups) boiling water. Simmer for 25 minutes or until just tender., Rinse under cold water, then drain., To make dressing, place all ingredients in a screw-top jar and shake well., Place pine nuts, olives, tomatoes and rocket in a large bowl with barley., Add dressing, toss to combine. Serve in bowls, top with feta and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.

name: Healthier chicken satay stir-fry recipe for two
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'light coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'crunchy peanut butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'kecap manis'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'light olive oil'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken tenderloins'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely chopped ginger'}, {'quantity': '225', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'peeled, deseeded pumpkin, cut into thin 4cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'broccolini, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'long red chilli, sliced (optional), to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander sprigs, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'brown basmati rice, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'halves, to serve'}]
steps: Combine the coconut milk, peanut butter and kecap manis in a small jug. Set aside until required., Heat the oil in a large wok over high heat. Add the tenderloins and cook for 3 minutes each side or until golden and just cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Set aside to cool slightly before chopping into thirds., Add the garlic and ginger to the wok. Stir-fry for 1 minute or until aromatic. Add the pumpkin and stir-fry to coat. Add 2 tablespoons water and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until tender. Add the broccolini and cover. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes or until tender., Add the chicken and coconut milk mixture to the wok. Toss to coat. Simmer for 1-2 minutes or until the sauce thickens slightly. Top with chilli and coriander. Serve with rice and lime halves.

name: Better-for-you French toast
ingredient: [{'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'milk or unsweetened almond milk'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(about 1 medium) banana, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'seedy wholegrain bread'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'raw buckwheat'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'coconut oil'}, {'quantity': '130', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) Greek-style yoghurt or coconut yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh raspberries'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Seeds', 'name': 'of 1/2 pomegranate'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'maple syrup'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Maca', 'name': 'powder, to dust (optional)'}]
steps: Blend the milk, banana, eggs and cinnamon for 20-30 seconds or until smooth. Transfer to a large dish. Place the bread slices in the milk mixture, pressing down on them so they absorb as much of the mixture as possible. Set aside for 10 minutes to soak., Meanwhile, place buckwheat in a small frying pan over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring constantly, for 5 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a bowl. Set aside., Melt half the oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Cook 4 soaked bread slices for 2-3 minutes each side or until golden and cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with remaining oil and bread., Divide the French toast among serving plates. Top with the yoghurt, raspberries and pomegranate seeds. Drizzle with the maple syrup and sprinkle with the buckwheat. Dust with maca powder, if using.

name: Gingerbread eggnog custard pie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g packets gingernut biscuits'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted, cooled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vanilla custard powder'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'litre', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brandy'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Large', 'name': 'pinch of ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Extra', 'name': 'ground nutmeg, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Roughly', 'name': 'chopped gingernut biscuits, to serve'}]
steps: Place biscuits in a food processor. Process until finely chopped. Add butter. Process until just combined. Press mixture evenly over base and side of a 4cm-deep, 24cm round (base) loose-based fluted tart pan. Refrigerate while preparing filling., Place 1 cup custard powder and sugar in a large saucepan. Add 1/2 cup of milk. Whisk until smooth. Gradually whisk in remaining milk. Place pan over medium heat. Whisk gently for 8 to 10 minutes or until mixture is thick. Remove from heat. Whisk in brandy, then nutmeg. Transfer to a large heatproof bowl. Cover surface with plastic wrap. Set aside for 1 hour or until cooled., Whisk custard until smooth. Spoon into prepared pan. Level top with a spatula. Cover surface with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or until set., Make Custard cream: Using an electric mixer, beat cream, custard powder, sugar and ginger together until just-firm peaks form. Gently fold in sour cream., Remove plastic wrap from pie and transfer to a serving plate. Dollop with custard cream. Sprinkle with extra nutmeg and biscuits. Serve.

name: Basic roast beef & vegetables
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles Australian Salted Butter, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1.2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'beef scotch fillet (rib eye) roast (See notes)'}, {'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': '(about 10) sebago (brushed) potatoes, peeled, halved lengthways, patted dry with paper towel'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'Dutch (baby) carrots, trimmed to 1cm, washed, scrubbed, patted dry with paper towel'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) Beef stock'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'spinach or green beans, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C. Heat 2 teaspoons of the butter and 2 teaspoons oil in a large shallow flameproof roasting pan over high heat. Cook the roast1.2kg beef scotch fillet (rib eye) roast (See notes), turning occasionally, for 5 minutes or until well browned. (If you don't have a flameproof roasting pan, you can use a frying pan to brown the beef and then transfer to a roasting pan.), Remove roasting pan from heat and season beef all over with salt and pepper. (The beef is seasoned after browning because salting may draw the moisture out of the beef, making it tough.), Place the potatoes1.5kg (about 10) sebago (brushed) potatoes, peeled, halved lengthways, patted dry with paper towel, 3 teaspoons of the remaining butter and 1 teaspoon of the remaining oil in a bowl. Use your hands to rub the butter and oil evenly over the potatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Arrange the potatoes in a single layer around the beef., Cook beef and potatoes in preheated oven, basting beef with the pan juices once during cooking to keep it moist, for 30 minutes., Place remaining oil and butter in another roasting pan. Place in oven for 5 minutes or until butter melts. Add carrots2 bunches Dutch (baby) carrots, trimmed to 1cm, washed, scrubbed, patted dry with paper towel and toss to coat well. Turn potatoes and baste beef. Add carrots to oven and cook, shaking pan occasionally, for 25 minutes until beef is medium or until cooked to your liking., Transfer beef to a carving tray and cover loosely with foil. Set aside for 15 minutes to rest. It is important to rest before serving as it allows juices and heat to redistribute. While beef is resting, transfer potatoes to a tray lined with baking paper. Increase oven temperature to 250°C. Return potatoes to oven and continue to cook while beef is resting. To make gravy, strain pan juices from the roasting pan into a heatproof jug. Return 2 tablespoons of pan juices to the roasting pan (alternatively, if you dont? have a flameproof roasting pan, transfer to a saucepan) and heat over high heat. Add the flour1 tbsp plain flour and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until mixture bubbles., Gradually add the stock375ml (1 1/2 cups) Beef stock and cook, scraping the pan with a flat-bottomed wooden spoon to dislodge any bits cooked onto the base of the pan. Boil, uncovered, stirring occasionally, for 8-10 minutes or until the gravy reduces and thickens slightly. Strain gravy into a warmed serving jug., Carve the beef across the grain and serve with the gravy, roast potatoes, roast carrots and steamed spinach or beansSteamed spinach or green beans, to serve.

name: Patatas bravas
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'sebago potatoes, peeled'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chilli powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley leaves, chopped'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Place potatoes in a large saucepan. Cover with cold water and bring to the boil over medium-low heat (potatoes should still be firm). Drain and set aside for 15 minutes. When cool enough to handle, cut potatoes into 2cm cubes., Pour 1/4 cup oil into a roasting pan. Place in oven for 5 minutes or until oil and pan are hot. Carefully add potatoes to pan. Turn to coat. Roast for 40 minutes or until crisp and tender., Meanwhile, heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a saucepan over low heat. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until soft. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add chilli powder and paprika. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add wine. Increase heat to high and bring to the boil. Cook for 3 minutes or until reduced by half. Add tomatoes and oregano. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer, uncovered, for 20 minutes or until sauce has thickened. Season with salt and pepper., Transfer sauce to a food processor and process until smooth. Return to saucepan. Cook, stirring, over medium heat for 3 minutes or until heated through. Stir through parsley. Transfer potatoes to a serving bowl. Spoon over sauce and toss gently to coat. Serve.

name: Ham, chilli and basil pasta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles spaghetti'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Coles extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chillies, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'capers'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'shredded ham'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'small basil leaves, plus extra, to serve'}]
steps: Cook spaghetti in a large saucepan of boiling, salted water according to packet directions. Drain and return to pan., Meanwhile, heat oil in a large frying pan on medium. Cook garlic, chilli and capers for 2 mins, or until fragrant. Add ham and cook for 2-3 mins, or until warmed through. Add ham mixture and basil to spaghetti and toss to combine. Serve topped with extra basil.

name: Ricotta and asparagus pesto dip
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh ricotta, whipped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Extra', 'name': 'virgin olive oil, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Finely', 'name': 'grated lemon rind, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Small', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Crackers', 'name': 'or toasted crostini, to serve'}]
steps: To make the asparagus pesto, preheat a chargrill pan or barbecue plate on medium-high. Spray asparagus with oil. Cook, turning often, for 5 minutes, until tender and charred. Transfer to a plate and set aside to cool. Coarsely chop., Place the asparagus, garlic, almonds, mint, parmesan and lemon juice in a food processor. Process until finely chopped. With the motor running, gradually pour in the olive oil and process until the mixture is combined. Season well., Spread the ricotta over a plate or dish. Dollop with pesto and swirl around. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with lemon rind and mint. Serve with crackers or crostini.

name: Ham and cheese slab pie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '41', 'unit': None, 'name': '⁄4 sheets frozen butter puff pastry, just thawed'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(about 7 slices) double smoked leg ham, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1⁄2 cup) bought caramelised onion relish'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}]
steps: Heat the butter100g butter, chopped and garlic1 garlic clove, crushed in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir for 1 minute or until foaming. Add the flour50g (1⁄3 cup) plain flour. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Gradually add milk500ml (2 cups) milk and mustard1 tbsp Dijon mustard, whisking constantly, until smooth. Bring to boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium. Whisk for 2 minutes to thicken. Stir in cheese200g (2 cups) grated vintage cheddar. Season. Set aside to cool., Preheat oven to 240C/220C fan forced. Lightly grease a 20 x 30cm (base size) slice pan with butter. Join 2 pastry sheets by overlapping on 1 side. Cut 1 remaining sheet in half then join to 1 long side of rectangle, overlapping. Use a rolling pin to seal. Line prepared pan with pastry. Spread half the bechamel over base. Top with ham250g (about 7 slices) double smoked leg ham, trimmed and relish180g (1⁄2 cup) bought caramelised onion relish. Use back of a spoon to spread. Spread over remaining bechamel. Join remaining sheet and quarter to create a rectangle. Seal. Place over filling. Trim, allowing pastry to overhang 2cm over sides. Crimp edges then cut slits on top. Brush with egg1 egg, lightly whisked., Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce oven to 220C/200C fan forced. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden. Set aside to cool slightly. Season and serve.

name: Basil and goat's cheese lamb racks
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh breadcrumbs (made from day-old bread)'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles Brand Pure Olive Oil'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': "goat's fetta, crumbled"}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'semi-dried tomatoes, from the deli, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Australian Lamb Racks (8 cutlets on each)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', thickly sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Perino tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'kalamata olives, from the deli'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'rocket leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C or 180C fan forced. Process the breadcrumbs, 2 tablespoons basil and half the oil to combine., Finely chop remaining basil. Combine basil, fetta and semi-dried tomatoes in a medium bowl. Use a sharp knife to cut along the length of each lamb rack, close to the bone, about 3cm deep, to create a pocket. Divide the fetta mixture evenly among the pockets. Use kitchen string to tie around each rack to secure. Place in a roasting pan. Press the breadcrumb mixture firmly onto the lamb racks. Arrange zucchini around the lamb racks. Drizzle with remaining oil. Season., Roast for 20 minutess. Arrange the tomato and olives over zucchini mixture. Roast for a further 10 mins for medium or until cooked to your liking. Set aside, covered, for 10 mins to rest., Carve the lamb racks into portions. Arrange the vegetable mixture, rocket and lamb on platters.

name: Spicy sausage & eggplant pizza
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '400g) tomato & basil sausages, skin removed'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'provolone or mozzarella, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '440', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pizza base with tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chargrilled eggplant'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh oregano leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Rocket', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 250ºC. Preheat a large baking tray in oven. Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan over high heat. Cook the sausage meat, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up any lumps, for 3 minutes or until browned. Stir in the chilli flakes., Arrange the provolone or mozzarella over the pizza base. Top with the sausage mixture, eggplant, onion and oregano. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until the cheese melts and the base is crisp. Top with the rocket.

name: Veal saltimbocca
ingredient: [{'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'broccoli, cut into small florets'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '150g each) veal schnitzels, halved crossways'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'sage leaves'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'pancetta'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) pine nuts'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) white wine'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) thickened cream'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Crusty', 'name': 'Italian bread, to serve'}]
steps: Place the broccoli in a large heatproof bowl and cover with boiling water. Set aside for 5 minutes. Drain., Meanwhile, top each piece of veal with 1 sage leaf and 1 slice of pancetta. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a frying pan over high heat. Add the veal, pancetta-side down, and cook for 1 1/2 minutes. Turn and cook for 1 minute. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil to keep warm., Heat remaining oil in the pan. Add the broccoli, garlic and pine nuts and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until the pine nuts are golden. Transfer to a bowl., Add the wine to the pan and cook for 30 seconds. Add the cream and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 2 minutes or until sauce thickens., Divide the broccoli mixture and veal among serving plates. Pour over the sauce and serve with crusty bread.

name: Soft fish tacos
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh coriander'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sea', 'name': 'salt, to season'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh barramundi fillets'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'whole egg mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': '-3 tbsp, chopped hot sliced jalapeno chillies'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'flour tortilla wraps'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'avocados', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'watercress, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'limes, halved'}]
steps: Combine paprika, cumin, coriander, oil and sea salt in a large bowl. Add fish and toss until well coated in oil mixture. Heat a large non-stick pan over medium heat and cook fish until browned on both sides and cooked through. Use a fork to break fish up into large chunks. Combine mayonnaise and chillies in a small bowl., Heat tortillas according to directions on packet. Spread each with jalapeno mayonnaise, then top with fish, avocado and water cress. Squeeze a generous amount of lime juice over each, before rolling up to enclose filling. Serve immediately.

name: Chocolate mousse
ingredient: [{'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'milk or dark chocolate'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', separated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'powdered gelatine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'boiling water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Dairy Whip Lite Cream'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Dairy', 'name': 'Whip Lite Cream, extra, to garnish'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'chocolate', 'name': ', extra, shaved, to garnish'}]
steps: Place chocolate into a heat-proof bowl. Melt, uncovered, on MEDIUM (50%) power, for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring every minute, or until smooth. Stir in yolks, 1 at a time., Combine gelatine and water. Stir with a fork until dissolved. Cool. Stir gelatine mixture into chocolate mixture. Mix well., Fold Dairy Whip Lite Cream into chocolate mixture. Using an electric mixer, beat eggwhites to soft peaks. Fold into chocolate mixture. Spoon into 4 x 1/2-cup capacity glasses., Cover. Refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours, or until firm., To serve, top with extra Dairy Whip Lite Cream. Sprinkle with chocolate. Serve.

name: Surprise raspberry chocolate cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) Dutch cocoa, (see top tips) plus extra, to dust'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) buttermilk'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) whole-egg mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '440', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '225', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) ground almonds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'bicarbonate of soda'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen raspberries'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate (55% cocoa solids), very finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pomegranate', 'name': ', seeded'}, {'quantity': '175', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'icing sugar, sifted'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted, plus extra, softened, to grease'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'flaked almonds, roasted'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 160°C. Grease pan well with extra softened butter (make sure centre tube is very well greased; this will make it easier to release cake). Dust well with extra cocoa, then shake out excess., Using an electric mixer, beat buttermilk, eggs, mayonnaise and 200ml water on low speed until combined. Sift cocoa, caster sugar, flour, ground almonds, bicarbonate of soda and 1 teaspoon salt through a fine sieve into a bowl, pushing through with a wooden spoon. Add to buttermilk mixture and, using a wire whisk, stir until combined. Add raspberries and chocolate, and, using a spoon, fold in until combined., Pour batter into pan, then place on an oven tray. Bake on bottom shelf of the oven for 1 hour or until a skewer inserted into centre comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes, then run a knife or spatula down sides of pan to release cake (repeat several times, if necessary). Invert onto a wire rack to cool completely., To make icing, place half the pomegranate seeds in a bowl and, using the back of a spoon, crush to release juice. Strain juice into a bowl. Place 1 1/2 tablespoons juice, icing sugar and butter in a separate bowl and stir until thick and smooth. Adjust with a little more icing sugar or juice to form a thick drizzling consistency., Spoon icing over top of cake, allowing it to drip down sides. Place remaining pomegranate seeds on paper towel and pat dry. Scatter seeds and almonds over icing. Stand for 10 minutes for icing to set, then serve.

name: Curried prawn noodles
ingredient: [{'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Trident 100% rice vermicelli noodles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'oil'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen raw peeled prawns, tail on'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'curry paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander, chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Place noodles in a large bowl. Cover with boiling water and set aside to soak for 5 mins, until soft. Drain, rinse and drain again., Meanwhile, heat oil in a large frying pan on high. Cook prawns for 1-2 mins each side, until pink. Remove from pan. Add onion, peas and 1/2 cup water to same pan and cook for 3 mins. Stir through curry paste and cook for 1 min, until fragrant., Mix together soy sauce, fish sauce and sugar. Add noodles, prawns and combined sauces to pea mixture and gently toss to combine. Top with coriander and serve with lime wedges.

name: Roast turkey with peach & pistachio stuffing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3.2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Ingham frozen easy carve turkey buffe'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried peaches, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pistachio kernels, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eg', 'name': 'g'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'chat potatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Jap', 'name': '/Kent pumpkin, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'bay leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil, to drizzle'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Use a sharp knife to cut down the centre of the turkey buffe either side of the breast bone. Cut close to the ribs to remove breasts from the bone. Run your finger under the skin of each breast at the top to create a pocket., Combine fresh breadcrumbs, dried peaches, pistachio kernels, fresh parsley and egg. Press into the pocket., Place the turkey, potatoes, pumpkin, garlic cloves and fresh bay leaves in a tray. Drizzle with olive oil. Roast for 40 minutes. Cover and set aside for 10 minutes. Serve with the vegetables and salad.

name: All-in-one bolognese risoni bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef mince'}, {'quantity': '305', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) dried risoni'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) Campbell’s Real Stock Beef'}, {'quantity': '510', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'jar tomato, onion and garlic pasta sauce'}, {'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/3 cups) pre-grated light mozzarella'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'basil leaves, to serve (optional)'}]
steps: Heat oil in a large, deep, non-stick, ovenproof frying pan over medium-high heat. Add beef and cook, breaking up with a wooden spoon, for 5 minutes or until browned. Add risoni and stir to combine. Stir in stock and pasta sauce, then bring to a simmer., Reduce heat to medium and simmer, covered, for 12-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until risoni is al dente. Stir in 1/3 pre-grated light mozzarella cup cheese., Preheat an oven grill to high. Sprinkle pasta mixture with remaining cheese. Grill for 1-2 minutes or until cheese is golden. Serve sprinkled with basil, if using, to serve.

name: Thai style chicken and rice noodle stir-fry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet dried rice stick noodles'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'oil'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken mince or pork mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': '(1 tbsp) lemongrass, white section only, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': None, 'name': '- 1/2 tsp dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'baby pak choy, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red capsicum, thinly sliced'}]
steps: Boil noodles according to packet directions, drain. Cut with scissors if really long., Heat oil in a wok and stir-fry chicken for 5 minutes, or until browned., Add garlic, lemongrass and chilli and cook for 2 minutes. Add capsicum and pak choy and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add noodles, stir, then add combined fish sauce, brown sugar and lime juice and heat through. Stir in coriander.

name: Pumpkin, ricotta and quinoa fritters
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, peeled and chopped'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Perfect Italiano Ricotta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '35', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) quinoa flakes'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', rind finely grated'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '700', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'btl Mutti Tomato Passata'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'spinach leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Small', 'name': 'basil leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Finely', 'name': 'grated parmesan, extra, to serve'}]
steps: Place the pumpkin in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on High, covered, for 4-5 minutes or until tender. Transfer to a sieve. Set aside to drain for  5 minutes. Transfer to  a large bowl and mash until smooth., Add the ricotta, quinoa, parmesan, chives, egg and lemon rind to the pumpkin. Season. Stir until combined., Heat 2 tsp of the oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the basil and garlic and cook, stirring, for  30 seconds or until aromatic. Stir in the passata and sugar and simmer for 5 minutes or until thickened slightly. Season. Set aside and keep warm., Heat 1 tbs of the oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Spoon four 1⁄4 cupfuls of pumpkin mixture into pan, spreading to 1cm thick. Cook for 2 minutes or until golden brown. Use an egg lifter to turn. Cook for a further 2 minutes or until cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining oil and pumpkin mixture to make 8 fritters., Serve fritters with the tomato sauce. Sprinkle with the spinach, basil leaves and extra parmesan.

name: Chipotle-crusted roast lamb with lime coleslaw
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'whole', 'name': 'chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried oregano leaves'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(', 'name': '300g each) lamb rump roasts'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) bought aïoli'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) crème fraîche'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt coleslaw mix'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'flour', 'name': 'tortillas'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Quartered', 'name': 'mixed cherry tomatoes, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve (optional)'}]
steps: Combine the peppers, oregano and cinnamon in a glass dish. Season with salt. Add lamb. Turn to coat. Cover. Place in the fridge for 10 minutes (or up to 4 hours) to marinate., Preheat oven to 200 ̊C/180 ̊C fan forced. Heat oil in an ovenproof frying pan over high heat. Add the lamb. Cook for 5 minutes each side or until golden. Transfer the pan to oven. Roast for 20 minutes or until cooked medium-well. Set aside for 10 minutes to rest then slice., Meanwhile, combine the aïoli, crème fraîche and lime juice in a large bowl. Add the coleslaw mix and toss., Heat the tortillas following packet directions. Serve with the lamb, coleslaw, tomato, coriander and lime wedges, if using.

name: Harissa roast carrot, quinoa and haloumi salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'carrots, peeled, thickly sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'yellow', 'name': 'capsicum, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'red quinoa, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) water'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'harissa'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'mixed herbs, firmly packed'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt haloumi, sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'seed mix with pine nuts'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 210C/190C fan forced. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper. Place the carrot, capsicum and onion on prepared trays. Drizzle with 2 tbs of the oil. Season. Toss to combine. Roast, stirring halfway, for 35 minutes or until golden and tender., Meanwhile, place the red quinoa and water in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to low and cook, covered, stirring occasionally, for 14-15 minutes or until tender. Rinse under cold running water. Drain well., Combine the lemon juice, harissa, honey and 25ml of the remaining oil in a bowl. Season., Place the roast vegies, quinoa, herbs and half of the dressing in a large bowl. Gently toss to combine., Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Spray with olive oil. Cook the haloumi, turning, for 3-4 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a plate. Add the remaining oil. Add the seed mix. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until toasted. Top salad with haloumi, drizzle with remaining dressing and sprinkle with seed mix.

name: Beef olives
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh white breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'semi-dried tomatoes, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated parmesan cheese'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'basil leaves, finely shredded'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'toasted pine nuts'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', beaten'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'thin', 'name': '(220g each) beef topside steaks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'beef stock'}]
steps: Combine breadcrumbs1 1/2 cups fresh white breadcrumbs, semi-dried tomato1/2 cup semi-dried tomatoes, roughly chopped, parmesan1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese, basil1/4 cup basil leaves, finely shredded, pine nuts2 tbsp toasted pine nuts, egg1 egg, beaten and salt and pepper in a bowl., Cut each steak in half crossways. Place a piece of steak4 thin (220g each) beef topside steaks between 2 sheets plastic wrap. Using a meat mallet, pound until very thin. Spoon 2 tablespoonfuls bread mixture onto one end of steak. Fold in sides and roll up. Secure with toothpicks. Repeat with remaining steaks and bread mixture., Heat oil2 tbsp olive oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook beef olives, in batches, for 2 to 3 minutes or until browned. Transfer to a plate., Pour stock2 cups beef stock into pan. Bring to the boil. Return beef olives to pan. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, turning occasionally, for 10 minutes or until cooked through. Transfer beef to a plate. Cover with foil., Increase heat to high. Simmer sauce for 5 minutes or until thickened slightly. Remove toothpicks. Place beef olives on plates. Spoon over sauce and serve with steamed vegetables, if desired.

name: Lamb, beetroot, walnut and bean salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can baby beets, drained, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'walnut pieces'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '125g each) lamb leg steaks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey mustard dressing'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shaved parmesan cheese'}]
steps: Cook beans in a saucepan of boiling water for 1 to 2 minutes or until tender. Drain. Rinse under cold water. Drain., Combine beans, beets, walnuts and rocket in a bowl. Gently toss to combine., Heat a barbecue plate or chargrill over high heat. Rub both sides of lamb with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Reduce heat to medium. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate. Cover loosely. Set aside for 5 minutes. Thinly slice., Combine lamb, dressing, parmesan and bean mixture. Serve.

name: Apple and pear crumble
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cooking', 'name': 'apples, peeled, cored and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pear', 'name': ', peeled, cored and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'stick'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Flora Buttery Spread'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 210°C., Place apples, pear, raisins, cinnamon stick and water into a saucepan. Cover and cook until fruit is tender. Drain. Place fruit into a 1-litre capacity ovenproof dish., Sift flour and cinnamon into a bowl and stir in the sugar. Using your fingertips, rub Flora Buttery spread into the mixture and sprinkle over the fruit., Bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown. Serve with low fat yoghurt or custard.

name: Rosemary salted baked potatoes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'small', 'name': '(about 1.1kg) coliban (washed) potatoes'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'coarsely chopped fresh rosemary'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sea', 'name': 'salt flakes & freshly ground black pepper'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220C. Place the potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with cold water. Cover and bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium and simmer, uncovered, for 15-20 minutes or until just tender. Drain and set aside for 5 minutes to cool., Spray a roasting pan with oil to lightly grease. Place the potatoes in prepared pan and use an egg lifter to lightly press until potatoes are slightly crushed. Spray generously with oil. Sprinkle with rosemary and season with sea salt flakes and pepper. Roast in preheated oven for 40 minutes or until golden brown and crisp. Serve immediatelyServing. suggestions: Serve with roast lamb or beef, and steamed broccolini and baby (Dutch) carrots.

name: Fish with cucumber salsa
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '800g total) white fish fillets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'baby potatoes, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'green beans, to serve'}]
steps: Make salsa Combine all ingredients, and salt and pepper in a bowl. Stir gently to combine. Cover. Set aside for 10 minutes., Place flour, and salt and pepper onto a plate. Lightly coat both sides of fish with seasoned flour., Heat oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook fish, 2 pieces at a time, for 2 to 3 minutes each side or until golden and just cooked through., Place fish onto 4 serving plates. Top with salsa. Serve with potatoes and beans.

name: Passionfruit cheesecake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Arnott’s Nice biscuits, finely crushed'}, {'quantity': '15', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cream cheese, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla essence'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) fresh passionfruit pulp'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'gelatine powder'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Double', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}]
steps: Combine the biscuit crumbs, butter and cinnamon in small bowl. Divide half the biscuit mixture between two 250ml (1-cup) capacity serving glasses or ramekins and press firmly to cover the base. Place in the fridge to chill., Use an electric beater to beat the cream cheese, sugar, milk and vanilla in bowl until very soft. Use a clean electric beater to beat the cream in another bowl until soft peaks form. Fold into the cream cheese mixture in 2 batches., Spread half the cream cheese mixture gently over the biscuit mixture. Top with the remaining biscuit mixture, then the remaining cream cheese mixture., Stir the passionfruit pulp and sugar in a small bowl until sugar dissolves. Place the water in a small heatproof bowl. Sprinkle with gelatine. Place the bowl in a small saucepan. Add enough boiling water to the pan to come halfway up the side of the bowl. Use a fork to whisk until gelatine dissolves., Stir the gelatine mixture into the passionfruit mixture. Pour over the cheesecakes. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 2 hours or overnight until set., Top the cheesecakes with double cream.

name: Mulled PIMM's
ingredient: [{'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3 cups) apple juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'stick'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'vanilla', 'name': 'bean, split'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) PIMM’s No. 1 Cup'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) brandy'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thinly', 'name': 'sliced apple, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cinnamon', 'name': 'sticks, to serve (optional)'}]
steps: Place the sugar and 80ml (1/3 cup) water in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir for 2 minutes or until the sugar has dissolved. Increase heat to medium-high and bring to the boil. Simmer rapidly, without stirring, for 10 minutes or until a dark golden colour and a toffee-like consistency. Remove from heat and set aside for 5 minutes to cool. Be very careful as toffee reaches a high temperature., Meanwhile, scrape the vanilla seeds from the pod, reserving both., Carefully add the apple juice to the saucepan, taking care as it may spit. Add the cinnamon stick and vanilla pod and seeds. Return to a low heat and cook, stirring occasionally, until the toffee has dissolved into the juice. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool slightly., Stir the PIMM’S and brandy into the toffee mixture. Remove and discard the cinnamon stick and vanilla pod. When cool enough to consume, pour the mixture into heatproof glasses. Serve warm, garnished with sliced apple and extra cinnamon sticks, if using.

name: Penne with fennel, brussels sprouts and pancetta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'penne rigate'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, unpeeled, bruised'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', zest peeled into strips, juiced'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pancetta, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'brussels sprouts, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bulbs', 'name': 'baby fennel, cut into thin wedges, fronds reserved'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) finely grated parmesan, plus extra, shaved, to serve'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) pine nuts, roasted'}]
steps: Cook pasta in a saucepan of boiling salted water for 8 minutes or until al dente, then drain., Meanwhile, heat oil and butter in a large, heavy-based frying pan over medium–high heat. Add garlic and onion, and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until onion is softened. Add lemon zest, pancetta, brussels sprouts and fennel, and cook, stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes or until the pancetta is golden., Add pasta, reserved fennel fronds and lemon juice to pancetta mixture and cook for a further 3 minutes or until pasta is warmed through. Remove pan from heat. Stir in parmesan and half the pine nuts. Season with salt and pepper., Divide pasta among bowls and scatter with remaining pine nuts. Serve with extra parmesan.

name: Herb-stuffed lamb leg with orange mint gremolata
ingredient: [{'quantity': '7', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'rosemary, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'lamb leg, bone in'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'wholegrain mustard or Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'brushed potatoes, peeled and cut into 2.5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, at room temp'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(185ml) whole milk, warmed'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'carrots, sliced 2cm thick on an angle'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'butter, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'mint, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Grated', 'name': 'rind of 2 oranges'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C (160C fan-forced). Combine 1 tablespoon of the oil with garlic and rosemary in a small bowl. With a paring knife, cut little pockets in the lamb leg big enough to fit your fingers in. Stuff the pockets with the garlic-rosemary mixture., Lay 6 strands of kitchen twine, spaced evenly apart, horizontally across a large baking sheet. Fold end of the leg into itself making a uniform roll, then place the lamb on top of the twine, perpendicular to the twine. Starting with the center twines and working outwards, tie the twines as tight as possible around the lamb, ensuring the cavity is tightly enclosed. Tie the last piece around the end flap to keep it from falling open., Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large frying pan over a medium-high heat. Season lamb with salt and pepper. Cook for 2-3 mins each side, or until golden brown, then remove from pan to a baking tray lined with a rack., Mix mustard with 3 tablespoons oil and coat lamb leg completely. Roast lamb in oven for about 1 1/2 hrs (allow 25 mins per 500g), turning once. Remove from oven, cover with foil and rest 25-30 mins., Meanwhile, cook potatoes in a large pot of salted water until soft. Strain into colander, return to pot and let sit for a few minutes to dry. Working in batches, press potatoes through a potato ricer or sieve into the same pot. Stir in 60g butter and half the milk, and season to taste. Add more milk as needed to make creamy. Cover and keep warm., In a medium saucepan place carrots and just cover with water. Bring to simmer over medium heat, and cover. Cook for 20 mins, or until carrots are just tender and liquid has evaporated. Drain any remaining liquid, if needed. Add 1 tbsp butter and sugar and cook until smooth glaze has formed. Season to taste with salt and pepper., Mix mint with zest in a small bowl and add 1 tablespoon oil., To serve, remove twine from lamb and cut across the grain, with a large, sharp knife, into medium-thick slices. Arrange on a serving platter and scatter gremolata over lamb. Spoon mashed potatoes and glazed carrots into separate serving platters and serve with the lamb.

name: Truffle, parsnip & sausage risotto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'Italian', 'name': 'pork sausages'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'parsnips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'L', 'name': '(4 cups) vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(330g) arborio rice'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60g) mascarpone'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80g) grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'sage', 'name': 'leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Truffle', 'name': 'oil, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Microcress', 'name': ', to serve (optional)'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 200C., Remove the sausage4 Italian pork sausages meat from their casings and roll into small balls. Place on a baking tray and drizzle with oil2 tbsp olive oil. Cut 4 parsnips in quarters lengthways, place in a roasting pan, drizzle with oilTruffle oil, to serve and season. Place the sausage and parsnip in the oven and roast for 10-15 minutes until sausage is cooked through and parsnip is tender., Meanwhile, coarsely grate the remaining 4 parsnips. Heat the stock1L (4 cups) vegetable stock in a separate saucepan. Melt 40g butter in a deep frypan over medium-high heat. Add the onion1 onion, finely chopped and cook, stirring, for 1-2 minutes until softened. Add the grated parsnip and cook for a further 2-3 minutes, then add the rice1 1/2 cups (330g) arborio rice and cook for a further 2 minutes to coat the grains. Add the wine1/3 cup (80ml) dry white wine and stir to combine. Add the stock, 1 ladle at a time, allowing each to be absorbed before adding the next, and cook for 20 minutes or until all the stock is used and the risotto is rich and creamy. Stir in the sausage balls and remove from the heat. Stir in the mascarpone1/4 cup (60g) mascarpone and parmesan1 cup (80g) grated parmesan. Season, cover, and set aside for 5 minutes to rest., Melt the remaining 30g butter in a frypan over medium heat. Add sage12 sage leaves and cook until butter is brown and sage is crisp., Toss the parsnip in the truffle oil. Serve the risotto topped with roasted parsnip, burnt butter and microcressMicrocress, to serve (optional), if using.

name: Oat, cranberry and pear bread
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'rolled oats'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted, cooled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'golden syrup'}, {'quantity': '1 1/3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped almonds'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'drained canned pears, chopped'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fanforced. Grease a 6cm-deep, 8cm x 17cm (base) loaf pan. Line base and sides with baking paper, allowing a 2cm overhang at long ends., Combine milk and 1/2 cup oats in a large bowl. Set aside for 30 minutes to soak., Add butter, egg and golden syrup to oat mixture. Stir to combine. Sift flour and baking powder over oat mixture. Add almonds and cranberries. Stir to combine. Add pear. Fold to combine. Spoon mixture into prepared pan. Sprinkle with remaining oats. Bake for 45 minutes or until a skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean. Stand in pan for 10 minutes. Turn out onto a wire rack to cool. Serve.

name: Black forest trifles
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '415g can Stoneless Black Cherries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'kirsch (optional)'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) bought vanilla custard'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) hazelnut-flavoured chocolate sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g pkt chocolate rollettes'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) double cream'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Grated', 'name': 'dark chocolate, to serve'}]
steps: Drain cherries, reserving 60ml (1/4 cup) of the syrup. Combine the reserved syrup and the kirsch, if desired, in a small bowl. Combine the custard and chocolate sauce in a small bowl., Cut each rollette crossways into 4 slices. Divide half the slices among serving glasses. Drizzle over half the syrup. Top with half the cherries. Pour over the custard mixture., Continue layering with remaining rollette slices, syrup and cherries. Top with the cream and chocolate to serve.

name: Vegetarian pad Thai
ingredient: [{'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried rice noodles'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tamarind paste or lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Coles Fresh Australian Superfood Stir-Fry'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Soyco Thai Tofu'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chives, halved'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'small coriander sprigs'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(45g) chopped peanuts'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Place the noodles in a large heatproof bowl. Cover with boiling water. Stand for 10 mins or until soft. Drain., Meanwhile, combine the soy sauce, brown sugar and tamarind or lime juice in a small jug., Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large frying pan or wok over high heat. Add the garlic, stir-fry mix and tofu and stir-fry for 1 min or until vegetables just start to wilt. Add the soy sauce mixture and noodles and stir to combine. Remove from heat. Stir in the chives, basil, coriander and half the peanuts., Divide the vegetarian pad Thai among serving bowls. Top with the remaining peanuts and serve with lime wedges.

name: Prawn, ruby grapefruit and macadamia salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'cos lettuce hearts, leaves separated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'radishes, trimmed, very thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'zucchini, cut into thin ribbons'}, {'quantity': '24', 'unit': '(', 'name': '750g) cooked medium tiger prawns, peeled, deveined (tails intact)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'macadamia nuts, toasted, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'ruby', 'name': 'red grapefruit'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'avocado oil (see notes)'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'small fresh coriander sprigs'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Toasted', 'name': 'crusty herb bread, to serve'}]
steps: Arrange lettuce, in a single layer, on a large serving platter. Top with radish, zucchini, prawns and macadamias., Peel and segment grapefruit (see notes). Squeeze membrane over a bowl to reserve juice (you'll need 1/4 cup). Discard membrane. Add segments to salad., Whisk grapefruit juice and oil together in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle over salad. Top with coriander. Serve with bread.

name: Catalan beef stew
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'piece pancetta, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'gravy beef, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onions, halved, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3 cups) beef stock'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) dry red wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '7cm cinnamon sticks, lightly crushed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'strips', 'name': 'orange peel'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'good-quality dark chocolate, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'continental parsley, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 160°C. Heat a large flameproof casserole dish over high heat. Add the pancetta250g piece pancetta, coarsely chopped and cook, stirring, for 2-3 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a heatproof bowl. Add 60ml (1/4 cup) of the oil80ml (1/3 cup) extra virgin olive oil to the casserole dish. Add one-quarter of the beef2kg gravy beef, cut into 2cm pieces and cook, turning, for 5 minutes or until brown. Transfer to the bowl with the pancetta. Repeat, in 3 more batches, with the remaining beef, reheating the dish between batches., Add the vinegar80ml (1/3 cup) red wine vinegar to the dish and cook, stirring to dislodge any bits that have cooked on to the base, for 1-2 minutes. Pour over the beef mixture., Heat the remaining oil in the dish over medium heat. Add the onion2 brown onions, halved, finely chopped and garlic4 garlic cloves, finely chopped and cook, stirring, for 10 minutes or until soft. Add the beef mixture, stock750ml (3 cups) beef stock, wine250ml (1 cup) dry red wine, tomato paste2 tbsp tomato paste, cinnamon2 x 7cm cinnamon sticks, lightly crushed, thyme4 sprigs fresh thyme, orange peel3 strips orange peel and chocolate30g good-quality dark chocolate, finely chopped. Cover with foil and a tight-fitting lid. Bring to the boil. Bake in oven for 2 hours or until the beef is tender. Set aside for 15 minutes to cool. Place in the fridge for 6 hours to chill., Preheat oven to 160°C. Use a spoon to remove any fat from the surface of the stew. Cook the stew, stirring, over low heat for 5 minutes or until heated through. Bake in oven for 45-50 minutes or until the meat is tender and the sauce thickens. Sprinkle the stew with parsleyFresh continental parsley, to serve to serve.

name: Quick ricotta torta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'smooth ricotta cheese'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'icing sugar mixture, sifted'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'multi-coloured glace cherries, chopped'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'mixed peel'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coffee liqueur'}, {'quantity': '460', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'double unfilled round sponge cake'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cocoa', 'name': 'powder, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Grated', 'name': 'chocolate, to serve'}]
steps: Combine ricotta and icing sugar in a bowl. Stir in cherries, chocolate and peel., Cut each sponge cake in half crossways. Place base of 1 cake, cut side-up, on a plate. Brush with one-third of the liqueur. Spread one-third of the ricotta mixture over cake. Top with 1 cake top. Repeat layers with remaining liqueur, ricotta mixture and sponge cake, finishing with a layer of sponge. Dust with cocoa powder. Top with chocolate. Serve.

name: Thyme butter salmon parcels
ingredient: [{'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon zest'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', thinly sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'asparagus, woody ends trimmed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '150g each) salmon fillets, skin on'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chillies, halved lengthways (optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', cut into wedges'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Combine butter, lemon zest and thyme leaves in a small bowl. Season., Cut four 30cm x 45cm pieces of baking paper. Place on a clean work surface. Divide zucchini, onion and asparagus evenly among paper. Arrange salmon over zucchini mixture. Top with chilli, if using, and butter mixture. Season., Bring 2 long sides of paper to the centre and fold over twice to seal. Roll up ends to enclose. Place on a baking tray. Bake for 15-20 mins or until salmon is just cooked. Divide among serving plates. Serve with lemon wedges.

name: The ultimate stir-fry sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) sweet chilli sauce'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) oyster sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated ginger'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'warm water'}]
steps: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl.

name: Kale and sweet potato pilaf
