ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Coles Brand ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Coles Brand ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'orange sweet potato (kumara, peeled, cut into 3cm pieces)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(200g) quinoa, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(375ml) vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'kale, stems trimmed, coarsely torn'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80g) coarsely chopped toasted almonds'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Greek', 'name': '-style yoghurt, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook the onion, stirring for 5 mins or until softened. Add the cumin, coriander, cinnamon and turmeric. Cook, stirring, for 1 min or until aromatic. Add the sweet potato and stir to combine., Add the quinoa and vegetable stock. Increase heat to high and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and cook, covered for 15 mins or until the quinoa is tender and liquid is almost absorbed. Remove from heat. Add the kale and toss to combine. Set aside, covered, for 10 mins to stand., Divide the pilaf among serving bowls. Sprinkle with the almonds and coriander. Serve with a drizzle of yoghurt and the lemon wedges.

name: Pasta with pea pesto and crispy chorizo
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) frozen baby peas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'firmly packed fresh mint leaves, plus extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) finely grated parmesan, plus extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'shallots, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', rind finely grated, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'garlic clove, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'light extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '420', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried maccheroni or other short pasta'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '250g) chorizo, finely chopped'}]
steps: Place peas in a heatproof bowl. Cover with boiling water. Set aside for 2 minutes. Drain. Rinse under cold water. Reserve 1/2 cup peas., Process the peas, mint, parmesan, shallot, rind and garlic until finely chopped. Season. Add the oil and process until smooth., Cook pasta in a large saucepan of salted boiling water until al dente. Drain, reserving 1⁄2 cup of cooking liquid. Return the pasta and reserved cooking liquid to the pan., Meanwhile, heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add chorizo and cook, stirring, for 4-5 minutes or until golden and crisp., Add pea pesto, half the chorizo and reserved peas to the pasta. Toss to combine. Divide among bowls. Top with extra mint leaves, extra parmesan and the remaining chorizo. Serve with lemon wedges.

name: Banana, date and walnut bread
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(300g) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(220g) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) buttermilk'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Australian Free Range Eggs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'bananas, mashed'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(45g) chopped dates'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(25g) chopped walnuts'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Caramelised', 'name': 'banana, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Butter', 'name': ', extra, to serve'}]
steps: Grease a 10cm x 20cm (base measurement) loaf pan and line the base and sides with baking paper, allowing the 2 long sides to overhang., Combine flour and sugar in a large bowl. Add buttermilk, butter, eggs and banana. Stir to combine. Stir in date and walnut. Spoon the mixture into the prepared pan and smooth the surface., Place an upturned heatproof saucer or ramekin in a slow cooker. Place loaf pan on the saucer or ramekin. Bake for 3 hours on high (or 5 hours on low) or until a skewer inserted in centre comes out clean. Set aside in pan for 10 mins before turning onto a wire rack to cool., Cut the loaf into slices. Serve with caramelised banana and extra butter.

name: Aussie crumpet burger
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef mince'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'Golden', 'name': 'Crumpets, toasted'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'cos lettuce leaves, torn'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tomato', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cooked beetroot, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Tomato', 'name': 'sauce, to serve'}]
steps: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook the onion, stirring occasionally, for 7 minutes or until well browned. Season and set aside., Meanwhile, divide the mince into 4 portions and shape each portion into a patty the same width as the crumpets., Cook the patties in the same pan over medium-high heat for 2 minutes each side or until browned. Season. Reduce heat to medium and cook for a further 4 minutes or until cooked through. Set aside loosely covered with foil., Meanwhile, heat remaining 2 teaspoons of oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Crack 4 eggs into the pan and cook for 3 minutes or until the whites are set., Divide 4 crumpets between 4 plates. Top with lettuce, tomato, beetroot, patties, onion and egg. Drizzle a little tomato sauce if you like and finish with remaining crumpets. Use a small toothpick to hold each burger in place.

name: Spicy sausage and basil pilaf
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'spicy lamb sausages (see note)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chilli powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'basmati rice, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'Beef stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, quartered, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'basil leaves, torn'}]
steps: Heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Lightly spray sausages500g spicy lamb sausages (see note) with oilolive oil cooking spray. Cook, turning, for 8 minutes or until browned and just cooked through. Transfer to a board. Cut into 1cm-thick pieces., Heat peanut oil1 tbsp peanut oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion2 brown onions, thinly sliced and garlic1 garlic clove, crushed. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until onion is soft. Add cumin2 tsp ground cumin, coriander2 tsp ground coriander, turmeric1/2 tsp ground turmeric and chilli1/2 tsp chilli powder. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until aromatic., Add rice2 cups basmati rice, rinsed to saucepan. Stir to coat in oil and spices. Stir in stock4 cups Beef stock and capsicum1 red capsicum, quartered, chopped. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until rice is tender and stock is absorbed., Stir in sausage and basil1/2 cup basil leaves, torn. Cover. Remove from heat. Stand for 5 minutes or until sausage is heated through. Spoon into bowls. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

name: Coconut and lime fish tacos with cucumber salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can coconut cream'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'lime rind,  finely grated'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '180g boneless skinless snapper fillets, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'panko breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'long-grain white rice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumbers, peeled into ribbons'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'flour', 'name': 'tortillas, warmed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sweet', 'name': 'chilli sauce, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Line a large baking tray with baking paper., Combine coconut cream and lime rind in a shallow glass or ceramic dish. Add fish. Turn to coat. Cover. Refrigerate for 3 hours, if time permits., Place breadcrumbs, coconut and chilli flakes in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine., Remove fish from marinade. Place on prepared tray, spooning over any leftover marinade in dish. Top fish with breadcrumb mixture, pressing to secure. Bake fish for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden and cooked through (see notes)., Meanwhile, cook rice following packet directions until tender. Drain., Combine cucumber, coriander and mint in a bowl. Divide rice, cucumber salad and fish among tortillas. Drizzle with sweet chilli sauce and serve with lime wedges.

name: Chicken antipasto pasta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'penne rigate'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'prosciutto'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'barbecued chicken, skin removed, shredded (see note)'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'semi-dried tomatoes, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pitted black olives, chopped'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'finely grated parmesan cheese'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Lupi extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'basil', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling salted water, following packet directions, until tender. Drain and return to saucepan., Meanwhile, preheat grill on high. Grill prosciutto for 2 to 3 minutes each side or until golden and crisp. Set aside to cool. Break into pieces., Add chicken, prosciutto, tomatoes, olives and parmesan to pasta. Toss to combine., Combine oil, lemon juice, chopped basil and salt and pepper in a jug. Add to pasta mixture. Toss to combine. Serve topped with basil leaves.

name: Frutta di mare all'acqua pazza (seafood in crazy water)
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mussels, scrubbed, debearded'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can cherry tomatoes (see note)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bay', 'name': 'leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'thyme', 'name': 'sprig'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '80g whole small fish (such as garfish or whiting), cleaned'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '80g red mullet fillets, cut into 3 pieces'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'prawns, peeled (tails intact), deveined'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'whole', 'name': 'small squid (see note), cleaned, tubes and tentacles separated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped flat-leaf parsley'}]
steps: Place the wine in a large saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Add the mussels, then cover and cook for 2-3 minutes, shaking the pan occasionally, until mussels have opened (discard any that haven’t opened after this time). Strain and reserve cooking liquid, then set aside., Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large frypan over medium heat. Add the garlic and chilli and cook, stirring, for 2-3 minutes until softened and fragrant. Add the tomatoes, bay leaves, thyme and reserved mussel liquid. Reduce heat to low and simmer gently for 3-4 minutes until slightly reduced. Add the mussels to the frypan, season with sea salt and freshly ground pepper, then cover and keep warm., Meanwhile, season remaining seafood. Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in a large frypan over medium-high heat. In batches if necessary, cook whole fish for 2-3 minutes each side until just cooked, then remove and set aside. Cook mullet and prawns separately for 1 minute each side until just cooked, then set aside. Cook squid, stirring, for 30 seconds until just cooked. Divide all the seafood among serving bowls, then pour over the hot broth and mussels. Serve scattered with parsley.

name: Dijonnaise with crudites
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'bunch baby carrots'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'radishes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'thin asparagus, woody ends trimmed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': '-3 celery stalks, cut into 5cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'jar Maille Dijonnaise'}]
steps: Peel carrots and trim radish ends, leaving a little of the green tops of each for presentation. Blanch carrots and asparagus in boiling, salted water for 1 minute, then drain and refresh in cold water. Drain on paper towel., Arrange vegetables on a serving platter with a bowl of Dijonnaise for dipping.

name: Raspberry and lime hotcakes with lime and cinnamon butter
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(300g) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(375ml) buttermilk'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) milk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lime rind'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen raspberries'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Extra', 'name': 'raspberries, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'zest, to serve'}]
steps: Sift the flour, sugar and baking powder into a medium bowl. Make a well in the centre. Whisk the egg, buttermilk, milk and lime rind together in a jug. Add to the flour, in batches, whisking between each batch, until a smooth batter forms. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside for 30 minutes to rest., Add raspberries to batter and gently fold to combine. Melt 1 tsp of the butter in a small, shallow non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Spoon about 1/3 cup of batter into the pan to form a 10cm diameter hotcake. Cook for 2 minutes or until bubbles have risen to the surface and the pancake is golden underneath. Turn with a spatula and cook for a further 1 minute or until just cooked., Transfer to a plate and cover with foil to keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter, re-greasing pan before each batch, to make 8 hotcakes., Meanwhile, use and electric mixer to beat remaining butter, sugar and cinnamon until pale and creamy., Divide pancakes among serving plates. Dollop with cinnamon butter and top with extra raspberries and lime zest.

name: Coconut banana fritters
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'bicarbonate of soda'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) soda water'}, {'quantity': '85', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) desiccated coconut'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Plain', 'name': 'flour, to coat'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3 cups) peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'bananas, peeled, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pure', 'name': 'icing sugar, to dust'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vanilla', 'name': 'ice-cream, to serve'}]
steps: To make the caramel sauce, stir the sugar, cream and butter in a saucepan over medium heat for 4-5 minutes or until smooth., Sift the self-raising flour and bicarbonate of soda into a bowl. Whisk in soda water until smooth., Spread coconut and plain flour over separate plates., Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat to 180ºC. Roll 3 pieces of banana in flour and shake off excess. Dip in batter, then roll in coconut to coat. Carefully add to the oil. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel. Repeat, in 3 more batches, with remaining banana, flour, batter and coconut., Dust the fritters with icing sugar. Serve with the caramel sauce and vanilla ice-cream.

name: Chorizo and bean minestrone
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'chorizo', 'name': 'sausages, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'sticks, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can Heinz Big Red tomato soup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'litre', 'name': '(4 cups) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can cannellini beans, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'English spinach, finely shredded'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Bough', 'name': 'pesto, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Crusty', 'name': 'bread, to serve'}]
steps: Heat a large saucepan over high heat. Add the chorizo2 chorizo sausages, finely chopped and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until brown. Use a slotted spoon to transfer to a bowl., Add the onion1 brown onion, finely chopped, celery2 celery sticks, finely chopped, carrot1 carrot, peeled, finely chopped, zucchini1 zucchini, finely chopped and garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed to the pan and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until onion softens. Return the sausage with the  tomato soup400g can tomato soup and chicken stock1 litre (4 cups) chicken stock. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until soup thickens slightly., Add the beans400g can cannellini beans, rinsed, drained and spinach40g English spinach, finely shredded to the soup and stir to combine. Remove from heat. Taste and season with salt and pepper., Ladle soup among serving bowls. Dollop with pestoBough pesto, to serve and serve immediately with crusty breadCrusty bread, to serve, if desired.

name: Glazed strawberry doughnut loaf
ingredient: [{'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'desiccated coconut'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sprinkles', 'name': ', to decorate'}]
steps: Make Quick Strawberry Jam: Place strawberry, sugar and vanilla in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring, for 4 to 5 minutes or until sugar dissolves. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until mixture thickens and strawberry is pulpy. Remove from heat. Set aside for 30 minutes to cool., Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Grease a 6.5cm-deep, 10.5cm x 21cm loaf pan, extending paper 3cm above all edges., Using an electric mixer, beat butter and sugar for 5 minutes or until light and fluffy. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating until just combined. Add flour, coconut and milk. Beat for 30 seconds or until well combined., Spoon 2/3 of the mixture into pan. Level top. Spoon jam over top of batter, leaving a 1.5cm border. Drop small spoonfuls of remaining batter over top of jam. Spread gently to cover. Bake for 45 minutes or until golden and top is firm to touch. Stand in pan for 5 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely., Make Icing: Whisk icing sugar and 1 tablespoon hot water together until smooth and combined, adding an extra 1 tablespoon hot water if needed. Using food colouring, tint pale pink. Spread icing over top of cake. Decorate with sprinkles. Set aside for 2 hours or until set. Serve.

name: Pina Colada
ingredient: [{'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bundaberg Five Rum'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'pineapple juice'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'light coconut cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': ', cut into two wedges'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cubed', 'name': '& crushed ice'}]
steps: Combine Bundaberg Five Rum, pineapple juice, coconut cream and sugar in a cocktail shaker or mason jar., Squeeze in half a lime, add cubed ice and shake for 10 - 15 seconds., Fill a tall glass with crushed ice., Strain drink into the tall glass.

name: Creamy vegan one-pot pasta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried fusilli pasta'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) Massel Organic Vegetable Liquid Stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'head', 'name': '(about 250g) broccoli, cut into florets'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'silken tofu, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'nutritional yeast, plus extra, to sprinkle'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', rind finely grated, juiced'}]
steps: Heat oil1 1/2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion1 small brown onion, finely chopped and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds or until aromatic., Add the pasta300g dried fusilli pasta and stock500ml (2 cups) Organic Vegetable Liquid Stock. Stir until combined. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until pasta is almost al dente. Add the broccoli1 head (about 250g) broccoli, cut into florets, peas150g (1 cup) frozen peas and 125ml (1/2 cup) water. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until broccoli is tender crisp., Place the tofu300g silken tofu, drained, nutritional yeast2 tsp nutritional yeast, plus extra, to sprinkle, lemon rind1 lemon, rind finely grated, juiced and 1 tbsp juice in a food processor. Process until smooth. Add to pasta mixture. Toss until combined and heated through. Divide among serving bowls. Season with pepper. Sprinkle with extra nutritional yeast to serve.

name: Smoked paprika and lime prawn tacos with pickled cabbage and avocado
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green prawns, peeled leaving tails intact, deveined'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': ', zested, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'ripe', 'name': 'avocado, stone removed, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'green chilli, seeded, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'corn', 'name': 'taco shells (Mission brand)'}]
steps: Combine the prawns, oil, paprika, oregano, cumin, coriander and lime zest in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside to develop the flavours., To make the pickled cabbage, combine the cabbages, carrot, onion, vinegar, sugar, salt and chilli in a large bowl. Set aside for 15 minutes to develop the flavours., Combine the avocado, chilli, coriander and 1 tbs lime juice in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper., Cook taco shells following packet directions., Heat a chargrill pan on high. Add prawns and cook for 2 minutes each side or until prawns curl and change colour., Drain cabbage of excess liquid. Divide prawns, cabbage and avocado among taco shells. Serve immediately.

name: Rice and tuna snack
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt microwave brown rice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '95g cans flavoured flaked tuna'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cherry', 'name': 'tomatoes, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'alfalfa sprouts'}]
steps: Cook rice in microwave following packet directions or until heated through. Divide the rice among serving bowls. Divide tuna among the bowls. Top the tuna with cherry tomatoes, and alfalfa sprouts. Serve immediately.

name: Basil chicken cannelloni on wilted spinach
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1 3/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'loosely packed fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'white onion, cut into quarters'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2 1/4', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '365', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Lite White milk'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lean chicken breast mince'}, {'quantity': '1 120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt cannelloni'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) shredded light mozzarella'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'English spinach, stems trimmed, washed'}]
steps: Position an oven shelf in top rack of oven. Preheat oven to 230°C. Brush a 17 x 23cm shallow (base measurement) baking dish with 1/2 teaspoon of oil. Place 1 1/2 cups of basil leaves, onion, garlic, flour, 85ml milk, remaining oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt in bowl of a food processor. Process until basil is chopped., Combine mince, 1/4 teaspoon of salt, 1/2 teaspoon of pepper and 1 tablespoon of basil mixture in bowl. Fill each cannelloni tube. Place in a single layer in the baking dish., Place remaining milk and basil mixture in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 1-2 minutes or until mixture thickens. Pour sauce over the cannelloni and sprinkle with mozzarella. Bake in preheated oven for 18 minutes or until cannelloni are tender when pierced with a knife., Meanwhile, place the spinach with water clinging to the leaves in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook, covered, shaking pan occasionally, for 2-3 minutes or until wilted. Season with salt and pepper., Place spinach on plates, top with 3 cannelloni tubes and remaining basil.

name: Moroccan lamb with carrot salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated orange zest'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon zest'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g lamb neck fillets, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(300g) whole-egg mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'harissa (see note)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'Dutch carrots, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'redcurrant jelly'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'orange', 'name': ', juiced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped flat-leaf parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(120g) pitted black olives'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Radishes', 'name': ', halved, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Watercress', 'name': 'sprigs, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Marinated', 'name': 'feta, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 200°C., Place zest on a baking tray and cook for 15 minutes. Add cumin and cook for a further 5 minutes or until zest is dry and crisp. Cool slightly then crush in a mortar and pestle with chilli and 2 tablespoons each salt and black pepper until a powder. Combine half the mixture with oil. Coat lamb in marinade, cover and chill for 2-3 hours., For the salad, toss carrots with honey and 1/4 cup (60ml) oil. Arrange in a single layer on a foil-lined baking tray and cook for 15-20 minutes until tender. Heat jelly in a pan over medium heat with the citrus juice, stirring to dissolve the jelly. Simmer for 5-6 minutes until reduced by half. Remove from heat and cool, then whisk in cinnamon, parsley and remaining 2 tablespoons oil. When carrots are cool, toss with olives, radish, watercress, feta and dressing., Heat a non-stick frypan over high heat. Add lamb and cook, turning, until browned on all sides. Transfer to a baking tray and roast for 12-15 minutes for medium-rare. Cover loosely with foil and set aside to rest for 10 minutes., Meanwhile, combine mayonnaise and harissa in a bowl. Set aside., To serve, slice the lamb and serve with the harissa mayonnaise and carrot salad.

name: Sesame salmon with pak choy & shiitake mushrooms
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '250g each) salmon fillets, skin on'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Hot Szechuan Seasoning'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil, to grease'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'shiitake mushrooms, halved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'pak choy, quartered'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'oyster sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil, extra'}]
steps: Place salmon, skin-side down, in a baking pan. Drizzle over the sesame oil and honey. Sprinkle with the seasoning. Cover and place in the fridge overnight to marinate., Preheat a barbecue flat plate on medium-high. Brush the flat plate with oil. Place the salmon, skin-side down, on the flat plate. Drizzle over the soy sauce. Cook for 1-2 minutes each side or until cooked through. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil to keep warm., Brush the flat plate with oil. Cook the mushroom, stirring, for 1-2 minutes. Add the pak choy and cook, turning, for 1-2 minutes or until just tender and wilted. Transfer to a bowl. Combine the oyster sauce, garlic and extra sesame oil in a small bowl. Drizzle over the vegetables and toss to coat. Serve with the salmon.

name: Mini pesto, pea and prawn patties
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(180g) frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'raw prawns, peeled, deveined'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chickpeas, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Leggo’s Basil Pesto'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'watercress, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow peas, trimmed, steamed, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'fennel, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(100g) whole-egg mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'hot water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Leggo’s Basil Pesto, extra'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'vine-ripened cherry tomatoes'}]
steps: Cook peas in a saucepan of boiling water for 3 mins or until just tender. Drain well. Place 1 cup (120g) of the peas in a food processor with the prawns, chickpeas, garlic, pesto and lemon rind. Process until well combined. Stir in remaining peas. Season., Use damp hands to shape 2-tbs portions of the mixture into patties. Place on a baking tray. Cover and place in the fridge for 1 hour to chill., Preheat oven to 200°C. Combine the watercress, snow peas and fennel in a large bowl. Combine the mayonnaise, water and extra pesto in a small bowl., Heat oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Cook the patties, in 3 batches, for 2 mins each side or until cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Cover to keep warm., Meanwhile, place the tomatoes on a baking tray. Spray with olive oil spray. Season. Bake for 10 mins or until the tomatoes begin to collapse., Divide the patties, salad and tomatoes among serving plates. Serve with the mayonnaise mixture.

name: Mexican chicken soup with crispy tortilla strips
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped jalapeno peppers'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Continental', 'name': 'chicken stock pots'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles RSPCA approved chicken breast fillets, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'corn', 'name': 'cobs, husks removed, kernels removed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': ', juiced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'corn', 'name': 'tortillas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocado', 'name': ', stone removed, peeled, diced'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, extra, to serve'}]
steps: Heat the oil in a large stock pot or saucepan over medium-low heat. Add onion and capsicum. Cook for 3 mins or until onion softens. Add garlic, peppers and cumin. Cook for 2 mins or until aromatic., Add stock pots, tomato paste and 6 cups (1.5L) boiling water. Stir to combine. Bring to the boil. Add chicken breasts. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 10-12 mins or until chicken is cooked through. Transfer chicken to a plate. Shred chicken with a fork., Return chicken to the soup with the corn kernels. Cook for a further 3-5 mins or until heated through and corn is cooked. Stir in lime juice., Meanwhile, spray a frying pan with cooking oil spray and heat over medium heat. Cook tortillas for 1-2 mins each side or until golden and crisp. Cut into strips., Ladle soup into bowls. Top with crispy tortilla strips, chopped avocado, and coriander leaves. Serve with lime wedges.

name: Green soup with crispy lemongrass tofu
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'coconut oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': '⁄2 bunch fresh coriander, roots finely chopped, leaves picked'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': '-piece fresh ginger, peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh broccoli, cut into florets, stems sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'L', 'name': "ctn Campbell's Real Soup Base - Asian"}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach, plus extra to serve'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': ', rind finely grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemongrass', 'name': 'stalk, white part only, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'long red chilli, deseeded, finely\xa0chopped'}, {'quantity': '15', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'palm sugar, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'firm tofu, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fish sauce, or to taste'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Light', 'name': 'coconut milk, to drizzle (optional)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander leaves, extra, to\xa0serve'}]
steps: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook the onion, coriander root, ginger, sliced garlic and broccoli stems, stirring, for 4 minutes or until softened. Add the soup base. Bring to the boil., Add the broccoli florets. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until tender. Stir in the spinach and coriander leaves. Remove from the heat. Stir in the lime rind and juice. Use a stick blender to process until smooth., Meanwhile, heat the remaining oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Cook the lemongrass, chilli and palm sugar, stirring, for 30 seconds or until aromatic. Add the tofu. Cook, stirring, for 4 minutes. Add the crushed garlic and fish sauce. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until the tofu is golden., Ladle the soup among bowls. Drizzle with coconut milk if using. Top with the tofu and extra spinach and coriander leaves.

name: Brownie tiramisu
ingredient: [{'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter, at room temperature, chopped'}, {'quantity': '170', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) cocoa Powder'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '65', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) sour cream'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate, melted'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of salt'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan forced. Grease a 20cm (base measurement) square pan and line with baking paper., Use electric beaters to beat the butter, sugar and vanilla in a bowl until pale and creamy. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Gradually sift in the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder, alternating with the sour cream, folding until well combined. Fold in the chocolate and salt. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until a skewer inserted in the centre comes out with a few crumbs clinging. Set aside to cool completely in the pan., While brownie is cooling, beat mascarpone, icing sugar and vanilla extract in a bowl until smooth. Fold through whipped cream., Cut brownie into pieces. Divide half the pieces among 6 glasses. Drizzle 1/2 cup Kahlua or marsala over brownie. Top with half the cream mixture. Top with remaining brownie, liqueur and cream mixture. Dust with cocoa powder.

name: Tomato and chickpea pasta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'spiral pasta'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cup mushrooms, quartered'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'brussels sprouts, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chickpeas, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80g) finely grated parmesan'}]
steps: Cook the pasta in a large saucepan of boiling water following packet directions or until al dente. Drain, reserving ½ cup (125ml) cooking liquid., Meanwhile, heat oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook, stirring, for 3 mins until onion softens. Add the garlic, mushroom and brussels sprout and cook, stirring, for 5 mins or until mushroom is tender., Add tomato, stock, chickpeas and reserved cooking liquid to pan. Bring to the boil. Add pasta. Toss to combine., Divide pasta mixture among serving bowls. Season and serve with parmesan.

name: Curried beef and lentil casserole
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Coles Olive Oil'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Australian Beef Chuck Steak'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'curry powder'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can Coles Smart Buy Diced Tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can Coles Lentils, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can Coles Chickpeas, rinsed, drained'}]
steps: Heat the oil in medium heavy-based saucepan over high heat. Add the beef and cook, stirring, for 5 mins or until browned all over., Add the onion, carrot, garlic and curry powder. Cook, stirring, for 3 mins or until onion softens., Add the tomato, lentils, chickpeas and 1 1/2 cups (375ml) water. Season. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 1 1/4 hours. Uncover and cook for a further 15 mins or until sauce thickens slightly and beef is tender. Serve.

name: Zucchini and ham 'rainbow' slice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'zucchini, grated'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'tub Bulla Creme Fraiche, plus extra to serve'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'grated pizza cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', grated'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'leftover ham off the bone, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'shallots', 'name': ', chopped'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C (160C fan-forced). Grease a 20 x 30 x 4 cm baking dish or tin. Line the base , extending over two sides with non-stick baking paper., Squeeze the excess moisture from the zucchini. Whisk the eggs and crème fraiche in large bowl. Add flour, half the cheese, carrot and zucchini, mix well. Stir through the ham and shallots, season with salt and pepper., Pour mixture into prepared dish. Scatter over remaining cheese. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until golden and just set. Serve warm or cold cut into pieces. Serve with extra Creme Fraiche if you like.

name: No-cook tarragon, mint and chicken salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'RSPCA Approved Hot Roast Chicken, skin and bones removed, meat shredded'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'sticks, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Coles Australian Baby Rocket'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(35g) slivered almonds, toasted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dill sprigs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tarragon leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'zest, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Bakery Rustic Baguette*, to serve'}]
steps: To make the herbed mayonnaise dressing, combine mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, mustard, mint, tarragon and dill in a bowl. Add 2 tablespoons hot water and stir to combine. Season., Combine the chicken, celery, rocket, almond, spring onion, mint, dill and tarragon in a large bowl. Divide evenly among serving plates. Drizzle with dressing and sprinkle with lemon zest. Serve with the bread.

name: Risoni, lamb and fetta salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried risoni pasta'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'zucchini, peeled into 3mm-thick ribbons'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried oregano leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'light flavour extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'leftover roast lamb, shredded (see related recipe)'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) leftover pan juices (see related recipe)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'white balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'drained baby capers'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', rind finely grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh mint, leaves picked'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'firmly packed fresh dill sprigs'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'feta, crumbled'}]
steps: Cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling salted water, following packet directions until al dente. Drain. Refresh under cold running water. Drain well. Transfer to a large bowl., Meanwhile, preheat a barbecue or chargrill on medium-high. Combine zucchini, oregano and 2 teaspoons oil in a bowl. Season. Cook, gently tossing, for 3 minutes or until lightly charred., Place lamb and pan juices in a heatproof bowl. Microwave on High for 1-2 minutes or until warmed through., To make the dressing, combine the vinegar, capers, lemon rind, 2 tablespoons lemon juice and the remaining oil in a bowl. Season., Coarsely chop half the herbs. Add all herbs, lamb mixture, onion, zucchini, half the dressing and half the fetta to the pasta. Toss to combine. Transfer to a serving bowl. Sprinkle with remaining fetta and drizzle with the remaining dressing.

name: Chicken meatball saganaki with risoni
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken mince'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh oregano leaves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onion (shallot), finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '700', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'btl passata'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '130', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/4 cups) coarsely grated fresh mozzarella'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'feta, coarsely crumbled'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried risoni pasta'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C. Combine chicken, fresh oregano, spring onion, garlic and lemon rind in a bowl (do not over-mix). Season. Use wet hands to roll tablespoonfuls of mixture into balls. Transfer to a plate lined with baking paper., Heat oil in a non-stick, ovenproof frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook meatballs, turning, for 4 minutes until golden brown. Stir in passata and sugar. Top with combined cheese. Sprinkle with dried oregano and season with pepper. Bake for 10 minutes or until meatballs are cooked., Meanwhile, cook the pasta in a saucepan of salted boiling water until al dente. Drain, Serve meatballs with pasta, rocket and lemon wedges.

name: Coconut tapioca with lychee and pineapple
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': "(100g) McKenzie's Seed Tapioca (Sago)"}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'vanilla', 'name': 'bean, split lengthways, seeds scraped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(90g) palm sugar, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '560', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can Coles Brand Pitted Lychees in Syrup, drained'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'pineapple', 'name': ', peeled, quartered, sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Small', 'name': 'mint leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Combine the tapioca, coconut milk, vanilla bean and seeds and 1 cup (250ml) water in a large saucepan. Set aside for 30 mins to soak. Place over medium heat and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 mins or until tapioca is transparent. Remove from heat. Add the sugar and salt and stir to combine., Set aside for 10 mins to cool. Remove and discard the vanilla bean. Transfer to a bowl and place in the fridge for 1 hour to cool completely., Spoon tapioca among serving bowls. Top with lychee, pineapple and mint.

name: Bacon and pumpkin pesto pasta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'kent pumpkin, deseeded, peeled, cut into 2.5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'penne rigate'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'short-cut bacon, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) basil pesto (see notes)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Shaved', 'name': 'parmesan, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': ', to season'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with non-stick baking paper. Place the pumpkin, in a single layer, on the prepared tray. Spray with olive oil spray and season with salt and pepper. Bake in oven for 25 minutes or until tender., Meanwhile, cook the pasta in a large saucepan of salted boiling water following packet directions or until al dente. Drain and return to the pan., Cook the bacon in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat, stirring, for 5 minutes or until crisp and golden., Add the pesto to the pasta and toss until coated. Add the pumpkin and bacon and toss until well combined. Divide among serving bowls and sprinkle with parmesan. Serve immediately.

name: Thyme roasted chicken and cauliflower
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '800g) chicken marylands'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'kipfler', 'name': 'potatoes, washed, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '600g) cauliflower, cut into florets'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onions, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'grated horseradish'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'thyme'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'green beans, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Heat oil1 tbsp olive oil in a roasting pan over medium heat. Add chicken4 (about 800g) chicken marylands; cook for 2-3 minutes each side or until golden brown. Transfer to a bowl., Add the potatoes8 kipfler potatoes, washed, halved lengthways to the pan and cook, turning occasionally, for 1-2 minutes or until golden. Transfer to bowl. Add the cauliflower1/2 (about 600g) cauliflower, cut into florets and onion2 red onions, cut into wedges and cook, turning occasionally, for 1 minute or until golden. Return chicken and potatoes to the pan., Combine wine1/2 cup (125ml) dry white wine, stock1/2 cup (125ml) chicken stock, horseradish1 tbsp grated horseradish and mustard1 tbsp Dijon mustard in a jug and pour over chicken. Sprinkle with thyme1/4 bunch thyme sprigs and season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Roast in oven for 25-30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Remove from oven. Serve with steamed green beansSteamed green beans, to serve, if desired.

name: Cheat’s beef stroganoff skewers
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby red potatoes, cut into 5mm slices'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'button mushrooms, halved'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sachet beef stroganoff recipe base'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sour cream'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed salad leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh chives'}]
steps: Combine potato, mushroom and 1 tablespoon oil in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Heat a chargrill pan on high heat. Cook mushrooms and potato for 4 minutes each side or until tender. Cool 5 minutes., Meanwhile, combine recipe base, beef and 1 tablespoon remaining oil in a medium bowl. Weave beef strips onto 16 small skewers., Heat same chargrill pan on high heat. Cook skewers, in batches, for 2 to 3 minutes, turning, until browned and cooked as desired., Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a small saucepan on medium-high heat. Cook onion, stirring, for 5 minutes or until just starting to brown. Add garlic and paprika. Cook, stirring, for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add sour cream. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until smooth and heated through., Combine potato, mushroom and salad leaves on a large serving platter. Top with skewers and chives. Serve with warm dip.

name: Spanish-style stuffed baked potatoes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'small', 'name': '(125g each) red-skinned potatoes'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'mild paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh rosemary'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pimento-stuffed green olives, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'light sour cream'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Zest', 'name': 'of 1 lemon'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, trimmed, steamed, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan-forced. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place potatoes on prepared tray. Spray with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 1 hour or until tender., Meanwhile, heat oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and capsicum. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until soft. Add garlic, paprika and rosemary. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add tomato. Cook for 5 minutes or until juice is released and tomato softens. Stir in olive., Combine sour cream, 3/4 of the lemon rind and 3/4 of the parsley in a bowl. Cut a deep cross in the top of each potato. Using a clean tea towel, hold potato and squeeze base gently to open up. Fill potato with tomato mixture. Top with sour cream mixture. Sprinkle with remaining rind and parsley. Serve with beans.

name: Sweet potato and lentil patties with tzatziki
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'peeled sweet potato, cut into 2cm cubes'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can brown lentils, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) (30g) fresh wholegrain gluten free breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '85', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) tzatziki, to serve'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket leaves'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'grape tomatoes, halved'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan forced. Line a large baking tray with baking paper. Place sweet potato500g peeled sweet potato, cut into 2cm cubes on prepared tray. Lightly spray with olive oil and sprinkle with ground cumin1/2 tsp ground cumin and coriander1/2 tsp ground coriander. Roast for 25-30 minutes or until tender. Place in a bowl. Coarsely mash. Cool., Add lentils400g can brown lentils, rinsed, drained, fresh coriander2 tbsp chopped fresh coriander leaves and breadcrumbs30g (1/2 cup) (30g) fresh wholegrain gluten free breadcrumbs to the sweet potato mixture. Stir until well combined. Season. Shape mixture into eight 2cm-thick patties., Heat the oil2 tsp extra virgin olive oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook patties, in batches, for 2-3 minutes each side or until golden. Divide tzatzki85g (1/3 cup) tzatziki, to serve among plates. Top with rocket100g baby rocket leaves, tomato200g grape tomatoes, halved and patties.

name: Butter chicken
ingredient: [{'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Greek-style natural yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': '-piece fresh ginger, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sweet paprika'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'garam masala'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chilli powder'}, {'quantity': '1.2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'chicken thigh fillets, quartered'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onion, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cardamom', 'name': 'pods, bruised (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tomatoes', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cashew nut spread'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can tomato puree'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) pouring cream'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) fresh lemon juice'}]
steps: Combine yoghurt, ginger, lime juice, garlic, paprika, 2 teaspoons of garam masala and 1 teaspoon of chilli powder in a bowl. Stir in the chicken. Cover and place in fridge for 2 hours to marinate., Heat a frying pan over medium-high heat. Spray with oil. Cook the chicken, in batches, for 3-5 minutes each side or until browned. Transfer to a plate., Heat oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Cook onion, stirring, for 2-3 minutes or until soft. Add cardamom, cumin, nutmeg, remaining chilli powder and remaining garam masala. Cook, stirring, for 1-2 minutes or until aromatic. Stir in tomato, cashew nut spread and tomato puree. Simmer for 2-3 minutes. Stir in the cream and butter. Add the chicken and reduce heat to low. Cook for 10 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Stir in the lemon juice.

name: Chicken cacciatore
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'RSPCA Approved Chicken Drumsticks, trimmed of excess fat, skin on'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'chicken', 'name': 'thighs, trimmed of excess fat, skin on'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'sticks, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sliced pancetta, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'button mushrooms, sliced'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': 'Mutti Polpa Finely Chopped Tomatoes 400g'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles Balsamic Vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh rosemary'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bay', 'name': 'leaf'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pitted Kalamata olives'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chopped', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley, to garnish'}]
steps: Heat the oil3 tbsp olive oil in a large casserole dish over medium-high heat. Add the chicken drumsticks6 Chicken Drumsticks, trimmed of excess fat, skin on and chicken thighs6 chicken thighs, trimmed of excess fat, skin on and cook until browned all over. Transfer to a plate and set aside. Add the onion1 large onion, chopped, celery2 celery sticks, chopped, carrot2 carrots, peeled, chopped and pancetta150g sliced pancetta, chopped to the pan and cook over low heat for 5 minutes until the onion softens. Add the garlic3 garlic cloves, crushed and mushrooms125g button mushrooms, sliced and cook for a further minute., Return chicken pieces to the pan, add the wine100ml dry white wine and allow to simmer 1-2 minutes., Add the tomatoes2 x Polpa Finely Chopped Tomatoes 400g, sugar1/2 tsp brown sugar, vinegar1 tbsp Balsamic Vinegar, rosemary1 tbsp chopped fresh rosemary, bay leaf1 bay leaf and stock150ml Chicken stock. Bring to the boil, then reduce heat to low and cook, covered, for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the olives1 cup pitted Kalamata olives and cook for a further 10 minutes., Transfer chicken to a platter, then reduce the sauce over high heat for 5-6 minutes. After cooking the sauce for 5-6 minutes, pour the sauce over the chicken on the platter. Serve garnished with the parsleyChopped flat-leaf parsley, to garnish.

name: Teriyaki tofu with warm udon and seaweed salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'firm tofu, cut crossways into 2cm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) teriyaki marinade'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'rice wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ginger, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '440', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt wok-ready udon noodles'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'carrots, cut into matchsticks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'Lebanese cucumbers, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'nori', 'name': 'sheet, finely shredded'}]
steps: Line a tray with paper towel. Place tofu, in a single layer, on paper towel. Top with more paper towel and press down gently to squeeze out excess moisture., Whisk the teriyaki marinade, honey, vinegar, ginger and half the oil in a bowl. Reserve half the mixture in a jug., Heat the remaining oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook the tofu, brushing occasionally with remaining teriyaki mixture, for 2-3 mins each side or until golden., Meanwhile, soak the noodles following packet directions. Drain. Place noodles, carrot, cucumber, spring onion, two-thirds of the nori and the reserved marinade in a bowl. Gently toss to combine., Divide the noodle salad among serving bowls. Top with the tofu and remaining nori.

name: Mediterranean chicken
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '150g each) chicken thigh cutlets, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'brown onion, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'jar arrabbiata pasta sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pitted kalamata olives'}]
steps: Heat half the oil in a large, deep frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook chicken, turning, for 4 to 5 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a plate., Heat remaining oil in pan. Cook onion and capsicum, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until onion has softened. Return chicken to pan. Add pasta sauce and olives. Season with salt and pepper. Cover. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, turning chicken occasionally, for 30 to 35 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

name: Char kway teow
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '450g pkt thick fresh rice noodles'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Peanut', 'name': 'oil, to coat'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'birdseye chillies, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'single chicken breast fillets, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'medium prawns, peeled leaving tails intact, deveined'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'shallots, ends trimmed, cut into 4cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dark soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'light soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'bean sprouts'}]
steps: Cook the noodles following packet directions. Drain and transfer to a heatproof bowl. Add a little oil and gently toss to coat the noodles., Place the chilli in a mortar and gently pound with a pestle until finely crushed., Heat the oil in a wok over high heat until just smoking. Add the chilli and garlic and stir-fry for 10 seconds or until aromatic. Add the chicken and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until just cooked through. Add the prawns and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until prawns curl and change colour., Add the noodles, shallot, dark soy sauce and light soy sauce and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until combined. Transfer the noodle mixture to a heatproof bowl. Add the egg to the wok and cook for 30 seconds. Return the noodle mixture to the wok and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes or until egg is just set. Remove from heat. Add bean sprouts and combine. Serve.

name: Smoked paprika chicken with warm barley salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'L', 'name': '(6 cups) cold water'}, {'quantity': '220', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) pearl barley (see note)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sweet smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '250g each) single chicken breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, topped, cut into 3cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red capsicum, halved, deseeded, cut into 1cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'shallots', 'name': ', ends trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '90', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) low-fat natural yoghurt'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Place the water and pearl barley in a large saucepan over high heat and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30-35 minutes or until tender. Rinse under cold running water. Drain., Meanwhile, combine the paprika and cayenne pepper in a large bowl. Add the chicken and toss to lightly coat. Preheat a chargrill on medium-high. Add the chicken and cook for 5 minutes each side or until just cooked through., Cook the beans in a saucepan of lightly salted boiling water for 2 minutes or until bright green and tender crisp. Rinse under cold running water. Drain., Whisk together the lime juice and oil in a small bowl. Combine the pearl barley, beans, lime juice mixture, capsicum, shallot and 1/2 cup of coriander in a large bowl. Season with pepper., Thinly slice the chicken across the grain. Divide the salad among serving plates. Sprinkle with the remaining coriander and top with the chicken. Serve with yoghurt and lime wedges.

name: Snow pea, asparagus and tofu stir fry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'asparagus, trimmed and cut into 5cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'zucchini, sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow peas, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'baby bok choy, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet firm tofu, drained and sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'oyster sauce'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'steamed', 'name': 'rice, to serve'}]
steps: Heat the oil in a wok or a large non stick frying pan over high heat. Add the asparagus and zucchini and cook for 5 minutes until tender. Add the garlic, ginger, snow peas and bok choy and cook for a further 2 minutes or until bok choy is wilted. Stir through the tofu and oyster sauce and cook for another minute or until the tofu is warmed through. Serve with steamed rice.

name: Chicken, corn and noodle soup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece fresh ginger, peeled, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'carrot, diced'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sliced chicken breast'}, {'quantity': '420', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can corn kernels, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'litre', 'name': 'Massel chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'boiling water'}, {'quantity': '85', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet instant noodles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sambal', 'name': 'oelek, to serve'}]
steps: Heat vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add garlic, ginger, carrot and 1/2 the onion. Cook for 5 minutes or until softened. Add chicken. Cook for 2 minutes or until just starting to brown., Add corn, stock, soy sauce and boiling water. Bring to the boil. Add noodles. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 5 minutes or until noodles are tender and chicken is cooked through. Using a slotted spoon, remove any foam from surface of soup., Ladle soup into bowls. Drizzle with sesame oil and top with remaining green onion and coriander. Serve with sambal oelek.

name: Roasted beetroot & silver beet
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'baby beetroot, ends trimmed, washed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'silverbeet, washed, white stems removed, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '35', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'reduced-fat feta, crumbled'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C. Wrap each beetroot bulb in foil and place on a baking tray. Bake in oven for 25 minutes or until tender. Remove foil. Wearing rubber gloves to avoid staining your hands, peel the bulbs and cut into wedges., Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the silver beet and garlic and cook, tossing, for 30 seconds or until the silver beet just wilts. Remove from heat. Add the lemon juice and beetroot and toss until just combined. Taste and season with salt and pepper., Place the silver beet mixture in a large serving bowl and sprinkle with feta. Serve with the Middle Eastern pastries.

name: Key lime pie with strawberries
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': "pkt Arnott's Granita biscuits"}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) desiccated coconut'}, {'quantity': '395', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can Nestle Sweetened Condensed Milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated lime rind'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', separated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'punnets', 'name': 'strawberries, washed, hulled, quartered'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'syrup, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thickened', 'name': 'cream, whipped, to serve'}]
steps: Process biscuits in a food processor until finely crushed. Add butter and coconut and process until combined. Press the mixture over the base and side of a 4cm-deep, 24cm (base measurement) fluted tart tin, with removable base. Place in fridge for 30 minutes to chill., Preheat oven to 180C. Whisk the condensed milk, lime rind, lime juice and egg yolks in a bowl until well combined., Use an electric beater to whisk egg whites in a clean, dry bowl until soft peaks form. Fold half the egg white mixture into the lime mixture until just combined. Repeat with the remaining egg white mixture. Pour mixture into the prepared tin. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until just set. Set aside for 30 minutes to cool. Place in the fridge for 3 hours to chill., Place the pie on a serving plate. Combine strawberry and half the lime syrup (see right) in a bowl. Top the pie with the strawberry. Cut into wedges and drizzle with the remaining lime syrup. Serve with cream., Make lime syrup: Remove rind and pith from limes. Discard pith. Cut rind into thin strips. Juice the lime. Stir lime rind, water and caster sugar in a pan over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until mixture thickens slightly. Stir in lime juice. Transfer to a heatproof container. Place in fridge for 30 minutes to chill.

name: Pork cutlets with nectarines
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'hot English mustard'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '200g pork cutlets, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'nectarine', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'yellow mustard seeds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salad', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'white rice, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 180C., Combine mustard and 1 tablespoon of the honey in a small bowl. Brush pork cutlets with the marinade and set aside., Bring a pan of salted water to the boil, add the nectarines and cook for 20-30 seconds, depending on the ripeness. Remove and refresh in iced water. Remove the skin and stones from the nectarines, then discard. Roughly chop the flesh., Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a saucepan over low heat, add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until soft. Add nectarine flesh, vinegar, sugar, mustard seeds and remaining honey, then season. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until thickened. Stir in coriander and set aside., Add remaining tablespoon of olive oil to a large frypan or brush over a barbecue. Cook pork over medium heat for 2-3 minutes each side to brown, then transfer to the oven for a further 5 minutes or until cooked through., Serve cutlets with the nectarine chutney, salad leaves and steamed rice.

name: Jacket potatoes with Texan-style beef
ingredient: [{'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brushed potatoes, scrubbed'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'quantity', 'name': 'Texan-Style Pulled Beef (below)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g can black beans, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60g) coarsely grated cheddar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'vine', 'name': '-ripened tomato, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped chives'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mint', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}]
steps: To make the Texan-style pulled beef, preheat oven to 150°C. Heat oil in a frying pan over high heat. Season beef. Cook beef in pan for 5 mins each side or until golden. Transfer to a roasting pan., Arrange onion around the beef in the pan. Whisk stock, vinegar, garlic, maple syrup, Worcestershire sauce, tomato sauce, mustard, paprika, onion salt, garlic powder, oregano and cumin in a jug. Pour evenly over beef, turning to coat., Cover pan tightly with foil. Roast for 3 hours or until beef is very tender and falls apart when tested with a fork. Increase oven to 180°C. Uncover and roast for a further 30 mins or until beef is golden brown and sauce thickens slightly. Set aside for 15 mins to rest., Use 2 forks to coarsely shred beef. Stir to combine with pan juices. Season., To make the jacket potatoes, preheat oven to 180°C. Prick potatoes all over with a fork. Wrap each potato in foil and place on a baking tray. Bake for 1 hour or until tender. Unwrap potatoes and bake for a further 10 mins or until light golden. Set aside to cool slightly., Meanwhile, combine beef and beans in a small saucepan over low heat. Cook for 5 mins or until heated through., Use a sharp knife to cut a cross in top of each potato and gently squeeze base to open. Top with beef mixture and sprinkle with cheddar. Bake for 5 mins or until cheddar melts., Combine tomato and onion in a bowl. Divide potatoes among serving plates. Top with tomato mixture, chive and mint.

name: Casarecce with lightly smoked eggplant, basilico sauce and green olives
ingredient: [{'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Barilla Casarecce pasta'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'eggplants'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'jar', 'name': 'Barilla Basilico pasta sauce'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'Basil', 'name': 'leaves, chopped'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green olives, sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Rock', 'name': 'salt, for pasta water'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sea', 'name': 'salt, to taste'}]
