steps: With a toothpick, pierce the eggplant skin., Roast the whole eggplant directly on a gas flame for a smoked flavour, about 2 minutes or until charred., Halve the eggplants, season flesh with salt and a drizzle of olive oil and cook skin up in the oven at 180°C for 15 minutes until soft., Remove from the oven and peel off the skin, then chop roughly., Bring plenty of water to the boil in a large saucepan. Once boiling, add rock salt. We recommend 7 grams per litre of water., Drop the Casarecce into the water and stir. Cook as per the instructions on the pack., Meanwhile in a fry pan gently cook the garlic until golden in colour; add the eggplant and Basilico sauce and bring to a simmer., Drain the pasta 1 minute before the suggested time, saving one ladle of cooking water. Toss the pasta and cooking water into the frypan with the sauce and allow the pasta to finish cooking in the sauce. Add the olives and basil., Serve with a drizzle of Extra Virgin Olive oil.

name: Orange rosemary chicken
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'whole', 'name': 'chicken, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'hot water'}]
steps: Make glaze: Stir orange juice, orange marmalade, maple syrup, Dijon mustard and chopped fresh rosemary in a saucepan over low heat for 2 minutes or until marmalade dissolves. Increase heat to medium-high. Simmer for 15 minutes or until the glaze thickens., Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large frying pan. Cook 1 whole chicken, quartered, for 2-3 minutes each side or until brown., Place 2 cups hot water and 2 tablespoons glaze in a roasting pan. Place chicken pieces, skin-side down, in the mixture. Cover with foil. Bake at 180°C, turning once, for 45 minutes or until just cooked., Preheat barbecue grill or chargrill on medium. Brush chicken with glaze. Cook for 2-3 minutes each side or until caramelised and slightly charred.

name: Beef stroganoff recipe
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '700', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef rump steak, trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onion, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sweet paprika'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'button mushrooms, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'beef stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles Tomato Paste'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'creme fraiche (see note)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cooked', 'name': 'fettuccine, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chopped', 'name': 'fresh flat-leaf parsley, to serve'}]
steps: Place flour2 tbsp plain flour and beef700g beef rump steak, trimmed, thinly sliced in a snap-lock bag. Season with salt and pepper. Shake to coat., Place 20g of butter and 2 teaspoons of oil in a large frying pan. Cook over high heat until bubbling. Add half the beef. Cook, stirring, for 3 to 5 minutes or until browned. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining butter, 2 teaspoons of oil and beef., Reduce heat to medium. Heat remaining oil in pan. Add onion1 large brown onion, halved, thinly sliced and mushroom400g button mushrooms, sliced. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until soft. Add garlic2 garlic cloves, finely chopped and paprika1/2 tsp sweet paprika. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add wine1/2 cup dry white wine, stock3/4 cup beef stock, tomato paste2 tbsp Tomato Paste, mustard3 tsp dijon mustard and beef to pan. Stir to combine. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 5 minutes or until sauce has thickened slightly., Stir in creme fraiche1/4 cup creme fraiche (see note). Serve stroganoff with pastaCooked fettuccine, to serve and parsleyChopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, to serve. Watch our step-by-step video below to see how to make our Beef stroganoff recipe.

name: Lemongrass & coconut chicken on egg noodles
ingredient: [{'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh thin egg noodles'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sunflower or canola oil'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'free-range chicken thigh fillets (about 500g total), quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'lemongrass', 'name': 'stems (pale part only), thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chillies, seeds removed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'broccolini, stems separated, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'silken tofu, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Coriander', 'name': 'sprigs, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges (optional), to serve'}]
steps: Cook the egg noodles according to the packet directions and drain., Meanwhile, heat oil in a large, deep frypan over high heat and cook chicken for 2-3 minutes on each side, until golden. Reduce heat to medium, add onion, lemongrass and chilli, and cook, stirring, for 2-3 minutes or until just soft. Add the fish sauce and coconut milk, and bring to a simmer. Cover and simmer over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until liquid has thickened. Stir in broccolini and tofu, then cover and cook for 2 minutes or until broccolini is tender and tofu is warmed through., Serve in bowls over noodles, with coriander and lime wedges, if desired.

name: Oven-baked chicken risotto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'arborio rice'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'Massel salt reduced chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, cut into 2cm cubes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(', 'name': '500g) chicken breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen peas'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'rocket, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Shaved', 'name': 'parmesan cheese, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large flameproof, ovenproof dish over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until softened. Add rice. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute., Add stock and 1 cup cold water. Bring to the boil. Add pumpkin. Cover. Transfer to oven. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, stirring halfway during cooking, or until pumpkin is tender and liquid absorbed., Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a frying pan. Cook chicken for 5 minutes each side or until browned and cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Cover. Set aside for 5 minutes. Thinly slice., Add peas to rice mixture. Cover. Set aside for 2 minutes or until peas are heated through.

name: Meat pies with homemade ketchup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'tomatoes, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dark brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles Olive Oil'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles Plain Flour'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Butcher beef chuck steak, cut into 1cm cubes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onions, cut into small dice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, cut into small dice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'stalk, cut into small dice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles Soy Sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles Worcestershire Sauce'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'beef stock'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'frozen puff pastry'}]
steps: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium heavy based saucepan over high heat. Coat meat in flour and brown well in pan., Reduce heat to medium, add 1/2 of the onions and garlic and cook for 4 minutes. Add carrot and celery and cook a further 4 minutes. Add coriander, soy and Worcestershire sauce and cook until almost dry., Add stock and cook for 1 hour or until meat is tender and sauce is thick. Allow to cool. Thaw pastry., To make Ketchup: Puree tomatoes in blender. Heat remaining olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat and cook onion for 5-7 minutes, until soft. Add the remaining ingredients and cook for 1 hour, stirring occasionally until thick. Season to taste. Allow to cool., To assemble pie: Preheat oven to 200C. Place pastry sheets on floured surface and roll out to 5mm. Cut 2 of the sheets into 8 squares in total, for the bases. Cut the third sheet into 8 equal smaller squares for the lids. Set tops aside in fridge., Place each base into lightly greased regular muffin pan, prick a couple of times with a fork and fill with a small piece of foil. Bake for 8-10 minutes until just golden. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Fill each base with filling and top with a lid. Press down on sides to seal., Bake for 10 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown. Remove from oven and cool a few minutes. Serve with ketchup on the side.

name: Creamy one-pan garlic butter chicken
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil, plus extra, to drizzle'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': None, 'name': '-6 chicken thigh cutlets, skin on'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'bought garlic butter, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh thyme leaves, plus extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) cooking cream'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) gluten-free Massel Stock Chicken Style'}, {'quantity': '425', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can no-added-salt cannellini beans, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'garlic bulbs'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, trimmed, steamed'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan forced. Heat oil1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, plus extra, to drizzle in an ovenproof frying pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken4-6 chicken thigh cutlets, skin on. Cook for 3-4 minutes each side or until golden. Transfer to a plate. Reduce heat to medium. Add garlic butter40g bought garlic butter, coarsely chopped, onion1 brown onion, chopped and thyme1 tbsp fresh thyme leaves, plus extra, to serve to pan. Cook, stirring, for 4 minutes or until onion softens. Stir in cream250ml (1 cup) cooking cream, stock125ml (1/2 cup) gluten-free Stock Chicken Style and cannellini beans425g can no-added-salt cannellini beans, rinsed, drained. Season. Remove from heat., Trim the tops from garlic bulbs2 small garlic bulbs to expose the cloves. Drizzle over extra oil. Add to pan, cut-side up. Return the chicken to pan, skin-side up. Roast for 30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and sauce has thickened slightly., Scatter extra thyme over the garlic chicken. Season and serve with the steamed green beans300g green beans, trimmed, steamed.

name: Turkey gazpacho salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(200g) whole-egg mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'creme fraiche or sour cream'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sundried tomato pesto'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'roasted', 'name': 'capsicums, sliced (or 190g jar roasted capsicum strips, drained)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'telegraph', 'name': 'cucumber, peeled, seeds removed, chopped'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'croutons'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'leftover cooked turkey, shredded'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'kalamata olives'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped flat-leaf parsley leaves'}]
steps: Combine the mayonnaise, creme fraiche or sour cream, pesto, balsamic, garlic, spring onion and basil in a large bowl., Add half each of the chopped capsicum, cucumber, tomato and croutons. Season to taste with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper, then stir through the shredded turkey., Pile the salad into a serving dish, top with the remaining capsicum, cucumber, tomato and croutons, then garnish with olives and parsley.

name: Lamb sausage and pumpkin pilaf
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'leek', 'name': ', halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'basmati rice, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, peeled, deseeded, cut into 2.5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, cut into 4cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'slivered almonds'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'thick lamb sausages'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander leaves, chopped'}]
steps: Bring stock2 cups chicken stock and 1/2 cup cold water to the boil in a small saucepan over high heat., Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add leek1 leek, halved, thinly sliced and garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed. Cook, stirring often, for 6 to 7 minutes or until leek is soft. Increase heat to high and add rice1 1/2 cups basmati rice, rinsed. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes., Add stock mixture and pumpkin500g butternut pumpkin, peeled, deseeded, cut into 2.5cm pieces to rice mixture. Bring to a gentle boil, stirring. Reduce heat to low. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat. Place beans200g green beans, cut into 4cm lengths over rice. Cover and set aside for 5 minutes., Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add almonds1/3 cup slivered almonds and cook, stirring, for 4 to 5 minutes or until light golden. Transfer to a plate. Add sausages500g thick lamb sausages and cook, turning occasionally, for 15 to 20 minutes or until cooked through. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel. Thickly slice. Add sausage, almonds and coriander2/3 cup coriander leaves, chopped to rice. Toss gently to combine. Serve.

name: Pad Thai
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dried shrimp (see top tips)'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried rice stick noodles'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'grated palm sugar'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lime juice or lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'green king prawns, peeled with tails intact, cleaned'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced, plus extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs, lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Chinese pickled radish,(see top tips) finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped roasted peanuts, plus extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'bean sprouts, plus extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Dried', 'name': 'chilli flakes, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Coriander', 'name': 'sprigs, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'cheeks, to serve'}]
steps: Place dried shrimp in a small, heatproof bowl. Cover with boiling water and soak for 30 minutes. Drain well., Meanwhile, place noodles in a separate heatproof bowl. Cover with boiling water and soak for 8 minutes or until soft. Drain. 3 Place sugar, lime juice, fish sauce and 1 tablespoon water in a bowl and stir until sugar dissolves. Set aside. Finely chop soaked shrimp and set aside., Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a wok over high heat. Add prawns and stir-fry for 3 minutes or until just cooked. Transfer to a plate., Add remaining 60ml (1/4 cup) oil to wok and heat over medium heat. Add garlic and stir-fry for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add spring onions and eggs, and stir-fry for 1 minute or until eggs start to set. Add noodles, stir to break up eggs, then add fish sauce mixture. Stir-fry for 3 minutes or until most of the liquid is absorbed., Return prawns to wok with soaked shrimp, pickled radish, peanuts and bean sprouts, and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until mixture is quite dry and bean sprouts are slightly wilted. Adjust taste of noodles with more palm sugar, lime juice and fish sauce, if desired (it should be slightly sweet, salty and sour)., Divide noodles between bowls, then scatter with extra peanuts, bean sprouts, chilli flakes and coriander sprigs. Serve with lime cheeks.

name: Super quick pumpkin soup with floating cheese toastie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, halved'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'thyme'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'pumpkin, peeled cut into 5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'Massel vegetable liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'wholegrain bread'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cheddar, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped chives'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Greek', 'name': '-style yoghurt, to serve'}]
steps: Add oil, onion, garlic and thyme to inner pot of Philips All In One Cooker. Press saute/sear high temp button. Set cooking time for 4 minutes and press start (do not close the lid). Stir occasionally. Stir in the pumpkin and stock. Close lid and turn knob to seal. Press manual in pressure cooking for 10 minutes. Turn knob to vent. Once the steam has been released, open lid., Meanwhile, preheat grill to high. Place bread on an oven tray. Cook under grill for 1 minute or until toasted. Turn bread and cover with cheddar. Cook under grill for 1-2 minutes or until cheese has melted. Cut toasties in half., Discard thyme sprigs. Using a hand held blender, blend soup until smooth. Serve soup with cheese toastie halves, chives and a dollop of yoghurt.

name: Coconut rice recipe
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'jasmine rice, well-rinsed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cold water'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can coconut cream'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece ginger, peeled, sliced'}]
steps: Place rice3 cups jasmine rice, well-rinsed, water3 cups cold water, coconut cream400ml can coconut cream and ginger3cm piece ginger, peeled, sliced in a large saucepan over high heat. Bring to the boil, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, covered, for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stand, covered, for 10 minutes. Discard ginger. Serve.

name: Cumin lamb with tomato, cucumber and goats feta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'roma tomatoes, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'goats feta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumbers, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': 'kalamata', 'name': 'olives'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh continental parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'white wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried oregano leaves'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'lamb', 'name': 'leg steaks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'pieces', 'name': 'Lebanese bread'}]
steps: Place the tomato, goats feta, cucumber, onion, olives and parsley in a bowl. Whisk the vinegar, oregano and 2 tablespoons of the oil in a bowl. Add to the salad and toss to combine., Heat the remaining oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Sprinkle lamb with cumin. Season with salt and pepper. Cook for 3 minutes each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plateCover. with foil. Set aside for 5 minutes to rest., Thickly slice the lamb. Divide the salad and lamb among serving plates. Serve with the Lebanese bread.

name: Roast beef with cabernet and pepper glaze
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) cabernet sauvignon wine'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) beef stock (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'coarsely ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Maggie Beer cabernet paste (see note), coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red onions, peeled, each cut into 3 slices horizontally'}, {'quantity': '850', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '-piece trimmed beef fillet'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'flat mushrooms, stems trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley (optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives (optional)'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Combine the wine250ml (1 cup) cabernet sauvignon wine, consomme250ml (1 cup) beef stock and pepper1/4 tsp coarsely ground black pepper in a medium saucepan. Bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the mixture reduces to 125ml (1/2 cup) liquid. Add the cabernet paste50g Maggie Beer cabernet paste (see note), coarsely chopped. Stir until the paste melts and the glaze thickens., Meanwhile, brush a large roasting pan with a little of the oil80ml (1/3 cup) olive oil to lightly grease. Chop enough of the thyme2 bunches fresh thyme to make 2 tablespoons. Spread the remaining thyme sprigs over the base of the prepared pan. Top with the onion slices2 large red onions, peeled, each cut into 3 slices horizontally., Use unwaxed kitchen string to tie the beef850g-piece trimmed beef fillet at 4cm intervals. Heat 1 tablespoon of remaining oil in a large heavy-based frying pan over high heat. Add the beef and sprinkle with salt. Cook, turning occasionally, for 5 minutes or until browned. Place the beef on top of the onion. Brush the beef with a little of the glaze., Combine the chopped1 tbsp chopped fresh continental parsley (optional) thyme, garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed and remaining oil in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Arrange the mushrooms6 large flat mushrooms, stems trimmed, cup-side up, around the beef. Spoon the oil mixture over the mushrooms. Bake in oven, brushing the beef occasionally with the glaze, for 20-25 minutes for medium rare or until the beef is cooked to your liking and the vegetables are tender. Cover with foil. Set aside for 5 minutes to rest., Drizzle the remaining glaze over the beef. Top with parsley and chives1 tbsp chopped fresh chives (optional), if desired. Serve.

name: Balti lamb curry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'brown onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'balti curry paste'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'diced lamb'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chickpeas, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'pappadums'}]
steps: Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onion. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until onion has softened. Add curry paste. Cook, stirring for 1 minute or until fragrant., Add lamb. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until coated and lightly browned. Stir in tomato and 1/2 cup cold water. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, covered, for 1 hour or until lamb is almost tender. Stir in chickpeas. Cook, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until sauce is thickened and lamb tender., Meanwhile, cook pappadums following packet directions. Serve curry with pappadums.

name: Leek & blue cheese tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': '(25 x 25cm) frozen ready-rolled shortcrust pastry, just thawed'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'leeks', 'name': ', trimmed, washed, sliced'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'blue cheese, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'sprigs fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '300ml ctn thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}]
steps: Line a 2.5cm-deep, 11 x 34cm (base measurement) fluted tart tin, with removable base, with pastry, overlapping slightly. Trim excess. Use a fork to prick the base all over. Place on a baking tray in the fridge for 30 minutes to rest., Preheat oven to 200°C. Line the pastry case with non-stick baking paper and fill with pastry weights or rice. Bake in oven for 10 minutes. Remove the paper and pastry weights or rice and bake for a further 8-10 minutes or until golden. Reduce oven temperature to 180°C., Meanwhile, heat the butter in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-low heat until foaming. Add leek and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5-7 minutes or until soft. Set aside to cool slightly., Arrange the leek, blue cheese and thyme in the pastry case. Whisk the cream and eggs in a large jug. Season with salt and pepper. Pour the cream mixture into the pastry case. Bake in oven for 25-30 minutes or until just set in the centre. Set aside to cool slightly. Cut into slices to serve.

name: Couscous with zucchini, mint and pistachio
ingredient: [{'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'couscous'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil, plus 1/2 cup olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon zest'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'lime zest'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(', 'name': '1 cup) medium zucchini, cut into matchstick-size strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves, chopped, not packed'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shelled pistachios, toasted, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}]
steps: In a large heavy saucepan, bring 1 cup water to a boil over high heat. Stir in the couscous, 1 tablespoon of the oil, and 1 teaspoon of salt. Cover and cook for about 5 minutes, or until all the water is absorbed and the couscous is tender. Transfer to a large bowl and fluff with a fork. Cool to room temperature., In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon and lime zest and juices. Slowly whisk in the remaining 1/2 cup oil to blend and emulsify. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Set aside., Fold the zucchini, cranberries, mint, pistachios, spring onions, and vinaigrette into the couscous. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature.

name: Manu's slow-cooker crispy-topped French beef and beer stew
ingredient: [{'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'beef chuck or oyster blade steak, cut into 4cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'piece speck, cut into lardons'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', peeled, sliced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'parsnips', 'name': ', peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onions, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'L', 'name': 'Campbell’s Real Stock Salt Reduced Beef'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'beer'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley'}]
steps: Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add one-third of the beef and cook, turning, for 3-4 minutes or until browned. Transfer to the bowl of a 6L slow cooker. Repeat with the remaining oil and beef in 2 more batches., Add the speck to the pan. Cook, stirring often, for 3-4 minutes or until golden and crisp. Add the carrot, parsnip, onion, garlic and thyme. Cook, stirring often, for 5-10 minutes or until onion has softened. Season. Transfer to the slow cooker., Add the stock, beer and tomato paste to the pan. Bring to the boil, scraping the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon so it doesn’t catch and burn. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until the liquid has reduced by half. You’ll need about 500ml (2 cups). Pour into the slow cooker. Cover. Set the slow cooker on High and cook for 3 hours., Meanwhile, for the potato top, place the potato and half of the thyme in a large bowl. Mix until well combined. Season. (For a crispy and golden potato top, see note.), Stir the parsley into the slow cooker. Arrange the potato slices over the top, slightly overlapping. Cover and cook for a further 1 hour or until the potato is tender., Meanwhile, heat the oil in a small frying pan over medium heat. Add the crumbs and remaining thyme. Season well. Cook the crumbs, stirring, for 3-4 minutes or until golden and crisp. Set aside., Rest the stew, uncovered, for 10 minutes. Scatter over the crispy crumbs and serve.

name: Orange passionfruit custards
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'custard powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'reduced-fat milk'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'passionfruit', 'name': ', halved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely-grated orange rind'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Whisk custard powder and milk in a bowl until smooth. Add eggs, sugar, passionfruit pulp and orange rind. Whisk to combine. Divide mixture between four 3/4 cup-capacity ovenproof teacups or ramekins., Place dishes or ramekins in a deep baking dish. Pour boiling water into pan until halfway up sides of dishes or ramekins. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until custards are just set. Serve.

name: Prawn & iceberg baguette with lemon herb mayonnaise
ingredient: [{'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'small cooked peeled prawns'}, {'quantity': '85', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) good-quality whole-egg mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped continental parsley'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh dill'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '30cm) baguettes (French sticks)'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'iceberg', 'name': 'lettuce, leaves separated, washed, dried, shredded'}]
steps: Combine the prawns, mayonnaise, lemon juice, parsley and dill in a medium bowl. Taste and season with salt and pepper., Trim ends from baguettes and cut in half crossways. Cut them in half down the centre, but not all the way through. Fill with some shredded lettuce and top with prawn mixture. Serve immediately.

name: Thai chicken, chilli and lemongrass bites
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chillies'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'shredded cooked chicken (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'stick', 'name': 'lemongrass, trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece fresh ginger, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves, torn'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves, torn'}, {'quantity': '24', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'baby spinach leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Thinly slice 1 chilli. Remove and discard seeds and membrane from remaining chilli. Thinly slice. Combine chilli, chicken, lemongrass, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sugar and lime juice in a bowl. Cover, refrigerate for 2 hours., Add coriander and mint to chicken mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Toss gently to combine., Arrange spinach leaves on a platter. Spoon chicken mixture onto each spinach leaf. Serve sprinkled with coriander leaves.

name: Easy shepherd's pie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', finely diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'stalk, finely diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fresh rosemary leaves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lamb mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles White Plain Flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'beef stock'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cream delight potatoes, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}]
steps: Heat oil1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add onion1 brown onion, finely chopped, garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed, carrot1 carrot, finely diced and celery1 celery stalk, finely diced. Cook, stirring, for 10 minutes or until softened. Add rosemary1 tsp fresh rosemary leaves, finely chopped. Cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Increase heat to high. Add mince500g lamb mince. Cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up mince, for 6 to 8 minutes or until browned., Add flour2 tbsp White Plain Flour. Cook, stirring for 2 minutes. Add worcestershire sauce1 tbsp worcestershire sauce and paste2 tbsp tomato paste. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add stock2 cups beef stock. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 25 to 30 minutes or until thickened. Season with salt and pepper., Meanwhile, place potato800g cream delight potatoes, peeled, chopped in a large saucepan. Cover with cold water. Bring to the boil over high heat. Cook for 10 to 12 minutes or until tender. Drain. Return to pan over low heat. Add milk1/2 cup milk and 25g butter. Mash until smooth., Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Spoon mince mixture into an 8 cup-capacity baking dish. Top with mash, using a fork to spread out over mince mixture. Dot with remaining 25g butter. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden. Serve.

name: Easter egg hunt brownie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '200g blocks dark chocolate, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'firmly packed brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Cadbury mixed mini Easter eggs, unwrapped'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet mini speckled milk chocolate Easter eggs'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Darrell', 'name': 'Lea Mega Minty Moments balls, to decorate'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Wildberry', 'name': 'Skittles, to decorate'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mini', 'name': 'Starburst Chews lollies, to decorate'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Bunny', 'name': 'marshmallows, to decorate'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Milk', 'name': 'chocolate Easter coins, to decorate'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Assorted', 'name': 'sprinkles, to decorate'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Grease a 6cm-deep, 20cm square cake pan. Line base and sides with baking paper, extending paper 2cm above edge of pan on all sides., Place 125g butter and half the dark chocolate in a medium saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring, for 10 minutes or until melted and combined. Set aside for 10 minutes. Stir in sugar, eggs and vanilla until combined. Sift flour and cocoa over chocolate mixture. Stir to combine., Pour brownie mixture into prepared pan. Top with chocolate eggs, pressing into batter. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until just set. Set aside in pan to cool completely., Place remaining dark chocolate and remaining butter in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on MEDIUM (50%), stirring halfway, for 1 minute or until melted and smooth. Spread chocolate mixture over brownie. Decorate brownie with Minty Moments balls, Skittles, chews, marshmallows, coins (see note) and sprinkles. Cut into pieces. Serve.

name: Baked sour cream and passionfruit cheesecake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet Gingernut Biscuits'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'passionfruit pulp'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g packet cream cheese, softened'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sour cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla bean paste'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Brand free range eggs'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 160C (140C fan-forced). Line the base of a 22cm springform tin with a large square of non-stick baking paper and clip tin together with the excess paper overhanging the sides. Break up biscuits and place into a food processor. Process to crumbs then add butter and process until combined. Press mixture over the base and sides of the tin using a glass to press firmly. Chill until needed. Use butternut biscuits if you are not a fan of ginger., Strain passionfruit pulp through a sieve, pressing and scraping with a spoon to extract the juice. Reserve 1 tablespoon of the seeds., Process cream cheese, sugar, sour cream, vanilla and eggs until smooth. Add passionfruit juice and process until just combined. Pour into the biscuit shell. Sprinkle reserved seeds over and use a knife to swirl through the mixture., Bake for 50 mins, until just set (it will still wobble slightly in the centre). Turn off oven, open the door about 10cm and leave to cool. Refrigerate overnight.

name: Beef fajitas in lettuce cups
ingredient: [{'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Old El Paso Taco Spice Mix'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Beef Rump Steak, fat trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Greek-style yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'mixed red and yellow capsicums, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'trimmed', 'name': 'iceberg lettuce leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander sprigs'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'frozen corn cobs, to serve'}]
steps: Combine 2 tablespoons seasoning and 2 tablespoons lime juice in a dish. Add steak. Turn to coat. Combine yoghurt and remaining lime juice in a bowl., Heat half the oil on a chargrill over medium-high heat. Cook beef for 3-4 mins each side or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate. Cover and rest for 5 mins., Meanwhile, heat remaining oil and cook onion and capsicums on grill for 5-7 mins or until tender, sprinkling with remaining seasoning in the last few mins of cooking., Slice beef. Divide lettuce among plates. Top with onion, capsicum, beef, yoghurt mixture and coriander. Serve with corn.

name: Roast tomato crush on crostini
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g punnets cherry tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '340g pkt baguette (French breadstick), diagonally cut into 2cm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'white balsamic vinegar'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line 2 large baking trays with non-stick baking paper. Place the tomato, cut-side up, on the lined trays. Season with salt and pepper. Bake in oven for 45 minutes or until soft and light golden. Set aside for 20 minutes to cool slightly., Meanwhile, place the bread slices, in a single layer, on 2 baking trays and lightly spray with olive oil spray. Bake in oven for 8 minutes. Turn the bread slices and lightly spray with olive oil spray. Bake for a further 8 minutes or until crisp and light golden. Set aside to cool completely., Combine the tomato, garlic and vinegar in a large bowl. Spoon the mixture into serving bowls and serve with the crostini.

name: Candied walnut, avocado, apple and grape salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'walnuts'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'red seedless grapes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'avocados', 'name': ', halved, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'royal gala apples, thinly sliced'}]
steps: Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place the sugar and 1/3 cup water in a frying pan over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until sugar has dissolved. Increase heat to high. Bring to the boil. Boil, without stirring, for 5 minutes or until mixture turns light golden. Add the walnuts. Carefully shake pan to coat. Cook for a further 30 seconds or until mixture is dark golden. Pour onto prepared tray. Set aside for 30 minutes or until firm., Meanwhile, toss parsley and rocket together in a bowl. Halve ¹⁄³ of the grapes. Cut remaining grapes into small bunches. Arrange rocket mixture, avocado, apple and grapes on a serving platter., Make Coconut Dressing. Combine yoghurt, lemon juice and chives in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper., Roughly chop the walnuts. Drizzle salad with dressing. Sprinkle with walnuts. Serve.

name: Korean beef stir-fry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ginger, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'mirin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Australian beef round steak, trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'hokkien noodles'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'yellow', 'name': 'capsicum, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow peas, halved diagonally'}]
steps: Combine garlic, ginger, soy sauce, mirin, sesame oil and sugar in a glass bowl. Add beef and toss to combine. Set aside for 30 mins to marinate., Meanwhile, prepare noodles following packet directions. Drain and set aside., Heat 1 teaspoon peanut oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Stir-fry beef, reserving marinade, in batches, for 2 mins or until browned. Heat remaining oil in the wok and stir-fry combined capsicum and snow peas for 3 mins. Add beef, reserved marinade and noodles. Stir fry for 2 mins or until beef is cooked through.

name: Black forest 'viennetta' with cherry sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'L', 'name': 'tub vanilla ice-cream'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate, melted'}, {'quantity': '415', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can pitted black cherries in syrup, drained, syrup reserved'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'cherries, to decorate'}]
steps: Place the vanilla ice-cream tub in the fridge for about 30 minutes to soften slightly. Lightly grease a 7.5cm-deep, 11cm x 21cm (base measurement) loaf pan and line with plastic wrap., Place 5 sheets of baking paper on the benchtop. Trace around the base of the loaf pan on each sheet. Thinly spread chocolate inside each rectangle and set aside to set. Pat the drained cherries dry with paper towel and coarsely chop. Set aside., Break 1 chocolate rectangle into shards and place in an airtight container in the fridge. Divide the softened ice-cream into quarters in the tub. Transfer 1 of the ice-cream quarters to a chopping board and roughly cut into slices (it will be quite soft). Layer the ice-cream slices in the base of the prepared pan. Use the back of a spoon to gently smooth the surface. Sprinkle with a quarter of the pitted black cherries. Carefully place a chocolate rectangle on top. Repeat with the remaining ice-cream, pitted black cherries and chocolate, finishing with a layer of chocolate. Cover the pan with foil and place in the freezer overnight or until very firm., For the cherry sauce, place the jam, brandy and 185g (3/4 cup) reserved cherry syrup in a small saucepan. Stir over medium-low heat until the mixture is smooth. Increase the heat to medium and simmer for 5-10 minutes or until the sauce has thickened slightly. Set aside to cool completely., Invert the ice-cream loaf onto a serving plate. Remove the plastic wrap. Decorate with chocolate shards and fresh cherries. Drizzle with the cherry sauce and serve immediately.

name: Mexican chicken loaded sweet potatoes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'gold sweet potatoes'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles RSPCA Approved Australian Chicken Mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g jars Coles Mexican Sauce'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can red kidney beans, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander sprig'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Cook sweet potatoes4 medium gold sweet potatoes in a steamer over a saucepan of boiling water for 20 mins or until tender. Use a sharp knife to cut a slit lengthways in top of each sweet potato (don’t cut all the way through). Gently squeeze base of each sweet potato to open slightly. Place on lined tray. Bake for 15 mins or until golden., Meanwhile, heat a non-stick frying pan over high heat. Cook mince500g Australian Chicken Mince, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up any lumps, for 5 mins or until cooked through. Reserve 1/3 cup of the Mexican sauce2 x 250g jars Mexican Sauce. Add remaining Mexican sauce, kidney beans400g can red kidney beans, rinsed, drained and ⅓ cup (80ml) water to the mince. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 mins or until mixture thickens slightly., Fill sweet potatoes with mince mixture. Drizzle with reserved Mexican sauce and top with coriander1/3 cup coriander sprig.

name: Chickpea ratatouille
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eggplant', 'name': '(large), cut into pieces (3-4 cm)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'capsicums', 'name': ', cut into strips (1-2 cm)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': '(medium), cut into slices (1 cm)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', zest only, no white pith'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': None, 'name': '-4 sprigs fresh basil, stalks and leaves separated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion (large), cut into quarters'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'tomatoes, cut into pieces'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'canned chopped tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh green beans, trimmed and cut into halves, if preferred'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pitted Kalamata olives, drained'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'canned chickpeas, rinsed and drained (approx. 250 g after draining)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': ', to taste'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Ground', 'name': 'black pepper, to taste'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Extra', 'name': 'virgin olive oil, to drizzle'}]
steps: Heat a large frying pan (see Tips) over high heat and add 3 tablespoons of the olive oil. Add eggplant, capsicum and zucchini and cook for approx.15 minutes, stirring frequently, until golden and softened. Cover frying pan with a lid, reduce heat to low and cook for a further 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender. Turn off the heat but leave the vegetables covered, in frying pan. Meanwhile, continue with the recipe., Place lemon zest into mixing bowl and grate 40 sec/speed 8 or until finely grated. Place in a small bowl and set aside., Without cleaning mixing bowl, place garlic and basil stalks into mixing bowl and chop 6 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula., Add onion and chop 4 sec/speed 5., Add fresh and canned tomatoes and balsamic vinegar and cook 14 min/100C/speed 2., Insert simmering basket and weigh green beans into it, then cook 6-8 min/100C/speed 2 or until beans are cooked. Remove the simmering basket with aid of spatula and place the beans into a large serving dish. 8. Place cooked vegetables from the frying pan in the serving dish. Place the serving dish onto mixing bowl lid, then weigh olives and chickpeas into it. Add reserved lemon zest and ½ of the reserved basil leaves. Pour tomato mixture over the top and gently combine with the spatula. Season with salt and pepper, then top with remaining basil leaves and an extra drizzle of olive oil to serve.

name: Spring carbonara
ingredient: [{'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'linguine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'thin asparagus spears, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(120g) frozen baby peas'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'prosciutto slices'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'light thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Australian Free Range Egg yolks'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(50g) shaved parmesan'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Coles Australian Baby Spinach'}]
steps: Cook the pasta in a saucepan of boiling water following packet directions or until al dente, adding the asparagus and peas in the last 1 min of cooking. Drain well, reserving 1 cup (250ml) of the cooking liquid., Meanwhile, heat a large deep non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook prosciutto, in 2 batches, for 2 mins each side or until crisp. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel. Set aside to cool slightly. Coarsely chop., Add the cream, garlic and reserved cooking liquid to the frying pan and bring to the boil. Whisk in the egg yolks until cream mixture thickens. Add the parmesan and stir to combine., Add the pasta mixture to the cream mixture in the pan with the prosciutto and spinach. Toss to combine. Season.

name: Chargrilled eggplant and zucchini with beans and hazelnuts
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggplants', 'name': ', thinly sliced lengthways'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', thinly sliced lengthways'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green round beans, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '160', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2/3 cup) extra virgin olive oil, extra'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) dry-roasted hazelnuts, coarsely chopped'}]
steps: Preheat a barbecue grill or chargrill on medium. Spray the eggplant and zucchini with oil. Cook eggplant on grill, in batches, for 5 minutes each side or until tender and goldentransfer. to a plate. Cook the zucchini, in batches, for 2-3 minutes each side or until tender and goldentransfer. to the plate., Arrange 1 layer of eggplant over the base of a large baking dish. Drizzle over a little oil. Continue layering with the zucchini and remaining eggplant. Set aside to cool., Cook the beans in a saucepan of boiling water for 2 minutes or until bright green and tender crisp. Drain., Whisk the vinegar and extra oil in a jug until well combined. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in the hazelnut., Arrange the eggplant and zucchini on a serving platter. Top with the beans and spoon over the dressing.

name: Gai laan with butter, lemon and almonds
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'gai laan, washed (see note)'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roughly chopped almond kernels (skin on)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}]
steps: Separate stems and leaves from gai laan. Place stems in a microwave-safe bowl. Cover with plastic wrap. Microwave on high (100%) for 2 minutes or until almost tender. Add leaves to bowl. Cover with plastic wrap. Microwave for 3 minutes or until leaves have wilted and stems are just tender., Place butter in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook, swirling, for 1 to 2 minutes or until butter is golden. Add almonds. Cook, swirling, for 1 minute or until almonds are just golden. Add gai laan. Cook, tossing, for 2 minutes or until coated. Add lemon juice. Toss to combine. Serve immediately.

name: Spring feta and lamb salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles butcher mini lamb leg roast'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'bakery rustic baguette, cut into cubes'}, {'quantity': '275', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed lettuce leaves'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'feta, crumbled'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C or 180C fan. Season lamb and rub with a little olive oil. Heat an ovenproof frying pan on high. Cook lamb for 2-3 mins, turning, until seared all over. Transfer to oven and bake for 20 mins, for medium-rare, or until cooked to your liking. Cover loosely with foil and rest for 15 mins., Scatter bread cubes on a baking tray. Drizzle with remaining olive oil and season. Gently toss to coat. Place tomatoes on another tray. Bake bread and tomato trays for 12 mins, or until bread is crisp and golden and tomatoes are soft., Place rocket, lettuce, tomato, fetta and croutons in a bowl and toss to combine. Whisk together dressing ingredients. Slice lamb, add to salad with dressing and toss to combine.

name: Mixed tomato salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'tomato medley mix'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red tomatoes, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, finely diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'small fresh basil leaves'}]
steps: Cut half the medley tomatoes in half. Place in a large shallow dish. Add remaining tomatoes and onion., Place oil, vinegar and sugar in a screw-top jar. Season with salt and pepper. Secure lid. Shake to combine. Add oil mixture to tomato mixture. Gently toss to combine. Set aside at room temperature for 20 minutes for flavours to develop., Top with basil. Toss to combine. Serve.

name: Creamy chicken, corn and pancetta soup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'leek', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pancetta, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) white wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'L', 'name': 'chicken broth, chicken meat reserved (see related recipe)'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Cream Delight potatoes, peeled, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'corn cobs, kernels removed'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley'}]
steps: Heat the butter in a large stockpot over medium heat. Add the leek, pancetta and garlic and stir for 5 minutes or until soft. Add the white wine and stir for 3-5 minutes or until the liquid has evaporated., Add chicken broth. Increase heat to medium-high and bring to the boil. Add the potato and simmer for 10 minutes or until just tender. Add the corn kernels and cook for a further 5 minutes or until just tender. Add cream and reserved chicken meat. Stir for 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir in parsley and season.

name: Rum & raisin ice-cream
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'dark rum'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'yolks'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) golden syrup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 tbsp) treacle'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thick cream'}]
steps: Place raisins and rum in a pan and bring to the boil then allow to cool and macerate., Place egg yolks, golden syrup, vanilla extract and treacle in the bowl of an electric mixer and beat for five minutes until thick. Add cream and beat for two minutes. Place in a plastic container in the freezer for 45 minutes until beginning to harden. Fold through rum and raisins until well combined, then freeze until firm., We served our ice-cream in home-made chocolate bowls. Simply melt 200g dark or milk chocolate in a bowl over a pan of simmering water, then set aside to cool. Dip the base of an inflated balloon into the chocolate. Remove then re-dip until base is well-covered in chocolate. Stand on a tray until it has hardened, then carefully deflate the balloon and discard. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

name: Berry sundaes with white chocolate sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g punnets strawberries, hulled, sliced widthways'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh raspberries or frozen raspberries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'litres', 'name': 'vanilla ice-cream'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'pouring cream'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'white chocolate, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Cognac or brandy (optional)'}]
steps: For white chocolate sauce, place cream in a saucepan and bring almost to the boil over medium heat. Remove from heat. Add chocolate and stir until smooth and melted. For an adult twist, stir in Cognac or brandy. Transfer to a jug then refrigerate sauce until chilled., Process sugar and 1/2 the strawberries in a food processor until smooth., To serve, place a few raspberries and a few remaining sliced strawberries in the base of a 2 cup-capacity dessert glass. Top with scoops of ice-cream and a few more berries. Drizzle with a little strawberry sauce and white chocolate sauce. Repeat with remaining berries, ice-cream and sauces in 5 more glasses. Serve immediately.

name: Broccoli pasta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'broccoli (1 small head), cut into small florets, stems thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '3 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'penne rigate'}, {'quantity': '45', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can anchovy fillets, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chilli flakes (optional)'}]
steps: Cook broccoli and zucchini in a large saucepan of salted boiling water for 1 minute or until tender. Use a slotted spoon to transfer to a bowl. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of oil. Toss to coat. Set aside., Return water to the boil. Add pasta and a pinch of salt. Cook following packet directions. Drain. Return pasta to sauce-pan. Toss with 2 teaspoons oil. Cover., Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a frying pan over medium-low heat. Add anchovies, garlic and chilli. Cook, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until anchovies dissolve and mixture is aromatic., Add anchovy mixture and vegetables to pasta. Cook over medium heat, tossing, for 1 to 2 minutes or until heated through.

name: Orange chicken with muffins
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Valencia', 'name': 'oranges, 1 sliced, 1 juiced'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh tarragon'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1.7', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'chicken pieces, scored'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'piece pancetta, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) walnuts, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'day-old baguette, torn'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) Massel salt reduced chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) white wine'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dark soy sauce'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sugar', 'name': 'snap peas, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'carrots, steamed, to serve'}]
steps: Combine orange slices, juice, tarragon, garlic and 3 tbs oil in a bowl. Add chicken. Toss. Season. Cover. Place in fridge for 4 hours., Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan forced. Grease eight 80ml (1/3 cup) capacity muffin pans. Cook pancetta and onion in remaining oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat for 4 minutes until golden. Add walnut. Cook for 1 minute. Add parsley. Transfer to a bowl. Add bread., Whisk stock and egg in a bowl. Stir into pancetta mixture and divide among muffin holes. Top with butter. Transfer chicken mixture to a roasting dish. Roast with muffins for 25 minutes. Swap shelves. Cook for 20 minutes. Transfer chicken and muffins to a plate. Pour pan juices into a jug. Skim 2 tbs of fat from surface and return to pan over medium heat. Add flour, stirring, for 1 minute. Whisk in wine, stock and remaining juices. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes until thickened. Add soy. Drizzle over chicken. Serve with steamed vegies.

name: Moroccan lamb with roast carrot salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Moroccan seasoning'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'orange rind'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '700', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lamb leg mini roast, rosemary discarded'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', peeled, cut into 1cm thick slices'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'pistachio kernels, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'couscous'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'currants'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Chickpea dip (see related recipe)'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}]
steps: Combine seasoning, garlic, orange rind, mint and 2 tablespoons oil in a small bowl. Place lamb in a shallow glass or ceramic dish. Spoon over marinade. Rub to coat. Cover. Refrigerate overnight, if time permits., Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Place lamb in a roasting pan. Roast for 15 minutes. Place carrot, honey and remaining oil in a bowl. Toss to coat. Arrange carrot around lamb. Roast for a further 15 minutes. Add pistachios. Roast for a further 15 minutes for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer carrot and pistachios to a bowl. Stand lamb, covered, for 5 minutes., Place couscous in a large heatproof bowl. Add 1/3 cup boiling water. Cover. Set aside for 5 minutes or until liquid has absorbed. Using a fork, fluff couscous to separate grains. Add carrot mixture, spinach and currants to couscous. Stir to combine., Combine chickpea dip and orange juice in a small bowl. Slice lamb. Serve lamb with salad and drizzled with chickpea dressing.

name: Peshvari naan
ingredient: [{'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 1/3 cups) plain flour, sifted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried yeast'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '160', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2/3 cup) warm water'}, {'quantity': '15', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil, to grease'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Melted', 'name': 'butter, extra, to serve'}]
steps: Combine the flour, yeast and salt in a large bowl. Make a well in the centre and pour in the water, butter and honey. Use a wooden spoon to stir until combined, then use your hands to bring the dough together in the bowl., Turn the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 8-10 minutes or until smooth and elastic. Brush a large bowl with oil to grease. Place the dough in the bowl and cover with plastic wrap or a damp tea towel. Set aside in a warm, draught-free place for 1 hour or until doubled in size., Meanwhile, to make the filling, melt butter in a frying pan over medium heat until foaming. Add onion, garlic, ginger, coriander, cumin and cinnamon and cook, stirring, for 10-15 minutes or until onion is soft. Stir in the sultanas and coconut., Preheat oven to 230°C. Brush 2 baking trays with oil to grease. Divide the dough and filling into 6 equal portions. Roll out 1 dough portion on a lightly floured surface to an 18cm-diameter disc. Spread 1 filling portion over one-half of the dough. Fold in half to enclose filling. Roll into an 18cm-long oval shape. Transfer to 1 prepared tray. Repeat with the remaining dough and filling. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside for 15 minutes or until almost doubled in size., Bake in oven for 10-12 minutes or until golden and puffed. Brush with extra melted butter to serve

name: Chicken and corn vermicelli noodle soup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried rice vermicelli noodles'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece ginger, peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'litres', 'name': 'Massel chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cobs', 'name': 'sweet corn, kernels removed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': '(about 300g) chicken breast fillets, trimmed, cut into 5mm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves, finely chopped'}]
steps: Place noodles in a bowl and cover with hot water. Stand for 10 minutes or until just tender. Drain and set aside., Meanwhile, heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, garlic and ginger. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until onion softens., Add stock and bring to the boil. Add corn, chicken and soy sauce. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, uncovered, for 2 to 3 minutes or until chicken is just cooked through., Add noodles. Simmer for 1 minute. Stir in coriander. Season with salt and pepper. Ladle soup into serving bowls. Serve.

name: Veal with grilled zucchini salad & white bean puree
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', thinly sliced lengthways'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter beans, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '180g veal T-bone steaks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'torn fresh basil leaves or small basil leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedge, to serve'}]
steps: To make the bean puree, place the beans and chicken stock in a small saucepan. Bring to the boil. Reduce to a medium heat. Simmer for 8 minutes. Set aside to cool. Add the garlic. Transfer to a food processor and process until smooth. Stir in the lemon rind and olive oil. Season., Heat a chargrill pan over a medium heat. Spray both sides of the zucchini with olive oil. Chargrill for about 2 minutes each side or until golden., Cook the beans in a saucepan of boiling water for 2 minutes or just until tender. Drain and refresh under cold water. Transfer to a large bowl., Spray the steaks with olive oil. Season. Chargrill for 3-5 minutes each side. Rest, covered with foil, for 3 minutes., Meanwhile, mix the lemon juice and olive oil until well combined. Add the dressing and zucchini to the beans. Toss until well combined. Toss through the basil., Serve the steaks with the salad and a dollop of white bean puree and lemon wedges

name: Fettuccine with mushroom bolognese
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'carrot, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cup mushrooms, sliced'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet Coles Regular Beef Mince 3 Star'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles Brand Balsamic Vinegar'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can Coles Brand Italian Diced Tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Brand Fettuccine'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'loosely', 'name': 'packed cup fresh basil leaves, torn'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Coles Brand Australian Parmesan Cheese Shredded'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}]
steps: Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan until hot. Cook onion and garlic for 2 mins, then add the carrot and cook for 1 min, or until just softened. Add mushrooms and cook for 2 mins. Season with salt and pepper., Add the beef and stir over high heat for 3 mins, or until lightly browned and no lumps of meat remain., Stir in the balsamic vinegar, allow to bubble for 1 min. Add the tomatoes., Meanwhile, cook the fettuccine according to packet directions. Remove 1 cup of the pasta water carefully and add it to the sauce. Cook the sauce for a further 10-12 mins, until slightly thickened. Turn off the heat and add the extra virgin olive oil. Drain the fettuccine., Add the fettuccine to the sauce in the pan and mix well. Scatter over the basil. Divide between four bowls and serve with the parmesan cheese.

name: Chilled soba noodle salad with teriyaki chicken
ingredient: [{'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Hakubaku Organic Soba Noodles'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'sticks, thinly sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': "Yeo's Pure Sesame Oil"}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'Coles Australian RSPCA Approved Chicken Breast Fillets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'shiitake', 'name': 'mushrooms, stems removed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Coriander', 'name': 'sprigs, to serve'}]
steps: Cook the noodles in a saucepan of boiling water following packet directions. Refresh under cold water. Drain well, then place in a large bowl. Add spring onion, celery, cucumber and sesame seeds., Combine the ginger and sesame oil in a small bowl. Add to the noodle salad. Gently toss to combine. Place in the fridge to chill., To make the teriyaki sauce, combine mirin, soy sauce, sake and sugar in a bowl. Stir until sugar dissolves. Add the chicken. Turn to coat., Heat olive oil in a wok or frying pan. Add the mushroom. Cook, tossing, for 3 mins or until lightly browned and tender. Transfer to a plate. Add chicken to the wok or pan, reserving sauce. Cook for 5 mins each side or until cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Add the reserved teriyaki sauce to the wok or pan. Bring to the boil. Simmer for 3 mins or until sauce thickens., Slice the chicken. Toss mushroom with noodle salad. Divide among serving bowls. Top with chicken, teriyaki sauce and coriander.

name: Turkey, sage and cranberry terrine
ingredient: [{'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'leek, trimmed, halved, sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brandy'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'prosciutto (see notes)'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh sage leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'turkey mince (see notes)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'mixed spice'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken breast fillet, diced into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cornichons', 'name': ', to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Jellied', 'name': 'cranberry sauce, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Crusty', 'name': 'bread, to serve'}]
steps: Melt butter in a frying pan over medium heat. Cook leek, stirring, for 5 to 7 minutes or until softened. Add garlic and brown sugar. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until mixture caramelises. Cool completely., Place cranberries and brandy in a bowl. Set aside for 15 minutes to soak., Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Grease a 7cm-deep, 11cm x 21cm (base) loaf pan. Line base and sides of prepared pan with prosciutto, slightly overlapping, allowing excess prosciutto to overhang about 6cm on all sides., Roughly chop 1 tablespoon sage. Place mince, leek mixture, cranberry mixture, egg, chopped sage and mixed spice in a large bowl. Season well with salt and pepper. Mix well to combine. Add chicken. Mix well. Spoon mixture into prepared pan, pressing firmly with the back of spoon to compact and level top. Fold prosciutto over top of mince mixture to cover. Cover tightly with foil., Place pan in a baking dish. Pour enough boiling water into dish to reach halfway up side of pan. Bake for 1 hour. Remove and discard foil. Bake for a further 15 minutes. Carefully remove pan from baking dish. Cool for 20 minutes. Carefully drain excess liquid from pan. Turn terrine onto a plate, top-side down. Cover. Refrigerate overnight., Remove terrine from fridge 15 minutes before serving. Heat oil in a small frying CHRISTMAS TURKEY pan over medium-high heat. Cook remaining sage, turning, for 1 minute or until crisp. Drain on paper towel. Sprinkle terrine with sage. Serve with cornichons, cranberry sauce and crusty bread.

name: Classic English pork roast with apple sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh sage leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'rolled pork loin'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Kent pumpkin, cut into wedges, roasted, to serve'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cooked peas, to serve'}]
steps: Make Apple Sauce: Place apple6 Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored, chopped, lemon juice1/4 cup lemon juice and 1/4 cup of water in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 20 to 30 minutes or until apple is very soft. Set aside for 10 minutes to cool slightly. Add sugar1/4 cup caster sugar. Using a stick blender, blend mixture until smooth. Transfer to a bowl. Cover surface with plastic wrap. Cool completely., Meanwhile, melt butter50g butter, chopped in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add onion1 brown onion, finely chopped. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add garlic1 garlic clove, crushed. Cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Remove from heat. Transfer to a bowl. Cool 5 minutes. Add breadcrumbs1 1/2 cups fresh breadcrumbs, sage2 tbsp chopped fresh sage leaves and egg1 egg, lightly beaten. Season with salt and pepper.
