Mix well to combine., Preheat oven to 240C/220C fan-forced. Place a greased wire rack over a flameproof roasting pan., Remove string from pork2kg rolled pork loin. Unroll. Place on a board, skin-side down. Slice crossways through thickest part of meat, being careful not to cut the whole way through. Open out to form 1 large piece. Press stuffing over pork. Roll up to enclose stuffing. Tie with kitchen string at 3cm intervals to secure. Rub with the salt2 tsp sea salt. Place on prepared wire rack. Pour enough water into pan to come 1cm up the side., Roast pork for 30 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 180C/160C fan-forced. Roast for a further 40 minutes or until juices run clear when a skewer is inserted into centre of pork., Transfer pork to a plate. Set aside to rest., Place the roasting pan over high heat. Add flour1/4 cup plain flour. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until mixture bubbles. Add wine1/3 cup dry white wine. Stir to combine. Simmer for 1 minute. Gradually stir in stock2 cups chicken stock. Cook, stirring constantly, for 5 minutes or until mixture boils and thickens. Remove from heat., Serve pork with apple sauce, gravy, roast pumpkin1kg Kent pumpkin, cut into wedges, roasted, to serve and peas2 cups cooked peas, to serve.

name: Cauliflower pakoras
ingredient: [{'quantity': '190', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/4 cups) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chilli powder'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'turmeric'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'yolk'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) water'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cauliflower, trimmed, cut into florets'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vegetable', 'name': 'oil, to deep-fry'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander sprigs, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Tzatziki', 'name': ', to serve'}]
steps: Combine flour, cumin, ground coriander, chilli and turmeric in a bowl. Make a well in the centre. Add the egg yolk. Gradually whisk in the water until a smooth batter forms. Cover and place in the fridge for 30 minutes to rest., Meanwhile, cook the cauliflower in a saucepan of boiling water for 3 minutes or until tender. Drain., Add oil to a large, deep saucepan or wok to reach a depth of 8cm. Heat to 170°C over high heat (when the oil is ready a cube of bread will turn golden in 20 seconds). Add cauliflower to the batter and stir to coat. Add half the cauliflower to the oil. Cook for 3 minutes or until crisp and golden. Use a slotted spoon to transfer the cauliflower to a plate lined with paper towel. Repeat with remaining cauliflower, reheating the oil between batches., Place the cauliflower in a serving bowl. Top with fresh coriander and season with salt. Serve with tzatziki.

name: Sticky hoisin pork chops with broccolini and nashi salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'hoisin sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'salt-reduced soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '200g each) pork cutlets, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'rice bran oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'rice wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'broccolini, halved lengthways and crossways'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, trimmed, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'nashi', 'name': ', thinly sliced crossways'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'natural sliced almonds, toasted'}]
steps: Combine hoisin, honey, 1 tablespoon of the soy sauce and 1 teaspoon of the sesame oil in a small bowl. Place pork in a shallow dish. Drizzle over 1/2 the hoisin mixture. Toss to coat., Heat a frying pan over medium heat. Cook pork, turning and brushing with remaining hoisin mixture, for 8 minutes or until sticky and cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Cover loosely with foil. Stand for 5 minutes to rest., Meanwhile, place rice bran oil, vinegar and remaining soy sauce and sesame oil in a small bowl. Whisk to combine., Place broccolini and beans in a heatproof bowl. Cover with boiling water. Stand for 2 minutes or until bright green and tender. Drain. Refresh under cold water. Drain well. Transfer to a large bowl. Add nashi, almonds and dressing. Season with pepper. Toss to combine. Serve pork with broccolini and nashi salad.

name: Stuffed onion petals and hummus
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onions, plus 1 small onion, extra, coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'sticks, coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sweet paprika, plus extra, to sprinkle'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) jasmine rice'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley leaves, plus extra leaves, to sprinkle'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) Massel Organic Vegetable Liquid Stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'harissa'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'tub hummus'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Cut large onions8 large brown onions, plus 1 small onion, extra, coarsely grated in half lengthways. Peel off skin. Place halves in a saucepan. Cover with cold water. Bring to boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer, covered, for 5-10 minutes or until soft enough to separate layers. Drain. Set aside to cool slightly. Carefully separate halves into petals with 2 layers in each. (You need 24 petals in total.), Heat 2 tbsp oil125ml (1/2 cup) olive oil in a small frying pan over medium-high heat. Add grated extra onion, carrot1 carrot, peeled, coarsely grated, celery2 celery sticks, coarsely grated, garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed, paprika2 tsp sweet paprika, plus extra, to sprinkle and cumin2 tsp ground cumin. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until softened slightly. Stir in rice200g (1 cup) jasmine rice and 330ml (1 1/3 cups) water. Cover and simmer for 8-10 minutes or until water is absorbed. Set aside to cool slightly then stir in parsley1/4 cup chopped fresh continental parsley leaves, plus extra leaves, to sprinkle., Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan forced. Grease a 20 x 27cm (base size) baking dish with oil., Fill each petal with rice mixture. Place in prepared dish. Combine stock250ml (1 cup) Organic Vegetable Liquid Stock and paste2 tsp tomato paste in a jug and pour a little over petals. Drizzle over a little remaining oil. Pour remaining stock mixture into the base of dish. Sprinkle with extra paprika. Season. Bake for 45-60 minutes or until filling is cooked through and sauce is reduced., Combine harissa2 tsp harissa and remaining oil in a jug. Spread hummus200g tub hummus over a serving plate. Arrange petals on top. Drizzle over harissa mixture. Serve with extra parsley and lemon wedgesLemon wedges, to serve.

name: Baked cinnamon ricotta drizzled with honey and berries
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh ricotta'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(55g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60g) natural vanilla yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla bean paste'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'punnet raspberries'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'punnet blueberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'ripe', 'name': 'fig, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'sugared brioche, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'croissants, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 160°C. Brush two 1-cup (250ml) dariole moulds with melted butter to lightly grease., Combine the ricotta and sugar in a medium bowl and stir until smooth. Add the egg, yoghurt, cinnamon and vanilla and stir until well combined. Spoon evenly into prepared moulds and smooth the surface. Place on an oven tray., Bake in preheated oven for 30-40 minutes or until light golden and just set. Remove from oven. Set aside for 15 minutes before turning out onto a plate to cool completely for 30 minutes., Place the ricotta on a serving platter. Top with berries and fig wedges and drizzle with honey. Serve with warm sugared brioche and croissants.

name: Salmon confit with shaved fennel salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'fennel, thinly shaved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh dill'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '95', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) basil pesto'}]
steps: To make the salmon confit, place the combined oil, bay leaves, thyme, lemon rind, peppercorns and salt in a 7cm-deep, 22cm x 15cm glass or ceramic ovenproof dish. Add the salmon. Cover and place in the fridge for 2 hours to marinate. Set aside for 30 minutes or until the oil mixture is at room temperature., Preheat oven to 90C. Bake the salmon for 12 minutes for medium-rare or until cooked to your liking. Set aside for 20 minutes to cool to room temperature., Use a slotted egg lifter to remove the salmon from the oil and place on a plate lined with paper towel. Use a fillet knife to remove the skin from each piece of salmon., Combine the fennel, dill, chives, lemon juice and olive oil in a bowl. Season. Divide the salmon among plates. Arrange the salad around the salmon and spoon a little pesto onto each plate.

name: Wonton noodle soup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken mince'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece fresh ginger, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'shallots', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped water chestnuts'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sherry'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '24', 'unit': 'wonton', 'name': 'wrappers'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(1 litre) Massel chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(1 litre) water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', cut into thin sticks'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'oyster or shiitake mushrooms, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'bok choy, washed, sliced lengthways'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'shredded Chinese cabbage'}]
steps: Place chicken mince, ginger, garlic, shallots, water chestnuts, sherry and 2 teaspoons soy sauce in bowl. Mix until well combined., Lay wontons out in a single layer on a clean surface. Spoon about 1/2 teaspoon of the mixture into the centre of each wrapper. Brush edges of with egg. Bring edges together and press to seal. Repeat with remaining wontons and egg., Place stock, water and remaining soy sauce in a large saucepan. Bring to a simmer. Add carrots and wontons. Simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes. Add mushrooms, bok choy and cabbage. Simmer for 1-2 minutes or until vegetables are tender., Divide soup among serving bowls and serve.

name: Split pea and rice meatballs (Koofteh berenji)
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60g) yellow split peas'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(100g) Basmati rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(50g) besan (chickpea flour) (see note)'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef mince or lamb mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped flat leaf parsley'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped dill'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped tarragon'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped mint'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'currants'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(30g) finely chopped walnuts'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(375ml) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125g) Tamar Valley Greek Style Yoghurt'}]
steps: Place peas1/4 cup (60g) yellow split peas in a bowl and cover with water. Set aside for 1 hour to soak. Drain well. Cook rice1/2 cup (100g) Basmati rice and peas in salted boiling water for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain well and set aside to cool., Place the rice mixture, onion1 brown onion, coarsely grated, besan1/3 cup (50g) besan (chickpea flour) (see note), mince400g beef mince or lamb mince, egg1 egg, lightly whisked, parsley1/4 cup finely chopped flat leaf parsley, green onions4 green onions, finely chopped, dill2 tbsp finely chopped dill, tarragon2 tbsp finely chopped tarragon, mint2 tbsp finely chopped mint, turmeric2 tsp ground turmeric, currants2 tbsp currants and walnuts1/4 cup (30g) finely chopped walnuts in a bowl. Use your hands to mix until well combined. Season with salt and pepper. Using wet hands, shape 2 tablespoonsful of mixture into balls and place on a tray. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes., Melt the butter40g butter in a large non-stick frying pan over high heat. Add the chicken stock1 1/2 cups (375ml) chicken stock, lemon juice1/4 cup (60ml) lemon juice and tomato paste1 tbsp tomato paste and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until well combined and heated through. Arrange meatballs in the sauce and reduce heat to low. Cook, covered, turning occasionally, for 40 minutes or until meatballs are tender and liquid is almost absorbed., Place the yoghurt1/2 cup (125g) Greek Style Yoghurt in a small saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until heated through. Transfer meatballs to a serving bowl. Drizzle with warm yoghurt and serve immediately.

name: Salmon balls
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': '(about 480g) orange sweet potato (kumara), peeled, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '210', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can red salmon (or pink salmon), drained, flaked'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60g) cottage cheese'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped red onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped flat-leaf parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'wholemeal plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(45g) wholemeal dried (packaged) breadcrumbs'}]
steps: Cook the sweet potato in a medium saucepan of boiling water for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain well. Return to the pan and use a fork to mash until smooth., Preheat oven to 180°C. Line an oven tray with baking paper. Combine the sweet potato, salmon, cottage cheese, onion, parsley, lemon juice and flour in a medium bowl. Divide mixture into 16-20 portions and shape each portion into a ball. Place the breadcrumbs on a plate. Roll each ball in the breadcrumbs and place on the lined tray., Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown and heated through.

name: 3-ingredient pie maker banana pancakes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'over', 'name': '-ripe bananas, plus 1 ripe banana, sliced, to serve'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Maple', 'name': 'syrup or honey (optional) to drizzle'}]
steps: Use a fork to mash the bananas in a medium bowl until smooth. Whisk in the eggs. Gradually stir in the flour until a smooth batter forms. Set aside for 10 minutes to rest., Spoon enough of the mixture to come to the top of the pie maker holes. Turn on the pie maker. Close and cook for 7 minutes or until golden and cooked through. Transfer pancakes to a plate. Repeat with the remaining batter., Serve the pancakes topped with the sliced banana and drizzled with maple syrup or honey, if using.

name: Chicken and asparagus salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'asparagus, trimmed, sliced diagonally into 5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'barbecued chicken, skin removed, shredded (see note)'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'slivered almonds, toasted'}]
steps: Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil over high heat. Add asparagus. Boil for 2 minutes or until just tender. Drain. Rinse under cold water. Combine asparagus, chicken, tomatoes and almonds in a bowl. Remove to an airtight container., Make dressing: Place lemon juice, oil, dill and garlic in a screw-top jar. Season with salt and pepper. Secure lid. Shake well to combine. Toss dressing through salad just before serving.

name: Sweet chilli & vegetable noodle salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt hokkein noodles'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sweet chilli sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'limes', 'name': ', juiced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', peeled and cut into matchsticks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, deseeded, and cut into thin strips'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'shredded Chinese cabbage'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'coriander, leaves picked'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'mint, leaves picked'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'bean sprouts'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sesame', 'name': 'seeds'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Barbequed', 'name': 'chicken skewers'}]
steps: Place 450g pkt hokkein noodles in a heatproof bowl and pour over boiling water. Set aside for 10 minutes. Drain well and transfer to a large bowl. Whisk together 1/2 cup sweet chilli sauce, 2 limes, juiced, and 2 tablespoons peanut oil., Combine the noodles, 2 carrots, peeled and cut into matchsticks, 1 red capsicum, deseeded, and cut into thin strips, 4 cups shredded Chinese cabbage, 1 bunch coriander, leaves picked, 1 bunch mint, leaves picked, and 2 cups bean sprouts., Add the dressing to the salad and toss. Place in a serving bowl and scatter with sesame seeds, if desired. Serve with barbequed chicken skewers.

name: Filo, roasted pumpkin, sage and fennel tartlets with walnuts and rocket pesto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, seeded, peeled, cut into 3cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely shredded sage'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fennel seeds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'fennel', 'name': ', cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'filo pastry'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'rocket leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place pumpkin on the lined tray. Drizzle with 2 tsp oil and sprinkle with sage and fennel seeds. Season with salt and pepper. Bake, turning occasionally, for 20 minutes or until beginning to brown. Remove from oven., Meanwhile, heat half the remaining oil in a medium frying pan over medium-low heat. Add fennel and cook, turning occasionally, for 15 minutes or until tender. Add the sugar and vinegar and cook, turning, for 5 minutes or until caramelised., Place four 8cm (base measurement) fluted tart tins with removable bases on a baking tray. Place filo on a clean work surface. Cut filo sheets in half widthways. Place in a stack and cut into quarters to make squares. Lightly brush filo with a little remaining oil. Place 8 filo squares, rotating slightly, in the base of a each tart tine, allowing the corners to extend over the edge. Bake in oven for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven., Divide pumpkin and fennel among pastry cases. Bake for 5 minute or until heated through., Meanwhile, to make the rocket and walnut pesto, process the walnuts, rocket and garlic in a food processor until finely chopped. Add lemon juice and oil and process until well combined. Season with salt and pepper., Place pumpkin tartlets on serving plates. Dollop with pesto and serve with baby rocket leaves.

name: Lime and ginger chicken skewers
ingredient: [{'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken breast fillets, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lime and ginger marmalade'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sweet chilli sauce'}]
steps: Thread chicken onto skewers. Place in a ceramic dish. Combine marmalade, oil and sweet chilli sauce. Pour over chicken. Turn to coat. Refrigerate for 30 minutes, if time permits. Drain marinade and reserve., Make coleslaw: Combine cabbage, carrot, capsicum, beansprouts and green onion in a bowl. Pour over dressing and toss gently to combine., Preheat barbecue plate on medium heat. Place baking paper on plate. Barbecue skewers, basting with reserved marinade, for 4 minutes each side or until chicken is just cooked through. Serve with coleslaw.

name: Smashed chat potatoes with garlic & herb cheese and prosciutto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'chat', 'name': 'potatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'garlic clove, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped flat-leaf parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh thyme leaves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'basil leaves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh ricotta or cream cheese'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'Italian prosciutto'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(50g) watercress sprigs'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 240C. Line a baking tray with baking paper., Place the potatoes in a large saucepan of salted water and bring to the boil over high heat. Boil for 15 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Drain well., Arrange potatoes on the lined baking tray. Using a potato masher, smash each potato so that it’s flattened but still holds together. Brush with the olive oil and season well with salt and pepper., Bake the potatoes for 25 minutes or until crisp and golden. Cool slightly., Meanwhile, mix garlic, parsley, thyme, basil and cheese together in a bowl. Place a spoonful of the herbed cheese on each potato, then finish with a slice of prosciutto piled on top. Serve the potatoes garnished with watercress.

name: Asian tofu and vegetable omelettes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'silken firm tofu, cut into 1cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'oyster sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red capsicum, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'button mushrooms, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'baby pak choy, chopped'}, {'quantity': '115', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh baby corn, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Asian', 'name': 'salad leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Place tofu pieces in a single layer on paper towel. Cover with more paper towel. Press down gently to remove excess water., Combine oyster sauce, soy sauce and fish sauce in a small bowl. Heat a wok over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon oil. Swirl to coat. Stir-fry capsicum and mushrooms for 2 minutes. Add pak choy, corn and onion. Stir-fry for 1 to 2 minutes or until vegetables are just tender. Add sauce mixture and tofu. Stir-fry for 30 seconds or until heated through. Transfer to a bowl. Cover, keep warm. Wash and dry wok., Whisk eggs and 2 tablespoons cold water in a jug until combined. Season with salt and pepper. Heat cleaned wok over medium heat. Add 2 teaspoons remaining oil. Swirl to coat. Pour 1/4 of the egg mixture into wok, tilting the wok to form a thin, round omelette. Cook for 1 minute or until egg is almost set. Transfer to a board. Repeat with remaining oil and egg to make 4 omelettes., Spoon 1/4 of the vegetable mixture into centre of 1 omelette. Fold four sides of omelette over to enclose filling. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining omelettes and vegetable mixture. Serve with salad leaves.

name: Lamb and fetta filo roll
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lamb mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'zucchini, trimmed, grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh dill'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'filo', 'name': 'pastry sheets'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fetta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold cooked white rice'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Tamar Valley Greek Style Yoghurt'}]
steps: Heat oil in a large non-stick frying pan over high heat. Add mince. Cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up lumps, for 5 minutes or until browned. Add garlic. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add allspice and zucchini. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until zucchini softens. Stir in 1 tablespoon dill. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a heatproof bowl. Set aside for 15 minutes to cool., Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Line a large baking tray with baking paper. Place 1 filo sheet on a flat surface. Brush with butter. Top with 1 filo sheet. Repeat with butter and remaining filo sheets to form a stack., Add fetta to cooled lamb mixture. Spoon a 6cm x 26cm-long strip of rice along 1 long side of the filo stack. Top with lamb mixture. Fold in ends and roll up to enclose filling. Place, seam-side down, on prepared tray. Brush with remaining butter. Bake for 35 minutes or until golden. Set aside for 5 minutes to cool slightly., Meanwhile, combine yoghurt and remaining dill together in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Slice filo roll and serve with yoghurt mixture.

name: Crispy pumpkin and quinoa croquettes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '45', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) currants'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) tri coloured quinoa, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(', 'name': '470g) Golden Delight potatoes, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) plain flour, plus 2 tbsp extra'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) panko breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'low-fat feta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander, chopped, plus extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Grape', 'name': 'seed oil, to shallow fry'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Tomato', 'name': 'relish, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salad', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Heat oil in a saucepan over low heat. Add onion, garlic and cumin. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes until soft. Stir in currants for 1 minutes. Stir in quinoa and water. Bring to a simmer. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 14 minutes until liquid is absorbed and quinoa is tender. Cool., Boil potato and pumpkin in a saucepan of boiling salted water for 15-17 minutes until tender. Drain well. Return to pan. Cook, shaking pan, over low heat for 1 minute until excess water evaporates. Mash. Transfer to a bowl. Cool for 10 minutes., Place flour and breadcrumbs on separate plates. Place egg in a shallow bowl., Combine quinoa mixture, pumpkin mixture, feta, coriander and extra flour in a bowl. Season well. Shape into twelve 10-12cm croquettes. Dip in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs. Transfer to lined tray., Add oil to a frying pan to come 2cm up side. Heat over medium-low heat. Cook croquettes, in 3 batches, turning, for 4 minutes until crisp. Drain on paper towel. Serve with relish, lemon wedges, coriander and salad.

name: Creamy pasta with spring vegetables
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'spaghetti'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(130g) frozen baby peas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'asparagus, trimmed, cut into 5cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen broad beans'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'leek', 'name': ', washed and sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'garlic cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) white wine'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'double cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely shredded fresh mint'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) freshly grated parmesan cheese, plus extra for serving'}]
steps: Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil and cook the pasta until al dente. Drain., Meanwhile, bring another saucepan of water to the boil and blanch peas and asparagus for 2 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and plunge into cold water. Cook broad beans in the same saucepan for 2 minutes, drain, plunge into cold water then slip off the outer skins. Set aside., Melt butter in a deep frying pan, add leek and garlic and cook for 3-4 minutes until softened. Add wine and cook until almost evaporated. Add cream and cook for 3-4 minutes or until slightly thickened. Stir through the peas, asparagus and broad beans for 1 minute to warm through then toss through pasta, mint and parmesan. Season to taste and serve sprinkled with extra parmesan

name: Thai massaman beef curry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, cut into large wedges'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(100g) massaman curry paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Coles Australian Beef Chuck Casserole Steak, cut into 5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated ginger'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) beef stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'stick or quill'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chilli, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bay', 'name': 'leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'palm sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(45g) roasted unsalted peanuts'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'potatoes, peeled, quartered'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'jasmine rice, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Coriander', 'name': 'sprigs, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Heat the oil1 tbsp vegetable oil in a large heavy-based pan over medium-low heat. Add the onion1 brown onion, cut into large wedges and cook for 5 mins. Add massaman paste1/3 cup (100g) massaman curry paste and cook for 1 min or until fragrant. Add the beef1kg Beef Chuck Casserole Steak, cut into 5cm pieces and cook, stirring, for 3 mins or until browned. Add the garlic1 garlic clove, crushed and ginger1 tbsp finely grated ginger and cook for 1 min., Add coconut milk400ml can coconut milk, stock1/2 cup (125ml) beef stock, cinnamon1 cinnamon stick or quill, chilli1 long red chilli, thinly sliced, bay leaves2 bay leaves, palm sugar2 tbsp palm sugar, lime juice2 tbsp lime juice, fish sauce1 tbsp fish sauce, peanuts1/3 cup (45g) roasted unsalted peanuts and potato400g potatoes, peeled, quartered to the pan and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 1 1/2 hours or until the beef is very tender., Divide the steamed jasmine riceSteamed jasmine rice, to serve among serving bowls. Top with the curry and serve with corianderCoriander sprigs, to serve and lime wedgesLime wedges, to serve.

name: Lamb and rosemary pie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'diced lamb'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'button mushrooms, halved'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chopped tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) beef stock'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) red wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh rosemary'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil, to grease'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'sheet', 'name': '(25 x 25cm) frozen puff pastry, just thawed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'rosemary sprig, to decorate'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'green round beans, to serve'}]
steps: Heat one-third of the oil1 1/2 tbsp olive oil in a large heavy-based saucepan over medium-high heat. Season the lamb1kg diced lamb with salt and pepper. Cook half the lamb, turning occasionally, for 3-4 minutes or until browned. Transfer to a heatproof bowl. Repeat with half the remaining oil and the remaining lamb., Heat remaining oil in the pan. Cook the onion1 brown onion, coarsely chopped, garlic1 garlic clove, crushed and mushroom250g button mushrooms, halved for 4 minutes or until soft. Increase heat to high. Stir in the tomato400g can chopped tomatoes, stock250ml (1 cup) beef stock, wine250ml (1 cup) red wine, tomato paste2 tbsp tomato paste and chopped rosemary1 tbsp chopped fresh rosemary. Cover. Bring to the boil., Reduce heat to medium-low. Return lamb to pan. Cover and cook for 1 hour. Uncover and cook for a further 30 minutes or until lamb is tender and the sauce thickens. Set aside for 1 hour to cool slightly. Transfer to a bowl. Cover with plastic wrap. Place in the fridge for 1-2 hours to cool completely., Preheat oven to 200ºC. Brush a 24cm (base measurement) pie dish with oilOlive oil, to grease. Spoon lamb mixture into dish. Top with the pastry1 sheet (25 x 25cm) frozen puff pastry, just thawed. Trim excess. Use a fork to press the edge to seal and decorate. Brush the pie with egg1 egg, lightly whisked. Cut a 4cm-wide cross in the top of the pastry. Decorate with a rosemary sprigFresh rosemary sprig, to decorate. (To freeze, see note), Bake for 40-45 minutes or until puffed and golden. Serve with steamed beansSteamed green round beans, to serve.

name: Horseradish sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '300ml ctn sour cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated fresh horseradish'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'thin cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}]
steps: Place sour cream, horseradish, cream and chives in a medium bowl and stir to combine. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a serving bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and store in the fridge until required.

name: Mixed bean & grape tomato salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '600g pkts frozen broad beans'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, topped'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '350g ctn marinated feta, drained, oil reserved'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '200g punnets red grape tomatoes, halved'}]
steps: Cook broad beans and green beans in a medium saucepan of salted boiling water for 2-3 minutes or until bright green and tender crisp. Refresh under cold running water. Drain well. Remove the skins from the broad beans., Place the lemon juice, mustard, sugar and 60ml (1/4 cup) of the reserved feta oil in a small bowl. Use a fork to whisk until combined. Season with salt and pepper., Combine the bean mixture, feta and tomato in a large serving bowl. Drizzle with dressing and gently toss until well combined. Serve immediately.

name: Easy superfood fried rice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g pkts 7 Ancient Grains microwave rice mix (or microwave brown rice and quinoa mix)'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed mushrooms (halved, if large)'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Australian superfood vegetable mix'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'gluten-free tamari'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}]
steps: Heat the rice following the packet directions. Set aside., Heat a lightly oiled wok over high heat. Stir-fry the mushrooms for 5 minutes or until softened and golden. Season. Transfer to a plate. Reduce heat to medium-high. Stir-fry the vegetable mix for 3 minutes. Add the tamari and warmed rice. Return mushrooms to wok and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes or until rice is heated through., Meanwhile, heat a lightly oiled large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add the eggs and cook for 3-5 minutes or until the whites are just set., Divide the rice mixture among serving plates and top each with a fried egg.

name: Shepherd's pie with purple mash
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'sticks, trimmed, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lean lamb mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) chicken stock or vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'purple sweet potato, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'large purple carrots, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'vintage cheddar, coarsely grated'}]
steps: Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add onion, celery and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 4-5 minutes or until softened. Add mince and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up any lumps, for 5-7 minutes or until browned., Stir in the tomato paste, tomato and stock. Bring to the boil, reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes, until liquid has reduced and thickened. Add zucchini. Simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in parsley., Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 210C/190C fan forced. Cook the sweet potato and carrot in a large saucepan of salted boiling water for 15-20 minutes or until soft. Drain. Return to the pan. Add the butter and season. Use a stick blender to process until just smooth. Stir in half the cheddar., Spoon mince mixture into a 2L (8 cup) ovenproof baking dish. Spoon the sweet potato and carrot mash on top, spreading over the filling to cover. Sprinkle with the remaining cheddar. Place the dish on a baking tray and bake for 25 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the mixture is bubbling. Set aside to rest for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Sweet corn and zucchini ratatouille
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onions, medium dice'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, medium dice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'capsicum, medium dice'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', medium dice, green parts only'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'ears', 'name': 'fresh yellow sweet corn, husk removed (about 3 cups of kernels)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh parsley, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh thyme, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'basil leaves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}]
steps: Heat the oil in a large sauce pot over medium-high heat., Add the onions and saute for about 4 minutes or until slightly softened., Add the garlic and saute for about 30 seconds or until fragrant., Add the red and green capsicum and saute for about 4 minutes or until slightly softened., Add the zucchini and corn and saute for about 5 minutes or until they are crisp-tender., Stir in the parsley, thyme, basil leaves and lemon juice., Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve.

name: Grilled miso fish with soy and sesame asparagus
ingredient: [{'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) sake (see note)'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) mirin (see note)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shiro miso (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil, plus extra, to grease'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '150g blue-eye trevalla fillets, pin-boned, skinned'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'asparagus, trimmed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Toasted', 'name': 'sesame seeds, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'rice, to serve'}]
steps: To make miso marinade, combine sake, mirin and sugar in a saucepan over high heat. Bring to a simmer and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until sugar dissolves. Whisk in shiro miso and peanut oil until smooth. Remove from heat, pour into a large bowl and refrigerate for 10 minutes., Add fish to cooled miso marinade, turn to coat and set aside at room temperature for 15 minutes., Meanwhile, to make soy and sesame dressing, combine oil, soy sauce, ginger, spring onions and sesame seeds in a small bowl., Preheat grill to medium–high. Line an oven tray with foil, lightly grease with extra oil and top with fish. Grill for 4 minutes each side or until slightly charred and just cooked., Meanwhile, cook asparagus in boiling salted water for 2 minutes or until just tender. Drain. Drizzle with half the soy and sesame dressing, and toss to coat., Divide asparagus among plates. Top with fish and drizzle with remaining dressing. Scatter sesame seeds over steamed rice and serve with fish.

name: Salmon nicoise salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '12', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '650g) baby coliban (chat) potatoes, unpeeled'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, topped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '280', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Atlantic salmon Fillets'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '120g pkt baby mesclun'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'ripe', 'name': 'tomatoes, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh dill sprigs'}, {'quantity': '65', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) kalamata olives'}]
steps: Cook the potatoes in a large saucepan of boiling water for 12 minutes or until just tender. Use a slotted spoon to transfer to a clean work surface. Halve., Add the beans to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes or until bright green and tender crisp. Refresh under cold running water. Drain., Meanwhile, place the eggs in a small saucepan of cold water. Bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium and gently boil, uncovered, stirring occasionally, for 7 minutes. Drain. Cool under cold running water. Peel and halve., Cook the salmon in the microwave following packet directions. Flake into large pieces., Whisk together the oil, lemon juice and mustard in a jug. Season with salt and pepper., Divide the potato, beans, egg, salmon, baby mesclun, tomato, dill and olives evenly among serving bowls. Drizzle over the dressing to serve.

name: Lamb with pumpkin and lentil winter salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, seeded, peeled, cut into 3cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'Dutch carrots, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'head', 'name': 'broccoli, cut into florets'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Moroccan seasoning'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Australian Lamb Cutlets, French trimmed (see notes)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(140g) Greek-style yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tahini'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can lentils, drained'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Combine pumpkin, carrots, broccoli, oil and half the Moroccan seasoning in a large bowl. Arrange in a single layer on the lined tray. Roast, turning occasionally, for 25 mins or until pumpkin is tender., Meanwhile, combine lamb and remaining Moroccan seasoning in a bowl. Heat a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the lamb and cook for 2-3 mins each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil. Set aside for 5 mins to rest., Combine the yoghurt, tahini and lemon juice in a small bowl. Season. Combine the pumpkin mixture and lentils in a large bowl. Divide among serving plates. Drizzle with the yoghurt mixture and top with lamb.

name: Slow-cooked pork with apricots
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Chinese rice wine'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'hoisin sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Massel Chicken Liquid Stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'star', 'name': 'anise'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece fresh ginger, peeled, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'sticks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'piece pork neck'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'apricots, quartered, stones removed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'rice, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Asian', 'name': 'greens, to serve'}]
steps: Combine the rice wine, hoisin sauce, chicken stock, sesame oil, garlic, star anise, ginger, cinnamon sticks and brown sugar in a ceramic dish. Put pork into this marinade, cover the dish and refrigerate overnight., Preheat oven to 160°C. Place a wire rack in a roasting pan. Remove pork from marinade, reserving marinade. Place pork on rack and pour half cup of water into the roasting pan., Cook for 1 hour, basting with reserved marinade every 30 minutes. Turn pork over and cook, basting every 30 minutes with pan drippings, for a further 60-90 minutes, or until very tender. Transfer meat to a chopping board. Stand for 10 minutes, before slicing thinly., Meanwhile, place remaining marinade in a saucepan. Add apricots and place over medium heat. Bring marinade to the boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until fruit is tender and beginning to break up., Spoon fruit sauce over slices of pork and serve with steamed rice and steamed Asian greens.

name: Middle Eastern carrot & radish salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', peeled, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'radishes, washed, dried, stems and roots trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, halved, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh continental parsley, leaves picked'}]
steps: Combine the carrot, radish and onion in a large bowl., Heat a small frying pan over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until aromatic., Whisk together the lemon juice, lime juice, honey, cinnamon and cumin seeds in a bowl. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Drizzle the salad with dressing and sprinkle with parsley. Gently toss to combine. Serve immediately.

name: Pollo alla romana (Roman chicken)
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.6', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'whole chicken, cut into 8 pieces'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pancetta, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red onion, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) white wine'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) Mutti Tomato Passata'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'fresh marjoram or oregano sprigs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'yellow', 'name': 'capsicum, thickly sliced'}]
steps: Heat a flameproof casserole dish over medium-high heat. Cook the chicken1.6kg whole chicken, cut into 8 pieces, skin-side down, in 2 batches, for 5 minutes or until golden. Turn and cook for 3 minutes. Transfer to a plate., Stir in the pancetta150g pancetta, coarsely chopped, onion1 large red onion, cut into wedges and garlic2 garlic cloves, thinly sliced for 3 minutes or until pancetta is crisp. Add wine125ml (1/2 cup) white wine. Cook for 1 minute or until liquid reduces slightly. Add chicken, passata500ml (2 cups) Mutti Tomato Passata and marjoram6 large fresh marjoram or oregano sprigs. Season with pepper. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover. Cook for 20 minutes. Turn chicken. Cook, covered, for 15 minutes. Uncover and cook for 15 minutes or until chicken is very tender., Meanwhile, heat the oil1 tbsp olive oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Stir in combined capsicum1 red capsicum, thickly sliced|1 yellow capsicum, thickly sliced for 5 minutes or until softened slightly., Stir the capsicum mixture into the chicken mixture. Cook for 10 minutes or until heated through.

name: Chicken with salsa verde and warm potato salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g packets Tuscan-style seasoned baby potatoes'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Praise whole-egg mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'walnuts, toasted, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'barbecued chickens, quartered'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Cook potatoes following packet directions. Set aside for 2 minutes. Transfer to a large bowl. Combine mayonnaise, lemon juice and parsley in a bowl. Add mayonnaise mixture and walnuts to potato. Toss to combine., Make salsa: Process parsley, mint, onion, capers, vinegar, mustard and oil until finely chopped., Place chicken on a platter. Top with salsa and parsley. Serve with potato mixture.

name: Moroccan glazed vegetables with orange mint couscous
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'couscous'}, {'quantity': '3 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'eggplant, diced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& pepper, to taste'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumins seeds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'carrot, thinly sliced diagonally (2mm thick)'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'mint, roughly chopped, plus extra leaves to garnish'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'light natural Greek-style yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'spinach leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'pine nuts, toasted'}]
steps: Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons oil in a large non-stick frying pan, over high heat. Add eggplant and cook until golden brown, tossing a few times to colour all sides. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Remove from pan and set aside on a plate., Return pan to medium heat and add remaining oil, coriander, cumin and onion and cook for 5 minutes, or until soft. Add carrot and cook for 3-5 minutes, or until tender., Meanwhile, in a shallow dish mix cous cous and raisins. Combine orange juice and water in a medium saucepan over high heat. Bring to the boil then pour evenly over cous cous. Cover and stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with fork and stir in half of the mint., Return eggplant to pan with onions and carrot, add stock and heat through. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until reduced slightly. Turn off heat, remove and stir in yoghurt until smooth. Fold in spinach., To serve, divide cous cous evenly among 4 plates and top with vegetables. Garnish with remaining mint and pine nuts.

name: Hazelnut coffee cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(200g) hazelnut meal'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(150g) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(330g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(185ml) light olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) brewed Melitta Blue Mountain Style coffee'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '2 1/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(360g) icing sugar mixture'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brewed Melitta Blue Mountain Style coffee, extra'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter, extra'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'golden syrup'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 170°C. Grease a 20cm square pan. Line with baking paper. Combine the hazelnut meal, flour and baking powder in a medium bowl., Use an electric mixer to whisk eggs and 1 cup (220g) sugar in a large bowl for 10 mins or until light and fluffy and tripled in volume. Gradually add oil, beating on low speed to combine. Fold in hazelnut mixture. Stir in ¼ cup (60ml) of the coffee until combined. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 50 mins or until a skewer inserted in centre comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 mins before transferring to a wire rack to cool., Place remaining sugar and remaining coffee in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir for 3 mins or until sugar dissolves. Increase heat to high. Boil for 5 mins or until the coffee syrup thickens. Cool., Use an electric mixer to beat butter in a large bowl until very pale. Gradually add icing sugar, beating well after each addition. Beat in the extra coffee., Place the chocolate, extra butter and golden syrup in a saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring, until chocolate melts and mixture is smooth. Set aside to cool., Cut cake horizontally into 3 layers. Place 1 cake layer on a serving plate. Brush with coffee syrup. Top with half the icing. Continue layering with remaining cake layers, syrup and icing. Spread with chocolate mixture. Cut into pieces.

name: Slow-roasted leg of lamb with speck
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'leg of lamb'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, quartered'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, sliced'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'speck, cut into batons'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'thyme'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'rosemary'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'parsnip, halved lengthways, cut into 4cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'celeriac, peeled, cut into 4cm pieces (see note)'}, {'quantity': '850', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'potato'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', cut into 4cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white wine'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 170C or 150C fan-forced., Season lamb2.5kg leg of lamb. Heat oil1 tbsp olive oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook lamb, turning, for 10 minutes or until browned all over. Transfer with a large fork to a large baking dish or deep oven tray., Cook onion1 brown onion, quartered, garlic5 garlic cloves, sliced, speck125g speck, cut into batons, thyme5 sprigs thyme and rosemary3 sprigs rosemary, stirring, for 5 minutes or until golden. Transfer to baking dish (with any oil and juice)., Arrange vegetables500g parsnip, halved lengthways, cut into 4cm pieces|750g celeriac, peeled, cut into 4cm pieces (see note)|850g potato|3 carrot, cut into 4cm pieces around lamb. Pour over vegetable stock2 cups vegetable stock. Tightly cover with foil and roast for 5 hours or until lamb is very tender., Remove foil. Carefully tilt dish to spoon 1 1/4 cups cooking liquid into a jug. Increase oven to 220C or 200C fan-force. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden., Meanwhile, melt butter30g butter, chopped in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add flour1 1/2 tbsp plain flour and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. Slowly stir in wine1/4 cup white wine and cooking liquid until combined. Bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat and gently boil for 4 minutes or until sauce thickens. Check seasoning., Serve lamb with vegetables and gravy.

name: Ham, cheese and potato wheel
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'desiree potatoes, peeled, cut into 3cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'leg ham, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'camembert, cut into small wedges'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) sour cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'filo', 'name': 'pastry sheets'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'tomato medley mix, halved'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'continental parsley leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon-infused olive oil (see tip)'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan forced. Place the potato300g desiree potatoes, peeled, cut into 3cm pieces in a large saucepan and cover with plenty of cold water. Bring to the boil over high heat. Cook for 10-15 minutes or until just tender when pierced with a skewer. Drain then transfer to a heatproof bowl and set aside to cool completely., Add the ham400g leg ham, cut into 2cm pieces, camembert200g camembert, cut into small wedges, chives1/4 cup chopped fresh chives, sour cream125g (1/2 cup) sour cream and mustard2 tsp Dijon mustard to the bowl. Season then toss until combined., Lightly grease a 22cm (base size) round fluted tart tin with removable base with oil., Place the filo10 filo pastry sheets on a clean work surface. Cover with a dry tea towel then a damp tea towel (to prevent the filo drying out). Brush 1 filo sheet with a little butter. Fold in half crossways. Place over base and up side of prepared tin, allowing the filo to overhang side. Repeat with remaining filo and most of the butter80g butter, melted, overlapping sheets, to completely cover base and side of tin., Spoon the ham mixture into the filo case. Carefully fold over the overhanging filo to enclose filling. Brush with remaining butter and sprinkle with sesame seeds1 tbsp sesame seeds. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden. Set aside in pan for 10 minutes to cool slightly., Transfer the tart to a serving plate. Top with the tomato300g tomato medley mix, halved and parsleyFresh continental parsley leaves, to serve. Season and drizzle over the infused oil1 tbsp lemon-infused olive oil (see tip) to serve.

name: Sweet and sour pork
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eg', 'name': 'g'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cornflour'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pork fillet, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '440', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can pineapple pieces in natural juice'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'white vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onion, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, cut into 2.5cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'capsicum, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'jasmine rice, to serve'}]
steps: Whisk egg and half the cornflour together in a bowl. Add pork. Stir to combine., Drain pineapple, reserving 2 tablespoons of juice. Place remaining cornflour in a bowl. Add reserved juice. Stir until smooth. Add tomato sauce, soy sauce and vinegar. Stir to combine., Heat a wok over medium-high heat until hot. Add 1 tablespoon oil. Swirl to coat. Stir-fry pork, in batches, for 1 to 2 minutes or until browned. Transfer to a bowl., Add remaining oil to wok. Swirl to coat. Add onions and garlic. Stir-fry for 2 minutes or until softened. Add capsicum. Stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes or until capsicum starts to soften., Return pork and any juices to wok. Add sauce mixture and pineapple. Stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes or until sauce boils and thickens. Serve with steamed rice.

name: Planes, trains and automobiles cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'square banana cake (see Notes)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'green sprinkles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chocolate sprinkles'}]
steps: Make icing: Place the butter in a large mixing bowl. Use an electric beater to beat for 2 minutes or until very light and fluffy. Gradually add the icing sugar and beat until the mixture is very pale and fluffy. Gradually add the dark chocolate and beat until smooth and well combined., Use glue or tape to attach the fabric to the cake board to cover. Using the base of the cake pan as a guide, cut a square of non-stick baking paper., Use a serrated knife to trim top of cake to even the surface. Top with baking paper square to protect fabric from cake. Invert cake onto board., Use a spatula or flat knife to spread the icing evenly over the cake, making swirls on the top and smoothing the icing over the sides., Sprinkle green sprinkles around base of cake and on a little area on top of cake. Top with 4WD or train. Place plane and truck on cake. Place chocolate sprinkles in truck and around truck's base. Place candles in one area., Place double-sided tape along centre back of grosgrain ribbon. Attach a 4cm-wide strip of waxed paper to tape and press firmly. Place double-sided tape on back of patterned ribbon, then attach to front of grosgrain ribbon. Position around the cake, pressing gently. Trim ends to join at back.
nutrition: calories: 23, fat: 1g, carbs: 3g, protein: nan, servings: 25

name: Matt Sinclair’s Thai coconut soup with prawns
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400ml cans coconut cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'L', 'name': 'salt-reduced chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'stems', 'name': 'lemongrass, halved, bruised'}, {'quantity': '2.5', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': '-piece ginger, peeled, cut into matchsticks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'birdseye', 'name': 'chillies, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'coriander, leaves picked, roots reserved and bruised'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'makrut', 'name': 'lime leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'raw prawns, peeled leaving tails intact, deveined'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'oyster mushrooms, torn, or button mushrooms, quartered'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of sugar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of salt'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thinly', 'name': 'sliced long red chilli, to serve (optional)'}]
steps: Bring the coconut cream2 x 400ml cans coconut cream and stock1L salt-reduced chicken stock to the boil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add lemongrass2 stems lemongrass, halved, bruised, ginger2.5cm-piece ginger, peeled, cut into matchsticks, birdseye chilli2 birdseye chillies, halved lengthways and reserved coriander roots1 bunch coriander, leaves picked, roots reserved and bruised. Tear 4 lime leaves5 makrut lime leaves and add to the pan. Reduce heat to low and simmer gently for 10 mins., Add prawns1kg raw prawns, peeled leaving tails intact, deveined and mushroom100g oyster mushrooms, torn, or button mushrooms, quartered to the pan. Simmer for 2-3 mins or until prawns change colour. Remove from heat., Stir in the fish sauce2 tbsp fish sauce, lime juice1 tbsp lime juice, sugarPinch of sugar and saltPinch of salt. Taste and add more fish sauce, lime juice, sugar and salt if needed., Finely shred remaining makrut lime leaf. Remove lemongrass from soup and discard. Divide soup among serving bowls. Sprinkle with shredded lime leaf, coriander leaves and chilliThinly sliced long red chilli, to serve (optional), if using.

name: Pork cutlets with spiced pear and rhubarb chutney
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(330g) rhubarb, washed and chopped into 5cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pears', 'name': ', peeled, seeded, and coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'allspice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'salt', 'name': 'and cracked black pepper'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'olive', 'name': 'oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'pork', 'name': 'cutlets'}]
steps: Place the rhubarb, pears, allspice, brown sugar, vinegar and 1 tablespoon water in a large, deep frying pan over medium heat. Stir until sugar has dissolved, then simmer, stirring occasionally, for 5-8 minutes, or until pears are tender. Season with salt and cracked black pepper and set aside and keep warm., Heat a little olive oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Sprinkle the pork cutlets with salt and pepper. Cook cutlets for 3-4 minutes each side or until golden and cooked to your liking. Divide pork between serving plates with rhubarb chutney.

name: Orange & cherry rice custard
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '430g can creamed rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated orange rind'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '425g can cherries in syrup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '7cm cinnamon stick'}]
steps: Combine the rice and orange rind in a bowl. Divide among four 185ml (3/4-cup) capacity serving glasses. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge to chill., Meanwhile, place the cherries and syrup, and cinnamon stick in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until heated through. Use a slotted spoon to transfer the cherries to a heatproof bowl., Increase the heat to medium-high. Simmer for 6 minutes or until the syrup thickens. Set aside for 5 minutes to cool slightly. Discard the cinnamon., Pour the syrup over the cherries and toss to coat. Spoon the cherry mixture over the rice mixture to serve.

name: Coddled eggs with crunchy croutons and smoked salmon
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cubed firm white bread'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(6 tbsp) chopped herbs, (such as chives, parsley and thyme)'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach leaves'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'free-range eggs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) thick cream'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'smoked salmon'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 170°C., Toss bread cubes with oil and 2 tablespoons chopped herbs. Spread onto a baking tray and toast in oven for 8 minutes or until crisp and golden. Set aside., Wash spinach and, without draining, place in a saucepan over medium heat. Allow to wilt, remove from pan and rinse under cold water. Squeeze to remove excess water, then season., Butter 6 small heatproof glasses or egg coddlers*. Divide spinach between them, break an egg into each and drizzle with cream. Sprinkle with remaining herbs and season with salt and pepper. Cover each glass tightly with foil (or clip lids, if using coddlers) and place in a saucepan of simmering water so water comes halfway up the sides. Simmer for 6 minutes, remove from heat and leave eggs to sit in the water for another 4 minutes., Place eggs onto serving plates in their glasses, serve with the croutons and smoked salmon.

name: Balsamic chicken bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '12', 'unit': '(', 'name': '2kg) chicken thighs (bone in, skin on), trimmed'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chat potatoes, quartered'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red onions, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, unpeeled'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'thyme sprigs'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) Coles balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/200°C fan-forced. Arrange chicken12 (2kg) chicken thighs (bone in, skin on), trimmed, potato600g chat potatoes, quartered, onion2 medium red onions, cut into thin wedges, garlic6 garlic cloves, unpeeled and thyme6 fresh thyme sprigs in two large roasting dishes. Whisk vinegar1/4 cup (60ml) balsamic vinegar, oil2 tbsp olive oil and sugar2 tsp brown sugar in a jug until sugar has dissolved. Drizzle over chicken mixture. Season with salt and pepper., Bake for 40 minutes. Add tomatoes250g cherry tomatoes. Bake for 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve chicken thighs with vegetables. Cover and refrigerate any leftovers for dinner the next night (see notes).

name: Mexican street corn tacos
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'corn', 'name': 'cobs, husks and silk removed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'yellow', 'name': 'bullhorn chillies'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Australian Sweet Baby\xa0Capsicums'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(180g) sour cream'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'corn', 'name': 'tortillas, warmed on barbecue'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(160g) shaved red cabbage'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'avocado', 'name': ', stoned, peeled, sliced'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(150g) crumbled fetta'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chilli powder (optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander sprigs'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'jar Coles Mexico Peppers Salsa\xa0Verde'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Prepare a barbecue grill or chargrill for high heat. Brush corn, chillies and capsicums with oil. Season with salt. Barbecue corn for 12-14 mins or until blackened in spots and cooked through. Cool slightly. Cut kernels from corn cobs. Season with salt., Meanwhile, barbecue the chillies and capsicums for 6-8 mins or until tender and charred all over. Remove and discard the stems and seeds, then cut into strips., Spread the sour cream over tortillas and arrange on a serving platter. Top with cabbage, corn, chillies, capsicums, avocado and fetta. Sprinkle with chilli powder, if using, and coriander. Serve with the salsa verde and lime wedges.

name: Classic lamb roast
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.4', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Coles lamb leg roast boneless'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'wholegrain mustard'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'chat potatoes'}, {'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'pumpkin, peeled, cut into large coarse pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'hot water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'apple cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'frozen peas'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 190C. Place the lamb in a large roasting pan. Spread the mustard over the lamb. Place the potatoes and pumpkin around the lamb (place some of the vegetables in a separate baking dish if the pan is overcrowded). Drizzle the oil over the lamb and vegetables. Roast for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Set aside, covered, for 10 minutes to rest., Meanwhile, place the water and sugar in a small bowl. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add the apple cider vinegar and mint. Season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine., Cook the beans and peas in a large saucepan of boiling water for 2-3 minutes or until tender. Drain., Slice the lamb. Divide the lamb and vegetables among serving plates. Spoon the mint sauce over the lamb.

name: Creamy chicken, artichoke and pesto pot pies
ingredient: [{'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken breast fillets, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '170', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'jar marinated artichoke hearts, drained, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'basil pesto'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'quantity', 'name': 'Béchamel Sauce (see related recipe)'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eg', 'name': 'g'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'frozen puff pastry'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/200°C fan-forced. Grease 4 x 1½-cup-capacity ovenproof dishes. Place prepared dishes on a large baking tray lined with baking paper., Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onion. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add chicken. Cook, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until chicken is lightly browned. Stir in artichoke, Basil Pesto and Béchamel Sauce. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Stir in peas., Whisk egg and milk together in a small bowl. Using the top of 1 dish as a guide, cut 2 circles from each pastry sheet, cutting the circles 5mm larger than the dish, Divide chicken mixture among prepared dishes. Top with pastry, pressing edges with a fork to seal. Brush tops with a little egg mixture. Cut a cross into the top of each pie. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and season with salt and pepper. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until pastry is golden and puffed. Serve.

name: Lemon-pepper crusted fish & vegie tray bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'beetroot bulbs, trimmed, peeled, halved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'baby carrots, peeled'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '200g each) firm white fish fillets'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) dried breadcrumbs (seasoned)'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'low-fat feta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C. Place beetroot and carrots in a large roasting pan. Spray with olive oil. Season. Bake for 40 minutes or until tender. (See note.), Arrange the fish fillets among the vegetables in the pan. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs on top of each fish fillet, pressing firmly to coat. Spray with olive oil. Bake for 15 minutes or until the fish flakes when tested with a fork., Sprinkle the feta and mint over the fish and vegetables.

name: Cos with garlic mayonnaise
