ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'cos lettuce'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) good-quality mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 tbsp) lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'grated lemon rind'}]
steps: Remove and discard outer lettuce leaves. Wash and dry the lettuce and place in a clip-lock jar., For the garlic mayonnaise, combine remaining ingredients, season, then pour into a small clip-lock jar., To serve, dip cos leaves into the mayonnaise.

name: Lentil & tomato salad with garlic lebanese bread
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '25cm diameter) Lebanese bread'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Combine the oil and garlic in a small bowl. Cut the Lebanese bread into wedges and use a small pastry brush to brush all over with the oil mixture., Place the bread wedges on 2 baking trays and bake in a preheated oven for 7 minutes or until crisp and golden., Meanwhile, to make the lentil and tomato salad, place the lentils in a sieve and rinse well under cold running water. Drain well and place in a large bowl. Add the tomatoes, parsley and onion to the lentils. Toss to combine., To make the dressing, place the oil, lemon juice, garlic, lemon rind and cumin in a small bowl, and whisk to combine. Taste and season with salt and pepper., Pour the dressing over the lentil salad and toss to combine. Serve with wedges of garlic bread.

name: Chicken breasts with feta and rocket
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '180g each) chicken breast fillets, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'feta, cut into 8 thin slices'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) rocket leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can diced tomatoes with oregano and basil (we used Val Verde brand)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pitted kalamata olives'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'small basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '1 1/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'dried risoni pasta'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'steamed', 'name': 'broccolini, to serve'}]
steps: Place chicken breasts on a cutting board. Using a knife, butterfly chicken. Open out flat. Place 2 slices of feta on one side of each breast. Top with rocket. Season with pepper. Fold over to enclose. Secure with toothpicks., Heat oil in a large, non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook chicken for 2 to 3 minutes each side or until golden. Add tomatoes. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 12 to 15 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Stir through olives and 1/2 cup basil. Season with pepper., Meanwhile, cook risoni in a saucepan of salted boiling water, following packet directions until tender. Drain., Place chicken on plates. Top with remaining basil. Serve with risoni and broccolini.

name: Mexican chilli beans
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red capsicum, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Mexican chilli powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'no added salt tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans no added salt red kidney beans, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can corn kernels, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'Basmati rice, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Avocado', 'name': 'slices, to serve'}]
steps: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until soft. Add capsicum and chilli powder. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 to 3 minutes or until capsicum is just tender., Add tomato paste, tomato, beans, corn and sugar. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 20 minutes or until mixture has slightly thickened. Divide rice and bean mixture between bowls. Top with parsley and avocado. Serve.

name: Choc cherry steamed pudding
ingredient: [{'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted, plus extra for greasing'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate, melted, cooled'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1 1/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '52g Cherry Ripe bars'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cocoa', 'name': ', for dusting'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thick', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}]
steps: Grease an 8-cup pudding bowl with extra butter. Line base with a circle of baking paper., Using an electric mixer, beat butter and sugar together until creamy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add cooled chocolate and milk, beating on low speed, until combined. Sift over flour and cocoa. Roughly chop Cherry Ripe bars, add to batter and gently mix until just combined. Fill prepared basin., Cover basin with a circle of greased baking paper and 2 circles of foil. Tie securely around rim of basin with kitchen string. Stand pudding on a trivet inside a large stock pot. Fill with enough hot water to come two-thirds up the side of basin. Simmer, covered, for 2.5 hours, until a skewer inserted comes out clean. Set aside to sit for 10 minutes, before inverting., Dust pudding with cocoa. Serve at room temperature in wedges with thick cream.

name: Lamb and cashew biryani
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'brown onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lamb mince'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Indian mild curry paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Basmati rice'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'stick'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sultanas'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, trimmed, halved diagonally'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'no-fat plain Greek-style yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cashew nuts, toasted, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'small fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}]
steps: Heat oil1 tbsp olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion1 medium brown onion, thinly sliced. Cook for 10 minutes or until light golden. Add mince400g lamb mince. Cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up mince, for 5 minutes or until browned. Add curry paste1/3 cup Indian mild curry paste. Cook for 1 minute or until fragrant., Add rice1 cup Basmati rice. Stir to coat in curry mixture. Add stock2 1/2 cups chicken stock, cinnamon1 cinnamon stick and sultanas1/4 cup sultanas. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, covered, for 10 minutes or until rice is just tender. Stir in spinach75g baby spinach and beans150g green beans, trimmed, halved diagonally. Cook for 2 minutes or until beans are tender. Serve biryani with yoghurt1/2 cup no-fat plain Greek-style yoghurt, nuts1/4 cup cashew nuts, toasted, roughly chopped and topped with parsley2 tbsp small fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves.

name: Turkey salad with chilli jam and toasted coconut
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(15g) shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'roast turkey, shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'white cabbage (about 1/2 regular cabbage or 1 mini cabbage), very finely shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'makrut', 'name': 'lime leaves, very finely shredded'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 150°C. For dressing, heat oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until golden. Add chilli flakes and cook for 1 minute, then add fish sauce and palm sugar and stir to dissolve. Remove from heat. Allow to cool. Stir in lime juice., Place coconut on an oven tray and toast for 5 minutes or until golden. Combine turkey, cabbage, herbs, toasted coconut and lime leaves in a large bowl and toss gently to combine., Add dressing to salad and gently toss to combine. Serve.

name: Honey peach and passion crumble
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'peaches, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'passionfruit', 'name': ', pulp removed'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla bean paste'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) honey'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) rolled oats'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) quinoa flakes'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) flaked coconut'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) natural sliced almonds'}, {'quantity': '45', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) wholemeal spelt flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'solidified coconut oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Low', 'name': '-fat Greek yoghurt or coconut yoghurt, to serve (optional)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Extra', 'name': 'passionfruit pulp, to serve (optional)'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan forced. Place the peach, passionfruit pulp, vanilla and 1 tablespoon of the honey in a 1.4L baking dish. Gently toss to combine., Combine oats, quinoa, coconut, almonds, flour and cinnamon in a large bowl. Add coconut oil. Use your fingertips to rub the oil into the flour mixture until combined. Drizzle over the remaining honey. Use fingertips to rub the honey into the flour mixture until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Sprinkle over the peach mixture. Cover with foil. Bake for 15 minutes. Bake, uncovered, for a further 30 minutes or until browned and peaches are tender. Serve with yoghurt and extra passionfruit, if using.

name: Broccoli and chilli pasta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried elbow pasta'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'broccoli, cut into small florets'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'feta, crumbled'}]
steps: Cook pasta in a saucepan of boiling, salted water, following packet directions, until tender, adding broccoli for last 4 minutes of cooking. Drain, reserving 1/4 cup cooking liquid., Return pasta and broccoli to pan. Add oil, garlic and chilli flakes and reserved cooking liquid. Toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with feta. Serve.

name: Cheesy chorizo-stuffed capsicums
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'finely', 'name': 'chopped chorizo'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'rocket, to serve'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '200g capsicums (2 yellow, 2 red)'}, {'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet microwave brown rice, warmed'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can black beans, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 ⁄3 cup) semi-dried tomato strips in oil, undrained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'zucchini, coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley leaves and stems'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'shallots, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 ⁄4 cup) Massel Vegetable Liquid Stock'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 ⁄4 cup) avocado oil'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan forced. Use a small sharp knife to cut the tops off the capsicums, reserving the lids. Use a teaspoon to scoop out the seeds and remove the membranes. Arrange the capsicum shells, cut-side up, in a small roasting pan., Heat a small non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Cook 2 finely chopped chorizo, stirring often, for 3 minutes or until golden. Combine with rice, beans, tomato strips, zucchini, parsley, lemon rind, shallot, garlic and stock in a large bowl. Season., Divide the rice mixture among the capsicum shells, pressing down lightly as you fill. Place reserved lids on top. Drizzle over the oil. Cover with foil., Bake for 25 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for a further 15 minutes or until the capsicum shells are just tender. Top the capsicums with baby rocket. Replace the lids to serve.

name: Chicken, hummus and tabouli wrap
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'barbecued chicken, shredded'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'bread'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Store', 'name': '-bought hummus, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Store', 'name': '-bought tabouli, to serve'}]
steps: Thickly spread four rounds of Lebanese bread with store-bought hummus. Top with store-bought tabouli and chicken. Roll up each bread round and wrap with baking paper. Slice in half and serve for lunch.

name: Chocolate cherry cheesecake trifle
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '85g packets 25% reduced sugar blackcurrant jelly crystals'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cream cheese, softened'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream, plus extra 600ml thickened cream to serve'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'icing sugar'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'block dark chocolate, melted, cooled'}, {'quantity': '415', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can stoneless black cherries, drained, halved'}, {'quantity': '480', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'double chocolate butter cake'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brandy'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Maraschino', 'name': 'cherries, to decorate'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Dark', 'name': 'chocolate shards (see note), to decorate'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cocoa', 'name': ', to decorate'}]
steps: Make jelly following packet directions. Pour into the base of a 14cm-deep, 20cm (16-cup-capacity) trifle bowl. Refrigerate for 4 hours or until set., Using an electric mixer, beat cream cheese, cream and icing sugar until mixture is light and fluffy, and well combined. With the motor running, add chocolate. Pat cherries dry on paper towel. Fold into cream cheese mixture., Cut cake into 4cm pieces. Arrange cake pieces on jelly. Drizzle with brandy. Dollop with cream cheese mixture. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 2 hours., Using an electric mixer, beat extra cream until just-firm peaks form. Dollop cream over trifle. Decorate with maraschino cherries and chocolate shards. Dust with cocoa. Serve.

name: Pork patties with gherkin dressing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'sebago potatoes (washed), unpeeled'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'pork mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) fresh breadcrumbs (made from day-old bread)'}]
steps: To make gherkin dressing, combine oil, gherkins, lemon juice, mustard and dill in a bowl. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Cover and set aside., Place potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to the boil over high heat and cook, uncovered, for 40 minutes or until tender. Drain and set aside for 15 minutes. Peel and place in a bowl. Use a potato masher to mash until smooth. Set aside for 15 minutes to cool., Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the pork mince and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up any lumps, for 8 minutes or until mince changes colour. Drain off any excess liquid and set aside for 15 minutes to cool., Add pork mince, onion and parsley to mashed potato and stir until combined. Season with salt and pepper. Divide the mixture into 16 portions and shape into 8cm patties., Place egg in a bowl. Place flour and breadcrumbs on separate plates. Lightly coat each patty in flour, shaking off excess. Dip in egg, then breadcrumbs, and place on a plate., Heat 125ml (1/2 cup) of the remaining oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add 5 patties and cook for 3 minutes each side or until golden brown and cooked through. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with remaining patties, in 2 batches, adding and reheating oil between batches., Serve the pork patties drizzled with the gherkin dressing.

name: Thousand-layer apple tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', juiced'}, {'quantity': '2.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Granny Smith apples'}, {'quantity': '215', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Double', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}]
steps: Place the lemon juice in a large glass bowl. Fill 3/4 full with water. Peel 1 apple and thinly slice into 3mm-thick slices using a mandolin. Transfer to lemon water. Repeat with remaining apples., Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan forced. Generously grease a 22cm (base measurement) springform cake pan with butter. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place a wire cake rack over the baking tray. Combine the sugar and cinnamon in a bowl. Drain half the apple slices and use a clean tea towel to pat dry., Layer the apple slices, overlapping in concentric circles in base of pan, to form an even layer. Sprinkle with 1 tbs of the sugar mixture. Repeat with the remaining drained apple slices, sprinkling with 1 tbs of sugar mixture between layers, and pressing down firmly with clean hands to compact. Drain remaining apple slices and continue layering with remaining sugar, until pan is full. Finish with a sprinkle of sugar. Place on prepared rack and bake for 30 minutes., Remove pan and tray from oven. Carefully release the springform pan slightly to allow pooled juices in pan to seep out. Reserve juices. Transfer pan to another tray. Reline baking tray with fresh baking paper (because the juices on the first paper might catch and burn) and top with wire rack. Place pan on wire rack. Brush generously with pan juices. Bake, basting with juices every 10 minutes and replacing paper every 30 minutes, for a further 1 1/2 hours or until dark golden and caramelised. Cool in pan for 20 minutes. Carefully release pan. Remove any apple slices that may have come up side of pan. Cool completely. Serve with double cream.

name: Passionfruit marshmallow pavlova
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'whites'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'cream of tartar'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cornflour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream, whipped'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'strawberries, hulled, quartered'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pulp', 'name': 'of 3 passionfruit'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 120C/100C fan-forced. Grease and line a baking tray with baking paper., Using an electric mixer, beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Gradually add sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating until dissolved between additions. Add cream of tartar, cornflour and vanilla. Beat for 30 seconds or until just combined., Spoon mixture onto prepared tray to form a 20cm circle. Use a spatula to make furrows up the side of pavlova., Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes to 1 hour 30 minutes or until pavlova is just firm. Turn off oven. Cool pavlova in oven with door slightly ajar., Place pavlova on serving plate. Dollop with whipped cream. Decorate with strawberries. Drizzle with passionfruit pulp. Serve.

name: Indian spiced nut mix
ingredient: [{'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) honey'}, {'quantity': '95', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) korma curry paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '160', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) almond kernels'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) salted peanuts'}, {'quantity': '145', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) unsalted cashew nuts'}, {'quantity': '145', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) unsalted macadamia nuts'}, {'quantity': '170', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) raisins'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) flaked coconut'}]
steps: Combine the honey, curry paste and garlic in a large bowl. Add the almonds, peanuts, cashews and macadamias and stir until well combined. Place the nut mixture in a large oven bag and twist the opening to close., Place oven bag on the microwave turntable, adjusting until the nuts are in a single layer and the twisted opening of the bag is underneath (this will prevent the bag opening during cooking)., Cook on High/800watts/100%, shaking the bag every 2 minutes, for 8-12 minutes or until toasted. Remove from microwave. Spread the nuts in a single layer over a baking tray and set aside for 30 minutes to cool., Coarsely break up the nut mixture and place in a large bowl. Add the raisins and coconut, and stir until well combined.

name: Blood orange and ruby grapefruit punch
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'blood', 'name': 'oranges'}, {'quantity': '1.25', 'unit': 'L', 'name': 'fresh or packaged ruby grapefruit juice'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'lemonade'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'ice', 'name': 'cubes, to serve'}]
steps: Cut 2 blood oranges into thin slices, then cut each slice again to form half moon shapes. Squeeze the juice from remaining oranges and place in a large jug or mixing bowl. Add grapefruit juice and lemonade. Transfer the punch to a serving jug or punch bowl along with plenty of ice cubes. Add the blood orange slices and serve immediately.

name: Beef and ricotta lasagne
ingredient: [{'quantity': '650', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'carrot, peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sticks', 'name': 'celery, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'eggplant, cut into 1cm cubes'}, {'quantity': '700', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'btl Mutti Tomato Passata'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) beef stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'basil leaves, shredded plus extra small leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'to', 'name': '6 fresh lasagne sheets'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh ricotta'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'freshly grated nutmeg'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'salad leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 180C (160C fan-forced). Lightly spray a 2 litre (8-cup) capacity baking dish with oil., Spray a large non-stick frying pan with oil. Heat over medium-high heat. Crumble in half of the mince. Cook mince, breaking up any lumps with the back of a wooden spoon. Let liquid evaporate and set first batch aside on a plate. Reheat pan, cook remaining mince and remove onto plate., Add oil, garlic, onion, carrot, celery and eggplant to pan and cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until onion softens. Return mince to pan and add passata, stock and worcestershire. Bring to the boil, reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 15 to 20 minutes or until sauce has thickened and vegetables are tender. Remove from heat, season to taste and stir through basil and spinach., Alternate layers of meat sauce with the lasagne sheets (trimming to fit) and half the ricotta into prepared dish. In a medium bowl combine remaining ricotta with parmesan and season. Spread top layer with sauce and then top with ricotta parmesan mixture. Sprinkle with nutmeg., Cook lasagne in oven uncovered for about 25 to 30 minutes until top is golden and bubbling. Garnish top of lasagne with basil leaves and serve with salad.

name: Slow cooker chicken wings
ingredient: [{'quantity': '148', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'bottle Frank’s hot sauce'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) maple syrup'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Italian herbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'chicken wing nibbles'}]
steps: Spray a 4.5 litre (18-cup) slow cooker with oil., Place the hot sauce148ml bottle Frank’s hot sauce, maple syrup125ml (1/2 cup) maple syrup, butter20g butter, herbs1 tsp Italian herbs, coriander1 tsp ground coriander and paprika1 tsp smoked paprika in a medium frying pan and bring to the boil over high heat., Place the chicken nibbles1.5 kg chicken wing nibbles in the slow cooker. Pour over the sauce. Cook on HIGH for 2 hours (or LOW for 4 hours), turning chicken halfway through, or until chicken is tender. Use a slotted spoon to transfer the chicken, skin-side up, to a foil-lined baking tray., Skim the excess fat from the sauce in the cooker. Pour sauce into a medium frying pan and bring to the boil over high heat. Boil for 7 minutes or until sauce thickens and is reduced by two-thirds. Set aside., Preheat grill to high. Brush the sauce over the chicken. Grill for 5 minutes or until starting to char. Serve.

name: Spring apricot chicken with barley salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pearl barley'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '160g) eschalots, peeled, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '(', 'name': '400g) fresh apricots, each cut into 6 wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '800g) Steggles chicken breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pine nut mix (with slivered almonds), toasted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh mint leaves'}]
steps: Place barley3/4 cup pearl barley and 1 litre cold water in a large saucepan over high heat. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer for 35 minutes or until barley is tender. Drain. Refresh under cold water. Drain., Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add eschalots4 (160g) eschalots, peeled, thinly sliced. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until softened. Add garlic1 garlic clove, crushed. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until fragrant. Add wine1/2 cup dry white wine. Simmer for 5 minutes or until almost all the wine has evaporated. Add apricots5 (400g) fresh apricots, each cut into 6 wedges. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until combined. Add stock1 cup chicken stock and honey2 tsp honey. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 5 to 7 minutes or until apricots are tender and sauce has thickened. Season with pepper. Transfer to a bowl. Cover to keep warm. Wipe pan clean., Heat remaining oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken4 (800g) chicken breast fillets. Cook for 6 to 7 minutes each side or until golden and cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Cover with foil. Rest for 5 minutes., Place barley, almond mixture, parsley2 tbsp finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves and mint2 tbsp finely chopped fresh mint leaves in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine., Slice chicken. Divide barley between plates. Top with chicken. Spoon over apricot sauce. Serve.

name: Tamarind-roasted vegetables
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'kumara', 'name': ', peeled, cut into chunks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicums'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'yellow', 'name': 'capsicums'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onions, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggplant , cut into chunks'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', cut into thick chunks'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sunflower oil'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 190°C. For the tamarind paste, place all the ingredients in a food processor with 1/4 cup (60ml) boiling water. Blend to a thin paste, then set aside., Toss the vegetables in the oil, spread over a large baking tray (you may need to use 2 trays depending on the size of your oven), then roast for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and toss with the tamarind paste, then roast for a further 20-25 minutes until tender. Serve hot or at room temperature, garnished with the extra mint leaves.

name: Spinach, olive and bocconcini salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'thin', 'name': 'slices prosciutto'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '150g pkt baby spinach leaves'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pitted drained kalamata olives'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '150g) bocconcini, drained on paper towel, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C. Line a baking tray with non-stick baking paper. Place prosciutto on prepared tray. Bake in preheated oven for 7 minutes or until crisp. Remove from oven and set aside for 5 minutes to cool., Place the spinach in a large bowl. Add the olives, bocconcini and oil. Season with salt and pepper and gently toss until combined. Divide the spinach mixture among serving plates and top with prosciutto.

name: Creamy sweet potato and thyme bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'frozen potato cubes'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet frozen sweet potato cubes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'brown onion, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bulla Cooking Cream'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated tasty cheese'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dried breadcrumbs'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced. Place potato, sweet potato, onion, thyme and parsley in an 8-cup capacity ovenproof dish. Pour over cream. Sprinkle with cheese and breadcrumbs. Season with salt and pepper., Bake for 1 hour or until potato is tender, covering with foil if over-browning during cooking. Serve.

name: Smoked salmon tartines with red onion-caper relish
steps: To make the relish: In a small bowl, stir the onion, capers, lemon juice, dill, and mustard seeds. Season to taste with salt., To make the tartines: In another small bowl, mix the cream cheese, creme fraiche, and chives to blend. Season to taste with salt., Spread the cheese mixture over the toasted slices of pumpernickel and baguette. Cut each slice of the pumpernickel bread into 3 rectangular pieces. Top each with 1 salmon slice, and then top each with a generous spoonful of the relish. Transfer the tartines to a platter. Finely grate the lemon peel over each and serve.

name: Warm vegetable salad with creamy lime dressing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onions, halved, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'red rascal potatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'baby beetroot, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'Dutch (baby) carrots, trimmed, peeled'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'zucchini, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'light sour cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Maille dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'shredded fresh basil leaves'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced. Place onion and potatoes in a large roasting pan. Drizzle with oil. Toss to coat. Wrap each beetroot in foil. Add to pan. Roast for 1 hour., Add carrots and zucchini to pan. Toss in oil to coat. Roast for 20 minutes or until vegetables are browned and tender. Wearing gloves, remove beetroot from foil. Peel and cut in half., Meanwhile, combine cream, lime juice, mustard and basil in a bowl. Serve vegetables dolloped with cream mixture.

name: Chicken, leek and bacon pie
steps: To make the shortcrust pastry place flour and butter in a food processor and process until it resembles breadcrumbs. Add egg yolk, salt and enough iced water to just bring dough together (about 2–3 tablespoons). Pulse until mixture comes together. Turn out onto a clean work surface. Form into a disk and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 30 minutes., Preheat oven to 180C. For the pie filling, place butter and olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add leek. Cook for 2 minutes or until softened. Add bacon and cook for a further 5 minutes. Add chicken and thyme and cook for 5 mins or until chicken is just cooked through., Add flour and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Gradually stir in chicken stock and 1 1/2 cups (375ml) water. Bring to the boil, reduce heat to low and stir for 3-5 mins or until sauce has thickened. Stir in lemon juice and zest. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside to cool. Discard thyme sprigs., Roll pastry between 2 sheets of baking paper to 2mm thick. Cut 8 circles of pastry to line the base and sides of 8 x 7.5cm base pie tins. Divide mixture between tins and cover with another disc of pastry. Press pastry together and crimp the edges. Brush with egg, sprinkle with sesame seeds and bake for 25-30 mins or until the pastry is crisp and golden and the filling cooked through. Cool slightly. Remove pies from tins and serve with roasted baby carrots and steamed broccolini.

name: Fish and crisp chips
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'sebago potatoes, peeled, sliced into 1mm-thick rounds (see tip)'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'rice bran oil or vegetable oil, for deep-frying'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'flathead fish fillets, skin removed'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cornflour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 1/4', 'unit': 'to', 'name': '1 1/2 cups chilled water'}]
steps: Pat potato slices dry with a clean tea towel. Heat oil in a large saucepan or wok over medium-high heat until hot. Preheat oven to 160°C., Carefully add potato slices, 1 at a time, to hot oil. Deep-fry potato slices in batches, turning occasionally, for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden. Remove to a wire rack over a baking tray lined with paper towel. Keep warm in oven., Cut fish into serving-sized pieces. Pat dry with paper towel. Place 1/2 cup plain flour in a shallow bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Coat both sides of fish in seasoned flour., Sift remaining 1 cup plain flour, cornflour, baking powder and salt together into a large bowl. Stir in sugar. Make a well in the centre. Add 1 1/4 cups chilled water. Mix to form a thick batter, adding more water if necessary (the batter should be the consistency of thickened cream). Don't over-mix., Reheat oil in saucepan or wok over medium-high heat. Dip 1 piece of fish at a time in batter to coat. Cook 2 to 3 pieces at a time for 4 minutes or until golden and cooked through. Drain on a wire rack over a tray lined with paper towel. Keep warm in oven while cooking remaining fish., Season fish and chips with salt. Serve with tartare sauce (see related recipe).

name: Asian-glazed pork cutlets with orange and avocado salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'char siu sauce (see note)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': '(90g) honey'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '240g pork cutlets'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'white rice, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Mix together the char siu sauce, ginger, honey, lemon juice, sesame oil and 1/4 cup (60ml) water. Heat vegetable oil in a large non-stick ovenproof frypan over medium-high heat. Cook pork for 2 minutes each side or until golden. Pour over sauce, then transfer pan to oven and roast for 10 minutes, basting once, until cooked through., Meanwhile, for the salad, remove the orange peel and pith. Holding fruit in your hand (over a bowl to catch the juice), cut segments away from the membrane with a small knife. Squeeze remains to catch extra juice, then place segments in a bowl with avocado and watercress. Place oil, ginger and 2 tablespoons orange juice in a small jar, add salt and pepper, then shake well to combine. Toss salad with dressing., Remove pan from oven and place pork on a plate, loosely covered with foil, to rest. Return pan to stove on medium heat, and reduce sauce, stirring for 2-3 minutes until thickened. Drizzle sauce over pork and rice on plates and serve with salad.

name: Fast salmon, dill and potato frittata
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'brushed', 'name': 'potatoes, peeled, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Australian Free Range Eggs'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(185ml) thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped dill'}, {'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Coles Hot Smoked Salmon Fillets, skin removed, coarsely flaked'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(120g) frozen peas'}]
steps: Preheat grill on medium. Heat a greased 20cm (base measurement) non-stick frying pan over medium-low heat. Add half the potato and cook for 2 mins each side or until lightly golden and tender. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining potato., Whisk the eggs, cream and dill in a large jug. Season., Arrange half the potato over the base of the frying pan. Top with half the salmon and sprinkle with half the peas. Continue layering with remaining potato, salmon and peas. Pour over the egg mixture. Cook for 5 mins or until almost set. Cook under grill for 3 mins or until golden brown and set., Cut frittata into wedges and serve warm or at room temperature.

name: Pecan cake with butterscotch sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '310', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Madeira cake mix'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(180ml) milk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pecans, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) thin cream'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(110g) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla essence'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vanilla', 'name': 'ice cream to serve, (optional)'}]
steps: Preheat the over to 180°C. Lightly grease 20cm round cake tin, and line the base with non-stick baking paper. Prepare the cake mixture according to packet directions. Spoon half the mixture into the prepared tin, and sprinkle half the pecans over., Spoon the remaining mixture into the tin, and sprinkle the remaining pecans over the top. Use a wooden skewer to swirl the pecans through the mixture, then smooth the surface., Bake for 40 minutes, until skewer comes out clean when inserted into the centre. Stand for 5 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack. Invert the cake so that it is right side up., To make the butterscotch sauce: combine the cream, butter, brown sugar, and vanilla in a small saucepan. Stir over medium heat until melted and smooth, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 2 minutes. Cool slightly. To serve, cut the cake into wedges, place into serving dishes and drizzle with the warm sauce. Serve with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, if desired.

name: Sticky chicken with green curry noodles
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raw cashews'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'chicken', 'name': 'maryland'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'thai green curry paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '\\t chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '165', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': '\\t sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '\\tsnow peas, thinly sliced, lengthways'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': ', juiced, plus extra wedges to serve'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'rice vermicelli noodles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'green chilli, seeded, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}]
steps: Heat oil in a large frying pan on high heat. Cook cashews for 1-2 mins, stirring, until golden. Using a slotted spoon, remove cashews and drain on paper towel. Chop roughly., Cut chicken marylands in half to separate thigh and drumstick. Add to same pan, skin side down. Cook for 5 mins each side, until golden. Reduce heat to low and cook, covered, for 15-20 mins, turning once, until cooked through., Meanwhile, heat curry paste in a pan on medium for 1 min, until fragrant. Add stock and bring to boil. Add coconut milk and sesame oil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 mins, until thickened slightly. Add snow peas and cook for 1-2 mins, until just tender. Add lime juice and season to taste., Place noodles in a large bowl. Cover with warm water and soak according to packet directions. Drain and return to bowl with chilli and 2 tablespoon of coriander. Add coconut mixture and toss to combine., Drizzle honey over chicken and turn to coat. Cook for 2-3 mins, until chicken is sticky. Divide chicken between serving plates and top with cashews and remaining coriander. Serve with extra lime wedges.

name: Slow-cooker southern pork ribs
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Aussie pork ribs (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'beer'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'barbecue sauce'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'drops', 'name': 'tabasco sauce'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mashed', 'name': 'potato, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': ', to season'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Coleslaw', 'name': ', to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Corn', 'name': 'cobs, to serve'}]
steps: Cut ribs into 3 to 4 bone portions. Heat oil in a large, deep non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Season pork with salt and pepper. Add half the ribs to pan. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes each side or until browned. Transfer to the bowl of a 5.5 litre slow cooker. Repeat with the remaining ribs., Reduce heat to medium. Add onion and carrot. Cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add garlic. Cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add tomato, beer, barbecue sauce and tabasco sauce. Stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Pour over ribs. Cover with lid. Cook on low for 6 hours or until ribs are tender and falling from the bone., Serve with mashed potato, coleslaw and corn.

name: Baked fish fillets with wilted choy sum
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lime juice (You can use lemon juice if limes are not available.)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '130g white fish fillets (such as snapper or bream)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'shallots, trimmed, thinly sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) raw cashew nuts, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '500g bunches choy sum, washed, dried, cut into 10cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 210°C. Line a baking tray with non-stick baking paper., Place the lime juice, soy sauce and sesame oil in a small jug. Whisk to combine and set aside., Place the fish fillets, skin-side down, on the lined baking tray. Brush with some of the vegetable oil and sprinkle with the salt, pepper, green shallots and cashew nuts. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes or until the fish flakes when tested with a fork., Meanwhile, heat the remaining vegetable oil in a wok or large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the choy sum and garlic, and cook, turning constantly with tongs, for about 5 minutes or until the choy sum wilts., To serve, place the wilted choy sum on serving plates with a fish fillet. Drizzle with the dressing and serve immediately.

name: Roast lamb stuffed with orange, cranberry and rosemary
ingredient: [{'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(105g) fresh breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(40g) pecans, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'rosemary, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'orange', 'name': ', zested'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(45g) dried cranberries, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1.3', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Coles Australian Lamb Leg Roast Boneless'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'brushed potatoes, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'bacon, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Brussels sprouts, thinly sliced'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C. Melt 40g of the butter in a medium frying pan over medium-low heat. Add the onion and cook for 3 mins. Add half the garlic and cook for 1 min. Stir in the breadcrumbs and orange zest. Cook for a further 2-3 mins or until breadcrumbs are golden. Remove from heat. Stir in the dried cranberries and orange juice. Season., Remove the string from the lamb. Place, fat-side down on a clean work surface. Open out lamb to form one large piece. Place stuffing down the centre of the lamb. Roll up lamb firmly to enclose filling. Secure with kitchen string at 2cm intervals., Place lamb, fat-side up, in a large deep roasting pan. Brush with oil and season. Arrange potato around the lamb. Drizzle with remaining oil. Season. Roast for 1 hour or until cooked to your liking. Transfer lamb to a plate and cover with foil. Set aside for 20 mins to rest., Meanwhile, heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Cook the bacon, stirring, for 5 mins or until golden and crisp. Add the remaining garlic, remaining butter, brussels sprouts and 1/4 cup (60ml) water. Simmer for 3 mins or until brussels sprouts are tender., Remove the string from the lamb and slice. Serve with potato and brussels sprout mixture.

name: Roast turkey with apricot and hazelnut stuffing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'whole turkey'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'apricot conserve'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Gravy', 'name': ', to serve'}]
steps: Make Apricot and hazelnut stuffing; Place hazelnuts in a frying pan over medium heat. Cook, tossing occasionally, for 4 minutes or until golden and toasted. Transfer to a large heatproof bowl. Set aside. Melt butter in frying pan over medium heat. Add onion. Cook, stirring, for 10 minutes or until softened. Add garlic and sage. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until fragrant. Set aside for 5 minutes to cool. Add to hazelnuts. Stir in breadcrumbs and apricots. Season with salt and pepper. Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Remove and discard neck from turkey. Pat dry inside and out with paper towel. Loosely fill neck cavity with stuffing. Using toothpicks, secure skin over neck cavity to enclose stuffing. Fill large cavity with remaining stuffing. Secure skin over cavity with toothpicks. Tie legs together with kitchen string. Tuck wings under turkey., Place turkey on a greased wire rack in a large roasting pan. Pour 3 cups water into pan. Place 1/2 the conserve and 1/2 the honey in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on HIGH (100%) for 30 seconds or until melted. Brush turkey all over with honey mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Cover pan tightly with lightly greased foil. Roast turkey for 1 hour 20 minutes., Place remaining conserve and honey in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on HIGH (100%) for 30 seconds or until melted. Remove and discard foil from turkey. Roast for a further 1 hour 40 minutes, basting every 20 minutes with honey mixture, or until turkey is golden and juices run clear when thigh is pierced with a skewer (see note). Cover with foil. Stand for 15 minutes., Remove and discard string and toothpicks from turkey. Transfer to a platter. Serve with stuffing and gravy.

name: Pomegranate tabouli
ingredient: [{'quantity': '90', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) burghul'}, {'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3/4 cup) boiling water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh mint'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pomegranates', 'name': ', quartered, seeds removed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'shallots', 'name': ', trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}]
steps: Place the burghul in a large heatproof bowl. Add the boiling water and set aside for 10 minutes to soak. Drain., Add the parsley, mint, pomegranate seeds, shallot, oil and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. Mix until well combined.

name: Corn and shallot blini with smoked trout
ingredient: [{'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3/4 cup) skim milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '420g can corn kernels, drained'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'shallots', 'name': ', ends trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of salt'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': '(about 150g) smoked ocean trout'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Baby', 'name': 'rocket leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) extra light sour cream'}]
steps: Whisk together the milk and egg in a large jug. Combine the flour, corn, shallot and salt in a large bowl. Add the milk mixture to the corn mixture and use a balloon whisk to whisk until a smooth batter forms., Spray a large non-stick frying pan with olive oil spray to grease. Heat over medium heat. Place 6 tablespoonfuls of the corn mixture into the pan, allowing room for spreading. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until bubbles appear on the surface and the blinis are golden underneath. Turn and cook for a further 1 minute or until golden underneath. Transfer to a plate. Repeat, in 2 more batches, with the remaining corn mixture, spraying the pan with olive oil spray between batches, to make 18 blini., Cut each trout slice into 3 portions. Divide the blini among serving plates. Top with the trout, rocket and sour cream. Season with pepper to serve.

name: White chocolate eggnog
ingredient: [{'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3 cups) milk'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'yolks'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'white chocolate, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brandy (optional)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vanilla', 'name': 'Marshmallow Stars (see related recipe), to serve'}]
steps: Heat milk in a saucepan over medium heat until simmering., Meanwhile, use a balloon whisk to whisk the egg yolks and sugar in a large bowl until pale and creamy. Slowly pour the hot milk into the egg mixture, whisking constantly until combined., Transfer to a clean saucepan. Reduce heat to low. Cook, stirring, for 10 minutes or until the mixture thickens slightly. Remove from heat. Add the chocolate. Stir until the chocolate melts and the mixture is smooth. Stir in the brandy, if desired., Divide among serving cups. Serve with marshmallow stars.

name: Smoked trout fishcakes with pea & watercress salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'desiree potatoes, peeled, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Zest', 'name': 'and juice of 1 lemon'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped chives, plus extra to serve'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'smoked ocean trout, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'creme fraiche'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten with 1 tbsp water'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(50g) dried breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil, to shallow-fry, plus extra to drizzle'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'apple cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(160g) fresh peas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'watercress'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Extra', 'name': 'lemon wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Place potatoes in a large saucepan of cold salted water. Bring to the boil, then reduce heat to medium-high and cook for 15-20 minutes until tender. Drain and return to the pan. Heat gently, stirring, for 30 seconds to remove any excess water. Cool slightly, then roughly mash., Add lemon zest, chives, ocean trout and 2 tbs creme fraiche, then stir to combine., Season well, then cover with plastic wrap and chill for 15 minutes., Form mixture into 12 balls and flatten slightly to form 3cm-thick patties. Coat with egg wash, then roll in breadcrumbs., Heat 2cm oil in a frypan over medium heat and, in batches, shallow-fry the fishcakes for 1 1/2 minutes each side or until crisp and golden. Drain on paper towel and keep warm., Meanwhile, whisk Dijon mustard, apple cider vinegar and remaining creme fraiche in a bowl, season and set aside. Combine peas and watercress in a bowl. Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil, then season., Serve fishcakes with salad, creme fraiche dressing, lemon wedges and extra chives.

name: Salted caramel smoothie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'frozen', 'name': 'bananas, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'raw', 'name': 'cashews, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'dates, pitted, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(500ml) So Good Unsweetened Almond Milk'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Sanitarium Natural Crunchy Peanut Butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'ice cubes'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chopped', 'name': 'banana, extra, to serve (optional)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cashew', 'name': ', extra, to serve (optional)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Date', 'name': ', extra, to serve (optional)'}]
steps: Place banana, cashew, date, almond milk, salt, peanut butter and ice in a blender and blend until smooth., Divide between serving glasses. Decorate with extra banana, cashew and date, if desired.

name: Chicken pad Thai
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried rice stick noodles'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'rice bran oil'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles RSPCA Approved Chicken Thigh Fillets, fat trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, cut into matchsticks'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'shallots', 'name': ', cut into 3cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow peas, trimmed, halved'}, {'quantity': '240', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'jar pad Thai paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '65', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) bean sprouts, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) roasted unsalted peanuts'}]
steps: Prepare the noodles250g dried rice stick noodles following packet directions. Drain., Heat 1 teaspoon of the oil1 1/2 tbsp rice bran oil in a wok over high heat until just smoking. Stir-fry half the chicken350g Chicken Thigh Fillets, fat trimmed, thinly sliced for 3 minutes or until cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with the remaining chicken., Heat remaining oil in the wok over medium heat. Stir-fry carrot1 carrot, peeled, cut into matchsticks and shallot4 shallots, cut into 3cm lengths for 1 minute. Add snow peas150g snow peas, trimmed, halved and pad Thai paste240g jar pad Thai paste. Stir-fry for 1 minute or until vegetables are tender crisp. Make a well in the centre. Add egg2 eggs, lightly whisked. Stir-fry for 1 minute or until egg is almost cooked. Add noodles and chicken. Stir-fry for 1 minute or until combined. Top with the bean sprouts65g (1 cup) bean sprouts, trimmed, coriander1/2 cup fresh coriander leaves and peanuts55g (1/3 cup) roasted unsalted peanuts.

name: Seafood salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'mixed fresh herb leaves (mint, basil, parsley)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': ', rind finely grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'baby squid hoods, cleaned, scored, cut into 4cm pieces, tentacles reserved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'heart, thinly sliced, leaves reserved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed baby tomatoes, halved if large'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'radishes', 'name': ', thinly sliced, plus extra, halved'}, {'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'cooked prawns, peeled, deveined, tails intact'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan forced. Line a baking tray with baking paper., For the dressing, place the tomato, cut-side down, on prepared tray. Drizzle with 2 tsp oil. Season. Roast for 25 minutes or until tender. Transfer to a sieve set over a bowl. Use the back of a spoon to push through the sieve to extract juice. Discard solids. Combine the lime juice, vinegar, sugar, 1/3 cup tomato puree and remaining oil in a bowl. Season well. Reserve 1/4 cup of the dressing., Finely chop 2 /3 cup of the fresh herbs. Combine the chopped herbs, rind, garlic and reserved dressing in a bowl. Combine the squid and oil in a separate bowl. Season., Preheat a barbecue or chargrill on medium-high. Cook the squid, turning, for 2 minutes or until just cooked through. Add to the herb mixture. Toss to coat., Combine the celery, celery leaves, onion, tomato, radishes, prawns, squid mixture, remaining herbs and half the dressing in a bowl. Toss to combine. Transfer to a plate. Serve with remaining dressing on the side.

name: Curried vegetable pilaf
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'balti curry paste'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'Basmati rice'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '420', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet stir-fry vegetable mix'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh coriander, leaves picked'}]
steps: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Add curry paste. Cook for 1 minute or until fragrant., Stir in rice to coat. Add coconut milk and 1 cup cold water. Bring to the boil. Cover. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 15 minutes or until the liquid has been absorbed. Stir in vegetable mix. Set aside, covered, for 5 minutes to steam., Stir in half the coriander. Divide between serving bowls. Sprinkle with remaining coriander. Serve.

name: Korma pork burger
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Australian Pork Mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'korma curry paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Greek-style yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber, halved lengthways, seeded, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'radishes', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', zested'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped mint'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Greek-style yoghurt, extra'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Coles Australian Baby Spinach'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Brioche Buns, split, toasted'}]
steps: Combine the mince, curry paste and yoghurt in a large bowl. Divide the mixture evenly into 4 portions and shape into patties., Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Cook the patties for 4 mins each side or until browned and cooked through., Meanwhile, combine the cucumber, radish, spring onion, lemon zest, mint and extra yoghurt in a small bowl., Place bun bases on serving plates. Top with spinach, patties and cucumber mixture. Season. Top with bun tops to serve.

name: Brekkie sandwich
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'button mushrooms, sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground pepper'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sliced leg ham'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'thick white bread'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach leaves'}]
steps: Heat the oil and 30g of the butter in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and cook, stirring often, for 8-10 minutes or until soft and golden. Season well with salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowl. Cover with foil to keep warm., Heat remaining butter in the frying pan over medium-high heat. Crack eggs into pan and cook for 2-3 minutes or until bases are crisp and golden. Turn over and cook for a further 1 minute, if desired. Remove from the pan and keep warm. Add ham to pan and cook for 1-2 minutes each side or until light golden and warmed through., Meanwhile, toast bread. Butter one side of each slice of bread. Top 4 slices with the spinach leaves, mushrooms, ham and egg. Serve the second slice of toast off to the side. Serve immediately.

name: Berry granola fro-yo bark
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen mixed berries, thawed'}, {'quantity': '1 1/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'Tamar Valley Greek Style All Natural Yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'crispy oat clusters with strawberries'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '10g packet freeze-dried strawberries'}]
steps: Grease a 20cm x 30cm lamington pan. Line base and sides with baking paper, extending paper 2cm above edges of pan., Place berries in a small food processor. Process until puréed. Spread yoghurt thinly over base of prepared pan. Using a small teaspoon, dollop berry purée over yoghurt. Using a butter knife, swirl berry purée through yoghurt to create a marbled effect. Sprinkle with oat clusters., Crumble about 1 tablespoon dried strawberries into a bowl to form a fine powder. Sprinkle remaining dried strawberries over yoghurt mixture (break any large strawberries in half). Dust with strawberry powder. Freeze, uncovered, for 6 hours or overnight. Roughly break into pieces. Serve immediately.

name: White chocolate panna cotta with rosewater syrup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thick cream (48% milk fat)'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'cream'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'good-quality white chocolate'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'leaf gelatine*'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Dried', 'name': 'rose petals, to decorate*'}]
steps: Place the creams, sugar and vanilla in a saucepan over medium heat and stir until sugar dissolves. Add chocolate, turn off heat and stand for a few minutes until chocolate dissolves., Soak the gelatine in cold water for 5 minutes until soft. Drain and squeeze out excess water. Add to cream mixture and stir until well combined. Strain and set aside to cool slightly before pouring into moulds. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours., Meanwhile, to make the syrup, place sugar and 1/2 cup of water in a pan and bring to the boil, stirring constantly until sugar dissolves. Reduce heat to low, add the rosewater and simmer for 10 minutes until thickened slightly. Stir in food colouring and set aside to cool., Dip base of each mould very briefly in warm water and turn out onto serving plates. Drizzle with syrup and decorate with dried rose petals.

name: Salmon & lime kebabs
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'shallots', 'name': ', ends trimmed, cut into 3cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '840g) skinless salmon fillets, cut into 2.5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'limes', 'name': ', cut into thin wedges'}]
steps: Preheat your barbecue or chargrill on medium-high., Thread shallot, salmon and lime wedges onto 1 skewer., Repeat to make 12 kebabs., Cook the kebabs for about 2-3 minutes each side for medium or cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate, cover with foil and set aside for 5 minutes to rest.

name: Coconut choc-chip cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cocoa powder, sifted'}, {'quantity': '2 1/3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'desiccated coconut'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk choc chips'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chocolate', 'name': 'chips, chopped, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180 ̊C/160 ̊C fan-forced. Grease a 9cm-deep, 11.5cm x 20cm (base) loaf pan. Line base and sides with baking paper, extending 2cm above edges of pan., Using an electric mixer, beat butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating until combined after each addition. Add cocoa powder. Beat until combined. Stir in flour, coconut and milk, in 2 batches, until combined. Stir in choc chips. Spoon mixture into prepared pan. Smooth top with a spatula., Bake for 1 hour or until a skewer inserted in the centre of cake comes out clean. Stand in pan for 10 minutes. Lift onto a wire rack to cool completely., Make Chocolate icing: Combine icing sugar and cocoa in a bowl. Gradually stir in hot water until mixture forms a smooth and spreadable consistency. Dollop icing over top of cake, spreading slightly to the edges. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Set aside for 1 hour to set slightly. Serve.

name: Spinach, bacon and tomato quiche
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'frozen shortcrust pastry, just thawed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'middle', 'name': 'bacon rashers, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Australian Free Range Eggs'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) Liddells Lactose Free Full Cream Milk'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60g) Liddells Lactose Free Shredded Cheese'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen spinach, thawed, excess water removed'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, halved if large'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'fennel', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'white wine vinegar'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Cut 1 pastry sheet in half. Place the 2 halves, slightly overlapping, over 2 sides of the whole pastry sheet. Press edges firmly to seal. Carefully line a 3.5cm-deep, 23cm (base measurement) fluted tart tin with removable base with the pastry. Use a sharp knife to trim excess pastry., Line the pastry case with baking paper. Fill with pastry weights or rice. Place on a baking tray. Bake for 10 mins. Remove the paper and weights or rice. Bake for 10 mins or until pastry is light golden., Cook the bacon and onion in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat for 3 mins or until onion is soft. Set aside to cool., Whisk the eggs, milk and cheese in a bowl. Season. Arrange the spinach and bacon mixture in pastry case. Pour over the egg mixture. Top with tomatoes. Bake for 30-35 mins or until filling is just set., Place the fennel, onion and rocket in a bowl. Add the oil and vinegar. Toss to combine. Season. Serve with the quiche.

name: Asparagus with sesame seeds and fresh herb tahini
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '9', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': '(about 1.5kg) asparagus, woody ends trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: To make the fresh herb tahini, place the tahini, yoghurt, parsley, coriander, water, lemon juice and vinegar in the bowl of a food processor and process until smooth. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a serving bowl., Cook the sesame seeds in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat, tossing, for 1 minute or until toasted. Transfer to a plate., Return the pan to medium-high heat. Add 1 teaspoon of the olive oil and half the asparagus. Cook, tossing constantly, for 3-4 minutes or until bright green and tender crisp. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with the remaining oil and asparagus, reheating pan between batches., Return the asparagus to the pan. Add the garlic and sesame oil and cook, tossing constantly, for 1 minute or until heated through. Drizzle with the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Arrange the asparagus on a warm serving platter and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve with fresh herb tahini and lemon wedges.

name: All-in-one-pan beef stroganoff
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef rump steak, trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onion, halved, cut into thick wedges'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cup mushrooms, halved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika, plus extra to serve'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'beef stock'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried angel hair pasta'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', cut into ribbons'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sour cream'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, to serve'}]
steps: Heat 1/2 the oil2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook beef600g beef rump steak, trimmed, thinly sliced, in 2 batches, for 4 minutes or until just browned. Transfer to a heatproof bowl., Heat remaining oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add onion1 large brown onion, halved, cut into thick wedges and mushroom200g cup mushrooms, halved. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until onion starts to brown. Add garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed and paprika1 tbsp smoked paprika, plus extra to serve. Cook, stirring, for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add Worcestershire sauce2 tbsp Worcestershire sauce and tomato paste2 tbsp tomato paste. Stir to coat. Add stock3 cups beef stock and 2 cups water. Bring to the boil. Add pasta300g dried angel hair pasta. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until pasta is tender., Return beef to pan with zucchini2 zucchini, cut into ribbons. Stir. Cook for a further 2 minutes or until heated through. Stir in 1/2 the sour cream2/3 cup sour cream. Serve stroganoff topped with remaining sour cream, and sprinkled with parsley1/4 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, to serve and extra paprika.

name: Roasted tomatoes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'cherry truss tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/200°C fan-forced. Line a large baking tray with baking paper. Place tomatoes on tray. Drizzle with oil and vinegar. Season with pepper., Roast for 15 minutes or until tomatoes just start to collapse. Serve. Use scissors to cut the truss into portions.
nutrition: calories: 79, fat: 4.6g, carbs: 7.7g, protein: nan, servings: 8

name: Shepherd's pie 'muffins'
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sebago potatoes, peeled, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'slice', 'name': 'white bread'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lamb mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chopped', 'name': 'fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salad', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add onion, carrot, garlic and thyme. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Set aside to cool completely., Meanwhile, place potatoes in a saucepan. Cover with cold water. Season with salt. Bring to the boil. Boil, covered, for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain. Return to pan. Cook over low heat for 1 minute to evaporate any liquid. Remove from heat. Add 30g butter and 1/2 the milk. Using a potato masher, mash until smooth., Meanwhile, place bread on a small plate. Drizzle with remaining milk. Stand for 1 minute. Squeeze out excess milk. Tear into small pieces. Place bread, mince, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce and cooled onion mixture in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Mix to combine., Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Line base and sides of 4 holes of a 3⁄4-cup-capacity Texas muffin pan, crossways, with two 4cm x 22cm strips of baking paper. Divide lamb mixture among prepared holes. Press down with the back of a spoon to compact. Place pan on a baking tray lined with foil. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Top with mashed potato. Dot with remaining butter. Increase oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced. Bake for 20 minutes or until cooked through and mashed potato is golden. Stand in pan for 10 minutes before transferring to serving plates. Sprinkle with parsley and serve with salad leaves.

name: Mushroom, capsicum and goat's cheese tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'large Portobello mushrooms, cut into 1cm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fresh thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) milk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions (shallots), thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'filo pastry'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chargrilled capsicum, cut into 1cm-thick strips'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': "goat's cheese, cut into 2cm pieces"}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C. Line a 20 x 30cm slice pan with baking paper, allowing long sides to overhang., Heat half the oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook mushroom, thyme and garlic, stirring occasionally, for 3-4 minutes or until the mushroom is browned. Add the vinegar. Cook for 1 minute or until liquid evaporates., Whisk eggs, milk and spring onion in a bowl until combined. Season., Place the filo on a clean work surface.
