Cover with a clean tea towel, then a damp tea towel (this prevents it from drying out). Brush 1 filo sheet with oil. Place another filo sheet on top, overlapping, to form a 30cm-wide rectangle. Brush with oil. Repeat with the remaining filo sheets and oil to make a filo stack. Line the prepared pan with the filo stack., Place half the mushroom mixture in the pan. Add egg mixture. Top with capsicum, goat’s cheese and remaining mushroom mixture. Season with pepper. Scrunch in the filo edges., Bake for 15 minutes or until filo is golden and crisp. Cover with foil. Bake for a further 10 minutes or until just set. Cool in pan for 10 minutes.

name: Sweet potato gems
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': '(about 3-4) sweet potato, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '45', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) chickpea (besan) flour'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mint', 'name': '-garlic yoghurt, to serve (see note)'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan forced. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper. Place sweet potato, cut side down, on 1 prepared tray. Bake for 40 minutes or until soft and tender. Set aside for 5 minutes to cool slightly., Peel off skin from sweet potato and discard. Process sweet potato flesh and garlic in a food processor until smooth. Season well. Add flour and process briefly to combine. Transfer to a disposable piping bag or large resealable plastic bag., Snip the tip of the piping bag or corner of bag to form a 2cm hole. Pipe sweet potato mixture onto remaining baking tray to form 4 x 2cm wide, 30cm long logs. Place in the freezer for 2 hours or until firm., Meanwhile, for the coating combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Season., Use a small sharp knife to cut sweet potato logs at 2cm intervals. Spray with oil to completely coat. Working in batches, toss in quinoa mixture to coat, and return to baking tray. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until golden and crispy., Serve hot sweet potato tots with mint-garlic yoghurt.

name: Poached pears with chocolate risotto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'L', 'name': '(4 cups) water'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'cinnamon stick'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '550g) just ripe beurre bosc pears, peeled leaving stems intact'}]
steps: Place the water, sugar and cinnamon stick in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring with a wooden spoon, for 2 minutes or until the sugar dissolves. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and add the pears. Simmer, covered, for 20 minutes or until pears are tender. Remove from heat and set aside in the poaching liquid at room temperature for 1 hour to allow the flavours to develop., To make the chocolate risotto, bring the milk just to the boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and hold at a gentle simmer. Heat the butter in a medium heavy-based saucepan over medium heat until foaming. Add the rice and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until the grains appear slightly glassy. Reduce heat to medium-low and add a ladleful (about 125ml/ 1/2 cup) of the simmering milk to the rice and stir constantly with a wooden spoon until all the liquid is absorbed. Continue to add the milk, a ladleful at a time, stirring constantly, allowing the liquid to be absorbed before adding more. The rice will take about 40 minutes to cook. Once the last ladleful of milk is just absorbed, the rice should be tender yet firm to the bite, and the risotto creamy., Add the chocolate and sugar, and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until chocolate melts and mixture is well combined., Spoon chocolate risotto into shallow serving bowls. Cut each pear in half lengthways and place on the risotto. Serve immediately.

name: Battered prawns on chickpea, chilli and avocado salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vegetable', 'name': 'oil, to deep-fry'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of salt'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) ice water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 'whites, lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'king prawns, peeled leaving tails intact, deveined'}]
steps: To make the chickpea, chilli & avocado salad, combine the chickpeas, tomato, avocado, onion, coriander, lemon juice, garlic and chillies in a bowl. Taste and season with salt. Set aside until required., Add enough oil to a large, deep frying pan to reach a depth of 4cm. Heat to 190°C over high heat (when oil is ready a cube of bread will turn golden brown in 10 seconds)., Meanwhile, combine the flour, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. Gradually whisk in the water and egg white until a smooth batter forms. Dip half the prawns, 1 at a time, into the batter to evenly coat. Deep-fry for 2 minutes or until curled, golden brown and cooked through. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel. Season with salt. Repeat with the remaining prawns and batter, reheating oil between batches., Spoon the chickpea, chilli & avocado salad among serving plates. Top with prawns and serve immediately.

name: Spiced poached pears
ingredient: [{'quantity': '220', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) red wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'sticks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bay', 'name': 'leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'vanilla', 'name': 'bean, split'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'firm', 'name': 'pears, peeled, halved, cored'}]
steps: Place sugar, wine, cinnamon, bay leaves and vanilla in a pan and bring to a simmer., Add pears and enough water to cover. Cook for 15-20 minutes or until just cooked (this will depend on ripeness of pears)., Remove pears, boil liquid until reduced by half, then pour over pears. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

name: Lamb, eggplant and bean bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': '(400g) eggplant, thinly sliced lengthways'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lamb mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chopped tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '420', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can Heinz® Beanz Creationz™ Mediterranean Style Beanz'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'potatoes', 'name': ', peeled, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) pizza cheese'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper. Lay eggplant on trays and drizzle with 2 tbs of oil. Season well and bake for 10-15 minutes, until tender., Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a pan on medium. Cook onion for 5 minutes, until softened. Increase heat to high and add lamb mince. Cook stirring constantly to break up any lumps, for 5 minutes, until brown. Add cumin and cinnamon and cook for 30 seconds until combined. Add tomatoes and Beanz Creationz™. Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, for 10 minutes., Microwave potatoes on high (100%) power for 5 minutes, until tender., Grease an 8-cup baking dish. Lay potatoes over the base of prepared dish. Top with a layer of eggplant and half of the mince mixture. Repeat eggplant and mince layers. Scatter over cheese and bake for 20 minutes, until golden. Serve with lemon wedges.

name: Zucchini carpaccio
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green zucchini'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'yellow zucchini'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': '(100ml) extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Juice', 'name': 'of 1 small lemon'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '225', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby rocket'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'shaved parmesan'}]
steps: Trim the ends of the zucchini and slice diagonally into wafer-thin rounds. Place in a bowl., Combine the oil, lemon juice and rind, and season with salt and pepper. Pour mixture over zucchini and leave for 5 minutes. Pile the rocket onto serving plates, then top with the zucchini and finish with the parmesan. Serve as a first course or as an accompaniment to simply grilled meat and fish.

name: Creamy beef and semi-dried tomato fettuccine
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fettuccine'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Australian Beef Round steak'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) cream'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(75g) semi-dried tomatoes, drained, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(120g) frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Flat', 'name': '-leaf parsley leaves, extra, to serve'}]
steps: Cook fettuccine following packet directions or until al dente. Drain., Meanwhile, preheat a barbecue grill or chargrill to medium-high heat. Season steaks. Cook for 2 mins each side. Transfer to a plate. Set aside, covered, for 5 mins to rest. Thinly slice., Heat oil in a medium frying pan over medium-low heat. Cook onion for 5 mins or until softened. Add garlic and cook for 1 min. Add cream, stock and semi-dried tomato. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 5 mins or until thickened slightly. Stir in peas and chopped parsley and cook for 2 mins or until heated through. Stir through fettuccine., Divide fettuccine mixture between serving bowls and sprinkle with extra parsley.

name: Scones with cardamom date spread
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '15', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3/4 cup) reduced-fat milk'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Extra', 'name': 'reduced-fat milk, for brushing'}]
steps: To make cardamom date spread, place dates250g pitted dates, chopped, sugar150g dark brown sugar, cardamom1/2 tsp cardamom seeds and water185ml (3/4 cup) water in a medium saucepan. Bring to the boil, stirring, over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, stirring often, for 10 minutes or until thick and glossy. (See microwave tip.) Spoon into a clean 250ml (1-cup) glass screw-top jar and seal immediately. Turn upside down for 2 minutes to sterilise the jar. Set aside right-side up until cooled to room temperature or serve while still warm., Preheat oven to 220°C. Sift the flour300g (2 cups) self-raising flour into a medium bowl. Use your fingertips to rub in the butter15g butter. Stir in the sugar2 tbsp sugar and make a well in the centre. Add the milk185ml (3/4 cup) reduced-fat milk and use a round-bladed knife to mix with a cutting action until the dough begins to come together., Use your hand to gently bring mixture together. Knead once or twice on a lightly floured clean surface until smooth. Pat out dough until 2.5cm thick. Use a round 5cm scone cutter dipped in flour to cut discs of dough. Place on a baking tray with edges touching. Gently re-knead and cut remaining dough. Brush tops with a little extra milkExtra reduced-fat milk, for brushing., Bake in preheated oven for 14-15 minutes or until golden and scones sound hollow when tapped. Serve warm with date spread.

name: Warm paneer and lentil salad with chutney dressing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'paneer, cut into 2cm pieces (see Notes)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'mild curry powder'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) sunflower oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can brown lentils, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'mango chutney'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'apple cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Naan', 'name': 'bread, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Yoghurt', 'name': ', to serve'}]
steps: Place paneer in a bowl and toss with 1/2 teaspoon curry powder and season with salt., Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a frypan over medium heat. Cook the paneer, turning, for 2-3 minutes until pale golden. Drain on paper towel and set aside. Add another 1 tablespoon oil to the pan and cook the onion for 3-4 minutes until softened. Add capsicum and garlic, and cook, tossing occasionally, for 2-3 minutes, then add the lentils and remaining 1/2 tsp curry powder. Cook for a further 1-2 minutes, season and stir until warmed through and combined. Remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly., To make the dressing, combine the chutney, vinegar and remaining 2 tbs oil, then season to taste., Combine the warm lentil mixture with spinach leaves and paneer, drizzle over dressing and serve with naan and yoghurt.

name: Pork belly with apple and pear relish
ingredient: [{'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Australian Pork Belly Roast Boneless'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt flakes'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fennel seeds'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onions, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'miso paste'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'apple'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'pear'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'apple cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely shredded mint'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 150°C. Place the pork on a clean work surface. Pat the rind dry with paper towel. Use a small sharp knife to score the rind. Brush the rind with oil and sprinkle with the salt flakes, fennel seeds and cumin seeds., Place onion in the base of a roasting pan. Combine the miso paste and stock in a jug with ¼ cup (60ml) water. Pour over the onion in the pan. Place pork, rind-side up, over the onion mixture in the pan. Cover and roast for 2 hours or until the pork is very tender., Increase oven to 230°C. Uncover the pork and roast for a further 30 mins or until the rind is crisp. Cover and set aside for 10 mins to rest., Meanwhile, core the apple. Cut in half and thinly slice. Place apple in a bowl. Repeat with the pear. Add vinegar, sugar, salt and mint to the apple mixture in the bowl and toss to combine., Thickly slice the pork and serve with the relish.

name: Cambodian fish curry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'coconut oil'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'firm white fish fillets, cut into 7cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '175', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby green beans, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': ', rind finely grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'rice, to serve (optional)'}]
steps: For the paste, place all the paste ingredients in a food processor and process until finely chopped and well combined, adding water if necessary. Transfer to a bowl., Heat oil in a wok or saucepan over medium-low heat. Add paste. Cook, stirring, for 4 minutes or until aromatic. Add coconut milk. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add fish. Reduce heat to low. Cook, covered, stirring once, for 5 minutes. Add beans. Cook, covered, for 3-4 minutes or until beans are tender crisp and fish is just cooked through., Stir in lime juice. Sprinkle with rind and coriander. Serve with rice, if using.

name: Avocado and prawn risotto (gluten-free)
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.25', 'unit': 'L', 'name': '(5 cups) vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(440g) arborio rice'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(165ml) dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green prawns, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80g) grated parmesan, plus extra to serve'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'avocado', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Juice', 'name': 'of 1 lemon'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roughly chopped chives'}]
steps: Place the stock1.25L (5 cups) vegetable stock in a saucepan, bring to the boil, then reduce heat to low and keep stock at a simmer., Meanwhile, heat the butter25g unsalted butter and olive oil1 tbsp olive oil in a deep frypan over medium heat, add the onion1 onion, finely chopped and cook, stirring, for 1-2 minutes until softened, but not coloured. Stir in the garlic3 garlic cloves, crushed, then add the rice2 cups (440g) arborio rice and cook, stirring, for 1 minute to coat the grains. Add the wine2/3 cup (165ml) dry white wine and allow the liquid to evaporate. Add the stock, a ladleful at a time, stirring occasionally, allowing each ladleful to be absorbed before adding the next. Continue until you have one ladleful of stock left - this should take about 20 minutes. Add the prawns500g green prawns, roughly chopped with the final ladleful of stock and continue to stir for 2-3 minutes until the prawns are cooked through. Stir in the parmesan1 cup (80g) grated parmesan, plus extra to serve, then cover and remove from the heat., Peel the avocados2 avocados, dice and toss in the lemon juiceJuice of 1 lemon. Just before serving, carefully stir the avocado mixture into the risotto. Serve in bowls topped with extra parmesan and chopped chives1/4 cup roughly chopped chives.

name: Italian potato salad wreath
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'baby potatoes, unpeeled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'zucchini, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'bottle Kewpie mayonnaise, well chilled'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'mini tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'pitted', 'name': 'green Sicilian olives, quartered lengthways'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'basil pesto'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': '-2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Small', 'name': 'fresh basil leaves, to sprinkle'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan forced. Line 2 large baking trays with baking paper. Trim the 2 ends of each potato, then cut each in half crossways so you have 2.5cm thick pieces. Place potato cut-side down on 1 of the lined trays. Spray well with olive oil and season. Roast for 35 minutes., Meanwhile, arrange the zucchini slices on the second lined tray. Spray well with oil and season. Combine the onion, vinegar, sugar and salt in a bowl. Set aside for 20 minutes to pickle., Add the zucchini to the oven with the potato and roast for 15 minutes or until potato is golden and tender. Remove vegetables from the oven and cool completely., Remove the red cap from the kewpie mayonnaise bottle. Pipe a dollop on the top of each potato slice. Arrange potato slices on their sides, just touching, around the edge of a large serving plate to form a wreath., Pipe small peaks of more mayonnaise on top (use picture as a guide). Top with zucchini, tomato and olives. Drain the onion mixture and arrange on top. Combine the pesto and enough oil to make it drizzle. Drizzle over the top of the wreath and scatter with basil leaves, to decorate. Serve.

name: Edamame fettuccine with walnut pesto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(70g) walnuts'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Coles Australian Baby Spinach'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(25g) finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Coles Australian Baby Rocket'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt edamame fettuccine'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Spread the walnuts in a single layer on a baking tray. Bake for 5-10 mins or until golden. Set aside to cool completely., Place half the walnuts in a food processor. Add the spinach, basil, garlic, parmesan and half the rocket. Process until finely chopped. Season. With the motor running, add the oil in a thin, steady stream until well combined., Meanwhile, cook the pasta in a large saucepan of boiling water following packet directions or until al dente. Drain well. Return pasta to the pan., Add the walnut mixture to the pasta in the pan. Toss to combine. Add the remaining rocket and toss to combine. Divide the pasta mixture among serving bowls. Season. Sprinkle with the remaining walnuts to serve.

name: Magical mini muffins
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eg', 'name': 'g'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted, cooled slightly'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'shaved ham, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated tasty cheese'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line two 12 x 1 1/2-tablespoon capacity mini muffin pans with foil or paper cases (press in to fit)., Sift flour into a bowl. Make a well in the centre. Using a fork, whisk egg and milk in a bowl. Add to flour with butter. Using a spatula or metal spoon, fold together until just combined., Add ham and cheese. Fold through until combined. Spoon mixture into cases. Bake for 15 minutes or until a skewer inserted into centre comes out clean. Serve muffins warm or at room temperature.

name: Cuban picadillo
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white quinoa, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Massel', 'name': 'Chicken Style Stock Cube, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'turkey mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'ripe', 'name': 'tomatoes, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'bottle tomato passata'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'dried', 'name': 'bay leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can red kidney beans, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pitted green olives, sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'chargrilled', 'name': 'corn cobs, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sour', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}]
steps: Bring quinoa, stock cube and 1 cup water to the boil in a saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Cook, covered, for 15 minutes or until quinoa is tender. Stand, covered, for 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork., Meanwhile, heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Increase heat to medium-high. Add mince. Cook, breaking up mince with a wooden spoon, for 6 to 8 minutes or until browned. Add cinnamon, cumin and cloves. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add tomato, passata, capsicum, vinegar, bay leaves, raisins, beans, olives and ½ cup water. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, uncovered, for 15 to 20 minutes or until thickened. Sprinkle with coriander. Serve with corn and sour cream.

name: Almond-crusted chicken with miso pumpkin mash
ingredient: [{'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'peeled pumpkin, cut into 2cm cubes'}, {'quantity': '55', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) almond meal'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'gluten-free cornflour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Chinese five spice'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) reduced-fat coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '(', 'name': '500g) chicken tenderloins, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'white miso paste'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow peas, steamed, to serve'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'broccolini, steamed, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan forced. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place pumpkin on prepared tray. Spray with oil. Bake for 25 minutes or until tender., Meanwhile, combine the almond meal, cornflour, sesame seeds and five spice in a large shallow dish. Place coconut milk in a seperate shallow dish. Working with 1 tenderloin at a time, dip into milk to coat, allow excess to drip off and then coat in almond mixture. Place on prepared tray. Repeat with remaining tenderloins., Heat oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook chicken for 2-3 minutes each side, until cooked through., Process the pumpkin and miso paste in a food processor until smooth. Season., Serve the crumbed chicken with the miso pumpkin mash, steamed snow peas and broccolini, and lemon wedges.

name: Balsamic vegies with ancient grains
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'baby broccoli'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'brown mushrooms, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'flat', 'name': 'mushroom, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed medley tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes (optional)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g pkts Coles 7 Ancient Grains microwavable rice'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Coles Australian Baby Rocket'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place baby broccoli, combined mushroom and tomatoes on the lined tray. Sprinkle with garlic and chilli, if using. Drizzle with oil and vinegar. Season. Roast, tossing halfway through cooking, for 15 mins or until vegetables are tender., Meanwhile, heat the rice following packet directions. Transfer to a serving plate., Arrange the vegetable mixture and rocket over the rice. Drizzle with the juices from the baking tray.

name: Barbecued steaks with grilled summer salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) dry red wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried thyme'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Australian Beef Fillet Steaks'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cup mushrooms, halved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'asparagus, trimmed, halved lengthways'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'wholegrain mustard'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'balsamic glaze'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Coles Australian Baby Spinach'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Bakery Stone Baked White Sourdough Vienna, sliced, chargrilled, to serve'}]
steps: Combine 1/4 cup (60ml) of the wine with the garlic, 1 tsp of the thyme and 1 tbsp of the oil in a medium bowl. Season. Add the steaks and turn to coat. Heat a barbecue grill or chargrill on medium-high. Cook the steaks for 3 mins each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil. Set aside for 5 mins to rest., Combine 1 tablespoon of the remaining oil with the mushroom, asparagus, green beans, tomatoes and remaining thyme in a bowl. Season. Cook the mushroom mixture on the grill for 2 mins or until just tender. Set aside for 5 mins to cool., Meanwhile, combine the remaining oil, remaining wine, mustard and vinegar in a large bowl. Season., Add the mushroom mixture and spinach to the dressing. Toss to combine. Divide the mushroom salad among serving bowls. Top with the steaks and serve with bread.

name: Cinnamon spiced hot chocolate
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cocoa powder, sifted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'litres', 'name': 'reduced-fat milk'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'sticks'}]
steps: Place cocoa and 1/2 cup milk in a large jug. Whisk until smooth. Gradually whisk in remaining milk. Pour into a saucepan. Add sugar and cinnamon sticks. Heat over medium heat until almost boiling. Remove from heat. Stand for 10 minutes., Remove and discard cinnamon sticks. Heat over medium heat until warm. Pour into warmed, heatproof cups. Serve.

name: Pulled lamb and warm lentil salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onions, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Coles Australian Lamb Whole Leg Roast'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can lentils, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed medley tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Coles Australian Baby Spinach'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley leaves'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 150C. To make the spice mix, combine paprika, coriander, chilli, cumin, ginger, allspice, cardamom, nutmeg and cloves in a bowl. Season., Arrange onion in the base of a large roasting pan. Stir the oil into the spice mix. Spread evenly over lamb to coat. Place lamb over the onion in the pan. Pour stock around the lamb and cover the pan tightly with foil., Roast, basting the lamb occasionally with the pan juices, for 4 hours or until the lamb is almost falling off the bone. Uncover the pan and increase oven to 180°C. Roast for 30 mins or until the lamb is golden brown., Arrange lentils, tomato and spinach around the lamb in the pan. Roast for 10 mins or until the lentil mixture is heated through. Loosely cover pan with foil and set aside for 10 mins to rest., Coarsely shred the lamb, discarding the bone. Arrange the lentil salad in a serving dish. Top with lamb and sprinkle with parsley.

name: Mulled wine
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'sticks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'whole', 'name': 'cloves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'vanilla', 'name': 'bean, split'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'orange', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'bottle dry red wine'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Halved', 'name': 'orange slices, to serve'}]
steps: Place cinnamon sticks, cloves, vanilla bean, orange slices, sugar and wine in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Bring to a simmer. Simmer for 10 minutes or until fragrant and sugar has dissolved. Cover. Set aside for 10 minutes to let flavours develop., Strain mixture into a heatproof jug. Pour into warmed glasses. Top with halved orange slices. Serve.

name: Meringue-topped lemon and passionfruit delicious
ingredient: [{'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'lemon rind, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh passionfruit pulp'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1 1/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', separated'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Double', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Grease a 1.5-litre (6-cup-capacity) baking dish., Place butter, lemon rind, lemon juice, passionfruit pulp, sugar, fl our, milk and egg yolks in a bowl. Whisk to combine., Using an electric mixer, beat egg whites on high speed until soft peaks form. Using a metal spoon, fold 1/4 of the egg white into lemon mixture. Gently fold in remaining egg white., Spoon mixture into prepared dish. Place dish in a large roasting pan. Pour boiling water into pan to come halfway up side of dish. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until golden and just set (see Notes)., Meanwhile, make meringue using an electric mixer, beat egg whites on high speed until soft peaks form. Gradually add sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating constantly until sugar dissolves and mixture is thick and glossy., Preheat grill on high. Remove pudding from water bath. Dollop meringue over pudding. Grill for 3 to 4 minutes or until golden (see Notes). Serve immediately with cream.

name: Vegetable and lentil curry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red onion, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'mild curry paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red capsicum, cut into 3cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cauliflower, cut into small florets'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'button mushrooms, quartered'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'eggplant, sliced'}, {'quantity': '415', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can crushed tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can brown lentils, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Plain', 'name': 'yoghurt, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'rice, to serve'}]
steps: Heat oil2 tsp vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion1 medium red onion, cut into wedges and garlic1 garlic clove, crushed. Cook, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until tender. Add curry paste2 tbsp mild curry paste. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until fragrant., Stir in capsicum1 medium red capsicum, cut into 3cm pieces, cauliflower300g cauliflower, cut into small florets, mushroom150g button mushrooms, quartered, eggplant2 baby eggplant, sliced, tomato415g can crushed tomatoes and stock1 cup vegetable stock. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer, covered, for 10 to 12 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add beans150g green beans, trimmed and lentils400g can brown lentils, drained, rinsed. Cook for 3 minutes or until beans are tender and lentils heated through., Serve with corianderFresh coriander leaves, to serve, yoghurtPlain yoghurt, to serve and riceSteamed rice, to serve.

name: Hawaiian pizza
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '335g 95.5% fat-free thin pizza bases'}, {'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'tub pizza sauce'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'light shaved ham'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'pineapple', 'name': ', peeled, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'button mushrooms, finely sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried mixed Italian herbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated low-fat mozzarella cheese'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 250°C. Place pizza bases onto 2 baking trays. Spread with sauce., Scatter ham, pineapple, mushrooms and herbs over bases. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 10 minutes, swapping trays after 8 minutes, or until bases are crisp., Cut pizzas into slices. Serve with spinach.

name: Toffeed pineapple with rum ice-cream
ingredient: [{'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3 cups) vanilla ice-cream, slightly softened'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'imitation rum essence (Queen brand)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '380g pkt (six slices) fresh pineapple slices'}, {'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2/3 cup, firmly packed) brown sugar'}]
steps: Combine ice-cream and rum essence in a metal bowl. Place in the freezer., Preheat grill on high. Place a wire rack over a baking tray. Cut 2 slices of pineapple in half through the centre. Place all slices in a single layer, on the rack. Sprinkle evenly with half the sugar. Cook under grill for 2-3 minutes or until sugar dissolves and pineapple browns. Turn and sprinkle with remaining sugar. Cook for a further 2-3 minutes or until sugar dissolves and pineapple browns. Remove from heat and set aside for 5 minutes to cool., Serve pineapple slices with a large scoop of rum ice-cream.

name: Chicken larb platter
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '200g packets rice stick noodles'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'chicken mince'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'lemongrass', 'name': 'stalks, white part only, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece fresh ginger, peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'kecap manis'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'gem', 'name': 'lettuces, finely shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh Thai basil leaves, plus extra to serve'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'salted roasted peanuts, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Make Chilli Lime Dressing; Place sugar and boiling water in a heatproof screw-top jar. Secure lid. Shake until sugar dissolves. Remove lid. Add lime juice, fish sauce and chilli sauce. Secure lid. Shake until combined. Set aside until required., Cook noodles following packet directions. Drain. Transfer to a bowl. Add 2 teaspoons oil. Toss well to coat. Cover to keep warm., Heat a wok over high heat. Add 1/2 of the remaining oil. Swirl to coat. Stir-fry mince, in 3 batches, breaking up lumps with a wooden spoon, for 3 to 5 minutes or until browned and just cooked through. Transfer to a bowl., Heat remaining oil in wok. Swirl to coat. Add lemongrass, garlic and ginger. Stir-fry for 1 minute or until fragrant. Return mince to wok. Stir-fry to combine. Add kecap manis and 1/2 the dressing. Stir-fry for 1 to 2 minutes or until mixture thickens slightly. Add noodles and toss. Remove from heat., To serve, add lettuce and basil to larb. Toss to combine. Transfer to a serving platter. Drizzle with remaining dressing. Sprinkle with peanuts and extra basil. Serve with lime wedges.

name: Wood-roasted garlic with soft cheese and bread
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'bulbs'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'thyme', 'name': 'sprigs'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) extra virgin olive oil, plus extra to serve'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': "soft fresh goat's cheese or ricotta"}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'loaf', 'name': 'wood-fired bread, thickly sliced'}]
steps: Using a sharp knife, cut the top off each garlic bulb to expose tops of the cloves. Don't remove the papery skin., Cut out 4 large squares of foil and place a garlic bulb and a sprig of thyme on each. Drizzle each with 1 tablespoon oil, season with salt and pepper, then wrap tightly. Place in the fire and roast for 30 minutes. Alternatively, place on a baking tray and roast in an oven preheated to 180°C for 35 minutes., To serve, peel away papery garlic skin, squeeze out the soft cloves, then mash. Spread garlic onto bread slice, top with cheese, season with pepper and drizzle with olive oil. Serve immediately.

name: Spiced apple juice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'L', 'name': '(8 cups) apple juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '7cm cinnamon sticks, lightly crushed'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'whole', 'name': 'cloves'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'strips', 'name': 'orange peel'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'strips', 'name': 'lemon peel'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'granny', 'name': 'smith apples, peeled, cored, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Ice', 'name': 'cubes, to serve'}]
steps: Place the apple juice, cinnamon, cloves and combined peel in a saucepan over high heat. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes or until aromatic. Set aside for 10 minutes to cool. Transfer to an airtight container and place in the fridge for 2 hours to chill., Strain the juice into a jug. Divide the apple and ice among serving glasses. Pour over the juice and serve.

name: Tuna, broad bean and risoni salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'frozen broad beans'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'dried risoni'}, {'quantity': '425', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can Greenseas tuna chunks in springwater'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh ricotta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Place broad beans in a heatproof bowl. Cover with boiling water. Stand for 5 minutes. Peel and discard skins., Cook risoni in a saucepan of boiling, salted water until tender, adding broad beans in the last minute of cooking. Drain well. Transfer to a heatproof bowl., Add drained tuna, ricotta, lemon rind, juice, oil and mint to pasta. Season. Toss to combine. Serve sprinkled with mint leaves.

name: Lebanese roast salmon and cauliflower salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '135', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) fine grit burghul'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '550g) cauliflower, cut into small florets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil, plus extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sumac, plus extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', rind finely grated, halved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': '(about 470g) salmon fillets'}, {'quantity': '130', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) Greek yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tahini'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 210°C/190°C fan forced. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper. Place the burghul in a bowl and cover with cold water. Set aside for 30 minutes to soak. Drain. Place in a clean tea towel. Squeeze out excess moisture. Transfer to a bowl., Meanwhile, place the cauliflower and onion on 1 prepared tray. Drizzle with 1 1/2 tbs oil. Season. Combine the sumac, cumin and coriander in a bowl. Sprinkle the vegetables with 1 tsp spice mixture. Roast, stirring once, for 25 minutes or until golden., Add the rind, 1 garlic clove and the remaining oil to the remaining spice mixture. Place the salmon on the remaining prepared tray. Season. Spread with the spice mixture. Roast salmon for the last 12 minutes of vegetable cooking time or until cooked to your liking. Rest for 3 minutes. Coarsely flake., Juice half the lemon. Combine the yoghurt, tahini, water, 1 1/2 tbs lemon juice and remaining garlic in a bowl. Season. Chop three-quarters of the herbs. Add vegies and chopped herbs to the burghul. Toss to combine. Divide among plates. Top with the salmon. Drizzle with the dressing and extra oil. Sprinkle with remaining herbs and extra sumac. Serve with remaining lemon.

name: Mulligatawny
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'curry powder'}, {'quantity': '360', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken thigh fillets, trimmed, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'litre', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'granny smith apple, peeled, grated'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red lentils, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pappadums', 'name': ', to serve'}]
steps: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add curry powder. Cook, stirring, for 30 seconds or until fragrant., Add chicken. Turn to coat. Add stock. Cover. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, covered, for 30 minutes or until chicken is just cooked through., Transfer chicken to a bowl. Cool slightly. Using a fork, shred chicken. Return chicken to pan. Add apple, lentils and coconut milk. Bring to a simmer. Simmer, partially covered, for 15 minutes or until lentils are tender. Stir in lemon juice. Season with pepper. Ladle into bowls. Top with coriander. Serve with pappadums.

name: Toad in the hole
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'thick beef or pork sausages'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'chat', 'name': 'potatoes, washed and quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red onion, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eg', 'name': 'g'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'grain mustard'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Combine sausages, potatoes and onion in a 26cm x 19cm base measurement ovenproof lasagne dish. Drizzle with oil and toss until well combined. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until sausages start to brown., Sift flour into a bowl. Make a well in the centre. Combine egg and milk and stir into flour. Add mustard and season., Pour batter over sausage mixture. Shake dish to distribute evenly. Bake a further 40 to 45 minutes or until batter is golden and well-risen. Cut into squares. Serve with steamed shredded cabbage, if desired.

name: Roast lamb with chickpea puree and mint sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', zested and juiced'}, {'quantity': '2.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Coles Australian Whole lamb leg roast'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans chickpeas, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sour cream'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice, extra'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Brand Australian Baby Spinach and Red Beetroot Salad Leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C. Combine 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon cumin, coriander and lemon zest in a jug. Season with salt and pepper. Rub marinade all over the lamb. Place the lamb in the roasting pan and roast in oven for 2 hours. Cover and set aside for 15 mins to rest., Meanwhile, process the chickpeas, garlic, sour cream, 2 tablespoons of the remaining olive oil, 2 tablespoon lemon juice, 1/2 cup (125ml) water and remaining cumin in a food processor until a puree forms. Season with salt and pepper., Combine the remaining olive oil, mint, sugar and extra lemon juice to make a dressing., Slice the lamb and serve with the chickpea puree, mint dressing and salad.

name: Thai style chicken wraps
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', halved, sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red chilli, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken tenderloins, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': ', juiced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'torn fresh mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'baby', 'name': 'cos lettuce, leaves separated'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'Patak', 'name': "'s chapatti wraps"}]
steps: Heat the oil in a wok over a medium-high heat. Add the onion, garlic and chilli, and cook for 3 minutes or until golden. Add the chicken and increase the heat to high. Stir-fry for 5 minutes or until chicken is just cooked through., Add the brown sugar, lime juice and fish sauce. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool., Toss the mint leaves through the chicken and serve with the lettuce and chapatti wraps.

name: Pomegranate chicken
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken thigh fillets, trimmed, cut in half'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'wholemeal couscous'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'boiling water'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'pomegranate', 'name': ', seeds dislodged (see Note)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'walnuts, toasted'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'green beans, to serve'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves'}]
steps: Heat oil1 tbsp olive oil in a large frying pan over high heat. Season chicken800g chicken thigh fillets, trimmed, cut in half and cook in 2 batches for 4 minutes or until well browned (this will give you a rich dark sauce). Set aside. Reduce heat to medium-high and cook onion1 brown onion, thinly sliced, stirring, for 3 minutes or until browned. Add garlic2 garlic cloves, thinly sliced and spices1/4 tsp ground cinnamon|1/4 tsp ground turmeric|Pinch ground nutmeg and cook stirring for 1 minute. Return chicken to pan with stock2/3 cup chicken stock and honey2 tbsp honey. Bring to a simmer. Gently simmer, turning chicken to coat occasionally, for 5 minutes or until sauce thickens and chicken is cooked through., Meanwhile, place couscous1 1/2 cups wholemeal couscous and boiling water1 1/2 cups boiling water in a heatproof bowl. Season with salt and stir. Stand, covered, for 5 minutes. Fluff up grains with a fork., Add pomegranate1/2 pomegranate, seeds dislodged (see Note) and walnuts1/2 cup walnuts, toasted t chicken. Serve chicken with couscous and green beansSteamed green beans, to serve. Sprinkle with mint1/2 cup fresh mint leaves.

name: Lemon meringue eggs
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Zest', 'name': 'and juice of 1 lemon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cornflour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'white vinegar'}]
steps: Carefully remove the top of each egg using a serrated knife. Separate the eggs by passing them through your fingers and letting the eggwhite drip through your fingers into a bowl. Place yolks in a heatproof bowl. Wash out eggshells, then dry carefully with paper towel. Set aside., Add 100g sugar, butter, zest and juice to the bowl with the yolks, then whisk until just combined. Set the bowl over a pan of simmering water (don't let the bowl touch the water). Stir gently with a wooden spoon for 6-8 minutes until the butter has melted and the lemon curd mixture has thickened. Cool., Half-fill each egg shell with some of the cooled lemon curd. Place in ovenproof egg cups, then refrigerate while you make the meringue., Preheat the oven to 220°C. Place the eggwhites in the bowl of an electric mixer with another 1/2 cup (110g) of the sugar and beat until soft peaks form. With the motor running, slowly add the remaining sugar until mixture is stiff and glossy, then beat in the cornflour and vinegar., Place meringue mixture in a piping bag fitted with a fluted nozzle, then pipe meringue into eggshells, about 3cm above the top. Place egg cups on a tray, then bake for 5 minutes until the meringue is crisp and tinged golden. Serve immediately.

name: Lamb wellington pops with minted pea smash
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'lamb', 'name': 'cutlets, French trimmed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'frozen puff pastry, partially thawed'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'quince paste, cut into 5g slices'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/200°C fan forced. Heat a large non-stick frying pan over high heat. Spray lamb with oil. Season. Cook, in 2 batches, or 30 seconds each side or until browned. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel., Use an 9cm round cutter to cut 8 discs from pastry. Use a 10cm round cutter to cut 8 discs from remaining pastry. Divide the 9cm discs among 2 lined baking trays. Top each round with a lamb cutlet and a slice of quince paste. Top each cutlet with a 10cm disc. Press to seal and crimp the edges. Brush with egg. Season with pepper. Bake for 14 minutes or until golden., Meanwhile, for pea smash, heat butter in the frying pan over medium heat. Add shallot and stir for 2 minutes or until soft. Stir in peas for 5 minutes or until tender. Cool for 2 minutes. Stir in mint and crème fraiche. Season. Use a potato masher to coarsely mash., Divide among plates and top with lamb.

name: Potato and crispy bacon soup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil, plus extra to serve'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(6 rashers) Coles Australian Made Thin Sliced Streaky Bacon'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'marjoram sprigs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'potatoes, peeled, cut into 3cm cubes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'vegetable stock powder'}, {'quantity': '1.2', 'unit': 'L', 'name': '(6 cups) water'}, {'quantity': '65', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) light sour cream, plus extra to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chargrilled', 'name': 'crusty bread, to serve'}]
steps: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the bacon and cook, stirring, for 4-6 minutes, or until crisp. Add the marjoram and cook for a further minute. Transfer the bacon and marjoram to a plate and keep warm., Add the onion and garlic to the pan and cook, stirring, for 4 minutes. Add the potato and cook, stirring, for a further 2 minutes. Add the stock powder and water. Bring to the boil and cook for 20 minutes, or until potato is tender. ! Remove 1 cup of the potato and set aside. Remove soup from heat and add the sour cream. Use a stick blender to blend the soup until smooth. Season with pepper., Divide the reserved potato between serving bowls. Top with soup. Sprinkle over bacon and marjoram and top with a dollop of sour cream. Drizzle with extra olive oil and season with pepper, if desired. Serve with crusty bread.

name: Chocolate rum and raisin pudding
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(150g) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dark cocoa'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'melted butter, cooled'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 1/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(310ml) boiling water'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) rum'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar, extra'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dark cocoa, extra'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Scatter raisins into an 8 cup ovenproof dish. Sift flour and cocoa together. Add caster sugar and make a well in the centre., Add milk, egg and melted butter. Stir until just smooth. Stir in chocolate. Spoon the mixture over the raisins and smooth the surface., Whisk boiling water, rum, extra sugar and cocoa in a jug. Carefully pour the mixture over the back of a spoon onto the cake mixture. Place the dish on an oven tray and bake for 35-40 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Chicken cooked in a salt crust
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(450g) plain flour, plus extra to dust'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sea salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped rosemary'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'grated lemon zest'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'chicken', 'name': 'breasts, skin on'}]
steps: Place the flour in a bowl with the sea salt, half the thyme leaves, 1 beaten egg and 175ml of cold water. Mix into a dough, then form into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes., Preheat the oven to 200°C., Meanwhile, combine the remaining thyme leaves, chopped rosemary, lemon zest, garlic and olive oil. Massage the mixture all over each chicken breast., Divide the dough into 4 pieces and roll out each piece on a lightly floured board. Wrap each piece of pastry around a chicken breast, sealing it all the way around. Place on a greased baking tray. Beat remaining egg and use to brush the tops of the parcels. Bake the chicken parcels in the oven for 20 minutes, then remove from oven and allow to rest for 10 minutes., Serve with mashed potato and steamed green vegetables.

name: Easy creamy rice pudding
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'L', 'name': '(4 cups) milk'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) medium-grain rice'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '110', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla essence'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Ground', 'name': 'nutmeg, to serve'}]
steps: Place the milk1L (4 cups) milk, rice200g (1 cup) medium-grain rice and salt1/4 tsp salt in a large saucepan over medium-high heat and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook, stirring, for 20 minutes or until the rice is tender., Add the sugar110g (1/2 cup) caster sugar and vanilla1 tsp vanilla essence. Increase heat to medium-high and bring to the boil. Boil for a further 5-8 minutes or until the rice is soft and the mixture thickens., Spoon the rice evenly among serving bowls. Sprinkle with nutmegGround nutmeg, to serve and serve immediately.

name: Sweet potato rosti
ingredient: [{'quantity': '700', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sweet potato, peeled, grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', beaten'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) olive oil'}]
steps: Preheat the oven to 150°C. Mix sweet potato with the egg, flour and melted butter. Season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Form the mixture into 6 patties and fry, in batches, for 2-3 minutes each side until crisp and golden. (Keep each batch warm in the oven.) Serve with the lamb.

name: Best-ever Christmas crack
ingredient: [{'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'Arnott', 'name': '’s Salada Original Crispbread'}, {'quantity': '160', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup, lightly packed) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'salted butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '180g blocks dark chocolate, melted'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'white chocolate, melted'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green and red M&M’s Minis'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Silver', 'name': 'cachous, to decorate'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180/160 fan forced. Line a 20 x 30cm slice pan with baking paper, allowing the paper to overhang the 2 long sides. Place crispbread6 Arnott’s Salada Original Crispbread over the base of the prepared pan in an even layer., Combine the sugar160g (1 cup, lightly packed) brown sugar and butter125g salted butter, chopped in a small saucepan. Cook, stirring, over medium heat until butter melts and the mixture is smooth. Bring to the boil. Cook, stirring, for 30 seconds or until thickened., Pour the sugar mixture evenly over the crispbread. Place in the oven and bake for 5 minutes or until sugar mixture is bubbling., Pour the dark chocolate2 x 180g blocks dark chocolate, melted over the crispbread and use a palette knife to smooth. Set aside until set., Drizzle over white chocolate100g white chocolate, melted and sprinkle with M&M’s and50g green and red M&M’s Minis cachousSilver cachous, to decorate. Set aside until set completely. Break into pieces to serve.

name: Peach and goat's curd pizza
steps: Sift the flour into a large bowl. Stir in the yeast. Stir in the salt and sugar until combined. Make a well in the centre. Pour in the water and oil. Stir until just combined. Use your hands to bring the dough together., Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead for 5 minutes. Drizzle extra oil into a large clean bowl. Add dough and turn to coat. Cover with a clean tea towel. Set aside in a warm draught-free place for 1 hour or until doubled in size., Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan forced. Brush a 23cm tart tin with melted butter., Knead the dough briefly in the bowl to knock out the air. Place on a floured surface. Halve dough. Roll out 1 half to a 23cm disc. Press into base and side of the prepared tin. Brush well with butter. Sprinkle with half the sugar. Roll out the remaining dough. Place on top of the first disc. Set aside for 20 minutes to rise slightly., Combine the goat's curd with remaining sugar. Spread over the dough. Top with the peaches. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until crisp and golden. Scatter with pistachio. Drizzle with maple syrup. Top with flowers, if using.

name: Antipasto platter
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '500g) eggplant, halved lengthways, cut into 1cm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', ends trimmed, thickly sliced lengthways'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed olives'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'semi-dried tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'drained baby bocconcini'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'prosciutto'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'mild salami'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'marinated', 'name': 'artichokes, quartered'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Mini', 'name': 'grissini sticks, to serve'}]
steps: To make the baked ricotta, preheat oven to 180°C. Brush two 250ml (1-cup) capacity ramekins with oil to grease. Combine the ricotta, egg and garlic in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon into ramekins and smooth the surface. Bake for 30 minutes or until just set. Set aside for 30 minutes to cool., Meanwhile, preheat a chargrill pan on high. Brush the eggplant and zucchini with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Add one-quarter of the vegetables to the grill and cook for 2-3 minutes each side or until tender. Transfer to a heatproof bowl. Repeat with remaining vegetables. Set aside for 30 minutes to cool., Turn the ricotta out onto a serving platter. Arrange the eggplant, zucchini, olives, semi-dried tomatoes, bocconcini, prosciutto, salami and artichokes on the platter. Serve with grissini sticks.

name: Blue-eye trevalla with almond pesto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'trussed cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(40g) slivered almonds'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(20g) finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '800g) desiree potatoes, peeled'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) thin cream'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '200g each) blue-eye trevalla fillets'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'green beans, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 160°C. Place the tomatoes on an oven tray and drizzle with vinegar and 1 tablespoon of the oil. Season with salt and pepper. Bake in oven for 15 minutes or until tomatoes begin to collapse., Place the basil, garlic, almonds and parmesan in the bowl of a food processor and process until fi nely chopped. With the motor running, add 1/3 cup of the remaining oil in a thin, steady steam., Meanwhile, place the potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with cold water. Place over high heat and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain well. Return to the pan with the butter and cream. Use a potato masher to mash until smooth. Season with salt and pepper., Heat the remaining oil in a large frying pan over high heat. Season the fish with salt and pepper. Add to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes each side or until golden brown and just cooked through., Spoon the mash onto serving plates. Top with fish and dollop with pesto. Place the beans on serving plates, top with tomatoes and drizzle with pan juices. Serve immediately.

name: Banana caramel trifle
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla essence'}, {'quantity': '450', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Madeira cake'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vanilla custard'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'bananas', 'name': ', halved, sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chocolate sprinkles'}]
steps: Combine sugar, cream, butter and vanilla in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until sauce comes to the boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 2 minutes. Pour caramel into a heatproof bowl or jug. Refrigerate until cool and thickened., Trim brown edges from all sides of cake and discard. Cut cake into 1cm-thick slices. Using a 4cm star biscuit cutter, cut 2 stars from each slice of cake., Place half the stars in bowls. Drizzle over half the custard. Top with half the banana. Drizzle over 2 tablespoons caramel. Sprinkle over half the chocolate sprinkles. Repeat with remaining stars, custard, banana and caramel., Top with remaining chocolate sprinkles and serve.

name: Pork and olive rolls in cherry tomato sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) olive tapenade'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '385g pork scotch fillet schnitzels'}, {'quantity': '160', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt baby spinach leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) water'}, {'quantity': '420', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'jar tomato pasta sauce'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby potatoes, red and white, halved'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Handful', 'name': 'fresh basil leaves'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 160C/140C fan forced. Spread olive tapenade70g (1/4 cup) olive tapenade over pork2 x 385g pork scotch fillet schnitzels. Top with half the spinach160g pkt baby spinach leaves. Roll up and secure with toothpicks., Spray an ovenproof frying pan with olive oil and heat over medium heat. Cook pork, turning, for 2-3 minutes or until browned. Stir in garlic3 garlic cloves, thinly sliced for 1 minute. Add water250ml (1 cup) water and tomato sauce420g jar tomato pasta sauce. Cover and transfer to the oven. Bake for 1 hour. Add potatoes500g baby potatoes, red and white, halved. Cook, covered, for 30 minutes. Stir through remaining spinach. Stand, covered, for 5 minutes, or until wilted. Sprinkle with the basilHandful fresh basil leaves.

name: Kinder Bueno cheesecake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'digestive biscuits'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '43g Kinder Bueno Chocolate Bars'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) boiling water'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tsps', 'name': 'gelatine powder'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt milk chocolate, chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cream cheese, at room temperature, chopped'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsps', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) thickened cream'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cocoa', 'name': 'powder, to dust'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '43g Kinder Bueno Chocolate Bars, broken into small pieces'}]
steps: Line the base and sides of a 20cm springform pan with baking paper., Place the biscuits200g digestive biscuits and 1 Kinder Bueno bar (2 sticks) in a food processor. Process until fine crumbs form. Add the butter100g butter, melted and process until combined. Transfer to prepared pan. Use a straight-sided glass to spread and press the biscuit mixture firmly over the base of the pan. Place in the fridge until required., Place the boiling water60ml (1/4 cup) boiling water in a small heatproof jug. Sprinkle with the gelatine2 1/2 tsps gelatine powder. Whisk with a fork until dissolved. Set aside to cool slightly., Place the milk chocolate180g pkt milk chocolate, chopped in a heatproof bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water (don't let the bowl touch the water). Stir with a metal spoon until smooth. Set aside to cool slightly., Place the cream cheese500g cream cheese, at room temperature, chopped, sugar100g (1/2 cup) caster sugar and vanilla2 tsps vanilla extract in a food processor. Process until smooth. Add 250ml (1 cup) of the cream375ml (1 1/2 cups) thickened cream and process until combined. Add melted chocolate and process until combined. Add gelatine mixture and process until combined., Pour half the cheesecake mixture into the prepared pan. Arrange rows of other 4 Kinder Bueno bars, about 1.5cm apart, trimming to fit, over cheesecake mixture. Top with remaining cheesecake mixture. Smooth top. Place in the fridge for 4 hours or overnight until set., Remove cheesecake from the pan and place on a serving plate. Use electric beaters to beat the remaining 125ml (1/2 cup) cream until soft peaks form. Top cheesecake with cream. Dust with cocoaCocoa powder, to dust and decorate with remaining Kinder Bueno bars. Serve.

name: Lemon chicken with potatoes and peas
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(', 'name': '180g each) chicken breast fillets, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', rind finely grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'desiree potatoes, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley leaves, chopped'}]
steps: Heat a large, heavy-based, non-stick saucepan over high heat. Spray chicken lightly with oilolive oil cooking spray. Cook chicken4 (180g each) chicken breast fillets, trimmed for 1 minute each side or until just golden. Remove to a plate., Add stock375ml Chicken stock, 1/4 cup lemon juice and potatoes to saucepan. Season with salt and pepper. Top potatoes4 medium desiree potatoes, thinly sliced with chicken. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and potatoes are tender., Add peas3/4 cup frozen peas and 1/3 cup parsley. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until peas are tender., Remove chicken to a plate. Slice each breast into quarters. Spoon potato mixture onto plates. Top with chicken. Drizzle with pan juices. Combine remaining parsley and lemon rind. Sprinkle over chicken. Serve.

name: Honey mustard chicken
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken tenderloin fillets, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '175', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pouch MasterFoods Honey Mustard Chicken Recipe Base'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'light cream'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'jasmine rice, to serve'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Heat oil in a medium non-stick frying pan over high heat. Add chicken and cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until brown. Add carrot and cook for 1 minute., Stir in recipe base and cream and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through., Serve chicken with steamed rice and coriander leaves, if desired.

name: Key lime pie
ingredient: [{'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'wheatmeal or Granita biscuits'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ground almonds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '395', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can condensed milk'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(160ml) cream'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Zest', 'name': 'and juice of 4 limes'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 170°C. Line base of a 20cm springform tin with baking paper., Process biscuits200g wheatmeal or Granita biscuits until fine crumbs. Add almonds1/4 cup ground almonds, sugar1 tbsp caster sugar and butter100g butter, melted, process until combined. Press mixture firmly into the base and 3cm up sides of tin. Refrigerate., Whisk eggs4 eggs, lightly beaten, milk395g can condensed milk, cream2/3 cup (160ml) cream, lime rind and juiceZest and juice of 4 limes until smooth. Pour into biscuit crust., Place on tray and bake for 40-45 mins or until set. Cool. Serve with extra lime slices.

name: Sesame chicken with vegetables
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'orange sweet potato (kumara)'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '420g) parsnips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '3 15', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkts sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '200g each) single chicken breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '420', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, topped'}, {'quantity': '85', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) Delikatess mayonnaise (Thomy Brand)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C. Line 2 large baking trays with baking paper., Cut sweet potato crossways into 1.5cm-thick slices and slice the parsnip diagonally into 1.5cm-thick slices. Place sliced vegetables and oil in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper, and toss to coat. Arrange vegetables in a single layer on a lined tray. Roast in preheated oven for 10 minutes., Meanwhile, toast sesame seeds in a medium non-stick frying pan over medium heat, stirring often, for 5 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a plate or a sheet of baking paper. Pat each chicken fillet onto sesame seeds, turning, until well coated. Place coated chicken on remaining lined tray., Place the tray of coated chicken in the oven with the vegetables and cook for a further 15 minutes or until the vegetables are tender and the chicken is just cooked through., While the chicken and vegetables are cooking, cook the green beans in a medium saucepan of boiling salted water for 2-3 minutes or until tender crisp. Drain. Combine the mayonnaise and lemon juice in a small bowl and season with salt and pepper., Cut the chicken into thick slices. Serve immediately with roasted vegetables, green beans and drizzled with the lemon mayonnaise.

name: Chicken, corn and asparagus tarts
