ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'frozen ready-rolled puff pastry, partially thawed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pure cream'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '340g bottle asparagus, drained, trimmed, cut into 1cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can corn kernels, drained'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated tasty cheese'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced. Grease a 12-hole, 1/3 cup-capacity muffin pan. Cut each pastry sheet into 4 squares. Press 1 square into each pan hole., Heat oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add mince and onion. Cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up mince, for 3 to 4 minutes or until mince is browned., Whisk eggs and cream together in a jug. Season with salt and pepper. Divide mince mixture between pan holes. Top with asparagus, corn and egg mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden and filling is set. Serve.

name: Spaghetti love nests
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh ricotta'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen chopped spinach, thawed, excess liquid removed'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) shredded parmesan'}, {'quantity': '65', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chargrilled capsicum, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried thin spaghetti pasta'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chopped tomatoes with paste'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pancetta slices, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'water'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Bake the breadcrumbs on a baking tray for 5 minutes or until dry but not browned., Combine the ricotta, spinach, 2 tablespoons parmesan and 50g of the capsicum in a bowl. Season., Cook the pasta in a saucepan of boiling water until al dente. Drain. Arrange in lengths on a baking tray. Set aside for 10 minutes to dry slightly., Meanwhile, to make the bechamel sauce, melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat until foaming. Add the flour and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until the mixture bubbles. Remove from heat. Gradually stir in the milk until smooth. Stir over medium heat until the sauce thickens. Stir in the chives and 2 tablespoons of remaining parmesan. Season. Cover the surface of the bechamel with plastic wrap to prevent a skin forming., Combine the tomato, pancetta and water in a jug. Season. Pour into a 5cm-deep, 25cm round baking dish., Spray pasta lightly with olive oil. Divide into 8 portions. Twirl 1 portion around your fingers to make an 8cm nest. Carefully place on a chopping board. Repeat with remaining pasta. Divide ricotta mixture into 8 portions. Press into the centres of the nests., Carefully arrange nests in the dish. Spoon bechamel sauce over the filling. Top with remaining capsicum. Combine breadcrumbs and remaining parmesan and sprinkle over the top. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until golden.

name: Maple and walnut-glazed ham
ingredient: [{'quantity': '9', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'cooked leg ham'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'maple syrup'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'wholegrain mustard'}, {'quantity': '320', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet Lucky Natural Californian Walnuts'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced., Using a small sharp knife, cut around the ham shank about 10cm from the end. Carefully run the knife under the rind, around the edge of the ham. Gently lift off the rind in 1 piece by running your fingers between the rind and the fat. Discard the rind. Place ham on a lightly greased wire rack in a large roasting pan. Pour enough boiling water into pan to reach 2cm up side of pan, Stir maple syrup, sugar and mustard in a small saucepan over low heat until sugar dissolves. Brush the ham with half the maple mixture to evenly coat. Secure ham hock with foil to prevent burning and bake for 1 hour or until golden brown., Meanwhile, chop walnuts until finely chopped (alternatively pulse in a food processor)., Brush ham with half the remaining maple mixture. Carefully press walnuts over ham to secure. Bake for a further 20 to 30 minutes or until golden. Rest for 15 minutes. Remove and discard foil from shank. Serve drizzled with remaining maple mixture.

name: Chicken, makrut lime and lemon-grass salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'fresh red chillies, deseeded, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'stem', 'name': 'lemon grass, pale section only,finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lean chicken mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, finely sliced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'makrut', 'name': 'lime leaves, centre vein removed, finely shredded'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves, torn'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'iceberg', 'name': 'lettuce, leaves separated, washed, dried'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'Basmati rice, to serve'}]
steps: Heat the oil in a wok over high heat. Add the chilli and lemon grass and stir-fry for 1 minute or until aromatic., Add the mince and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up any lumps, for 3-4 minutes or until cooked through., Transfer the chicken mixture to a large heatproof bowl. Add the onion and makrut lime and stir until well combined., Whisk lime juice, fish sauce and sugar in a jug until the sugar dissolves. Add to the chicken mixture with the coriander and mint and combine. Arrange the lettuce leaves on serving plates. Spoon the chicken mixture among lettuce leaves. Serve with rice.

name: Chocolate puddings with salted caramel filling
ingredient: [{'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted (for greasing)'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '70% cocoa dark chocolate, chopped'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': "Nestle Top 'n' Fill"}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt flakes'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'icing sugar mixture'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'scoops', 'name': 'vanilla ice-cream, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Grease six 4.5cm-deep, 8cm (base), 1/2-cup-capacity ovenproof ramekins with melted butter. Line bases with baking paper. Place on a baking tray., Place chocolate, butter and sugar in a large heatproof bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water (make sure base of bowl does not touch water). Heat, stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes or until melted and smooth. Remove bowl from heat and set aside to cool for 2 minutes., Meanwhile, combine Top 'n' Fill and salt in a small bowl (don’t overmix)., Add eggs to chocolate mixture, whisking until combined. Sift over flour. Whisk until combined. Reserve 1/4 cup of batter. Divide remaining batter evenly among prepared ramekins. Gently spoon 2 teaspoons caramel mixture into the centre of each pudding (caramel mixture will slowly sink into batter). Top each pudding with 2 teaspoons of reserved batter. (If making ahead, see Notes), Bake puddings for 12 minutes or until a crust has formed on top, but puddings are still wobbly to touch in the centre. Remove from oven. Stand to cool for 2 minutes. Run a small knife around edge of puddings. Gently turn puddings onto serving plates. Serve immediately with a dusting of icing sugar and ice-cream.

name: Zucchini and bacon fritters with garlic yoghurt
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'zucchini, grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'desiree potato, peeled, grated'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'shortcut', 'name': 'bacon rashers, trimmed, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vegetable', 'name': 'oil, for shallow frying'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chopped', 'name': 'chives, to serve'}]
steps: Squeeze excess moisture from zucchini. Drain on paper towel. Combine zucchini2 medium zucchini, grated, potato1 medium desiree potato, peeled, grated, bacon4 shortcut bacon rashers, trimmed, finely chopped, flour1/4 cup plain flour, egg1 egg, lightly beaten and chives2 tbsp chopped fresh chives in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper., Heat oilVegetable oil, for shallow frying in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Spoon 1/4 cup zucchini mixture into pan, pressing to flatten. Repeat to make 3 more fritters. Cook for 5 minutes or until golden underneath. Turn, pressing again to flatten. Cook for 5 minutes or until golden and crisp. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel. Cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat process with remaining mixture., Meanwhile, make Garlic yoghurt: Combine garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed and yoghurt1/2 cup Greek Style Yoghurt in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle fritters with extra chivesChopped chives, to serve. Serve with garlic yoghurt.

name: Chocolate strawberries
ingredient: [{'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'milk chocolate'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'white chocolate'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'large strawberries, washed, dried'}]
steps: Line a baking tray with baking paper. Break milk chocolate into even pieces. Place into a heat-proof bowl., One-third fill a saucepan with water. Bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Place chocolate bowl over saucepan (don't let bowl touch water). Stir with a metal spoon until smooth., Dip one-third of the strawberries into chocolate. Place onto tray. Repeat with dark and white chocolate. Refrigerate until set.

name: Crispy-skin salmon with citrus
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '150g each) salmon fillets, skin on'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'limes', 'name': ', juiced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Ruby', 'name': 'Red grapefruits or pomelos, peeled, segmented'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'limes', 'name': ', extra, peeled, segmented'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumbers, peeled into ribbons'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chilli, thinly sliced (optional)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(75g) cashews, toasted, coarsely chopped'}]
steps: Heat a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Spray both sides of the salmon with olive oil spray and season. Sprinkle both sides of salmon with cumin seeds. Cook, skin-side down, for 2 mins or until skin is crisp. Turn and cook for a further 2-3 mins for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil. Set aside for 5 mins to rest., Meanwhile, combine lime juice, sugar, fish sauce, ginger and oil in a small jug., Combine grapefruit or pomelo, lime segments, cucumber, mint, coriander, red onion and chilli, if using, in a bowl. Drizzle with dressing. Toss to combine. Divide among serving plates. Top with salmon. Sprinkle with cashew.

name: Ratatouille
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) Vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': '(about 660g) red capsicums, deseeded, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': '(about 440g) green capsicums, deseeded, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': '(about 700g) eggplant, cut into 3cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans whole peeled tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '320g) zucchini, quartered, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roughly chopped fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}]
steps: Bring the stock250ml (1 cup) Vegetable stock to the boil in a large saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium, add onions2 red onions, chopped and garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed, and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until the onions soften slightly., Add capsicums3 medium (about 660g) red capsicums, deseeded, cut into 2cm pieces and eggplant2 medium (about 700g) eggplant, cut into 3cm pieces, and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes3 x 400g cans whole peeled tomatoes, tomato paste70g (1/4 cup) tomato paste and sugar2 tsp caster sugar. Cover and cook over low heat for 40 minutes., Stir in zucchini4 (about 320g) zucchini, quartered, cut into 2cm pieces. Cook, covered, for 20 minutes or until vegetables are soft. Remove from heat. Stir in basil1 cup roughly chopped fresh basil leaves. Taste and season with salt and pepperSalt & freshly ground black pepper.

name: Mustard dill pikelets with smoked trout and avocado salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(150g) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eg', 'name': 'g'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'wholegrain mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) buttermilk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped dill'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'smoked ocean trout fillet, skin removed, coarsely flaked'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'ripe avocados, halved, stoned, peeled, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'watercress sprigs'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Creme', 'name': 'fraiche, to serve'}]
steps: Sift the flour into a medium bowl and make a well in the centre. Whisk the egg, mustard, buttermilk and half the dill in a small jug. Season with salt and pepper. Gradually add egg mixture to flour and whisk until a smooth batter forms., Combine the lemon juice, oil and remaining dill in a small jug. Season with salt and pepper. Combine the trout, avocado and watercress in a medium bowl and set aside., Spray a medium non-stick frying pan with cooking spray or lightly oil and place over medium heat. Drop two 1/4 cups (60ml) of batter into pan, allowing room for spreading. Cook for 20 seconds or until bubbles appear on the surface and base is golden. Turn and cook for a further 20 seconds or until golden and cooked through. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil. Regrease pan and repeat with remaining batter in 3 more batches., Drizzle the lemon dressing over the trout mixture and gently toss to combine. Place the pikelets on serving plates. Top with trout salad and a dollop of creme fraiche. Serve immediately.

name: Couscous-stuffed apples with honey syrup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) walnuts'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) couscous'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) boiling water'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'toasted slivered almonds'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'currants'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Large', 'name': 'pinch of ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red apples'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Tamar', 'name': 'Valley Greek Style Yoghurt, to serve'}]
steps: Place the walnuts in a small frying pan over medium-low heat and cook, stirring, for 4 minutes or until toasted., Preheat oven to 180°C. Place the couscous in a heatproof bowl and pour over the water. Set aside for 5 minutes or until all the liquid is absorbed. Use a fork to separate the grains., Place the walnuts and almonds in the bowl of a food processor and process until finely chopped. Combine the couscous, butter, sugar, currants, cinnamon and walnut mixture in a bowl., Line a baking tray with non-stick baking paper. Use a knife to remove the top of each apple and place on the lined tray. Use an apple corer to remove cores from apples. Use a teaspoon to scoop out the flesh to create a 4cm cavity, keeping the cavity narrow at the base. Cut a horizontal slit around the centre of each apple, being careful not to cut all the way through (this will prevent the apple skin from splitting during cooking). Place upright in a baking dish., Divide the couscous mixture among the apple cavities. Bake for 20 minutes. Add the baking tray with the apple tops to the oven and bake with the whole apples for a further 20 minutes., Meanwhile, to make the honey syrup, place the water, honey, sugar, cardamom seeds and cinnamon stick in a small saucepan over medium heat and stir until the sugar dissolves. Increase heat to high and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 15 minutes or until syrup thickens. Set aside to cool., Place 1 apple and a dollop of yoghurt on each serving plate. Replace the tops. Spoon over the honey syrup to serve.

name: Pineapple, passionfruit and coconut slushies
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Coles caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pineapple', 'name': ', peeled, cored and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Coles passionfruit pulp'}, {'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'light coconut milk'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'slices, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Malibu', 'name': 'liqueur, to serve (optional)'}]
steps: Combine sugar and water in a medium saucepan, and stir over low heat, without boiling, until sugar has dissolved. Bring to the boil and cook for 2 mins, then remove from heat and set aside to cool., Place pineapple pieces in a food processor and puree until smooth. Place in a sieve. Using the back of a spoon, press over a bowl to extract as much juice as possible. Discard pineapple pulp., Combine cooled syrup, pineapple juice, passionfruit pulp and coconut milk. Pour into a large, shallow plastic container. Cover tightly and freeze overnight., To serve, use a fork to scrape the frozen mixture and spoon into serving glasses (it will melt down to a “slushy” consistency in the glass). Garnish with a small lime slice and add a splash of Malibu to each glass, if you like.

name: Slow cooker lamb ragu with pappardelle
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'lamb', 'name': 'shanks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, halved, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'fennel', 'name': 'bulb, trimmed, diced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dried', 'name': 'bay leaf'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'sprig', 'name': 'fresh rosemary'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red wine'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'Massel Vegetable Liquid Stock'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet dried pappardelle'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Finely', 'name': 'grated parmesan, to serve'}]
steps: Heat half the oil in flameproof slow- cooker bowl or large deep frying pan over high heat. Season lamb with salt and pepper. Add to bowl. Cook for 2 minutes each side or until browned. Transfer to a plate. Discard oil and wipe bowl clean., Heat remaining oil in bowl over medium- high heat. Add onion, fennel, garlic, bay leaf and rosemary. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add wine. Boil over high heat for 1 minute. Add tomatoes and stock. Season with salt and pepper. Return lamb to bowl. Transfer bowl to slow cooker. Cover. Cook on HIGH for 3 hours., Discard rosemary and bay leaf. Transfer lamb to a board. Add pasta to sauce, pushing pasta into sauce. Cover and cook on HIGH for 18 minutes. Meanwhile, using 2 forks, shred meat. Discard bones. Return lamb to slow cooker. Toss to combine., Serve ragu sprinkled with parmesan.

name: Leek, goat's cheese and olive free-form tarts
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': '(29 x 29cm) Pampas frozen ready-rolled shortcrust quiche pastry, just thawed'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'leeks, pale section only, washed, dried, halved lengthways, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': "100g pkts goat's cheese, crumbled"}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) shaved parmesan'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) pitted black olives'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'thyme leaves, extra, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C. Spray a baking tray with olive oil spray to lightly grease. Using a 28cm-diameter plate as a guide, cut 1 disc from each sheet of pastry., Heat the oil in a frying pan over low heat. Add the leek, garlic and thyme and cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes or until the leek has softened and is brown. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside for 15 minutes to cool., Combine the egg, goat's cheese and two-thirds of the parmesan in a large bowl. Stir in the leek mixture., Divide the egg mixture evenly among the pastry sheets, leaving a 4cm border. Fold in the edges of the pastry discs to partially enclose the filling, leaving the centres open. Place on the prepared tray. Sprinkle the olives evenly over the tarts and top with remaining parmesan., Bake in oven for 20-25 minutes or until the pastry is golden and crisp. Set aside for 1 hour to cool. Sprinkle with extra thyme and serve.

name: Pear and cheese pull-apart bread
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '550', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Finest by Laurent Rye Sourdough Vienna'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Beurre', 'name': 'Bosc pear, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60g) grated vintage cheddar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(50g) grated mozzarella'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Extra', 'name': 'honey, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Extra', 'name': 'thyme leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with 2 large pieces of foil., Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Cook the onion, stirring, for 5 mins or until soft., Slice the bread at 1.5cm intervals (don’t cut the all the way through). Spread each slice with a little mustard. Fill cuts with onion, pear, cheddar, mozzarella and thyme and drizzle with honey., Wrap the loaf in foil to enclose. Bake for 20 mins or until cheese melts. Uncover and bake for a further 5 mins or until top is crisp. Drizzle with extra honey and sprinkle with extra thyme.

name: Spicy prawn, wombok and shredded pea salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': None, 'name': '-1 tsp dried red chilli flakes, to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green prawns, peeled, tails intact'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'wombok, trimmed, finely shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'baby pak choy, trimmed, shredded'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow peas, trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sugar snap peas, trimmed, halved'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed grape tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves, shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'salt reduced tamari'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Combine chilli, garlic, 1 tbs lime juice and 2 tsp oil in a glass dish. Add prawns. Stir to coat. Set aside for 10 minutes, to marinate., Meanwhile, place wombok, pak choy, snow pea, sugar snap pea, tomato and mint in bowl. Whisk tamari, sugar and remaining lime juice and oil in bowl. Add to salad. Toss to combine., Heat a chargrill over high heat. Spray with olive oil. Cook prawns for 1-2 minutes each side or until just cooked through., Divide salad among plates. Top with prawns. Serve with lime wedges.

name: Labne
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Greek-style natural yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, bruised'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '2cm-thick strips lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': '-3 small sprigs fresh rosemary'}]
steps: Spoon the yoghurt into a fine sieve. Place over a bowl. Cover and place in the fridge overnight to drain., Roll the yoghurt into walnut-sized balls. Place in a serving bowl. Cover with the oil and add the garlic, lemon rind and rosemary.

name: Blackberry crumble cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Melted', 'name': 'butter, to grease'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '170', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '185', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3/4 cup) milk'}, {'quantity': '230', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) fresh blackberries or frozen blackberries'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pauls', 'name': 'vanilla custard, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C. Brush a round 22cm (base measurement) springform pan with melted butter to lightly grease. Line the base and side with non-stick baking paper., Use an electric beater to beat the butter and sugar in a bowl until pale and creamy. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the combined flour and milk and use a large metal spoon to fold until well combined. Spoon the mixture into the prepared pan and use the back of the spoon to smooth the surface. Arrange the blackberries, in a single layer, over the top., To make the crumble topping, place the flour in a bowl. Use your fingertips to rub the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse breadcrumbs. Stir in the coconut and sugar., Sprinkle the crumble topping over the blackberries. Bake for 1 hour. Cover loosely with foil. Bake for a further 25 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Set aside in the pan for 10 minutes to cool before transferring to a wire rack to cool slightly., Cut the cake into wedges and serve with the custard.

name: Gingerbread milkshakes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'ginger', 'name': 'thins (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(90g) honey'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'scoops', 'name': 'vanilla ice cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'L', 'name': '(4cups) milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon, plus cinnamon quills to serve'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': '-2 tbsp treacle or golden syrup'}]
steps: Whiz the biscuits to fine crumbs in a food processor, then transfer to a plate. Place honey on a separate plate. Dip the rim of 4 glasses in honey, then in crumbs. Chill to firm up while you make the milkshakes., Blend remaining ingredients, except cinnamon quills, in a blender until smooth and combined, then pour into the glasses. Serve with cinnamon quills.

name: Chicken, leek and mushroom pot pies
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles RSPCA Approved Chicken Breast Fillets, skin off, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'leek', 'name': ', trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cup mushrooms, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) white wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(250ml) chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(160ml) Bulla Light Thickened Cream for Cooking'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'wholegrain mustard'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Australian Free Range Egg, lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'sheet', 'name': 'ready-rolled frozen puff pastry, thawed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Steamed', 'name': 'greens, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C. Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large frying over medium heat. Add chicken and cook, stirring, for 3-5 mins or until browned. Transfer to a plate., Heat remaining oil and butter in the pan. Add the leek and mushroom. Cook, stirring, for 3-5 mins or until mushroom is golden. Add wine and cook for 2 mins or until reduced by half. Add flour and cook for 1-2 mins. Gradually add combined stock and cream, stirring. Stir in the mustard and peas. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for 2-3 mins or until thickened slightly. Return chicken to the pan and season with salt and pepper., Spoon the chicken mixture into four 1 1/2 cup (375ml) capacity ramekins. Cut four 11.5cm diameter circles from the pastry, slightly larger than the diameter of the ramekins. Brush the edges of the ramekins with egg. Top with pastry and press down edges to seal. Place on a baking tray and bake for 20 mins or until pastry is golden and filling is cooked through. Serve with steamed greens.

name: Buckwheat tabouli with dukkah lamb
ingredient: [{'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3/4 cup) raw buckwheat'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': ', rind finely grated, juiced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Cobram Estate Extra Virgin Olive Oil Light Flavour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'white balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '480g) lamb backstraps'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dukkah'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'firmly packed fresh mixed herbs (mint, coriander, parsley)'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, finely chopped'}]
steps: Bring a saucepan of water to the boil over high heat. Add buckwheat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 5-6 minutes or until al dente. Drain and refresh under cold running water. Spread over a tray lined with paper towel to dry., Meanwhile, place the lemon rind, juice, oil, vinegar and garlic in a screw-top jar. Season and shake to combine., Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Spray lamb with olive oil, then season. Cook, turning, for 6-8 minutes for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate. Set aside to rest for 4 minutes. Spread dukkah on a plate. Press lamb into dukkah to coat. Slice lamb., Finely chop three-quarters of the herbs. Combine buckwheat, herbs, tomato, onion and half the dressing in a bowl. Serve with lamb. Drizzle with remaining dressing.

name: Tofu noodle soup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(1L) Coles Japanese Inspired Mushroom & Miso Style Broth'}, {'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'soba noodles'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': '-piece ginger, peeled, cut into matchsticks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, cut into matchsticks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'baby choy sum, cut into 5cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen edamame or broad beans, thawed, peeled'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt honey soy tofu, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Table of Plenty Asian Black Sesame Dukkah Salad Sprinkles'}]
steps: Place the broth in a large saucepan over high heat. Bring to the boil. Add the noodles and cook for 3 mins or until the noodles are tender., Add the ginger, carrot, choy sum and edamame or broad beans to the pan. Cook for 1 min or until the carrot is just tender and heated through., Divide soup among serving bowls. Top with the tofu and spring onion. Sprinkle with dukkah to serve.

name: Fig bakewell tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(160g) blanched almonds'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(75g) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, melted, cooled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Zest', 'name': 'and juice of 1 orange'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plum jam, plus extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'figs or black figs, thinly sliced'}]
steps: For pastry, process flour, sugar and butter in a food processor until mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add combined egg yolk mixture and essence and process until mixture just comes together. Form dough into a disc and freeze for 30 minutes or until firm., Using the coarse side of a grater, grate pastry into a bowl. Working quickly, scatter over a greased 11 x 35cm loose-based tart tin, then press to cover base and sides evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight., Preheat oven to 190Â°C. Line pastry with baking paper and fill with dried rice or beans. Place on an oven tray and bake for 10 minutes. Remove paper and rice and bake for a further 10 minutes or until crisp and dry. Set aside to cool., Process almonds and sugar in a food processor until finely ground. Add butter, eggs, rind and juice and process until combined. Spread jam over base of tart then pour over almond mixture. Arrange figs over top. Bake for 25 minutes or until tart is puffed, covering with baking paper during the last 10 minutes to prevent over-browning. Serve brushed with extra jam.

name: Garlic balsamic mushrooms with Turkish toast
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'flat mushrooms, stalks trimmed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'olive', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'Turkish bread, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roughly chopped flat-leaf parsley'}]
steps: Combine garlic and balsamic vinegar. Mix well., Brush mushroom tops with balsamic mixture. Spray lightly with oil. Place stalk-side up on grill tray., Preheat grill on high. Grill mushrooms for 4 to 5 minutes or until tender. Transfer to a plate and keep warm. Spray bread with oil. Grill for 2 minutes on each side or until golden., Arrange mushrooms and bread on serving plates. Sprinkle with parsley.

name: Peaches and cream cheesecake trifle
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen raspberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'dry apera (sherry)'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cream cheese, softened'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'icing sugar mixture'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely grated orange rind'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g jam sponge rolls'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'yellow', 'name': 'peaches'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'fresh raspberries'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla bean paste'}]
steps: Place lemon juice, caster sugar and frozen raspberries in a large microwave-safe glass bowl. Microwave, uncovered, on HIGH (100%), stirring every minute, for 4 minutes or until sugar has dissolved., Microwave, uncovered, on HIGH (100%), stirring halfway through, for a further 12 minutes or until slightly thickened. Strain mixture through a fine sieve into a heatproof bowl. Discard seeds. Cool for 30 minutes., Meanwhile, make Maple Cinnamon Almonds Place almonds in a frying pan over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes or until just toasted. Add maple syrup and cinnamon. Cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute or until almonds are golden and toasted. Transfer to a bowl. Set aside to cool., Reserve 1/3 cup of raspberry sauce. Add dry apera to remaining raspberry sauce. Stir to combine., Using an electric mixer, beat cream cheese, icing sugar, rind and juice until light and fluffy. Add 1 cup cream. Beat until combined., Cut each sponge roll into 2cm-thick slices. Thinly slice 2 peaches. Reserve 1/4 cup fresh raspberries and 1 tablespoon almonds. Layer sponge roll slices, peach slices, remaining raspberries and almonds with dollops of cream cheese mixture and raspberry apera mixture in a 3-litre (12-cup-capacity) serving bowl., Using an electric mixer, beat vanilla and remaining cream until just-soft peaks form. Thinly slice remaining peach. Layer spoonfuls of cream mixture with peach slices and reserved fresh raspberries, almonds and raspberry sauce over trifle. Serve.

name: Cinnamon butternut log
ingredient: [{'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cinnamon, plus 2 tsp extra'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'caster sugar, plus 2 tsp extra'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': "250g packet Arnott's Butternut Snap Cookies"}]
steps: Place the cream, vanilla, cinnamon and sugar in a bowl and beat until stiff peaks form. Use half the cream mixture to sandwich together the biscuits and arrange standing side-by-side on a baking tray lined with non-stick baking paper to form a log. Carefully spread remaining cream mixture over entire surface of log. Roll in non-stick baking paper and refrigerate for 6 hours or overnight until set., Combine extra cinnamon and sugar and scatter over a piece of non-stick baking paper. Carefully unroll the log and place on the cinnamon mixture. Using the paper to help, roll the log back and forth to coat evenly. Slice log diagonally to serve.

name: Warm potato salad with cheesy sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'sebago potatoes'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, unpeeled'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cream cheese, chopped, softened'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sour cream'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'gruyere cheese, grated'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'middle bacon rashers, trimmed, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'zest, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Line a large baking tray with baking paper., Cut potatoes into 5cm chunks. Place in a large saucepan. Cover with cold water. Bring to the boil over medium-high heat. Boil for 5 minutes or until just tender. Drain. Transfer to prepared tray. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons oil. Toss to coat. Season well. Roast for 40 minutes, turning potato halfway through cooking. Add garlic. Roast for a further 15 minutes or until potato is golden and tender., Place cream cheese, sour cream and milk in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until melted and smooth. Squeeze garlic from skins into mixture. Add mustard and gruyère. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and smooth. Season with salt and pepper., Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add bacon. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until golden. Remove from heat. Add onion. Stir to combine., Add 3/4 of the bacon mixture to cheese sauce. Place potato in a serving bowl. Drizzle sauce over potato. Season with pepper. Sprinkle with lemon zest and remaining bacon mixture. Serve.

name: Apple, fennel and chicken salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chickpeas, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'sticks, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'fennel, thinly sliced, fronds reserved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Pink', 'name': 'Lady apple, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cooked chicken, shredded'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley leaves'}]
steps: Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a small frying pan over medium heat. Cook the chickpeas, stirring occasionally, for 5 mins or until golden., Arrange the onion, celery, fennel, apple and chicken on serving plates. Sprinkle with the chickpeas., Combine the lemon juice, garlic and remaining oil in a small bowl. Drizzle over the salad. Sprinkle with the parsley and reserved fennel fronds. Season to serve.

name: Toasted salmon burrito
ingredient: [{'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'skinless salmon fillets'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Mexican spice mix'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'wholegrain', 'name': 'wraps'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'iceberg', 'name': 'lettuce, shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'carrot, peeled, coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'grated cheddar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'avocados', 'name': ', thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander sprigs'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Garlic', 'name': 'aioli, to serve'}]
steps: Cut salmon into 1cm slices. Place spice mix and sesame seeds in a large sealable bag. Add salmon. Seal. Toss to coat., Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Spray with oil. Cook salmon, in batches, for 1-2 minutes each side, until cooked., Top each wrap with lettuce, carrot, cheddar, avocado, salmon, coriander and aioli. Wrap up to enclose., Cook the burritos, 1 at a time, on a preheated sandwich press for 1-2 minutes, until crisp and light golden. Remove and cut in half. Drizzle with a little more aioli.

name: Cumin and turmeric steamed cauliflower
ingredient: [{'quantity': '700', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cauliflower, cut into small florets'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece fresh ginger, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'low-fat Tamar Valley Greek Style Yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'roughly chopped fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}]
steps: Combine cauliflower, ginger, cumin and turmeric in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat., Place cauliflower mixture in a metal steamer. Place steamer over a large saucepan of simmering water. Cook, covered, for 8 minutes or until tender., Transfer to a large bowl. Add yoghurt, coriander and lemon juice. Gently toss to combine. Serve.

name: Saffron & pistachio rice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '660', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(3 cups) medium-grain rice, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'saffron threads'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3 cups) cold water'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of salt'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pistachio kernels'}]
steps: Heat the butter and oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the rice and saffron. Stir to combine., Add the water and salt. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and cook for 12 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Set aside, covered, for 10 minutes to stand., Heat a frying pan over medium heat. Add the pistachios and cook, stirring often, for 1-2 minutes or until aromatic. Coarsely chop. Add to the rice mixture and stir to combine. Serve warm.

name: Potato and anchovy bakes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(about 4 large) desiree potatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '45', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can anchovies in olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '95g cans Sirena Tuna In Rosemary Infused Oil'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'thyme'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemo', 'name': 'n'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'pouring cream'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley'}, {'quantity': '15', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) dried breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'watercress'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'orange', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil, to drizzle'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 210C. Wash potatoes, then, using a mandolin or knife, cut into julienne (matchsticks). Peel, halve and thinly slice onions. Drain anchovies and tuna, then finely chop anchovies., Melt butter in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add onions and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add anchovies, then strip leaves from thyme and zest lemon into pan. Reserve lemon. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until anchovies are dissolved. Add potatoes and cook, turning occasionally, for 3 minutes or until slightly softened. Add cream and toss to combine., Grease 6 x 310ml (1 1/4-cup) ovenproof dishes. Divide half the potato mixture among dishes, top with tuna, then remaining potato mixture. Tear the leaves from parsley, finely chop, then combine with breadcrumbs in a bowl. Scatter over potato mixture. Bake for 25 minutes or until tops are golden.

name: Penang chicken & bamboo shoot skewers
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': '(100g) penang curry paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '165', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can light coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'chicken', 'name': 'breast fillets, cut into 2cm cubes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red capsicum, cut into 2cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '190', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can sliced bamboo shoots, drained'}, {'quantity': '1 1/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(250g) jasmine rice'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roughly chopped coriander leaves'}]
steps: Soak eight 20cm wooden skewers in hot water for 10 minutes. Mix the curry paste, fish sauce and coconut milk, then add chicken and turn to coat., Thread 3 alternating pieces of capsicum, bamboo and chicken onto each skewer. Add 1/4 cup (60ml) water to remaining marinade and set aside. Cook the rice according to packet instructions, then toss with the coriander., Meanwhile, heat a large frypan over medium-high heat. In batches if necessary, add the chicken skewers and cook for 1-2 minutes on each of the 4 sides. Pour over the reserved marinade and bring to the boil, then simmer over low heat for 2 minutes or until marinade thickens slightly. Serve the skewers with rice and drizzle with the pan juices.

name: Radicchio and rocket salad with balsamic dressing
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'radicchio', 'name': 'treviso, leaves separated, coarsely torn'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'rocket, trimmed, coarsely torn'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(45g) toasted pine nuts'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}]
steps: Place the radicchio, rocket and pine nuts in a large bowl., Combine the oil and vinegar in a screw-top jar and shake until well combined. Taste and season with salt and pepper., Drizzle the dressing over the salad and gently toss to combine. Serve immediately.

name: Lemon pepper chicken schnitzel with fennel salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon pepper'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(110g) panko breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(75g) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'Brand Australian free range eggs, lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Rice', 'name': 'bran oil, for shallow-frying'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'Coles RSPCA approved chicken breast fillets, spilt in half crossways'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, trimmed, halved diagonally'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'fennel', 'name': ', thinly sliced lengthways, fronds reserved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'white wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby washed potato, quartered, steamed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Combine lemon pepper and breadcrumbs in a shallow bowl. Place flour and egg in separate shallow bowls. Coat chicken pieces in flour, shaking off excess. Dip in egg then breadcrumb mixture., Add enough oil to a large frying pan to reach a depth of 1cm. Place over medium heat. Cook chicken for 5 mins each side or until golden and cooked though. Drain on a plate lined with paper towel., Meanwhile, cook beans in a saucepan of salted boiling water for 2 mins or until just tender. Drain. Refresh under cold water and drain. Combine beans with fennel and onion in a bowl. Whisk vinegar, oil and mustard in a small bowl and drizzle over salad. Toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper., Divide fennel salad, schnitzel and potato among serving plates. Garnish with reserved fennel fronds. Serve with lemon wedges.

name: Fried chicken with coleslaw
ingredient: [{'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'buttermilk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'mustard powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sweet paprika'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'chicken', 'name': 'drumsticks'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) whole-egg mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'white wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(160g) finely shredded green cabbage'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80g) finely shredded red cabbage'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', grated'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(300g) plain flour, seasoned'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sunflower', 'name': 'oil, to deep-fry'}]
steps: Combine the buttermilk, mustard, paprika, garlic and 1 teaspoon each sea salt and pepper. Add chicken and turn to coat in the buttermilk mixture. Cover and marinate in the fridge for at least 1 hour, or overnight. Preheat the oven to 180°C., To make coleslaw, whisk mayonnaise, vinegar and 2 tablespoons warm water in a bowl until combined. Season, then toss with the cabbage, carrot and spring onion. Chill. Place flour on a plate. Remove chicken from the buttermilk mixture, shaking off excess. Roll in flour, then shake off excess., Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large pan to 190°C (a cube of bread should turn golden in 30 seconds). In 2 batches, fry chicken for 4-5 minutes, turning with tongs to ensure even cooking, until crisp and golden., Place on a tray and bake in the oven for 15 minutes until cooked through. Sprinkle chicken with salt and serve with coleslaw.

name: Spring leek minestrone
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'zucchin', 'name': 'i'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'leek', 'name': ', pale section only, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(1L) salt-reduced chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '200g) Coles RSPCA approved chicken breast fillet'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'farfalle pasta'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'asparagus, woody ends trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60g) frozen peas'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'zest, to serve'}]
steps: Use a mandolin or a vegetable peeler to peel zucchini lengthways into ribbons. Thinly slice ribbons lengthways., Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the leek and garlic and cook, stirring, for 3 mins or until leek softens. Transfer to a bowl., Add the stock, 2 cups (500ml) water and chicken to the pan. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 mins or until chicken is cooked. Transfer chicken to a chopping board and coarsely shred., Add the pasta to the stock and cook for 5 mins. Add leek mixture, zucchini, asparagus and peas. Cook for 5 mins or until the vegetables are tender and the pasta is al dente. Stir in the chicken., Meanwhile, to make the pesto, process basil, parsley, garlic, almonds, parmesan and lemon rind in a food processor until finely chopped. With the motor running, gradually add the oil in a thin, steady stream until combined., Divide the soup among serving bowls. Top with dollops of pesto and sprinkle with lemon zest.

name: Cucumber salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'telegraph', 'name': 'cucumbers, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'onion, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'rice wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of ground cayenne pepper'}]
steps: Combine the cucumber and onion in a serving bowl. Season with salt., Add vinegar, honey, oil and garlic. Toss to combine. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper.

name: Apple and almond strudel
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'filo pastry'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can apple pie fruit'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'almond meal (ground almonds)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sultanas'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Low', 'name': '-fat custard or ice-cream, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper., Place 1 sheet of filo pastry on workbench. Lightly spray with oil. Cover with another sheet of pastry. Spray and fold in half (short side to short side) to form a square. Repeat with remaining pastry sheets., Combine apple, almond meal, sugar, sultanas, cinnamon and nutmeg in a bowl. Spread one-quarter of the apple mixture over 1 pastry square, allowing a 3cm border at the top and bottom edges., Fold in sides and roll up tightly to enclose filling. Place, seam-side down, on prepared tray. Repeat with remaining pastry and apple mixture., Lightly spray strudels with oil. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until pastry is crisp and golden. Serve with low-fat custard or ice-cream.

name: Spaghetti with prawns and feta
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80ml) extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'vine ripened tomatoes, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh oregano leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sea', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to season'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cooked cocktail prawns'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'thin spaghetti'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Clover Creek Tasmanian feta, crumbled'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Finely', 'name': 'grated zest of 1 lemon'}]
steps: Place half the oil and garlic in a large frying pan and cook gently for a few minutes until garlic softens. Add tomatoes, paprika, sugar, half the thyme, oregano, salt and pepper; cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes, or until tomatoes have softened slightly. Add prawns and gently cook until just heated through., Meanwhile, cook pasta in a large pan of salted, boiling water until just tender. Add drained pasta to sauce and toss until well combined., Divide pasta between four serving bowls. Sprinkle fetta, lemon zest and remaining thyme leaves over each bowl, and drizzle with remaining olive oil. Serve immediately.

name: Tuna, bean and roasted tomato fattoush
ingredient: [{'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green beans, trimmed, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber, peeled into ribbons'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'pita breads'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sumac (see note)'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can four bean mix, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '425', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can tuna in oil, drained, flaked into large pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Line a large baking tray with baking paper., Place green beans and cucumber in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Add vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat. Set aside for 20 minutes., Meanwhile, place tomatoes and capsicum on prepared tray. Spray with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Roast for 20 minutes or until tender., Heat a chargrill pan over medium-high heat. Cook pita, 1 at a time, turning, for 1 to 2 minutes or until crisp. Transfer to a baking tray. Brush with 1/2 the oil. Sprinkle with sumac. Season with salt., Add four bean mix, tomatoes and capsicum, tuna, green onion, parsley leaves and remaining oil to green bean mixture. Toss to combine. Tear bread into pieces. Add to green bean mixture. Toss until just combined. Serve immediately

name: Crumbed lamb cutlets with warm pumpkin salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butternut pumpkin, peeled, seeded'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'grape tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can chickpeas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bulb', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) panko (Japanese) breadcrumbs (see note)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'lamb', 'name': 'cutlets'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'feta'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 220C fan-forced. Meanwhile, cut pumpkin into 2cm pieces and place with tomatoes in a roasting pan. Rinse and drain chickpeas, then pat dry with paper towel. Break garlic into unpeeled cloves and add to pan with chickpeas., Drizzle pumpkin mixture with 2 tablespoons oil, season with salt and pepper, then roast, stirring halfway, for 20 minutes or until pumpkin is tender. Meanwhile, tear leaves from parsley. Finely chop handful and place in a bowl. Reserve remainder to serve. Add breadcrumbs to bowl, then zest over 1 lemon. Reserve lemon. Line a tray with baking paper. Place flour in a second bowl and season. Crack eggs into a third bowl and lightly beat. Dust lamb with flour, shaking off excess, dip in eggs, then coat in breadcrumb mixture. Place on lined tray, then refrigerate until needed., Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Cook cutlets, in 2 batches, for 2 1/2 minutes each side or until crumbs are golden and meat is still pink in centre., Squeeze juice from reserved lemon over pumpkin mixture, drizzle with vinegar, then transfer to a platter. Cut remaining lemon into wedges. Crumble feta over pumpkin mixture, then scatter with reserved parsley. Top with cutlets and serve with lemon wedges.

name: Reduced-fat pork nachos
ingredient: [{'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pork fillet'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'white', 'name': 'corn tortillas, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can kidney beans, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'mild thick and chunky salsa'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated reduced-fat cheddar cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'avocado, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'low-fat natural yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'vine', 'name': '-ripened tomatoes, finely chopped'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Line 3 large baking trays with baking paper. Lightly spray pork fillet with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Heat a frying pan over high heat. Cook pork, turning, for 6 minutes or until browned. Transfer to 1 prepared tray. Bake for 7 to 10 minutes or until cooked through. Stand, covered, for 5 minutes to rest. Roughly chop pork. Place in a bowl., Place tortilla wedges, in a single layer, on remaining prepared baking trays. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden and crisp., Chop half the coriander leaves. Add chopped coriander, kidney beans, salsa and three-quarters of the onion to pork. Toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper., Arrange tortilla wedges, slightly overlapping, in a round baking dish. Spoon pork mixture over wedges. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 7 to 10 minutes or until cheese has melted., Meanwhile, mash avocado in a bowl. Stir in yoghurt and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. Divide the nachos between plates. Sprinkle with remaining coriander leaves and onion. Serve with avocado and tomato.

name: Slow-cooked pork and eggplant cannelloni with crème fraiche
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': '⁄3 cup extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'eggplant, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'boneless pork shoulder, trimmed and cut into thirds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onions, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Zest', 'name': 'of half orange'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g canned cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'bay', 'name': 'leaves'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'lasagne sheets'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'Bulla Crème Fraiche'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Parmesan', 'name': 'or Provolone cheese, finely grated'}]
steps: Heat 1/3 of the oil1⁄3 cup extra virgin olive oil in a large heavy-based saucepan over medium heat. Cook the eggplant800g eggplant, diced in batches until golden, remove with a slotted spoon and set aside, repeat with remaining eggplant adding oil as needed., Add pork2kg boneless pork shoulder, trimmed and cut into thirds to pan, season with salt and pepper and cook until browned. Remove from pan and set aside. Add onion2 brown onions, finely chopped and garlic6 cloves garlic, finely chopped and cook until lightly browned. Add flour2 tbsp plain flour and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add sugar1/4 cup brown sugar, balsamic1/4 cup balsamic vinegar, orange zestZest of half orange, thyme1/4 cup thyme leaves and paprika2 tbsp smoked paprika; stir well to combine. Add stock2 1/2 cups chicken stock, tomato2 x 400g canned cherry tomatoes, bay leaves4 bay leaves, half of the eggplant and pork and bring to a simmer. Cover, cook over a gentle heat for 2-3 hours or until very tender., Remove pork from cooking liquid and, using two forks, shred the meat. Add 2 cups of sauce to shredded pork; this forms the cannelloni filling. Add remaining eggplant to sauce and reduce if necessary., Preheat oven to 200C (180C fan forced). Grease the base of an ovenproof dish. Top a pasta20 fresh lasagne sheets sheet with approximately 1⁄3 cup of meat mixture and roll lengthwise. Place, fold side down in baking dish, repeat with remaining filling and pasta sheets. Spoon remaining sauce over cannelloni, cover and seal well with baking paper and foil. Cook for 20–30 minutes. Remove cover, plate two cannelloni with sauce, spoon over crème fraiche400ml Crème Fraiche, top with a generous handful of grated cheeseParmesan or Provolone cheese, finely grated. Flash under the grill quickly to brown cheese.

name: Quick chicken and corn soup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'chicken', 'name': 'breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(375ml) Massel chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'stalks, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'leek', 'name': '(white part only), finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(180g) small pasta shapes, such as small shells or small macaroni'}, {'quantity': '310', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can creamed corn'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Sliced', 'name': 'baby spinach leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Place the chicken and stock in a large pan with 3 cups (750ml) water. Bring to the boil, then simmer for 10 minutes over medium-low heat. Transfer chicken to a bowl, then strain stock into a jug or bowl., Heat the oil in the cleaned pan over medium-low heat and add the onion, garlic, celery and leek and cook, stirring occasionally, over medium-low heat for 5 minutes or until the onion is soft. Add the strained stock and bring to the boil., Meanwhile, cut the chicken into small pieces. Add to the soup with the pasta and creamed corn and return to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer rapidly, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes or until the pasta is al dente. You may need to add a little extra water if the soup becomes too thick. Season to taste with a little sea salt and plenty of black pepper., To serve, add a handful of sliced spinach to the base of each bowl and ladle over the hot soup (the heat will wilt the spinach).

name: Grilled chicken with Sicilian mint sauce
ingredient: [{'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '120g small chicken breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'lemon', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'bay leaves'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'torn marjoram leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'Spanish onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'dried chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped spearmint leaves'}]
steps: Remove tenderloins from chicken and reserve for another use. Using the flat side of a meat mallet, flatten chicken to an even thickness. Cut 1 lemon into 6 thin slices. Place a slice on each breast, top with a bay leaf and secure with kitchen string. Place in a flat container and squeeze the juice from the remaining lemon over, drizzle with 2 tablespoons oil and scatter with marjoram., For Sicilian mint sauce, place onion in a bowl, cover with boiling water and stand for 5 minutes, then drain well and return to bowl. Add remaining oil and rest of the ingredients and season with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper., Preheat a barbecue to medium. Season chicken, then cook, plain side down first, for 2 minutes or until white around edges, turn and cook for a further 2 minutes or until cooked through. Serve chicken drizzled with sauce.

name: Chargrilled pumpkin and haloumi salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'jarrahdale pumpkin, peeled, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g packet haloumi, sliced'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'walnuts'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sunflower seeds'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'torn fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}]
steps: Spray a chargrill with oil. Heat over medium heat. Cook pumpkin for 3 to 4 minutes each side or until tender. Transfer to a bowl. Cook haloumi for 1 minute each side or until golden., Add haloumi, spinach, walnuts, sunflower seeds and parsley to pumpkin. Whisk vinegar and oil together in a jug. Season with pepper. Drizzle over pumpkin mixture. Toss gently to combine. Serve.

name: Spicy beef and broccoli stir-fry over rice noodles
ingredient: [{'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'vermicelli rice noodles'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'canola oil'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '3-star beef mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chillies, thinly sliced into rounds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onions (60g total), sliced, white and green parts divided'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'knob fresh ginger, peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'head', 'name': 'broccoli, cut into florets, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'oyster sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'corn flour'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roasted salted peanuts'}]
steps: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the noodles and cook for 2 minutes, or until they are tender. Drain well., Heat a wok or large heavy frying pan over medium-high heat. When the wok is smoking, add the oil and then the beef, chillies, white parts of the spring onions, ginger and garlic. Cook, stirring frequently to break up the beef, for about 4 minutes, or until the beef is cooked and browned. Add the broccoli and cook for 2 minutes, or until it has wilted. Whisk together the stock, oyster sauce, soy sauce, sugar and corn flour. Stir into the beef mixture and cook for about 1 minute, or until the sauce has thickened. Remove from the heat and stir in the peanuts and most of the green parts of the spring onions., Divide the noodles among 4 plates. Spoon the stir-fried beef over the noodles and sprinkle with the remaining spring onions. Serve immediately.

name: Coconut French toast
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'can Ayam coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'thick white bread'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Tamar Valley Greek Style Yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'bananas, sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 150°C/130°C fan-forced. Line a large baking tray with baking paper., Whisk eggs, coconut milk, cinnamon and sugar together in a shallow dish., Melt 1/4 of the butter in a large frying pan over medium heat. Dip 2 slices of bread in egg mixture until soaked through. Drain excess egg mixture. Cook bread for 2 to 3 minutes each side or until golden. Transfer to prepared tray. Place in oven to keep warm. Repeat with remaining slices of bread, egg mixture and butter., Divide French toasts between plates. Top each with yoghurt and banana. Serve drizzled with honey.

name: Beef stir-fry with quick kimchi
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'flat rice noodles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef sirloin steak, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'soy sauce'}]
steps: For the kimchi, combine cabbage, spring onion and carrot in a bowl. Combine salt with 1.5L (6 cups) water in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to the boil, then stir for 1-2 minutes until salt dissolves. Remove from heat and pour over cabbage mixture., Set aside for 10 minutes to pickle. Rinse and drain, then set aside to cool. Whiz remaining kimchi ingredients in a small food processor to a paste. Add to cabbage and stir to combine. Set aside., Soak the noodles in boiling water for 5 minutes or until soft, then drain., Heat a wok or large frypan over high heat until almost smoking. Add sesame oil and beef, then cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add soy sauce and cook for a further 2 minutes. Remove from heat., To serve, divide the noodles among 4 bowls and top with the beef, kimchi and extra spring onion.

name: Creamy tuna and pea pasta bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'dried curls pasta'}, {'quantity': '350', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'broccoli, cut into small florets'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '425', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can tuna in springwater, drained, flaked'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '375ml cans evaporated milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh white breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'grated tasty cheese'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Chopped', 'name': 'fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salad', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cherry', 'name': 'tomatoes, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling salted water, following packet directions until tender, adding broccoli for last 2 minutes. Drain. Return to pan., Meanwhile, heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until onion has softened., Add tuna, peas, onion mixture and flour to pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Add evaporated milk. Stir to combine. Pour mixture into a 12 cup-capacity ovenproof dish. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and cheese., Bake for 30 minutes or until heated through and top golden. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with salad leaves and cherry tomatoes.

name: Cheesy garlic damper pull-apart with bacon chilli jam
ingredient: [{'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'Coles', 'name': 'bakery damper rolls'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pizza cheese'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley leaves, to garnish'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thyme', 'name': 'sprigs, to garnish'}]
steps: To make the bacon chilli jam: Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add bacon. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until bacon is crisp. Using a slotted spoon, transfer to a large plate lined with paper towel., Add onion to same pan over medium heat. Cook, stirring for 8 to 10 minutes, until golden.
