Return bacon to pan with garlic, sugar, maple syrup, vinegar and chilli. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 8 to 10 minutes or until mixture thickens. Cool 15 minutes., Preheat oven to 220C/200C fan-forced. Grease a 4cm-deep, 21cm round (base), 29cm (top) frying pan., Cut 2 slices horizontally and 2 slices vertically into the top of each damper roll, being careful not to cut the whole way through the rolls. Open up slices slightly. Combine butter and garlic in a small bowl. Spread butter mixture on cut sides of damper rolls. Place rolls in prepared frying pan. Spoon 3/4 of the bacon jam into cuts. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbling., Dollop with remaining bacon jam and sprinkle with parsley and thyme. Serve immediately.

name: Lamb shanks with Middle Eastern flavours
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'lamb', 'name': 'shanks (see note)'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'eschalots', 'name': '(see note)'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'quill'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'star', 'name': 'anise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'orange', 'name': ', zest peeled into strips'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'pomegranate molasses (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'L', 'name': 'chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'dried', 'name': 'figs, halved'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'moghrabieh (see note) (pearl couscous)'}, {'quantity': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'natural almonds, roasted'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 160C. Heat oil1 tbsp olive oil in a casserole over medium heat, then brown shanks6 lamb shanks (see note), in 2 batches, for 5 minutes or until browned all over. Set aside., Add eschalots12 eschalots (see note), garlic8 cloves garlic, crushed, spices1 tsp ground cumin|1 cinnamon quill|4 star anise and orange zest1 orange, zest peeled into strips, and stir for 5 minutes or until eschalots are lightly browned. Add tomato paste2 tbsp tomato paste, pomegranate molasses3 tbsp pomegranate molasses (see note), stock1L chicken style liquid stock and figs6 dried figs, halved. Return lamb to casserole, bring to the boil, then cover with a lid and transfer to oven. Cook for 2 hours or until meat pulls away from bone easily; the time will depend on the size of the shanks., Half an hour before lamb is cooked, cook moghrabieh200g moghrabieh (see note) (pearl couscous) in a saucepan of boiling salted water for 15 minutes or until almost tender. Drain and keep warm., Meanwhile, for orange salad, segment oranges2 oranges and lemon1 lemon (see note). Cut segments in half, place in a bowl, then squeeze over juice from membranes. Rinse onion1/2 red onion under running water and squeeze dry. Add to bowl with olives50g pitted kalamata olives, halved and coriander2 tbsp coriander leaves, and toss to combine., Skim off excess fat from shank cooking liquid, scatter with almonds30g natural almonds, roasted, then serve shanks and liquid with moghrabieh and orange salad.

name: Barbecue chicken with carrot-zucchini slaw
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil, plus 1 tbsp extra'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'small', 'name': '-medium brown onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Cornwall’s cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Coles Brand tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Coles Brand brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Coles Brand Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Coles Brand Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt'}, {'quantity': '1/8', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of Coles Brand cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(about 2 small-medium) Coles RSPCA approved chicken breast fillets, each sliced through the centre lengthways into 2'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Coles Brand whole egg mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': "Cornwall's cider vinegar"}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': '(180g) zucchini, cut into thin matchstick-size strips'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': '(200g) carrots, cut into thin matchstick-size strips'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red onion, very thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh coriander, leaves and stems separated, leaves coarsely chopped'}]
steps: In a small heavy saucepan, heat 2 teaspoons of the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring often, for 4 minutes, or until tender. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute or until garlic is tender., Stir in the vinegar, tomato sauce, water, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, salt, black pepper and cayenne. Bring to a simmer over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer uncovered, stirring often, for 15 minutes or until the sauce reduces and thickens slightly. Remove from heat. Reserve 1/4 cup sauce for basting., Heat the barbecue on medium-high. Coat chicken with remaining tablespoon of oil and season with salt and pepper. Place chicken on the grill, close the hood for hooded barbecues, and cook chicken, basting occasionally with reserved 1/4 cup barbecue sauce, for 2-3 minutes each side or until cooked through and slightly charred on the outside but still juicy., Meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk the mayonnaise and vinegar to blend. Season., Using your hands, gently toss the zucchini, carrots, onion and coriander leaves and stems in a large bowl to combine. Toss the slaw with enough dressing to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper., Transfer the chicken and slaw to plates. Serve with remaining barbecue sauce.

name: Red hot shot
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'ripe tomatoes, chilled'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) water'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': '-3 drops red Tabasco pepper sauce'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Ice', 'name': 'cubes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'sticks with leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lemon', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Use a juice extractor to process the tomatoes. Transfer to a jug. (Alternatively, place the tomatoes in the jug of a blender and blend until pureed. Strain through a sieve into a jug. Discard seeds and skin.), Combine the tomato juice (you will need 300ml), water, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce and Tabasco in a cocktail shaker. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Add the ice cubes, cover with the lid and shake well until chilled., Strain the tomato mixture into 2 serving glasses. Garnish with celery sticks and lemon wedges, and serve immediately.

name: Rich dark chocolate and stout fruit cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'mixed dried fruit'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'prunes, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red glace cherries, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dark brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'bicarbonate of soda'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'mixed spice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'stout'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Blanched', 'name': 'almonds, to decorate'}]
steps: Place butter, mixed dried fruit, raisins, prunes, cherries, sugar and 1/2 cup water in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until butter is melted. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in bicarbonate of soda. Set aside to cool completely., Preheat oven to 150C/130C fan-forced. Line a 6cm-deep, 20cm square cake pan with 3 layers of baking paper, extending paper 3cm above edges of pan., Add eggs to cooled fruit mixture. Stir to combine. Sift over flour, spice and cocoa. Mix well. Stir in stout and chocolate. Spoon mixture into prepared pan. Level top. Tap pan gently on bench to remove any air bubbles. Level top. Arrange almonds on top of cake in a decorative pattern, pressing gently to secure., Bake for 3 hours or until a knife inserted into cake comes out clean (cover cake loosely with foil during cooking if over-browning)., Place a sheet of foil over cake in pan, wrapping foil down sides of pan. Place a wooden board on top of cake and turn upside down to cool completely in pan. Remove cake from pan and serve.

name: Boston baked beans
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'brown onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'middle', 'name': 'bacon rashers, trimmed, cut into 3cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'garlic clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'golden syrup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans borlotti beans, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans diced tomatoes'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced. Heat oil in a flameproof ovenproof dish over medium heat. Cook onion, stirring, for 3 minutes or until softened. Add bacon and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 3 to 5 minutes or until bacon has browned., Add paprika. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add sugar, tomato paste, golden syrup and worcestershire sauce. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until combined. Stir in beans and tomato. Bring to the boil., Bake for 20 minutes or until sauce has thickened and beans are heated through. Serve.

name: Slow cooker French onion chicken and cheese melt
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'chicken breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g pkts cream cheese, at room temperature, chopped'}, {'quantity': '120', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) grated tasty cheese'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sachet French onion soup mix'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'shortcut', 'name': 'bacon rashers, cooked, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped chives'}]
steps: Place the chicken, cream cheese and 80g (1 cup) tasty cheese in a slow cooker. Sprinkle over French onion soup mix and pour over 125ml (1/2 cup) water. Cover and cook on HIGH for 4 hours., Use 2 forks to shred the chicken (see note). Mix the shredded meat through the other ingredients to coat. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Cover and cook for a further 30 minutes., Sprinkle with bacon and chives to serve.

name: Chicken with potato cakes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '135', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'btl Always Fresh Fusions Red Pepper or Tomato Tapenade'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'chicken', 'name': 'breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Golden Delight potatoes, washed, peeled, coarsely grated (see note)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Olive', 'name': 'oil, for shallow-frying'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mixed salad leaves'}]
steps: Place the tapenade in a bowl. Add the chicken and turn to coat., Place the potato in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Add enough oil to a frying pan to come 5mm up the side. Heat over medium heat. Add four 1/3-cup portions of potato and flatten slightly. Cook for 2-3 minutes each side or until crisp and golden. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel. Repeat, in 2 more batches, with the remaining mixture., Meanwhile, preheat grill on high. Cook chicken for 3-4 minutes each side or until cooked. Thickly slice., Serve with potato cakes and salad.

name: Easy lamb sausage caponata stew
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '(', 'name': '500g) thick lamb sausages'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'eggplant', 'name': ', cut into 1.5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'name': 'capsicum, cut into 1.5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'stalks, cut into 1.5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fennel seeds, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'drained baby capers'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'small fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '480g sourdough garlic bread, warmed, to serve'}]
steps: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large, deep frying pan over high heat. Cook sausages, turning, for 5 minutes or until browned. Transfer to a board. Thinly slice., Heat remaining oil in same pan over medium-high heat. Add eggplant, capsicum, celery and onion. Cook, stirring, for 10 minutes or until eggplant is almost tender. Add garlic and fennel seeds. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until fragrant., Add paste, tomatoes and 1 cup cold water. Bring to the boil. Return sausage to pan. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 10 minutes or until sauce thickens and sausage is cooked through. Stir in vinegar and capers. Sprinkle with basil leaves. Serve with garlic bread.

name: Lemony lamb tray bake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby chat potato'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'lemons'}, {'quantity': '800', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lean lamb leg roast, fat trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'zucchini, thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomato'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green Sicilian olives, pitted and drained'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C or 180°C fan-forced. Place potatoes and 2 tablespoons water in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave, covered, on High (100%) for 6 minutes or until tender. Drain. Refresh under cold water. Drain., Meanwhile, remove leaves from half the oregano sprigs. Discard stems and finely chop leaves. Finely grate rind from lemon, then cut lemon into 8 pieces. Combine chopped oregano, rind and 1½ tsp sea salt in a small bowl. Season with pepper., Tie lamb with unwaxed white kitchen string at 5cm intervals. Heat oil in a flameproof baking dish over medium heat. Cook lamb, turning, for 10 minutes or until browned. Add potatoes, zucchini and lemon pieces to dish. Sprinkle lamb and vegetables with oregano salt mixture., Bake for 15 minutes. Add tomatoes, olives and remaining oregano sprigs and bake for 10 minutes or until potatoes are golden and lamb is cooked to your liking. Serve.

name: Minted sausage stew
ingredient: [{'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'thick', 'name': 'beef sausages'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'sliced', 'name': 'brown onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried mint'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'parsnips', 'name': ', halved and thickly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen peas'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'mint, to serve'}]
steps: Cook beef sausages8 thick beef sausages in a large heavy-based saucepan over medium heat, turning, for 10 minutes or until browned. Transfer to a plate. Cover to keep warm., Add brown onion1 sliced brown onion to pan. Cook for 5 minutes or until soft. Add garlic cloves2 garlic cloves, crushed and dried mint1 1/2 tsp dried mint. Cook for 30 seconds. Add carrots2 carrots, thickly sliced and parsnips2 parsnips, halved and thickly sliced. Cook for 5 minutes. Add plain flour1 tbsp plain flour. Cook for 1 minute. Slowly stir in chicken stock2 cups chicken stock until smooth and combined. Return sausages to pan. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, partially covered, for 30 minutes or until sausages are cooked., Stir in frozen peas1/2 cup frozen peas. Cook for 2 minutes or until peas are tender. Serve sprinkled with fresh mintFresh mint, to serve.

name: Chorizo skewers with apple and chickpea salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '6', 'unit': '(', 'name': '500g) fresh chorizo sausages (see note)'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'marinated roasted capsicums (see note)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans chickpeas'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'savoy cabbage'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eschalot', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'granny', 'name': 'smith apple'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'lemo', 'name': 'n'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'white wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) extra virgin olive oil'}]
steps: Flatten sausages, firmly pushing down on them with your hands (this will make cooking quicker and easier), then cut each one into 3 widthwise. Cut capsicums into 12 wide strips, then thread 2 pieces of capsicum and 3 pieces of sausage alternately onto skewers. Makes 6., Heat a chargrill pan or heavy-based frying pan over medium heat. Cook skewers, turning, for 8 minutes or until cooked through., Meanwhile, to make salad, drain chickpeas and rinse under running water. Drain again and place in a large bowl. Pick parsley leaves, finely shred cabbage, thinly slice eschalots and cut apple into julienne (matchsticks), then add to chickpeas., Juice lemon. Whisk mustard, vinegar and lemon juice in a small bowl, then gradually whisk in oil. Season with salt and pepper. Pour dressing over chickpea mixture and toss well to combine., Serve skewers with the salad.

name: Smoked salmon tart
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 3/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cold butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'iced water'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Rocket', 'name': ', to serve'}]
steps: Place the flour and butter in a large bowl. Use your fingertips to rub the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs. Add the water and use a round-bladed knife in a cutting motion to mix until just combined. (Add a little more water if the mixture is too dry – to test it, pinch some dough together). Bring the dough together in the bowl., Roll out the dough on a sheet of non-stick baking paper to fit a 26cm tart pan, with removable base. Line the pan with pastry and trim excess. Chill for 20 mins. Preheat oven to 180C (160C fan-forced)., Line the pastry case with baking paper and fill with pastry weights or rice. Bake for 15 mins. Remove paper and weights or rice and bake for a further 15 mins or until pastry is dry and lightly golden. Set aside to cool completely., To make the filling, heat the oil in a medium frying pan over medium heat. Cook the spring onion, stirring, for 3 mins or until soft. Cool, then spread over the pastry base., Arrange the salmon in the tart shell and sprinkle with most of the dill. Top with brie and sprinkle with remaining dill., Place the tart on a baking tray. Whisk the eggs and cream in a large bowl until smooth. Season. Pour the egg mixture evenly over filling. Bake for 35 mins or until set and golden. Stand for 5 mins before cutting into wedges. Serve with rocket.

name: Sour cherry and hazelnut panforte slab
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'natural almonds'}, {'quantity': '110', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet skinless hazelnuts'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet pistachio kernels'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'CSR Golden Syrup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'CSR Caster Sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fruit mince'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'block dark chocolate, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried apricots, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried sour cherries'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Dutch-processed cocoa'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'mixed spice'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 170C/150C fan-forced. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Grease a 20cm x 30cm lamington pan. Line base and sides with baking paper, extending paper 5cm above edges of pan on all sides., Place nuts on prepared tray. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until toasted. Stand for 30 minutes to cool. Reserve 2 tablespoons., Place golden syrup, sugar, fruit mince, 1/2 the chocolate, 3/4 cup apricots and 3/4 cup cherries in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until chocolate is melted and smooth. Bring to the boil. Remove from heat. Transfer to a large heatproof bowl., Add nuts to chocolate mixture. Sift over flour, cocoa and mixed spice. Stir until well combined. Pour mixture into prepared pan, spreading evenly. Bake for 1 hour 10 minutes or until top is just firm to touch in the centre. Cool completely in pan., Place remaining chocolate in a microwavesafe bowl. Microwave on HIGH (100%), stirring with a metal spoon every 30 seconds, for 1 minute or until melted and smooth. Drizzle chocolate over panforte. Roughly chop reserved nuts and remaining cherries. Sprinkle panforte with nuts, cherries and remaining apricots. Stand for 30 minutes or until chocolate has set. Cut into pieces. Serve.

name: Honey-roasted pear, hazelnut and blue cheese salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'beurre', 'name': 'bosc pears, cored, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'witlof', 'name': ', leaves separated'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'ash-coated blue cheese, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(75g) toasted hazelnuts, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'chives, cut into 2cm lengths'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sherry vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'hazelnut or olive oil'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line an oven tray with baking paper. Place the pears on the oven tray. Drizzle with honey. Bake in preheated oven, turning occasionally, for 15 minutes or until tender and caramelised. Remove from oven and set aside to cool., Arrange the witlof, blue cheese, hazelnuts, chives and pears on a large serving platter. Combine the vinegar and oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Drizzle over the salad and serve immediately.

name: One-pot vegetarian spaghetti & meatballs
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'carrot', 'name': ', peeled, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'sticks, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Birdseye Plant Based succulent Meatballs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '410g can crushed tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(3 cups) vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(½ cup) tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh continental parsley, plus extra to serve (optional)'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt dried spaghetti pasta'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) coarsely grated cheddar'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan forced., Heat oil in a large, deep ovenproof frying pan over high heat. Add the onion, carrot and celery and cook, stirring, for 1-2 minutes or until softened. Add the meatballs and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until golden. Stir in the zucchini and garlic., Add the crushed tomatoes, vegetable stock, tomato paste and parsley. Season. Bring to the boil. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the pasta and stir until softened slightly., Bake for 15-20 minutes or until pasta is al dente. Stir to combine. Scatter over cheese. Grill under a preheated grill for 5 minutes or until cheese is golden., Sprinkle with parsley, if using, to serve.

name: Barbecued cumin and coriander crusted lamb racks
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'coriander seeds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'lamb', 'name': 'racks (8 cutlets on each rack), excess fat trimmed'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) mirin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'raw sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '115g pkts baby corn'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'asparagus, woody ends trimmed, halved diagonally'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh mint, leaves picked'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'shallots, ends trimmed, thinly sliced diagonally'}]
steps: Combine the coriander and cumin seeds in a small frying pan over medium heat. Cook, tossing, for 1 minute or until aromatic. Transfer to a mortar and pound with a pestle until coarsely crushed. Press the spice mixture over the lamb racks. Place lamb racks in a disposable foil tray., Preheat a closed barbecue to 200°C. Cook lamb racks in closed barbecue for 40-45 minutes for medium or until cooked to your liking. Remove from barbecue, cover with foil and set aside for 5 minutes to rest., Meanwhile, whisk together the mirin, sesame seeds, sugar and sesame oil in a jug until well combined., Add the corn and asparagus to the barbecue plate. Drizzle with oil and cook, tossing, for 4-5 minutes or until tender crisp. Transfer to a bowl. Add mint and shallot. Drizzle with dressing and gently toss to combine. Cut lamb racks into quarters. Divide lamb and salad among plates. Serve immediately.

name: 2-ingredient dairy-free Ninja Creami banana ice-cream
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'overripe', 'name': 'bananas'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}]
steps: Peel the bananas2 overripe bananas, then halve lengthways and slice crossways. Place in a Ninja Creami Ice Cream Maker container, making sure the surface is as flat as possible. Cover with the lid and place in the freezer on a level surface for at least 4 hours, or overnight, until firm., Remove the container from the freezer and remove the lid. Add the lemon juice2 tbsp fresh lemon juice., Place the container in the Ninja Creami outer bowl. Position the outer bowl in the Ice Cream Maker and turn until it locks into place. Push the sorbet button and process, until completed. Turn the outer bowl to release it from the Ice Cream Maker., Spoon ice-cream into serving bowls and serve topped with banana slices.

name: Watermelon caprioska salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'lime', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) vodka'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'peeled seedless watermelon, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'scoops', 'name': 'Connoisseur Absolute Lemon ice-cream'}]
steps: Use a zester to remove the rind from the limes. (Alternatively, use a vegetable peeler to peel the rind from limes. Use a small sharp knife to remove the white pith from the rind. Cut the rind into very thin strips.), Combine the lime rind, lime juice, sugar and vodka in a large bowl. Set aside, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until the sugar dissolves., Add the watermelon and mint to the vodka mixture. Gently stir to combine, being careful not to break up the watermelon. Set aside for 5 minutes to macerate., Divide the watermelon and syrup among serving glasses. Top with the ice-cream and serve immediately.

name: Pumpkin and chickpea curry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'grapeseed oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cinnamon', 'name': 'stick'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onion, quartered, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'garlic cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'fresh red chilli, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'garam masala'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '270ml cans coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '1.2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'Kent pumpkin, cut into thin wedges, halved'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans chickpeas, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Toasted', 'name': 'cashew nuts, to serve'}]
steps: Heat the oil in a large, heavy-based frying pan over medium-low heat. Add the cumin and cinnamon and stir for 1 minute or until aromatic. Add onion, garlic and chilli and stir for 3-4 minutes or until soft. Add garam masala and turmeric and stir for 1-2 minutes or until aromatic. Season., Stir in the coconut milk and bring to the boil. Stir in the pumpkin. Reduce heat to low. Cook, covered, turning the pumpkin halfway through cooking, for 25 minutes or until the pumpkin is almost tender., Stir in the chickpeas. Cook, covered, for 5-10 minutes or until the pumpkin is tender. Season. Add the spinach and stir for 1-2 minutes or until just wilted. Stir in the lemon juice. Divide among bowls. Top with coriander leaves and toasted cashew nuts.

name: Easy molten chocolate souffle
ingredient: [{'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', separated'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'of cream of tartar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'caster sugar, extra'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'Lindt', 'name': 'Lindor Dark Chocolate Balls'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Double', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease four 310ml (1 1/4-cup) ovenproof dishes with butter., Melt chocolate and butter in a large glass or ceramic bowl in microwave on high, stirring every minute until smooth. Cool for 5 minutes., Stir the sugar, flour and egg yolks into the chocolate mixture until well combined., Use an electric beater to whisk egg whites and cream of tartar in a bowl until soft peaks form. Add the extra sugar and whisk until firm peaks form. Use a large metal spoon to fold into the chocolate mixture until combined., Divide the chocolate mixture among the greased dishes. Press 2 chocolate balls into the centre of the chocolate mixture in each dish. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until moist crumbs cling to a skewer inserted into the centre (see notes)., Meanwhile, to make the sauce, heat the chocolate, thickened cream and butter in a heatproof jug in microwave on high, stirring every minute until melted and smooth., Serve with sauce and double cream.

name: Cream of cauliflower soup
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chilli flakes'}, {'quantity': '750', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cauliflower, trimmed, cut into florets'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'Massel vegetable liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pouring cream or creme fraiche'}]
steps: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 6 to 7 minutes or until very soft., Add coriander, cumin and chilli flakes. Increase heat to high. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Add cauliflower, stock and water. Cover. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, partially covered, for 30 minutes or until cauliflower is tender. Set aside for 20 minutes., Blend soup in batches until smooth. Return to saucepan. Stir in cream. Stir over low heat until hot. Season with salt and pepper.

name: Mushroom & egg bakes
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '160', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'button mushrooms, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'light cream cheese (Philadelphia brand)'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'fresh', 'name': 'continental parsley leaves, to garnish'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add the mushroom and cook, stirring occasionally, for 3-4 minutes or until tender. Spoon mushroom evenly among four 125ml (1/2-cup) capacity ovenproof ramekins. Pour egg over the mushroom. Place 1 teaspoon of cream cheese in the centre of each ramekin and garnish with 3 parsley leaves., Bake in preheated oven for 8-10 minutes or until the egg is just set. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

name: Larb with spicy mango salsa
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'mango, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber, halved, deseeded, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'green chillies, deseeded, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'lemongrass', 'name': 'stalk, trimmed, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '700', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pork and veal mince'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh Thai basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(80g) beansprouts, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'iceberg', 'name': 'lettuce leaves, to serve'}]
steps: Combine mango, cucumber, 1 tablespoon lime juice and half the chilli in a bowl. Set aside., Heat oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Add lemongrass and garlic. Stir-fry for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add mince. Stir-fry for 5 to 7 minutes or until browned and cooked through. Stir in remaining chilli., Add fish sauce and remaining lime juice. Cook, stirring, until heated through. Add onion, basil and beansprouts. Toss to combine. Spoon mince mixture into lettuce leaves. Serve with mango salsa.

name: Curtis Stone’s zucchini schnitzel melts
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(75g) panko breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(40g) finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(75g) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'extra', 'name': '-large Coles Australian Free Range Eggs, lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'zucchini (about 180g each), cut diagonally into 1cm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, divided'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'mozzarella, torn into small\xa0pieces'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 230°C (210°C fan-forced). In a shallow baking dish, combine breadcrumbs, parmesan and 1/4 tsp pepper. Place flour and egg in separate shallow baking dishes. Season zucchini slices with pepper. Working in batches, coat zucchini in flour, shaking off excess. Dip in the egg, then in the breadcrumb mixture, pressing to coat., Heat 2 large non-stick frying pans over medium heat. Melt 20g butter and 1 tbs oil in each pan. Add half the crumbed zucchini to each pan. Cook for 2-3 mins each side or until golden brown and crisp. Transfer the zucchini to a plate lined with paper towel., Meanwhile, on a large rimmed baking tray, toss the tomatoes with 1 tbs oil. Roast in oven for 8-10 mins or until the tomatoes soften and begin to burst. Transfer to a bowl. Add the remaining 1 tbs oil and stir to combine, breaking up some of the tomatoes with a fork to release their juices., Preheat grill on high. Wipe baking tray clean and add the zucchini. Spoon tomato mixture over zucchini and top with mozzarella. Cook under the grill for 1 min or until cheese melts.

name: Beef and red wine stew
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'beef chuck steak, cut into 4cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'brown onions, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'celery', 'name': 'sticks, trimmed, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'carrot, peeled, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) red wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400g cans whole peeled tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(2 cups) water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'beef', 'name': 'stock cubes, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'drained capers, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh oregano leaves'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cooked', 'name': 'spiral pasta, to serve'}]
steps: Season the beef2kg beef chuck steak, cut into 4cm pieces with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil60ml (1/4 cup) olive oil in a large heavy-based saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook one-quarter of the beef for 2-3 minutes or until browned. Transfer to a plate. Repeat, in 3 more batches, with remaining beef., Heat the remaining oil in the pan. Cook onion2 large brown onions, coarsely chopped, garlic3 garlic cloves, thinly sliced, celery2 celery sticks, trimmed, thinly sliced and carrot1 large carrot, peeled, coarsely chopped, stirring, for 4-5 minutes or until lightly browned. Stir in the wine375ml (1 1/2 cups) red wine, scraping the pan to dislodge any bits that have cooked onto the base. Stir in the beef, tomato2 x 400g cans whole peeled tomatoes, water500ml (2 cups) water and stock cubes2 beef stock cubes, crumbled., Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 1 1/2 hours. Uncover and simmer for 30 minutes. Add the capers1/4 cup drained capers, rinsed and simmer, uncovered, for a further 10 minutes. Stir in the oregano1/3 cup fresh oregano leaves. Serve with pastaCooked spiral pasta, to serve.

name: Herbed beef in prosciutto
ingredient: [{'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chopped fresh rosemary leaves'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'}, {'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'beef eye fillet, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'prosciutto'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red wine'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced. Lightly grease a large, flameproof roasting pan. Combine butter, garlic, rosemary and parsley in a bowl. Rub beef with mixture., Place a 30cm x 35cm piece baking paper on flat surface, with 1 short end facing you. Place 8 slices prosciutto lengthways in a row on short end of paper, overlapping slightly (see notes). Make another row with remaining prosciutto, overlapping first row slightly., Place beef at short end facing you. Using baking paper as a guide, wrap beef tightly in prosciutto. Carefully remove paper., Place beef in prepared pan. Roast for 35 minutes. Add wine to pan. Roast for 40 minutes for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate. Cover loosely with foil. Stand for 5 minutes to rest., Meanwhile, place pan over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until wine mixture has reduced by half. Serve beef with wine mixture.

name: Sesame beef stir-fry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cm', 'name': 'piece fresh ginger, peeled, finely grated'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef rump steak, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '270', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'packet soba noodles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', peeled, halved, thinly sliced diagonally'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'snow peas, trimmed, halved'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': 'bunch English spinach, trimmed'}]
steps: Place soy sauce, garlic, ginger, sugar and 2 teaspoons sesame oil in a glass or ceramic dish. Add beef. Stir to coat. Cover. Refrigerate for 30 minutes, if time permits., Cook soba noodles following packet directions until tender. Drain., Meanwhile, heat a wok over medium-high heat until hot. Add sesame seeds. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until toasted. Transfer to a bowl., Add 1 teaspoon remaining sesame oil. Swirl to coat. Add one-third of the beef mixture. Stir-fry for 1 minute or until browned. Transfer to a bowl. Cover to keep warm. Repeat in 2 batches with sesame oil and beef mixture., Add remaining sesame oil to wok. Swirl to coat. Add onion. Stir-fry for 2 minutes or until softened. Add carrot. Stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes. Add snow peas. Stir-fry for 1 minute. Return beef mixture with spinach and noodles. Stir-fry for 30 seconds or until spinach has wilted. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve.

name: Kahlua christmas puddings
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'raisins, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) Kahlua liqueur'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Melted', 'name': 'butter, to grease'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'instant coffee granules'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'hot water'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup, firmly packed) brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '140', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) fresh breadcrumbs (made from day-old bread)'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/2 cup) self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Bought', 'name': 'vanilla custard, warmed, to serve'}]
steps: Combine raisins and Kahlua in a large glass bowl. Set aside for 4 hours to macerate., Preheat oven to 160C. Brush ten 250ml (1-cup) capacity pudding moulds with melted butter. Line the bases with non-stick baking paper. Stir the coffee and water in a bowl until the coffee dissolves., Use an electric beater to beat butter and sugar in a large bowl. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the coffee mixture. Add breadcrumbs and combined flour. Stir until just combined. Add raisin mixture. Stir until well combined. Spoon into prepared moulds. Smooth the surfaces., Cut ten 15cm-square pieces of non-stick baking paper and ten 15cm-square pieces of foil. Place the paper on top of the foil. Fold to make a small pleat in the centre. Place 1 square, foil-side up, over each mould. Tie a double piece of kitchen string around moulds., Place the puddings in a roasting pan. Add enough boiling water to the pan to reach two-thirds of the way up the side of moulds. Bake for 1 hour or until a skewer inserted into centres comes out clean. Serve with custard.

name: Seafood Malabar
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'chilli powder'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'skinless snapper fillets, cut into 2.5cm pieces'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'green medium prawns, peeled, deveined'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'calamari tubes, cut into 1cm-thick slices'}, {'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) sunflower oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'brown', 'name': 'onion, halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'fresh green chilli, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '400ml can coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/2 cup) vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Fresh', 'name': 'coriander sprigs, to serve'}]
steps: Combine the garlic3 garlic cloves, crushed, sugar1 tsp sugar, chilli powder1/2 tsp chilli powder, turmeric1/2 tsp ground turmeric, salt1/2 tsp salt and cinnamon1/4 tsp ground cinnamon in a bowl. Add the snapper500g skinless snapper fillets, cut into 2.5cm pieces, prawns250g green medium prawns, peeled, deveined and calamari250g calamari tubes, cut into 1cm-thick slices and stir to coat. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 1 hour to marinate., Meanwhile, to make the coconut sambal, combine the coconut1 tsp finely grated fresh ginger, chilli1 large fresh green chilli, thinly sliced, corianderFresh coriander sprigs, to serve, lemon juice1 tbsp fresh lemon juice, yoghurt1 tbsp Greek-style yoghurt and ginger1 tsp finely grated fresh ginger in a bowl. Season with salt. Cover and place in the fridge to chill., Heat half the oil80ml (1/3 cup) sunflower oil in a wok or large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add one-third of the snapper mixture and cook, turning, for 1-2 minutes or until browned. Use a slotted spoon to transfer to a plate. Repeat, in 2 more batches, with remaining oil and snapper mixture, reserving excess marinade., Reduce heat to low. Add the onion1 brown onion, halved, thinly sliced, ginger1 tsp finely grated fresh ginger, fresh chilli1 large fresh green chilli, deseeded, finely chopped and reserved marinade and cook, stirring, for 10-15 minutes or until onion is soft. Stir in the coconut milk1 x 400ml can coconut milk and stock125ml (1/2 cup) vegetable stock. Increase heat to medium. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes., Add the snapper mixture, reserving the calamari, to the pan and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 2-3 minutes. Add the calamari and cook for 2 minutes or until cooked through. Stir in the lime juice2 tsp fresh lime juice. Transfer to a serving dish and top with coriander2 tbsp chopped fresh coriander. Serve with the coconut sambal.

name: Mexican chicken rice bake with pickled jalapeno
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'garlic salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'pickled jalapeno, drained, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'chicken thigh cutlets (skin on)'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'green', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red capsicum, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1 1/3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white long-grain rice'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can red kidney beans, drained, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can corn kernels, drained'}, {'quantity': '453', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'jar mild chunky salsa'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'Massel salt reduced chicken style liquid stock'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pickled jalapeno, drained, extra'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'reduced-fat sour cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh coriander leaves, roughly chopped, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Combine oregano, coriander, garlic salt, finely chopped jalapeno and 2 tablespoons oil in a large bowl. Add chicken. Rub to coat., Heat remaining oil in a 6cm-deep, 21cm x 31cm (12-cup-capacity) flameproof roasting pan over medium-high heat. Cook chicken, turning, for 5 minutes or until browned. Transfer to oven. Roast for 25 minutes., Transfer chicken to a plate. Add onion, capsicum, rice, beans, corn, salsa and stock to pan. Season. Stir to combine. Top with chicken. Cover with foil. Bake for a further 40 to 50 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and chicken is cooked through. Remove from oven. Stir. Cover with foil. Stand for 10 minutes., Sprinkle chicken bake with extra jalapeños. Serve with sour cream and coriander leaves.

name: Midori melon salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '80', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/3 cup) fresh orange juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'strips', 'name': 'lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'whole', 'name': 'star anise'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Pinch', 'name': 'cardamom seeds'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) Midori liqueur'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'rockmelon', 'name': ', deseeded, peeled, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'honeydew', 'name': 'melon, deseeded, peeled, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'seedless watermelon, peeled, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '250g punnet strawberries, hulled, washed, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'small fresh mint leaves'}]
steps: Combine the orange juice, lemon rind, star anise and cardamom in a saucepan over high heat. Bring to the boil. Boil, uncovered, for 3 minutes or until liquid thickens slightly. Remove from heat and set aside for 5 minutes to cool slightly., Strain the orange mixture through a fine sieve into a large serving bowl. Add the Midori and stir to combine., Add the rockmelon, honeydew melon, watermelon, strawberries and mint, and gently toss until well combined. Serve immediately.

name: Farfalle, beef and asparagus salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'farfalle pasta'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'beef rump steak, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'asparagus, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'walnuts, toasted (see note)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flat-leaf parsley leaves'}]
steps: Cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling, salted water, following packet directions, until tender. Drain and transfer to a bowl. Add 2 tablespoons oil and toss to combine. Set aside to cool., Preheat barbecue grill on high heat. Brush steak with remaining oil and season with pepper. Grill for 3 minutes each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate. Cover with foil and allow to rest for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, place asparagus on grill. Grill, turning, for 3 minutes or until just tender. Cut into thirds crossways., Make mustard mayonnaise dressing: Place mustard, vinegar, mayonnaise, sour cream and chives in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Mix until well combined., Thinly slice steak across the grain. Add steak, asparagus, walnuts and parsley to pasta. Pour over dressing. Season with salt and pepper and toss gently to combine. Serve.

name: Raspberry ice-cream
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'litres', 'name': 'vanilla ice-cream'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'frozen raspberries'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'meringues, crushed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'ice', 'name': '-cream wafers or cones, to serve'}]
steps: Line two 9cm x 9cm loaf pans (base measurement) with plastic wrap. Remove ice-cream from the freezer and let it soften, but do not allow it to melt. Spoon into a large bowl., Add frozen raspberries and crushed meringues. Using a large metal spoon, gently fold the mixture until all the ingredients are well-combined., Spoon ice-cream mixture into prepared loaf pans. Cover and place in freezer for 4 to 6 hours or until frozen. Scoop into cups or cut into 2cm-thick slices and sandwich between ice-cream wafers and serve.

name: Mississippi mud cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Melted', 'name': 'butter, to grease'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'good-quality dark chocolate (Lindt Excellence 85 per cent Cocoa brand), coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 cup) freshly brewed strong espresso coffee'}, {'quantity': '430', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) caster sugar'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) bourbon whiskey'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', lightly whisked'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2 cups) plain flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Cocoa', 'name': 'powder, to dust'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Creme', 'name': 'fraiche, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 160°C. Brush a square 20cm (base measurement) cake pan with melted butter to grease. Line base and sides with non-stick baking paper., Place butter, chocolate and coffee in a saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until chocolate melts and mixture is smooth. Remove from heat and set aside for 5 minutes to cool., Pour chocolate mixture into a large bowl. Add sugar, bourbon and egg, and use a wire balloon whisk to whisk until well combined. Sift flour and baking powder over chocolate mixture and stir with the whisk until well combined. Pour into prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 1 1/4 hours or until crumbs cling to a skewer inserted into the centre of the cake (cover with non-stick baking paper halfway through cooking if it browns too quickly). Remove from oven and set aside for 1 hour to cool., Turn cake onto a chopping board. Cut into squares and dust with cocoa powder. Serve with creme fraiche.

name: Turkish coffee
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'L', 'name': '(4 cups) water'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 cup) white sugar'}, {'quantity': '45', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/3 cup) Turkish-style coffee'}]
steps: Place water, sugar and coffee in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 3-4 minutes or until coffee simmers and froth forms on the surface., Pour coffee into small cups and serve immediately with the baklava.
nutrition: calories: 33, fat: nan, carbs: 8.1g, protein: 0.3g, servings: 8

name: Frozen Mars bar mousse
ingredient: [{'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Vegetable', 'name': 'oil spray'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '60g Mars bars'}, {'quantity': '600', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'eggs', 'name': ', separated'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dark chocolate, melted, to drizzle'}]
steps: Spray a 1-litre terrine mould with oil. Line with plastic wrap, leaving long sides overhanging. Roughly chop 4 bars and place in a heatproof bowl with 300ml cream over a pan of simmering water (don't let bowl touch water) until melted, then stir to combine. Cool slightly, then whisk in remaining cream and egg yolks., In a separate bowl, beat eggwhites with electric beaters until stiff peaks form. Fold into chocolate mixture. Pour into terrine, folding in wrap. Freeze overnight until firm. To serve, dip mould briefly in warm water, then invert onto a platter. Chop remaining bars, scatter over terrine and drizzle with melted chocolate.

name: Sue's roast lamb
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'leg of lamb, boned'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh breadcrumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': ', lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'crushed garlic'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'dried rosemary'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Use a sharp knife to butterfly lamb leg to open out flat., Melt butter and honey in a saucepan over low heat until well combined. Place breadcrumbs into a bowl. Add egg, garlic, 1 teaspoon of rosemary, half the butter mixture, and salt and pepper to breadcrumbs. Mix well with clean hands., Arrange stuffing down centre of lamb leg. Roll up. Tie tightly with string to secure. Brush lamb with remaining butter mixture. Sprinkle with remaining rosemary., Place lamb into a large, greased roasting pan. Roast for 10 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 160°C. Roast for a further 45 minutes for medium (see hint). Remove to a board. Cover with foil. Stand for 10 minutes. Slice and serve.

name: Squid with tomato and peas
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'kg', 'name': 'small squid, cleaned (ask your fishmonger to do this, or see Notes)'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'onion', 'name': ', halved, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can crushed tomatoes or 400ml tomato passata (sieved tomatoes: see Notes)'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) chicken stock, or water'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'mild paprika'}, {'quantity': '1 2/3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(200g) frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped flat-leaf parsley'}]
steps: Cut squid1kg small squid, cleaned (ask your fishmonger to do this, or see Notes) hoods into thick rings, and each cluster of tentacles in two lengthways., Heat the olive oil1/4 cup (60ml) olive oil in a heavy, wide-based casserole or saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion1 onion, halved, thinly sliced and cook gently, stirring, for 10 minutes or until soft., Add the garlic2 garlic cloves, crushed and stir for 30 seconds, then add the squid and cook for 3 minutes or until the squid is lightly coloured, turning occasionally., Add the wine1/2 cup (125ml) dry white wine, let it bubble for 1-2 minutes, then add the tomatoes400g can crushed tomatoes or 400ml tomato passata (sieved tomatoes: see Notes), stock or water1/2 cup (125ml) chicken stock, or water and paprika1/2 tsp mild paprika. Season with sea salt and pepper., Simmer very gently over low heat for 25-30 minutes until the squid is tender and the sauce has reduced., Add the peas1 2/3 cups (200g) frozen peas to the squid and simmer for a further 3 minutes or until peas are tender. Sprinkle with parsley1 tbsp finely chopped flat-leaf parsley and serve.

name: Quick chilli pork stir-fry
ingredient: [{'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt egg noodles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Coles Australian Pork Mince'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'cloves, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated ginger'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'long', 'name': 'red chillies, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '227', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'can water chestnut slices, rinsed, drained'}, {'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'pkt Coles Supreme Vegetable Mix'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(95g) oyster sauce'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(35g) roasted peanuts, chopped'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thinly', 'name': 'sliced long red chilli, extra, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Coriander', 'name': 'leaves, to serve'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Lime', 'name': 'wedges, to serve'}]
steps: Cook the noodles following packet directions. Drain., Meanwhile, heat the oil in a wok or large frying pan over high heat. Add the mince and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up any lumps, for 5 mins or until cooked through., Add the garlic, ginger, chilli, water chestnut and vegetable mix. Cook, stirring, for 2 mins or until vegetables are wilted. Add the oyster sauce and noodles and cook, stirring, until well combined and heated through., Sprinkle the stir-fry with peanut, extra chilli and coriander. Serve with the lime wedges.

name: One-pot chicken spaghetti al limone
ingredient: [{'quantity': '400', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken breast fillets'}, {'quantity': '250', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'dried spaghetti pasta'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '375', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/2 cups) thickened cream'}, {'quantity': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) finely grated parmesan'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Finely', 'name': 'shredded lemon rind, to serve'}]
steps: Fill a deep saucepan three-quarters of the way with water. Add the chicken400g chicken breast fillets. Heat over medium-high heat until water comes to a simmer. Skim the surface. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Use tongs to transfer chicken to a plate, reserving the cooking liquid., Increase the heat to high and bring the cooking liquid to the boil. Add the pasta250g dried spaghetti pasta and cook following packet directions or until al dente. Drain. Transfer pasta to a heatproof bowl. Add the oil2 tbsp olive oil to the pasta and use tongs to toss until well coated. Cover and set aside to keep warm., Add the cream375ml (1 1/2 cups) thickened cream, butter40g butter and grated lemon rind2 tsp finely grated lemon rind to the saucepan. Bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce to medium and simmer for 15 minutes or until thickened. Stir through three-quarters of the parmesan70g (1 cup) finely grated parmesan until melted. Add the lemon juice1 tbsp fresh lemon juice, pasta and chicken and use tongs to toss until well combined and heated through., Divide the pasta among serving bowls. Top with shredded lemon rindFinely shredded lemon rind, to serve and season with pepper to serve.

name: Spinach, cheese & tomato omelette
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cream'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'tomatoes, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'baby spinach'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}]
steps: Preheat grill to high. Whisk together 2 eggs and 2 tablespoons cream. Season to taste with salt and pepper., Melt 1 teaspoon of butter in a small non-stick frying pan on medium heat. Pour in egg mixture and cook for 2-3 mins until base is set. Scatter over quarter of the tomato and 1/4 cup of cheese. Place under hot grill for 2 mins until puffed and golden. Scatter over 1/4 cup baby spinach, fold omelette in half and serve., Repeat with remaining ingredients to make 4 individual omelettes.

name: Wholemeal wraps with smoked ocean trout and egg and lettuce coleslaw
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'sheets', 'name': 'wholemeal mountain bread'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'smoked ocean trout, sliced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'hard', 'name': 'boiled eggs, peeled and chopped'}, {'quantity': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'iceberg lettuce, coarsely shredded'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'good quality mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely grated lemon rind'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'finely chopped capers'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}]
steps: Lay bread on a board and divide smoked ocean trout along one edge of each piece of bread. In a large bowl, toss egg and lettuce together., In a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, lemon rind and capers. Season with salt and pepper and fold through the egg and lettuce., Pile salad onto wraps and roll up firmly to enclose. Slice in half and serve immediately.
nutrition: calories: 289, fat: 17g, carbs: 17g, protein: nan, servings: 4

name: Roast lamb focaccia with tzatziki
ingredient: [{'quantity': '280', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'slices lamb roast'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'focaccia, halved'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Greek-style thick natural yoghurt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumber, chopped lengthways, seeds removed, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'whole egg mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chargrilled capsicum, cut into thin strip'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'rocket, trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'garlic', 'name': 'clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'sea salt'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'peppe', 'name': 'r'}]
steps: Preheat grill to medium-high. Place focaccia on baking tray and toast each side for 2-3 minutes or until golden brown., Place cucumber, yoghurt, mayonnaise, salt, cumin and garlic in a small bowl. Stir until well combined. Season with pepper., Spread tzatziki on one side of each focaccia slice. Add rocket, lamb, and capsicum. Top each with remaining focaccia slice and serve.

name: Pancake shaker impossible zucchini slice
ingredient: [{'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', coarsely grated'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '330', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1 1/3 cups) milk'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1 cup) original (plain) pancake mix'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'shortcut bacon, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '70', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(2/3 cup) coarsely grated cheddar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh chives, plus extra, to serve'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan forced. Grease and line a 20x30cm slice pan, allowing the paper to overhang the sides., Place zucchini2 zucchini, coarsely grated in a colander and use clean hands to squeeze out excess liquid., Whisk together eggs4 eggs, milk330ml (1 1/3 cups) milk, oil60ml (1/4 cup) vegetable oil and pancake mix180g (1 cup) original (plain) pancake mix in a large bowl. Season. Add zucchini, bacon200g shortcut bacon, finely chopped, cheddar70g (2/3 cup) coarsely grated cheddar and chives2 tbsp finely chopped fresh chives, plus extra, to serve and stir until combined. Pour mixture into pan and bake for 35 minutes or until golden and just set. Set aside to cool for 30 minutes., Sprinkle with extra chives to serve.

name: Thai beef salad
ingredient: [{'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(about', 'name': '200g each) scotch fillet steaks'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'Lebanese', 'name': 'cucumbers'}, {'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(1/4 pkt) Asian Greens'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'coriander, leaves picked'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'bought chargrilled capsicum, drained, cut into strips'}, {'quantity': '60', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': '(1/4 cup) sweet chilli sauce'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'bottled lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'garlic clove, crushed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Salt', 'name': '& freshly ground black pepper'}]
steps: Preheat barbecue grill on high. Brush steaks with 2 teaspoons of oil. Cook for 4 minutes each side for medium. Set aside for 5 minutes to rest., Meanwhile, use a vegetable peeler to peel down the length of the cucumbers to form long ribbons. Place in a large serving bowl with the Asian Greens mix, coriander and capsicum strips. Toss well to combine., Thinly slice the beef across the grain. Combine the sweet chilli sauce, lime juice, garlic and remaining oil in a small jug. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Add the beef and dressing to the salad and toss gently to combine. Serve immediately with bread.

name: Carrot cake
ingredient: [{'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '175', 'unit': 'ml', 'name': 'sunflower oil'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'carrots', 'name': ', finely grated'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Finely', 'name': 'grated zest of 1 orange'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'self-raising flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'bicarbonate of soda'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'grated nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(50g) walnuts, toasted, chopped'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and line the base and sides of a 23cm cake pan., Combine the eggs, oil and sugar in a bowl and beat to combine. Stir in the carrot and orange zest. Sift in the dry ingredients, then add the walnut and stir gently to combine. Pour batter into the pan and bake for 35-40 minutes until a skewer comes out clean. Allow to cool slightly, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely., Meanwhile, for the candied carrot, place sugar in a small saucepan with 1 cup (250ml) water and bring to the boil over high heat, stirring until sugar dissolves. Add carrot and cook for 5 minutes or until just tender. Remove carrot from pan and transfer to a bowl. Cook syrup for a further 10 minutes or until reduced. Pour syrup over the carrot and set aside to cool., Garnish cake with candied carrot and serve with carrot and pecan ice cream (see related recipe).

name: Gourmet vegetarian pizza
ingredient: [{'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(70g) basil pesto'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'x', 'name': '30cm pizza bases'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'purchased chargrilled capsicum, cut into strips'}, {'quantity': '150', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'purchased chargrilled eggplant, halved'}, {'quantity': '200', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'purchased chargrilled artichoke hearts, cut into thin wedges'}, {'quantity': '180', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'container baby bocconcini, drained, halved'}]
steps: Preheat oven to 230°C. Place two oven trays in the oven., Spread the pesto over the pizza bases. Top with the capsicum, eggplant, artichoke hearts and bocconcini., Place pizzas on preheated trays and bake for 12-15 minutes or until base is crisp and cheese melts. Serve immediately.

name: Macadamia & golden syrup pies
ingredient: [{'quantity': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(125ml) golden syrup'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'firmly packed (100g) light brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'mixed spice'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Zest', 'name': 'and juice of 1 lemon'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'egg', 'name': 's'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '(290g) unsalted macadamias, halved'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': 'Thick', 'name': 'cream, to serve'}]
steps: To make pastry, place zest, icing sugar, flour and butter in a food processor with a pinch of salt. Process until mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add egg and extra yolk, then process until mixture forms a smooth ball (add 1-2 tablespoons chilled water if necessary). Wrap in plastic wrap and chill for 30 minutes., Uncover pastry and cut into 4 equal pieces. Roll into balls, then roll out flat on a floured board. Use the pastry to line 6 lightly greased 11cm loose-bottomed tart pans. Chill for a further 15 minutes. Preheat the oven to 200°C., Line pastry shells with baking paper, fill with pastry weights or uncooked rice and blind bake for 10 minutes. Remove paper and weights or rice and return pastry shells to the oven for a further 5 minutes until the pastry is light golden and dry., Reduce the oven to 175°C., For filling, place butter, syrup, brown sugar, spice, zest, juice and eggs in a large mixing bowl and beat until mixture comes together. Pour into pastry shells and sprinkle macadamias over top. Bake for 15-20 minutes until filling is firm and nuts are golden. Cool for 10 minutes, then remove from pans. Serve warm with cream.

name: Grilled harissa zucchini on tabbouleh
ingredient: [{'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'zucchini', 'name': ', halved lengthways, thickly sliced on the diagonal'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'mild harissa paste*'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'burghul (cracked wheat)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped flat-leaf parsley'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tomatoes', 'name': ', finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'spring', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '(60ml) lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': "soft goat's cheese, crumbled"}]
steps: Heat a lightly oiled chargrill or barbecue on medium-high heat. Combine zucchini and harissa in a bowl. When grill is hot, cook zucchini for 10 minutes, turning to brown all over, until lightly charred and tender., Meanwhile, mix burghul with 1 1/4 cups boiling water. Cover and stand for 10 minutes until just softened, then drain well. Toss with remaining ingredients, except cheese. Serve zucchini on tabbouleh and top with cheese.
